i cant believe it ! i thought this is a good sequel when jim carry in the film has a great plot with lots of cute plots and a nice storyline . but , you can see how it could not be done properly . there were too many twists to get the story into any real order . the first couple of months were pretty lousy , especially as we were constantly having to go to the movies . the other night i was up at 5 am and trying to get some work done when i decided that i should try to do some research on the internet before i slept .

Stanwyck and Morgan are perfectly cast in what is, in many ways, a modern equivalent of Dickens' Christmas Carol in its sensibility. The success of the film depends on the casting of Sydney Greenstreet as the Alexander Yardley character. Yardley is the modern equivalent of Dickens' Scrooge in the way he exercizes control over his employees -- until the Christmas spirit overtakes him. The role is a 'walk in the park' for Greenstreet who had been one of the stage's great Falstaffs when he was part of the Lunts' company.

You know I only watched 15 minutes of this film, so I can't really describe how great it is. I mean the concept alone is so original and intriguing it just did not let me go. Then there is the mass of academy award winning people involved here plus the academy award nominated director. YOU JUST CAN'T miss. I mean imagine it is the middle of the night and you're not sleepy yet. This film comes on. You watch it and are shocked. It is so brilliant, so original it is so GREAT.

As a parent of two girls(14 and 11) I have grave doubts about this show and all the shows aimed at tweens. First, I am always amazed that the living conditions of Drake/Josh, Zac/Cody, Hanna, Carly, Derek, Sunny etc. always make most houses look tiny and cramped. Most people work hard all day to pay for living quarters less than half the size yet on these shows nobody is going or coming from work, paying utility,rent, mortgage or insurance bills, mopping, sweeping, changing lightbulbs, fixing toilets,etc.

I was so looking forward to watching the documentary self-immolation of the mastermind behind Boondock Saints, one of the most aggravating and pointless movies I've ever seen. But the makers of "Overnight" - buddies (ex?) of the mastermind in question - also need to learn how to make a movie. Various unsavoury remarks, yelling obscenities into the phone, and enjoying his alcohol do indeed make Mr. Duffy look like a putz. But it doesn't shed any insight into why the guy got a contract in the first place, what his creative process or vision is - what's Boondock Saints even about?

in my opinion of this movie the entire video portion of this movie was absolute trash ! ! ! ! i am not a fan of film that can be played as a joke by a person or woman but this is definitely no joke at all . it looks like there has never been anything else like this to come from such a great movie . i really do have some ideas for this film and they are very entertaining . first , i think maybe we can try to find some reason why someone would use this to commit murder against his family .

I only heard about Driving Lessons through the ITV adverts, and to be honest, I didn't know how much I would like it. I switched on the TV last night and was totally surprised. Driving Lessons is a modest, simple film which draws you in right from the start. Rupert Grint plays the part of socially awkward teenager Ben brilliantly. He's definitely one to look out for in the future. Dame Eve Walton is played by the fabulous Julie Walters. I loved the simple plot and the way the actors portrayed their characters with great sensitivity.

this movie is so predictable when you know the modern american dream : do nothing , be a loser and leave your life . if i 'm not mistaken , this movie was made during the late 1800 's and is one of the biggest in the world . the acting is bad as in most film films that make it sound like it is going to last forever . i just wanted to hear what would happen next . i think i have already read all the reviews . it was really awful , but i had no interest in it .

david cronenberg ' s ` existenz ' is a well designed reflection of the philosophy of existentialism . it addresses the need to believe that we are all on the same planet , and that everything we see and hear is true . as a man who has been brought into this world with nothing more than the ability to view himself as an observer , he may experience some of the worst moments in his life . but i must say that my son was a good example . when i first came back to hollywood , i was hoping to go to work at a video studio .

Sometimes there's a film so bad that you just keep watching in awe. This is one of those films. Of course I can't help that I'm biased. I'm from Chicago so I watched the scenes closely for accuracy and I don't find Billy Crystal funny at all. And I can't stand all that English style photography(Tony Scott etc) with the smoke machine working overtime and all the flourecent, soft lighting. I suppose we're supposed to believe that Billy Crystal is really from Chicago because he wears a Cubs jersey. Oh and the plot.

i had the privilege of being one of the still photographers on the set of ` ` grand champion ' ' and so i took some pictures . at one point i thought this was just a great opportunity for me to be one of the best people in the country but it turns out that i was not . after i finished my photo shoots , i went back to the beach house to get something to eat . i could n't have done this without the camera . it was the worst experience of my life . i remember watching the whole thing and feeling sorry for myself .

Awful, awful, awful times a hundred still doesn't begin to describe how crappy "Biggest Loser" is. Picture this: take two fat couples with nothing interesting to say, humiliate them, and let them work to lose weight, all on prime time television. Am I the only one who thinks that this isn't something people with IQs in the 3-digit area WANT TO WATCH? Everything drags on forever, with the lumps of lard whining on about how losing weight is going to mean so much for them and their lives. Does anyone care? Do they think we care?

this is another of robert altman ' s underrated films ( let ' s be honest , the only movie he ' s ever made in his entire career ) . there are all kinds of scary scenes where he ' s walking down a dirt track with an ax ready to chop off someone ' s head . it ' s pretty funny and some of what he says comes out sounding sort of cheesy . as you ' re watching this scene , i would like to ask you if you had something that you were really interested in doing .

i went to crooked earth to see a piece of new zealand . what i found was a badly scripted and cheesy comedy . the acting was not as bad as the others and the plot was not bad , either . but it was lame . the only thing that really made me hate the movie was the actors . we had no idea they could even have any good ideas about film . i ca n't help but wonder how many times in my life someone is forced to watch an old movie that is supposed to be popular with the population of the entire country .

I used to think that it couldn't get worse that "Army of the Dead" but this load of crap makes the afore mentioned movie look like "The Godfather"!! The special effects are HORRIBLE (Makes the original Nintendo graphics look like HDTV). When it comes the acting, put it this way, I went to a play with my 6 year old niece in it and she gave an Oscar worthy performance, when compared to these D-List (and that's being kind about it) actors and actresses.

i just got back from ` ` ags ' ' . after seeing it , i ' m convinced that no matter how hard i try to get it to come to my attention , every time i try to find some way to explain the film or even to convince myself that this was all a bad joke , it does not make any sense . so there you have it . one of the best things about being an actor is that whenever i look at the script , i always see something that makes sense . well , as far as i can determine , this movie is a little lame .

In 1929, director Walt Disney and animator Ub Iwerks changed the face of animation with the release of the very first installment of their "Silly Symphonies" series, "The Skeleton Dance". Iwerks and Disney had been collaborating together since the early 20s, in Disney's "Laugh-O-Gram" cartoon series; however, their friendship suffered a tremendous blow when Iwerks accepted an offer by a competitor to leave Disney and start his own animation studio. That was the birth of Celebrity Productions, where Iwerks continued developing his style and technique (and where he created the character of Flip the Frog).

this movie is a haunting telling of the life of the author and poet , mishima . it jumps around in time and time again and then dies off . but i think there is no end to the number of characters that have lived in these pages for more than fifteen thousand years . at the age of sixteen we could have spent the rest of our lives reading all of these books . it is very nice to know that when you get old you are still able to listen to all the songs of the world with one ear on the sound - aids .

Let's face it, a truly awful movie, no...I mean a "truly" awful movie, is a rare, strange, and beautiful thing to behold. I admite that there is a special place in my heart for films like Plan 9 From Outer Space, Half Caste, Species, etc. And although I'm giving this film a 1, I highly urge anyone who enjoys a bad film for what it truly is (a bad film) to find a friend, snacks, something to drink, and make the special occasion it deserves out of: Aussie Park Boyz.

tom stern and jeremy slate are swing bachelor ' s planning to hijack a casino , ala ` ` ocean ' s 11 . the only thing i do not see in the movie is that it is supposed to be scary but instead this is very humorous . i can just imagine being in the room of this guy as he makes a lot of money at some high end casino on the north shore . why did they make that movie so bad ? what about all those people going off the reservation to kill their own children , or try to kill someone else if they decide to go there themselves ?

I honestly don't know what words IMDB will allow me to use in this review, as a result, I'm having a hard time describing these shorts. Let's just say there's a good amount of gay sex, some necrophilia, some incest, a fair amount of masturbation, and several artificial.... members. And I loved every minute of it.Not that it's ALL crude humor. It isn't. They stray away from fart gags for the most part, with the exception of one sketch entitled "Pizza" in which they use one very well.

A snore gore. I saw this piece of horrible, stinking, worthless, junk at the Cameo Movie House (Now the famous Crobar Night-club)on Washington Avenue on South Beach in 1980 or 81. I was 17, and my three buddies and I laughed at this horrible, gross, piece of trash. The theater was on it's last legs and there were mostly drunks snoring and sleeping in the place. They didn't miss a darn thing. The Worst acting ever.These actors deserve the Academy Award for the worst, and I mean worst acting roles in the history of the cinema.

this movie was physically painful to sit through , maybe because ( like many people my age , and younger ) it was totally lacking in fun and romance . however , at the beginning i had a feeling that it would have been even better if it had been a little bit funny . but it was really not . it just seemed so dull . for all of the comedy and action , it is not as bad as some of the other films are . when you are reading the film or watching the dvd you might actually be able to see what others are thinking .

You know, before seeing this film I had little sympathy for those caught up in criminal cases. I mean if they were arrested and charged, "they must have been guilty" I reasoned?I formed this opinion over some years. You see a good friend of mine once worked as a detective in some of the more seedy areas of Sydney. He frequently complained that his policing efforts were wasted due to 'bleeding heart' lawyers and magistrates. He would "bang the crooks up in the morning and they would be "back on the street by noon".

time has not been kind to this film from the transition days of sound from silent . the plot has taken an unexpected turn into a rather unpleasant experience . as you could tell , there is something else out there that does not make any sense . i think it 's only because this movie was made in 1974 that we have seen so many films . at least , most of them did . it was just a bunch of people getting drunk , trying to get laid , and hoping to catch some bad guy ( who they did n't actually catch ) .

I'd like to point out these excellent points in favor of this movie:#1 Angelina Jolie sex scene #2 Foley artist outdid themselves #3 plot was quite thick #4 DVD does includes trailers and chapter stops#5 no animals were harmed in the making of the movie #6 homages to blade runner through out the film #7 burning trash cans #8 funny guy with no legs #9 Voice overs by Jack Palance added a real dynamic element to the film. #10 Sage advise, for example "When you dine with the devil bring a long spoon".

loved this movie ! kicking it old school ! love the idea . love the script . love the characters . it was good , but also creepy . how could i agree with this ? i would never have allowed myself to look at this movie if he had shown it to me . his face was so close to mine . it made my heart ache just thinking about watching it . i would rather watch an action movie right now , than watch anything remotely funny . there is really nothing like seeing a man being murdered and then hearing your lover tell you to go home for christmas .

I, like many this evening braved the frigid winter and long lines to see what I had anticipated to be one of the best movies of this year. However, I was left sadly wanting in many ways after the credits rolled. But to be fair, there were redeemable qualities (although very few). Let's start with what worked. First, the Lycans: on point in every way  from their terrifying physicality to their sheer ferocity. The action: sublimely visceral  when it did occur. Nighy/Victor and Sheen/Lucian: Perfect. Now, what did not (and there is plenty).

just want to inform you guys that this movie was actually pretty good ! ! ! thought it was a lot of work - and quite boring , as well - but it was fun . i really enjoy watching the film because i think i might have enjoyed having it on my own . ) i got an extra $ 10 from the first episode , so i decided to go to the cinema in the middle of the day . i made it back there in one piece and left about 5 minutes before anyone could come to see me . i would not have missed the show if i had seen it myself .

this film tells the true story of escaped black slaves who found their own mountain - top commune as free men in search of escape . they find it hard to believe there are other places in the world where slaves can live or die . that 's a big part of the problem , but you have to accept it is also a big part of the problem because it leads to nothing good . the main problem is that many of the movies are really boring . i just ca n't imagine being able to make much money on this film . why would anyone even think to try ?

i ' ve been looking forward to the release of this movie since i first heard the concept two years ago . in fact , i ' ll be taking it over a month hence if they do n't give me one hell of an excuse to show my face on television again . i don ' t care what you think of me or who i am ; i don ' t care about anyone else . this movie is way too boring . i would love to just sit around watching and wait for someone to pick up my phone and send me an annoying text saying why are you being so dumb ?

this comment is meant mainly as a warning to the people who might be attracted to the title by its author . for those who think i 'm making an attempt at humor , i am not . i actually found the novel more interesting than any other story i have ever been forced to edit . i thought that it would make me feel better if i got to watch a movie in a way that was nice . but i did n't . while it may have been good to see some action , it also had nothing to do with how you felt about them or how much you hated them .

This movie was outright painful for me to watch. I understand that indie films do not have the same resources as other mainstream films. But there are basic elements of film making that typically you want to adhere to. First off, jump cuts. There are numerous in the film's opening 15 minutes. There are shots in which it appears that two separate takes of the same shot were edited together. What I mean by this is a character will say half a line from one take, and the rest of the line is from a different take. Secondly, the dialog.

In my opinion the directing, editing, lighting, and acting(minus Franco) were very good. I must admit, I was pleasantly surprised and impressed with this film. I wasn't expecting much, in way of camera angles, sound, etc, but in these areas the film wasn't bad at all.After seeing the film, I personally felt frustrated with both characters because I wanted so badly for these two characters to reach out to one another. And I felt like the Travis(Franco) character wasn't really affected or changed in the end after Terri commits suicide.

This movie is a very enjoyable homage to the Bogart and other detective films of old. Robert Sacchi nails it as Bogie and Michelle Phillips is a truly timeless beauty as Gena Anastas. However, the most noteworthy portion of this film involves the longest belly dancing scene ever produced in a Hollywood film. One well-known professional instructor commented that nothing else in cinema comes close for dance excitement. The scene, which ends up being an important part of the plot, occurs in a lushly beautiful Middle Eastern nightclub and is by all accounts mesmerizing.

While this movie is not the most entertaining in the world, I think it is better than most over all. I mean it had it's little laughs and just all around a good feeling. It's not too often we get to see two old geezers just having fun with their age and honestly having a good time with the jokes. Walter and Jack had such a great chemistry together as friends/brother in-laws. Just watching them romancing these women was fun and you rooted for them all the way because wither we have to admit it or not, for their age, they still had game!

SPOILER ALERT!!!! This was my son's review of the movie, which he wanted me to post.He wrote this, I swear.With Malcolm in the Middle's Frankie Muniz, and Nickelodeon's Amanda Bynes, they get to go to show business. They team up on the actor Paul Giamatti. He stole Jason Shepherd's essay on Big Fat Liar, and makes it in to a movie. Jason (Frankie Muniz) and Kaylee (Amanda Bynes) have to go to L.A. to get it back. Jason's dad does not believe that he wrote that essay.

enormous suspension of disbelief is required where will ' s ` ` genius ' ' is concerned . not just in math - - which is a little boring ) , but also with the music and movies . as for the films themselves , no matter what they were written on , i would have preferred it if they made them up . at least this way i can say that i was more impressed when we first saw them . i watched them twice last night , and there were even a lot of them , so i should have known why the film was taken .

Having lived in Michigan's Upper Peninsula (30 miles from Escanaba) in the mid-1990s, I was eager to see this film. It begins promisingly enough, with some superficial understanding of the values and quirks of U.P. life. But Jeff Daniels apparently was not content with a low-key approach that would have been fitting given the place and the people. Instead, he introduces extremely crude humor and some wildly inappropriate mystical/supernatural elements. Although there is a good movie to be made about this practically unknown region of the U.S., this is NOT it.

jennifer montgomery ' s ` ` art for teachers of children ' ' is a stunning , disturbing masterpiece . montgomery ' s gritty style is based on the premise of a movie which has been going around for almost two years and still shows no real talent . in fact , i would be more inclined to agree with this idea if i didn ' t remember that it was an action flick and there was something wrong with the cast . don ' t let the tv show you re watching get your hackles up and make them jump up and down .

Without John Rhys-Davies, I have to admit that this would never even register on my movie-meter. But in spite of that single fact, this is not a bad little thriller, considering the low budget, the low quality effects, the stiff acting and the Sci Fi Channel aspects. The blood effects are very convincing, and the Chupacabra actually looks realistic... regardless of what you think a Chupacabra looks like this is one good-looking Chupacabra.Aside from the positives, this runs kind of like Kolchak: The Night Stalker (Darren McGavin, remember?)

` ` hoppity goes to town ' ' was the second and last full length animated feature made by max and dave . i can make a decent documentary on them if you want it to be a complete failure . the first half is a bit boring . it takes me awhile to understand what it is about , but i do like it . i think my parents have a great deal of fun when they get together . we spend our days in front of the television , eating dinner and watching tv shows that are pretty good . then once the movies start coming on , it starts to get boring .

the st . francisville experiment claims ` ` this ai n ' t no walk in the woods ' ' , a direct slap in the face to his father : ' i was your mother ! it 's true ; you and i are still young ' and that is exactly what he thought . he did wonder why some teenagers were trying to get their hands on cocaine and others were trying to get their hands on guns . he always thought that maybe they really would like to kill him . but then again , how many times has he gone to church with his dad as a kid ?

Synopsis: the sequel to the acclaimed Silence Of The Lambs, Hannibal is a big budget production that totally fails to deliver; not only is it not as clever as its predecessor, it is not even a splatter or suspense or horror movie, just a totally boring time waster. Do not be fooled by the media hype, and particularly the stories about people throwing up in cinema and being mentally scarred for the rest of their lifes because of the brain - eating scene: in the movie it just comes across as laughably bad SFX.

omg what has disney done lately . . most of their new shows really suck . suite life of zach and jenn are not too bad either . i hope to see them soon and they can all help each other . it would be good if we could get together again but that would take a couple of days since i have my own work to do for the show . oh , here 's what i want you to do tonight . go over to his house and try to convince him to come out with you guys . tell him how sorry you are .

last year , i fell in love with the tim burton ' s version of sweeney todd so i wanted to get together as much as possible before i go on stage . a lot of movies do have special effects ; however this one does not . when it first appeared , it went well and had a great cast ( even if it looked like they were being used by the director ) . it got really interesting as it followed the series of bad reviews from the publisher . the only problem was that most of the time , the story was n't funny at all .

see dick work . see jane work . dick and jane are married . they are successful . they have a son . they have a nice house . they are perfect for the marriage . so how did this happen to be about jane ? well , i am going to tell you one thing . it will sound weird . but i can say with complete conviction that this is a story that i never had the opportunity to read in any genre . it just was not my thing . i would have loved to read it in the early days of the trilogy .

if this movie would have been in english , all critics would have trashed it . the language is extremely good and the characters are well received . i just like to think of this novel as one of those ' bad movies ' which can take you back to a place where you were not meant to come from . however , i could n't let this play out too far because the main plot was such a complete crap film . i am not proud of this movie ; i hope you do n't regret coming along on this trip .

(This review does not necessarily expose the plot of the movie, however it may change one's expectations of the movie and thus make for a less enjoyable experience.) Ever rented a scary movie, expecting to be on the edge of your seat in fear, and instead ended up howling in laughter at each and every stupid turn of the plot? This movie had so many opportunities to impress and actually scare the viewer. It was cut poorly and jumped around too much; making references to the past seem more like excuses as to why the plot was heading in its particular direction.

It beats me how anyone can rate this film very highly. It is no understatement to call it far fetched. How the guy managed in such a short space of time to construct a wooden maze of underground rooms is quite ridiculous or maybe he was the greatest carpenter since Jesus. The obese sheriff played by Hoyt Axton looked like a refugee from the Jerry Springer show and I found the blonde female lead Jennifer Jason Leigh rather plain. We have an expression here in the U.K. 'mutton done up as lamb' which suits her perfectly.

If you want to see someone accidentally eat another man's testicle, or look at a row of pathetically fake hard-ons at a wedding, or listen to a man talk about how good it felt to have sex with a girl while she was throwing up, then this is the movie for you. Alternating, in neck breaking fashion, between romantic and gross out comedy, Tomcats is certainly interesting. The lovely Jaime Pressly plays the wife of Horatio Sanz(tell me another one) who is found in many silhouetted situations with other women, but there is, surprisingly, no nudity.

Dante would of been mortified, if he knew that his masterpiece was being ACTED OUT PUPPETS!!! Also the actors who played the puppets are sell outs. Due to the fact that playing a puppet is not acting it is just basically doing nothing. No one really will care who the puppet was. people only care who played a major role in like an actual movie. this is just annoying how you could mock such an amazing man and his belief, by this dumb little movie. This should be a crime and.... I cant believe you would ruin a book like that.

After their star cross-country runner dies after a race, the members of a track team are stalked and killed by a mysterious masked murderer seeking vengeance for the girl's death.From the beginning of this film, it was quite obvious it was not going to be very good (at least as far as true quality goes). The 'dramatic' track race at the end of the introduction scene was one of the least believable sporting events I've ever seen in a film. It would seem that the winner of the race had never actually run before in her entire life.

koyaanisquatsi is simply the best film i ' ve ever seen . it ' s a masterpiece where everything is at the bottom of the food chain and the only problem is there is nothing to do with eating . i spent a good portion of the day in front of the tv watching that movie . i really enjoyed watching it , but was just too embarrassed to say anything since my dad would have been disappointed . instead , i settled on listening to the tape from the box . it was about two or three hours long and boring .

' be with me ' is almost the ultimate wallpaper movie . just leave it running in the background . chat on the big screen for two minutes every day so i can watch my own comedy . all of a sudden , you have to find a way to turn the damn thing off or it 'll go out of business . i 'm trying to make fun of this movie and it looks like it works . i was thinking that it would be a good idea to rewrite the picture from the beginning but i ca n't bring myself to do it .

Me and my mates used to gather together in one house to watch this on a Friday night before going to the pub. It was the only programme that ever made us miss opening time. It is one of the best comedies I have ever watched if not the best. David Jason was brilliant and was compared many times to Buster Keaton with his clever stunts that were pulled off so believably. I wish I could get hold of the series on DVD to watch again. He had an amazing ability to make stupid things look believable and this series shows how much talent he has in so many different directions.

one of the worst theatrical movies of the year , if not all time . anthony hopkins belittles himself by making such outrageous jokes . he also is a horrible actor ( and i have no idea who he is ) but in his movie he gets really good reviews . i loved that movie because i was actually able to pay attention to the dialogue . i spent hours looking at some of the most boring acting scenes . there were n't any characters that looked like they were actors or film directors . it was hard to watch when you were watching your favourite movie .

Naruto the Anime TV Series has so far spawned 2 feature length theatre movies, and a third one is coming our way this summer.The first one, which was released in the summer '04 was a fun adventure featuring the main characters of Naruto in an exciting adventure. However, one must be a blind, deaf and one legged chicken to deny that film's faults. Whilst the first was most definitely enjoyable, there were a lot of things that could be improved on. Naruto Movie 2, however, takes all of these aspects and excels upon them.The action first of all, was incredibly cinematic.

Not having any idea what this film was about, but based on the fact that John Leguizamo was appearing in it, we decided to watch it. Well, it turned out not to be the wisest decision. In fact, as another commentary in this forum puts it, we felt embarrassed for the actors that participated in this movie.While the film is by no means horrible, it doesn't make sense at all. The over the top performance by William Baldwin doesn't help the situation either. John Leguizamo is a multi-talented actor who deserved better.

The odd thing about Galaxina is not that it is supremely bad, although it is. The odd thing is that in spite of being supremely bad, it is not funny. Supremely bad movies have their own particular brand of unintended humor--the secret of their success, you might say. But Galaxina is quite uniquely different--it is MST3K's worst nightmare, a bad movie in which the intentional *and* the unintentional humor alike fall flat.It is easy enough to figure out why the intentional jokes fail--and the reasons are quite varied.

` ` mr . bean ' ' , starring the legendary rowan atkinson , was a huge hit during its run in the 1930 - ' 80s . i ca n't figure how anyone could live through this . you never really get used to it because no one understands what it 's like to live with this kind of an episode on the radio . i think there is something seriously wrong with this movie , especially when it involves a beautiful young woman who falls in love with someone else and then has them kidnapped and taken to another town .

Spend your time any other way, even housework is better than this movie. The jokes aren't funny, the fun rhymes that are Dr. Seus aren't there. A very lousy way to waste an evening. My kids 4-16 laughed a little at the beginning the younger ones got bored with it and left to play Barbies and the older ones left to play ps2 and surf the net. My wife left and did dishes. So I finished it alone. It was the worst "kids" movie I have seen.

Charlie Chaplin responds to open auditions at Lodestone Studios. Rival Ben Turpin arrives at the same studio, obviously another unemployed comedian! Turpin tries to horn in on Chaplin's action after the studio head hollers, "Next!" Chaplin manages to walk in over Turpin, however. Charlie amusingly manages to botch jobs as an actor and carpenter. In the end, he manages to get a big break, but will a star be born? There are a lot of jokes involving the buttocks. The initial scene involving slapstick from Chaplin and Turpin is a relative highlight.

I've always enjoyed Frank Sinatra's music, and just recently I wrote a term paper about his life story. I've been fascinated by the life and legend of Ol' Blue Eyes. However, I've never seen any of his movies. So I wanted to see if his acting was as great as his singing. Well...it was! I was blown away by his performance in this movie! He really does a tremendous job as recovering heroin addict Frankie Machine, who's trying to put his life back together and audition as a drummer for a local band.

blackwater valley exorcism is set on a small town ranch where teenager isabelle ( kristin erickson ) is found wandering in search of her daughter . unfortunately , she ends up spending most of the weekend with two teenage girls who end up doing terrible things to each other . they do have a bad reputation though ; both of them were murdered in the bar of the cabin , so we just have to hope that there will be no record of the murders . if not , i shall try to stay out of the slasher movie as best i can without getting myself in more trouble than i already am .

this movie gets a 10 because there is a lot of gore in it.who cares about the plot or the acting.this is an Italian horror movie people so you know you can't expect much from the acting or the plot.everybody knows fulci took footage from other movies and added it to this one.since i never seen any of the movies that he took footage from it didn't matter to me.the Italian godfather of gore out done himself with this movie.this is one of the goriest Italian movies you will ever see.no gore hound should be without this movie in their horror movie collection.buy this movie no matter what it is a horehounds dream come true.

stealing is a crime , and these guys , kenny yakkel and corbin bernsen look like their going to get the best of me . i could be wrong about this but i would n't be . i am on my second coke and it just makes no sense to me how this is happening . i have never actually been hit by a gun before in my life and i really thought i was safe at home . i saw this movie with a few kids who got hit by a truck during one of those bad movies that make you want to jump for cover .

superb editing , outstanding acting , especially by epatha merkerson , and highly enjoyable musical soundtrack . this film reaches the very top . i have not seen a lot of movies in my life so i thought this one would be a breeze . however , i know it wo n't ever come close to coming up with any other good movies than this one . i just hope the people who wrote this were willing to put on a show that will make the rest of the world forget how to see stars . this is the first time i have ever seen an actor like this .

if you have seen the telugu version of gilli ` ` okkadu ' ' you will find this to be very similar . . . yes , there are some interesting pictures and stories in this story . it is an excellent story which seems to help me to get a little more out of the storyline as i go along . my readers like the characters and the plot but they don " t want to see the character die out because they " d rather not watch it at all - so i thought it might be interesting to watch it while i am here .

This is my first "awful" rating ever on IMDb and I couldn't think of a more deserving film to honor it with. I hoped for entertaining trash and found trash of the saddest, dullest kind. I found a film which no one can possibly have cared a bit about, including its creator. "Hell Ride", directed, written by and starring Larry "Friend of QT" Bishop, has a simple plot about a hidden treasure and a trio of keys, two bands of bikers and a gruesome murder in 1976 which has yet to be avenged.

I have noticed that a lot of films that have been featured on "Mystery Science Theater" have received a tons of low ratings on IMDb. However, a few of the films featured on the films weren't that bad and it's not fair to rate a film that's been given the "MST" treatment--with the hosts making funny comments during the film. Now I am NOT saying that "The Girl in Lover's Lane" is a great film, but it's not nearly bad enough to merit its current IMDb score of 2.1.The film begins with Bix and Danny meeting.

****SPOILER ALERT**** My boyfriend, some friends, and I rented this movie as part of a marathon of really bad movies. We sort of knew what we were getting into. But the lack of plot, direction, and special effects actually left us hoping for a great (or passable) fight scene between the two main characters... the badly rendered swimming cobra and the super violent giant komodo (that ate people like scooping ice cream)... we sort of get this in the end, but had to be cut short due to possibly budget or time constraints?

The movie eXistenZ is about a futuristic video game on a "pod" system that is almost like virtual reality. The only copy of the video game is damaged when an assassination attempt is made on the designer (Jennifer Jason Leigh). Unless it can be repaired, the many years and 38 million dollars spent on the development will all go to waste. The only way to repair the game however, is to actually go in the game with the only person she feels she can trust(Jude Law). This movie was pretty good, but doesn't really pick up until very late in the film.

I tried to give this show a chance, but it really doesn't sit well with me. Although the performances are good, the writing isn't. The two oldest step-siblings, Derek and Casey, are equally annoying; I get the impression that we're supposed to side with Casey, given that she's the protagonist, but I don't find her at all likable. The parents are continually portrayed as utterly clueless. The three younger children are the most watchable things on the show; Lizzie and Edwin are sweet the way they team up, and Marti is adorable.

Though it's better than most made-for-TV movies, "Buried Alive" is nothing more than a run-of-the-mill revenge tale. There are so many plot holes in this one, it makes you wonder why the screenwriters didn't go through a series of re-writes. The ending has a nice twist to it, but it's hardly believable.The acting by Jennifer Jason Leigh is terrific, as always, but Tim Matheson hams it up with cheesy one-liners that reminds one of Jack Nicholson in "The Shining". Don't bother with this one.

anyone that is looking for an episode of ` ` law and order ' ' or ` ` csi ' ' would have to be a real nerd to get into this place . if you go through the motions of helping people but you do it with something akin to reverence , it makes no sense . i could n't put my finger on what was different about this movie . it was so boring . the film did n't seem very exciting . when it first started out as a movie , there had been some nice things about it , like its quality in the last few episodes .

i read a few reviews of the movie and got the impression that it was not as good as the movies i usually watched . i guess this was because my reading was n't as good as it had once been . unfortunately , this is not to say that there have been any negative reviews of the movie . we saw two very nice films involving people who died in a plane crash . neither of these movies was what i was hoping for . when you spend most of your life watching bad movies , you will take an extreme dislike to them .

I'm not even going to comment on what piece of trash this film is since that has already been established. This movie will not be considered for an academy award, but if you enjoy a movie that doesn't take itself seriously and just wants the viewer to enjoy for ninety mins it is not a disappointment. You'll enjoy a send up of Darth Vader for the villain (the breather), a female Batman for the heroine (but much cuter with much less costume), and a running joke that involves cigarettes and the police captain that's very funny. Not by any means a great cinematic achievement. But if you enjoy campy fun it was worth a viewing.

cheap , gloriously bad cheese from the 80 ' s , the decade of cheese . i watched this one first hand because it really had something to offer . you can only imagine what a documentary like this was like , if you were allowed to watch it at all . the premise of this film was that there are two things about cheese that people should know about before making their films . first , and most important : it 's better to have cheese than a movie that is too cheesy to make any difference . second , why does the movie have to take so much effort to create ?

a savage , undisciplined lion has been put behind bars for a circus carnival . he suddenly notices a hole in the film . he can not tell who or what made the film , although he is sure that it was taken in 1956 , from 1915 to 1960 . the acting is excellent , though the quality is abysmal . there is nothing to say about the main character , and the theme of the show is totally devoid of emotion . the dialogue is slow and repetitive , and at first he thinks this is just dumb luck . but when he finally finds his voice again , it is all wrong .

I watched this on HBO because it won the Oscar a week earlier. It compares favorably with fictional courtroom dramas.The story is of a 15-year-old black kid placed on trial for the Jacksonville, FL, murder of an elderly white woman based almost solely on the identification by the victim's husband and on a confession that the defense contends was coerced.About half the footage is of the trial; it's supplemented with footage of the defense lawyers (two public defenders) explaining their case, interviewing witnesses, and visiting key locations. This is edited with a minimum of needless repetition, and placed in logical order.

oh f * cking hell , where should i start . . . first of all ; this show is just another big joke . there are a lot of dumb stunts in it , most of them pretty good , and not a single one makes any sense . why do the people want to go to such stupid shows ? because that 's the way it looks at the movies . you can watch as many as ten different bands for a few hours every day , then they will leave your house and have no idea how much longer you can stand the torture of sitting through an hour of their time .

this feels very stilted and patronizing to a great extent . the whole plot is extremely forced - especially the part where the story is about a man who is kidnapped and imprisoned by a terrorist group , whom they suspect is going to kill him . it is not something that i have seen on tv . however , when i look at these movies , i find myself having an overwhelming urge to know what the real characters are doing in other scenes . i am sure that my imagination is running wild . this film is quite different from anything i have ever seen or heard of anywhere else .

For all those bewildered by the length and pace of this film ("like, why does he show spaceships docking for, like, 15 minutes? "), here's a word you might want to think about:Beauty. Beauty is an under-rated concept. Sure, you'll often see nice photography and so on in films. But when did you last see a film that contains beauty purely for the sake of it? There is a weird belief among cinemagoers that anything which is not plot or character related must be removed. This is depressing hogwash.

I saw this movie last night on HBO & didn't expect to get hooked - I usually fall asleep when I watch HBO. But it happened & you will too. This film was most deserving of an esteemed Oscar - you'll be moved to tears.

the prey has an interesting history , unless you remember the ads for it in newspapers in june of 1984 and july of 1985 . here , this story has a very good beginning , which i have enjoyed for a while because i loved watching it in its entirety . one that i enjoyed as well is the part where the author shows his love for a young lady who is looking for her parents to meet her . there is a strong possibility that this could even be true . the relationship with this woman is so different from anything that i have experienced on earth that i am still amazed .

They used footage of some real protest spliced with some woman talking about a society with no men to make it seem like these people were cheering for the 'gendercide' of men. Leni Riefenstahl would be embarrassed by the disgusting propaganda Moore tries to call "humor". Yes it is your typical direct to video action flick. And of course they do their best to change it up a little bit but fail miraculously. The worst part is that it didn't cover my bad movie basics which are: 1  Cheap looking villains. 2  Perfectly timed one-liners. 3  Intense car chases with massive explosions. 4  The hero hooking up with the hot chick.

the other is a supposed ` ` horror ' ' movie made during the 1970s . it is not to be confused with some classic film , though i do have an opinion on one point of view in the book : the director was never good at anything . he did what he was told to do and he acted out his lines perfectly . it makes you wonder what kind of people are capable of acting like this . as a matter of fact , it makes me wonder why we ever thought we were being nice to any of them . none of us could even imagine doing something like this .

This movie was a disappointment. The story is essentially The Shining with a castle (or a very cheap set masquerading as a castle, to be specific) substituting as the hotel and a monster instead of the ghosts. The budget is the same you'd see from a Cinemax softcore porn, as is the photography, sets, lighting, and video it was shot on. The story is a failed attempt at sincerity: there's no easier way to make your audience feel sympathetic for your characters than to show them experiencing emotional trauma. And the trauma in this movie is pretty trite.

at first sight , i must say already , watch the contractor , 2007 . with wesley snipes too . he likes to play with explosives . if you do n't notice , this movie and the rest of his films are more than a little lacking in good acting . i remember one of these movies playing out on a large flat screen . there were a few others as well , mostly for the entertainment , but there were quite a lot of bad jokes that seemed to go along with it . i saw two of these so called " comedic comedies " because i thought they had some kind of plot or drama .

i thought this movie was perfect for little girls . it was about a magical place where genevieve and all her friends were saved from drowning when they were young . that is one of the things that got me hooked on this movie . i knew i needed to try it , but the idea just would n't leave my mouth . so what do you think ? Sometimes it's hard to be a pirate...............but by golly Miss Jean Peters has a lot of fun trying - and it shows,particularly during her first spot of friendly swordplay with Blackbeard (Mr Thomas Gomez - eminently hissable)when the sheer joy of performing is plain on her face. With fifty years of hindsight Feminists seem intent on grabbing this movie as some sort of an anthem for the empowerment of women in a male - dominated society but I have serious doubts that either M.Tourneur or Miss Peters had any such concept in their heads at the time.

I admit - I was lured to this one from the hype - and I didn't stop to consider the sources. "one of the best indie exploitation flicks of the year (1999)", shocking", and " a must have ".Well - I wasted my money. But not all was bad in this movie. THey at least got the gore right, as well as some of the most unique methods of murder seen in a long time. There is even a storyline (kinda) and that is about it.But for an exploitation film there is a surprising amount of content - but no exploiting.

I rented a copy of this one from Netflix -- big mistake. The DVD version titled "The One-Armed Swordsmen" was produced by madmen who thought that the fighting sequences would be appreciated better pasted all together in one big chapter than as part of a consistent, sequential story. Some of the story was left in separate chapters, which you can select from the main menu, but the DVD is still a mess. Don't rent or buy it. Not that there was anything wonderful about the original story, an absurdly complicated piece of nonsense.

oh , there are many worse wayne movies . this movie is edited poorly but it has a campy element . you can probably tell it is bad because of the tone . it sounds like he was making some serious money from it ! i love these books , but sometimes i wonder if they have all been made out of actual money . what kind of person makes that kind of money ? how would you get rich with a bunch of money ? and how did this make the film so crappy ? i will not be able to leave my place in the theater without being seen by some of the critics .

the plot - in the future when nearly all men have been killed by a y - chromosome - targeting virus , a ( non - human ) result is that this story is more of a joke than a comedy . so i want to thank everyone who saw this and were able to laugh . most of my characters are still out there somewhere in the universe . if it were up to us , they would have stayed where they were for at least 2 years . if they wanted to go on another adventure , they would have chosen something else .

Once again Bronson's talent is mostly wasted on this shock value 1984 thriller which (uncut) is far more disturbing than most of what is out even today. The fact that "The Evil That Men Do" is very disturbing (in its verbal and visual depictions of torture) is not the problem. It is the shameless gratuity in which it is presented. Interestingly, this film seems to symbolize that latter part of Bronson's career in which he has tortured many of his fans with the same egregiously predictable and uncreative plots. One hopes this fine actor will rise again.

I saw this film on 19SEP2009 at the Cambridge Film Festival. The Beagle's only in a couple of short flashbacks, the whole thing is about Darwin's life from 1841 to 1859, when he was ensconced in Kent with his growing family, 200+ pages of Origin had already been drafted and he was wondering whether to complete the book. The script is based on Randal Keynes's book Annie's Box (Annie, Charles's daughter, died when she was 10). It is mostly a family drama, but does include sex scenes - however, the participants are married, both on and off screen.

This film is one of the best of 1986 with creepy, yet intriguing performances from Crispin Glover and Dennis Hopper! The Reagan years were pretty bleak for a lot of people, not just teenagers, but this flick really captured the desperation and despair. Well-directed with great script (apparently based on a true story), I don't really see any weaknesses in this. The opening shot was brilliant.Keanu Reeves was decent for a change and Miss Skye was right on the money. Hopper had three other great performances that same year (Blue Velvet, Texas Chainsaw II, and Hoosiers).

Wow. I just saw Demon Wind a little while ago, and I don't think I'll ever be the same. Or, similarly, so much bad zombie (?) makeup that makes you hungry for those Halloween green marshmallows.Or so much naked old lady, for that matter. But then, there was "The Shining. "The plot here is so amateurish that it actually almost holds a little bit of charm, as does the dialog.

Nemesis Game is a mind-bending film filled with riddles, death, mystery, and philosophy. In it's simplest sense the film is about seeking answers and what happens when you've finally found them all. The search for answers leads Sarah Novak down a path that gets darker as it gets more compelling. The final answer seems more dangerous than it is worth, yet Sarah is so close to understanding it all. What would you do if you were offered the ability to finally make sense of the chaos of life?The movie was written and directed by Jesse Warn.
