This is truly one of the most awful movies of all time. It's dull, ponderous, badly acted, and teeth crawlingly pretentious.I watched for about an hour waiting for some kind of drama to unfold, before realising there wasn't any. The shot on a shoe string budget was particularly painful. These have to be the worst day for night shots since Plan Nine from Outer Space.The only barely redeeming feature is the ludicrous 'demons' wandering around the countryside with a plastic cat basket. How scary is that? And I did like the moggys used as extras, I suppose they are least cheap.

I can envision the writers of this story thinking up this script:1.Let's make a serial killer movie like Se7en, Knight Moves, Copycat, and Silence of the Lambs. People like serial killer stuff. It'll sell... 2.The killer needs to adopt some sort of pattern. I know; he'll copy it out of a serial killer mystery novel. That hasn't been done yet, at least not exactly like that. 3.Now, we need some kind of way to make this movie unique; of course, the good guy can be bedridden like in Rear Window.

It's almost impossible for me to sit down and write a conscientious review of THREE COLORS: RED without letting people in on some of the ideas that Krysztoff Kieszlowski has explored in the previous two entries to this fascinating trilogy. The more I see them and think of them, and imagine myself in their world, the more I get its theme: that we are more linked to each other than we would want to think ourselves, and all it takes is a little hand of fate to set some events in motion.

If there are people that don't like this movie, I don't think they are human. This film deploys all emotions and shows many sides of Judith Light's character. Made in 1997, this is one of the best movies I have seen and really the film that Judith Light has starred in to make me a huge fan of hers. This movie, although sometimes you want to rattle the son for trusting her so much, is incredibly moving. I cry at the end every time and it takes much to do that to me!

you belong to me was the final teaming of henry fonda and barbara stanwyck as a screen team and it is a good movie . i am not an actress , but i can be creative when i want . this movie was about a man in his sixties who was on the verge of bankruptcy and was struggling to raise his two children in a foreign country ( he would have preferred they remain in their home in europe ) , but he somehow managed to find enough funds to pay the rent and pay for a couple of meals from the food stores in the south .

I found it hard to care about these characters, who were either annoying or insipid, all living their fabulously hilariously urban lives.The dialogue was excruiciating at times, and at other times the narrative seemed hard to follow - was it me or were entire scenes deleted?It felt like a poor sitcom somehow turned into a film. The stereotypes and jokes about "men's groups" would perhaps have been funny in the early 90s. As it is, this is where much of the humour of the film comes from - and boy, does it get old fast.Apart from the attractive Irish man - this film was a dud.

The wind and the lion is a marvelous sweeping motion picture. It is a monument to what filmmaking once was but is no more.Connery, despite the thick scottish brogue, plays the Raisulu very well. He inspires the viewer in a way many lead characters cannot. Candice Bergen, in one of her early roles, is marvelous as the kidnapped socialite Mrs. Pedacaris, showing courage in the face of adversity (and plenty of humour as well). A marvelous film, rent or buy it and you won't be disappointed.

The original "Psycho" (1960) is widely considered as Alfred Hitchcock's best work and certainly, in my opinion, is one of the best movies of all time. The decision to film a shot by shot remake is therefore, a little puzzling.The cast in the original was flawless, so the cast of this remake had a lot to live up to. Vince Vaughn as Norman Bates was not a good choice for the lead. He is too much of a pretty boy hunk and is not very convincing as Bates.

B: That untalented Juliette Lewis is in it.

Certain aspects of Punishment Park are less than perfect, specifically some of the acting. However I feel that this is probably the most important movie of the "war on terror" era. I grew up hating hippies and in some respects I still do. It wasn't until the United States was started down the path of an unnecessary and deceitful war in Iraq that I began to see the world through their eyes. I can feel what they must have felt. Although the film is somewhat dated, watching it brings those uncomfortable emotions about our present situation right to the surface.

Went with some friends and one of my friends mom, thinking it would be a good way to start off the spring break, but the movie turned out awful. We all agree it shouldn't have been PG-13. More like R material. Lots of sexual dialog, cussing and referring to boy and girl parts (below the waist). Not worth the time or money. Strongly urge you not to go, or rent it when it comes out. If you do end up going, don't take smaller children. Not the type of movie to see with the family!

"Witchery" is a decent little Euro-Trash horror yarn! David Hasselhoff is pretty damn funny in this one and sadly, he's one of the better actors. Linda Blair is downright terrible and the lady who plays Hoff's wife...she is hilariously bad! The plot of this film is ridiculous too. It's got some holes, which you can't help but notice, but it remains entertaining throughout.The gore in "Witchery" is freaking outstanding. I loved the part where the old bag gets "sucked" into the trash chute and ends up in the chimney to roast!

2005 will go down in 'Dr.Who' history as its most incredible year. Everything seemed to click; a first-rate new Doctor and companion, big audiences ( 10 million for the first episode and Christmas special ), major awards, critical acclaim and those idiots who spent years giggling at the Daleks' seeming inability to negotiate stairs were well and truly silenced. But then Christopher Eccleston dropped a bombshell, quitting after just one series. It looked like the honeymoon was over. Luckily, the public appears to have embraced his successor, the excellent David Tennant.

Many believe this movie is a baseball movie. Such people are disappointed because it's about a baseball player, but the movie isn't about baseball.Some think this movie is a romantic comedy and are disappointed because the relationship isn't really developed. This movie is not a romantic comedy.This movie is about culture. An arrogant American Major Leaguer and a stern traditional Japanese baseball manager cannot succeed because they can't, indeed, won't understand one another. It's after they manage to break through the cultural barrier that they have success.

I'm not sure if this is a comedy or not, but I found it pretty comical. Isobel is possessed by the devil. Somehow a perverted priest and the gardener are gonna' fix that. "Carlito's Angels" is a spoof of "Charlie's Angels" that is not afraid to spoof even itself at times, however that does not mean that the film is above criticism by the viewers as well - it is amateurish and juvenile (I think "fast-motion" stopped being funny around 1914). For several reasons, this movie is simply awful. Other posters have listed some of this movie's historical errors. Well, I have a layman's knowledge of Roman history and even I found the inaccuracies flagrant. I usually forgive errors in historical movies because I understand that the purpose is to entertain not educate. And shrinking a long saga down to a two hour feature requires some, let's say, historical license. But this movie goes well beyond mere rounding.There's worse. To tell a story from a distant period, the movie uses flashbacks which just make the story more confusing.

People call a 976 "party line" to talk dirty to strangers, and perhaps meet up for a sexual liason. A deranged, somewhat incestuous sister and occasional transvestite brother use the line to find people to kill, usually married men, but they don't discriminate! One of them works as a babysitter for a married man who's hot for her (or anyone).Meanwhile, a vice cop is borrowed by homicide when he's the first to discover one of the siblings' victims.

` ` catchfire ' ' or ` ` backtrack ' ' as it is sometimes called , is not very good . that is where we are in the game . if i can tell you what happened , all i can say is that this was the best game ever made , and it will be even better from this point of view . some players were really good at the game , and others were really good at catching the ball . one bad player could get caught with an easy start . so much of this game had been written up in movies and documentaries to justify its use .

this film powerfully demonstrates the struggle of two women in love in a culture so deeply entrenched in ritual and culture . i had no idea , until now , how much it was going to affect my art . not only that , but i am quite aware that there are certain aspects of the film that have been written down in the last five minutes because of the sheer volume of commentary . i felt sorry for her and decided to watch the movie for a second time . when i finally managed to get out from under the covers , i thought i would die of fear if i stayed in bed .

it ' s the sooooouullltakaaaa ! wow . what a skin peeling bad movie . honestly , this is one of the more depressing movies that i have ever seen . i do not know how anyone can watch something like this on television without laughing and crying . i want to run out the front door into the parking lot and beat some heads off with my fists . this is one of the most depressing shows i have ever watched . why did we put this on tv ? i just ca ' t figure it out yet . i was hoping that this might help in some way , but nothing seemed to work .

ham - handed homage to honest hacking . felt good in a soft - core way about equivalent to its mild pornography , until you got too used to it . after all , it was not as though i could be bothered to even consider buying a proper set of clothes . one day , on a rainy afternoon , the sun went back up . i was wearing this shirt and some jeans when i saw a guy in a long dark overcoat come out of the bookstore . he walked slowly , casually , like he did n't have a care in the world if he was late .

this is one of the most unoriginal , cliche - ridden movies i have ever seen . even if you did n ' t know it was based on some of the worst movie lines i ve ever seen in my life , this film is pretty bad . seriously . how did anyone live through this shit ? i ' ll be damned if i ' m going to watch this one again . i think we should take a break . * * * 
 when i first heard that he had just been arrested for murder , i was so worried about him that i really did not care what his name was .

Well, the Sci-Fi channel keeps churning these turkeys out... and they seem to get worse every time. When normally good actors like John Rhys-Davies and Giancarlo Espositto come off as rank amateurs, you can imagine how abysmal the REST of the cast in this waste-of-your-time effort is. The only halfway decent thing is the rubber outfit of the creature(which is glimpsed in such quick flashes that you don't really have time to see how phony it really is). The dialogue...the plot...if this "movie"(and I use the term loosely) was food, Jack-In-The-Box would be a gourmet meal compared to this.

i was very disappointed in this film . the director has shown some talent in his other endeavors , but that 's about it . the director is not as good at this as the rest of us and he has no flair for these films . it is quite sad really . i think there is something to see on the back of these movie posters . the first part of this film is based on a story written in 1937 by one of the greatest minds in america . the story seems to be going along like a dream . if only you had gone to my school with me .

*****I reveal two 'twists' at the end of the film. Do not read if you want to watch this movie for some reason*****Oh my, this is bad. Earth has been destroyed in a nuclear holocaust. Well, parts of the Earth, because somewhere in Italy, a band of purebred survivors--those without radioactive contamination--are holed up in a massive mansion surrounded by lush grounds, waiting for the next opportunity to go hunting for those with polluted blood. The Final Executioner is the story of one of their would be victims, Alan (William Mang, who looks, not surprisingly, a lot like Kurt Russell), and his efforts to take down the legally sanctioned hunters, who are led by Edra (Marina Costa) and Erasmus (Harrison Muller Jr. ).

this is a well - crafted piece from everyone ' s favorite master of suspense . as usual , the technical elements such as the dialogue are just not very useful in this case , but that does not mean that we will get much of it . if you would be so kind as to make this movie based on an earlier one i would love to hear what you have to say . let 's start with something else and leave it there . ok . i do n't suppose you can write this film unless you are at least 20 years old and live in the middle class .

I like Steve Buscemi. I like his work very much, both as an actor and a director. You could say that I am -into- Steve Buscemi. A Steve Buscemi freak. I lurv Steve Buscemi.I remember when I first saw Buscemi's full length directorial debut, "Trees Lounge." I enjoyed the movie, although it wasn't as good as it could have been. It was -almost- there. It -almost- scratched that itch, the itch of wanting to see "small" movies about "small" people in "small" bars that are in "small" towns.

Maybe it's just that it was made in 1997, or maybe whoever managed to get this up to a 7 has a soft spot for kids with AIDS. But really people, the maniacal laughter & mayhem during the withdrawal scene? Did you not see that coming? I'm surprised there was no baby crawling across the ceiling and sickboy addressing the camera. The acting was fine, sure. But to me this is just one example of a movie from a time when situations and subject matter could pass for cinematic language. Things happen, but that's it.

Down Periscope is not a "Great Movie". But then again very few flicks are. So if your looking for entertainment instead of great wisdom this is a "great movie", without the capitals. No sharp sexism or graphic violence spoil this light comedy about a bunch of misfits who are assigned to a antique submarine. They are set to fail their tasks so that a general can get his extra star. They must take on the entire US-navy with it's nuclear submarines. But they are underdogs and this is a comedy so you can guess the outcome.

I caught this during a brief run in a Philadelphia theater. Despite its local provenance (and its relation to a hometown tragedy, namely the beating death of Eddie Polec in 1994), I really have to come down hard on this movie. The director, for reasons best known to himself, decided to shoot the entire film guerilla-style, with nonstop handheld cameras and rapidfire cuts. Such technique might work for the scenes of jarring violence, but is utterly inappropriate for the rest of the material, which makes up the majority of the film.

i found the movie very interesting . i really enjoyed the film the actors were great . it was entertainment , but it did not come close to getting me on the list of people in this film who deserve to die like this . i got a good view of the whole film , and i watched it as much for the first time . there are times when i would like to see the movie again , but i could not afford to . after seeing it once more , i had no desire to see it again . what if i get to watch this one again ?

The series finally hits rock-bottom with this lousy fourth installment, which was (thank God) the last one. None of the three sequels did justice to the highly entertaining original, but this particular film is nothing more than a shameless attempt to exploit the name of the "Magnificent Seven" and Bernstein's rousing music theme. The production values resemble those of a made-for-TV movie and the characters are forgettable and indistinguishable: in parts "II" and "III" you couldn't remember their names, here you can't even remember their faces.

i started off being interested somewhat in the movie . it appeared it might be serious drama , dealing with an ex - girlfriend who used to play tennis with the local high school and has been trying to get his head out of his ass for a while now . there were lots of good comedies that made this movie more interesting , as did many of the really good ones . i had seen quite a few reviews of this one . some of these ' comedies ' were not what i wanted to watch but some of them actually helped me learn the film .

to date this is still the worst piece of rubbish i ' ve ever viewed . so annoyed i even complained to your brother that he should put it in an open box and watch it burn . i don ' t have the heart to turn it over to the media - it ' s bad enough being on tv , now i ' ll have to see it in person . " " really ? " asked mr . king . " i never had any idea you liked films . " " well if i didn ' t know better i would have thought you ' re trying to make me dislike them .

it has taken several viewings for me to fully appreciate this film . initially , i was struck by the fact there are six characters involved , one of which is the actor from my last movie . the rest of the movie is a complete and utter failure . the acting is so awful , i had to sit in the front row while the director used the remote to shut it up . after that , i wanted to jump in the shower as soon as possible . i even tried to see if i could turn on the soap or at least put on a shirt , but the water was already freezing .

I was once a big Olsen fan. I received this movie when I was six and watched it almost nonstop until I was nine. Then it lay on my shelf gathering dust until yesterday. I was left speechless.Mary-Kate and Ashley play Allie and Mel, two twelve year olds who are sent to spend Spring Break in Paris with their ambassador grandfather. Along the way, they meet, as one might expect, two cute French boys who show them the more fun side to Paris. I guess the two boys were okay, fake French accents aside.

Incident on and off a Mountain Road is Don Coscarelli's entry in Mick Garris' Masters of Horror series. Coscarelli is famous for being the man behind such cult gems as the Phantasm series and the irresistibly weird Bubba Ho-Tep; but he brings none of the qualities that made those films great to this TV episode. The plot is a run of the mill one that follows the routine idea of an innocent being chased by a madman. This time, it's a young woman driving down a mountain road. After a head on crash, she finds herself being stalked by a white faced maniac.

this is an apocalyptic vision of the hell of our contemporary world . the social criticism of our shallow , low - budget society is just too much fun for the average person . as a child i was so angry with my mother and dad that i used to spend hours talking about them in graphic detail . they would never let me play video games . they would make it seem like i could do what i liked , and that ' s exactly what i did . now i feel very bored by all the action .

i just had to add my comment to raise the average on this one . paul giamatti lets it all go - he gets angry when he sees what a complete moron i 've become in my efforts to create a good example of him ! i have never been much for portraying his work , but that 's exactly what was written there . as a kid i was so focused on being a decent writer that i did n't really even bother with anything other than creating stories . after watching how awful they were , i thought maybe someone was paying me a little visit or something and wanted to get their hands on one .

I'm not really sure where to begin. From start to finish, bad, stinky bad, like stepping into a port-a-john on a 100 degree day. If you force yourself to watch this as I did, keep some Vicodin handy for the pain. I will never understand how flicks this bad make it past the cutting room without the entire reel ending up on the floor. The movie is a cross between Gumby rides Pokey, meets the terminator, meets Wally Beaver playing cowboys and Indians without the cowboys. I've seen better animation in the original cut of the Blob.

i found the film a bit predictable and boring but i am 14 . i was really annoyed with my little cousin at the end of the movie . you see , it was on the news before i moved in so i got up early to watch it . oh well , after that i could n't wait to get away from everything that was happening in my life , so i spent most of my days trying to catch up with people who were having a good time . this film has been popular since its inception , and i love every minute of it .

What can I say?? This movie has it all...Romance, break-ups, rich kids, punks and preps. This is my all time favorite movie that I can recite line for line....I remember when it first came out, I was 14 and couldn't get in....so finally got to see it on cable... I was hooked! Wanted to move to California and be a Valley Girl.. (Hey, I even remember the song by Moon Zappa, do you?) Tried in vain for years to get the never produced soundtrack...now you can find it on rhino records....

there was nothing remotely funny about this movie . it makes fun of various sports movies and cliches but nothing like this . the story is so depressing . i just want to watch a bad sitcom and be done with it by the end of the film . here goes nothing . the script takes a right turn , and suddenly i find myself in an alleyway . it 's dark , but there are lights up ahead . i get out and try to take a look at the source of the headlights . they are bright and shining .

This film is terrible - honestly. The acting is terrible, the script made me cringe, the effects are completely lousy (which I usually don't mind for older films, but this was made just two years ago), and everything about it just annoys me. A few friends go out on Halloween into the woods and meet a witch and her cannibal son. Of course, before that it has the cliché "You really believe that? Ha ha ha, it's just a story" routine dragged out for a while.

This woman is a terrible comedian. She can't crack a joke. She has no real character. She does not deserve anything but booing.Why can't America dump this kind of turdish delight, and go for something that actually contains humour.She is not funny.

I've always liked Barbara Stanwyck who was, perhaps, the hardest working lead actress of the 30's and 40's although few of her movie roles are memorable. Today she is remembered most for the TV show "The Big Valley". Stanwyck worked so much because she was durable; it seems that she would accept most any role and make the most of it to make the movie a success and so directors loved her and many an ordinary picture gained credibility by her presence.And so it was for "Christmas in Connecticut" a very ordinary effort whose plot strains credulity and isn't even really about Christmas.

camp blood is an absolutely atrocious slasher film . we ' re mixing friday the 13th with the blair witch project , and i would hate to see what happens if people start seeing this movie . " " please do not give me anything special on this film ; there are just too many scenes . the plot has nothing to do with the story or genre of this film . you can ' t even imagine the characters in this film ( it ' s a total dump ) . it was basically a waste of money . who gives a crap about this movie ? !

at first i did n ' t think that the performance by lauren ambrose was anything but flaky , but as her acting took a turn , she had some amazing voice and she was beautiful . she went through with all of her parts and played well . when she came over to us , i could tell she felt really bad for having to perform so poorly , and i told her i just wished she would go back home and let us do this . she looked at me sideways , shrugged her shoulders , gave me a quick peck on the cheek and said , " i know , i know .

most of the critiques on this flick have been pretty damn accurate . it is an hour and half waste of time , but then there are a few instances where i feel more like a character out of the movie than a regular person on the shelf . that night was not particularly good , but you get used to it after a while . one thing that i had never experienced was being forced to work in a house full of spoiled brats . it took some time to find a place to park , because my parents would n't allow me to park with someone who does not have a car .

I spent many a sleepless night after watching 2001. Not only because of the psychological horror (of which 2001 is a masterpiece) but also because of the way it brought me (a restless soul) some clarity to the way I observe the universe. It changed my way of thinking in a very profound way. And after reading the novel (by Arthur C. Clarke) I found myself once again inspired (a writer as I am) by the level of imagination.The Space Odyssey is not something one can just "go and see".

and obviously i did n ' t see it ! but looking at the cast and seeing that doug masters is back there , he ' s not just a movie . he don ' t look like he can do anything to save his life . when i heard this film , i got so excited i had to be on my way to the restroom . i know i should have been more worried about how well the script is going , but i was so busy wondering how i would get out of this one , i barely saw what i really needed to know .

As an ex (nuclear) submarine officer I must admit this is my favorite submarine movie (even exceeding Hunt for Red October). Someone knew something about submarines when they wrote the movie. OK - not realistic - but it is a comedy - and has all of the "inside jokes" from the submarine force. A great cast with the stereotypical uptight submarine guys on the "Orlando" and our heroes on the diesel boat. Definitely "DBF" by the way = that means diesel boats forever. But they want ten lines in order to post this - jees is the Admiral in charge here?

Follow-up to 1965's "My Name Is Barbra", and shot in brilliant color, "Color Me Barbra" has La Streisand alternating nostalgia, clowning comedy, feminine romantic angst, and beguiling seriousness for a crazy-quilt hour of show-biz razzle dazzle. She's a cut-up and a femme fatale, a sprite and an enigma. With her Egyptian eye make-up and ever-changing hairstyles, she's also a chameleon. Her voice is rich and moving, even if a few of her songs are not ("One Kiss", "Yesterdays").

Yes, why? Among the filmmakers that came out in the 80's and 90's Gus Van Sant is one of my idols. There are others, a few. Steven Sodebergh, PT Anderson, Tim Hunter, Danny Boyle, Martin Donovan, Harmony Korine, Wes Anderson. Idiosyncratic, infuriating some times, but consistent, surprising, unpredictable. Their names make me switch on the TV, go to a video store or even buy a ticket and go to a movie theater. Van Sant's "Psycho" however, gives me pause. Why? I wonder.

It's about jealousy, it's about racism, it's about manipulation, but the underlying message is love. Geoffrey Sax tried to pull off Shakespeare's Othello, by bringing it to modern day context. However, the actors were not convincing enough to pull this off. There were extra bodies to help put everything in to perspective, however, John Othello, played by Eamonn Walker, over reacted a lot in this film, causing for the down fall of Keeley Hawes, Dessie Brabant, eventually ending in Dessie's death.

Although this movie (and I use the term loosely) was made in 1997, we just watched it tonight for the first time. My husband commented that a Tommy Lee Jones movie that we'd never heard of made him a little apprehensive. I blithely watched anyway, certain that if Jones was in the movie, it must at least be worth two hours of my time. After all, he has been one of our go-to actors for years. Although Heche isn't one of my favorite actresses, I was additionally reassured by seeing another well-known face.

Eh. This is a popcorn movie, nothing more. I watched this with a bunch of friends (and though that might NOT be the best way to view a horror movie...) and most of the dialogue and action was laughable.It left me yearning for a real film. :)The main problem is the lack of tension in the film. It keeps flashing back to 'explanation' scenes, which dissipates any discernible tension.And the character relationship 'twists'? Yeah, they suck. I won't say what they are, but they just don't add anything to the film/storyline.

it ' s been a long time since i have been in the art - house theater and i went to see douches , " he explained . " it was pretty good , though . i didn ' t expect anything different . i watched a few more scenes , and then when i thought i had finally seen every action flick i could ever remember seeing , i felt really bad for watching them so i did some of the other movies on the shelf . i am glad that my mother chose to buy such a nice one . i thought that this film was much more exciting .

Like in a circle the movie leads back to its point of departure, the image of the cranes that are crossing a Muscovite sky. They represent the freedom to realize your life as you wish, in order to aspire the greatest possible fulfilment.In the beginning Veronica and Boris experience such a promise of happiness, and their eyes follow the path of the cranes in exhilaration. It seems as if they might be able to live according to their dreams.But Man is not a bird. Life draws up its own rules, from which no human can escape and which we cannot change - not even by making a supreme effort.

i think i can safely say ( without really giving anything away ) , that this movie had no robots . when you see someone else with a robot it tends to make a good story . as the credits begin rolling i look over at ryan . " what the hell was that about ? " i ask . he looks like he has never seen a sci - fi movie before so his expression is one of pure bewilderment . " who knows ? " i say in exasperation . " it could have been funny , it just seems so stupid . " i said .

the evil below starts on ' the straits of san sebastian 1683 ' as the 17th century treasure ship the el greco - roman war machine . at the moment , though , he does have something interesting to say . after a while , i can not stand his voice and i think maybe it has something to do with the lack of a proper naval command system . he is one of those guys who thinks they need to make everything look like a military action movie . there was one time that i saw him sitting in front of his computer , but he just watched tv .

dear reader , watch out ! this movie is not really a movie , though its creators have the impertinence to mention it was written in 1936 , and has yet to be produced . when i was an adult i loved that movie , but i never would have considered myself a big fan of it if i had known there would be a sequel to it . my mother used to tell me one day how she could always count on her grandchildren to come back and watch the movie . i must say that it was somewhat disappointing , because i was expecting to see more of the same characters all over the place .

First i gotta say that this film is way less pretentious than The Da Vinci Code. sure, you have the religion vs science problem but it doesn't try to make a big statement about it. its basically an action thriller that moves from one scene to another very well. one scene particularly (that involves fire) i found extremely well done. Second, the changes from book to film. although when i was following the development of the film i complained about the change of some characters and the complete removal of others, i gotta admit i was wrong.

jon cryer reprises his role as a neurotic guy in two and a half men , which he perfected in the second book . i mean , if anyone knows how to fix the movie , it would be him . with a film like that , you have to really believe it is one of the most successful movies on the planet and you get a special rating from the characters . also , these movies are very good and the plot is incredibly entertaining . they even make this movie interesting , though i think it is not quite as bad as you might think .

* * possible spoilers ahead * * whenever fans of bad movies congregate for more than a few minutes , they always go back and tell us what the worst movie has ever seen in their lives . here , i want to say that this was not the worst movie ever made . it actually was quite cool . all the actors were cute as sin and all the acting was easy . but the plot was very boring , and we were all disappointed in the end . when i said that i thought the whole thing was pretty good , i was told it was just an attempt to show off some talent .

this show is made for persons with iq lower than 80 . the jokes in the show are so lame they sound as if they were made by a teenager . there was no humor in the movie . that is just not what i expected at all . it is certainly not what i expected to see when i first walked on stage . i thought maybe the producers and crew would take the opening act as one of the main characters from the movie , but they have not . i am surprised that the cast and crew actually voted for this . they should be proud of their ratings .

i love cheesy horror movies , i think dead alive and bad taste are great and i think slumber party is my least favorite thing to watch on tv . i 've seen this movie plenty of times in my life so it never occurred to me to check the cable or radio channel before i went to sleep . now , if you 'd rather watch something else than watch zombie movies , i could really use some popcorn . i 'll admit there are a few parts where the plot stinks , but nothing like this . this was not a film that i liked much as a child though .

solomon and sheba has come down in hollywood lore not for the quality of the film , but for the entertainment value of the story . " " i think a lot of these things are being written about me so that i will never be quoted here again . i do not like this script at all . it is very bad . you should know better than to put a name on any scenes that have been done by someone who does not have a clue about their own character . the only good thing about it is that it sounds like an awful way to spend my day .

This is a movie that should be viewed and treated as a piece of art. This is an oblivious labour of love by the Schrader brothers about the life of Yukio Mishima that is full truly artistic elements. The movie jumps from color to black and white, past to present, fictional works by Mishima to him. All without being confusing in the least bit. The only thing that gets me is that the entire movie, with the exception of the narrator's spoken parts is in Japanese. Still a masterpiece that deserves an audience but hasn't found won.

i love these awful 80 ' s summer camp movies . the best part about ` ` party camp ' ' is the way the kids get up from bed in the morning without any effort on their part , and act as though they just walked out of a shower . no one cares what anyone else thinks because if you go to college you do not have to waste your spare time watching old movies or trying to decide which side you want to take to win a scholarship to harvard . it was almost like having a tv that turned itself off during the night .

You don't have to spend much time watching this made for TV movie or series pilot or whatever it was intended to be to figure out just what lies in store. The incredibly bad musical score makes its debut from the start. Seriously, if this isn't the worst theme I've ever heard, I certainly can't remember it. While the acting talent is available here, from Jeff Bridges to Carl Betz, Vera Miles, and Sal Mineo, the writing is atrocious and the story is contrived, filled with insipid stereotypes, and an obvious ripoff from Ken Kesey.

this film is undoubtedly one of the greatest landmarks in history of cinema . by seeing this film , we know that it is from a movie of great horror , not real life at all . i can assure you this film is based on much more realistic reality . and it really is good - but do n't judge me for the fact that i have to try and convince you otherwise . here is a brief overview of the role of this film . it is very well written and has a beautiful quality . the plot is interesting and the characters are interesting .

` ` strangers on a train ' ' was one of those film classics i had always heard about but somehow never witnessed . not that there was much to see and i was just as surprised by what i saw . the actors in this film did have great talent , but at least they did not need to do something completely unmemorable to make it exciting . the movie was not bad . i really liked the premise , although i knew very little about the character and its characters . there are some points where i could describe the plot perfectly , but so many of them are pretty vague .

This is an apocalyptic vision of the hell of our contemporary world. The social criticism of our shallow, commercially oriented values is what makes this film an exceptional vision of the "war is hell" cliché, underscored by a mythical journey upriver to Cambodia by a special forces captain whose mission is to eliminate (with extreme prejudice) a rogue colonel, who's left behind the army's concepts of justice to create his own world. When I saw Apocalypse Now in 1980, I thought it was a deeply flawed masterpiece.

Why would I say that? Because when the movie ended, I was in a good mood. So many people exclaim at the end, wow! Bruce Willis can be funny. For those of you who believe he learned how to act after the sixth sense, you must be very new to his career. He won an emmy for best actor in a comedy series before he did Die Hard. It's like saying, wow, the sky learned to deposit snow on the ground just because it's your first winter in life. The movie was hilarious.

There is no way to avoid a comparison between The Cat in the Hat and The Grinch Who Stole Christmas, so let's get that part out of the way. First of all, let me start by saying that I think Grinch was an underrated and unappreciated film. Cat was... well, just awful.Jim Carey was cast because he is a brilliant physical comedian, and fearlessly commits to over the top, outrageous characters. Mike Myers fell back on his old bag of tricks.Why, why, why Mike Myers?? The kids could care less, and the Austin Powers demographic isn't going to spy this film.

i have watched the root of all evil with the avowed object of refuting this so called scientific atheist . that is , before we knew there were any things to say . ' it ' s funny how many people believe in god . but not many believe in anything other than sex . at the end of every movie , one of these guys comes to know about what 's happening and he tries to warn everybody away . it seems that the two guys are friends , but after a few weeks , the two guys come back to the dorm room and start talking .

Jim Henson's The Muppet Movie is a charming, funny and brilliant film that can be watched AND enjoyed by adults and kids. I feel this is my favorite childhood film because it combines great characters, great story, and great wit that it is irresistable. The plot involves Kermit the frog (puppeteered and voiced by Henson) in his odyssey across America to follow his dream in Hollywood. Along the way, he meets Fozzie Bear, The Great Gonzo (my favorite), Miss Piggy, Rolf, and DR. Teeth and the electric mayhem.This film has so many good things I can't even say them.

Franco films can be divided into 4 categories- the "earlies" (often black and white and inventive), the "naughties" (late 1960s/early 1970s often involving Soledad Miranda), the "nudies" (of various periods, but using full frontal female nudity as plot drive)and "the rest".This is part of the "rest". It is not really a cannibal movie at all. It is certainly no gorefest. The few women in the picture dont even lose their loin cloths and there is little full frontal stuff at all.

This film is about a bunch of misfits who are supposed to be assigned to a task that is expected to fail miserably. The misfits pull together to successfully complete their mission.Hilarity ensues.Like the "Police Academy" films, the humor comes from the kooky characters on the boat. I thought it was an engaging film and I will stop to watch it anytime it is on TV. No, it won't cause you to ponder your relative role in the cosmos or inspire you to do great things for the service of mankind, but it is fun enough entertainment for 90-some-odd minutes.

as far as i am concerned , this film noir had two totally different things going for it as opposed to what we were thinking of making in the movie . first off there were so many characters , that there were so many great scenes . the only thing i really liked was how a lot of the actresses acted and played their roles . they also had a bit of a sense of style and style which made it interesting to watch them . most of the actors did not know how to act or act , so you do not really understand what is going on until it is too late .

to even say that this film is sebastien ' s work at his best just tell you everything you have to know , because it 's not really a movie at all . i had been so happy and carefree back then , but i had become disillusioned by the whole thing . in fact , i am pretty sure i could never be happier . now my mind is thinking of something that i should have seen earlier , but i was too lazy to care . as soon as we finish filming , there are only about 45 more scenes to go and i am having a lot of trouble watching it .

dreadful , stupidly inane film dealing with corruption at the louisiana purchase lumber company . everyone in the state of louisiana seems to have it on tape . is there anything you like better than a bad movie ? why do you watch it anyway ? who is it about ? i could tell this was a bad movie if you tried to talk to me ; however , you should have taken some time to go over this video . let me remind you that this film is supposed to be about a girl who has been kidnapped by a very dangerous man .

night hunter is a sold b style action movie . get a life and grow up people . don ` ` t be an idiot . you will know what it is even if you watch it for a couple hours . in fact , i ' ve only seen this movie once . it was filmed in the summer of 1951 on a country farm in california . there is a farmer who works as a doctor to save a family from the dangers of the wilderness . unfortunately , all he can do is drive off without ever knowing his wife , daughter , or children are gone .

At first sight, I must say already, watch The Contractor, 2007. With Wesley Snipes too. A better action movie and with a more dramatic plot.The Detonator has an horrendous plot focusing in some sort of atomic bomb, set in Romania and with awful directing for an action movie-- there is no thrilling moments and an action movie is turned in to boredom.Really, what you expect Wesley Snipes to do, when awful screenplays like this one are offered to him? Don't blame him, he needs the money.This was the first impression when I saw the movie, 3 years ago.

this movie had me stuck in this endless loop of thinking about it for days afterward...granted i am not the movie snob that some folks around here appear to be, but i thought this was amazingly well-acted, and a powerful creation, if lacking a little subtlety in exectution. i happen to admire movies that can effectively recreate the sensation of watching a stage play, it creates an inharmonious eeriness that works well with this flick. i am also a great fan of alan rickman, so that might be my bias.

naach a more detailed review can be obtained anywhere else in the web . this one is a good portrayal of the work of the actor , who used the role to make it sound as though he was having a better time than he actually is . you may also find this picture somewhat difficult to figure out ; the plot is too well crafted and there are so many bad lines that it is impossible to judge whether anyone really cares about the performance . the best way to read the story is to keep an eye on the cast .

we have a character named evie . evie just wants to be a good person . she ' s nice , but is too dumb to take the time to understand why people make movies with such a small plot and so little character structure . the main thing in this movie is the fact that it didn ' t include anything that would actually give you a sense of what the characters or character really were like . if you do not like the acting , you ca n't possibly understand who they are because it was never done .

One of the worst movie I have seen in 2009 so far: The story hesitates between a silly thriller or a dumb comedy.As nothings happens, the void is filled with long, boring dialogs that don't make any sense! The cast is famous but doesn't bring any emotions except to fast-forward the play! And it happens in a plush seaside hotel that looks really gloomy. In comparison, the one of the "Shining" is funfair! NB: a lot of users think that it is located in the French Riviera! They are wrong!

I can admit right away that this is one of the worst movies i have seen in my life. And that is not saying a little, because i consider myself to be somewhat of an aficionado when it comes to crappy film. But this is beyond bad. This movie is so awful that there is no fun left in it, it's just bad.Reviewing this is almost impossible. There are no strong points and nothing positive to say. I'll just ramble about a few of the points that sucked. First off, the CGI has to be one of the worst i've seen.

after the success of star wars , there was a boost in interest in sci - fi movies . this was one of those things i had never seen before . well , i saw some pretty good sci - fi movies so it was no surprise that my reaction to this one was not as unconvincing as it should have been . and then i heard something about aliens . i remember thinking how odd that would have been . they do n't talk much about their culture , nor do they tell you what they like or what they prefer . what is the point ?

Just finished watching 2FTM. The trailers intrigued me so much I actually went to see it on opening weekend, something I never do. Needless to say I was very disappointed. The story has so much potential and it's frustrating to see it get screwed up. I really feel the problem with the movie was the directing and Matthew McConaughey. First off I am not a MM hater, I thought he was awesome in both Reign of Fire and Lone Star. I enjoyed his performance in those movies without having to see him with his shirt off 3-4 times.

poor bela lugosi . just another day at work . a group of saboteurs attempting to disrupt the american war is trying to infiltrate russia , and we do n't want them anywhere near the u.s. it looks like the entire world is on the brink of war as this movie starts again in 2046 . i 'm very impressed with what happened on this film ( although i really do n't think there ever had to be any reason to ) . not only that , however , the characters all look so bad , you might as well ask if they were murdered .

i just glanced over another comment posted here in which the writer discusses the disturbing ways the teenagers in this story have done so . there is no other way that i can describe it as bad . if i was to write a good story i would probably be criticized by the audience and then they would want to re - read it . but because i did not work hard enough on this book to put together an original , my editor insisted i should make a better show out of this . i could only hope that this will be enough . what is the worst that could have happened ?

The first feature-length adventure of Jim Henson's beloved muppet characters is a very competent musical comedy vehicle as Kermit The Frog leaves his carefree, swampy surroundings for the bright lights (egged on by stranded Hollywood agent Dom DeLuise who overheard him singing); on the way, he meets Fozzie Bear (a pitiful stand-up comedian at James Coburn's El Sleazo Café who has Telly Savalas for a bouncer and Madeline Kahn a patron! ), the piano-playing dog Rowlf, bestial drummer Animal and his laid-back, funky band, egomaniacal beauty queen Miss Piggy (in a ceremony presided over by Elliott Gould and Edgar Bergen), etc.

one should have the right to expect from people who make a film about the second coming and the third coming . some people just want to get rid of the bad stuff they 've got on them . that sort of thing is hard to come by in any industry . i can see how you would suggest it . but there are lots of things that really annoy me about it , and no matter how much i tell you not to look for this film , this is just plain stupid . if you want to go to war , do it with your heart .

Brilliant actors and brilliant picture!! I love the chopper scene with the music in the beginning, it is just SO touching and at the same time real but at the same time surrealistic! The Vietnam War was far from human and I believe this movie kind of shows have terrible human beings can act under certain circumstances. Modern war movies are spending so much money on effects. This is just a straight forward smart movie that takes you beyond your imagination. A movie that really pictures evil and hate mixed in fearness and fate.

I thought this movie was cleverly written and very well acted. Its a movie that greatly surpasses other films in terms of originality and enjoyment.Rupert Grint played the part marvelously, and has a general knack for the acting business. The almost obsessive mother added quite a lot to the plot, and was a character one could almost instantly loathe. This reminded me, in a way, of the Divine Secrets of the Ya-Ya Sisterhood. Not by means of actual content of the film, but the premises, and overall tone to the film itself.

I give it 8 out of 10 because it is a cult classic. Also it is directed by legendary sasquatch hunter Robert W Morgan who also plays the part of Jarvis in the film. In listening to recent blogtalkradio show called the AARF show(Robert Morgan is a co-host)he tells that because it has become such a cult classic and does well at movie conventions and such,there are plans to maybe do a sequel to this film. I think he said that two of the original stars have signed on and he hopes to have a few more.

i have just seen today you die . it is bad , almost very bad . 1 ) the direction and editing are great , but 2 ) you will never hear anything more interesting than this movie : the story of a child who takes his parents away to the country for a weekend to live with her father in a foreign country . this is something that i ca n't watch or even see anymore because i was taught to not watch television . so here i am watching an old movie that i do not want to watch at all .

I saw this originally on Channel 4 (UK) and it was a fantastic film that left a great impression on me. However I saw it on Irish TV recently and there was an added narration by Roy Scheider ("we're going to need a bigger boat!"). This ruined the film for me. His droning monologue adds absolutely nothing to the film, and if anything takes from the films brilliance. I wonder at the new DVD version that has no Roy (due to legal reasons?) would stop people from buying it.

now for sure , this is one of the lightest - hearted stories that bruce willis has been in to date and will ever tell about his characters . i have to say i think it 's pretty good . at first , i was a fan of bruce willis , but then i read some of his books and i thought he might be a bit over the top . while i was n't disappointed , i did find the book quite interesting . there were a few moments on the movie screen when bruce willis goes down into hell .

This movie was cheesy and it was more than that. It was about this guy who gets a curse on him and he turns into a gorilla. I had to see how bad it was because of the title. Before this guy turns into a gorilla, he gets married. I was a little upset because she wasn't a bride of a gorilla: she is now the wife of the gorilla. She should have married him when he was a gorilla then the title would have made more sense. There are all these people in the middle of the jungle too and they all want to leave.

Although i don't like cricket at all and i have seen this movie 13 years ago, I still think it is one of the best coming-of-age movies ..i remember the day i returned home from my school and sat down to have my lunch, I saw the opening titles of that movie and then....i was so immersed in it that i felt i was there, it really affected me personally. i still remember how i felt when i first saw it ,i felt that the poor boy was a friend of mine, going through the same adolescent experience we were having in those days.

Having endured this film last night, I turned off the DVD player with a sense of deserving a medal for having the stamina to see it through to the end. Throughout the film I felt that I was watching the storyline fillers that you get in a high budget porn movie. the acting was stiff and taut, camera work appalling, and the locations and sets were so poor it felt like they had borrowed them from the local High School "Amateur Dramatic's Society".The only saving grace for this movie was that it had Amy Adams and Harriet Sansom Harris in its credits, other than that it was pure dribble.

A antique shop-owner in NYC, played by Joanne Whalley(Valerie Alston)gets put on a US District Court jury, on a trial of a known Mafioso Armand Asante(Rusty Pirone), and most of this very slow-paced film revolves around attempts of Pirone attempting to get Whalley to acquit him of murder, by threatening to kill her son, and herself. Much action ensues, involving gruesome mob-rub outs, interspread with Willam Hurt as the go-between. Much of this silly, disjointed mess surrounds Hurt and Asante's obsession with Whalley, courtroom scenes that we've all seen time and again, and an ending that is unbelievable.

I'm not a big musical fan, but this is one of the few I really love. Unlike many other musicals, such as "The Sound of Music," none of the songs are about gratuitous stuff. Each song is social commentary, acumen on war, sexuality, recalcitrance, spirituality, and freedom. Especially amazing songs are "Easy To Be Hard," "Age of Aquarius," "Hair," "Flesh Failures/3-5-0-0," "Walking In Space," and "Hare Krishna." Totally revolutionary and wonderful. I can't wait to someday see it live!

the outsiders is undoubtedly a classic australian tv series . well defined characters , tight scripts , varied and interesting plot - all very hollywood . no wonder they have such an impact on their lives : this has to be one of the worst sitcoms i 've ever watched . in fact , i would not have been surprised if it was written by someone with a better sense of humor . however , i am glad i was spared watching it . i really want to make this movie when it is filmed . it is too bad the acting is not good , because i could have made it a good one .

secret service agent jay killion ( charles bronson ) has been assigned to protect the president - elect ' s wife , the woman who has become such a celebrity that no one can remember her name and probably never will . this is a very sad story and i think we should turn it into a movie . " there were so many things i wanted to say . in the last few days i had seen some of the coolest movies i had ever seen . they were not only amazing , they were absolutely awesome . the characters were fantastic !

Got to confess right up front that I didn't watch this entire movie. I missed the first hour during a Sci Fi Channel broadcast. Or was I spared the first hour? The other reviewers sum this one up nicely. It was badly conceived. Badly scripted. Badly acted.But the worst thing for me was the ADR. The entire film, which appeared to have been dubbed, sounded like it was done in somebody's garage. There was a voluminous echo to the words, which just served to make the bad dialog hang. And hang. And hang.

the final part of kieslowski ' s trilogy based on the colors of the french flag finds the director at peace , as if there was any other . but i must point out that the film is in a constant state of disrepair , and so it is hard to feel happy when you have no time for your own family . however , we are allowed to watch this movie , which is good , because it is entertaining . i am looking forward to seeing these scenes , because they can be very nice and amusing . the book is one of my best and the characters are really interesting .

I am in a movie club at my school and I was forced to sit and watch this utterly dismal film. The film's story is not dismal, but the entire movie itself is exceedingly dismal. The acting was absolutely dreadful. The children were overly whiny. A metal pole could have done a better job. I wanted desperately to fall asleep, but because the television was so loud, I was kept from peace. The monkey's are neither cute, nor are they funny. The drama is laugh-worthy. I cannot remember when I saw a more dreadful film.

mystery science theater 3000 would have not been able to bring any redeeming quality to a showing of this ` ` movie ' at all . it is , however , a masterpiece that makes up for its injustices in the most amazing way possible . and if it was not so bad before , i would like to show you how well the rest of this movie actually compares to the movie . here are the good parts : 
 4 . the only thing that changes the characters is that they are no longer made out of ordinary human beings . this film will be different .

I can't explain it, but I find this movie not only funny, but so enjoyable I feel compelled to watch it over and over, or at least I did when I had cable TV. I always felt it was a really poorly made movie, but perhaps that is because I watched it on cable. I plan to get a DVD of this movie to really take an honest look at at, but more importantly to just have a good time watching it. I liked the plot and the idea of the movie and I especially liked the cast.

this film is one of my fondest childhood memories . seeing the muppets ( at the height of their popularity , i loved to watch them as a boy ) on television made it so much better . and that ' s the way i like it for movies . they are always full of characters and funny dialogue . but this is a very sad time in a movie . there are lots of dead people scattered across the theater . the actors were all murdered by animals . we have also seen more gruesome horror films in the past few hours than we have had since world war ii .

Like the previous two 'Mad Max' films, 'Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome' is not exception to the violence and strange plot. Mad Max is in a post-war society where he must destroy master blaster and get the children to 'tomorrow morrow land'. This is generally a warped film with Peter Pan references and Tina Turner, methane-pigs, and odd characters. I got very bored by watching it all, and it offered nothing to me. I did not feel inspired after watching this film; the only decent thing about this film were the extremely-odd characters that got picked off in various ways throughout the film.

It's 1913. A studio prop boy spies the actress who is going to become Hollywood's next great movie star and he's the director that's going to make it happen. After inventing pie throwing and the keystone cops, his dream comes true. Being completely absorbed in his film-making, however, he fails to notice that he is losing his leading lady to another man. Several over-budget flops later, he is known as nothing more than the director who turned down Rin-tin-tin. Fortunately for him, the loyal and compassionate residents of Hollywood are untainted by ambition and ego.

i was 19 years old when i saw first saw this film , in the theater . i have a feeling that i can learn to enjoy films as long as i choose to . i know this because of how much time i spent with my parents , and about the way they talked to me throughout the movie . so , if you ever feel like it is an excuse to see one of your friends , do not hesitate to find me . i still miss them . i wish i could say that we are all great friends who really care about you , but we are completely opposite personalities .

The film is a pathetic attempt to remake Ingmar Bergman's "Autumn Sonata"(1978) starring Ingrid Bergman,Liv Ullman and Erland Josephson.It did not take me more than 5 minutes to figure that out.It is time Film journalists like Khalid Mohammad took out time to do some creative thinking. It makes me sad when potentially good film-makers waste their talents by making substandard remakes of Hollywood and European films.You've got to give the film-maker something though. The film he picked for copying is one of Bergman's classics, and easily one of the finest instances of the portrayal of a strained human relationship in European cinema.

i was totally surprised just how good this movie actually is because when i first saw it i was only mildly disappointed . now i get to read about it through a cheap tv and not have to watch any more movies that would make you feel guilty about reading about it , although there is really no reason for anyone to be ashamed of what they are doing ! this is a horrible movie . i do n't know whether to be horrified or angry . the fact that it has a title makes me like this movie even more . i ca n't imagine how awful it looks to be in its former glory .

everything that made the original so much fun seems to absent here . this is simply a ` ` run of the mill ' movie with a few bad twists , some good scenes . i like the premise well , but the plot was so predictable . i think we should leave it up to the director to come up with something new . and if anyone wants to start acting they 'll get the job done ! i have a feeling that it will not be any kind of work for anyone who has never had a shot at a film .

this is a film by oshima , the director of the notorious ` ` in the realm of the senses ' ' . it is not really any good , because it lacks anything resembling reality . 
 " i saw it once during my life ; i was a little young when it had it . on the back was a picture of an old man , dressed in a shabby dress , who was trying to convince his wife that he was one of the original people who took the movie out of the storage tank . he was so convincing that she actually said no .

first of all , the nature in the movie is beautiful , and there is a bit of mongolian music . i would n't want to come with this guy , but it was pretty good . i could n't say i felt any disgust when the dialogue was bad . at least not for me anyway . the movie started off by playing a movie about a japanese girl who gets killed by her father . the narrator said that she ' d seen this movie before and had no interest in watching the movie , so she went home instead . the japanese girl has lots of potential and will get a nice job .

Director and playwright Richard Day adapted his own stage material for the screen, clearly inspired by Rock Hudson's real-life dilemma from the 1950s: what to do with a screen idol who is secretly homosexual? Marry him off to an unsuspecting woman in order to quell the gossips (and keep him working). Wispy-thin idea given some energy by the good cast and retro production design which amusingly resembles a greeting card by Shag. The dialogue isn't very clever, and there's some slapstick goofing around near the beginning which fails to work (spitting out food, etc.).

the movie with its single set , minimal cast , and straightforward photography ( except for a couple of brief comedies ) . i did n't think that any character would survive a long film , let alone live it to its full potential , but that is precisely why i chose this one . you could say that my work was nothing short of spectacular . the first two episodes are simply boring . well , if you enjoyed them , do n't worry because they are no better than those in the first episode . what i really meant to tell you is that they were not good .

Assy McGee is an out-of-control, hard-nosed detective based on the countless examples from late 20th century police dramas. The twist here is that Assy is literally a walking buttocks.The cheap, low-brow facade of the show belies its cleverness and hidden satire. That is not to say that Assy is devoid of fart jokes, just that the toilet humor is used sparingly enough to elicit consistent laughs, not groans and eye-rolls. The title sequence of the program demonstrates the clever, subtle humor used throughout. The sequence consists of panning photos of the city set to a jazzy 70s cop theme.

after just viewing the movie , i must say this is one of the worst films i have ever seen . the characters are so lame it 's funny to see . and the plot is completely lacking in reality ! i 've never seen anything like this show before and i thought it would be a good way to pass my finals . the problem was that the cast only had about 2 hours to perform . they were so stupid ! what kind of character takes such an awful class ? there is n't any acting in this film .

finally ! other people who have actually seen this show ! it is the funniest anime i have ever seen , and i am not a fan . as a matter of fact i just watched it on a big television channel . well , i really do n't remember watching it before but i saw some pretty funny scenes in the late ' 90s . one day , this guy was on a date with this chick , he had a lot of good looks and she got into his car and went home alone . when the movie played over , she told him how she wanted to get back to her friends .

this is a bad film , as its central message is very muddled and the plot seems like it was written from the bowels of some medieval castle . the main character ( who appears to be about five - three or so ) is in danger and can not see the danger and does not understand what is going on ; the ending looks awful . the acting is bad enough . why i wanted to watch this movie i am not clear . first of all , i do n't want to watch it with my brother .

I watched this movie tonight and I do need to say that it is horrible! I expected it to be great, because you know, usually we don't have many movies about Asian vampires mixed with Asian culture; but already in the beginning it started in a bad way: the introduction of the movie seemed not to have an end! The plot is so weak and if you take the fights and the soundtrack off, you really don't have anything useful at all! The director of this film doesn't look to have some important notions about how much time to spend in introduction and flashbacks for example.

A film, first and foremost, should be good storytelling. It should be entertaining - and entertaining doesn't necessarily mean "laughs", and it doesn't necessarily mean "light". It basically means you're not bored while watching it. As brilliant as 2001 may be, it is a difficult film to watch, especially for the current (video-game-playing/iPod fumbling) generation. Its slow pace and the sometimes intolerable amount of time it takes for an actor to perform a single action (e.g. the attempt to rescue the crew member floating in space) will stretch your patience.

grand champion is a bit old fashion at first glance . andrew morton at the fort worth star telegram said , ' that 's one of the worst performances i 've ever seen in my whole life . ' he actually made it sound bad . this was only the third time and it seems that all of the others did too . i still do n't know where to begin . when you come across these things , you can not imagine what their content would be . if you look at the tv shows that they have been airing since the beginning of the era , then you are pretty well accustomed to them .

Now out of all the shark movies I've seen, this one takes the cake! The plot of the movie was good, but the excitement factor sort of took a nosedive afterwards. Antonio Sobato, Jr. does an excellent role as a son who seeks the shark who killed his father. A megaldon is one of the biggest sharks of all and the most dangerous one as well. The view of the shark was indeed scary in some angles, but the effects were a blur, and the scenes were a little weak in some places.

"Tart" is a good illustration of old the Yogi Berra saying: "If you don't know where you are going, you will probably end up someplace else". Writer/Director Christina Waye (in her first feature) has managed to make a $3 Million movie that ends up someplace else. "Tart" is either a coming of age story devoid of characters that a rational person can connect with, a black comedy without any humor, or a sexploitation movie without anything that is particularly sexy.Unlike the standard Swain film, "Tart" actually employed a competent and experienced production designer.

i am an avid julie andrews fan and i just watched this for the first time on dvd - - the movie you can not have . it was a great film , but i was n't sure if i would like it or not . i do n't think there was even any real emotion behind it . i did n't see many people who actually liked it , so i gave it up . it was a crappy movie , but i loved the way the characters had acting in their actions to make them feel like something more .

It is not only difficult to comment separately on the three parts of Kieslowski's trilogy, it seems obvious that the filmmaker wants us to do just the opposite: view them in order, Blue, White, and Red, and consider them together as one complete work. It is true they are distinct stories with distinct themes: liberty, equality, fraternity, and each them is developed with unique applications of intrigue and artistry. They are each well worth seeing independently, but I believe they are best seen as one work.

sheltered young woman , home - schooled and possibly quite gifted , harbors a disturbed , overly - emotional side which comes to the surface of everything that 's happened in this story . i ca n't imagine her as a complete failure ; she was very bright , intelligent , self - competent and had the smarts to do great things in her career . i think it was probably the only time she even attempted to write something . i do not have an idea where she learned how to write anything , or why she made it all the way up to the top .

this picture hit the movie screens on june 6th 1980 , starring stephen macht as sergeant thor , avery schreiber , richard smith , and harry potter . when i wrote this first draft of the original version i thought it would be more like a thriller , or a comedy . what i found that was even worse than the original was the idea of the actors . i wanted to film an action movie which would be entertaining but not very exciting . well , except for at least three comedic dramas in the 1970s and ' 78 . since then i just have been trying to kill time by watching the news .

I really couldn't get into this movie. The plot is some old woman has been torturing someone so long that he is deformed. She dies and he is left in the basement to starve. Months must pass and a family moves in. The daughter is blind because of an accident caused by the father. Well anyway this guy in the basement, who for all rights should be long dead is still around. He eats a cat and now is superhuman. He now wants to eat people and have sex. And when a hooker dies father gets the blame.

the director is sweet , as is his co - directing wife shira geffen , but their movie sucks . it has a huge plot line and there is no action ( i have never heard of this show ) . i think they need a lot of good acting to make the film come out , but they ca n't seem to find the energy to get it off the ground . they are so lame and pathetic . it 's almost like they have no spirit . at least i hope they have enough energy to go out onto the stage and perform .

i caught this during a brief run in a philadelphia theater . despite its local provenance ( and its relation to the film ) , you might find the quality of films more than what they actually show . the main problem with this film was that it is so bad that i could not even see a single word on it . when i looked down at it in the late afternoon sun i could see that the words were written in a very short way , as if the whole film was designed to be read in any given sentence . this was really just the most boring movie i have ever seen .

i ca n ' t get over the quality of the score , the book , and the performances . this is a great cover shot , and i like it much more than the rest of the work . there were some interesting parts that are funny at times , but for the most part these things just look dumb . they do n't make a thing of how we act in this film , and i want to stay out of it . the whole experience is not so bad , but there is one little flaw with the movie . the plot is totally wrong .

Filmmakers made a rather boring everyman's story look interesting and complex by focusing on his wife back at home. At the same time, we're exposed to a truly original, existential French loner. The film is more than a documentary. Hardly ever do I feel that I've experienced something that's accidentally profound, which makes it all the more profound.Film has visually interesting interior moments. Absolutely loved the journey the filmmakers took me on. (Quite a lot of Europeans in the credits). Hopefully, PBS will screen this so that it reaches a wider audience in the USA.

With great expectations I went to see this film, Spain's contribution to the Oscar-race this year. Part from being completely pointless, banal, pathetic, badly written, edited, acted and directed, the movie is too long. It fails in delivering the "message" it tries to give, fails in its storytelling, clumsy historical settings and above all in its rhythm. There are some so extreme misfires I haven't seen in a movie in a long time (the story of Lucas whose dead sister lives in his head, the divine revelations, all that lizard nonsense).

I really like the show!! As a part of Greek Life, I can say that some things are over-exaggerated, but overall it's still pretty damn funny.Rusty is a likable lead character, his roommate is HILARIOUS and the entire cast is entertaining in their own rights. I like that it focuses on individual situations as well as interpersonal relations with the organizations.This show covers it all, and they do it without cursing or anything else that bad (how else could it be on ABC Family? ).My favorites are Cappie (of course), Rusty's roommate and pretty much all of Kappa Tau.

This is a very enjoyable, fluffy, glamorous musical from the 40's. 'Cover Girl' made Rita Hayworth (formerly the dark-haired Latin senorita Margarita Cansino) into a bona-fide, all-American star. It confirmed Gene Kelly's amazing talent as a dancer, singer, actor and choreographer. It epitomises the exuberance and colour of the musical genre.Rita Hayworth is great as Rusty Parker- it is her picture, and her presence is always at the forefront. Her singing is dubbed, but her dancing is absolutely brilliant and she combines very well with Kelly.

I hope this isn't a portent of things to come. High-definition camcorders are getting cheaper all the time (although I wouldn't swear that's what was used here), so it's open season for all the wannabe Scorseses and Tarantinos.There is no hiding the cheapness of this stinker, and calling it a 'film' would be doing the industry a big disservice. The photography is of a standard you would expect on a family outing to the zoo. I could build me a new house with all the wooden acting. What's remarkable about that is that nobody stands out as the worst.

without a shadow of a doubt this is and probably will always be the worst film i have ever had the displeasure of viewing . i am not even sure what i was looking at . it does seem to me that this movie would be more interesting if it were a real horror movie , but since it really is one of the worst films i have seen , i think it could just be an improvement on those horrible ones in the books . unfortunately , as soon as i saw this , i felt sorry for you .

this is one of those classic american made for tv movies that are just made for watching on a rainy friday afternoon . as the movie begins , i start to laugh . this movie is really depressing because it reminds me too much of my mother when she was a teenager . all the other films were so good , and they were boring , so i just decided to get into an old fashioned movie in search of something interesting . there was this little girl living with her mother who lived alone at the bottom of a well .

first , let me state that i have no idea who nora roberts is . so the book may have been written by someone who does not even know my name . yes , this is a movie . but if you read the film , it is just as bad because the character is one of the characters who is really good at acting . if you go down to the theatre and check with the director for any type of feedback , you will be surprised at the amount of commentary that the script makes . i only know what i heard about her on the tape , and i can not remember much else .

i enjoyed the prequels , and found the relationship between tucker and chan previously hilarious . rh3 , however , seemed like it was doomed from the moment i set foot there . i mean , why would an old movie have that much to say about the people in the movie ? well , you will never be able to make out their faces , but it sure looks as though these two characters were extremely close . they both have this funny way of sticking together and having fun . i could only hope that this film was not going to do anything to me that made me want to take my clothes off so badly .

Who really wants to see that? Disgusting violence, disgusting sex, for such a long time. I do not want to, but I always stayed true to my philosophy to watch any movie as bad as it may be. This was the hardest (right after "Next Friday").It's basically just crap. How can you possibly call it anything else? The story of a Roman emperor as an excuse for gore and T&A. Yeah, yeah, "Hey, it's realistic, they have been like this." Fine, but why bother us with it?

I went into this movie with semi-high expectations after loving the cartoon series in my childhood, and this nearly wrecked that love for me. Jason Lee, David Seville in the film, is horrifying. I understand it can't be easy to act with CGI characters who aren't actually there, but I really found his performance atrocious, along with all the other non-animated characters. The chipmunks were adorable, yet sometimes blatantly obvious at moving the plot of the story along, and therefore did not tempt me to stay in the theater for longer than half an hour into the film.

I can't quite explain why I find this so alluring and "The Leopard" not; it may be because the focus here is on all that was great with that film, those intimate moments that Visconti can render so magnificently. Like that film, it has a majestically slow pace, but this time it isn't overlong. It's the kind of film where nothing happens but twenty minutes passes like that. I think that must be due in part to the way the film deals with flashbacks that act as their own mini-story.

This picture hit the movie screens on June 6th 1980, starring Stephen Macht as Sergeant Thor, Avery Schreiber as Captain Comelius Butt, J.D.
