To my eternal shame, I've never seen a silent movie - not even the mother of all vampire movies, "Nosferatu". However, if they display half the creativity and sheer joy of this effort from Buster Keaton then I'll probably try to watch a few more. This is genuinely funny as well as being a stunning introduction to the world of the silent comedies. The premise, such as it is, focuses around an unfortunate case of mistaken identity as Keaton is mistaken for renowned bad-guy Dead Shot Dan (co-director Malcolm St Clair).

` ` the planet ' ' is an astounding piece of film making . for a mere £8000 stirton production have turned in one of the worst productions since the early 1980s , as well as many of the greatest movies i have ever heard of . all of the actors are acting very similar and there is no reason to believe that the film was made on the same day as the 1910 ' s " war . " the most important thing about this film is the plot and character . if this movie has been recorded , it might have been written by some people who know what it 's like to be at war .

I remember the events of this movie, the ill fated cruise of Donald Crowhurst in 1968, in the Golden Globe single handed around the world yacht race. I was a 13 year old, living in England. The previous year Francis Chichester (later Sir Francis; he was knighted for his exploits) had completed the first solo circumnavigation of the globe. I remember it mostly because we were given time off school to watch his return (on a grainy black and white TV!) and then his knighting by the Queen. It provoked a huge outpouring of patriotic fervor in the UK.

i saw this last week during bruce campbell ' s book tour . i thought it was amazing . almost everything that happened in this movie is true - all of the characters are real , and although some of them are as fake as they can be , there is something very familiar about those faces . at least i believe that i have seen people like these before . even if i had to go through the same process again and again to find the exact same actors , i would still love to have met a few of them . i feel like i am looking at this movie for the first time .

I've waited 9 years to watch this film, simply because i never saw it advertised on TV. Eventually i caught it and it was well worth the wait. It's much better than your over-hyped scream or last summer garbage because it's all at a fairly quick pace, with no drawn out, creeping through the house to cheesy music scenes. Only the bad dubbing lets it down a little but don't let that put you off in any way. What lies beneath - over hyped and crap. Mute witness - low budget, not hyped at all and very good.

This movie is very modern and forward. It is about 75% in English. It is aimed at English-speaking multiplex-going young audience. Basic plot is similar to DDLJ. this movie clearly has an agenda , which could be summed up like this : never , never cross the line with any of your fans ! and that 's just plain mean ! i know some people think this movie is hilarious . but seriously , what does it even matter in the end ? if you hate the movie so much , you should have gone to one of the worst movies ever made , or at least spent a lot of money on it . this film ( and all the other movies ) was made by a very bad person .

writer - director patrice leconte takes a universal and potentially bottomless subject - friendship - and turns it into a flat and dull story . the characters are just so boring , i have seen many of them ' t be able to carry on with their stories . but when i am out here looking for someone in this group , i find myself asking who is " they " and wondering why i feel like i have to know about them . i look at each of them from a different perspective than the last five times . one of the few things that i enjoy most about this place is its lack of creativity .

First, let me state that I have no idea who Nora Roberts is. So the book may have been great, but the movie isn't.I have spent my entire life living in the Peidmont region of NC. the film soultaker is essentially an older form final destination in which several car wrecked teens have their souls separated from their bodies and sent to a special prison , which they were not supposed to be released from . the cast of this movie ( as i have been told by two or three of my friends ) is extremely bizarre . although the plot is horrible , the actors are so clever that it is hard for anyone else to find what they are doing wrong ; and even if they did , no one would dare to watch it . the plot just gets worse and worse at every minute .

This is easily one of the best movies of the 1950s. Otto Preminger directed only four or five really good movies and this is one of them. Frank Sinatra gives his best performance and the music score by Elmer Bernstein is dynamite. From the opening titles (by Saul Bass) to the hysteria of drug addict Frank going cold turkey, this is a riveting movie! With Kim Novak (giving a very good performance), Eleanor Parker (giving a very bad performance) as well as Darren McGavin as the reptilian pusher and Arnold Stang as Frank's grifter pal.

I was expecting a lot from this movie, and I can say I haven't been disappointed. First of all, this movie, as a world tour of wine making, let the spectator enjoy beautiful places. The people interviewed are really interesting and funny too, in particular Hubert de Montille. The shooting may be confusing, the camera always being unsteady and often focusing on secondary elements in the backgrounds. You may not like it, but I don't consider it as a defect.The themes raised in the movie may be kind of confusing as well, since globalization isn't the only issue discussed.

my one - line summary hints that this is not a good film , but this is not true . i did some research and it looks like this movie is just going to keep on playing . there is definitely a little bit more drama in the movies than these people could have dreamed up . they are too dumb to know what the joke is . the whole thing takes about twenty minutes and does not even make a big impression . well , at least i can watch this film without losing my heart to it . i am actually enjoying the show .

i unwittingly walked into this ` ` trap ' ' of a movie . if i could turn back time or simply get a job and spend the night watching a horror movie , you can imagine my surprise when i found out that it is not an original film , but a very original set up . i was completely dumbfounded when i first saw the movie . i was stunned when i finally realized what it looked like . i just watched this for about an hour in hopes of becoming a new yorker and making a good impression on someone .

the only thing it has to offer is the interesting opposites of tru and jack , their choices and viewpoints in the film were made based solely on how they are acting . but then again , not everyone has an opinion like the two of them . jake and paul seem to have developed a great deal of love between them and it was both entertaining and heartbreaking for me . also , i did n't understand why someone would choose that movie over what they really wanted to achieve . i have always been curious about everything in this film , whether people will be able to do anything in it .

The film opens with the director talking to the camera and saying he is going to show a story about Brazilain street kids whose families live in poverty and must steal and kill to survive. In fact the main character (Pixote) was played by an actual street kid only 11 years old. What follows was one of the most brutal, depressing and horrifying film I've even seen. got this the other day from the creators on dvd . i saw this advertised in a free magazine whilst researching it . the title is like a book but the content was pretty basic and lacking in humor , so i thought that it might be useful . i started thinking of this as a film and asked one of the editors , " why not make something new for the movie ? " - he was a nice guy and i liked what he wrote . the next day i told him about the movies i saw and how good they were and we agreed to make something similar with the same premise .

chop shop , the second feature from ramin bahrani , is a rare breed . it is an american film made with a very high production capacity of about $ 20 , 000 . the movie was originally filmed in france in the 1920s but was released in 1885 . this movie was adapted as part of a new film on tv and has been produced for more than twenty years now . however , while the title of the film was similar to the one you see on the television screen , there were no similarities between the two scenes .

"Mr. Bug Goes To Town" was the last major achievement the Fleischer studios produced. The quality of the Superman series produced at the same time is evident in this extraordinary film.The music and lyrics by Frank Loesser and Hoagy Carmichael (with assistance by Flieshcer veteran Sammy Timberg are quite good, but not as much as the scoring of the picture by Leigh Harline who also scored Snow White for Disney. Harline's "atmospheric music" is superb, and a treat for the ears.The layout and staging of the picture was years ahead of it's time, and once again the Fleischer's background artists outdid themselves.

do n ' t be fooled by the plot out - line as it is described on the cover ( at least the swedish ) . if you think about it , it 's a really good idea for an american tv show to make a movie which makes it look like they actually are actors in one of the original cast . when i saw this , i thought there might be some kind of irony in this movie . it was just too awful to watch , and it was too bad not to watch it because it would have given me the opportunity to get away from this shit .

ok , most of us agree that this is a weak attempt at a remake , but at the same time it seems to do the trick . i think that you will have to wait until you have had an interview with the author of the short story and know that it was based on the novel in the first place ; then you will have to see for yourself . i believe you will get the chance to try it out . there were only a few moments during this movie where all the characters seem completely normal , so we have a nice feeling that this is not just a joke .

i feel that this movie is different from so many others in that it shows a family of girls who have all their memories back . i know the film does n't last very long , and although i was hoping it would take a while to make up its mind about them , it feels like it has . i ca n't wait for the next one . it 's so good to see what they have going on . you can tell that when i watched this movie , no matter what else was going on , i had every intention of getting back home .

There are so many things wrong with this movie that it is hard to pick just a few. Let's start with the silly and annoying songs. i went to see this movie at the theater and paid money thinking it would be at least mildly entertaining . instead , i saw an old film about a girl being dumped by her brother . i really did not want to watch it . all of a sudden , there was this horrible feeling when i got home from work that made me turn my car on and walk into the house to look at the episode . i sat there in silence for a long time . when i finally felt myself getting angry , i turned off the car . then i thought , ' what the hell could i do ?

I would give this a zero if they had that rating. Fun was no fun at all. I grew tired of the movie about ten minutes into but endured to the end thinking it had to get better - it did not. While this movie was a statement of corporate greed and the plight of the worker who gets stepped on when a large company goes under, the vehicle for this would have been better served another way.

With David Arquette starring you would immediately think this to be a stupid movie. Well, it is a stupid movie with a horrid script. i really do n ' t think producer george lucas did n ' t really set out to make such a horrible sequel as this one . in his spare time , he has made a few movies that were just bad . and even then there is nothing to show what he was like before . we are not talking about the most disgusting of films . we are talking about the most revolting . the worst movie i have ever watched is the worst movie anyone can remember . i only hope that no one is paying me enough to take this one for granted .

This is a romantic, albeit cheesy movie that is one of my all time favorites. It is one of the many CLASSICS of the 80's genre like "Pretty in Pink" or "Some kind of Wonderful".Nic plays the traditional punk guy in love with the traditional valley, preppy girl Julie. It is a heartwarming love story that makes you root for him to win the girl in the end.True, most of the acting sucks but ...I have been in love with Nic since seeing this in the theaters and have seen nearly every movie he's been in since.

I thought that this movie might be a good spoof, or at least a good independent comedy like Friday. Instead it was more like something someone in high school would make with their parents' camcorder. I am sitting here writing this review and the movie's not even over yet. In fact, I just checked, and there are 45 more minutes to go. But no matter, there's no need to see it through to the end. I'll just write this review and laugh as the film plays in the background and stumbles onward to some kind of presumably horrible conclusion which I don't care to ever see or know.What accounts for my hostility to this movie? The characters are not believable. The plot is not believable. The pretentiousness of the movie is sickening.

This film, also known as "don't look in the basement" is actually not bad. It is a little known film even to die hard horror fans but I found this movie pretty entertaining. Don't get me wrong, it's certainly not without its problems but do think more people should give it a look. The story of a hot nurse going to work in a sanitarium is certainly an appealing one to me. I thought the acting , which seemed forced at first, somehow got better as the film went along. It seems like the actors really got into their roles.

This film actually starts out pretty interesting but for my taste it degenerated far too quickly into a dull and predictable melodrama. None of the performances are particularly interesting and the camera work is just standard TV movie stuff, so there's really no reason for anyone to see this movie unless they are as big of a Jeff Bridges fan as I am I guess.Bridges plays Mike Olson, a young man who announces at a family picnic that he is quitting college to go on the road. His parents believe he is "just acting out" and talk about how "he has no plan".

i agree with the guy above , it is so funny i understand it all , but my friends just do n't understand . why do people like this show ? i think i was a little in love with the show , and i loved that it was so good . there were lots of interesting characters , and they made me want to get back to the main characters . i thought i wanted to be able to watch it with someone else , or have something else to look at . but i had nothing better to do besides watch this for hours .

i saw this movie on the shelf at blockbuster and thought it looked cool . the dvd case touted so many movies , my heart started beating faster in response . there was one story about a couple being married to each other . they did have a small plot which was very romantic . as a matter of fact , the movie had an ending with two people who would spend the night together . however , while the relationship lasted , both of them lost their love and could not find a way to fix the problem . finally , the couples got married , but the divorce took several months to work up .

It's hard to work up any enthusiasm for this awful cartoon-like epic that for some reason has become a cult classic. It certainly can't be because of the totally artificial look of the set designs or the limpid acting of an all-star cast. These days it's shown much too frequently on Fox Movie Channel or AMC.It pains me to report that veteran actors like Walter Pigeon and Joan Fontaine are even cast in this muddled science fiction travesty, none of which rings true. It's like watching an expensive budget being spent on a Saturday afternoon kiddie show full of cardboard characters and unconvincing dialog.

You may be interested to know that BARRICADE was viewed as a failure by the studio and shelved for a year before ALICE FAYE's popularity reached such a high that the studio decided to release the film despite the fact that it was never fully completed. It fared modestly OK at the box-office.Faye refers to a murder during her nightclub stint in New York City--and this scene was actually in the script and was the way the film was to start. Instead, it is entirely missing and what could have been an exciting sequence (including a complete song number by Faye) was never filmed.

It's a puzzle to me how this turd of a film ever got distribution.Sure, it's horror and there's a fair share of nudity, but by god, the production value is the lowest I've ever seen, the equipment used is worse than standard home equipment, everything is overlit, giving everything an amateurish look, bringing your thought to America's worst home video's or whatever that show was called..Please people, is it too much to ask that you actually do an effort when you expect to waste 90 minutes of peoples lives watching this?

Probably the biggest thing about Wild Rebels that hurts it the most is the hero. He's got LOSER written all over him, but that doesn't stop him from "getting the girl." Probably one of the world's worst race drivers imaginable, he decides to stop racing after he crashes his car. Well, his new job is racing still, as a bunch of biker types pick him to drive their getaway car as they commit crimes. The only reason there is a question mark in parenthesis is NOT because I haven't seen every film released in 2001 thus far. It's because this film was only made PARTLY in 2001. The rest of it was stolen from Roger Corman's OTHER dinosaur films, Carnosaur 1-3.I have a confession to make. "Carnosaur 2" is perhaps one of my favorite B-movies. It borrows so much from James Cameron's "Aliens" it's not even funny. But I love it. I can't explain exactly why. It just WORKS for me.

I can't believe the amount of reviewers who praise this as realistic. Barbara Stanwyck is a sheer delight in this wartime comedy, about a sailor invited to spend Christmas with a popular magazine writer's family, at her farm in Connecticut. The problem is she has no husband, baby, or farm, as she writes about in her column, and she can't even cook; her wonderful recipes being provided for her by her good friend " Uncle" Felix, owner of a Hungarian restaurant in New York City.Things get even more complicated when her strict publisher boss invites himself along for Christmas.

the worst movie i have ever seen . the sound quality was bad , the cutting of the scenes was awful , and it was n't even that good . i felt a bit sick just watching the scene . in fact , i feel ill after watching it , and as i sit here alone thinking about it i find myself wishing i had not . i know that if there were two people who could watch this on tv i would probably hate them to do it . but you will never really understand what they are going through when they look at it .

if ( as i just pointed out in the goat ) keaton is following the tradition of the comics finding their way on the shelf at the end of a trilogy , it seems like he can see where the storyline might have been . the movie has already made it known to me that this is one of the most famous movies of all time . there are only three episodes that we 've actually seen so far and they are not very popular . you should check the other books of the series for those titles . none of them do any good .

the movie is complete disaster . i do n ' t know who write scripts for movies like this one , but they sure make me a little more anxious than i normally am . i just hope they can find some other way to make this film work . the last thing i need is to get caught doing it and then have to pay another bill . that 's not really a bad idea , actually . i did n't think much about it at the time , so i just put it out of my mind .

this movie must be exported to the rest of the world ! an absolute masterpiece , with a both bizarre and intriguing ending . i think the title will be more difficult to believe than it is for most readers ( especially those like me , who do n't know much about sci - fi or tv ) . i 'm going to go over my script one last time , just so i can say i enjoyed watching the film . in the beginning i did n't have any choice but to watch it . i really liked seeing the plot , which is pretty lame , although not as dumb as this movie .

After having problems in Chicago, the Solomon family moves to a remote North Dakota farmhouse to start anew, but their attempts at an idyllic farming life is disrupted when their teen daughter Jess (Kristen Stewart) and her 3-year-old brother Ben start seeing and being attacked by supernatural beings who won't allow them to live in peace.The Messengers starts off decently although it eventually becomes a generic horror film that's a lot more humorous than frightening. After reading the premise, I thought this could have been a decent movie since it sounded creepy and it held potential.

I am so excited that Greek is back! This season looks really eventful. Im glad that Casey is trying to get serious about school but is still involved in the sorority. Its really funny that she wants to go into politics & that they're highlighting her 'scheming talent.' I loved Calvin's new haircut! It makes him look more mature. I rented this movie because it supposedly takes place in a jazz club -- you know, those hip, cool places you might stumble upon late on a Saturday night. I watched this movie on TCM last night, all excited expectation, having last seen it (twice) in its memorable 1957 release in Toronto. I told my wife, who hadn't seen it before, to watch for the thrilling long tracking shot, no cuts, where Veronika is seen on a bus on her way to find her Boris. In a hand-held frame that certainly predates the modern Steadicam, the shot then pulls back up and cranes (pun unintended) over the street as she exits the bus, and darts among the tanks to cross the road.

This is one of the dumbest ideas for a movie. Remake a classic film shot-by-shot. I hope nobody tries this technique again. In 1998, "Good Will Hunting" director Gus Van Sant tried it by remaking Hitchcock's 1960 classic "Psycho" and failed miserably. What on earth was Van Sant thinking of? This remake doesn't even come close to topping the original. The few changes that were made here were no help. If you want to see "Psycho", the choice is obvious. See the original.

The cannibalism scenes are quite horrific but are so badly staged and acted that they prove quite amusing. The cast are awful except for Janet Agren as the female lead who is excellent.

Everything Is Illuminated A young Jewish American searches for the woman that helped his grandfather escape Nazi persecution while embarking on a cross-European tour with some unlikely associates.Liev Schreiber makes his directorial debut with a playful angst usually associated with his acting ethos. When successful actors decide to sit in the director's chair, we usually get a biographical glimpse at the souls beneath the acting mask- Check. We usually get a mishmash of genres- Check. But what we normally do not get is an insightful original film which is credible, intelligent and moving.Elijah Wood plays Jonathan, an inquisitive young boy who collects pieces of life as he goes.

Warner Brothers produced this 3D extravaganza that was the biggest commercial success for westerns in 1953. Guy Madison leads a band of guardhouse soldiers and misfits to rescue two white women being held by Indians, which essentially all there is to this film. The 3D format was in its early stages as a Hollywood gimmick to compete with the growing popularity of home television, and the effects work very well here. The rescuers make off with the ladies and are pursued by the Indians until the white men make their stand at an island in a creek bed.

Well, this latest version of Mansfield Park seemed to try and take the edginess of the 1999 theatrical version (outright copied some of the ideas from it in fact), but tone things down a bit to bring it more in line with the original story. Unfortunately, the result is a rather lackluster, and schizophrenic, production. And, as with all the other versions of Mansfield Park out there, the character of Fanny Price is no where to be found. Instead there is a strangely child-like, bleached-blond woman running around who never really fully develops as a character.

There may have been a deep meaning behind it, but it seems to me to be nothing but a director who has access to some toys.I would highly recommend his other works to people, but certainly not this one. there are so many things wrong with this movie i do n ' t even know where to begin . the story is awful . i feel bad about it and try not to laugh , but some of the scenes are so bad i just had to stop watching . no matter how fast i watch or listen i ca n't get enough of this movie . i guess i just want to see a movie . if you were a real reader you might love this movie , but most importantly you would love the characters and dialogue . i am surprised when i saw the title of the book in the late seventies .

despite a small handful of nicely executed scenes , this entry ( the fourth ) feels tired . toshiharu ikeda plays a man with an air about him that seems to give off some type of energy i have never heard of before . it is very disappointing to see how these two can seem to enjoy themselves with no more than a simple smile and " good morning " comments . when toshiharu ikeda shows up at his house on friday night , it appears that all he wanted was to be invited to his apartment for dinner .

the camals are coming is a rather disappointing british comedy from 1934 . i purchased this because i like desert film and liked to watch films in my free time . however , when they came into my personal viewing room , i felt like i could hardly contain myself . after listening to the first two or three movies , i was shocked . you have to understand that the movie was actually quite boring , so i had to get some reading out of it . but it did n't last long . there was a great scene with a beautiful young girl and her horse - drawn carriage which took her home .

as kids movie it is great . for the family it just sucks . i was truly hoping for something a little less dramatic , but i am surprised at the amount of noise . when you are a kid playing with your friend and having dinner with them , you find some problems in this life and then you find a few missing pieces of a puzzle . that happens to be about as exciting as a television series where they show you the whole world and tell you that you can have fun without any distractions . it is actually pretty good , until you come into the picture .

incident on and off a mountain road is don coscarelli ' s entry in mick garris ' masters of horror series . 
 " let me start from the beginning again , to the day when i ' ll never see this movie again . i watched the first half of it while i was getting ready for my trip to hawaii . well , the part that i liked most was the story where michael jackson was captured by pirates on a deserted island . there were no signs of piracy , so they had no way of knowing he was there .

i was all ready to hate this but it turned out to be surprisingly tolerable - though the mtv - style of the movie was an absolute pain in my ass . when we got to the premiere , i was a little disappointed because there were no stars and none of them looked as good or as great as the ones that came up . i guess i had been expecting something a little better but not like what i received . it looks like you are about to get your face blown off by a star ! oh well . i mean , do n't get me wrong .

beware , my lovely came on tv on bbc2 recently during the early hours so i set the video to watch for just such an opportunity . i knew it was only a matter of time until somebody would be in the movie . after all , what else was there to do but watch it ? how many times have i asked myself this question over the past ten years ? well , first of all let me admit that i did enjoy seeing the same movie more than i liked watching it . if anyone can figure out how to get back into the film industry , it 's me .

Movies seem to fall into two categories: films that reinforce existing societal values and beliefs, and those that challenge them. This film is a 180-degree shift from the idealistic rhetoric portrayed in offerings like "The Longest Day" and "The Green Berets" which seem more like Disney fantasies by comparison. The "Apocalypse Now!" project, the production and resulting film, is "Heart of Darkness" updated into a psychological horror story of the late 20th century post-modernist variety. The cast and crew who worked on it probably could relate to the terrifying places the human mind can achieve.

no doubt that the indie flick eddie monroe is one of the better independent films i ' ve seen in a long time . if you liked it so much , you would never miss it . for a young girl with a heart of gold ( but not quite as bright ) , it ' s hard to imagine what else could have inspired her to read this movie in the first place . there is an interesting footnote ; we can see how she might want to try and learn some new things to be a fan of horror movies .

for once a sequel to ` ` the karate kid ' ' without ralph macchio ! hilary swank did an excellent job of convincing me that the original character was very real and really good in this story , but if you 've never been around a japanese movie before , you 're not supposed to judge the performance of their actors . i think the film had a lot more flair than i originally thought . it looked like one of those horror flicks where everyone looks at each other and starts laughing hysterically . i watched the whole movie with the exception of brad pitt who can take any joke and be charming .

there is a solid group of people that have lives like this girl going through the admissions process at school . it does n't seem possible . she does n't look much older than my own grandmother , so i would never have thought she should be working in an elementary school . as i had suspected earlier , this is not just a preschool class , but one where you spend your whole life waiting for the next grade - level version of your family or your best friend to show up . it makes no sense . the first place you will get to see your parents is on the other side of the world .

i am a longtime fan of the original of this movie ( bella martha / mostly martha ) , and everything that i have ever seen before in this film seems to tell me it is going to live . i mean , there was some serious angst about this movie from the early 1990 's . well , i can say that it was more than a bit boring , but it was still very good . at one time , it was something like $ 25 an hour . not quite as much fun as those movies you see on tv when you actually watch it .

it ' s 2005 , my friends . . . a time of amazing special effects and an age of technology . so the story is true . if you want to make a film , why not do it here , in this small town . but , i just thought that it was best if we all stayed away from one another at least for a few days before filming . this film is a work of fiction ; some people even say they actually watched it . it really did look very good to me as the plot was much worse than what you could think of .

1 . i ' ve seen branaghs hamlet : branagh is too old , speaks frequently with a high pitched voice , but he always manages to hold his title . what the hell made him so great ? where did all this talent come from ? it is not like i could give a damn about any of this stuff . i just wanted some action in my life because i was on the tv for god ' s sake ! the idea that someone could get into the film , or even do something funny , does make me want to find out why .

Ice the Limerick:A virus pulled out of the iceJust didn't know how to play nice.If infected you'll killBecause you are ill.The cure is to be infected twice.Ice is a great episode; one of the greats from season 1 that began shaping the show and if you ask me you really couldn't ask for much better throughout the entire series. It starts out with an awesome teaser which in my opinion is really one of the best teasers of the series also. A group of scientists in Alaska have drilled something out of the ice core which has for some reason caused them to kill each other.

This movie narrate the story of John Belushi,based of his biography `Wired' , wrote by Bob Woodward.All of movie is narrate on flashback without a chronological order , where after the death of John Belushi we see one angel accompany Belushi during few points of his life.Michael Chicklis in the character of John Belushi is enough credible , but entirely devoid of the devastate force of Belushi ,and his play stay only a pale animation.The director,on more,not succeed to give continuate on the story , that for who not knows the book is very confused.

I don't normally go out of my way to watch romantic comedy, and maybe I will in the future after seeing Return to Me. The plot was simple and no secret after the publicity. You don't have to be Einstein to guess what will happen after the first 15 minutes. What you can do is relax and let the cast take you into a world where the "chemistry" abounds and the good guys win and you can just laugh and have a good time. I LOVE this movie....and have the DVD on order!

i was having a horrid day but this movie grabbed me, and i couldn't put it down until the end... and i had forgotten about my horrid day. and the ending... by the way... where is the sequel!! !the budget is obviously extremely low... but ... look what they did with it! it reminds me of a play... they are basically working with a tent, a 'escape pod', a few guns, uniforms, camping gear, and a 'scanner' thing. that is it for props.

Anyone who critiques 'Jacqueline Hyde' as anything more than the playful and undeniably erotic romp that it's intended to be is just not playing with a full deck. Just from the title, it's obvious that this low budget horror comedy isn't meant to be taken seriously... it's as tongue in cheek as a nympho's french kiss, and just as titillating. The female cast members are all great and fun to watch. Check this out, Rolfe Kanefsky is the clown-prince of soft-core horror. Unlike most soft-core horror flicks, this one is entertaining all the way through with charismatic and exceptionally attractive actresses.

i admit - i was lured to this one from the hype - and i did n ' t stop to consider what it might mean if i left this place . in all my years as a writer or artist , there is not a single time when i have n't tried to write something . i also have been trying hard to do this because it has been good for a long while . i just had an odd feeling of having done something wrong . well , i 'm pretty sure that you would have called me crazy but i guess i got off easy .

Cool action - yeah the premise has been done - but not this way - that's the trick. hey folks - SHOCK - it's an X-File.To me - it's cool that Scully/Mulder have almost no scenes together -- they have to adapt, rely on each other's intrinsic sense about what's really going on - and each other's adaptation skills. They read into each other's moves and get the job done.... (sort of).Oh yeah --- really good acting -- do these people get paid to do this? valentine , a model in france is separated from her lover who is abroad , they plan to meet up on a weekend after the holidays so that they can have a romantic tryst together . for some bizarre reason it makes me laugh because i know that will be very difficult to get over if you 're going to marry a man who lives in a castle and does n't give a crap about anything outside of himself . i think it might be more like an affair than a love affair with a man who ca n't seem to leave the country .

I really tried to like "Saw." The story was good, and I admire the breakneck pace of the way the film was shot. However, there were too many clichés and elements that while they may have looked "cool," they really made no sense.First, what I liked about the film was the overall tone of the story, and I thought the premise was fantastic. The character of The Jigsaw Killer was intriguing and reminded me of vintage Dario Argento. Danny Glover was excellent in his role as an obsessed detective, and Monica Potter was good in a thankless role as a doctor's abducted wife.

Some of the secondary actors try, really hard. And camera shots in the desert are quite lovely. Otherwise, this film is horrible.William Shatner's character, Harvey, is an amateur screenwriter. He's also a psychopath, a man who quite literally escapes from a mental institution. Is the point of this film that amateur screenwriters are psychopaths? Harvey will do anything to get his script read and turned into a movie, even if that means taking a film crew hostage. Do amateur screenwriters ... grovel? Maybe they do.The film's setup is way too long.

"I remember waiting to be born..." "Vision quest that was the American West." "We went to a psychic..." "I'm sure their first reaction is that she's cuckoo" "...the place is haunted..." "I think there's another dimension right here." An artist (Marta Becket) and her husband many decades ago left the hustle and bustle and culture of New York and moved to a god-forsaken town with a population of 10 in Death Valley. There, they renovated a theater--painting it is a very home-spun/folk art manner.

By the time the Hellraiser franchise was reaching it's forth film the premise was wearing a bit thin. Dr. Paul Merchant (Bruce Ramsey) is a scientist in the future, whom while prisoner regales his captor of the story of how his ancestors (all played by Ramsey) had first built the evil Lament Configuration puzzle-box that sets evil upon the world and how his bloodline had subsequent dealing with said box. The film is a awash with lack of continuity in regards to the other films and lack of coherency in this one.

tyra banks needs to teach these girls that it ' s not all about being beautiful on the outside . the real truth is , when you ' ve lived for so many years and still have trouble with what you ' re seeing in the eyes of the average person , you start to see a change in their life . now , i knew i was going to spend some time with them tonight , but they would probably only come down here to watch the movie . there is nothing else to do around here , so why are we even bothering to hang out ?

i was attracted to this film by its offbeat , low - key , ' real life ' story line . that is if it did n't scare the pants off most of the audience ! i just had a very interesting day today . i have never seen one so boring and predictable in my whole life . the movie was quite boring . there were no comedies and the plot was dull . i even watched some stupid movies but nothing else really appealed to me . then on the way home from the school i came across an interesting story with people wearing costumes .

this movie was , perhaps , one of the most unoriginal and unfunny films i ' ve seen in a long time . it is not at all the plot i expected or expected to see when i saw this film , but then i really didn ' t expect it to be this good . even more embarrassing than any of the others . I totally agree. This is "Pitch Black underground" and a well worn plot. The best scenes I thought were the divers exploring the caves, going through impossible subterranean passageways, some of them were heart pounding. The scenery was great. Had they dispensed with the staple "alien" toothy CGI badboys entirely the movie would have been much better. All they would have had to do is never show any monsters at all but have everyone wondering, and follow Jack's descent into madness, and this might have been a top rate hitchcock-style thriller, maybe award material.

look , this film is terrible . . . the ` ` plot ' ' involves twins who are neglected by their self - absorbed parents to do their job and take advantage of the children in order to keep them alive ' ? there is nothing to tell ! the only thing to say about this film was the fact that you can not know if it will ever be made or not . i read the reviews from some of the other cinematographers here . it is so stupid that it goes against my sense of enjoyment . the characters are absolutely miserable , even the actor looks like he wants to cry .

this is a movie from toilet pictures . if the name of the production company is any indication how stinky there is , then maybe it was a comedy . i hope they did n't film it on purpose ; it makes my blood boil . and i have no doubt that it was not intended for the public to know about what happened here tonight but for them to have shown up at this time . i think you can understand why i would find it very funny . after all , it has been four years since my last film and it has been one of the greatest films i have ever seen !

When I saw the trailers for this movie, it looked like a good romantic comedy. I expected some light fluffy fun. Instead, I was bored and a little depressed.Honestly, there was no chemistry between the leads at all, and the movie had little, if anything, that was funny about it. The little girl was adorable - when she cried, I cried - but I thought they might have used someone a little bit younger in the role.Either way, the movie was filled with long, dull silences or swelling opera music.

i absolutely adored this movie . for me , the best reason to see it is how stark a contrast that movie was with the rest of the films , which seemed to be boring and unoriginal . the main characters are usually quite nice and seem genuinely interested in the movie . when i first saw this film i had no idea what to do about it . but after seeing this one , i realized that some of the stories i have heard are not very convincing or believable . as you may possibly know , i have been watching this film for some time now .

i ' ve read the positive comments on this movie . i assume people who were in this movie must ' ve found some excuse to watch , a reason to come . or maybe you don ' t really like movies at all ; it ' s not the best of comedies , but it is certainly entertaining . and as for the actual characters themselves , i hope they will get your point : they are probably better off living their lives where they can enjoy other people ' s attention . if so , do not be worried .

I agree with several of you that this film was rather boring and dull. I found myself disliking the main character and the following actors/actresses that came in the scenes. oh yeah , this one is definitely a strong contender to win the questionable award of ` ` worst 80 ' s . he really should see a movie about how people who have gone to prison can not get out of it . that kind of shows how stupid they all are . do you see what i mean ? no , you ca n't let yourself be taken away from your favorite show just because some guy thinks he can find something better on his own . if there was any chance that we would get caught , i would have turned the tv off when i saw it .

UP AT THE VILLA (2000) **1/2WARNING: YOU MAY FIND SOME SPOILERS AHEADIt's hard to know what is the point in UP AT THE VILLA, a gorgeous but shallow period piece, one of those made with the only objective of earning Oscar nominations for best costume design and art-set direction (one for cinematography and another for score are also welcome). It has the same basic idea of thousands of period pieces produced every year: a good-looking, intelligent woman trying to find love in a strange place to her.

I awarded this presentation 4 stars. They are all for the script, which has been butchered beyond recognition in places. What can possibly be said? They took one of the finest plays written in the last century and methodically robbed it of its heart, humor and humanity. I don't really blame the actors, who are probably doing their best with shoddy direction and incomplete characters (because the very complete characters of the stage version have had their insides -- and insights -- ripped out). I do very much blame the director, who seems to strain to find ways to undermine the script.

The MTV sci-fi animated series "Æon Flux" is brought to life with Charlize Theron playing the title character, a freedom fighter who fights oppression in the walled city of Bregna, 400 hundred years into the future. For her latest mission, she has been sent to kill the city's leader Trevor Goodchild (Marton Csokas), but she uncovers secrets along the way.Aeon Flux falls under the category of good premise, mediocre execution. Interesting story yet the film was a little dull. A lot of people are saying that this is one of the worst movies of the year and that's not true at all.

there ' s only 2 reasons i watch this show . . . i invested the time already in previous episodes and col . james , it has all the qualities of an episode about a teen heartthrob who isn ' t bad looking , but his heart is always on fire . the second reason for this was to keep up with the story : " what happened to you ? i mean , how did you end up doing this ? if you were really good and talented like me , then could you have stayed on tv so that you wouldn ' t have to deal with those kind of things ? "

in my opinion the directing , editing , lighting , and acting ( minus franco ) were very good . it gave me an insight into what the characters would look like if we had given them this movie . but as i say , this movie is a real letdown . i am not complaining about its content , of course , i was quite surprised to see the actual characters that appeared on this film ; the plot is completely different from ours . all the same , i was glad for the actors who came out to play at the beginning of this movie - they could have looked more realistic and believable .

i found it almost impossible to empathize with ricci ' s character in this film . if she was supposed to be an actress who got pregnant , why did she spend so much money on a movie that is n't going to come out of the closet for another twelve months ? what kind of movie would she have to put her name on ? no way would i be forced to watch this movie . the only thing i thought i liked about it was how it was totally unappealing . it made my heart hurt as i tried to picture ricci sitting on a beach with him doing anything but walking or playing baseball .

this is one of the few movies - maybe the only - that truly haunted me for years . it 's a classic film , and i spent so much time watching it that i could never remember what was going on in it . even now , as i am standing in front of the camera with my arms crossed , i can still feel myself turning to see if someone has come along who has witnessed the film , or how it would play out at its best . i had been hoping for a real movie since i was small , but i do not know how well any of these things are actually done .

How do I describe the horrors?!!! First, some points: First, this review should be taken with a grain of salt -- I saw this over 20 years ago, when I was a boy, at the Museum of Modern Art in New York City.Secondly, I am giving away some scenes and plot points. However, it does not have much of a plot.Finally, I don't enjoy these type of art films anyway.This film was directed by proto-auteur Luis Bunuel. He was a surrealist and dadaist. These were modernist themes or movements popular critically in the 1920's and early 1930's.

whomever thought of having sequels to Iron Eagle must be shot. In this case once was enough. Iron Eagle was a good movie to watch. Even though it is unrealistic, it is still entertaining. Iron Eagle II has a senseless plot and can be used to as a cure to insomnia. I didn't even bother to watch Iron Eagle III, but from looking at the R rating, I assume it's more violent than the past 2 movies. Well, Iron Eagle IV is probably the most inane sequel. Lou Gossett Jr. returns as the always delightful "Chappy" Sinclair.

I first saw this movie at least thirty years ago, and it remains one of my all-time faves! It's a classic - the intriguing plot, great characters, suspense and shocking twist ending (all set against the backdrop of the gorgeous Monterey/Big Sur coast) never get old. Roy Thinnes portrays Johnny Brant, a captivating character that grows more mysterious as his true identity unfolds. The acting is great and believable; viewers get caught up in the web that develops between the workaholic husband, disenchanted wife and the alluring stranger (Thinnes as Brant).

I must admit I wasn't expecting much on this movie. I was surprised I truly enjoyed it as much as I did. The script wasn't oscar material, but it wasn't horrible either. The acting was great by Mark Wahlberg. Jennifer Aniston had a great supporting role, and looked lovely as ever. What made this movie for me was the music. If you do not like 80's glam metal or hair bands, then you probably wont like this movie. Its all about being a rockstar. Some cliche's were present, but didn't bring down the movie at all.

I love these awful 80's summer camp movies. The best part about "Party Camp" is the fact that it literally has no plot. It simply drops a weak batch of "characters" into a location and then things occasionally happen. The cliches here are limitless (SPOILERS): the nerds vs. the jocks, the secret camera in the girls locker room, the hikers happening upon a nudist colony, the contest at the conclusion, the secretly horny camp administrators, and the embarrassingly foolish sexual innuendo littered throughout. The only cliche missing is the presence of Corey Feldman.

unreal ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! . after reading the initial reviews posted by alleged reviewers , i have not even seen a single negative review in over two hours ! this was supposed to be a fun time for me and i really enjoy writing my first horror film . i would like to thank the many actors that have been nominated for this special award for this series . i love how people are so eager to read their first horror film ( it has always seemed to be a chore to me ) . i think it is rather sad that we do not have something better to do at this stage .

Katharine Hepburn as a mountain woman who mixes prayer with positive thinking--and is thought by the local folk to be a witch. Kate works overly-hard trying to convince us she's a backwoods hick (named Trigger Hicks! ), but you can see she doesn't even believe in this unintentionally comical scenario. Constantly-smiling Robert Young plays a foreman working on the construction of a mountain dam who becomes Trigger's first crush...but alas, he's married! No amount of white magic can resuscitate this formula, based on a play and brought to the screen by R.K.O.

almost missed it . while visiting friends in philadelphia sometime in the early 1980 ` s , i was channel surfing at a bar on the east side of campus where i met this young man whom i fell in love with but did not really know very well until we got involved in the program . as i saw him at his friend 's graduation party and how he was so perfect for me , all i wanted to do was marry him . i would have done it if there had been other options . instead , i just gave myself one good reason and then left it behind .

Norris plays a Chicago cop who stumbles upon a devil's apprentice? who wants to, well, create Armegeddon. He eventually kills the creature by, get this, throwing a solid gold 24 inch spike, not very sharp, about twenty feet, hard enough to penetrate the chest. Unlikely? So is the rest of the movie. Much of it consists of CN and his sidekick driving cars and talking nonsense. The Israeli (or Arab) kid is there ostensibly to humanize CN. OK. Doesn't work, makes no sense, and advances the plot, so-called, not one bit.

I saw this superb documentary at the Santa Barbara Int'l Film Festival. It is extremely absorbing and very well crafted, drawing you into the life and career of Harry Nilsson, one of the most overlooked musical talents of the 1960's and 70's. While I was familiar with his better known compositions ("One is the Loneliest Number", "Without You"), I learned about this man's brilliant writing and beautiful singing. If you love music, you'll find plenty to draw you in to his world, which unfortunately spiraled out of control as his success increased and his past haunted him.

The film idea was going nowhere... I was sure it would have a foggy end, and of course... it did!

something strange is happening in loch ness . the water is crystal clear , nor cold . a giant robotic turtle swims in it 's path . its white - eyed eyes do n't seem to be trying to kill anyone . the turtle has no apparent intention of stopping . i watch as it goes past the bridge over the channel and makes a left turn towards the lighthouse . i thought that would be the most obvious course to take . i watch as the turtle disappears behind the lighthouse . when i was on my own , i was always afraid of turtles .

The Camals Are Coming is a rather disappointing British comedy from 1934. I purchased this because I like desert adventures and states on the box that it is a drama. It certainly isn't.It is about a couple who head for Egypt to capture some desert drug smugglers.This would have been much better if it had been done as a drama instead of a comedy, which lets it down a lot. I doubt whoever wrote this screenplay has ever actually read Mansfield Park...or if they have it was not very well. the nun is a revenge picture whereby a very strict nun is killed by her rebellious trailer trash charges and her brother is thrown in prison . this was not what the script had in mind for me . this movie seemed like it could have been made to make a great movie without any serious effort . i had no doubt that the story was going to be good , even when the plot did look pretty good . however , after reading the script and seeing some of the things that were portrayed in the movie , i am surprised at how much the characters are able to relate to each other .

In the twilight years of his career, Charles Bronson forged long-running partnerships with several directors, most notably J. Lee Thompson and Michael Winner. He did two films for one-time Bond director Peter Hunt too - the first being the decent 1981 actioner Death Hunt, the second being this indifferent political chase thriller. Assassination is pretty dull if truth be known, and come the end you'll find yourself longing for something with a bit more passion and pace, like The Wilby Conspiracy for instance (which, plotwise, this film resembles).

I went to an advance screening of this movie thinking I was about to embark on 120 minutes of cheezy lines, mindless plot, and the kind of nauseous acting that made "The Postman" one of the most malignant displays of cinematic blundering of our time. But I was shocked. Shocked to find a film starring Costner that appealed to the soul of the audience. Shocked that Ashton Kutcher could act in such a serious role. Shocked that a film starring both actually engaged and captured my own emotions. Not since 'Robin Hood' have I seen this Costner: full of depth and complex emotion.

This film is enjoyable if you like poverty row, public domain films from the first half of the 20th century, or are a fan of amateur film-making. The film splices together public domain thrillers together along with newly shot scenes in which the "actors" (With the sole exception of Redfield doing a near dead on Lugosi rip, all of the "performers" are simply dreadful!) attempt to interact with the stock footage. The "New" footage is covered with digitally added film scratches, as is some of the already substandard old footage (??!!).

This film is undoubtedly one of the greatest landmarks in history of cinema. By seeing this film,we can only retrospectively notice that world cinema in 1950s had such a purely humanistic dramaturgy,such a strong and adequate use of sound-image montage,and almost religious admiration of ethical choices in human life. Cinema was then not only one form of arts. It was much higher than ordinary life and it gave many people hope to live after the tragic war. It is said, that even Picasso was moved and cried that such a work of art can appear only once in 100 years!

A BUSTER KEATON Silent Short.Poor Buster becomes THE GOAT ("scapegoat") for a dangerous escaped murderer.This is a wonderful, hilarious little film with Keaton at his absolute best. In what is essentially a series of chases, Buster gets to exercise his endlessly inventive imagination. Big Joe Roberts appears as the highly suspicious police chief.Born into a family of Vaudevillian acrobats, Buster Keaton (1895-1966) mastered physical comedy at a very early age. An association with Fatty Arbuckle led to a series of highly imaginative short subjects and classic, silent feature-length films - all from 1920 to 1928.

What a cast...and what a waste of it. Seriously, when a movie has Gabriel Byrne, Jamie Foxx, Thandie Newton, Stuart Townsend, Hal Holbrook, Melanie Griffith and Sylvester Stallone in it you would expect some quality. Review: Nunsploitation films. They've been around since forever. A few that pop to mind are the Mexican devil worshiping movie Alucarda, Night of the Demons 2, The Convent and of course Dante Tomasellis Desecration. Cant blame somebody for trying to exploit a religious/holy image and twisting it around to make it scary. If done right, it works. Here comes the most recent addition to the nunsploitation sub-genre simply titled The Nun.The story is about this group of girls that live in a Catholic school. In this school there's a Nun who is particularly cruel to one of the girls.

I saw this film via one of the actors' agents, and it surely conforms with a great deal that comes out of Sth. Australia in terms of the overall *tone,* which is rightly dark and moody.I thought the little boy in the film was excellent. Mostly kid actors are *hammed up* and embarrassing but not in this case. He was really very good. In terms of the *surrealism* thingy mentioned by jingo, well, I just think this film is plain 'weird.' It's a real weirdo film, with weirdo locations, storyline, weird stuff going on the whole time.

In general, I prefer horror movies that creep me out so much I'm afraid of everything for the next day or so, not the ones where people act stupid and get killed by an indestructible monster. This is one of those movies. The chupacabra of legend is a dog-faced lizard-skin greenish-gray monster that hops like a kangaroo, has fangs and claws, has a row of sharp spines sticking out from its back, and sucks the blood of livestock. As in many horror movies, good and bad, this movie takes liberty with the legend.

The first feature length Muppet Movie, and excepting maybe The Muppet Christmas Carol, the movie puppeteers the world over are still looking for as a guide. Disney has done the Muppets a dis-service and this movie proves it over and over again. Featuring classic comedians and guest star cameos, keeps to a simple but original plot, classic Muppet lame jokes, Paul Williams genius in song writing, and Electric Mayhem madness, and comes off with an amazing movie especially when you realize that the major cast are puppets. Only Croft has come close to Hensen's genius with puppets.

Why can't a movie be rated a zero? Or even a negative number? Some movies such as "Plan Nine From Outer Space" are so bad they're fun to watch. THIS IS NOT ONE.
