christopher nolan ' s first directorial effort , a year before he did ` ` memento , ' ' and this is almost the whole thing . ' but it was not one of those " special " films that are just for kicks . there is a lot about the plot that you do not know . i ' m sure your readers would like to find out what part of my film you like and how much you think about it . now , as a matter of fact , we didn ' t have time for this !

I have watched two episodes so far, I really like it. Even though I am no longer in college, it makes me miss the wonderful college life. I wish that I spent a little more time socializing. I kind of identify myself with rusty. When I was rushing a fraternity, my big brother was not like Cappie at all, I wish that I had a big brother like him. So if a show like this can actually make people to identify themselves with the characters, then it is a pretty good show.It is more realistic than American pie with less explicit sex jokes.

This movie has to be the worst film I have seen. There is a reason it was made to be a MOW (Movie of the week). The continuity was all wrong (palm trees in a Chicago setting even though it was filmed in Toronto, Canada), the effects were left to be desired for the year of 2004. HELLO. "Lord of the Rings" had better CGI than that. But I guess they also had the money for it. The budget will for sure affect the outcome but anyone that calls this MOW more than a 2 needs to go back to Film and TV school.

when hoppity goes to town he discovers nothing but bad news for his little insect neighbors in the lowlands . that is what this movie is all about and you can see it with your own eyes ( or so i hear ) . there 's a picture of the three of them together as they are walking back to their ranch . one of the most awful scenes of my whole life is being eaten by a huge bear - sized bear at the front of a cattle drive . the bear eats the poor young cowboy who was standing right under its snapping jaws while holding a baseball bat .

o boy , was this really bad . i saw this on videotape . in scenes that had soundtrack music , it was hard to believe anyone would do something like this . if you look at the screen over and over and over again , you wo n't see it . no , you just have to think about it a bit and realize that these are not videos at all . there are no pictures of what happened from any one location , but there are pictures of people playing around and some of them holding each other as if they were two or more old friends .

I rented this movie for about $1.50 - the most complete waste of money (and time) I have ever spent. It's LAME! I couldn't believe how they could come up with something like this.The plot... there is no plot. Everything you'd expect to happen, it does, only in a worse way. The acting was horrible. My dog could've done better. The special effects have no effect whatsoever - except inducing complete disbelief. And the cheesy lines.... I mean, why even bother? The only credit I can give this piece of sh*t are the opening scenes.

I have just caught this Movie on TCM, and can understand why George Murphy went into Politics if this was the best MGM could serve up to him. It is so slow-moving that the attempt to make it a real film-noir effort does not come off. It featured two of my favouriteplayers in Eve Arden (completely wasted) and Dean Stockwell(the best actor in the Film), but what really hit me was that the leading lady Frances Gifford went through some 90 minutes (it seemed longer!) without changing the expression on her face--her fainting scene was comical.

dark and bleak sets , thrilling music that cuts through your spin like aknife ( or razor ) a perfect piece of art . it is hard to imagine how anyone could stand to watch this movie without actually feeling some pain . if you 're looking at this film , you probably already know all the actors ' names - i 'm just going to assume there is a story behind their name . what was in the video ? it 's not so bad . i do n't really know why i did n't see this movie before : i have lots of other movies to keep me busy .

i admire deepa mehta and this movie is a masterpiece . i ' d recommend to buy this movie on dvd . i hope you enjoyed this book , as well as all of the stories that come out of it . thank you for reading my story and making it special ! i know it was very good , especially in the beginning . this movie is totally unoriginal , and does not look like anything that i will ever have seen in any of these movies , but it still gives me great pleasure . it shows how hard it really is for people to understand what it is they are missing in their entire lives .

i was expecting a lot from this movie , and i can say i have n ' t been disappointed . first of all , i have to know where the hell he gets his ideas for films . i do n't really want to hear that again . second , the plot is stupid , it makes me laugh on the way in , and the acting is horrible . third , i think i am going to need a long rest when i get home . why do i have to spend an entire day with no tv ?

this film really used its locations well with some amazing shots , dark and disturbing the film moves very slowly . i am quite impressed by the overall performance of the film . i will give a special rating to anyone who can watch it . i find it hard to believe that this is what i was missing in the first two weeks . as a result of watching the movie i was not particularly interested in seeing much of any of the details . i think there are things more important for a person to see than the actual execution of an evil movie .

i didn't hate this one. i just couldn't adapt to the story. it didn't really grab me. Michael Mann is a very good director but i have to disagree with his methods in this. i'm also a fan of Daniel Day Lewis. some projects he's been in are pretty rubbish but his acting is brilliant. my favourite Daniel Day Lewis films are There Will Be Blood and Gangs Of New York.there is one thing i loved about this and that was the musical score, it gave the film a lot of atmosphere. thats about all i liked in it though.

there is no reason to watch this film . why ? many reasons . first up , the acting is awful . but i have n't seen this movie yet and i love watching it . second , the plot is so boring and unimaginative that you just feel like talking to your own self . if only you could have a little bit of dialogue with your own thoughts . this was a really bad idea after all . what a load of crap ! in the film it seems as if these people are just trying to make fun of each other .

do n ' t get me wrong . i ' ve got a considerable soft spot for the works of charles band , though i suppose it would have been preferable to being in this business . but the music is not really about what you make of the work that makes them happy . or how you turn them into something other than what they actually are . most of my time was spent in the studio . i never knew much about music , and i know very little about any of the songs that are written in the studio . the only good thing that came out of this was the singing .

Well it might be a kid's movie...perhaps but i'm not gonna let my kids from 9 watch it!,so the one who say it is a kid movie hmm? !,it is teenager movie i agree..,so but back to the movie it is about a boy who can lie very good..,so good that at the end nobody nows truth or lie.Anyway it is a nice movie to see nice screen play i vote a 8 for screen play and story ...i think they writers mend a litlle lesson whit it...''the truth is never overated''.

i ' m pleased that this was the work of foreign cinematographers because it ca n ' t be accused of unfair bias in the story . and , as you can tell , my father would like a little help from his peers in this issue . the story is based on an example of a woman who lives alone in a small rural town and has seen a lot of strange people in her life . these things may sound odd to you now but i have seen how they look at other people . many people are treated badly by some of the people in the town because of their lack of understanding .

Asmali Konak has arguably become one of the best TV series to come out of Turkey. With its unique cinematography and visual approach to filming, the series has gained a wide following base with rating records continuously broken. Personally I do not agree with singers becoming actors (hence, Ozcan Deniz - the lead actor) but I guess the figures speak for themselves.In relation to the movie, it was disgusting to see how much someone can destroy such a plotline. Years in the making, this movie was able to oversee every descent story that existed within the series.

Previous reviewer Claudio Carvalho gave a much better recap of the film's plot details than I could. What I recall mostly is that it was just so beautiful, in every sense - emotionally, visually, editorially - just gorgeous.If you like movies that are wonderful to look at, and also have emotional content to which that beauty is relevant, I think you will be glad to have seen this extraordinary and unusual work of art.On a scale of 1 to 10, I'd give it about an 8.75. The only reason I shy away from 9 is that it is a mood piece.

legendary hammy and arrogant horror movie star conrad radzoff ( splendidly played with wicked sardonic aplomb by ferdy mayne ) had been given a chance to take control of a real , life - and - death drama . at the end of the film , i could barely keep from laughing . this movie was horrible , so terrible in fact that it did more damage to my mental health than it did to anyone else . all you can think about is how many times one should go to the hospital and check on the poor man . after an hour or two , i just got tired of thinking about it .

There are places for political commentary in film, but "Masters of Horror" is not one of them. I get enough of this stuff from Newsweek and every other editorial in the newspaper. Now I've got to watch this in horror movies? C'mon! All I wanted was a good zombie schlock film, not another "Bush is bad!" rant. If Joe Dante wants to express his politics, let him go on Air America. And if you must insist on making a "message" film, be a little more sly about it.

So keira knightly is in it...So automatically we compare this film to attonement. Aside rom the fact that this film is also wartime and her appearance is uncanning, these films are totally different.The Actors work well, i think one good thing is there is no memorable person, they are a team.If you want a film where things happen, then id advise another as the story of this film is about human interaction and their physche's damaged by their experiences and how their lives are intertwined.This film have genuine interaction, perfect pause moments that make you hold your breath.

An Asian blowgun assassin takes out victims in Niagara Falls and New York City before getting run over by a car. Sheila Morris (former Miss Sweden Janet Agren, given a hilarious "Southern belle" dub to show she's from Alabama) finds a connection between these killings and the disappearance of her sister Diana (Paola Senatore) and sets out to investigate. This brings her to New Guinea where she promises a sleazy guide (Robert Kerman i.e. American porn star R. Bolla) 80,000 dollars to help locate her sister.

when i first saw this movie i was literally rolling around on the floor laughing (especially when they were getting chased by the water, and when the guy drove through peoples gardens, i mean would it hurt to drive around the washing line?) the special effects! this movie clearly didn't have a big budget. either that or the guy left his toddler in charge of the controls. the water coming out of the damn looked like a close up of a can of beer that had fizzed up. what were the actors thinking? did they actually believe that it was a good movie?

this movie begins with a man who appears to be some sort of sports driver . he meets up with a woman named rachel in a warehouse . when they arrive , she asks him why he has the car parked at his apartment . the man simply says he just wants to show off the car . rachel laughs . the woman tells him he is being ridiculous . he looks back and says , " i really am not going to bother you with this . let me show you the city . you will like what you see when you enter . " the woman walks away laughing .

young , ambitious nurse ms . charlotee ( rosie holotik ) is sent to work at a mental asylum out in the desert southwest . she spends the first twenty - four hours alone and suffers from depression . we can not find any more information on her or her children because they are all dead by the time we get back to our story . it is interesting that there is very little to tell about their lives , but it seems like there has always been someone else out there who believes that something terrible is going on . this may have been the real reason why many of the kids ended up in foster care .

warning : plot spoilerthe always - abnormal movies of david cronenberg certainly are an acquired taste . fans of his earlier films love what he is doing on screen . and they also like what he shows , even if it does make a bad movie . although i would strongly advise you not to be too surprised by this in any way possible , there has been nothing else for me so far about this project . it seems to have been fairly good , as long as you did n't read too much of it . i just do n't understand why someone would waste all of their time on this nonsense !

The director Godfrey Reggio must be a very charming and persuasive man for this dreadfully botched project to have seen the light of day. Reggio's message, so powerful and resonant in his previous two Qatsi films, is hopelessly jumbled here. Athletes, equations, oceans, keypads, laughing heads, etc, mingle without purpose. The parade of banal imagery is mostly generic stock from Getty Images et al, and the heavy-handed digital manipulations are amateurish in the worst way imaginable. Surely someone involved (Steven Soderbergh, executive producer?)

sorry for all you guys that are not family with the lynches . my sister in law asked me how you can do something so stupid , and when i told her it made me laugh . why ? why did i have to be such a complete jerk at this very moment ? why does it hurt so much to hear your name mentioned by an old friend ? i am so tired of hearing about your family . i just want to know why you ca n't seem to understand how important you are and what you want to achieve .

i kind of like jag . it do have its charm but lately its to much propaganda in it . when you watch a movie you will not see it as an original , which is just about the dumbest thing that ever happened on this film . i mean who wants to watch a movie that was so great that they had to go back and watch it ? ! i hate this movie even though it is good . the actors are dumb and boring . they all try to make a move on the camera with no luck .

i wanted to like this movie . i really , really did . i was so excited when i saw the movie on the internet . it was so much fun and i loved watching it . after a little bit i realized that i had been getting way too bored in my entire life . all of the movies made me think that they were more fun just watching than actually doing something else . so i started going off and acting . i have often thought about what a great movie it could possibly be . one thing led to another .

Stunning blonde Natasha Henstridge is the young, not-so-grieving widow in the mansion on the hill, telling her story to a TV reporter in Monroeville, Virginia. And among the community's well-heeled horsey-set, she's suspected of involvement in the death of her older husband. That's James Brolin, trusting as a babe-in-arms. Flashback teledrama made in Canada, based on an article that appeared in Vanity Fair magazine. It must be true! Whatever, it's far more romance than mystery, and a very familiar tale. Leggy Species star Henstridge as a gold-digging hospice nurse?

i just can not emphasize enough what a lovely movie this is . justthe memory of this movie right now is just too hard to bear . every single one of the characters and even some of the scenes themselves are so bad it 's hard to really watch them . there is no film that does n't make my teeth hurt ( especially in this particular one ) but i ca n't seem to find anything else to say . it feels like i 've just been watching an uninteresting movie with absolutely no understanding of how you should feel when things happen .

Lovely Candace Bergen as the widow Perdicaris are kidnapped and held for ransom by the Sheik Raisuli played by one dashing Sean Connery. The incident comes during 1904 as Theodore Roosevelt runs for election to the presidency in his own right. Needing a good example to show off the muscular foreign policy of the United States, Brian Keith as Roosevelt issues a stunning declaration to the Sultan of Morocco, "Perdicaris alive or Raisuli dead. "But in this adaptation of that incident the famous declaration is the only true thing about this story. The Perdicaris in question was in reality one Ion Perdicaris who was a Greek immigrant and dilettante playboy.

I'm trying to understand what people liked about MirrorMask. I am an avid film viewer and hobbyist film maker. As I was telling friends during my lunch hour, MirrorMask may well be my biggest movie disappointment of the year. Just like the short Moongirl, the film missed its marks. Several times during the movie it made attempts at humor. It sets you up for the laugh. Instead of making you laugh, it leaves you feeling empty. The jokes reminded one of the recent Star Wars films. They weren't funny unless you were five.

this is a pretty simplistic romance . girl finds boy , girl loves boy , girl loses boy , girl becomes boy , girl finds man , girl discovers the truth of life . what happened here was a little out of place by any modern standards in my opinion but i am happy to say that everything seems to work out . it was not so bad once we started watching the movie and were able to find out some good points . when we finally got the chance to take a photo , the first thing that i really noticed about it was that the whole scene looked like a comedy from the start .

i love watching the jericho mile . i mean watching peter strauss run the mile is like watching usain bolt on the matrix . you can see for miles and miles , and it just goes on and on and on . i loved watching the sequel to the movie a great deal . i especially loved watching the version about the man who comes out of nowhere to kill the people he killed . this was something i could never have had the nerve to watch . there are many ways to kill someone with an electric gun , but that ' s exactly what we did .

ahh , nuthin ' like cheesy , explopitative , semi - porn , masquerading as horror . . . this one stars jaqueline lovell who goes about his everyday business of working on a movie he knows is not supposed to be out there . . . except it is really happening , and i do n't mean in an embarrassing way . no . . . i mean the film is just so ridiculous that i ca n't help but chuckle . . . for what it 's worth though , i think these scenes were probably made by another person .

very poor script and acting . i was very surprised that the director was able to convince his cast with just enough money and influence to get this film done . in the end , the director made the movie work . it was one of the most popular films of the last decade . the director was a well - known guy who became famous as a writer on two occasions . both times , you get an award from him and you know how much he liked writing these kinds of films . it was so good that my family had to buy them .

One of the best,Lackawanna BluesGreat movie,great cast,great music,this is one of those movies that is so good that when it is over you wish it would go on for another 90 minutes,I will w3atch this one many times. This is one of those movies that grabs you from the beginning and twist and slams you emotionally throughout the feature. The cast is extraordinary without the faintest hint of anyone being uncormfortable in their role. You get the sense that you're really there taking all this in. A great deal of care was given in the sets, costumes and music of the period.

this is a snuff movie . i ' m shocked it is even considered to be in the imdb library . when i saw the film i started to believe that there was some truth to the movies . however , seeing how one of the characters has lost his mind and tries to destroy the human race by attacking humans , made me wonder if it was such a bad idea to go through with the whole screening . i could not see what the original actors were going to think as well , so let ' s skip the part of the actor ' s face and ask the real questions .

Ahh, nuthin' like cheesy, explopitative, semi-porn, masquerading as horror...This one stars Jaqueline Lovell(sometimes Sara St. James), the nubile starlet also seen in "Femalien", "The Erotic House of Wax", and that family favorite "Nude Bowling Party". She is now a fixture in Surrender Cinema's line-up of talentless cuties starring in pointless, soft-porn exploitation flicks. "Head of the Family" actually tries to be a real moovie. A con-man and a tramp try to get said-tramp's husband off-ed.

The most die-hard worshippers of John Wayne will cringe when they watch The Lawless Frontier. Even for a poverty row studio, this one is one stinkeroo.Unusual for a western we have a criminal who is a sex crime perpetrator. Earl Dwire plays a halfbreed white and Indian who for reasons that are not explained, pretends he's a Mexican, hokey accent and all. Dwire sounds like the Frito Bandito of advertising fame back in the day.He and his gang happen upon Gabby Hayes and his daughter Sheila Terry. They really don't have anything worth robbing, but Dwire just wants an excuse to kidnap Terry and have his way with her.

i hate movies that end like this ! ! ! ! this 16mm disaster is full of cliches , stereotypical comedies and stupid plot points . the plot has a completely different cast to it , much more sophisticated and realistic than what you get at disney . the actors do their best to make sense of everything and try to figure out who was responsible for creating the entire film . as such , one thing they seem to be trying to do right now is not let go of reality . they ca n't help it ; they just feel sorry for other people .

I read a lot of high hopes from readers of the book that this would be a faithful adaptation of Nora Roberts' story. Not having read the book, I don't know if this adaptation was faithful but I do know it wasn't good. Actually, the screenplay was the best part of the movie so kudos to Nora Roberts.I planned ahead and watched Carolina Moon because of Claire Forlani. I've never been sure if she's a good actress. She's been decent in some movies, average in others and really bad in this one. But, Forlani wasn't alone.

As was mentioned by others, could there be any other reason to see this film other than to see former "Wayne's World" star Mike Myers play a serious role? The story line is interesting but lacks development and is sabotaged by loose ends and bad characters. If there was any good scenic shots of Ireland then it would give it another reason to see it. But instead it focuses on a little normal village that is obviously surrounded by the 'green pastures' of the Emerald-Isle that are often shown in Irish films.

"Lets swap Murders- your wife, my father"- seemingly innocent conversation between two strangers - Bruno Anthony and Guy Haines when they meet over lunch on a train journey. Guy, a solid, respectable tennis player, whose problem is that his wife, the flirtatious Miriam, won't divorce him so he can marry senators daughter Anne, laughs the whole conversation off as a joke. The following week he isn't laughing any more. In a scene of classic Hitchcock suspense, Bruno stalks Miriam through a carnival and strangles her.

I knew it was going to be awful but not this awful! !, as it's one of the most boring movies i have ever seen, not a damn thing happens!. All the characters are dull, and the story is stupid and incredibly boring!,plus The ending is especially lame!. The only reason i rented this piece of crap because i am a big fan of Michael Dudikoff, however he is wasted here, and looks extremely bored and shows no emotion what so ever!, plus i cheered out loud when the movie was over!.

OH MY God I am lost Now I know everything this guy does is Pointless R J A wrote at August 13th, 2006 (posting no. 881): What an awful experience. It looked like a bunch of 3rd graders stole a video camera, borrowed some old editing software from 1995, and played a joke on each other. When naïve young Eddie Hatch, a window dresser at Savory's Department Store, falls for a statue of Venus and gives her a chaste kiss, Venus steps off her pedestal and gives Eddie more than he bargained for. This creaking example of what Hollywood can do to a Broadway musical manages to emphasize the inane story and eliminate most of the first-rate songs. The purpose was to make a safe, popular movie without too much investment while capitalizing on Ava Gardner's upward mobility to super stardom. Robert Walker as Eddie gets lost in a thankless role.

After watching this film, I thought to myself, they really glossed up Errol Flynn's life! The movie is really nice eye candy. They really got the 1930s and 1940s atmosphere of Hollywood just right. The costumes were great. All the women looked glamorous and all the men looked handsome and debonair.Is this a serious film about Errol Flynn's life? Nah! It's a fun movie based on all the scandalous stuff he did in his life.Why am I critiquing this film? This is a film that had a lot of promise but failed to deliver.

One of the last films DIRECTED by Lionel Barrymore, "Ten Cents a Dance" stars Barbara Stanwyck as the dance-hall girl "Barbara" in her sixth role. Stanwyck looks quite "plain-jane" in this one, and opens with her getting chewed out by the dance hall manager. Then along comes rich guy Bradley Carlton (Ricardo Cortez) who wants to sweep her off her feet. (Cortez and Stanwyck had made three films together in the 1930s.) Then she meets Eddie, who's very different from the dashing Carlton.

Earth Final Conflict began like a new world, a new vision from the creator of Star trek, something fresh and unique full of great elements. A very good cast with an extremely credible Kevin Kilner as William Boone, an ex cop good begins to work as guard of some kind of ambassador of a mysterious alien race (Talons), after the dead of his wife in strange circumstances. But soon the character of Kilner joins to a group with the mission to discover what are the truth intentions of the aliens, why they seem to be so nice and care for the human race.

A less than redemptive hunka junk that is mercifully free from the ravages of competence. Some Northern idiots come to the deep South looking for some confederate rifles stashed on the legendary Whiskey Mountain. They are menaced by scary hillbillies, in a wide nod to 'Deliverance'; but it turns out that the hicks are fronting for a Northern marijuana-trafficking badass. This is brought to light so early that it doesn't even qualify as a twist. The women are locked up and raped into catatonia; rather than rescuing them, the guys run down to town to get the sheriff, who is lazy and doesn't believe them.

an unintentionally hilarious early talkie melodrama with kay francis as the countess balakireff chasing everything in pants . at the beginning of the film there was only about five or six feet between the two characters when it all started and it went very wrong . the plot was bad but the plot was even worse ; it is so unfunny i had to look down on this movie for awhile . the first thing i heard about this movie was how the characters could not act , they simply did not . then i noticed that they seemed to have some sort of special ability to sing a different tune than any of the others .

I cant put it any simpler than that, this is a terrible film. I've worked in the industry and made several (short) films myself, so okay my standard is pretty high but seriously, i absolutely hate this film. I haven't made a comment on IMDb before but i hated this film so much i literally had to come and warn others. It is a piece of sh*t. The writer/director is an idiot who just has no idea how to make/write a good film and has the writing skills of an adolescent teenager.

I was waiting for this movie for a time. In the first day of the air in Turkey, I watched it. It was totally a disappointment for me. I was planning to watch a historical movie, but the one in the screen was a fictional one. First of all, the main character of the movie Cengiz Han, the great conquer was portrayed like a soft, calm, even a loser one. You can not feel the power in the movie. Historically, the war machine he created was conquered ¾ (even more) of the world know in those years.

in his descriptions of caa , platinum card lunches in hollywood , psychoanalysis , a vacation in provincetown he never takes seriously to the extreme . i 've had it for a decade now and my life has been one full of tragedy and drama . i thought i was getting along great until the last minute when this guy came up and tried to take my car . i asked him to leave before he hurt me or something but he kept coming . i could n't understand why he wanted to kidnap me like that . i thought he was some kind of serial killer .

this is one of those movies that you just do n ' t want to end . the characters are rich like the movie and they have no idea how to work around it . the comedy is pretty awful and the plot is hilarious but i hate the characters , i thought i was getting to see them in action . when i first went through the movie i thought it would be fun , but after seeing the movie with the audience , i realize that it did n't even improve the acting level . it was definitely bad .

Blackwater Valley Exorcism is set on a small town ranch where teenager Isabelle (Kristin Erickson) is found wandering around covered in dog's blood. Her parents Ely (Randy Colton) & Blanche (Leslie Fleming-Mitchell) own the ranch & are deeply worried about their daughter, recently she has not been herself & is considered a danger to herself & other's. Ranch hand & ex-priest Miguel (Del Zamora) recognises Isabelle's symptoms as a possible case of possession & when she starts to speak ancient Latin in a strange voice he becomes convinced of it.

Bonny Hunt scores a coup with her directorial debut. Minnie Driver and David Duchovny have that indescribable something called chemistry. Sure the plot is unlikely, but that doesn't stop one from enjoying this film. Carroll O'Conner does a great job as Grace's grandfather. Other great character actors play his card buddies. Jim Belushi is hilarious as the down-to-earth husband of Megan, part of the extended family.Faith, family, and marriage are respected. A few sexual references and salty words are used but in context and with gentle humor. And in the background that wonderful Dean Martin tune--"Return to Me.

everyone knows that late night movies are n ' t oscar contenders . fine . i mean i ' ll admit that i don ' t like this movie but i also can ' t say i care much for it anyway . the character is bad , the dialogue is horrible and the acting is a total waste of time . i was disappointed in my choice of films when i first saw them . the premise seemed to make perfect sense and the overall story seemed to be a good plot piece . unfortunately , i really don ' t know if this movie is even supposed to be good .

...now please move on because that's getting on my nerves.Seriously, the man behind brilliant pieces like "My Own Private Idaho" and "To Die For" (and others not so brilliant movies, i.e. the unnecessary "Psycho" remake) started an experimental phase with "Gerry", which reached its peak with the thought-provoking "Elephant". "Last Days" had some interesting aspects but was very uneven, while "Paranoid Park", his new film, also has good-looking 15 year-olds walking around... and not much else.

so if a guy meets you and he says ' i want you to look at my erection ! ' it would be an interesting situation . i ca n't believe how dumb i can be for believing such a preposterous suggestion . there is just no way the man with the big dick would ever actually do this movie . i must say that i was stunned at the amount of money in the dvd , but the premise is pretty good . as i watched it , i was reminded of one of the films i had seen in the late 1980 's . "

first of all , let me just say that after watching this movie i felt like i ' d been sold out on a real live horror movie . even though this film is the best one that i have ever seen so far , i don ' t know how much more boring it would be to watch a bad sci - fi film that has no characters , or plot whatsoever . the only thing i enjoyed about this movie was the fact that in addition to some good dialogue with a few comedians , it turned into quite an experience for the audience .

Death in Venice is a movie I need to see once every ten years. It is always different, because I am always at a different stage of life.The movie is about art, beauty, longing, death. Some scenes are painfully slow, others simply annoying to watch, especially if you have seem them before. Yet I would not want to miss a single frame. The music is repetitive, the main theme of the adagietto from Mahler's fifth is used again and again. Yet I would not want to miss a single note.

i left the theater , and i was only 10 years old . that ' s how bad it sucked . i still feel like a failure on my first day at this job , even more so in my undergrad school classes . but no matter , i knew that i could make it for another five years before having to choose between doing what is best for the rest of my life or making a terrible movie . i wanted to be an actress , but did not really have a choice . as a result , i was stuck with just being an ordinary kid who spends most of her time talking about movies .

why would i say that ? because when the movie ended , i was in a good mood . so it was easy to get out of the car and stand on the sidewalk with my feet planted firmly on the asphalt as i looked forward to getting back to the hotel . 
 " where are you going ? " i called after her . she had stopped walking and turned around to give me a smile . 
 " do n't worry , i 'm staying at the bellagio , " she laughed . " it 's very beautiful . it 's one of the finest hotels in san diego .

Think Jumanji but with a death curse. A bunch of surfer dudes get their hands on a game that takes the life of some one who is playing it. Supposedly it was made from the skin of a witch during the Spanish Inquisition and carries a nasty curse. Okay, undemanding and just sort of watchable tale isn't anything you haven't seen before.Frankly its a been there and done that story that hits all the right buttons in such away as to have no real surprises. Far from the worst thing that SyFy has run but certainly its not the best.

boy oh boy , does this movie stink . this movie is one of the worst pieces of trash i have ever seen . i thought it would be good to try my hand in a film but it just makes me gag . when the final credits roll , i look around and notice there are only two people left . so , i go to sit next to the other three and ask them if they like it . one of them says yes that 's what i thought at first but i could see the disappointment from the other two . it must have cost $ 29.99 .

if a copy of this movie fell into the wrong hands , the world would be in grave danger . but it did not have to be like this . i know i 'm not looking for a sci - fi / horror flick , but this movie is quite a different story than what i 'd expect from one of the other books that came out recently . it starts with an old woman dying of cancer . at first i thought she was having an affair with her husband because he had n't seen her in over three decades , but then something else catches my attention .

Christopher Nolan's directorial debut is a memorable one. The film was very well received and help land contracts for making 'Memento' and quite rightfully so. Following is an exquisite example of how films should be made. No fancy effects or blood-dripping gore...just brilliant writing and good acting. Nolan manages to captivate us once again with his writing. The actors, all unknowns to me and I suppose most people, did a good job bringing the characters to live. They were all believable and that's all they need to be.

Peter Watkins' rarely seen Punishment Park is a brutality-laced, uncompromised political weapon set across a never ending desertscape. An unapologetically left leaning anti authoritarian abuse fest, the escapades at first appear to be so over the top militaristic and sickening that it could come off as some distant fantastical dystopian alternate history, one Harry Turtledove would even enjoy. But once we delve deeper in and really pay attention to the abhorrent diatribe spouting out of those presiding over the tent topped tribunal, as well as the shotgun toting guards overseeing the bloody affair, our eyes are truly opened.

This movie certainly is a weird one to say the least. The basic plot is 3 old business associates invite 2 strangers into their home for returning a lost wallet with 10 bucks in it. The two whom show up fall in love. The 3 older business men die and come back as ghosts to try to help the two younger guests out. Okay so that may make sense but then we have 3 old guys whom apparently have some bread living together..slightly weird here...Harry Carey plays his part way off base you can't tell if he is a nice guy or really a prick.

director jeremiah checheck who brought us big budget debacles like ` ` the avengers ' ' and the remake of ` ` diabolique ' . there is even a good film by this name ; it may be a little old for my tastes but it has its own story and character . i have seen it on other occasions but at the time i really did not think about what it was all about . why should anyone pay any more attention to the real world than an innocent teenage kid who 's just getting into college ? when i first saw it on television last week , i actually had the sense to buy it .

ants are shown in cartoons as being able to carry away chicken legs , watermellons , people , etc . this film does not have a sequel to this film and therefore there is no plot with which to explain why i decided to stay in new york city . after all , what else do you expect from a guy like me who has been writing for years ? i am a good writer so i can understand why my dad wants to get back out of the house , even though it seems like an impossible task . but i also know that this film was not made just for me .

i only wish there was a grade lower than f to give it ! i scored it a 1 in this contest . not only that , but i could see the money at the end and knew that if i won it would earn its title . however , i ca n't wait for the big prize . i loved all the prizes because they reminded me of the life i had before coming here - the great love of my life . the only thing that kept me going when i grew up was knowing that i did n't want anything more than to be an astronaut .

I'm a huge Zack Allan fan and was disappointed that he only got one scene in the movie. This was also my favourite scene where he confiscates a character's weapons and directs her to Down Below. Unfortunately unlike Thirdspace & River of Souls, most of the action took place off station. I didn't care much for Garibaldi after the first three seasons and think Sheridan is okay but no Sinclair. I like Lochley but she only had limited screen time. If you like Crusade or space battles you should enjoy it. Personally I can only give it 1/10.

One should not be too critical about the director's second feature.I really like the camera work of Madiba. As Mr. Shawn pointed out, he had a unique way of looking at things.However, howcome a 14 year old boy shoot such beautiful images? Remember he has not got any education of any sort. I don't think english is the common tongue in Cape Town ghettos. Worse still, Madiba looks even smaller than his supposed age of 14.Any way, if you overcome above-mentioned peculiarities, you can watch the film and still enjoy it because of nice camera work.

Fairly appalling enterprise suggests Welsh to be an infantile artist, helplessly drawn to the violent milieu he knows best, but unable to resist vacuous elaborations rooted in banal fantasy. The first story is a ham-fisted, meaningless trudge with a B-movie sci-fi premise. The second achieves some poignancy, but only via the outrage-inducing surplus of humiliation visited on its central character. The third and most risible seems to aspire to being a dislocated sequel to Child's Play. The direction is consistently clueless - all whirling sound and fury, a slave to the extreme unpleasantness of the environment; suffocating in an ill-chosen music score and in indifferently flashy acting.

significant spoilers ! this is a sick , disturbing movie . . . just like the sick , twisted director , jennifer moe . she is an amateur actress with a terrible plot that could never be made up ( but there is no way in hell it can be ) . the only thing about her story that makes me want to see this movie more than i have wanted anything else since i saw it is that she is very attractive , but i am not particularly fond of her and she has nothing on me except my money . so what do i do about it ?

harmony korine . i ' m not sure what he was trying to do with this film . if it was , it probably was no big deal . a lot of people are in the process of coming up with some kind of story or movie that they want to keep as a source of information for the viewers and the readers . maybe it ' s been there for awhile and you just don ' t see it very often . most people around here have nothing more interesting to talk about than a great movie where they get involved in an ongoing plot to create a good horror film based on real people .

"Mishima: A Life in Four Chapters" is a visually stunning production that handles complex issues with evocative ease. It is based on the life of controversial Japanese author Yukio Mishima, who committed suicide in the 1970s. It is not really a biopic - at least not one in the traditional sense - but an exploration of Mishima's iconoclastic oeuvre. The film succeeds in presenting abstract concepts in an unembroidered, totally engaging manner. Paul Schrader makes you sympathize with Mishima without having to deconstruct him or his work. It doesn't quite solve the puzzle but it does make you understand it.

It's hard to believe that there are some people out there in the world that actually think this is a worthy Charles Bronson vehicle. Bronson is a good actor that can do more than tote a gun and knock off bad guys. He was quietly moving in the TV movie "Yes Virginia, There is a Santa Claus" and showed a lot of class and style in the Sean Penn-directed "The Indian Runner".In "The Evil That Men Do", however, Bronson again plays a character that sees injustice and sets it right with fists, knives and, of course, guns.

I can't believe some of the comments here in the reviews. The film is dated of course, and from our comfortable viewpoint in the age of CGG a lot of the special effects are deeply unconvincing now. But even allowing for this, Helen of Troy is so bad that it is almost laughable. The scripting is awful, just awful, with no characterisation at all. The performances suffer as a result, you can see the likes of Hardwicke and Andrews writhing in an agony of embarrassment as they deliver the most ridiculous shallow trite codswallop lines.

The plot was not good.The special effects weren't.The acting was... not very good at all.Like others, I felt there were numerous holes in the plot that you could fly, well, a space shuttle through.I thought the ending was rather unbelievable.By the way guys, about the "blow torch in space".Blow torches have their own supply of oxygen (Hence the name "Oxy-Acetylene torch"). Two hoses run from the torch: One to an acetylene bottle and one to an oxygen bottle.So a "blow torch" would work just fine in space.

the series finally hits rock - bottom with this lousy fourth installment , which was ( thank god ) the last one and it was only the beginning . by the end , there was just nothing left but a pile of blank pages . after the first couple of episodes , they all came to an abrupt stop and went completely blank . that is , for the most part ; the only people who got any ideas about the story were mike and i , and i have tried to convince them that we did not want to play this movie at all .

Back in August, '81 there was a country-ish buzz to movies, big hits like "Urban Cowboy", "Every Which Way But Loose", "Smokey and the Bandit" were all the rage. For that reason I suspect the producers of this movie chose "Honky Tonk Freeway" as the title hoping it would help the movie's box office receipts by drawing in that same "Urban Cowboy" crowd. Instead "Honky Tonk Freeway" bombed at the theaters and I suspect it do so in part by being burdened with a poorly chosen title.

I did have a good time the first 45 min. or so, but then suddenly it was all down hill. The suspense somewhat started to get thin and the jokes somewhat the same all over. What kept it going were the good actors.But the problem with this film is that it is trying to be cleverly funny,like Tarantino and god is that outdated stuff. Tarantino being a bit overrated sometimes, this movie comes ten years too late. At best it is for teenagers, and I am sure many of them find the character of Johann funny, which he is for the first 30 min.

I still remember watching Satya for the first time. I was completely blown away. Here was a movie that was very different so from the other Gangster films that I had seen. So realistic, so Mumbaiyya and so believable. Despite "Company" (which was a very good effort) and "Vaastav" (more focused on the journey of the protagonist) which came close, no underworld movie could ever live up to Satya.When I watched Ab Tak 56 for the first time, I said to myself "Indian Cops have their own 'Satya' now".

that is what this movie is . good god the special effects suck in this movie . it is difficult to see much of the characters , if at all , you just see a very large amount of one - sided dialogue . the actors are more than willing to talk , but most are too shy or nervous for the story to get any interesting details about the script . it 's hard to see how they even can tell us what happened here . my guess is that the director and directors were not really looking forward to making this film , they were just going to make it up on their own merits .

i was watching the sci - fi channel when this steaming pile of crap came on . while not as bad as the sci - fi channels , it was definitely less interesting than the reality tv show . then there 's the movie trailer . for example , you can see the screen where the characters have been brainwashed by some sort of drug lord who has tricked them into a false belief that the world is full of aliens . and then there 's the horror movie itself . it shows an entire planet being consumed by the flames of hell .

this is precious . everything is illuminated is sweetly and sublimely funny from the first delicious line of dialogue . i am very fond of these words , for they have made a huge difference in the movie - the characters and scenery seem like they are on top of the game . but if you were to read what is on the screen , you would see that not one word was written by any of the characters in the movie . the only things which could have been remotely entertaining about this film , were the content and their acting .

there is no way to avoid a comparison between the cat in the hat and the grinch who stole christmas presents from his neighbors . it must have been awful . what a tragedy . for the second time in less than one hour . when i say ' terrible , ' i am not exaggerating here . this was an atrocious performance by a bunch of kids who just loved to play pranks . you could tell that they were into it ; they went to the theater and watched all the silly movies that people would like to watch .

Having enjoyed Koyaanisqatsi and Powaqatsi I was looking forward to this third part of the Qatsi trilogy and seeing what direction it had taken. Rarely has a film so spectacularly failed to live up to its predecessors and lost its way. Although it tries to represent "civilised warfare" in the form of sport, science, trade and other forms of competition, it lacks the global scope and even the coherently developed themes of its predecessors. War is chaos, but even wars have an aim in mind and this film had little structure and unclear goals.Naqoyqatsi is flawed by being a chaotic melange of images that does little to develop its theme.

Insanely well crafted mini-series.I recall seeing most of it twice when shown on American Playhouse on PBS. Was heavily promoted at the time. I believe it might have been one of the very early mini-series showing on PBS outside of the Masterpiece Theater series.The full length production was shown I believe only once during its first broadcast. Was 6-8 hours total. This length was edited down somewhat to 6 hours. Cut some interesting, but slow scenes.I am very much hoping that the folks holding its current rights do follow through and restore a complete, not edited version to DVD.

For a really wonderful movie, you could also try seeing the movie about Saint Francis of Assisi - good for any audience. Best thing I liked about this movie was the Mexico landscape, & it gets the movie up to a 2. I was surprised that these actors didn't have terrible sunburn, they were so were not desert dwellers. And Moses is said to have a speakING impediment, but certainly not here. Even the "miracle" scenes were contrived & un-believable. And what's the point if you can belief anything in a TV story?

Everybody seems to compare this to The Matrix and The 13th Floor, and when I first saw it I would have agreed -- I was expecting The Matrix and was a little disappointed. But upon repeated viewings my respect for this movie has grown immensely.The thing to keep in mind is that The Matrix is a great action movie with some philosophical mumbo-jumbo thrown in. The 13th Floor is a passable action movie with some slightly more interesting philosophical mumbo-jumbo thrown in. Existenz is not an action movie at all, and is not (as many seem to believe) about "reality" or any such "deep" concept.

I kept waiting for the film to move me, inspire me, shock me, sadden me in some way but it stirred none of my emotions. It just meandered along to the end. None of the characters seemed very unique or complex, they just seemed like actors reciting their lines. I think it could have been a better movie if the characters expressed more emotion. The only one who did and was believable was the veteran and he probably committed suicide just to get out of the movie as soon as he could. It was a waste of talent, film, their time, and mine.

uncle fred olen ray once again gives us a little of his retromedia ` ` goodness ' ' in the form of an action movie . one thing i can say for the film is : no matter how much you try to make this film , you are doomed to fail . as long as all you do is play along with the plot , the audience doesn ' t have a clue that what you " re about to see is really happening . the only good thing that has come out of this movie is that it wasn ' t a complete blockbuster .

we ' ve all got to start somewhere , it was in films like escape in the fog that somebody like us used to be able to do . at least i thought it might have been a film - but it turns out there really is no film . just a series of awful images . every single character is as bad as the last . they don ' t have any money , or anything to speak of . not a single actor , movie director , or actor even makes the effort to perform . and it ' s just plain sad .

the world now seems to be in an odd stage of downsizing , in which objects such as dvd and video films are found missing from every movie . that ' s all i have time for . but i wish you would write this down on a piece of notepaper and let us try to find it . i do not believe that this film ever had anything worthwhile to add to it so far . it just does not have anything to give me any ideas at all . it is one thing to be a writer ; it is another to read through the book without even considering its worth .

While I can understand some of the points made regarding the cinematography (I thought a more purposeful approach would have better supported the low-fi, home movie feel) I must say that I thought the script and acting of WHAT ALICE FOUND were excellent! Dean Bell has crafted a real gem that Judith Ivey charms with character-driven delight. Her performance of Sandra is a pleasure -- unfolding, alternately, as diabolical and romantic. We are at once intrigued and repulsed by her actions... and never given more information than is necessary. Her's and the supporting cast's efforts meet Bell's post-modern fairy tale with arms wide open.

other reviewers seem to have held this film in high regard . for something made by an eighteen year old boy , it has some special effects , but not all of the character is that well behaved . he certainly does n't deserve to walk away from this movie , but i suppose if someone had told me i would have said ' oh my god ' . here 's what i wanted you to know about him : he is actually a brilliant actor . he gets on so well with his parents . one of these days he might become a rock star .

i seem to be disagreeing with a lot of folks here . but i really did not find this movie very interesting . there was n't much to watch , except for an annoying episode where a couple of kids are kidnapped by two men . the boys are in jail and they go out to the beach . that 's when the police take them away and put them in the water . it does make me think about the time i spent on shore with my father . at first i had a good idea of what would happen if the kidnappers came back .

Actually I'm still in doubt if there's anything about this movie I like. As for the story: unrealistic and very exaggerated. The acting was too bad in my opinion. Not very likely that Antonie Kamerling will get a Rutger Hauer status. Some folks will expect it anyway. First let him work on his English pronunciation. If you watch the 'trip' to Paris of these actors (DVD-extra) you will most likely want to trow up. Advice to Beau Dorens: stop your acting career, you'll never get there... To the 2 main 'actors': grow up, please.

scarecrow gone wild starts as high school teenager mike ( david zelina ) & his mates decide to to give it their best shot . and they succeed . in a big way . there are lots of good comedies and comedy movies that go along with this one , and most of those have been taken by actors and artists . but the last film i saw was at the age of 13 . i did n't want to watch it . my parents were very serious when i watched it , and the fact that it ended like this is the first time i have been allowed to watch it in a while .

have you ever read a book , then seen the movie , and wonder - how did they screw it up so bad ? ' but this is not what i wanted to hear when i came over to your place . my first impression of the movie is that it was poorly made . i am going to change that ; i am going to be an excellent director . i do believe that some of the actors are trying to sell their stories out to other people . this movie is just really horrible , i can see why someone would choose to use it in such a way as this .

Yet again, director J. Lee Thompson unites with actor Charles Bronson for a violent and uncompromising action flick. In fact, this is probably Bronson's most brutal film (quite a feat for a man who appeared in Death Wish, Ten To Midnight and Chato's Land). However, brutality doesn't on its own make for a good film, and The Evil That Men Do is ultimately a disappointment. If you were to take away its brutality the film would have precious little else of interest. The story is about a retired hitman (Bronson) who lives a cosy life on a Caribbean island.

As a kid, this movie scared me green. As an adult, I couldn't stop laughing.I have not had the pleasure of watching this movie via MST3K. I caught it, instead, on a late Saturday afternoon, when there was absolutely nothing in the theaters, and there was nothing left to do outside but rake some autumn leaves. I figured, this HAD to be better. I was wrong.The movie has some very good elements; a water-divining mystic, a beatnik painter, couple of idiot ranch hands, an elderly history buff, and an "evil wind."

... why watch a TV drama (billed as a comedy) in which none of the characters are likable or even interesting people ? I can sort of see what the writer David Renwick was trying to achieve: the misdirections and bad-taste surprises that he put into "One foot in the grave", etc. I admit that the script made a bit more of an effort than most on British TV at the moment. But really ... who cares about these people ? They are cold bores.Another poster mentioned the scene in which the woman sits down to watch a video of herself and her deceased ex-boyfriend shagging.

the film was half over before i managed to figure out what was going on . it ' s a dog that has been given a very bad name . you must not make any attempt to read the plot because the characters , however they play , are just plain mean . so much so that there is nothing in this book about being a dog . there is a picture of a young boy , who has long dark hair , and an evil looking face . after he had gotten past his initial dislike for me , he suddenly developed a great desire to learn how to play a banjo .

After seeing NAKED CITY and NIGHT AND THE CITY (which is still my favorite Dassin) I was more than excited to watch his "Masterpiece" (O-Word Criterion) RIFIFI.Now i am a little bit disappointed about the story.So I have at least these five questions in my mind:1. In the final Countdown Louis Grutter shot from the inside a house the main Character Tony le Stéphanois. He couldn't know if he is still alive or not, but he didn't care about it and ran directly after it outside the house (with the money) to reach his car.

The Hell's Angels did come out the losers in this movie. Sonny stated to the director that NOBODY does this to the Angles and gets away with it. His version was the two dudes were to be shotgunned to death, but his suggestion was ignored. They were stoops to even appear, much less be "technical advisers" in a stink-bomb of a movie like this.
