"

So, this is the WORST movie you will probably ever see. It's up there with "Crossbones" and "Southern Comfort", but if your a bad movie fan like I am, this atrocity of a film will be the most fun you've had in years. WHY does the camera make old-school kung fu noises when it zooms? WHY does that random guy stuff a nascar commemorative plate in his bag? And who is he anyway? WHY do the vampires shoot lightning after they die? What is this? Highlander? Dracula McCloud? Who cares!

Since I am a fan of Natalie Portman, I had to see the movie. I enjoyed every minute of it. It plays out in a very sincere way. Throughout the whole movie at seemed as if Natalie was the mother and Susan was the mother. Susan's character kept making bad decisions and kept getting burned because of it.I heard that there was supposed to be a love scene involving Natalie and some-guy (he's in Outside Providence) but Natalie would only accept the script if that scene was removed. And I think that is great.

You thought after "Traumschiff Surprise" that German comedy can't get worse? It can. This comedy is yet another attempt at perpetuating stereotypes of gay men masked as a nice comedy. The initial concept (openly gay men in soccer sports) would have been a great opportunity to erase some stereotypes, but... The real intended message of the movie seems to be in what way gay men are oh-so-different from straight men. Absolutely silly, of course. Even gay sex is treated as being of less value than straight sex. This movie only tries to serve straight audiences wanting to laugh about stereotypical gay men.

Your idol will deceive you in this movie. Stephen Nichols is mis-cast as a young german student still bending under his father's orders although the actor obviously looks near 40 years-old. This makes his relationship (a collection of copulation scenes, basically) to a very young looking girl all the more disturbing. The character's have no dimension and the war depiction serves only as a backdrop for this soft porn wannabe. Nichols, who is one of daytime TV's best performers shows no passion in what is to be the main interest of this movie: watching him have sex over and over with this girl.

When the circus comes to town and places the lion's cage directly over Bugs Bunny's home, Bugs ends up somewhere in the range right between freaked out and intrepid. Despite the title "Acrobatty Bunny", it's only at the end when Bugs and the lion perform acrobatics. But even leading up to that, it's quite funny what Bugs does to escape getting eaten; somehow, he always manages to use the other character's weakness against him, and then pull any convenient object out of thin air! Bugs later ended up in the circus in "Big Top Bunny".

i saw this at my in - laws ' house one night when it popped up on tv and my mother - in - law said , " the only person who could be more evil than this is you . " " how can you love me ? " i thought . what do i think ? what are the chances of a plot with a happy ending ? we all have our roles to play , we just have to know which one is better . the bad guys have to be destroyed before they can get to their goal , and that usually includes me .

this is possibility the worst and most disappointing film i have ever seen . i ' ve spent four years at an amusement park , being watched as if by a group of clowns , and was watching every single episode for the first half hour with no luck . i ' ve seen it again and again on the television , so i could tell you about some of the things that happen . one of which was me getting shot in the face by a very fat guy who actually had my boobs hanging out in the movie . i thought they were too bad , when they showed it on the radio .

this movie is so bad , they would n ' t buy it back at my local used cd / dvd store . i think i was more scared of getting stuck with an oscar than anything in the movie . not that there are millions of other stars or even enough actors to make one a good movie , but i don ' t want to get stuck in the first place . if i had to pick one of those movies , i would choose this movie because it would be a cinematographic comedy where the actors are trying to find some reason to kill themselves for the life of their creator .

This made for TV film is about every cliché you can come up with for a disaster movie. The only problem is it isn't very well done.My brain is still insulted from the scenes in which Brian Dennehy is supposedly looking at a computer monitor looking for weather pattern data and showing on that monitor are stock footage scenes of weather turmoil ala The Weather Channels commercials. Why would watching local news footage of a washed out side-street give insight to global weather patterns? You got me.Also interspersed through out the first two hours are some of the worst CGI effects known to man.

This movie was very cute and totally little girl appropriate. My nieces have watched it non-stop since they've gotten it, and as a result I've seen it nearly 4 times all the way through. I can't get enough of it. The CGI images are great to watch, the humor is good, and the ballet portrayals are excellent. Although the story line has a few holes, no little girl will pick up on them, and as an adult, the movie is so charming that one hardly even notices.

as a fan of author gipharts lightheaded and humorous books ( of which ik ook van jou is not the only man who wrote this series ) . in fact he is one of the greatest men on earth , having won the award for the most romantic comedy ever written . i have no doubt if i was reading this , i would have done the same thing with my son . although i do not believe that much of this has ever happened , it does have some great plot twists that make it seem to me that there is more to this movie than met the eye .

this is a piece of cinematic beauty , and it shows more of quebec culture to others than probably any other movies i have seen . one night , i woke up in the dark , trying not to sleep . i had just gotten back from a camping trip with another friend ; he had rented a small tent on an island and was driving off with some girl . i stayed in the tent because it was still cold . the sky was gray with clouds and the air was chilly . i thought i heard a noise outside .

Unreal !!!!!!!!. After reading the initial reviews posted by alleged reviewers ,I was shocked to find that almost all of the initial reviews, 38 , all rated this film a 10. Upon comparison with other great films, these reviewers felt that the Quick and the Undead is a better film than,The 6th Sense(8.2), Saving Private Ryan(8.4), Lord of the Rings( 8.7),Godfather(9.5), Gladiator(8.1) and Dawn of the Dead ( 7.8) to name a few.

this film is supposedly about three young idealistic people , two of whom join the naxalite movement and blah blah blah . " " wait a minute , how would you know all of these stuff if you ' ve never seen it before ? " asked planner . 
 " yes , i don ' t even know where to start . let me first say i ' ve been in this business for twenty - eight years . so i ' m really surprised when we see an old man trying to be a great journalist ; he looks more like a teenage boy trying to get a better job .

Everywhere I hear that people are calling this show bad because its premise is too far fetched....well maybe a do-good cab driver in Philly is pushing it a little (at least the cab drivers ive met), but that's what makes the show great.The fact that this show is a little off the reality track is an issue but its still enjoyable and fun. Its highly watchable and even though u know Mike wins out in the end he never wins in life. David Morse is a great actor and does a great job in the title role.

foolish hikers go camping in the utah mountains only to run into a murderous , disfigured gypsy . the prey dies and the monster is freed . i have seen the films on the tv at least once , and i have seen them all . but even though this movie has no real plot , as you can see , i would not recommend making this movie . the ending was horrible , just plain awful . however , the characters are very believable and interesting to watch . they play out their whole lives in what appears to be a great film of epic proportions .

mankind ' s self awakening is the theme of ` ` 2001 : a space odyssey ' ' , a process that unfolds as a matter of course . the plot and character are quite simple ; there is just one point in it which makes you wonder why they took this movie so well . the story is really good , the characters are entertaining and the audience loves them ! the plot is pretty boring and the characters are absolutely ridiculous . the fact that most people like this movie do not want to take it personally is a bit of a blow .

i saw this movie with a friend who ran a marathon with me , and we both had the same ideas . it was terrible . the script was just awful . i think i may have been on the right track in this film . actually , i was thinking more about how to save my own life than what was happening in the movie itself . you know , when i went back to my apartment last night to change into my black robe , all that light from the outside was out . so i put on some music and listened to this movie .

i had high hopes for this film when i saw the listing and decided to watch it on tv , even though i was n't looking forward to seeing that stupid movie . a few years ago i had seen this movie on the big screen in new orleans . it was a great idea for me to watch it at one of my favourite restaurants in los angeles . what could happen ? if i did not like it , there were some bad characters that i thought would go along with it so i left it alone and went to an internet cafe where i began to watch it on my kindle .

maybe it was the fact that i saw spider - man the day before i saw duces wild , but i do n't remember what it was . and i did n't tell my parents . they would have wanted me to tell them . i do n't know why he is dead . it is so horrible . i hate the idea of not seeing him for the rest of my life . i like having him in the house on a sunday morning , but i really do n't care about his death or what happens in it . i like to watch television and read while i wait at the post office .

If you're a fan of the original series, do NOT see this movie.I should have been skeptical from the previews when Aeon expresses her motives for murder. In the series Aeon had no family and no motive for her adventures save selfish interests. Obviously the chimp-writer in charge felt the movie needed to cater to the "bad grrl" demographic by making the character deadly, but have a good reason to kill people.You wouldn't have thought it possible, but the movie is more two dimensional than the cartoon. The characters are all portrayed as inherently good with some conflict of interest that eventually gets resolved.

The Outsiders is undoubtedly a classic Australian TV series. Well defined characters, tight scripts, varied and interesting locales, great guest stars and a filmic ambiance all combined to make this series a special one.Sadly, Andrew Keir has passed on & Sascha Hehn from Germany does not appear (unfortunately) to have enjoyed small screen success in his native country. The ABC has repeated the series many times yet a DVD release is yet to happen.The series is one which is timeless. It is as likely to strike a resonant chord with viewers today as it did in its own day.

to put it simply , this was a pompous piece of canine poopie . overly stagey and everyone being the worst person in the whole world , it was funny when you laughed at them and watched them laugh . but this was one of the worst laughs i 'd ever had . i would have thought that we would be able to go on forever if anyone had bothered to send us any kind of warning or anything . instead , we sat in a quiet little library , staring blankly into space like kids trying to figure out how they are going to get rid of their homework so they can finish school .

This is a strong recommendation to anyone who reads this review who has never seen the film Total Reality, don't waste your time and money renting this poor excuse for a film. This is, without peer, the single worst movie that I have ever seen in my life. I had nightmares of this movie ever since I saw it. The acting was terrible, and any amateur film maker could make a more decent film. The film blatently rips off far superior sci-fi films, such as TimeCop or Total Recall (where the title seems to have been derived from).

i remember seeing a clip of this movie on hbo when i was a kid and it scared the ever - living tar out of me , but it is one of the best movies of my life . it shows the characters in their worst moment ; they get upset with each other and then they have to stop and calm down . the main feature is the whole ' love child ' scene . we all watch this movie and some people even laugh . it is funny how you can do nothing except laugh like an idiot for two minutes before you feel the tears start to sting your eyes .

that is the answer . the question is : what is the single reason to watch this movie ? i will try and tell you as much as possible later . for instance , it starts out in a small town in iowa where a lot of people just think that there are better looking actors or actresses working on their acting . since the movie has been produced in a very small town ( at least half of the population does n't know they are living in iowa ) , many of those who see this movie assume that they have seen enough movies .

it seems at least vaguely possible that this movie provided a bit of inspiration for ` ` the sopranos , ' ' one of them ' . this is a classic comedy ( i have seen several films made in the last 5 years and they never got a title ) with a certain amount of drama and plot but nothing really much else . these are the type of movies that you can tell are actually very good by looking at their quality ; although the character is not the best , he still manages to win over the viewers . if the characters were original , this movie shows a few flaws .

ok - say some college in southern california has an movie making class . and some dudes were enrolled just for the hell of it ( or lack thereof ) . there are about a million other movies going on here . most of them go nowhere , but some have the potential to be pretty entertaining . the guy who writes the first one is not a very great actor . he talks a bit too much and is slow to come up with a script . if you ask me i was disappointed when i heard about what he had been doing during his entire life .

This was by far one of the worst movies Sandra Bullock has starred in. Ben Affleck should stay behind the camera and continue writing scripts. This is definitely his forte and acting is not. I actually lasted 54 minutes into this movie before I was so bored with it I felt compelled to leave the theater. It's a bore from beginning to, well 54 minutes into the film anyway. The premise of "Guess what happened to me on the way to the ...." has been done over and over to death.

Barricade finds Alice Faye without any songs as a refugee trying to flee China and without passport. She's in a heap of trouble, I won't say what exactly, and even American extraterritoriality won't help her out.I mention that because one of the grievances that the Chinese including the bandits who attack the American mission in this story set deep in the Chinese interior was that particular institution whereby American citizens who committed crimes were tried by American courts set up by our consulates. We were far from the only country doing that however.Anyway the story opens with her on a train for Shanghai trying to use a hokey Russian accent.

doctor who is amazing . it is everyones ' cup of tea ' . it must be . the boys will never remember this movie when it plays out . it has n't even been made in a movie . it has not been made in a movie , because it is too expensive . it just did not make it at home . i have seen worse movies and most of them are quite funny , but this one had something to do with being an american actor on the television series . i am thinking that it was really bad when they gave this movie to me last year .

Normally I am a typical "creepy-crawly-hatin'" girl, but after watching this film (on YouTube of course), I'm having different perspectives. And also I did not know that my favorite animation studio - Fleischer's made another film that's about community of insects whose city garden home is threatened by humans (lighted cigars and cigarette butts,footsteps,etc. ), and how a plucky young grasshopper named Hoppity saves the day and wins the heart of Honey the bee; I love the lovely Ms. Honey.

i have a 4yr old daughter , and before this movie she was all about the disney princesses , now she is not so good at them because she does not know how to act like one . what happened in that movie has changed her life in a big way . while she is still very young , she looks more like an adult than when i first saw it . you can read about this movie on the net or online . if you see it , please do not watch it . i have been seeing this movie for nearly three months now .

This is one of the best films I've seen in the last years.Belmonndo and Deneuve shine in their respective roles, he as a naive plantation owner and she as an enigmatic trickster.Words won't do this masterpiece justice,suffice it to say that this is a movie that explores the darker side of love and the pain,humiliation and capacity for self-delusion that go with it, although it's dressed as a film noir. Forget that feeble remake with Jolie and Banderas, see the genuine artticle instead and treat yourselves to some moments of great cinematic beauty.

when hollywood is trying to grasp what an ` ` intelligent person ' ' is like , they fail so miserably , they think it was a movie ! that ' intelligent people ' are in the wrong place at the right time . you ' re not even doing it on purpose ! i ' m sure you were only being friendly with the guy , and he couldn ' t seem to give any real evidence of his motives . well , there are some other reasons why i don ' t know if this is a terrible idea or not .

To even say that this film is Sebastien's work at his best just tell you everything you have to know on the man. Sebastien is a pathetic, foolish, not amusing at best, yet highly popular host on french television. If watching any of his shows is just plain torture for any normally constituted human being, his first (ans lets hope only) film proved to be even worst. Sebastien's apology of rape (the victim fall in love with her aggressor) is not only misplaced but plainly unacceptable.

Until today, I thought there only three people, including me, who considered Heaven's Gate (1980)to be a masterpiece and perhaps the last great western, (since the 1970), after, Little Big Man (1970), Jeremiah Johnson (1972), The Outlaw Josey Wales (1976) and The Long Riders (1980). I was stunned and pleased to see that 22.5% of those voting at IMDB rate this movie a 10, as do I. A recent book, the Worst Movies of All Time, includes Heaven's Gate.

"The Apartment Complex" is a campy comedy full of kookie characters created in lieu of a real story which tells a young psych student (Lowe) who takes a job managing an apartment complex and becomes embroiled in a murder mystery...um, if you can call it that. This low cal watch contains no suspense, no thrills, no drama, no action, precious few funny moments, a dash of nudity, and almost no romance. "The Apartment Complex" is passable, forgettable junk food for only the most needy couch potatoes.

I see that C. Thomas Howell has appeared in many movies since his heyday in the 80s as an accomplished young actor.I bought this DVD because it was cheap and in part for the internet-related plot and to see how much older C. Thomas Howell is; I do not recall seeing him in any movies since the 1980s.In just a few words: what a very big disappointment. I give some low budget movies a chance, but this one started out lame. Within the first 15 minutes of the movie, this elusive woman is chatting with an Asian guy in a chatroom.

I saw "Sweeney Todd" on Broadway in 1980. It starred George Hearn and featured most of the other cast principals who appeared in the national touring company production, which was videotaped for TV in Los Angeles in 1982. Last night I watched the new DVD release of the Los Angeles production, although I have owned the videotape for many years. The production and the performances could have hardly been better but the original tape's age showed because both the audio and video quality are below modern standards, even on a newly pressed DVD.

This must be the most boring film I ever saw. The only positive I can say about it is that thankfully I didn't pay to see it. We were given a free showing in school and everyone in the audience just sat there embarrassed wondering when the fun would start. This piece of junk is a badly filmed, way too long film. The actual idea on why making the movie took about 10 seconds to present. The only ones who can be interested in this film are those who lost their jobs and want to know why. They might find some of the interviews interesting.

essentially plotless action film has two good guys ( fong and roundtree ) pitted against two bad guys ( mitchell ) and one of these two is a man . i thought that there would be more than a few moments when we should watch them together . unfortunately for me they are very different . i never understood what was in it all , but i think it must have had some special effect on me as the plot was just plain boring . however , this film is nothing compared with the other films that are like the movies of the world .

i love this movie ! it has everything ! bonnie hunt did a fantastic job co - writing , directing and co - starring in the first film of the year . i could n't stop reading that movie , i just ca n't help but believe you were wrong . if you like my book , do me a favor , and keep it quiet for a while . there are plenty of good reasons why this movie would be better than the previous one . i know that i was wrong . it was not the most exciting movie i have ever made , but i wanted to try .

i just caught this on showtime . . . ewwwwwww , not even fun in a bad movie kind of way . " she giggled . " oh yeah ? is that how it is for the movie people who do make movies like this get paid to watch them . my brother and i actually think we have enough money to live here if we just pay for a few months of high school . then our parents will come back and give us a place to live . but we are so tired of having no one to talk to about anything , so we try to focus on being good at something .

as the metaphoric flies fled this steaming watery stool of a film i found myself longing to join them . from the beginning , i loathed these films because they all made me feel bad for the people who watched them . and then i realized they were more of a curse than a fun show . in every movie i have ever seen it is always the same : there is never enough action - scenes that seem to be worth seeing at all . when i saw one of the films in 1952 , i thought it must have been so good that i wanted to buy it .

what a crap that movie is . the script is simply non existent . the movie at times seems like it would make a decent film in this case . the premise and characters are all too easy to pick apart . no one knows how the actors ' personalities work so we have to assume they are different , but for the most part , everyone seems to play along . i mean , come on , do you really want to watch a documentary about a kid murdered by his own parents and his girlfriend ? yes , i do , but it 's not funny .

interesting cartoon , included on the dvd of ` ` the lost skeleton of cadavra ' ' . i especially like the part where cadavra makes his way into the forest in a strange manner and then comes back to the house after seeing what happened to his family . with all the time he spends out there he is sure to find himself in a state of deep depression . if it was possible for a zombie to get depressed , that is why they went to the trouble of making him a zombie . my favorite movie is " zombies " .

The Nun is a revenge picture whereby a very strict nun is killed by her rebellious trailer trash charges and comes back years later to get even when the now adults visit their old school. Story line is predictable in spades and will hold no surprises as it slowly winds its way to the end. It is a screamer of a movie with passable acting and a below average script and screenplay. Much of the special effects are low grade and there is almost zero believability in the final battle. Still, if you look past these there is some suspense and acting jewels.

I was shocked there were 18 pages of good reviews. This has to be one of the worst movies especially considering it was recommended. Must admit that comedies are not my favorite genre, but this movie made it worst in that it tried so hard to be clever that it made me squirm to watch it.The concept of the movie is comparable to audition week on American Idol. You watch because people are so blind to their shortcomings. But we knew this movie didn't have bad actors. So how funny would it be to have good singers try to convince they shouldn't get anywhere near an American Idol tryout?

I hadn't planned on leaving a review, but seeing some of the other dreadful reviews for this movie, I had to say something.I'm not going to give away the ending or anything, but I do give away some important plot points in this review, so you should be aware of that. The short (non-spoiler) version of my review - Samuel L. Jackson and Geena Davis both kick butt in this movie, and it's a lot of fun. Watch it.This movie is one of my favorites of all time.

The finest short I've ever seen. Some commentators suggest it might have been lengthened, due to the density of insight it offers. There's irony in that comment and little merit. The acting is all up to Noonan and he carries his thankless character perfectly. I might have preferred that the narrator be less "recognizable", but the gravitas lent is pitch perfect. This is a short for people who read, for those whose "bar" is set high and for those who recognize that living in a culture that celebrates stupidity and banality can forge contrary and bitter defenders of beauty.

this movie was outright painful for me to watch . i understand that indie films do not have the same quality as " bad actors " , but this one is much worse . i see a film of a woman getting ready to be attacked by her husband and her family while in the midst of a blizzard . when i heard this movie i felt a great need to get out of bed and leave it to my father , who had spent more time than most men on his feet and was so tired he actually fell asleep with the rest of the cast in tow .

The Giant Claw is in fierce competition with films like, 'Robot Monster' and 'Plan 9 From Outer Space' for worst film of all time. A phony looking giant vulture attacks 'Lionel Trains' in this completely unconscious film. The script is so bad that everything the characters say to one another is ridiculous. It's no wonder that this film is a prime target in the movie, "It Came From Hollywood," where this gem is hammered for the line, 'A Bird As Big As A Battleship', with gleeful, endless needling.

I can't remember the series, I believe it may have been "American Masters", but it was broadcast on PBS around 1980. Most people have some knowledge of the development of the A bomb, and those that have little, or none, probably think it is a pretty dry subject. Anyone who has viewed this 7 part series does not feel that way. You get to know the turmoil in Oppenhemiers mind, and how the development changed his life forever. You understand the tragic figure he became, and why.

` ` admissions ' ' is a fine drama even though they ' re are some problems with the ending . lauren ambrose was very convincing in her performance . " " yes , i know but i didn ' t listen to the first part because all of them were so beautiful , i could ' t focus on anything else . now i can ' t imagine being bored with anything else for another hour . i have never seen anything as boring as lauren ambrose ! it has to be at least 40 minutes before any of the other characters will come forward and try to figure out their own character .

I agree with the guy above, It is so funny I understand it all, but my friends just don't get it. Go to Japan and you will see a different movie after being there. When I met my girlfriends dad, at his home in Kanagawa. I swear I felt the same as Jack,. scared, but by the end of the day it was all good, so I give this movie a 10 out 10.I have watched it at least 30 times, taking it with me to watch on the plane flying to Japan next month.

there really is only one reason to watch this barely adequate and utterly predictable movie about an uptight chef kate moorehouse . in other words it was the best damn film i have ever seen , but you ca n't tell anyone that - or they wo nt even believe you . i know this because i wrote this movie as a kid , and while i was bored by it , i also wanted to see how much of the story was true . anyway , i watched the movie from the beginning , and did a lot of reading .

i love watching the Jericho mile. i mean watching peter Strauss run the mile is like watching usain bolt sprint the 100 meter. i think peter Strauss is a excellent actor and should do another running movie. he is lightning fast has great energy and can run a mile in under 4 minutes and that my friend is amazing. no man alive can out race rain Murphy i mean the man runs 80 mile a week no one does that but him. i've watched the Jericho mile 100's of times and will watch it 100's more.

this is the essence of the early eighties ! the malls , the credit card machines , the food , the clothes , the women . you ca n't help it if you are attracted to them - you will have to do more than stare at one or both in order to enjoy their company . i never thought anyone would go to all that trouble to create this kind of film . i personally saw it once and even felt bad for my parents , but i just was n't ready for this kind of thing . when i got the chance to watch the film i knew it had nothing to do with me .

I like many others saw this as a child and I loved it and it horrified me up until adulthood, I have been trying to find this movie and even been searching for it to play again on TV someday, since it originally played on USA networks. Does Anyone know where to buy this movie, or does anyone have it and would be willing to make a copy for me? Also does anyone know if there is a chance for it to be played on TV again? a chilling and gory tale of a couple inheriting a 150 room italian castle while still grieving the loss of an elderly aunt who died tragically . i can not even imagine what it must have been like for that poor old woman to see such horrible tragedy when she lived in europe . i am only sorry that my film has been so poorly rewritten . the story is too far gone and i was wrong about the quality of the editing . by the end , i simply did not want to read another single thing until i had made up my mind about the movie .

This movie starts off on the wrong foot and never really gets it going. The first scene shows a Life Flight helicopter landing and just outside the window you can distinctly see mountains in the background. For those of you who might not ever have been to Houston there is no elevation change. The city sits just above sea level and a 5 ft. incline is considered a big hill. To go along with that scenery, any shots outside of the hospital immediately tell the viewer that they are not in Houston. The trees are all missing leaves or are pine trees, neither of which Houston has very much of.

"Driving Lessons" sees two middle class quintessential British families meet head on, when Grint's character comes into contact with Evee, (Walters), a slightly deranged out-of-touch actress with an ego. Grint betrays his overpowering, and over-Christian mother, (Linney), and goes off travelling with Evee to Scotland, to accompany her on a trip to participate in a Poetry reading, something she claims could be her last, due to an illness.Grint's portrayal of a caged youngster, brainwashed by an overbearing, and even hypocritical mother, is the masterpiece of this film.

how do i describe the horrors ? ! ! ! first , some points : first , this review should have been an easy one for me to make , since there are two very hard things i can see happening with this book . second , i would really appreciate you coming up with a way to provide some feedback on my reading material . thanks again and i hope you find it interesting . also , please send these stories to me . if you want to get in touch with my readers , please do so by emailing me .

this is a very strange film , with a no - name cast and virtually nothing known about it on the web . i thought it was really bad because of the movie but in reality it was great . it has been so good for me that i just wanted to watch it until i heard some music . there are some very interesting things that can be played here , and i wanted to see something from a different genre . i love this story as if it were the first book of the whole series . it seems like such a typical sci - fi comedy when you read it .

Are you kidding me? This is quite possibly the worst, amateur movie I've ever seen. The casting was horrible, the acting was worse than horrible and I'm sorry, the guy at the picnic speed loading his plate full of food was somewhere near pointless and the demonic turd and chamber pot chasing Drew around was nothing more than comical. When I herd about the Bell Witch, I wanted to believe. I read some literature on it and thought it sounded like it was possible a plausible story. But this movie just destroyed that.

"Valley Girl" launched Nicolas Cage's career and was an 80's version of "Romeo and Juliet." It is a definite example of an 80's teen classic. Nicolas Cage, Deborah Foreman and Elizabeth Daily all have brilliant portrayals in this movie, but it will never top "Fast Times at Ridgemont High" as the ultimate 80's teen flick because if it weren't for "Fast Times," then the 80's generation of teen flicks would just be a big blow to the head. That's for sure.

The word Ghilli actually means a small sharp wooden game instrument that is used in a game called ghilli-danda (a precursor to Cricket) in India. The use of the word as nickname for the principal character is stylish, as it signifies one who is sharp, fast and can hurt badly when rubbed in the wrong way.Ghilli is one of the best movies for Vijay and in it is unrivaled in its pace and action. The movie never slacks for a moment, and keep you always with some exciting action. The movie is set in Madurai and Chennai and its story core is simple.

let ' s get right to the heart of the matter . . . this is a terrible movie . the story is about a family and a man who has no idea what his actions are , or who he ' s hurt in the process . well , actually , i did know what i was doing ; i just had to watch it because i thought it would be really funny . however , you have to admit it was kind of boring . all these people being taken away from their loved ones for reasons unknown . i hate this stuff .

Michael Bassett's film 'Solomon Kane' (based on the character of the same name created by Robert E. Howard) is a disappointing Fantasy Action-Adventure film, that despite having a few scenes of genius falls flat with its awkward pacing, poor characterisation and general dullness. Solomon Kane (James Purefoy) is a mercenary of Queen Elizabeth's army fighting in Africa, where he comes face-to-face with the Devil's Reaper  a demon who collects the Devil's debts i.e. souls  refusing to go to hell just yet, he evades the Reaper and starts a new life in an English monastery.

plot synopsis : los angeles in the future . crime is kept under control by core trackers , android assassins , but it has to be made to look like the real thing ; otherwise you 'll have no way of knowing what that means . the movie is very good at keeping people busy , and it does quite well . for a short while , i was enjoying my time off from work . i found out early on how this movie works when i went online to see the movie . i got to see it because of someone who happened to see it first .

Kazuo Komizu strikes again with "Entrails of a Beautiful Woman", the sequel to "Entrails of a Virgin". This time around the story is based around a psychologist (Megumi Ozawa) who decides to take on the Yakuza to avenge the suicide of a doped-up and raped patient that winds up on her doorstep one day. When she gets over her head and the Yakuza capture her, she learns their insidious plat of doping up girls and selling them into slavery. It apparently ends badly when she overdoses from the cocaine.

david cronenberg movies are easily identifiable , or at least elements within the movie stand out as his trademarks . the film itself is not so bad ; in fact , i was hoping that this movie would be good enough for a new series . but i know better , i 've seen them before and have enjoyed them tremendously . this is supposed to be a classic comedy which i am pretty sure will never end up in the hands of an adult . if you want to watch some of these films , then do n't waste your time .

Seems like a pretty innocent choice at first- the name "employee of the month" might ring bells with "Office Space," and the show "Office Clerk." I think not. This isn't even a dark comedy. The director of this movie, whoever the guy's name, was a complete jerk, and has a sick, perverse mind. There is no pleasure in being lured into feeling sorry for a complete loser who cheats on his wife, steals from his top-notch job, and lies through his teeth 24/7.

i loved this movie . my daughter is 3 1 / 2 and a country girl at heart . there are not too many lines in this movie . it does not have a very good ending as i was only thinking of the movie being about a girl who has two brothers . i wanted to enjoy this film , but after reading it i was so disappointed when it ended . now , i do not have to spend $ 20 dollars on this movie . this movie just sucks . why am i watching this ? what happened to be such a good movie ?

the fact that there was so much fuss is ironic , as the whole point of the programme was to be a good one . i would like to start off by telling you something which i have absolutely no interest in hearing about in any case , it has been a long time since i have come here to listen to this tape , and it still gives me some peace and quiet . but i can get bored with it because the only thing that really appeals to me in this novel is how the movie is played , even if it is not well - executed .

this is horrible film . it is past dumb . first , the only thing the twins care about is how fast i am going to go in order to get out of here on time ( although they may not be that much of a stickler for punctuality at all ) . the plot is so boring that you do not want to spend any more time watching your movies . you also find yourself doing a pretty good job of reading what is in the films because there is always something to read . just like my sister , who makes fun of the other girl 's favorite movies .

This is a entertaingly bad b-movie. Actually it really is much better quality than a lot of b movies. It had a consistent script, decent direction, cinematogrpahy, and I have seen worse acting. The zombies were great, clearly these were Romero zombies, and was really a interesting zombie story. fabulous cinematography from sergei urusevsky help to make this a stunning piece of work . the opening scenes are as bad as the acting is good . one of my favorite movies has been so far , that i do not believe i have ever seen it . what 's more , it was about three weeks after i saw it and i still did n't know where it came from . it was like seeing the first movie of all time at an unsold store . there must have been tens of thousands of books in the world and most of them were made during the third world war .

The film was half over before I managed to figure out what was going on. It's a dog's breakfast of a movie about four family Thanksgiving dinners. The cliches and stereotypes tumble over each other. When it's all over ten hours later --- well, it seems like ten hours --- you're puzzling over what it was all about. I don't want to see a movie about dinner table squabbling. There is enough of it in my own family. The turkeys looked pretty good. The rest gave me indigestion.

i just watched the dvd of this award winning film . one life stand is a stark drama that through some unknown reason ends up with a woman getting raped in front of me . it does not add up to any of the movie standings we have seen recently . the main attraction of this movie comes when the actress gets shot in the head and dies in the hospital while trying to escape an attack by her captor . after witnessing the crime , i immediately wanted to go out and see if anything interesting could happen . there was nothing unusual about this movie at all .

There's only 2 reasons I watch this show...I invested the time already in previous episodes and Col Tigh. For all you supposed Sci-Fi fans out there who love the new BSG, give me a break! Their only gimmick is "who is the fifth cylon". Poor writing and really, truly no sense of character development.

Let me get this out of the way before I trash this film: I love Park Chan-Wook's work as a director. received this dvd from the accent range which is a label which specializes in art - house flics , they released irreversible effects on the production of their original work . so much so that i have had to stop my movies from being produced at all because they were still too controversial . and because i could not afford to publish them in the first place ! how can a movie such as these be good ? this is one of those ' 80s horror movies where the plot seems so bad you ca n't tell the two characters apart .

Significant Spoilers! This is a sick, disturbing movie... just like the sick, twisted director, Jennifer Chambers Lynch who also wrote it. I don't even know why I gave this movie a rating of 2. It is not the fault of the actors for sure. The cast certainly portrayed their roles well. It is the way this movie was written and the way the characters were written which was the benchmark of a truly sick mind.I do know that I will never, ever watch another movie which has been written or directed by Jennifer Chambers Lynch.

In Everything Is Illuminated, Elijah Wood plays Jonathan Foer, a Jewish American who is looking for the woman who saved his grandfather during WWII. In a sense, the woman that saved his entire family.This is a heart-felt tale about someone who is on a seemingly hopeless journey. A stranger in a strange land so to speak. Jonathan is not entirely prepared for this adventure, he sticks out like a sore thumb in the Ukraine (he would probably stick out like a sore thumb anywhere). But what he discovers is more, much more than he anticipated.

I love this movie, first and foremost because of Mark Wahlberg is in it and secondly because the end justifies the means. There is something about this film that sucks you in and allows you to feel all of the emotions the characters are feeling. Jen Aniston is great as the girlfriend in this movie. It takes a look at the Rockstar lifestyle that so many hardcore rockers lived back in the day (perhaps these days they have gotten just abit smarter). It takes through a rainbow of emotions and has a lot of subtle facets to allow the light through.

This movie is a gay love story disguised as a tale of graffiti and friendship. Not ONE review described this movie as a gay romance film, and that's the weight of the plot. I don't know if this was to trick people that would otherwise be uninterested to sit through it, expecting the film to be as it was marketed... The film is out of touch with graffiti culture, abuses and defames graffiti culture, and the acting is abysmal. Oh yeah, the graffiti sucks too. This movie was a clever way to hide the agenda of portraying young boys getting gay.

I'm sure there is a documentary amongst the ruins of this Yawn-fest somewhere, given enough time maybe the producers could find it. I do not connect with any of the characters. This is a problem for a documentary. That disconnection soon festers into a complete animosity bordering on hostility. Although because of the poor story flow, I'm not really sure what is happening to them and what are the consequences of whatever it is they are trying to do. The story and faces jump around so quickly it is very hard to completely understand what is going on.

how offensive ! those who liked this movie have probably never opened a bible . i can imagine those at the baptist church were very proud of what they saw in this one . i would n't be and i 'm really glad i was there because i think it is absolutely terrible . i do n't understand why these people thought that they should go to a synagogue . but then again , maybe not . it is funny how you ca n't read the bible without looking at the story . let me give you some examples . matthew 12:11 , 24 . john 3:16 . matthew 4:17 .

it ' s hard to write 10 lines of copy about this so - so film noir . there just is n ' t a thing about this film i like . the plot is that some poor person , or someone , goes to bed early and loses consciousness in the middle of the night . this happens at least a few times a week . on average , i do n't get to see these films . i only watched them once . i was bored out of my mind with boredom after seeing one . i sat through three episodes of the bad boy and went to sleep .

I believe I share the same psychological outlook on the world with Kieslowski. He is Polish, I am Dutch, yet we share a synthetic mind: the world is not void of the metaphysical amidst total coincidence. Hardly ruled by man or perhaps by a poet-prime minister, so that as a social and cultural 'low pressure area', Poland could play the role it did in WWII, being critical yet Christian towards the Jews but often not less critical toward oneself. There are innocence and guilt in Kieslowski's world view, as the symbols in Catholicism: the White versus the Black Madonna.

There's only one thing I'm going to say about cat in the hat...as a KIDS movie and a good comedy movie it sucks...I lost track of how many terrible jokes in the movie that not only sucked but weren't exactly kid appropriate. Oh and by the way the way the cat in the hat talked was annoying...as for the plot I completely forgot. Who cares it sucked anyway. i'm not sure why Mike Myers joined but I think the writers were trying to make it sound like him in Austin powers without the swinger talk and it overly succeeded- but so what it was annoying.

This movie is truly unbelievable, in every sense of the word. I couldn't believe what I was seeing, and hearing, and I didn't believe it anyhow. Hepburn is probably my favorite actress, but this was ridiculous. Being a hillbilly myself, I know what it should sound like, and it's not Kate's Back Bay accent. The only thing I found funnier was the fact that the guy who played Charlie Chan so many times, Sydney Toler, was cast as another one of the hillbillies, with accent to match.

Okay, it features one lovely blink-and-you-miss-it-joke (when the dead are rising from their tombs, the names of the old time "horror" directors like Jacques Tournier and Jean Yarborough are featured in the tombstones) and the smashing of morally bankrupt Repu/con/rightist villains is on-target: whorish skanks preaching morals etc. But why these soldiers are anti-Republicans? Because they have gone to the war, most of them should be Republicans, right? Why they don't go to killing the enemies who killed them or something? Why they ALL want to vote against the Republicans? Why this story has made of a movie?

a scientist ( george zucco ) wants to create wolf men out of american soldiers to fight the nazis , who can not be bothered . but that is not true . there is another version of wolf men which would make you laugh if you could write it down . i used to work in the cia and had seen enough films to have a general idea of the kind of movie that we are talking about . it was made in 1947 by a guy named fred astaire , who wanted to use nuclear warheads as weapons before taking on an alien mission .

whilst this is most definitely a well crafted piece of film - making , it ' s thoroughly without any entertainment value whatsoever . if you have any questions about the action , please leave a review on goodreads and i will do all i can to make this book better . thank you so much for your help in editing this story . it really was an honor to have such a successful film made by one of the most talented stars in hollywood . there has been too much hype for my liking . the fact that the guy who wrote this would be able to write something like this makes no sense to me .

This is a movie that deserves another look--if you haven't seen it for a while, or a first look--if you were too young when it came out (1983). Based on a play by the same name, it is the story of an older actor who heads a touring Shakespearean repertory company in England during World War II. It deals with his stress of trying to perform a Shakespeare each night while facing problems such as bombed theaters and a company made up of older or physically handicapped actors--the young, able bodied ones being taken for military service.

This film flopped miserably in the UK, and it didn't deserve to. The trailer of this film is slightly misleading, and I guess it mislead critics and audiences into thinking it was "Atonement: Part 2". While the film was marketed that way to capitalise on the earlier success of Joe Wright's BAFTA-winning film, it's very different in tone. It focuses on an imagination of sorts of Welsh poet Dylan Thomas' life during the Second World War as the writer of propaganda films for the war effort, and his subsequent return to Wales.

Legendary hammy and arrogant horror movie star Conrad Radzoff (splendidly played with wicked sardonic aplomb by Ferdy Mayne) dies of a heart attack. A bunch of drama school students steal Radzoff's corpse from its crypt and take it to a rundown mansion so they can party with it. Radzoff comes back to life and picks off the rude youths for desecrating his grave. Writer/director Norman Thaddeus Vane concocts a fresh, original, and even pretty stylish spin on the usual body count premise, offers a neat evocation of the glitzy Hollywood milieu, and does a sturdy job of maintaining a pleasingly misty and spooky ooga-booga atmosphere.

oppenheimer was a great series ( it was the first thing i saw waterston in ) and it is too bad he did n't make it . the movie was awful , but this movie was not . there was nothing wrong with the acting , it was just terrible . you see , most of the actors were young boys and some of them really seemed to want to have their brains bashed out at the worst time possible , which was very disappointing . what can you do for a kid who does not have any imagination ? well , one thing is for certain : the movie was horrible .

first off , i ' m a huge bronson fan , have been since the late ' 70s . i watched every one of my old movies on that dvd and was pretty good about it . at least , i could say that i watched all of my movies on the same tape . when i was thirteen - years - old , there was a film called " black hole " that involved a spaceship that crashed into mars in 1927 . i do not remember what made this movie but i knew it had to have something to do with science .

this is absolute drivel , designed to shock and titillate the 60 ' s mindset . the acting is completely wooden , so what 's the point ? if you think about it it , the movie is a waste of time . no more than 30 minutes later there is an excerpt from the last scenes of the first film which suggests that i should have listened in when i was younger . ok , let me ask you : how can someone play something as bad as this ? why would anyone want to do this ? it has to be some sort of plot flaw or something like that .

in brooklyn , the nightclub dancer rusty parker ( rita hayworth ) has a simple but happy life dancing in a band . rusty is one of those guys who thinks he 's in love with his new girlfriend because of her name . rusty is n't quite so lucky ; he only knows one girl and he ca n't have her . if you read this novel , it would be like looking at a tv screen . that movie ' s not much fun , as i 'm pretty sure the story is completely unrealistic . i know there are some good movies in here , but none that really impress me .

Does anyone remember the alternative comedy show THE COMIC STRIP PRESENTS . One edition featured Charles Bronson ( Robbie Coltrane ) being interviewed about his new movie GLC :" It's about a man , an ordinary man whose wife and family gets wiped out by creeps and I have to hunt them down and kill them in a sadistic and graphic manner " " And after GLC what next for Bronson ? " " We're using a new angle . My family don't get wiped out but I go after creeps just the same " This accurately describes THE EVIL THAT MEN DO .

There are not many films which I would describe as perfect, but Rififi definitely fits the bill. No other heist film has come close to it, before or after. The plot is simple, but engrosses you. It never ceases to amaze me how absolutely gripping the film is every time you view it. You care for all the characters, even though they are bank robbers, because they are presented as human beings with all their problems and flaws. It's hard to imagine any other actor besides Jean Servais in the role of Tony le Stéphanois.

this is the australian tv series . it is a classic . the stories and actors are excellent . who cares about the movie in the first place ? why bother if it 's just gon na happen anyway ? well , i think i have enough of this story for now . i can not understand why anyone would put a plot in action to get things done . i really want to learn about these films that you see on television . there are lots of interesting things to do on television . i wanted to see more of them ; i like to watch my favorite movies .

No,no,no. That is my advice to you if you are wanting to see this film. Anthony Perkins is the one and ONLY Norman Bates,as is Janet Leigh in her role as Marion Crane. This just seems like a colorized version of Psycho,with a few mildly different touches thrown in for a more modern appeal. Vaughn is dull as ill Norman,and Viggo Mortenson's Sam Loomis seems too much the cowboy compared to the original. Please folks,do yourself some justice. Don't bother with this.

WARNING: PLOT SPOILERThe always-abnormal movies of David Cronenberg certainly are an acquired taste. Fans of his earlier films will probably like `eXistenZ', but it definitely isn't one for the squeamish. All of the usual elements are here. A game pod made out of skin (hooked into your back), buckets of blood, a gun made out of bones, and a manic mechanic to name but a few. The result is good in parts, bad in parts, and just plain weird in others. But one thing the film has is undeniable originality.

my favourite movie of all time . this was a flawed piece of work by coppola and seeing the documentary , i felt an affinity for it as well . in fact , i am convinced that coppola also wanted to save his son 's life . i can say that this film was not one of those films where the actor loses his job , or has to do away with people he knew for more than twenty minutes . however , this film was so bad at its best ; it did n't seem to be worth saving even though there was absolutely nothing special about it .

* * * * contains spoilers * * * * as a fan of rachael leigh cook , i watched her in paris . she was a pretty girl with long brown hair and an american accent . but that was because her parents had taken her to disney world when she was young . her father has been gone for several years and she spends most of her time sleeping at home . so the movie is not really mine . my mother would like me to take it back to england to watch it on one of the many channels that show movies in america , but i just do n't have the energy .

I ordered this movie on the Internet as it is very difficult to get Turkish movies where we live. Regarded as another one of the recent over-the-top drama's brought upon us by Hollywood, this movie excels where others have totally failed(especially considering the most underrated performance in recent dramatic character portrayal by that of Natalie Portman), this film is almost unanimously driven by the chemistry that both Susan and Natalie share. They seem to be so natural during the movie that you would mistake them for a real family. They go through so many mother-daughter conflicts in the story its kind of hard not to pick up on their acting abilities.

check out the first 20 minutes even though the suspense has n ' t yet kicked in . we get a pretty good look at it , and i ca n't help but feel a bit uneasy for some reason . just how much could this movie be worth ? after all , when the movie starts , you have to pay a special attention to details like what the characters are doing or saying . this is not a movie where you can spend an entire night waiting for someone to come up with a better way to go about this .

stanwyck and morgan are perfectly cast in what is , in many ways , a modern equivalent of dickens ' " all that jazz " ( which i prefer not to talk about , as i have always thought ) . although the play is an unusual affair , it was based on an episode from one of the first films i ever heard about . i really wanted to watch this one , since i had n't seen it in years , but found myself disappointed when the whole thing did not go as i had expected it would .

i can only think of one reason this movie was released . to capitalize off the upcoming fame of guy and / or lady in love with the most famous hollywood actress in the world . it could n't be a coincidence that the director , ' dave ' , had the title " chick flick , " so why would she give it to you ? is this a good idea ? i mean , how many people in this movie know about this movie ? oh well , they will see what happens once they watch it . now all you can do is sit back and enjoy .

` ` hollywood cavalcade ' ' is a mildly entertaining 1939 film starring two staples of the 20th century fox roster , and a movie made in the late 1890s which has its origins in an old indian town . this film was first released in texas in 1972 , and before that it came up in the 1980s as a classic . " i ' m going to be a fan ! " one of the other characters said . i knew it was a mistake , but what could i have done ? i decided to make my way back to washington for a chat with some of my colleagues on the team .

I finally saw LAURE and I have to say that I equally enjoyed it and was dismayed by it. What's great about it is the atmosphere, the music, the location, the cinematography and the beautiful cast. The story is non-existent for sure but with these movies it doesn't really matter. The pace in languid and the settings are exotic. The film has a lot going for it. Unfortunately, it also has a few things going against it. The first thing is that the gorgeous Annie Belle and the handsome Al Cliver have no chemistry whatsoever.

I tried. I really, really tried to think of something that would merit rating this higher than a two. It's not that I don't "get it" -- I'm a big fan of Asian cinema. The truth is, the movie is infantile in construction, long-winded, and painfully disjointed.I suppose that if you are of Alfred Hitchcock's school of thought "Don't tell them, show them," then you could try to appreciate this movie, but you would still be hard pressed.First of all, The Terrorizers tries stream-of-consciousness in the style of Jean-Luc Godard and fails in this.

` ` 200l : a space odyssey ' ' is a supremely intriguing space - travel journey with a profound look at mankind ' s life and its present situation , but it must be written to the public . the movie is based on a science fiction movie , but it is far more complex than anything i have ever seen before . this movie was set up as a documentary that i think you will like . i would recommend letting it run for another year or so , while you are learning your way around all these parts . after the movie , you may read some of my books .

i feel extremely sad for some of the people who have been reviewing this film . it is apparent that none of them will see this movie , as there is too much sadness to be felt in this book . so many other people have lost their lives and now they do n't have to make any effort to live up to what they want to do . we can only watch it for so long before something gets caught up in it and dies . no wonder i hate movies like this . they are nothing more than a load of crap that makes no sense .

my first warning should have been that this dvd was on sale for $ 5 . 00 . but since it featured the worst thing i could ever do , i decided to give it another go - and see how it reacted . there were a few good laughs . i can still hear it in my head , even after i get off of the stage . well , let me tell you something . as an adult , i knew that ' bad movie ' films are always bad , but this one is worse . it was so horrible that i had no choice but to leave the theatre .

i would like to submit the following goof . during the bridge scene , soldiers are seen wading out in the river and walking down it . but when the soldiers enter a cave , they get confused about where they should put their clothes ( which is why they come up with a dress ) . as one of them follows behind the others , it 's easy to tell what happens on the water ; it is very difficult for anyone to see . at the bottom of this story , however , is something that appears to be made of stone .

I was enticed into watching Shark Hunter by the comments posted on IMDB. The movie was bad but the shark was cool blah blah blah. So I rented it. Bad idea. This movie was bad on so many levels that I'm glad that I had the option to fast forward. The shark itself is ok. It's appearance is decent and it is the only thing saving this movie from getting a 1, (I gave it a 2). The acting is incredibly bad and the dialogue is just as deplorable. I wasn't expecting much but I was continually surprised by this suckfest.

this is a semi fictional memoir of an ` ` international man ' ' who have witnessed various political upheavals in recent years and which have caused a lot of problems . after the first few days he got used to the idea of being with a bunch of people who are constantly trying to make a life that does n't include anyone important , including himself . they do n't seem to understand where we came from , or how we could have been so stupid . on the other hand , i 'm going to be honest here .

Why is it that in the '50s and '60s, Italians made so of the best movies, and then during the '70s and '80s, made nothing but zombie and cannibal movies? Probably because art films didn't make any money. , The Cannibal Movie, unlike the Zombie Movie, which was created by Americans and `exploited' by Italians, is a purely Italian creation, designed as a mondo exploitation showcase, and to make as much money as possible (no artistic integrity getting in the way here). Eaten Alive came during the Cannibal Movie heyday.

this is the worst film i have ever seen and what disappoints me the most is that this is yash 's second year . yash is an amazing character , he is a natural born director , who spends more money in movies than he does in movies . however , yash has been acting all his life and this movie is not something he would expect to see at home . how did yash put up with this ? as far as any other films i have seen this movie , i just wish i could say that i really liked them .

there is a serious scene in this movie . a scene that lets you know that his film wo n ' t go on any longer , but it does n't stop there . i just ca n't understand how anyone can believe that such a horrible movie ever had to start up again . maybe because the plot was based on so many of my favorite shows . well let me rephrase that and pick a worse version of the film . ok , the film could have done better by someone who really wants to live it up , but i am pretty sure neither of those men even saw what they were talking about .

real - life husband and wife paul bettany and jennifer connelly star in creation , which recounts the period of charles darwin ' journey to immortality . at that point , the author does not know how or where he came upon this story , though he knows from experience it is a fascinating one . so why am i still here ? why am i thinking about all of this now ? what do i need to do to find out the reason why i was brought into this ? i just ca n't remember what happened . for the past two decades , i have been living on an isolated island surrounded by barren trees .

A truly excellent look at the world and the realities of being a heroin addict. The movie is one that will hit much too close to home to those who were involved in the drug culture and have knowledge of what being(or being around) a heroin addict really is. Good movie, which will never truly be outdated. Excellent performances by all involved and the minimalist set is Preminger's way of showing how bleak a JUNKIE'S world can become. Worth a look--an education of sorts. The golden arm is a worried look at the truth of the underground life of pain a junkie lives in.

Without a doubt this is the WORSE comicbook movie every made. PERIOD!! Yes, it's worse then Dolph Lundgren's (1989) Punisher. Yup.. worse then the 1979 & 1991 Captain America movies. Sheeshh.. that movie was so bad that the guy who played Nuclear Man only starred in one other film and it was only on T.V. =oPThis movie is "D" quality. This is one of the most unoriginal, cliche-ridden movies I have ever seen. Even if you didn't like this film's antecedents, 'The Bad News Bears' and 'The Mighty Ducks,' they are bound to have done a better job than this one. From the moment the new teacher greets her class and they tell her, "Don't bother with us, we're all losers," you can see everything that's coming twenty miles away for the rest of the film. All the usual suspects are here.

I have witnessed some atrocities of cinema. In the past couple of years, it seems producers and directors are bent on making films that drive me closer and closer to insanity. Hannibal was not an exception. I wasn't expecting much, when I went in to see the movie. The book was ridiculous, and the saying, "The Book is always better than the movie" did not assure me at all that this movie would be anything but trash. But what I came to see was a movie that made all other bad movies seem better in comparison.

The characters are so stupid and ridiculous.

Don't Look in the basement is actually a very clever and well thought out exploitation flick that gets a bad rap because of its cheap quality and bad acting. Sure, it's not a masterpiece by anyone's standards but it is a very fun little B-film with a lot to offer and even a lot of creepy scenes that will stay in your head.As I said, the acting could have been a lot better but that's the case with most exploitation so I can't really complain. The story is clever and has some great plot twists that will keep you guessing.

This is my favorite Renoir from the Fifties. It's the story of how Henri Danglard built and launched the Moulin Rouge nightclub; we see the workmen blasting at the site to get construction underway, and the training of the dancers. Finally, the giddiness of opening night and the long sequence of cancan dancing. Financial problems and the ego displays of the performers are described.Gabin is in great form as the easy-going Danglard--see him deal humorously with Nini's violent boyfriend. Gianni Esposito is moving as the wistful Prince who is courting Nini.

another movie that makes the story of the beach boys worse than it is . i especially remember the scene where the man in the sand gets ripped to shreds by a giant wave . he is so torn that he jumps in and tries to help save his friend from being eaten by the sharks , which is totally uncalled for . i would have thought he would be too embarrassed to do it himself . when you watch movies like this they always start with a splash and then get all the way to the end . as far as i know this movie was not made just for my enjoyment , but for myself .

This is one of the worst movies I've ever seen. It's supposed to be a remake or update of "The One-armed Swordsman", by Chang Cheh. The ham-fisted direction and crappy fight choreography mean that the fight scenes aren't even worth watching. The script tries desperately hard to seem serious, but is full of cliches like, "And I knew then that nothing would ever be the same again..." or "If only I'd known what a heavy price I would have to pay." Ugh! And who is that girl who plays Sing?

a gaggle of unpleasant city dwellers descend on le touquet for a week ' s holiday . stories intertwine , characters have their own names and i know this is going to be one long , uninteresting story . in fact , i have read the book twice , and only once did i find it at all interesting . you can say that when i first came here , i found myself drawn to something about these guys that i had absolutely no reason not to like . but i saw this film as a way to get to know them .

Jeff Fahey has such alert eyes and a smudgy, insidious smile that every character he plays seems villainous; therefore, it doesn't really work to cast him as the good guy of the piece, the audience is just waiting for his character to crack and start blowing people away. Drew Barrymore, fresh off her acclaimed role as "Poison Ivy", must have done this film simply as a favor to director Phedon Papamichael (he was the cinematographer on "Ivy"); playing a character named Daisy Drew (!

since i am a fan of natalie portman , i had to see the movie . i enjoyed every minute of it . this one was so bad it would have taken a lot longer to paint it . i think i could have made some money with that movie . my family and i actually went out to dinner and then we spent the night in the hotel room watching it . i ca n't tell you how impressed i was . i got really lost in the plot when i saw her first film ; i just started thinking she should be wearing a cape and riding a horse .

This 1955 heist film follows Tony le Stephanois, recently released from prison for theft, as he undertakes the robbery of his life. He teams up with his old heist buddies and they bring in an expert safe-cracker, Cesar from Milan (played by Jules Dassin, who also directed. He only directed because he had been blacklisted as a communist in the U.S. and couldn't work in Hollywood.) The brilliance of this film is the 1/2 hour during the robbery. During all this time, there is no dialogue and no music, only the muted sounds of digging through the floor or drilling the safe.

I'm having as much fun reading the user comments as I did watching the movie! It seems that this is the classic either "Love it" or "Hate it" movie. And I have to say that I not only am on the "Love it" side, I'm going on a limb to say it this my FAVORITE movie, EVER! Thank heavens I found it in the first place. Almost IMPOSSIBLE to find, I was lucky about ten years ago to record it off a late night UHF channel.

` ` the death of a performer at a broadway stage play brings a theatre critic and a police detective together . you are probably wondering why i had to do this : i felt like an outsider when i first met these two people , and i was afraid they would say or do anything to harm my work . i was just waiting for the appropriate opportunity to ask some questions about them . it seems as if their story does n't have any substance at all . i hope you will agree that the story ' s quality is very decent but its overall bad .

there are plenty of comments already posted saying exactly how i felt about this film so ill keep it short . i want to take a break for a minute and find out what is going on . the first thing my editor just told me was that this film is a classic movie made in 1955 , but very old . we did n't see the film for more than 2 months before it appeared in 1937 . i can understand why people would say that it was pretty lame . this movie was made in 1966 ; one of the funniest movies i have seen since the beginning of the 21st century .

This is the only movie that I can think of where after it ended, I was seething with anger at the waste of money and time on the part of myself and everyone involved in making it. Disclaimer: During my ventures into foreign cinema, I have taken a liking to a wide variety of movies that span different genres that include horror, action, drama, comedy, and romance, to name a few. Thus, I have enjoyed the thoughtful, serious tone of dramas as well as the mindless, popcorn fun of action films. With a wide array of Chinese, Japanese, and Korean movies under my belt, I am confident in my ability to recognize bright spots in movies to appreciate and complement. Unfortunately, Ashes of Time has nothing to recognize.

this is a horrific re - make of the french movie ma vie en rose ( http : / / imdb . com / title / tt0119590 / ) . the scene is made up as you go , but it is not complete . i know there is some kind of an explanation in there , but i ca n't think what that would be . at any rate , my father did not approve of this re - make , he simply gave me a very bad grade , and if you can imagine his reaction , i have plenty to say . i just do not want to mention it .

given the subject matter of drug addiction down to the bone almost ca n ' t help but be a rather depressing character , or so they all think - and i swear , it is not at all accurate . there have been times when i have found it very interesting to know that a person has a habit of abusing their body with drugs ( heroin , cigarettes , alcohol , liquor , alcohol , women , sex ) . this is also one of the most inhumane examples of the treatment of addicts , for example . some people do n't seem addicted at all .

A few buddies and myself have the strange hobby of seeking out really horrendous and utterly obscure (for a good reason) horror flicks and then subsequently watching them under the influence of mind-broadening consumer goods like alcohol and/or soft drugs. Surely a lot of people do this, but they watch movies like the "Godzilla" remake, whereas we torment our eyes and brains with stuff like "The Loch Ness Horror". And, eureka, this is a prototypic bad movie! We open traditionally, with bag pipes music during the opening credits.

I wasn't sure where this was headed until the ending. when it turned out that this was all a liberal conspiracy to hand the world over to European wimps and the United Nations.
