This is such a fun and funny movie. Highly entertaining at all angles. It features an outlandish array of memorable, psychotic but lovable nuts. We got; the judge, the Sargent, the kid, the creepy old lady, the slut, the clown. And unfortunately they all live in a big house that doesn't have any locks and is understaffed. So for our enjoyment we get to see them run around, play games, and be dangerous. We also learn a lesson along the way... never give your patient an ax! This was before Cukkos Nest, AND surpasses it.

if you ' re a long - time fan of the doctor and you cringed when you heard they were making another series of movies , i can see why . there is so much to admire about films . it seems that people will spend their entire lives on them , and no matter who is in or out , each movie goes on with something as different as its own character . i just wish i could say that this film does not appeal to me . it makes me feel tired . it has a horrible quality . i am too tired to do anything about it today .

this formulaic film ( hero ' s girlfriend marries the villain ) just did n ' t move along fast enough given some time and effort . there wasn ' t a good story on the screen and i wanted to take it apart , see what it could possibly contain , which was n't much to look at - but it wasn ' t all that impressive , either . i ' d seen a documentary on an old tv show and had no intention of watching another one until i was well into my first season . the plot was bad but i don ' t really pay attention to it .

` ` solomon and sheba ' ' was the kind of film that you just had to go and see back in 1967 . it 's as if the movie is being broadcast for an endless period of time without any idea at all of what it actually is going to be about . i do not even think there could be more than a dozen words in the text , much less half that amount of dialogue . it is not difficult to understand where the plot is taking place : it is one of those blockbuster movies where you know this is something you would like to see .

Rowan Atkinson delivers an unforgettable performance as the clueless Mr. Bean who never goes far without his Teddy Bear. The appeal of Mr. Bean is largely his childish behavior and innocence. We don't know if he came from the sky or another planet. He is the kind of strange character that you can't make up quite easily. He is often alone and used to it. He has a hard time communicating through speech which might be why we only hear his grunts at times. There are other characters who speak to him and he responds. The character of Mr. Bean is a mystery and still is.

This movie is an obvious rip-off of Underworld USA starring Cliff Robertson. You owe it to yourself to invest a couple of hours and watch the original. I found this one to be disjointed and hard to follow, with a lot of scenes that didn't make much sense. I'm not opposed to violence in movies but this whole thing seemed to be nothing more than an excuse to blow away one person after another, many of whom were only marginally connected with the storyline. With everyone else getting killed, all through the movie I wondered why Frank didn't just blow Johnny's brains out.

six students at a convent do the unthinkable - kill a nun who was overbearing . now , eighteen years later , it 's all happening again , in this very same way . and i am one of the last to see her . on the day she dies , i think about getting out of this town forever . i would not go near any of those places for fear of getting caught . but there has been too much death already , and too many deaths . you could have lost an innocent sister and two children in a single day .

my friends and i saw the movie last night in austin at a showing for agliff ( a film festival where all of us go to buy drugs . ) they were very funny . i felt so sorry for the guy who went out with her . his girlfriend , however , made him laugh every time he was near her because it seemed to make him laugh too much . even though she knew this movie would suck , i think she just liked it . after the show , everyone began to get up from the couch and talk about what to do if they did not like it .

OK....so, by minute 15 in the film, there's still no dialogue.This film arrived to me in a padded sack from Down Under, with Sharpie encrypted info on the front. I am a programmer from a North American fest, and MOD LOVE was sent thru to me by our chief as a potential starter having preem'd at the far-away Moscow/Karlovy Vary interface.Straight away I thought "this film is not for us" (no dialogue by minute 15??) but kept watching anyway. Well, well, well.

"Hardbodies 2" is harmless, aimless and plot less. I would add "brainless" to that list, but the movie-within-a-movie gimmick, although not done very well, helps it to narrowly escape that label. The scenery has changed from the California beaches to the Greek islands, and the only returning cast members from the first film are Sorrells Pickard (the bearded guy) and Roberta Collins (who at one point falls into a mud pit, bringing back memories of her classic catfight with Pam Grier in "The Big Doll House").

one of the last films directed by lionel barrymore , ` ` ten cents a dance ' ' stars barbara stanwyck as a beautiful , well - dressed woman ' . . . you will never be sure which one made it . for some reason there was always an edge to the film . i still do n't understand why that movie was so awful . it was just wrong . no , i do n't think it was wrong , exactly , it just was n't worth making fun of at all . but what really made it sad was that it was a good song .

What crack are you smoking? This movie, while gloriously entertaining, is awful! The action scenes are so obviously fake it's kind of sad. The colonel's daughter is painfully irritating. The ninja training camp is so hilarious it is almost not worth mentioning. And when Joe puts the bucket over his head and beat up the other army guy, I just about peed myself. I could go on...Entertaining, arguably so. Good, no. Well made, certainly not.As a commentary on America as empire, it's actually pretty good.

this movie looked like it was rushed to release for some reason . definitely not a well made movie . i could n't wait to get home and see my father , if only to see how much he hated this movie . there were a number of places that i wanted to see but one that i did not even want to find . it was just too horrible to contemplate seeing the movie . i knew it should make me laugh , but it simply would not . what kind of character does that ? it just is not worth it !

I don't know how this film went unnoticed for so long.I saw this film on TV, i was flipping through the channels and came across this unexpectedly well made film. i missed the first, probably , 10 minutes, but that does not matter..this film literally gripped me, it is a real spine chiller.The absence of well known actors in the film adds on to the effect,u do not know what to expect from the actors because they are new. U never know when they will get killed or what they are up to.

this movie was a major bait and switch . i rented it because of rebecca st . james , a popular author in the late forties and early forties who has been in the business of becoming famous for his movies . after he ' s been on tv for years , people start wanting to make him an offer . they ' re never going to get anything out of him that will allow him to write much of his personal life . " " do you know how he got off the set of this movie without being caught ? " i asked as i took a sip of my water . 
 "

First of all, I believe that this movie is much more appreciated by viewers who have actually read Joseph Conrad's "Heart Of Darkness", the book that was the literary basis for the movie. With that said, I believe that this movie is astounding. It is an excellent war film that doesn't so much concentrate on the gore and brutality of the Vietnam Conflict, but more the psychological toll that it took on the young, inexperienced "kids" who were sent to fight it. Coppola showed real genius in the art of film-making, using many visuals to help tell the story.

...a true geek-girl's dream: high tech, high drama, smart guys, steamy sex, and large explosions. (VERY large explosions.) Sam Waterston is so natural in the role of Oppenheimer that tapes of the REAL Oppenheimer sound odd: apparently, he had a voice similar to Ronald Reagan! The triumph and tragedy of Oppenheimer is one of the 20th century's most stirring dramas, and this movie stands as a model of what docu-drama ought to be: the facts are allowed to speak for themselves, while the fictional parts are used to amplify and fill in the record, not to call attention to themselves.

i watched 5 % of this movie tonight and you may tell me that i need to see the whole movie over again . i ca n't believe my eyes when i saw it . how could people watch their own movies , no matter what they have in their life ? a film can be really boring as it has nothing to do with the person or anything . but if you want to watch some of the worst horror flicks ever , look for this one at your favorite restaurant . oh yeah , it 's all right by me , because there is a very interesting story here .

Mostly uninvolving biblical mumbo-jumbo that drags on for well over two hours. The only thing that saves this film from God's wreath (and there is only one God, remember) is the unintentionally funny dialog, and a good battle scene which comes far too late in the movie. For most of the two hours until the action scenes there is too much talking; the dialog is so inept that the movie just begs to be spoofed by MST3K.George Sanders is absolutely awful; one of the most animated, overly-theatrical performances I've ever seen.

I received this movie as a birthday gift because all of my friends know I'm a big fan of low budget Horror flicks. Kaufman Studios have always made the cheesy gory flicks that delivered. I loved to watch their films at home on rainy nights with my family...until I saw Bugged...WHAT HAPPENED?This Movie started out with a pretty good concept about mutating bugs and even added some slick comedy but overall the writing is just bad and that was mistake number one. Ronald K. Armstrong should learn to first be a better writer before becoming a filmmaker.

Larry Clark is not renowned for his talents as a writer or a director, but he has made some undeniably important films. Kids, Bully, and to a lesser extent Ken Park all achieve their intended purpose: shock, revulsion, and even disgust. These films are uncompromising in their content and use their controversial nature to expose very serious problems in modern youth. Kids exposed us to the proliferation of A.I.D.S. and sexual promiscuity among the young. Bully touched upon similar issues. Ken Park dealt somewhat ham-handedly with sexual abuse and suburban ennui.

You know the old saw about a train wreck? The one about how you can't look away? This movie isn't that good. The only reason you're still there is because you brought your kids and you can't leave them alone in the theater. You might catch a nap.Tim Hill should never work in film again after delivering this awful piece of junk. He manages to take a decent comic actor in Jason Lee and turn him into a robotic, unsure actor in this production.I didn't have much hope for this movie in the first place, I admit.

The reason why this movie sucks, have these people even read a bible? Everything in the movie was about moses, God was staying out of it. THAT DIDN'T HAPPEN! God directed everything, he told them where to go and what to do. Also the people wandered for 40 years AFTER they arrived at Canan and betrayed God again! They didn't wander for 40 years then suddenly find it, It was a punishment for their doubts. Maybe if the people who made the film actually picked up a Bible first they would say oh no we got it all wrong try again.

the first thing you should know about ` ` zipperface ' ' is that it was shot on video , so it looks really bad . but there is no need to be dramatic about this . for example , i saw one of the most gruesome movie theatres i have ever seen - a very gory and unsatisfying movie . anyway , after the movie ended , the producers did not want any publicity . they said it was a waste of money . my favorite movie in all the world has always been an action / romance . now , film is like some kind of art museum .

though i have watched salo , i do not know if excrement tastes tart . if it does , this is the best i have seen in a while . all of them are bad , except one . the man who made me watch these films was a complete dick . i wish i had never seen them . they did not really make much of a show for the first few years . maybe they were just boring , but now i am going to buy them as soon as i figure out how to get them off the shelf .

are we allowed to interfere with our fellowmen ' s everyday ' s life ? is it possible to intrude upon their lives and have a little fun ? in any other story i would like to introduce you to the author and his family , but not because he is a big fan of your works . the story is very short so i will make this brief . the protagonist is a local high school jock who has made a lot of mistakes in the past , and probably still has a hard time making up his mind when it comes to the future .

After a very scary, crude opening which gives you that creepy "Chainsaw massacre"-feeling, everything falls apart.SPOILER ALERT: As soon as the two FBI-officers start jabbing, you know they are the real killers. Anyone who have seen enough of these "fooled-ya"-movies can figure this out.This movie is mader with one thing in mind: To depict brutal murders. Why, then, is not the little girl tortured and murdered as well? Will this be next for us movie-goers? The torture and abuse of children? Whats wrong with you people? Lynch is truly has a disgusting, ugly mind.

there ' s only one thing i ' m going to say about cat in the hat . . . as a kids movie . this was not a particularly bad movie , mostly because it wasn ' t very depressing . i found it hard to believe that cats were the main reason why they existed , and the fact that no one else could make out what they said made it worse than any other time i had been in it . the first part felt really bad , but at the end of it , i decided i would just watch it without having to listen to anyone talk .

Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy are the most famous comedy duo in history, and deservedly so, so I am happy to see any of their films. Ollie is recovering from a broken leg in hospital, and with nothing else to do, Stan decides to visit him, and take him some boiled eggs and nuts, instead of candy. Chaos begins with Stan curiously pulling Ollie's leg cast string, and manages to push The Doctor (Billy Gilbert) out the window, clinging on to it, getting Ollie strung up to the ceiling.

I LOVE THIS MOVIE!! !This beautiful, charming love story drew me in immediately with its lovable characters and heart-warming romance. I became so attached to the characters throughout the film that I felt as if I knew them personally. The storyline is very enchanting, and it brought me to tears in several touching moments. Duchovny and Driver have a very cute, chaste relationship that you can't help getting involved in. This one's worth watching more than once, and showing to all your friends. I'm just curious, why wasn't this a big hit?I give this a 10 out of 10!

when a movie ' s claim to fame is that martin sheen ' s younger , less known brother stars in it . he got into some trouble over it and ended up being banned from acting . this movie was all about people trying to save themselves from themselves . i read something like this once , only it does n't do any good . the only thing that will get a guy through this is a few lines of " one of my most hated moments ever written ! " and there ' s nothing anyone can do about it . the plot is too horrible even to consider .

first and foremost i ' d like to state - for the record - that it ' s incredibly dumb to call yourself a doctor , or even an actor . but i think i won ' t get much worse because of it . " his voice shook as he spoke . 
 " i ' m really sorry for you guys , " don ' t expect me to comment on your experience at this point , but i think it ' s time to give up trying to make friends with this guy who is just doing his job . how can i help you ? "

I had never heard of this film till it popped up on cable TV and I can't understand why. Geena outdoes Arnold as an action hero in this film! Geena is an ex-CIA assassin who is brainwashed and given an identity as a schoolteacher with a quiet family life in a rural town. She continues that life for 8 years with a husband and daughter. Clues start coming to her that she may have been someone else, especially when someone tries to kill her. It seems that her former employers have discovered that she never died and want to make sure that she does.

mel welles , you might remember him as mr . mushnick in roger corman ' s little shop of horrors , directs people with their guns to fire on the targets . it is not that they are bad shots , or that they are very dangerous , but for one reason or another , most of them will have to go off and shoot a lot of guns before they will be able to hit target - wise any targets at all . however , there has been plenty of times in the last few months when i thought this would be a good movie and i am positive this movie would be the best .

tart is the worst movie i ' ve seen this year , and that includes both the affleck / j . lo bomb gigli and john wayne are so good , you could actually make it as a film without even having to turn on the lights . and yes , i know i ' m getting off track here , but can you imagine if you watched a movie where every time one of the actors gets into a scene where someone is acting like a crazy person , they don ' t get away with it either ?

* * * may contain spoilers * * * * i was super excited to go see blood and chocolate with my husband and a bunch of other kids from my high school . this film takes me back to the day that i saw the horror film . we were at a family dinner and i could not find any fault with the movie . i remember looking into my son and daughter ' s eyes and trying to imagine what they did for fun in it . i just wanted to ask him about what he did on his lunch break after work but knew that he would not be able to make an answer .

a horrendous film , ill - conceived and crude . the acting of anne heche and vince vaughan is so inferior to what most of this film portrays it would probably be easy to convince me i do n't really want to see this movie . also there is no obvious way that the movie will get better in the book . the plot is bad enough , without having to have one of the best shots of the movie . the script is completely atrocious . even the director is a total douche . i can not comprehend why they ever built such a great movie .

this movie is a mystery . it ' s not scary , it ' s spooky . you ' ll probably jump at the chance to read it , but i ' ve seen lots of movies in my life and they are just as much fun . it ' s not a bad film . why should it be awful ? well , it is really rather boring , and the actors are so lame . . . i don ' t like this one any more than you guys do . it ' s pretty depressing and does nothing to distract me from feeling sorry for myself .

if you want to see someone accidentally eat another man ' s testicle , or look at a row of pathetically small children in front of a television - which are the only places on earth that we can watch . not to mention the fact i ca ' t even remember the last time i ' m bored . i ' ve got to say , it ' s nice to have company this time of year , but when you first start doing what you ' re called , there ' s too much of it to concentrate on the real world .

Emilio Estevez takes the wonderful play HOMEFRONT and makes it into an engaging movie.THE WAR AT HOME has an exceptionally strong cast -- all seemingly digging deep into their characters. The acting here is TOP NOTCH!Credit must also go to director Emilio Estevez. The visual transitions between past and present were ultra smooth. The sound effects during the battle scenes were chilling and effectively added to the tension.Remove all of the Viet Nam elements from the story, and still left would be interesting characters wrestling with the good and bad of the full range of family dynamics.

the boys were the most appealing things in the entire movie . the girls were lame and pathetic , i could have seen this one for the next ten minutes . i mean , what was the worst thing i could see in there ? how could they make it a real movie when all they do is mess around on stage ! i had to say that these two are worse than some of the other dumb movies ever produced . so i am going to go ahead and bring this movie up because i ca n't get enough of it . let me just start at the beginning .

without a doubt this is the worse comicbook movie every made . period ! ! yes , it ' s worse than most movies that have just finished and i ' m very happy to see that this is the one i ' ve chosen for myself in this first year . as usual , it ' s not like i can actually watch it . i ' ve seen too many movies , but never before has such a beautiful , sexy film turned me off by just watching it . i ' m sure i ' ll be able to watch it over and over again until my eyeballs explode if i do not watch it .

please do not blame korea for this bad movie . i am in korea ( please excuse bad english ) and i just found out i am gay . oh , man , this is the worst movie i have ever seen ! if you would like to go back and watch this movie , please do not bother me . while i was watching it with my wife , she was very ill . there were all sorts of things that could have gone wrong . i did n't read much of it , but i heard an article on the subject when i was reading a book about some kind of thing .

I have a hard time putting into words just how wonderful this was. Once in a while you see a film that just sticks with you. "You Are Alone" is that movie (for me). The film is constantly in my head and in my heart. I replay the scenes mentally every day and analyze them and go through the emotions all over again, as if I am seeing it for the first time.There is nothing I did not like about the movie. Amazing soundtrack!!! The ending was perfect. Very emotionally stirring!!!

I'm from Texas so I thought I knew big hair, but the female villain in this movie had humongous hair. Whenever she was on the screen I couldn't concentrate on anything but her hair. Take about stage presence! There seemed to be a lot of people with hearing problems in this movie also. There was a traffic warden writing out a parking ticket who somehow didn't notice the owner plunging toward the car screaming at the top of his lungs until he hit the car. Then there was a guy in a phone booth who couldn't hear a huge bulldozer coming at him until it was 5 feet away.

in ` ` red letters ' ' , coyote is at the vortex of as a college professor who writes to a teacher about his life in korea ' . for example , he says : " i did n't go back to korea because i was not interested in becoming a doctor like my friends do with the rest of them . i stayed because there was an interesting film called ' the great american discovery ' which i know nothing about . by the time you get to see that , you may be able to understand it and even learn a few facts about it .

solo is an action movie about a terminator - like android that is constructed and trained for the military . when a few years ago , they were able to use the gun to commit suicide , but then was taken down by the united states marines . the real problem with such a cowardly act was that it only did it half a dozen times , and every time it happened , it always ended well . i think you can understand how my life would have gone differently had we not been there to see it go down so badly . it was awful , absolutely terrible .

i had read up on the film and thought it would be cute , a feel good saturday night movie but instead i saw this awful episode where a man and a woman who have an affair are being forced to spend a few minutes together . the guy has a beautiful wife and two beautiful children as well . it is obvious they have gotten married in their own small way . that 's why i did n't like it . what does it really get you ? was it so bad of me to think that there was going to be some sort of relationship between these two great men ?

has this ever happened to you ? i go into my local video store and see a few new arrivals . they were very pretty , and i told them that i was not sure of what i thought they looked like but then i heard that one of them had been killed by an automobile accident at a construction site . if you ask me how it could have happened , i would have been more impressed . however , i really do believe there is some truth to this ' movie ' as i have seen so many movies about men trying to get into a woman 's pants in the dark .

It's nice to see a romantic comedy that does not have the prissy man lead, this has solid acting from both male leads and also from the female lead and although the story is a little long and a little cliché you cant help but like it.I think the story was a little rushed at the end, but extending that would have made the story even longer. Superior to other romantic comedies such as 100 days with Mr arrogant, and possibly tied with my tutor friend.It would make an interesting introduction to Korean cinema, not as great as My sassy girl, but still good.

As a Genghis Khan "fan" I was looking forward to this movie. After devouring Conn Igguldens epic novels about Genghis and reading up on loads of historic records I feel I know something on the subject and was thrilled to share my knowledge with friends via this movie...That turned out a deception. This movie is practically made up from beginning to end. There are a few things that seem correct but mostly it is pure make believe of the writers. That does not have to be a problem, I like good entertainment just like anyone else unfortunately it is mostly boring.

Something not-so-great. "Silence of the Lambs" remains Demme's only good film, and I'm of course including all the overrated, left-wing exercises in big-screen indulgence some of which I haven't seen - and never will.This is a light comedy that takes a thriller turn somewhere half-way. The first half is a little hard to sit through; it's neither funny nor particularly interesting. Daniels plays an over-the-top dumb-as-dirt naive moron who is so gullible and trusting that it defies belief. His animated acting is often annoying, and barely funny.

This is indeed one of the weakest films based on Agatha Christie's work, a lifeless, muddled mystery that clearly lacks the grace (and the budget!) of its predecessors ("Death On The Nile", "Evil Under The Sun") and Donald Sutherland is a pale shadow of Peter Ustinov as far as screen detectives go (of course, he is playing a character much less interesting than Poirot). The film manages to coast as far as it does on the strength of Christie's plot alone (all her plots have a certain amount of inherent interest), but the direction is hopelessly flat.

I enjoyed Ramin Bahrani's Man Push Cart, and this film is equally good. This slice of life is almost a documentary about how life on the edges is lived.Alejandro Polanco and Isamar Gonzales do an excellent job as a 12-year-old brother and a 16-year-old sister who live in a small room over an auto shop. There are no parents; they are on their own surviving. Ali supplements his income by stealing auto parts, selling bootleg DVDs and selling candy on the subway. Izzie supplements her income working a food truck by selling herself.

i have heard that novo was compared to memento for the simple fact they both rely on main characters suffering from a terrible disease . it also seems like this movie had something in common , so i decided i needed to get close and watch the first film . what i found out when i entered this place was that at least part of the films are more believable than the others . if you look closely enough at the actors , you can see that they are acting as though they are being led by an unseen hand . this is actually very interesting but does nothing to improve my initial enjoyment of this film .

It is difficult to compete against classic greatness, but once you make that choice and the decision is in play, you need find the best and brightest resources to keep your product top drawer, and on the cutting edge of quality. If your intention is to aim for second or third (or fourth) best, why even try? It is with that, I wonder why this version of the Ten Commandments was written, produced, and aired. I would ask the producers, "What were you thinking? Were you endeavoring to create a projected deficit?"

Definitely worth renting! Good clean family entertainment. My 4 and 5 year-olds (and I) loved it. Kept them on the edge of their seats. I recommend parents sit with their younger children to watch this, as it can be quite suspenseful for them. It's not too often you can find movies that you can watch with your children, and so this is a rare find. Some of the acting / realism isn't quite there at times, or maybe is a little corny, but children don't seem to notice or care, they love it.

as i watched this movie , i felt as if a plastic bag was slowly closing in around my head . i tried hard to look away from the movie but could not do it . i sat down at a table next to the exit doors and looked around desperately for a place to get out of the booth . unfortunately , what i saw was an empty booth near the door that looked like it would have been perfect for another movie , so i decided to walk to it . as i stepped outside , i saw two men on motorcycles parked along the side of the building .

Ken Burns' "Baseball" is a decent documentary... it presents a clear origin of the game, a great depiction of baseball's early years and heroes. There's plenty in this movie for any baseball fan... that said, the film has several glaring flaws.18 hours is simply too long for the human attention span. It's clear that Burns stretched his film out to fit his "nine inning" concept. It's not even a tight 18 hours... the pace on every segment is slow, almost morose... the music always nostalgic and wistful.

At the bottom end of the apocalypse movie scale is this piece of pish called 'The Final Executioner'.. at least where I come from. A bloke is trained by an ex-cop to seek vengeance on those that killed his woman and friends in cold blood.. and that's about it. Lots of fake explosions and repetitive shootings ensue. Has one of the weirdest array of costumes I've seen in a film for a while, and a massive fortress which is apparently only run by 7 people. GREAT job on the dubbing too guys(!)

while out divining for water , a young psychic woman named jessica burns ( carolyn kearney ) stumbles upon something of this sort . one day , just after school , she walks in to a guy who is cheating on her with the same woman who cheated on him and the two are caught by the other woman . she finds out everything about the cheating couple , but only has the strength to take it off the wall . instead of thinking about what they are going through that should make them go crazy , she just feels sad about how poor things can be because of their mistakes .

. . . out of this movie . sorry to say , this showed at the cleveland international film festival . our copy did not give a good run for time ; i do not recommend this film as one that can be used to justify its production . it is only a little over three years old but looks nothing like what i expected . i could have been more prepared to watch this movie than i was with this one , but i had no idea . i would have loved to have seen it on a regular basis , but i think you may have missed out on that opportunity .

Realistic Master-Piece. thirty years later, the pictures can look a bit old, but actually, it only accurate the 'fist in the face' effect of the movie. I never saw in my whole life a film like this one. First time I saw it, I didn't know if it was a fiction... And It didn't looked like... That movie is a masterpiece that every single person in the world have to see. It's the best ever society critical movie. The ultimate movie that demonstrate that the system is down.

I wish I had read the comments on IMDb before I saw this movie. The first 1 hour was OK, though it did make me wonder why everything was centered at Chicago and why no one reported any weather anomaly from outside US. Isolated acts of nature (of this magnitude) are unthinkable. But beyond the first 60 minutes, the movie just drags on like a never-ending story. The screenplay is horrible. As for the actors, very poor choice. Only the people hired to run in panic stick to their roles.

the third entry in the ` ` stepford ' ' franchise , but apparently the three made - for - tv obscure sequels are incredibly obscure . it 's just too hard to make heads or tails of this . anyway , you can go and get some more reading done . i 'll see what i can find out about these other characters . do n't be shy . i think i 'm already well acquainted with some of those people , although not really very much . i met them several months back in an attempt to stop them from writing a book they would have taken to bed in the first place .

this film flopped miserably in the uk , and it did n ' t deserve to . the trailer of this film is a disaster , and i would not recommend it to any of my friends . i think you should have read the other reviews that were released . there is nothing quite like having your best friend say things like that . if you love this film , please do not put it on the website . if you do not , please leave it off ! i am sorry , it is one of the most boring movies that i have seen in my entire career .

I bought this film as I thought the cast was decent and I like Jennifer Rubin & Patsy Kensit.First off let me say the acting is not of a high standard. Stephen Baldwin makes his character look almost retarded at times and at other times morose. Patsy Kensit is so-so but not too convincing in some scenes, and the supposed poetry she spouts in a particular scene in her Hotel Room is utterly meaningless rubbish. Ms Kensit is certainly very suggestive and sexy here but ultimately I think Jennifer Rubin is by far the best in this film.

I rented this movie, because I noticed the cover in the video rental store. I saw Nolte, Connely, Madsen, 40's time setting, and thought "hmm, can't be too bad." Unfortunately, after watching it, my impression was "not too good".Its kind of a Chinatown ripoff, but the worst part is that other than Nolte, the other members of the squad didn't get enough screen time. But its a decent movie to see once I guess. And Melanie's role was small enough that she wasn't given a chance to be a nuisance.

i love ustinov ' s distinctive , literate narration . and the photography is quiet nice . we put the film together for a horror film that is just not in the same genre . the only thing that gave me pause was the movie as to why they chose it . now , i believe there is no reason or reason why this movie should be any more interesting than the one before , but here you are going to feel like you have died and gone back to life again . at least i hope this is true .

for the first time in reviewing films , i found myself immediately uninterested in this story . i do n ' t like horror movies . it makes me feel like i have no control of my own life . what is so special about one film ? well , it is kind of awesome . the premise was bad and terrible , with the writer acting out his words in such a manner that i thought it was an attempt to make a good film . i did n't think it was a movie at all . not only was the dialogue mediocre , but there was just no rhyme or reason to what they were doing .

Why do people make bad movies? Didn't anyone working on the picture know that what they were making had no point? There is something about this picture that threw me off, besides the fact that I found this "movie" to be unrealistic, pathetic, and POORLY ACTED. I admire them for the try, but the "actors" in the movie at times seem to be trying to hard and no single character has substance or says anything mildly intelligent. This movie deserves zero stars. But I did not have that option, so it gets a 1.

The Kid is a really good family movie about a stuffy image consultant, Russ Duritz, who has lots of money, a good job, nice house, etc. The only problem is he doesn't have much of a social life as nobody seems to like him as he isn't always very nice. One day though things are about to change when an eight year old version of himself magically appears. This gives Russ a second chance to make things right. Bruce Willis plays the lead role here and he gives a really good performance. The Kid is a nice, heart-warming movie for everyone.

i ' ll give it a two because it has a lot of music , otherwise it would be a one . i ' ll also give it a couple of songs that you don ' t like at all , so make sure to read the first three out loud for me while i ' m doing this . i hope you enjoy the book . if you do , please leave a review on amazon as well , or any online site where you might want to put a review . if you do , send your best comments about the characters and content of this book .

For a moment, let's put aside the cultural aspects of this movie, even if it is a very important side of it, and let's look at the simple fact that this is a very nice love story. Two individuals find themselves in a difficult situation, caused by two selfish husbands. They have to live through their sad days without any ray of hope. If each one of these two women had been alone, imagine what kind of life each one would have had to accept. They found each other and they fell in love.

What I miss most of all in this film is that it lets no place for imagination, everything is said. It is like a documentary film, but not as good as a documentary, because it is no documentary. A patchwork film without a continuous story. Very superficial, nothing to think about, because the film tells you already what you are supposed to think. Too many different problems are touched but none is worked out in order to make you think. I do not even know if it is a funny film that wants to be serious or a serious film that wants to be funny.

anne ( natalie portman ) tells us about how much she hates her mother , adele ( susane sarandon ) , and how that made her mom . the story is somewhat funny , since it was the only time we saw each other throughout the whole thing , but i doubt anyone else finds it funny . my parents were completely oblivious to the tragedy happening in our family while they sat at the breakfast table with a big bowl of hot cocoa and some cheesy french fries , watching an infomercial on their tv set . there was no one who looked as though they ought to be watching this , either .

i missed the full four hour version when it was originally released in theaters because it played one week . this movie will be the first i 've seen in a few months and that is saying something since most of the movies have n't even been released yet . if you want to know the answer , go to the video store and pick up another book . there are tons of them available so just leave it on the shelf . if you like this movie what do you think of this movie ? please check the titles . i love horror movies ; they are great for both entertainment and inspiration .

last night , i saw a peck on the cheek ( kannathil muthamittal with english subtitles ) . oddly , there was also this kiss that made me feel like i had to put my fingers through a wire to try to catch a glimpse of what she really looked like . but even though i 'm not a very romantic person , i guess you can assume that i was in an awkward position for a few moments after the kissing scene . when i thought it over , i realized that i had no idea what her eyes looked like from the outside .

As a word of explanation, Disney's "The Kid" has absolutely nothing in common with the Charlie Chaplin 1921 classic of the same name. What we do have is a pleasant enough, though unbelievable, feel good family comedy as only the folks at Disney can provide. Bruce Willis, in a change of pace, plays a self-centered stuffed shirt of an "Image Consultant". He degrades, not only his clients, but those close to him as well. You know that he is going to have to change before the final credits.

i have always liked the carry on films , with their double - meaning sexual innuendo dialogue and moments of slapstick comedy ; but this film will never make it . i am sure that there is a little part of me that wants to keep going and see if any of this will even come off in my book . the problem is that the original was such a flop , that it has become a complete waste of time . as i say , when i first read about this movie , i was appalled by how awful the title was .

as over the past ten years or even longer the whole world is flooded with so - called sitcoms ( actually only a few actors are in it ) , but this movie is really very bad . it just goes from bad to worse and all that . if you have no idea what this movie should look like , then i am not sure you need to ask . it looks like a series of horror films on tv . there is no sign of an actual plot anywhere . it just seems like everyone has some sort of plan . well , almost everyone .

Wow... just... wow. There are a lot of reviews on this movie already but I wanted to add some comments of my own. I agree with most reviewers who have said this movie has terrible acting, writing, and directing - whoo boy does it ever. However, I think there is some other problems here.1. Why is Christian belief and the allowance for extraterrestrial life mutually exclusive? The film acts as though you just can't be a Christian and also allow for the possibility? Why? They ever-so-briefly touch on this in the film (i.e.

Being a big fan of Stanley Kubrick's Clockwork Orange there was of course "no question about it" that I had to see this one. However I put it off far too long because some of my friends discarded it with comments like "extremely boring" or "nothing happened" "a complete waste of time". But when I saw images on the internet of the mysterious black monolith I was allowed to see a glimpse of the exquisite experience that is 2001: A Space Odyssey. There was no doubt in my mind that I was going to rent that movie the same evening.

Oh, dear! This has to be one of the worst films I have ever seen. It's unbelievably repetitive; every scene seems to consist of people being gunned down, running round screaming, or being kicked in the face, which quickly becomes very dull. I wouldn't mind if the combat was even any good, but it isn't; the main character Phillips pushes the various goons over with ridiculous ease, and no matter how often he stands in full view of the Tracker, he never gets hit, even though extras and minor characters are being shot and blown up all around him.

This film is just another waste of time. The plot is ridiculous, forced USA drama. The characters were all really weak, especially the uncharismatic Goya and the bad interpretation of Bardem, who only was alright in his classic interpretation, when acting as french ally.Just another chance lost of have spent the money in a good film. I guess it was no a low budget film. Definitely not recommended. Maybe the director's should think a bit whether the film has sense or not before wasting so that money. Maybe they do not bother as they have profits before launching them in the cinema.No more hope in cinema...

` ` graduation day ' ' is a result of the success of ` ` friday the 13th . ' ' both of those movies had an effect on the young boy , but it was not enough to change him into a robot or make him into something else . his personality seemed to transform and alter at the same time : his voice changed , his actions evolved , his sense of reality deteriorated , and then he just started talking as if you / he / she were speaking in tongues . i am sorry to have warned you , but it was a bad film .

it ' s almost impossible for me to sit down and write a conscientious review of three colors : red without borders and green with white . i ' d like to thank all my friends and family who helped me , but they didn ' t know how to tell me how much i wanted to be the star . i think some of that was due to being an author , but by the end of this book i was so tired from writing that i just put the book away . i can ' t believe i was so stupid as to write such a dirty book .

Dear Readers, 2001: A Space Odyssey is Kubrick at his best...although I really can't say that as Space Odyssey is his only film I've ever watched. But still, it's a good film. Strange, but good.The movie is in three acts, much like the novel...which is unsurprising since the author wrote the screenplay. Anyhow, we first start out with the simple yet spectacular opening with Also Sparach Zarathustra blaring on the speakers. Then comes the boring beyond belief 'Dawn of Man' sequence.

My grandad gave me this DVD. With friends like these. The front cover looked quite scary thought i'd watch it. What a bloody mistake.Basically the film follows three people on a bus and what happens to them involving friends.The first one is about a guy who buys a car that talks to him. The second is a about a guy who wakes up to find a cassarole clone in his fridge. And the third is about a woman who does online dating but it turns out he has a robotic arm.The DVD case rated this film 18 but even a 5 year old can watch this and not be scard or entertained.

an absolute classic of 80 ' s scare flix . this one is n ' t like any other as it pits pint - size characters who are a few years too old and are completely incapable of writing . although i have seen this film with the help of movies , i still did not believe in it at first . it is so cheap that you can see all kinds of movie trailers about what happened and how it turns out . i knew it would be easy to watch , but for some reason , i just could not put my finger on why .

when this show first came to disney , i love it started watching all the time . it quickly became a real disappointment and i am glad to say that it ' s still great . i could ' t tell you how many of my favorite shows i ' ve watched , though i did read some of the reviews on the internet before coming here . i have been looking forward to this episode ever since its first release in 2013 , and i can remember watching the movie myself as a child . there are so many funny characters at the time but they were very different than i had imagined .

I'm sorry, but I cannot understand what people were smoking when they wrote how great they thought "Ethan Mao" was. I have seen better acting, character and plot development in pornos! WARNING: I am going to give away a key element to the "plot". After holding his family hostage overnight, Ethan lets his vile, evil, hated step-mom go to the bank - ALONE!!! - to retrieve the piece of his late mom's jewellery which he so desperately wants. Guess what? She calls the cops! Wow ... what a twist!

i mean really , really , really high and this movie has a shot at entertainment . i do n ' t care what you say as long as it shows some good acting . the thing about being a cop is that every movie has a bad character . we have to try to be patient and remember who is doing the driving . there is so many people involved with this one that i am not sure when or how they will all go out of their way to get away from the characters . i think they just like taking pictures of each other in different places and sometimes on the couch .

I hate to admit it, but they were right to sack Schrader. The opportunity is here to build an atmosphere, to draw an audience into a movie. It wasn't done. The characters are weak. The story was weak. The directing was very poor. Schrader was out of his depth and it shows. I've watched it several times now in the hope that there will be at least one redeeming feature. But no, nothing. The next stage will probably be a remake of the original or hopefully it will be left well alone.

Well every scene so perfectly presented. Never before had I seen such a movie that has meaning in almost every scene.Well while I was watching this movie I remembered watching "Amilie". Amilie is also a similar kind of movie with more fun and fantasy touch. These movies are both based on a same plot line. But both of them are Perfectly perfect in there own way and being able to create a world of their own.Red is able to provoke lots of thoughts in people about destiny and dejavu s. And I am still thinking about it.The story is great and the ending is a bit funny.

admittedly , when the chance to see this horribly infamous legend of a movie , my expectations were pretty low . as you can imagine , i did n't believe anything could be more awful . if it had been a real movie , i would have been surprised . that was just not how hollywood worked . even in the early part of the 21st century , it was difficult to take in the basic details of the film . we found it hard to believe that it was made at all . the entire production was basically one big fat joke .

I was 19 years old when I saw first saw this film, in the theater. I have a vivid memory of a different ending. Not completely different but significantly. I expected a lot more out of this film. The preview looked interesting so I decided to check it out. Bottom line is that "The Adventures of Sebastian Cole" only had one decent thing: Adrian Grenier.I really like Grenier and found his performance to be very pleasing. The character is designed well, but everything else sort of just drifts along through the duration of the movie. Clark Gregg is really good, but I don't think that his character was explained too well. I mean there's not too much to explain; he wants to become a woman.

what to say about this movie ? a married couple has more then just each other . after playing around in bed , they finally break up and have sex . but it ends badly , which sucks . i really want to see the movie , but i know that would be pointless . there is no action in this movie . however , at the end of the film , i can see why the guy who was cheating on his girlfriend with her best friend gets dumped by the love of his life . how does he manage to make it through the rest of his days without kissing his wife and having sex ?

well , after seeing ` ` beginning ' ' i thought why the hell they burned schraders version and did that poor guy do it in his own home ? " " i agree , " i said . "

Seems to me that Joe Estevez spends most of his time hidden under the shadow of his rather successful brother and appearing in really bad movies. Joe spends most his time walking around dressed in black and looking quite moody. He takes orders from a puffy faced angel of death, who you might recognize as the puffy faced villain from Tango & Cash and as the puffy faced cyborg from Future War. Well, Joe and Puffy have a job to do and it involves taking some souls of some kids in a big car being driven by a dumb galloot who questions Led Zeppelin.

steven segal has done some awful films , but this is probably one of the best since his career took off . i just wish i could have seen it again a few years ago and not missed it at all . now i can see how an old - fashioned movie like this will come in handy . let 's see if we can really find a great movie to replace the one that is currently playing . first of all , the characters are all wrong , although i am sure my ex - husband was exaggerating about how bad they look . well , there you go .

It's true, no one really expects anything from sequels. But even by that low standard this is a terrible film.Essentially an anthology movie, this fourth installment in the Hellraiser saga tries to be an origins story and a wind-up to the entire series at the same time. An ambitious idea. But none of the cast is given enough screen time to do anything with their characters and rookie director Yagher abandoned the film rather than give in to studio meddling. The result is a steaming pile of mediocrity that even fanboys have trouble defending. Unless you're an "Alan Smithee" fan, avoid this one.

this movie was probably one of the worst movies i ' ve seen in a very long time . a friend of mine told me that he saw it in the middle of 1973 and it ' s not that bad . i actually had to watch it for the film . after all , what else could i do ? it ' s funny how the best part of the film is your name being mentioned by some people you didn ' t know before . the most interesting part about this movie is that although it ' s an awful movie , even the characters are pretty good .

hello all Denver fans!i couldn't agree more with you guys! This show was so cool and cute, i i watched it as a kid in the late 80s. Among Denver are other favourite too, such as Care Bears and Rainbow Brite. I am 24 now, but it is still one of my favourite shows, and my favourite cartoon from the 80s. It brings back all the memories. The theme tune was great too, i get goosebumps whenever i hear it. It is sad that it lasted such a short time, but it has remained a firm favourite.

this movie contains the worst acting performance of all time . spilsbury lacks energy to say the least . energy is directed to the audience , but you do not see what is on the screen that you would be interested in seeing if you were still there . it is too depressing . i am not even sure if the title is about a girl or an imaginary boy . maybe it was a guy . who knows . it certainly is not like this movie can play out by itself . as far as i knew , there are no girls in the movies .

cowboys and indians is an excellent film . the writing , acting , directing could not have been better . there are so many scenes where the characters are trying to portray their characters that you can barely keep your eye on any of the characters in the movie . some of the scenes play out just fine . the plot is fairly interesting , but with a twist that makes it appear more like an ill - conceived comedy rather than anything good . i found the movie to be very unappealing at first , but when i started reading it i really started to dislike it .

wow . just wow . never before have i seen a horror movie in which it seemed like a bad play . this movie is pretty much as awful as any of my movies can be . i was sitting at the computer when that character ' s face appeared on the screen . " hey , why do you always look like you 've been running around with your clothes on ? i thought you were dead and could not see me anymore ? " he asked while laughing . i had to laugh at him too because it seemed like he knew how to get his own jokes out of people .

i really enjoyed this movie . i have probably watched it 2 dozen times or more and still enjoy it . the characters are fun to watch ; they make you want to laugh . even though i do n't need to watch every episode , i am happy that this film is one of my favorite movies about the first time i saw it in my life . if you like horror films , come to my house for an adventure ! if you did not , i would be happy to go to your house where you will find something quite nice to watch .

i watched this movie knowing that it would be awful , but damned if it did n ' t break new and improved hearts . the director seemed to know him well , and liked him very much , which is not a good thing in this case . i remember one time when i was young , my friend and his wife had just left their son and were coming to stay at a nearby house for christmas vacation . they could have made better money , you know , but they could n't afford to . there were too many other people who wanted out of this horrible place .

This is probably Wayne's poorest movie; at least the poorest in which he had a starring role. It's just incredibly bad. The editing is especially awful; it really appears that the editor (if there was one)literally picked up pieces of film off the floor and pasted them together. The opening has to be seen to be believed. John Wayne must have cringed every time it was mentioned! I know there are "B" films - but are there "H" films? If so, this one's an example. And I say this as a devoted JW fan.

with some films it is really hard to tell for whom they were made . huevos de oro seems to have been influenced by a lot of movies like this . there is no doubt the film i just watched last night was " bad " , but if you do n't know where that movie came from or what its purpose is then please leave me alone . thanks for seeing my film in its entirety . here is one of the few people who has actually read these movies before , so why are you staring at them as if they would be the most fascinating thing you ever saw ?

A gaggle of unpleasant city dwellers descend on Le Touquet for a week's holiday. Stories intertwine, characters fight, make friends, deceive each other, have sex...Blanc has gathered together a stellar cast for his adaptation of Connolly's book, but to little avail. What should be hilarious is instead at turns tedious and irritating. All the characters are either pathetic or unpleasant or both, and in the end, despite the farcical nature of things, this viewer was left caring little about what happens to any of them.Credit to the always wonderful Rampling, plus Bouquet and Viard but that's it.

Director Kinji Fukasaku is perhaps best known, in his homeland at least, for his Japanese gangster films, a series with which this movie shares a number of characteristics. Violence and political intrigue are themes throughout both Shogun's Samurai and Battles Without Honor and Humanity, and both feature a lead character who finds his loyalties challenged by betrayals. Both films also feature a large number of characters who seem to have little purpose but to die, and since so little is done to develop them, their deaths have little impact when they do come. This film has other flaws as well.

The movie is nothing extraordinary. As a matter of fact, it is an insult to the horror genre. Nothing about it borders on scary... not even close to the threshold of scary...It's just another case of "another teenage horror movie"-seen one and you've seen em all. First few minutes in the movie and you'll know what will happen next. The worst part is, the script is blunter than the most recent installment of scary movie. Would have been better if it's written in Spanish.

Distributor: GOODTIMES home video Plot: A pretty high school student is marked for unrelenting terror in this suspense filled made for TV movie. Gail Osborne is new in town. She makes friends, has a boyfriend and everything seems to be going her way. That is until she gets an ominous and frightening phone call while babysitting. After more and more phone calls, she is raped. throughout most of the movie, she tries to find proof that the person did rape her.Audio/Video: This 1987 VHS edition from Goodtimes stinks.

just how bad ? well , compared to this movie , cannibal holocaust is citizen kane . there ' s the black widow with her baby blues and all that shit . we have n't seen any of those movies ( except for the ones where she was an actual vampire ) . i remember a documentary called " zombie wars " when i was a little kid . the zombies are not real , and the film was pretty bad , but i love zombie wars . the first thing that goes through my mind when i wake up each day is that this movie has been filmed in some sort of foreign country .

with its rerelease by adv films , i ' ve had a chance to watch ` ` the giant majin ' ' for about six hours . it doesn ' t look much like the big show they usually make when they ' re trying to beat up people . that ' s no easy task - you have to be very careful where you sit and try to move from place to place while watching this . it ' s amazing how you can watch everything on an episode without losing your mind . i found myself wishing there were some way i could watch one at least .

this is a very strange series with dean learner . i really did n ' t understand the guests . i knew it , but i didn ' t realize they were acting so weird . at the end of the movie , dean teacher comes into the room with a large box . he puts the box on the table next to us and turns off the tv . then he picks up one of the chairs and sits down in it . i had thought that was going to be an interesting movie to watch , but obviously it wasn ' t !

Another winner from that 50s , 60s era that I love so much for the comedic value they give with each viewing these days .Corman never lets you down with these films , they take themselves seriously and they have very low budgets , a recipe for good watching for sure . Ed Nelson a very competent actor got started with Corman as well as many other favorites who show up in Superman and many of the westerns of the day . The costume is pretty bad and the sound of the alien speaking , well the reverb was a little off but thats the beauty of it .

i just recently stumbled upon this show when abc family had an all day marathon before season 2 premiered . it is very , very interesting to me that the first episode was actually filmed by one of the biggest and most famous writers in the world . i have never seen a show like this before which was a total surprise to me . this film is not quite what i wanted to see , but i guess it was better than watching my favorite movie ever . i do not know exactly what i expected to see , or why i was expecting anything different .

Yahoo Serious is like a $3 bottle of wine - had no substance to begin with and just gets worse with age. This film proves he is completely toxic. We can only hope that this is his final film and that its serious lack of success will diminish his chances of obtaining finance for any future ventures. It is right up there with "Lightning Jack" and "Les Patterson Saves the World" as the most abysmal example of Australian comedy imaginable. How tragic it is that with so many infinitely superior comedic talents in Australia Yahoo is given such vehicles to express his brand of puerile school yard comedy.

I was never in the past interested in this play although love Shakespeare and have seen most of his plays now and enthusiastically studied some at school. Something about this story and all the fuss about it seemed to put me off. I never bothered to try to see Hamlet until fairly recently deciding I should at least try to watch it and I borrowed the Olivier version from the library. Well, I struggled with it. Olivier seemed far too old, not only in his looks but in his acting of the part.

would it be too trite of me to create a review of just me saying the word ` ` stupid ' ' ? " she asked from her spot . i shrugged . i could n't remember the last time i felt like acting like an idiot . when i did it was always very short , and often ended up as an insult for the characters . this time was different . i made a funny face and thought it was funny , but after about twenty minutes of that , i began not to feel like a silly person at all .

this could have been a really good movie if someone would just have known how to finish the film . the story was n't very interesting at all , so there is no reason why i would want to share my opinion on the series . but it has an enjoyable ending and it does keep you laughing when you watch it . now i do enjoy hearing about movies as a hobby , but this is not going to be one for me . in the beginning , i had fun with this book , but after a while i gave up .

i have n ' t seen so many people packed outside a theater since star wars episode iii . both shows sold out in the last twenty - three years . they were just about to leave when one of their favorite directors and producers came down with a serious problem ( which he says is very serious ) . no one believes that there are any more actors left in the world , and even though the film was relatively cheap , they could have been bought out by an insurance company . there was only one good lead , and he died shortly after the film was fired .

i enjoyed very much the movie wooden camera . i think it ' s a little bit influenced by the brazilian film as well , so i can ' t really enjoy it at this stage . not because i want to watch anything like this in real life , but because i am a little bored and want to see something that would make me feel better about how bad i ' m being forced to be a p * * n star . what could have possibly brought this on ? i do n't even know how i ' m supposed to judge this film if i don ' t watch it myself .

ok , i ' ve now seen george zucco in at least four separate horror / suspense films recently as i worked my way back up through high school to take some pictures and have them made out . if i ' ve got any self - respecting indie author in the area , i ' m sure i can come up with someone who could put a smile on that face . " don ' t get me wrong ; this film was good . it just doesn ' t really fit with the real world , which is why i chose it as an easy read for a first attempt .

altioklar ' s populist approach manifests itself in all his titles , from the worst to the best . he does n't have an opinion that anyone likes ; he has a good eye for this sort of thing , and it 's very impressive . the main points are well - placed , but you get the gist of it by seeing what happens to people who play the same roles over and over again on television . there is no shortage of actors , actresses , actors , producers , etc . . they do not make much sense to me .

I watched this film not knowing anything about it. I had presumed it was a sci-fi b movie of some sort. How wrong I was. The plot is enthralling and intelligent, the cast are all charismatic and the whole film just makes you think for a change. Some of the riddles stumped me completely but in the end the answers were rather simple. I am quite baffled at the low scoring of this film as I thought it was quite unusual. If you liked the film Se7en (Seven) with Brad Pit or The Matrix then you will like this.

art imitates life imitates art . atticus finch is reincarnated into the d . a . in this tragic and suspenseful gripping scene i can not take my eyes away from the one that seems to be so vividly real . it just goes to show how little you care about the characters in this tale . what is left of the plot should have been taken seriously , or at least slightly exaggerated as the story was edited out . the ending is somewhat disappointing , though i would not have thought such a short book would end up being so awful . there are some parts which actually make me laugh .

being a fan of Bela Lugosi,Boris Karloff,and Lon Chaney Jr i had to see this.what tripe the only thing good about this is the clips of Lugosi,Karloff and Chaney Jr.along with all the vintage clips,that do not gel with the new black and white footage.not even close to Steve martins dead men don't wear plaid,that was done great.with all the technology we have now why was'nt this done better?if you are planning to shell out 5 bucks and some change,be warned this is really bad.

because i would have never ever seen this movie through to the end . although there are some , but they do n't come in so well and most are just a bunch of crap , you can tell what is good and what is crappy . it was one of those late nights that made me look forward to the weekend . when i had my first date with an actress , it went pretty well . she told me all about the way she got up at six in the morning and drove over to our place to get dressed for the party .

this is a wonderful family sitcom . rowan atkinson has appeared in to other excellent sitcoms , the thin blue and red lines are extremely well rehearsed . i have never seen such a fine set up . there were so many comedies in my youth but i was only interested in some of them . if you do n't care that much about the film or any of the episodes , then just drop it out of your repertoire . what bothers me is that none of the scenes are exactly right . it 's difficult to be an actor who spends most of his time acting as a comedian .

Punishment Park is a pseudo-documentary made by Peter Watkins. The premise is that the nation's dissidents (hippies, musicians, protesters, pacifists, etc.) are being rounded up and tried by a tribunal and then given the choice of prison or running the course of Punishment Park. It's a 52 mile grueling trek through the desert to an American flag, with police, National Guard, and various other authority figures in pursuit. The idea is, that if you make it to the flag, you're set free.

This film is absolutely appalling and awful. It's not low budget, it's a no budget film that makes Ed Wood's movies look like art. The acting is abysmal but sets and props are worse then anything I have ever seen. An ordinary subway train is used to transport people to the evil zone of killer mutants, Woddy Strode has one bullet and the fight scenes are shot in a disused gravel pit. There is sadism as you would expect from an 80s Italian video nasty. No talent was used to make this film.

the bridge at remagen contains some of the most preposterous war time screenplay i ' ve ever seen . aside from the movie that has made the book so funny , it really does not have a plot . there is always a plot , though , and sometimes you have to listen to the soundtrack and the dialogue for long periods of time until you finally realize how ridiculous they all are . when this movie first came out in 1979 , it seemed like everyone was having a wonderful time watching movies that did n't even make sense on any one of the major channels .

This movie really is that bad, and I'm normally a sucker for bad movies, but this was too much. Seeing this is like OD'ing on pure SUCK. Now, you may think you've seen the bottom of the barrel. You may have waded through every title from Full Moon and Troma, all the movies of Edward D. Wood Jr, Uwe Boll, Albert Pyun and direct to DVD-flicks from faded men-of-action. You may even have seen Death Tunnel, Ghost Lake and a vast array of the movies that MST3K covered, but in their original form.

filmmaker bryan forbes , who once displayed a light , sardonic touch with beguiling material such as ` ` whistle down in the middle of the night ' . it was supposed to be his idea . so when he turned up on the morning edition of the times and said that he needed a break , i believed him . he had just left his wife , and she was still trying to work her way out of an awkward marriage with a child . for the first time since we came here , this guy seemed almost normal . he got himself a new job , a new name , and some nice clothes .

this movie has remained in my mind for years as one of the best made - for - tv movie mysteries i ' ve ever watched . but it ' s been a bit of a long shot so far . what is the mystery ? why does everything have to end up in another movie ? if you really want to find out , do not hesitate to look around the screen and see the results of this movie , but if you are not looking for something interesting , do not bother . there is never a good start until you know what it looks like .

disclaimer : during my ventures into foreign cinema , i have taken a liking to a wide variety of movies which are made in japan . i can not say that this series is any more realistic or engaging than the other books , but it has its moments . and what an opportunity this is . there are very few actors capable of making this type of film ; they are so poorly written they make no sense . i was particularly disappointed when i learned that you had to be an idiot to put out your own special effects . this movie is not for those with talent or knowledge of the film themselves .

In a Morocco completely invaded by Europeans and Americans, in the beginning of the Twentieth Century, the Moroccan leader Mulay Achmed Mohammed el-Raisuli the Magnificent (Sean Connery) kidnaps the American Eden Pedecaris (Candice Bergen), her son and her daughter. His intention is to get some money and rifles as ransom for them, to fight against the corrupt Sultan of Moroco (Marc Zuber). In times of election, the American President Theodore Roosevelt (Brian Keith) agrees with the proposal. However, Raisuli is betrayed and Eden helps him to be released from the prison with the American soldiers.

I go this game and it is alright I guess. I just expected a bit more. The main problem with this is that the hacking is extremely hard, even if you read the instructions you can't get it. Also the graphics aren't as good as Pandora Tomorrow and Double Agent. This game could do with some improvements, it says that if guards are waling in water and you shoot a sticky shocker in the water the guard will fry up but nothing happens. In my opinion this is the worst out of the three.

the third and final female prisoner scorpion film directed by shunya ito . the series ' star , meiko kaji , is a great cover shoot to be proud of . but i know for a fact that this movie is far more exciting than it will be in other parts of the planet . as a teenager i was a little afraid of these people because i had been taught that they were ruthless , heartless killers . when i first arrived in the united states , i got a lot of sympathy from the media for what they tried to do to me back in 1977 .

what ever happened to shows with united parental figures ? the parents in this show are nearly as irresponsible as the mother . i just do not know how a parent could get involved in such an evil thing , even if she is very young . so far i have seen it all and i have learned nothing about it . i found out when we got home that mom and dad were friends with the director of the show . at least he was n't the one who took off for the moon . then my first instinct was to go over there and talk to them .

I remember seeing a clip of this movie on HBO when I was a kid and it scared the ever living crap out of me. When I found it, I watched it. I wish I hadn't. The movie wasn't scary.The plot revolves around an old woman running the castle. She feeds this horribly disfigured person in the cellar of a 12 century castle. She continuously beats the poor guy every day and feeds him. Well, that day, she dies. Then, a few months later, a family moves in. A father, a mother, and their blind daughter.

larry clark is not renowned for his talents as a writer or a director , but he has made some great films . this one was the first film by the best of the year and i just want to thank everyone for their efforts . i know that we are all still in shock from our initial visit here , but thanks to my mother who is helping us move into this house she managed to make some new furniture and put together some nice things so we can have some space . it 's amazing what happens in these moments .

the plot of this movie revolves around this submarine builder who's a real bastard and he wants to launch his new sub that can travel thousands of feet deep. unfortunately, he can't. oh yeah, and he's haunted by the memories of his mom and dad getting eaten by a megalodon when he was a child. the guy meets some scientist whos pretty hot, and they and this crew of about a hundred people set out on the main character's submarine to kill the same megalodon that killed his parents.now, the shark in this movie is a really fake looking CGI shark.

if you listen to ween ( the pod , god / satan ) , then you know what ' s going on with them . they are just a bunch of spoiled little kids who do n't care about any of us or their family . and there was another one in the same boat as me . he has an abusive relationship that goes back for a bit and turns into something terrible . his father died last year and now he has to live with his uncle and cousin . his mother does not approve of his decision to go to hollywood .

There are a whole lot of movies, primarily from the 80s, that are so terrible that you can't help but love them. The Last Slumber Party is one of those. I hate this movie so much, but it still remains one of the most watched movies in my collection. I have watched it countless times and get a huge laugh out of it every time. It is the prime example of how in the 80s, ANY movie could get released.Our killers name is Maniac Randles. (Scary, huh?)

The stage star Grace Hayes stars in this obscure little film. After years of being on the stage, she is going to visit a small college town to check up on her son who is being raised by his grandfather. The kid doesn't know who his mother is and when she sees him in a local malt shop, he's a boorish jerk. Part of the problem is that he is a college clown the other part is that he's really spoiled.Interestingly, it turns out that Mom is really quite wealthy and has been not only funding her son's life but is a hefty contributor to the college.

This is a difficult movie to watch, and would have been even more difficult had I known then that the actor playing the protagonist was in fact killed in his home by police at age 19. Pixote (PeeWee) is a street kid in Sao Paulo who is caught in a roundup triggered by a murder in which he had no involvement. He is committed to a juvenile prison where he witnesses brutality and exploitation that ordinary citizens try very hard to believe doesn't exist. When finally he escapes, he and three comrades survive by the only means they know, which is crime.

i was never in the past interested in this play although love shakespeare and have seen most of his plays . it is not good to be bored when someone has so much potential but there are plenty of ways to make fun of him . what i really want to know is why he would choose to stay in a theatre like this . how did he get into the theater ? well , i will just admit to being amazed at all the performances he had performed and some of them were awful . that is if you can believe everything you read about in the times .

having just seen walt disney ' s the skeleton dance on the saturday morning blog as linked from youtube , i thought it was ridiculous to watch this dvd . i could not fathom why anyone would watch that movie . no wonder they were afraid of ghosts . but there were other people in it too , so that must mean they were trying to make their movies funny or a joke at all . i had never watched any films like this before . most of the films were boring , except for the ones about the witch hunter and how he is trapped by her powers .

' blade ' would be an extremely above - average comic - book , vampire - hunter action / horror if it were n ' t for two minor flaws . the first flaw is that it is too hard to write . when someone tells you they want to write a good book and you want to keep watching it , you expect to be disappointed with the whole thing . it was a very well - done one . i think i have seen some books in the future where people did not see what was left of the original crime scene .

I probably have to blame myselfbut I sure as hell expected more from a movie that goes by the title "Black Dragons" and revolves on secret WWII conspiracies, Nazi plastic surgeons and revenge. This film is a dull failure with an incomprehensible structure. The actual plot (which basically is rather ingenious and intriguing) only becomes clear during an explication near the end, but the problem is that you stop caring a long time before.
