first off let me say that this movie is nothing spectacular . the cast is like the saved by the film crew who are trying to build an image of themselves at the end , or something . when it happens , they fail miserably . i think it will be good for everyone in the theatre if they can work together . maybe it will help them have some fun . the characters and dialogue are a mix of what could have been and what could have been . it should not be so bad ; the scenes are usually fairly predictable .

this movie is great . 80 ' s sleazy slasher movie about three kids born during an eclipse , so they get it from the guy who plays a little boy in the bad movie . of course , these guys did have one good thing going for them . they had fun , got to know each other , knew each other , and even found time to do a little research into this movie . i actually saw the film in late 1980 . it was a really nice film and was not bad looking . at first , i believed it would go down well .

it seems to be a common thing in the 90 ' s to play with cliches . some manage to do so without having any sense of style . other than this movie you would think that it would be bad , but it only plays out as an example of what might actually happen . i will tell you that there is a lot of comedy involved in this movie . at the moment , there are about three dozen scenes and it 's hard to decide how many or how often . we are sitting in a large office in a very large building located on the outskirts of town .

my husband wanted to watch this film because the review in the paper said that it was better than fatal attraction . i never understood why people were so hung up on this movie ; it was a shame to see it . as long as we all like this film , we can get along just fine . although there was some negative reviews , most of our viewers and fans seem to be enjoying this film . how does one tell someone about their feelings towards the movie if you love it ? everyone seems to find it amusing , yet nothing is funny or even very funny .

computer savvy john light ( as john elias ) goes from stanford drop - out to successful young dotcom - era tycoon . but you ca n't even say " i was born on the dot , " because i do not have that type of brain capacity . all this has to do is look at the results of the ' 80s shows and there are just a few very nice people with an abundance of money in their wallets . it is only fair for everyone else to be involved in this movie . here are the highlights of my film . first , i want to let you see where it started .

I can't believe I rarely ever see this title mentioned by all you eighties horror freaks and I definitely won't be joining all my fellow reviewers here in saying that 'Bloody Birthday' is awful viewing. On the contrary, I enjoyed it very much and I was pleasantly surprised by the ingeniousness and surprise twists it offers. Don't just refer to this film as being 'another 80's slasher' because the victims here are rather unlikely and so are the killers. We're introduced to three cherubic-looking youngsters who were all born during a solar eclipse.

a group of adventurers travel to the ' dark continent ' to try and locate a lost heiress named diana , who has been dead for about a year now . this is a complete waste of time - what were the chances of anyone being able to find her ? it would be much easier to search through all the old texts and find some references to a missing daughter or grandson . but there are a number of people with no idea what she looked like in 1931 . i think the only thing we really got out of their stories was that she had a high school degree .

heh . . . i ' m surprised this movie still exists in any form , let alone it being available for rent from the film industry . " " my first impression was that there is not a lot of quality entertainment to be had out there in the usa today . if you have just seen enough of the early 1930s movies to know what type of films these are , your eyes were deceived . some of them are very predictable and well known , most of them are pretty funny . but they are boring . one does not want to read too much into these things .

When one of my friends recommended this to me, raving about how well it was filmed, the underlying themes and the general greatness of the film, I obviously expected an amazing, at least entertaining film.The two hours I spent watching this turned out to be a huge disappointing waste of my time.I understand that this movie is meant to be surreal, but even in surreal movies, there is something which anchors it down, even if it is only in the slightest. This movie, on the other hand, felt forced and fake.

Dolelemite (1975) is a cult classic. Starring Rudy Ray Moore as the pimp superhero out to wrong rights whilst challenging the MAN along the way. He has two enemies, that no good Willie Green and the sleazy mayor. Watch Dolemite kick, punch, slap and pimp his way across the screen. What's the man's name? DOLEMITE!Interesting film that paved the way for a generation of rappers and performers. To sell more of his party albums, Rudy Ray Moore made several on the cheap films during the seventies. Self produced and marketed he catered towards a specific audience.

i have to be honest and admit that this movie did basically nothing for me except baffle me completely . the first time i saw this movie , i thought it sounded a lot more believable . i was wrong . this film is just plain terrible . if you read about these movies on wikipedia ( one of the reasons why i never looked at them ) then you would understand how awful they really are . the story is so far from any decent comedy i have ever seen , and there are no comedic moments . the script is unappealing , even though the characters are wonderful .

` ` tart ' ' is a good illustration of old the yogi berra saying : ` ` if you do n ' t know how much money you can spend on something like that , it would be a disgrace to you both . but in fact , i really enjoyed this last movie . all the guys were very friendly and i found myself agreeing with them . the first movie was bad , but i could feel my heart sink as it got better . it did n't take me long to start feeling sorry for myself . the second movie was not too bad either .

bad , bad , and did i mention bad ? aside from the comical monster terrorizing the workers the funniest thing i saw on the day i had to do it was the worst movie of my life . i have never experienced a movie like that in my life . i tried to think what could be done to change the situation but unfortunately there were too many options for me to choose between watching the horror or seeing the film . however , i thought i would watch them anyway , because it seemed to be the best way to stay sane .

a great movie , with a rather unclear political message . its shot in a theatrical style , i . c . p . r . b. t . s . s . a. v . e . l ' s a good movie and i loved it ! i am very excited about the new book . i thought it was funny . when i came on scene i had an idea of where it could be filmed . i think it might have been directed by don ' t - go - anywhere - else but it was the first action that i ever watched .

hannibal must be the most god - awful movie i have seen in a long time . in fact , i want nothing better than to see the film . even if there are no other movies in it , that 's just the first one i want to see and watch . besides , the movie is so depressing , it will ruin any good quality time i have with the plot . who wants to watch an unappealing movie with no purpose other than to make fun of someone else ? you do n't even know where the guy falls off the wagon or whether he has ever been kissed by a woman before .

even with only 6 , 000 bucks and a cast of part - time actors , christopher nolan was a master . nolan is a movie director and works hard to write the screenplay as a prop . his work includes several films that would be great if they had been available at the start of the series . but it is just not worth taking into account all the fun and excitement i got watching this movie . there are three main characters , two girls and a boy . the first one is a cute kid who likes to shoot people on the beach .

one of the more prominent / popular episodes , but clearly one of the worst . a red - shirt female falls for khan , and he gets to date her . that 's enough to make any girl cry . then there are the horrible things that play out in movies . when i was ten , my dad gave me this dvd . i could n't believe i had watched it . the first night i slept alone i got really sick . i still remember the feeling of terror that i had as i lay on my bed , hoping to wake up at any time .

I picked this movie up because it sounded like a pretty decent flick, and I've always been a fan of Foreign films. However, for someone who likes movies, I was surprised at how much I hate, hate, HATED this movie.Although it does aim to expose the lives of young, lowerclass men in Lima, and to an extent it does succeeed, the characters are hopelessly shallow and the audience winds up having absolutely no feelings whatsoever for them.Although the story chiefly revolves around M, he rarely ever speaks, and his dialouge is, at best, amazingly dry and dull.

I would like to know if "The Outsiders" (Australian TV series) will ever be released on DVD sometime in the future? And is the music (Title Theme) available on CD?There was only one series of 13 episodes of this drama and should have gone on to at least three or even four series in total.The Young German Actor in the series was also in a German TV series called "Black Forest Clinic" which aired here in the UK with English dialogue superimposed with the lip-sync. I look forward to hearing any comments from TV Industry personnel on the above questions, thank you in advance.

i do n ' t know where to begin . perhaps the whole idea of this movie was just a disaster waiting to happen , and it was all in vain . oh well , i guess i could always get on the phone with her and tell her about it later . if she ever decides to hang up on me and listen to my side of the story , then i might as well have told her the entire story already . it seems like i have some explaining to do , too . what an odd thing to say ! i had no idea that this series was going to be short .

This is the worst movie I have seen to date. 85 minutes of utterly bad acting,(half the cast seem to be suffering from Asperger's syndrome) ghastly wigs, strange make-up (including tide lines around wig areas) and holier than thou characters with holier than thou dialogue that makes you want to puke. One comical aspect of this film, if you have the patience to watch it, is the sheer overwhelming number of costume changes the unfortunate cast appear in from scene to scene - was this film backed by a catalogue manufacturer of desperately dodgy pastel casual wear?

i saw heaven ' s gate on its opening week nearly twenty years ago . tickets were sold in advance based on the story . i thought that was quite odd . i did n't think such things were likely to be a popular movie at the time . so it is still not true . you can ' t say that they have never been made before . this film , or whatever it is , does not look anything like the movies i ' m used to watching . it appears to be an old - school movie .

when i saw the trailers for this movie , it looked like a good romantic comedy . i expected some funny little characters that would appear out of nowhere and ask ' are you going to go with us or just stand by ? ' but none of the acting is what i expected . there seems to be nothing funny about any of this film ! this is all such a waste of time . why do they have so many action scenes in this movie ? it seems as if most of the stunts were just not well executed at all .

OK, this doesn't compare to the explosive tempo of the first part's opening sequence; nor to its visual shock value; nor, for that matter, to the melancholic suspense of the second installment. No, it's surprisingly and refreshingly different (apart, of course, from the two main actors). The tongue-in-cheek futuristic scenario drives the characters towards each other across genres and languages with an almost gravitational force. The moment of impact-conclusion is your choice of: a)Shakespearean metaphor of life and humanity in a cartoon costume; b)sublimation of violence into homo-erotics; c)humorous detonation of an impossible buildup.

i have always loved the ironic symbolism and brilliant cinematography of coppola ' s masterpiece . i was lucky enough to hear of this novel in one of the local journals for the first book . the story is funny but there is an odd quality to the plot , a strange twist . it seems that the plot revolves around all of the things that make you want to go see the dead . so far no - one has shown me any of their work since the last book came out . what makes this movie such an odd film ?

The Love Letter is one of my all-time favorite books, so naturally I was skeptical when I heard it was to become a movie. But, I liked it. I found myself grinning through the entire movie. I admit that it isn't a great movie but definitely a pleasant hour and a half. I thought that Capshaw and Scott were perfect as Helen and Johnny. Just as I pictured them. And the town and scenery were just right as well. I recommend this film, but don't expect too much, just enjoy it.

1st watched 7 / 29 / 2001 - 4 out of 10 ( dir - mark dindal ) : fast - paced , frantic animation effort by ted ' s friends is very satisfying for one of us . but the characters were completely unrealistic . i have to say i was a bit shocked to learn this movie might not be available on hbo . in fact , that makes it look pretty much like a play or tv series . however , there are so many people who would like to try this movie because of the way it came out and what it will take to win .

sadly this film lives up to about 1 % of the hype that the game created in 2004 and leaves a good feeling . it is truly amazing , but i think you may be right about how much of an audience it has been for over 50 years . it actually looks like it could use some more work and i do not blame anyone for not liking it . i was looking forward to working with one of my old friends on this , but i had to get back to work after what i saw last saturday afternoon . there was something odd about the entire set .

I've seen some Bible-based trash. This one tops it all. To make matters worse, it lasts about three hours. A horrible waste of time, unless you want to match your kid's biblical knowledge against the innumerable aberrations. Do yourself a favor - take a walk in the Sahara instead. Since I am required to give you a ten line statement of why not to watch this movie, let me just say there is absolutely no redeemable quality to it. God's conversations with Noah are ridiculous. The whole thing has a stench of "let's make the Biblical account look retarded."

I attended a screening of 'The Cooler' at the Toronto Film Festival this year. While the other reviews I've read seem to be generally (and mystifyingly) positive, I must tell you without any kind of axe to grind that this film is unimaginably, unspeakably bad. The very brave and candid performances by William H. Macy and Maria Bello have been horribly misspent on what is probably the least polished, most clichéd script to have received the green light in years. I don't know how bad The Brown Bunny was, but I'm certain it couldn't have attained the Dante-style depths that this one did.

not having any idea what this film was about , but based on the fact that john leguizamo was appearing in one of their best films . i had a bad feeling at the end of the show , but i did n't dare question it . i still do n't know how the story ended up going down the same track as before , so i let it go . i decided to take a break from my studies and take some more time to write another book . i would rather have a full - time job than sit around and watch movies like this .

Based on what little i have seen of this show I don't think I will ever watch it again. Its not even remotely believable and frankly the Derek character just makes me angry.Sorry but seeing such a spoiled brat get his way time and again? Why would i want to watch that?!? No thanks, there are plenty of other shows that involve devious characters (Phil of the Future's Pim for example) where the evil one doesn't win or if they do not in the way they though.Not to mention that I think this is a terrible picture to paint about living with step-siblings.

I love this show. I watched every episode last year. I bought the DVDs. And I tune into to watch tonight and I see for some reason you have retooled this great show. And you have taken what made it work and ruined it. You took one of the best aspects of the show away which was the 4 friends. Sam, Sully, Lizzy and Piper. I love the other characters as well, but they are good in small dozes like Derek, Darcy and even Sully. It is like the show lost some of its family and everyone else is trying to hard to fill in.

ah ! when good actors take on bland material ! if you are thinking of this movie as a tight - lipped horror film , i assure you that it was not . the characters have been cast in different genres , none of them quite as bad as the plot and some of them certainly are very good . there is no point in saying that we are not doing anything for our characters , just that we know they would enjoy it if we do . there is nothing about this movie that is supposed to be funny . it is a total letdown .

Although it isn't mentioned very often, "Don't Look in the Basement" is a very interesting film and is definitely worth a watch. The story follows a young nurse, Charlotte Beale, who is hired at Stephen's Sanitarium to replace Dr. Stephens, after he is murdered by a patient. Many patients begin to torment Miss Beale, and her boss, Dr. Geraldine Masters, acts as if she's hiding something...This movie has many appealing characters that you actually end up caring about, and have sympathy for during the climax, which doesn't happen very often in horror films.

though i strongly feel that sitr is the best gene kelly movie , but this a pretty good one . i hope you enjoyed it and may even be happy with the reviews . thanks for taking a chance on a nice guy . if you were going to make a film , we could have been in a bad place . thank you so much for letting me stay with you as your roommate . i really hope you did not have to rent a trailer for this movie . i ca n't afford to get a trailer , and it seems like a great idea .

while trying to build a major mall or complex or something like that , a wealthy landowner ignores ancient native american art as if it had no significance . the only thing he has done well is get rich . he was in a real bad mood today . i have never seen so much poverty on this film before . there was no way he could have picked up his camera when we were going through here . he spent more than half of it watching the movie . he made sure everyone knew how awful it was . then he did something very different .

i attended an advance screening of this film not sure of what to expect from kevin costner and ashton kutcher . in my opinion there is nothing more disgusting than watching two people who are obviously attracted to each other at the age of five get involved . i had a very interesting time at the movie theatre , but it did n't last long . as expected , it ended badly . we were on the verge of being bored out of our minds by the whole scene and i found myself beginning to wonder why the actors actually thought this was funny .

another decent offering from the pen of vince gilligan . a pre - ' ' malcolm in the middle ' ' bryan cranston plays patrick mcgraw ' . these are all great works of fiction that would have been better if they had been published at any of the other cinematography programs i have ever heard of . as one of the writers in this film , it is his duty to put the story together well enough to save the reader 's life . but , it does n't do anything . there is nothing more terrible than not being able to finish your book and then get out of it alive .

Despite the all-star cast, this attempt at epic fails. It comes across as a set of flat cartoon stereotypes strung together by an all too, too clever social commentary. It's as if with every bit of dialogue and introduction to a new character the writer peeks out and says "Isn't that clever? Am I not smart? Isn't that biting social commentary?" And,sadly, the answer is always "Ummmm...no." Wearying self-absorbing stuff that is more like soap opera (in the worst sense of the term) than a movie...and an obvious attempt at television immortality.

Irwin Allen put all his talents behind this one: he's co-screenwriter, producer and director of this cartoonish "epic" about an atomic submarine and its efforts to reduce a ring of radiation circling the Earth. Potentially exciting story fails to take off, despite an eclectic cast. Varied players from Walter Pigeon and Joan Fontaine to Frankie Avalon and Barbara Eden are interestingly intermingled and provide a dash of color, but this soggy sci-fi is pretty cheesy. Good for a few stray laughs, but Allen didn't seem to know the difference between strong, solid adventure and campy nonsense.

From the makers of Underworld, we have, by far, the worst werewolf movie I have ever seen. It is basically a reconstructed version of Underworld, yet lacking vampires (not a big deal), cool effects (a BIG deal), and generally just about everything that can possibly be done right to produce a decent film dealing with lycanthropy (the biggest deal of them all!). A twenty-something lycanthrope chocolate maker named Vivian is currently residing in Romania ever since her family was hunted down and executed in front of her years ago in America for being werewolves.

my girlfriend, as we walk in the cold London evening in leicester square, after the movie, says: if they didn't speak English and they didn't show the stadium, you could have thought this was the slums of a South American city or some other slum anywhere in the world,not Queens in NYC.Ramin Bahrani is , right now, my official hero, because he seems to have devoted his work to show not the OTHER face of American, but the REAL face of America.Ramin Bahrani's movies are like Ladri di biciclette, or Germania anno zero, or Roma citta' aperta.

i decided to watch this movie because i ' d not seen carol lombard before in any movie . i ' m not even sure whether i liked her , or if she was really that bad but i liked the idea of watching it for some reason . i found it a little funny to watch the film with a girl who could only have been 17 . i couldn ' t understand why she would give up her life for such a monster . i thought she was nice , although she never said anything about her past .

I am a huge Eric Roberts fan, I collect his movies and so far has get to 60. But I´m honest to say that sometimes he really makes awful movies. But hey that´s why I like him - he is entertaining.But this one has to take the price, I can´t stop wonder why. Somehow they managed to get Eric and also Corbin Bernsen to the picture.While Bernsen is plain awful (I really don´t like him), Roberts manage to be the best thing in the movie (and that doesn´t mean much).

i will commend it in only one respect . . it was innovative . innovative does n ' t mean it ' s a great film . it just has to do its part and that ' s all anyone knows . you don ' t see so many of those films at these times , either . if you don ' t like them , then you can ' t watch them . if they are bad , go back to the movies . if there is an opportunity to live up to expectations , then try to follow your own rules and find something more positive to look forward to .

The third film I got to watch at the philly film fest was this outstanding drama from Japan. After breaking out of prison nine escaped convicts plan to find the "key to the universe" that a tenth convict who didn't break out told them about. Along the way we get to know each of these men fairly well. Each has their own dreams. For much of the movie it seems to be mostly a comedy, but a shift takes place that the film ends up a tragedy. All of the actors give great performances.

This movie deserves a 20/10 if I could give one. "THE HOLLOW" is a great Hercule Poirot novel and the twist at the end fools most people. I am overjoyed that this movie stayed completely faithful to the novel. There was no major difference that I could spot. The only difference was that Poirot was introduced into the story earlier that in the novel. The acting was superb, and the music, as usual, was amazing quality! David Suchet is perfect in his role, and the rest of the cast is perfect in their respective roles either.

I love Ustinov's distinctive, literate narration. And the photography is quiet nice. We put the film on for our 3.5 year old who sort of wandered in and out of the room. So for our first viewing, we only saw about 1/3 of the movie and were quite charmed. When we re-watched, sitting down for family time,we were all mortified at the violence and life-threatening situations the poor otter got into. About halfway through the movie, there's a rack of dead, bloody furry animals. Lots of blood, not just a little.

Watched the director's cut last night...glad it was free rental, even a dollar would have been too much for me to pay to watch this attempt at "film noir". The anachronisms (modern telephones) were annoying to me, not clever, seeming more like budget constraints than anything else. The "non-traditional" casting I also found distracting. If I have to stop following the story to wonder "what the heck is the black chick/drag queen doing there?" then the storyteller has failed me. Again, not clever in my opinion but annoying and irritating, and very film school final project-ish.

i was lucky enough to have seen this film at it ' s seattle film fest screening , and was blown away by what i thought of as the movie ' s finest . it wasn ' t even that great . the only thing that did really make me dislike it was the fact that it was so boring . no - one ever gets to see anything like this . the whole film is nothing more than an overblown production . there is no way to actually know what the characters are about . all i know is that it ' s not very convincing .

"My Blue Heaven" is boring. The plot is insipid; the characterizations and dialogue stink; the musical numbers, while occasionally staged in interesting ways, are not only too often absurd, but also lyrically trite, painfully bright, and emotionally hollow to the core. The leads, Betty Grable and Dan Dailey, are attractive professionals; however, in spite of their every talented effort to uplift the drear and uncompelling material, they fail. David Wayne and Jane Wyatt, for all their demonstrated talent in other projects, are more or less cyphers here.There's really only one reason to watch "My Blue Heaven".

ok , i ' ve seen over 100 troma films , and some of them are pretty bad . ` ` sizzle ' is one of them . for example , you ' ll have to wait 6 years before you find a movie where they make a film of an alien being murdered by aliens . at least , that ' s what it looks like . in this movie the aliens are all dead - no life , no intelligence , no power , no material . they don ' t even act like aliens , they just eat each other .

OK, if you are a fan of Mystery Science Theater 3000 and love to mock movies, then you will have a lot of fun with this. Otherwise, it may really be TOO painful to see.Plot: Obsessed cryptozoologist sneaks a huge crate containing a Chupacabra onto a cruise ship (apparently not having to declare it at customs, or even mention that he's bringing aboard a live animal -"no really, it's research equipment, the air holes are just an accident"). Some dipsticks he hired to lade it open the crate, figuring he paid bunches of money, maybe there's something to steal.

never , ever , have i been as impressed by a film as this little piece about four groups of men who are at least fifty - two years apart in age . there is n't much about it that i 'm aware of , but i can tell that the overall picture was good . the story was pretty good , the characters were good and they made a great story , but the main thing for me to say about it is that it was an awesome story . i ca n't believe you did all this research and got nothing from this . "

This is my first Deepa Mehta film. I saw the film on TV in its Hindi version with its "Sita" character presented as Nita. I also note that it is Radha who underwent the allegorical trial by fire in the film and not Nita/Sita. Yet what I loved about the film was its screenplay by Ms Mehta, not her direction. The characters, big and small, were well-developed and seemed quixotic towards the end--somewhat like the end of Mazursky's "An Unmarried Woman." They are brave women surrounded by cardboard men.

mostly uninvolving biblical mumbo - jumbo that drags on for well over two hours . the only thing that saves this film from being lost is that one of my best friends will be in it ! ' i ' d like you to hear a snippet of this story . it was edited by a man with very good taste in movies , who loves to show off his work and make himself famous . the movie does not have any particular theme . there is nothing about why they decided to get into the game , or how much of what they are told is actually real .

this film gives new meaning to the term ` ` uneven ' ' , giving us a few intriguing characterizations offset by the reality of the story . for example , there is a huge difference between these two movies , but the original was so badly filmed and so poorly played that you can not even imagine it could have happened . the acting is completely out of character - in the worst possible way . the plot is so atrocious that you ca n't begin to understand it . it is utterly useless . the whole thing is too ridiculous , and it is all about trying to make sense of it .

Despite having an absolutely horrid script (more about that later), this film is still vaguely watchable just because it stars two excellent actors, Barbara Stanwyck and Henry Fonda. Aside from one or two REAL stinkers, I'd probably watch just about anything with them in the film, as I am a huge fan of Hollywood's golden age of the 1930s and 40s. However, no matter how much I love their films, I just can't recommend this film.The movie begins with Fonda and Stanwyck on vacation at some ski resort.

dr . pena ( giancarlo esposito ) , a ` ` crypto - zoologist ' ' ( fancy term for one of those self - deluded losers who do not have enough money or talent to go on any kind of movie ) was an absolute moron . he thought that all the people who could afford to live in luxury were wasting their energy . but he was wrong . it did n't even work because they never made any money ! the only reason i went to the movies at all was just to get out of them ! i like my movies very much .

this is another sci - fi channel original movie staring rhys davies where its hard to decide whats worse , the acting or the horror ? how did we get here ? well , there were some interesting scenes , but not enough for me to do much reading . it was actually more a comedy than anything else , with one notable exception : i have n't seen any of these characters in a long time . they may not have ever been actors from the movies that i have watched . i really think about writing this on my own and seeing what happens when people want to be portrayed as a great actor .

Fun With Dick and Jane failed to entertain on so many levels. There were loose ends with the writing, for example, it seems as though one of the major conflicts was the indictment of Jim Carrey's character DIck Harper, but the writers never follow up that particular conflict. Basically the story is weak and mostly unfunny, but Carrey saves a few scenes with his physical humor, but honestly, Jim Carrey wasn't very funny in this movie, and Tea Leone might as well have been there just for her appearance because she wasn't funny either.

I disagree in calling this a stoner movie just because weed also makes an appearance. I can't imagine this as even approaching "stoner classic." That would be like calling Singles a "grunge film." The movie definitely plods along with a murky plot. At times I wondered if the script had either been dropped and shuffled or if they lost it entirely and just tried to wing it. Watching this movie reminded me of watching children play-acting and making the story up as they go along.The characters are wooden, the dialog is taxed, and the whole story seems to be completely disconnected.

From the beginning of this film,with it's "The Lost boys" rip off opening sequence, to the bad wire work and even worse dialog ending, this movie slimed along at a snail's pace. "The Covenant" came highly recommended from some of my co-workers, who I am thoroughly convinced were playing a practical joke on me. At least I hope that was the intention and their taste isn't that bad! This movie was not much longer than an hour and a half, yet felt much much longer then that.

I was impressed with this film because of the quality of the acting and the powerful message in the script. Susan Sarandon plays the part of a flighty, irrational and possessive mother, who constantly gives her daughter the message that they must stick together. She removes her daughter from a dysfunctional but loving family in Indiana to pursue an exciting acting career in Hollywood. The daughter is dubious, but at first she has no choice--- the bond with mother is pathologically strong.In time the girl sees that the mother is off into flights of fantasy and does not have her feet on the ground.

to make this short and sweet : i hope this movie will not be considered the seminal work for the entire trilogy . i am disappointed that it did not give me more than an hour , let alone five minutes . the plot is not interesting in any sense except as long as you like the characters . the premise and characters of this film are just as bad as anything i have seen on dvd . i do not care what happens to the script or who made it ; i am just grateful that this movie makes me feel good . thank you for your time and understanding .

the first time i saw this film i was a kid . i was ten years old when it was shown on tv , and as i looked around at all the strange twists and turns of it , i realized that it was one of the oldest films ever made , and probably the most difficult to watch . i remember sitting there with my mom on a couch watching movies with my brother in the recliner . it was funny , but only for a couple of minutes . however , if you do n't believe me , look at this one .

The pace of this movie is quite slow. It takes about 70 minutes to get Katie to China (which we know that she will) and leaves 30 minutes to wrap things up. The storyline is so predictable that you know everything after about 5 minutes. Nothing surprises you. I guess that the movie is a coming of age movie but the movie is full of stereotypes that are quite over the top:Katie - A beauty that realizes that looks, boys and shopping isn't everything. She realizes that she can "feel" and "see the real world".

I remember when this show came out. It was originally advertised as a mini-series. At the end of the last episode it said "To Be Continued" to the dismay of all the people who had watched the whole boring beyond words thing. It ended as it was supposed to, so yes, you can blame the series for having no ending. The plan was for there to be another obviously if ratings had been higher, but it was a boring show that way too long, and annoyed people by not ending when it said it would, so they never made any more.

i really wanted to like this film but it barely eked out a 3 . it ' s surprising that equal opportunity is so much bigger . and who knows , it could have been an award - winning film too if it had been allowed to do the job of setting up the production in its own special way . anyway , i ' m just glad i didn ' t see this movie because the actors are not very interesting . one night , at the movies theatre , i wandered over to a table for two by the window looking out into the bright lights of downtown hollywood boulevard .

five fingers relies heavily on barbaric , shock value hollywood tactics to elicit apparently a positive movie - going response . this is nothing short of ridiculous . the actors were obviously used to dealing with high drama and they did n't even notice that all the action was coming in from different directions . i do n't really care about the characters or where they came from . i just do not understand why those two men would have worked at a nightclub . when i thought of it , there was no reason why either man would ever go into a nightclub .

you know , before seeing this film i had little sympathy for those caught up in criminal cases . i did have some sympathy from people who were involved in these murders . but it 's not the movies that are the most important thing about this movie . i loved the first episode and was impressed by the quality of the story . the plot was one of the main points that i had heard throughout the films . we were playing the same scenes over and over again ; it was just much more entertaining than the second half . this was one of the worst episodes ever .

The Brighton has a traumatic drama in the breast of their family: the twenty years old Emily Brighton (Taylor Roberts) is retarded due to a fall when she was one, and her overprotective mother Martha Brighton (Amy Madigan) blames her negligence for the accident. The seventeen years old Evie Brighton (Lauren Ambrose) loves her sister and reads poems and stories for Emily. Their father Harry Brighton (John Savage), a bank investor, lives in the basement with his models of trains and railroads. Evie mysteriously sabotages her interviews for different universities being rejected, and teaches the poetries of her own to Emily.

having enjoyed neil gaiman ' s writing ( especially his collaboration with yoshitaka amano in ` ` the dream hunters ' ' ) . " and this is what i got , for being a great person who could write it well . i just wanted to see if you had the time . i can only hope you do n't have some kind of bad taste in music . i hope you do not like this song . i love this song ... but i ca n't let it continue . it is really too loud . please take your time and look at it and tell me why .

at the beginning of the movie , ramgopal verma says that ` ` sarkar ' ' is his tribute to the godfather ' . in fact , it appears that he has seen it as much as any of the others ( who have ) . in this case i thought it was a good - looking movie , so i thought it might be funny to watch it with you . no , it wasn ' t funny . for all intents and purposes it didn ' t really look like a movie at all . i ' ve watched too many bad horror movies these last 20 years to count .

The Soap is an interesting movie and very brilliant at parts. You must watch it for its strong characterisation and the risks the plot about two troubled individuals falling in love takes. You must know the story through various other reviews, so lets speak about what is brilliant about this movie.Firstly, the two protagonists are so real and such intriguing personalities. The first being a woman who has opted out of a four year relationship and is angry enough to sleep with anyone coming her way. The second being a man who has always wanted to be a woman, whose pain and loneliness is shown with so much sensitivity and brilliance.

Buyer beware. The Alpha Video release uses a print that defies description. The movie was shot in color but you wouldn't know it for the first 25 minutes or so. The print that is used is so faded and decrepit that it appears almost sepia toned. After 30 minutes some color seeps back into the print but from there to the conclusion the color comes and goes. Keep in mind, even at it's best the color is pale and washed out. It looks like the print was recorded off a television that wasn't getting the best reception.

I had to write a review for this movie based on the ones that are saying gory, non stop action, great movie..These people were obviously watching a different movie. Killpoint honestly sucked from the word go!! I kept waiting and waiting for this film to get better and it was to no avail. Some said this movie was brutal and others said gory but I can't find either of those adjectives actually showing up in this, I mean hell there are so many scenes with people getting shot and there being no blood at all it's not even funny!!

I am not sure who recommended Surveillance to me, but I think I have an idea: one of the "Fat Guys At the Movies." The person said they were astonished by how great it was and said it was one of the goriest/disturbing movies. (I'm paraphrasing and doing this only by memory, so forgive me if I misquoted.) At any rate, I made the decision to watch it. So I take full blame for my own miscalculation in watching one of the most horrible, predictable and STUPID movies I've ever seen.

I've always found the dilettante Man Ray and his artistic efforts to be deeply pretentious, and I've never understood why his work attracts so much attention. Apart from his Rayographs (which he invented by accident, and which are merely direct-contact photo prints), his one real contribution to culture seems to be that he was the first photographer to depict female nudity in a manner that was accepted as art rather than as porn. But surely this had to happen eventually, and there's no real reason why Ray deserves the credit.

. . . and i ' m so disappointed because i ca n ' t seem to buy the dvd or vhs of it anywhere . its a good movie , but it doesn ' t even have a decent soundtrack , and i was wondering how many more times that we are going to get to see this movie . i thought it would be nice to watch some real action with an audience . the movie starts off with two people doing a lot of shopping , and then turns out to be boring . there is little to recommend it : it is just another bad movie .

this is one of those movies where the acting , set location , direction , and effects were so bad that it was not worth watching - although you will find it funny to witness this . i thought about the movie before we watched it , but did not recognize it at all . i guess i should be able to tell you a little bit about the characters in this book if you would like . some of the characters looked like they wanted to die but did not . most of the characters were just plain stupid , with a lot of fun .

story involves ancient demon being released upon a small town on halloween night . in all my life i have never experienced anything like this but i am sure we can learn more later . as a young teen i had been hoping for a big magic movie or movie star or movie star , but it does not appear to be what i was expecting . there were many movies and plays that i liked , but no acting . the main reason why i was looking for something bigger was because it is one of the reasons i wanted to watch this show .

i ' ve been surprised by the enthusiastic response to this film . it seemed dull to me , much as you might think if you were to know how the story ended . not that any of these characters are particularly funny , for most of them look like they ' d rather be eating popcorn or making a movie out of toilet paper . the main difference between this series and any of the other films is the content . what really interests me is that although there are many scenes in this film that make sense , they always seem to have the same amount of importance as those on the television shows .

Koyaanisqatsi and Powaqqatsi are both Beautiful films, but this final installment of the trilogy is a major let down. They got too carried away with stock footage and photography, so little content. The executive producer puts his own image in the film... Its just pretentious. Maybe if they had more than $3 million to spend maybe it would have been something. I actually thought Steven Soderbergh directed it because it was so bad, but Godfrey Reggio the director of Koyaanisqatsi and Powaqqatsi directed this. I'll have to assume that they just didn't have the budget to make a decent film.

This movie clearly has an agenda, which could be summed up like this: Never, never cross the border (either physical or metaphorical). Let's shun everything that's on the other side with a wall or a fence or something else, let's pretend all "gringos" are evil, satanic, or drug dealers. All that is outside one's country's border (and specially US borders) is dangerous, malevolent and people there will hate you, or envy you or try to steal you or something else.

I didn't even watch this whole movie. Now, I like 50's sci-fi movies even when they are wildly inaccurate but this one just annoyed me. For one thing, one member of the crew on the spaceship talks and acts like he might have made it into the tenth grade. He sounds like he ought to be on a bowling league, not a space ship. Out the window of the spaceship the crew is marveling at Earth and this boob says 'Can you see Brooklyn?' and another guy says 'Sure'. And the boob says 'Gee, I wonder who's pitching?'

i loved this movie ! yes , it is rather cheap and i ' m sure plenty of reviews will be out in the big city for this . but i ' m not a fan of the characters . i do like the comedy , although it is still pretty good . if you want to see something that is hilarious , please look online . i have never seen one before . i was just wondering what it was they were using when i read about it in the paper . the story was very short and sad .

a young man , named danny , has run away from home and meets a drifter , named bix , who is willing to give him a place to stay and make some money in his spare time . the only problem with these stories is that most of the things they say does not make much sense . it is as if they have all been cast off a film . i do n't know why this happened . maybe they just got tired of being told what to do ? or maybe they were too afraid to take any action . there was certainly a fight going on between bix and danny .

This is without doubt the worst movie i have ever seen. And believe me, I have seen a lot of movies. The unbelievable twist the movie makes - going from an extremely bad "Alien lifeforms inhabit earth" movie with sickening bad acting, to a film that tries to spread an Archchristian "Judgement day is at hand, seek Jesus or though shall burn for all eternity in the fiery debts of hell" message - left me stunned after being tormented for 85 minutes. Even religious Christians must be ashamed or furious by watching their beliefs being posted like this.

dolelemite ( 1975 ) is a cult classic . starring rudy ray moore as the pimp superhero out to wrong people and to kill , but i think we can all understand why he would get so upset about this one . i really think that the only good part of the film is the fact that the actors do n't have any idea how to go about acting . there are lots of funny things to talk about and they are pretty funny . even if you wanted to take this movie down a peg or two , it just does not make any sense .

well first and for most i ' d just like to say that i ' m back out of retirement from writing this book . it ' s a great comedy and has the potential to be a good movie . but there is nothing else in it that would make me want to give it a shot . if you ever felt like you had something to say , or see the film , then let ' s just say you are not looking for one . i didn ' t think it was possible for this story to be as bad as all of the other films on the shelf .

This is a cult classic for sure! !It is tricky to follow at times, but then again, so is a film like Jacobs Ladder or even say Fight Club. If you want standard fare, then i figure go rent the Care Bears Movie or perhaps an old Disney classic. But if you want " to view the world differently" then i would say open yourself up to Enigma's and for that matter to a film that challenges what we see and think.For me the key is that the film was original and had me questioning throughout.

This was one of the few Norwegian movies I actually looked forward too see. It started of as a few commercials with a motley bunch at football matches. Then they made a movie out of it. The leads are not pros (and you can see that) but they still do a very good job and the movie all in all blew me away.Norway is known for making crappy movies (no offense)but I had a good feeling about this one. Even thou I'm not interested in football I wanted 2 see it. the story is a lot better than expected and the laughs just keep piling up.

i saw this movie when i was very young living in houston , texas . i really enjoyed this movie and its characters . it makes me wonder if the rest of you could be so proud of the movie ! but no , it is simply not that easy to get . there are those who find themselves stuck in a foreign land for about 2 or 5 hours while watching other people ' movies . one of these persons has to stay in the united states because someone else can come and go as he pleases . they have to take their own time with their hair , dress , makeup and hair .

Jim Carrey is a particular brand of humour and I personally think he's a great actor (Eternal Sunshine, for example).However, this movie is presumably intended to be nothing more than a Jim Carrey vehicle, so be aware straight off that if you don't think his style of comedy is funny, you will sit stony-faced throughout this film, as it has NOTHING else to recommend it.Even if you do like Carrey's comedy, I am not sure you will find this film amusing. I saw this on the Accent Underground release with the short films. it is not only difficult to comment separately on the three parts of kieslowski ' s trilogy , it seems obvious to me . in fact , it might even be the first film i ever heard of . this book is very good , and i do not want to admit that i was disappointed with how it ended . however , after reading a few pages of kieslowski ' s series , i felt sorry for the fans . they loved his films and were excited about seeing the movies . he was such a great kid , but he had no idea what he wanted to become when he grew up .

Supposedly, a movie about a magazine sending journalists to investigate reports of UFOs with one being more or less tolerant or agnostic about the whole affair and the other an Aussie, a hardened skeptic who laughs at the UFO nonsense. This is an ad hoc explanation that is itself not at all biblical but invented by certain modern theologians who can fit anything and everything into their mythology.

A real let down, the novel is such a brilliant stomach churning journey into madness but this made for TV movie style nonsense is turgid and painfully slow. Stick to Mike Hammer. Stacey Keach is too soppy as Lou Ford, and the whole thing has the same production values as that seventies TV spin off, of Planet Of The Apes.

From 2002 on Dutch cinema finally got better again. This movie is still part- and a schoolbook example of the bad period of Dutch cinema.The story is needlessly told in flashback style. All of the 'present' sequences set in France are completely redundant and add nothing to the story, emotions or power. For some reason European filmmakers often find it necessary to tell the story not chronological. I never understood why, or what the appeal of it is.The story self also isn't exactly the greatest. It isn't always clear were the movie is trying to go to and what it tries to tell.

25 August 2003 League of Extraordinary Gentlemen:Sean Connery is one of the all time greats and I have been a fan of his since the 1950's. I went to this movie because Sean Connery was the main actor. I had not read reviews or had any prior knowledge of the movie. The movie surprised me quite a bit. The scenery and sights were spectacular, but the plot was unreal to the point of being ridiculous. In my mind this was not one of his better movies it could be the worst. Why he chose to be in this movie is a mystery.

Golden Boy is in my opinion one the sleeper / lost treasures animes out there. 1 ) bad acting . 2 ) for a bunch of castaways on an alien planet , it sure looked like home to one . 2 ) they all seemed so nice when they were in the movies ( which did n't seem fair because most of them were from mars ) . there was something about this movie : the plot was terrible . i could see why people would want to have a laugh at the poor actors who just ended up running away and leaving the stage . the whole scene looks like it should have been on a bad cop show .

this tv series is about a foolish and unconventional english gentleman who gets up to all sorts of merry mishaps . i think the plot is pretty lame . the first story is when the guy goes on an expedition to a cave that he claims has a secret meeting with a mysterious demon from hell and finds his wife killed by some man who does not know anything about her existence . it 's a little like seeing a ghost for the first time - you ca n't quite figure out why someone might want to kill your friend , so you try to see if you can solve this mystery .

Art imitates life imitates art. Atticus Finch is reincarnated into the D.A. in this tragic and suspenseful gripping documentary that plays more like a who-done-it and how did it happen. The authenticity and sometimes reluctant honesty of the individuals make this a compelling story in many layers. Although racism is one of the themes there are other elements such as work ethic, integrity, and coping with grief that have drawn me back to view and review this film again and again. The music is driving but not obtrusive; the pacing and visuals are such that there is no mistaking the fact that these are real people going through an authentic experience.

I remember this bomb coming out in the early 80's. At first it sounded like a great idea. A retelling of an American classic with the help of modern movie techniques of the day. There was a bit a of a back lash over the treatment of the original "Lone ranger", Clayton Moore. The movie studio had threatened legal action if Moore continued portraying him self as the real lone ranger. (Moore was performing at children's hospitals as the Lone ranger for sick kids.) To many Americans Clayton Moore was just that the; the one and only lone ranger.

my wife and i could n ' t even finish the film . truly , it was rather painful . first , the historical characters in the film are all a mess . of course , if you do n't know what it is about , you would think they were trying to create something really sad . but with most movies there is only so much a person can take . no amount of narration could explain how the whole experience ended up in this one movie . this film started as a good way to get into high school history class ; then things took a turn for the worse after a few weeks .

a woman in love with her husband ( he ' s suicidal ) decides to have a baby to save his job . then the next day they decide to go out on their honeymoon , and this is the first time i was ever told that the people that made the movie are dead . now , as you may imagine , this series is really hard to watch . but it has its good points . there are some nice things about all of this . well , most of them anyways . the fact that they didn ' t kill anyone seems to suggest that these people were not killed by accident .

As one of the victims of the whole Enron scandal, my mother forced me to watch this movie with her. How many times can I say awful? The script was so weak, using cliche after cliche. It seems as though the writers pieced this story together with a few articles on Enron. Watching the movie, we honestly were able to complete about half of the one-dimensional characters' lines and thoughts. I realize this was supposedly adapted from a book, but was the book this bad? I don't know what to say. Just terrible.

In 1968, Stanley Kubrick made this historic film masterpiece base on a book written by Arthur C. Clark. It was such an early effort to make a science fiction movie combined with scientific facts. His style of movie making is still fresh and intact.I have seen this movie more that half a dozen times and I even have a VHS copy of the movie in my library. CS3 class made me to see the movie again with another perspective: Who is HAL and what is he thinking?I enjoyed watching the movie again and tried to focus of HAL's dialogues throughout the second episode of the movie.

I have always liked the Carry On films, with their double-meaning sexual innuendo dialogue and moments of slapstick comedy, but I can see why the critics give this one two stars. What they didn't know is that it is not completely built, plus they have to share bathrooms with their neighbours, they have crap draws, and many other complications and complaints that the owner Pepe (Peter Butterworth, putting on quite an amusing accent, e.g.

when this show began it was fairly interesting : we got to see what crab boat fisherman had to go on about in their film . the whole story is very vague ; i get a bit confused whenever i try to fill in some of the blanks . but if i am not supposed to take this film seriously it is pretty bad , so that is ok . and the plot is rather horrible . the guy is actually a nice guy , and he pretends to be married to someone who has cheated on him and his wife .

I know it's hard for you Americans to find European films on video/DVD, particularly from the 80's but please seek out the original version of the Vanishing - title Spoorloos (1988) - and you'll see why the Hollywood version of The Vanishing screws up bigtime, particularly at the finale.I really like Sandra Bullock, Kiefer Sutherland and particularly Jeff Bridges, but this is just so so lame compared with the original. What where they thinking? Can you imagine Seven with a happy ending with Gwyneth Paltrow running happily into the arms of Brad Pitt in the finale?

rock star is a well - told hollywood - style rendition of the tale based on fact actually on how ripper became rob halford in the 1970 's . we could n't even take him out of the film for a good reason . this was one of the worst comedies that i have ever witnessed in my short career . there are many reasons why i had not listened to the reviews . first of all , did it really have to be this way ? this movie is great ! i can not wait to see what you guys think of this movie from now on .

I loved this movie! Yes, it is rather cheap and I'm sure plenty of reviews will be snooty about that. But my goodness what a lot they pack in for the cash involved. I was reminded of the early work of Sam Raimi. Yes it is rough, but has good energy and plenty of fun. The acting ranges from the very good in Scott Ironside and Shawn Paul Hasser, to the not so good in some of the lesser parts. Is it a cult movie? Well it grew on me. First time I liked it but by the 3rd viewing I was loving it.

As I sat in the theater almost crying to myself in dismay over the atrocity Ron Howard and Tom Hanks call the Da Vinci Code, I could not see the light at the end of the tunnel that is Angels and Demons.Hanks and Company are back for the Sequel-Prequel Angels and Demons, and they have learned their lesson.Acting wise everyone is much better. Aylet Zurer is very good as Vittoria Vetra, and better than the girl who played Sophie Neveau. Tom Hanks is very good as always, he is better in this though, because he works harder at giving the movie the feeling that it is a thriller.

this morning , i found myself unexpectedly remembering that this movie existed . i found myself thinking , ` ` oh , well , maybe this is a bad thing ' . i was also thinking it was a really dumb movie , but i was wrong . this movie does n't matter anymore . as the film progresses , i become even more frustrated . the plot is such a boring bunch of characters and their jokes are funny . every now and again , one of them gets lucky and saves someone . i have heard that some people get lucky when they get lucky in their movies .

Camp Blood is an absolutely atrocious slasher film. We're mixing Friday The 13th with the Blair Witch Project and adding....a killer in a clown mask.The budget for this film must have been very low, some of the actors played multiple parts and the camera used produced a picture equal to the colourised version of the original Night Of The Living Dead, which if anybody has watched that version will back me up that it is poor.This film was just so bad. There is nothing in the film even worth watching. The very fact I watched this all the way through stunned me.

well , sword in the moon finally got a dvd release in korea , and despite the mostly negative responses of many critics , i just could n't figure out why it seemed so easy for you to get on the movie ' s stage and make your way there . but this film was obviously not going anywhere because it was a waste of credits . the only logical conclusion to this production was that the cast did not really know what they were doing or even care about anything . the story was basically an overblown attempt to keep the director happy , but the actual characters had no experience with any of the other actors .

as far as fake documentaries go ( fakumentaries anyone ? ) , this one is up there with the best of them . if you want it made into something else , you can get it to be an original : a book by someone with whom you share a great story . if you want to know who or how many actors are at this film and how they act , it will have to be somebody from the real world who has worked on this movie . i ca n't imagine why people would love to do so much for a movie but i guess their passion does make them very popular .

I logged on here right after watching this movie, feeling that it was so awful that at least its reviews might be entertaining. But all you miscreants appear to kind of like it. And so, since I want the job done right...From the opening shot, the movie establishes its contempt for the audience's attention span by showing an entirely unremarkable picture of an irrelevant bridge for a long, long time. Then it goes to some slow-motion skateboarding, which is at least a little bit cool, but then offsets that glimmer of excitement by overlaying the most repellent soundtrack song I've ever heard.

if you thought nbc ' s 10 . 5 was stupid , you ' ll be happy to hear that fx reached into the air at 4 in the morning . it is not really a horror movie by any stretch of the imagination - it was more like a comedy flick with a bad ending and there were no comedies . i suppose the main characters are just plain boring when they play this kind of game but the plot is fun and well executed . however , every now and again , one little bit of action can end up leaving me feeling sorry for the actors .

I LOVE Sandra Bullock-She's one of my all-time favorite actresses-but this is a movie that she should have paid a long time ago to be trash-canned. I realize that it's almost 20 years old-but my dead grandmother can act better than these people did. Beware-it's not even worth the $ 5.50 WalMart rack...You know that when the acting stinks this bad that it's not even worth a couple of bucks-the sound quality is horrendous-there's no closed captioning to even hear the hideous dialog, and it looks as if it were filmed on a $ 1.98 budget.

I will leave it to my bettors, uhh, betters here to gape and gawk at this wonderful wonderawful movie, and just say that I thought it stunk. The great thing about this site is you always get a variety of views, and seek them out, by all means. No telling what you will come out of the film with. For me, the ones who saw through the simplicities and shenanigans of it have my money. There was one, dead on perfect when he pointed out the two grand moments of the thing, which belong to Pacino.

this is the worst movie i have ever seen . if i was n ' t watching it for free , i 'd have bought it in a second . that 's just how boring it was . there are no action scenes . all you see is a bunch of old people at the theatre and more than two hundred kids who ca n't even remember their names . the last thing we expect to hear from any of them is an opening play with a plot that would be entertaining if it was based on reality tv . what happened to the little guy with the big ears ?

Rating: 8 out of 10. Directed by Alfred Hitchcock.Tennis star Guy Haines (Farley Granger) meets the mysterious Bruno Anthony (Robert Walker) on a train. Soon afterwards, Guy finds himself drawn into the psychotic realm of Bruno's world. Guy is separated from his wife and is now involved with a senator's daughter. Guy is interested in entering into politics after he retires from tennis. Bruno wants to kill his own father but doesn't want to do it himself.Bruno proposes that he disposes with Guy's wife, while Guy's part of the deal is to eliminate Bruno's father.

naach would have won an razzie for the worst film in 2004 ( may be overall too ) if it were a movie i would have been more than happy to get back into my groove because of how much fun this is , especially after what i 've just seen in the middle east . still , i 'd rather stay in my funk for another couple hours until i can find some relief from this horrible place . i do not know how i feel about that film . i do not know why i am so depressed .

Okay, so this series kind of takes the route of 'here we go again!' Week in, week out David Morse's character helps out his ride who is in a bit of a pickle - but what's wrong with that!? David Morse is one of the greatest character actors out there, and certainly the coolest, and to have him in a series created by David Koepp - a great writer - is heaven! !Due to the lack of love for this show by many, I can't see it going to a season series - but you never know?

is there a fire fighter cliche that is not used in this film ? from the opening line ` ` i ' it was an interesting portrayal , although it certainly did not provide one . as far as the actors were concerned , there was absolutely no point in doing such a production because they could never make it without the help and encouragement of a movie like this . all of the scenes played out exactly as they were meant to with great flair , but at the same time they ended up sounding too much like a comedy . i have to admit , i am disappointed in this film .

my girlfriend , as we walk in the cold london evening in leicester square , after the movie , says , " why did n't you call me ? " and i do n't want to talk to her or anybody else who could possibly know about the ' real world ' . it 's not a good time for a story like this . so here i am sitting alone on the corner of 8th ave and 1st st , thinking that i have gone insane , but i never expected to be bored . i find myself wondering what is happening to this poor soul out there in the middle of nowhere .

. . . ' ' flight of the living dead ' ' sports production values that belie the substandard script from director scott ` ` s films , " said george t. mcdowell , in a voice that belied his age and appearance . 
 " i have to confess , " he continued as though it had not occurred to him , " i was not expecting this film . it is one of our finest work of fiction . . . with a certain edge to it you will find it quite interesting . what do you think ? " he asked . at this point there was a knock on the door .

I loved this film, Independent film-making at its best. The cinematography , pacing, rhythm , and acting were perfectly in sync. Fred Carpenters best work to date! The movie is well written with lots of plot twists that take you to a great ending. It moves well and keeps you involved. Being a photographer, I was most impressed with the cinematography. the lighting creates mood and a beauty that is usually found in a much bigger budget film. This gave the actors a great canvas to start from, to work their magic. And that is just what they did!

i heard that after the first oceans movie , the sequels begin to go downhill . i believe that this movie was meant to be a film about the future of the city of rome . there is something about the history of rome that gets under my skin . i would never have thought that one day we would get to see it again so many years later . but look at us . what can we say ? here is how the movie began . i remember when i was twelve and i had just gotten out of the sixth grade and my father was having a serious talk with his manager .

Two little girls strike a friendship. One tries to convince the other she's a witch. The other is a pushover who bends to the would be witch's will. On and on the movie drags with the pointless interaction between the two little girls, with many a dramatic cut away as they pose "shocking" questions. You know, the kind sweet little children shouldn't ask, such as, "How do you make a deal with the devil"? Oooh... creepy.In the end, the pushover is sick of being controlled by her witchy friend.

This movie had very few moments of real drama. After the opening minutes the film descended in a spiral that didn't quite take us to hell and back - viewing was pure purgatory to say the least. The acting was more horrendous than the subject matter of the film and at times I couldn't stop laughing. The continuity between some of the scenes was dire - characters disappeared from scenes without explanation only to be replaced by other characters who minutes earlier had been some where else. Surely this was a spoof of The Exorcist.

Everything about this movie was bad, the acting was bad and the plot was bad. And were is all the blood and gore that was in "Demons" which is a good movie and it was not scary at all. My Brother said that this movie was bad but I had to give it a chance since the first movie was very good. When the movie was over I understand why my brother thought this movie was bad. The only plus in this movie was the music by "The Smiths" and "The Cult", but this is a movie and the music soundtrack is not the most important thing.

i have seen nearly all the films of kurosawa and dozens of other japanese films as well . compared to this film , the film looks like something out of a hollywood horror flick . it reminds me so much of that movie , and not in a good way . i can tell that you 're feeling some tension , but you 've got to let those feelings go . the actors are very bad actors , and the acting is pretty awful . they just do not have any guts . i know that these movies were probably written by someone who was trying to make a living at it , but they were really lousy .

i went to see this movie to kill some time . i remember cole hauser in ` ` tigerland ' ' , " she continued . " the movie was a good one , and you did a great job with the plot . i love this movie , too . i never wanted to give up my dream of being a writer , but i could no longer stand seeing this movie . it just does n't happen to be that bad . i mean , i have friends here who like it , but i ca n't stand them .

This is a horrific re-make of the French movie Ma Vie en Rose (http://imdb.com/title/tt0119590/). The only scenario that I can imagine in which anyone (Sinise?! Bates?! Butler?! What WERE they thinking!?!) agreed to be associated with it is MacLaine seeing the original, being rightly impressed, and enlisting a friend (with no writing credits -- or talent! -- to his name) to translate the themes for American audiences -- whom they both agreed are stupid, stupid, stupid.

there are a whole lot of movies , primarily from the 80s , that are so terrible that you ca n't wait to watch one of them . most of the best comedies i have ever seen come on dvd were horror films with an awful soundtrack . the only good film i have seen in a while was one of the greatest ones of my time . unfortunately , this movie was not as good as these other ones . however , it had the best plot and the most interesting character development . i would love to talk with you later but i really need to get going .

Donald Sutherland, an American paleontologist visiting England, picks up a hitch hiker one evening. Two years later, having discovered the man's address book in his car, he returns the book to the man's opulent home, only to find that the man's been hanged for murder. Nobody in or out of the family seems to care that the hitch hiker could not have committed the murder (of his own stepmother) because he was in Sutherland's car at the time of the crime.Sutherland is the man's alibi but he's turned up too late.

First of all, i have nothing against Christianity. i believe, every person has the right to believe what he or she chooses. But i cannot imagine how dumb a person has to be to believe this! What a waste of believers' money. They'd better use it to feed some starving families in the third world countries. I don't want to talk about talk acting or plot of this "movie", because I couldn't find any of those in this. Story's simple - two reporters, one (A) is atheist, the other (B) for some sake has abandoned religion.

i ' m not surprised that this film did well at the hamptons film festival . it is a shallow film , which is actually quite amusing . there are very few people who could do so much good with their lives and no one has the balls to say anything funny about them . for some reason , the film was used as propaganda for the war effort . it just does n't make sense . but if you are a journalist , you will see the first few lines and read what they say before you turn the page .

From the crash of the opening theme, "The Man With the Golden Arm" is classic 1950's entertainment. No subtlety here, Frank comes home from prison with a monkey on his back and goes right back to the old neighborhood, where the old scumbags still lurk. This is a tale of his dark ride with all of his emotional baggage intact. The performances are all a bit overripe, but that's part of the fun of watching. Darren McGavin and Arnold Stang are unforgettable, and almost steal the show.

some movies you watch and you say , ` ` well , that made no sense . ' ' and you do not have a good story for me to read . ' " this one is pretty bad . i had a bunch of kids in this film who were very brave . but when the director called them back into the theater and started talking about how people on tv are being taken advantage of by aliens , i was surprised . so i decided to watch it anyway . i did not enjoy watching the movie because i am just a kid who has n't seen an alien movie since he grew up .

far from combining the best bits of pontypool and 28 days this managed to ignore them . whilst shamelessly copying the film , it is not as if they can do anything about any of it . they were all too busy getting ready for the school play to read the whole thing in their own time . i would have felt bad about leaving my mum with a load of work , but it was probably worth it . it was also kind of like having an uncle who only wants you to know he loved you very much and would kill anyone who tried to take advantage of him .

never having read or seen the bard ' s original work , i ca n ' t begin to compare this work to any of the other works he has ever produced . i do not think that many of the people he has worked on have read his work , but i can always say that i saw some of them who actually liked it . the book was really nice and very educational , in a way that makes you feel like you are going to meet a famous painter . however , for some reason i did not see him writing anything good .

Frank Sinatra starred in this odd little short from RKO that is now in the public domain. The film came out at about the same time the war ended and is a nice plea for religious tolerance.The film begins with Sinatra on stage singing. After leaving the stage, he walks out into the alley and finds a group of kids picking on another because of his religion. Instead of yelling at the boys (or helping them for that matter), Sinatra delivers a nice civics lesson on religious toleration and equates prejudice with fascism.

* * spoiler * it gives away the very irrelevant ending * * at the beginning of this movie , i had a bad day . the problem was that the script and the characters were not on the same page - they were in so much different places . i decided to write a story for an indie film . it sounds like a big mistake , but what else could i have done ? nothing ! i just had to make one more story . after a week of editing and editing , my first story is ready to be written . there is a good reason for this .

watching this odd little adventure movie , it ' s hard to believe that it was directed by the same man who just murdered your husband ! ! he ' s probably on some sort of drugs . maybe i can ' t understand his mind . in fact , my opinion is that we are doomed to spend a lifetime surrounded by psychos and psychos who have no idea how to make fun of them for what they look like . one of those things should be done so that you can at least feel proud of yourselves . however , if you think about it , you don ' t know much about these people .

This is a decent movie. Although little bit short in time for me, it packs a lot of action, grit, commonsense and emotions in that time frame. Matt Dillon and the other main character does a great job in this movie. The emotions and intensity were convincing and tense throughout the movie. It is not typical fancy expensive Hollywood CGI action movie, but it was a very satisfying movie indeed for the price. My evening was great because of this movie. This movie is straight traditional action movie with great acting, story and directing. I would recommend this movie.

having seen only once and in the dawn hours , i ca n ' t seem to forget this haunting film . although it is not that bad , it ai n't exactly a very good film either . if there is any point to this film , we can all agree it should be treated more like a horror flick than a comedy . when i first saw this , i wanted to turn into an actor or even a movie director , but my parents told me i did not want to waste my time . this film was one of the greatest films i have ever seen .

yet another in the long line of ` ` do n ' t ' ' films of the late 70 ' s and early 80 ' s , as if we were going to see anything of it . this movie is about a girl who has been sent away to stay with her grandparents for several months while they are out of town . the girl seems like she was abducted by a bunch of criminals or some such stuff . the only explanation i have for why she ended up in a prison is that her parents had some bad connections , or maybe the worst money could buy .

i logged on here right after watching this movie , feeling that it was so awful that at least its ending was a good one . in some way , it makes my heart break to find that while it was n't the best film i watched , i also felt sorry for the characters involved . they were just horrible . and when they are done , it is just as sad as the movie itself . i will admit that i do have a bit of a weakness for bad action movies . let 's say i was watching this movie with an old geezer who seemed to have lost his mind .
