just awful . it ' s almost unbelievable that , with characters and situations provided by dashiell hammett , such a horrible tragedy can happen to the best of mankind . but the most amazing thing about this is how fast it happens . at the beginning of the movie - which i love more than any movie in history ever did - there is a lot of screaming and gnashing of teeth , then an explosion of action , then someone throws a brick or two against the back door and we are forced to retreat down the hallway .

the violent death of fernando ramos da silva only eight years after the completion of this film , only adds to the intensity of the films . when they are edited i like to give you a good reading about the characters and the dialogue so i can make sure that all is well . while i hate watching a movie like this it is almost funny to watch it with the person who has chosen to put it into the dvd . i know there is more to this movie but if you had seen it on tv or read about some of the real movies then you would be too shocked to say much .

give director stanley tong of jackie chan ' s super cop and rumble in the bronx , and what do you find out . it turns out that they are a bit more successful in the world of serial killers than any movie i could even imagine . if you love crime novels , you want to watch this little sci - fi series . well , this one is n't really a sci - fi flick . it ' s mainly some kind of comedy , which is funny , yet not very funny . on the bright side , most of the movies are pretty much predictable .

I grew up in the 90s; therefore, you must understand that i witnessed firsthand the premiers of the greatest DCOMs. I was there when Brink! appeared, Zenon, Halloweentown, Johnny Tsunami, etc, These movies constitute my childhood. When these movies came on, not only myself but whoever I was watching them with would stand completely in awe for 1h30, talk about it for the week to come and catch it again the next weekend. I don't think words could express the amount of excitement Zoog Disney brought.

I worked on this atrocity ten years ago. Luckily for me, no one knows it because I didn't make the final cut. And when I saw the movie in the theaters, I was glad! My agents were driven nuts by the (apparently first-time) filmmakers, rewriting the script daily and changing their arrangements with the agencies just as often. They later told me that, once back in California (we shot in Atlanta), these "professionals" had 4 1/2 hours worth of footage! Even edited down to 90 minutes, it's at least twice as long as it needs to be.

Wesley Snipes is perfectly cast as Blade, a half human, half vampire known the daywalker. He has all their strengths and his only weakness is the thirst for blood. Since he teamed up with whistler (Kris Kristofferson) he has hunted down vampires who have lived amongst us unnoticed for centuries, but omnipotent overlord Deacon Frost (Stephen Dorff) is tired of living in harmony with the humans (Food as he calls them) and he plans to waken the blood god and take control of the world.This movie is well cast, written and directed; ensuring the viewer has a thrilling ride from start to finish.

Perhaps the wildest outlier in Alfred Hitchcock's career is this straight-out comedy vehicle by the director, pairing Carole Lombard with Robert Montgomery as a couple who discover a mistake has invalidated their marriage. Where do they really stand with each other?Contrary to what others say, there IS an element of suspense here: The idea that these two miserable people might escape each other, free to inflict their awfulness on some other, undeserving mate.It's funny reading comments here about how miserable Lombard's Ann Smith plays out in this film, because Montgomery's role is as much of a heel.

I found this film completely and utterly incomprehensible. I knew some of he facts about Caravagggio, but here they were twisted and puzzling. The images were weirdly interesting but I was looking more for a biographical and/or critical accounting of Caravaggio's life and works, not an LSD type drug trip. The dialogue was very confusing and jumping back and forth in time via the use of trains, calculators, typewriters and cigarettes was extremely distracting. Had it been labelled an "artsy film" I wouldn't have purchased the DVD; now I have a DVD that I'll never watch again and who would buy it?

when watching this movie , with it ' s deterministic cause and effect , wall - to - wall cliches and hackneyed sentiment , can make you realise that you ' ll be living in a new york town for a very short time if you ' re lucky . this is the same kind of hollywood horror movie i was watching before i became a performer at the theater . this is where the characters go from bad to worse , not really sure what they don ' t know . this film has had quite an impact on both sides of the world , including my own parents .

I will never, ever forget watching this show around the age of 13. Even at the young age I remember thinking, "This is a Baywatch rip off show without the one thing that makes Baywatch tolerable. The girls in bathing suits." Nonetheless I was too small in those days to be the holder of the remote in my house. The high point of Pacific Blue was an episode in which a couple of thugged out gangsters are coming to whack someone with submachine guns ... on bikes!!! As a thirteen year old I never laughed so hard at something that was supposed to be taken seriously.

The trailers for this movie promised and this movie delivered exactly what was promised: Good campy fun with lots of very good looking naked broads! If you were expecting a major Hollywood movie with major stars, stellar budgets, and MPAA tamed money shots, you will be *very* disappointed.However, if you are a fan of the old "B" movies with unknown, but very good looking young stars that act amazingly well, given the material, some hokey, but surprisingly well done special effects, and very tight naked nubile bodies, this movie is almost heaven!

Shame Shame Shame on UA/DW for what you do! I was appalled. Do NOT take kids to see this movie. The humor is totally inappropriate for children - plus they'll be bored and disappointed. Certainly *we all* have read Theo's wonderful children book and certainly we have expectations...but this is pure trash. Dr. Seuss would be ashamed and certainly would've never given his "thumbs up" at such a dastardly attempt to capitalize on a classic.What a pity. Spend your money on the book. If you own a copy, then buy the book and donate it to a Toys for Tots program.

As an ancient movie fan, I had heard much about the controversial movie CALIGULA assessed ambiguously as one of the most realistic epics by some and as one of the most disgusting porn movies by others. I decided to see it in the entire uncut version to evaluate it myself hoping to find something positive that would make justice to the many accusations towards the film. I sat down in my chair one autumn evening and started to watch. The beginning quotation from the New Testament shocked me a bit and raised the first controversy in me...why to entail a sentence from the Gospel by Mark in the movie about pagan Rome?

I loved this movie. My daughter is 3 1/2 and a country girl at heart. There are not any movies for young children. I loved this one because the worst thing in it was when one of the boys said "stupid". I applaud them for stepping out and making a true family movie. I rented it the first time we saw it and know looking to buy to add to our collection. My daughter can not stop talking about it. It goes along with our lifestyle. We live in East Texas. I hope to see more family films like this one.

mishima is one of the greatest films ever made . now i think paul schrader is the greatest screenwriter of any of them , that 's why they write so much for this movie . it also seems to have a lot of subplot elements . most of the reviews were negative , as you know , but these critics are very good about what they make of their films . if you look back , you will find out that even though this film was written before 1911 , it was originally released in 1812 , and then filmed in 1953 . we have a whole lot of great movies here .

i was having a horrid day but this movie grabbed me , and i could n ' t put it down until the end . there was this one guy who just seemed to know all about me , and he had this story of how he had known my parents were gay , but they never told him anything about their affair . no one knew why they were in love , except for some old friends who were really into that film , so i guess they tried to warn people away from it . it 's pretty stupid though , and it only made me want to watch it more .

to think this film was made the year i was born . to think people are still having their constitutional rights , no matter what it takes in the big scheme . i do love this film , with its twists and turns - and a whole lot of ' good ' that happens when you go on a road trip . there are moments like this when i can just wish i had n't left the city at such an early age . but there is something so special about watching your own life flash by ; if you really want to be seen then you must see some of it .

This movie is like Happiness meets Lost in Translation with a Sixth Sense ending (or maybe a Crying Game surprise), and the best soundtrack I've probably ever heard...if that all make sense.The first 30 seconds pretty much tells you you're in for a twisted ride. (I was surprised no one walked out right away during the Brooklyn premiere.) But from there, the film settles down into a talk-fest between two really damaged people, Daphne and Buddy.They're lonely, mess-up, and boy do they talk about sex.

it looks b grade and you will probably think there is no reason to rent this film ! but do not be so hard on me for i have been doing this film for over a decade . after some reviews i decided that this movie should be a huge help to us in our future career paths . let us see how many people can say ' hi ' to one of our films and then start making fun of us ? this is very much like watching the first three movies with their own set of bad acting , bad plot , bad acting and bad acting .

i ' ve been strangely attracted to this film since i saw it on showtime sometime in the early 80 ' s when i was a junior , but this film is so bad you can never tell . i do love this movie ( it ' s awful ) , but i really wanted to watch this one . if the story of how my parents were raised by their own parents is about as boring as this one is going to get , there is absolutely no way i could see how they ever found each other after being raised by their own parents .

I first saw this movie in the theater. I was 10. I just watched it a second time and I must say it was amazing. The music, the dancing, the acting. It is a great story and told extremely well. I fell absolutely in love with Treat Williams when I was a kid after seeing him in this movie. One of my favorite parts was when his mom kept yelling at him to give her his pants, and then finally said "how much do you need"? (money). That was classic. ; ).

CAUTION SPOILER: At the end of the movie it is announced that the bridge collapsed just a few days after it was captured. The impression is that the attack was all for nothing. In reality, taking the bridge at Remagen was the last important victory for the Western Allies. It was the crossing of the Rhine that the Allies had been trying to achieve for six months. Because the Remagen Bridge was taken, the war ended in just a few weeks.The bridge only need to last for a day after it was captured.

i ' m not sure where to start with this . in short , it was a disappointing movie . having read the film , i decided to try my best to make some small talk . 
 " what 's your idea of a good time ? " i tried to find out who had won the title . it was probably just a bunch of children playing a video game or watching a cartoon . at this point , i really wanted to know how this movie ended . the acting was great , but the plot was somewhat off . the script did not speak of anything that was familiar to me .

All the criticisms of this movie are quite valid! It is pretty boring, and filled with all kinds of pointless ridiculous stuff. A couple exchanging nods over their "good grub." A medium shot of a desk as a phone rings until someone finally comes, sits down, and answers it at a pretty leisurely pace. Quadruple-takes or more when people look at things. Solitary banjo-tuning and playing, taking a break for a beer. Telling a joke to a fawn, about a big-mouthed frog trying to learn what to feed its babies, complete with many big-mouthed expressions (which are needed for the weak punchline).

love the tpb ' s but this was a lame episode . did n ' t have the same feel that the series had and i watched it anyway . in fact , i would say that they really were an odd lot to watch at the time . if you like p ; 1 or l , just keep reading until you see a whole series of them on the way back . i think they are very funny characters , but do n't try to get your hands on any parts of them . once you begin reading all the titles , you will be shocked how bad they are .

I'm a next generation person...i've never saw the original doctor who but i have heard about the series that sparked a great fan base in the past and still making its mark in the 21'st century; the new "Doctor who" started in 2005 but for those that live here in the states like myself we pretty much see it as new episodes on sci-fi channel or BBC America; from season one we are introduce to a new player Rose Tyler (Billie piper) and a pretty cool new doctor played by Christopher Eccelson (misspelled last name sorry).

during the making of this movie i once caught a statement on television about it . something like : ` ` this was one of the best comedies i ever saw in my life , but now it is just bad . ' there were two things i hated about this movie ( the first was that it was such a stupid show ) . first off , it seemed like the whole episode should be shown to its viewers instead of playing some cheesy romantic comedy where the characters act like they are going to attack someone or else get murdered by aliens .

started watching this but did n ' t believe in any of the characters . in particular the relationship between the bakery and my own job is that i could not figure it out . the fact that the shop was on tv and there were some movies on it does not prove anything . it was a lot of fun to watch because it made me feel at home , so i figured i would just get a new camera and do something with it for the rest of the evening . as soon as i got home , i called my mom and told her what had happened .

This is a low budget, well acted little gem. Alice, a small town Massachusetts teenager, fed up with her existence, takes to the road to escape her mother who flips burgers and her own job as a check out in a super market. She sets out for Florida and to stay with her wealthier high school friend who is a freshman at Miami. After her car suspiciously breaks down on the thruway and she loses all her money, she ends up with a retired couple in an RV who also happen to be traveling to Florida..

There's something strange about the antisocial sentiment you can find in some Cheech And Chong material. One of the songs in Up In Smoke, well, I often wish more songs these days began that way. But in this excuse for a video, the stoner duo are showing us the videos for four songs from their album of the moment, also titled Get Out Of My Room. You hear a voice-over during the opening credits in which some anonymous producer describes the record as being a novelty recording that will just take up room on the charts.

this movie is truly unbelievable , in every sense of the word . i could n ' t believe what i was seeing . the movie was made to portray a boy that had fallen out of love with his mother and she found out he was her daughter . there was nothing romantic about it but for the part where the two young people fall in love , it is extremely entertaining . the story is very old school and quite predictable . after the third episode of the film , don ' t give me a break , because i am just sitting at home trying not to cry .

` ` mr . bug goes to town ' ' was the last major achievement the fleischer studios produced . the quality of the work was abysmal - and not only because it was a waste of film , it was cheap and cheap for my own money . i found it an even worse job in the industry . there were more people who had made this film than those who had done it , and most of them were completely lacking in creativity or skill . i have never felt so alone . if i ever go on a tour with this movie , i will never leave out the important parts .

This movie spends most of its time preaching that it is the script that makes the movie, but apparently there was no script when they shot this waste of time! The trailer makes this out to be a comedy, but the film can't decide if it wants to be a comedy, a drama, a romance or an action film. Press releases indicated that Shatner and Hamlin made this movie because they loved the script (what were they thinking?). If you like William Shatner (I do) see "Free Enterprise" instead.

i have only seen this movie once , when i was about 14 years old , but i was thrilled that it had finally gone to dvd . however , the last episode was so awful that i was afraid to even watch it . what a total disappointment . on the screen was a man trying to kill a woman in an underground bunker where there is no way he could ever escape his imprisonment . all i got was the worst scene of my entire film . i felt sorry for the poor person that was locked up inside and would have been unable to sleep at all .

` ` go fish ' ' garnered rose troche rightly or wrongly the reputation of a film maker with much promise . its then , and only this is an interesting premise but lacking in detail as to how it was created . i am very sorry to say that it will remain so until a sequel comes along . after several years , i will no longer write this movie and i have already sold over $ 5 , 000 credits . i hope you will accept my invitation for a drink while i try to figure out what to do with the next few months .

I love just about everything the late Al Adamson directed in his long and varied career, but "The Possession of Nurse Sherri" stands head and shoulders above fun yet admittedly grade-Z schlockfests like "Horror of the Blood Monsters" and "Dracula Vs. Frankenstein". This film is actually scary! Am I saying that you're going to jump out of your seat when you watch "Nurse Sherri"? No, of course not. But this pastiche of elements from "The Exorcist", "Ruby", and "Carrie" is one of those nice, eerie little horror movies common to the seventies.

I agree with all aforementioned comments. This show was a delight to watch. Funny, witty, terrific acting and zany sets. It's always a thrill to find a show that is smartly written, assumes the audience has brains and displays subtle humor. I would spend good, hard-earned cash money to see it again on DVD. And as long as we're requesting Smart Series That Never Got a Chance...How about DVD releases of Maximum Bob (another well written, odd duck show with a delightful cast of characters.) And add to the list...Middle Ages or Frank's Place.

this was pretty bad - from bad acting , bad technical details , bad camera shots , and bad audio . you could have had a whole bunch of bad actors on their stage . the only one that did n't appear to be very good in the film was john travolta , and i really hated the guy for that . my father says he does n't like him at all , but it sure would be nice to have someone who is a little more interesting than he is . anyway , as we walked back down to the car , i noticed a lot of ' 80s stuff being passed out around us .

Bloody Birthday plays on the assumed innocence of children and shows them as bloodthirsty monsters. Steven (Andy Freeman), Curtis (Billy Jayne;credited as Billy Jacoby), and Debbie (Elizabeth Hoy), were all born on the same day during an eclipse. Besides sharing a birthday, they also share a love of murder (and they're not picky about who they kill either). Young Billy, Elizabeth, and Andy play the parts of these emotionless monsters quite well but they know when to put on the charm too. But they can't go on fooling everyone.

i ' m almost embarrassed to admit to seeing caligula twice . the problems with the production are almost too numerous for me to comprehend . perhaps it was because i had been so excited about learning more about what was happening in this world that i chose to focus my attention on the actual filming of a movie , which was supposed to be a work of fiction and is actually pretty good . i got the sense that it wasn ' t based on reality , instead it was based mainly on how many scenes were portrayed in both films .

i would have to disagree strongly with the previous lame comment . i watched this not expecting too much from this film . the movie was well done in a way i never expected . there were very few scenes that you can actually figure out , but some of them took me aback . what the heck is that all about ? i thought the plot was pretty simple . if i had read the book i probably would n't have paid so much attention to any of the details . it has a lot of technical detail , such as turning one of the actors into an actor .

If this film had been directed by DW Griffith or Stanley Kubrick, it would be recognized for what it is: a cinematic masterpiece, told with depth and subtlety and passion, a film with no equal in the visual realm. It is unremittingly stunning and also very brutal in its depiction of our great heritage of greed and annihilation. And of course, what the reviewers could not abide is it doesn't tell a simple narrative dick-and-jane tale like 99% of hollywood output. Its characters are complex and confused by their passions and thoughts, fears and emotions.

this movie was so frustrating . everything seemed energetic and i was totally prepared to have a good time . i just knew this movie would n't be as good as the one i had watched with my family . if it ever got out that i was having a relationship with them , they would probably get an award for their performance . i was ready to give up on this movie and move on . i never wanted to watch this movie at all in the first place . it was just too awful . there were so many terrible scenes of death and violence .

if there ' s anything worse than this movie i do n ' t want to see it . i remember so many other movies in college but none of the scenes are as bad as this one , at least they ' re the worst . i just don ' t know how to make them better . the first book was a classic horror thriller about three men who were hired to kill someone and steal all their worldly possessions . the second story was much worse : a film about a woman who finds herself caught in an accident while making a trip to las vegas for a weekend vacation .

i loved this show . i think the first time i tried rocky road ice cream was due to this one . it was kind of sad though because at the end of the film there are only a handful of songs that you can watch , which do n't take up your time . the main character is a young man in his late teens who has been arrested for sexual molestation and is being led around like a pincushion . he goes through the entire scene again , then tries to get away and runs into a rock wall . he looks like he should have died in the movie .

Carole Lombard and James Stewart gamely try to inject some life and meaning into this bizarrely constructed film about the tribulations of a newlywed couple. The scenes play as if they were parceled out among various directors, each with a different goal. Some are Capra-cute, some screwball, some melodramatic, and some surprisingly noir. There's even an extended adventure sequence, when the plot suddenly focuses on a small plane flying through a blizzard. It's hard to say which scenes are the most incongruous, when the film as a whole is so erratic in tone, and the storyline not exactly believable.

yes , thats that i felt after i completed watching this movie . the acting is below - average and the special effects are mediocre . however , the characters were quite good , and i really like this one . when i heard of this story , i thought that this film would be a cinematography based on the first few chapters . so i bought it . i was expecting to have to pay $ 2 , 500 to see this movie , but then my eyes wandered over to some other people in the movie and i saw they were very talented .

a great performance by emily grace ! i stumbled upon this movie while browsing my satellite listings and was curious to see what happened to it . when i saw the movie i decided to buy it and watched it for about 25 minutes . it seemed to have a ton of interesting things to tell , so i took a peek at the screen and got excited to find myself in the midst of the most amazing film ever written . it was an all - time standalone movie with just the right amount of dialogue and structure . but unfortunately it was also completely lacking in substance .

this movie was never intended as a big - budget film but was a cute little picture that pretty much anyone could have made . i actually had to watch it several times just to make it go away ! it was a lot of fun and the plot was interesting ; however , i really enjoyed most of the scenes and found myself wanting to get out from underneath the covers and run for the hills . the only thing that kept going through my head in the whole episode was the way we all felt on the screen .

the sun was not shining , it was too wet to play , so i went to the movies , and my favorite movie was " love story " . this made me really sad because that was a good movie , and i never heard of it . why would she choose such a bad film ? i asked her once , and she did not like it , so i got angry about it and turned off the television . in this movie , the narrator goes on and on about the woman he is going to marry . it is horrible , even though i thought it should be funny .

i ' m not a big musical fan , but this is one of the few i really love . unlike the old musicals , this time i do n't want to give it too much thought . all of my friends ( and i ) are great characters . they all have good stories and some are funny . you know what ? they can still sing . i had fun listening to them because i was so close to them before they went off on a tangent . in other words , i wanted to listen to them play for a living instead of having to listen to people who would talk about movies and tv .

six out of seven people who took the time to comment on this movie have very positive responses . the first three were not even remotely good . the last one was quite bad . there is a guy that gets in bed with his girlfriend , has an affair and spends the rest of his life in prison . the other two were fairly good . when they saw this film they had no idea that it was just a waste of space . they got their kicks out of making it all the way through the credits . the main thing that really got them down was knowing that the sequel would be something else entirely .

The name of this film and the clips that I saw caused me to believe that this film would have excitement and interesting moments. I was disappointed. The desert sands were interesting but this film inched along at a snails pace. It started fine with an underground cave and something coming out but then tried to involve us with the lives of some very unlikeable human beings. As they found dead bodies, or should I say, skeletons with some flesh on them, they began a search for the reason why? At times it became somewhat different as something was following them in the desert.

i saw the film at the brooklyn international film festival ( world premiere ) . a haunting , intimate portrait of one of the most beautiful young girls i had ever seen . i wanted to get into that film and find out what the hell is going on behind the scenes . i have found out quite a little bit of what i thought was true . for instance , the movie has an old man , who does n't want to tell us much about his life when he speaks . the director knows there are a few important people in this film , so he tells it like it is .

Enormous suspension of disbelief is required where Will's "genius" is concerned. Not just in math--he is also very well read in economic history, able to out-shrink several shrinks, etc etc. No, no, no. I don't buy it. While they're at it, they might as well have him wearing a big "S" on his chest, flying faster than a jet plane and stopping bullets.Among other problems...real genius (shelving for the moment the problem of what it really is, and whether it deserves such mindless homage) doesn't simply appear /ex nihilo/.

I grew up in New York and this show came on when I was four-years-old. I had half-day kindergarten and this was on WPIX Channel 11 in the afternoon. I just loved the music and stories and remember humming them around the house when playing.I just saw part of an episode on YouTube and for a moment I could remember how it felt watching those shows as a small child. I, of course, stopped watching when I got in 1st grade because it was on before school got out (no VCR's or DVR's back then).

So unfortunately me and my mate watched this!!! It was showing on a Sky channel over here called "Zone Horror" which basically shows crappy B-movie horror films 24/7. It was a boring Friday night, so decided to have a laugh and give this one a look. Apart from the atrocious acting, the awful plot, the dire effects, the shoddy camera work and the brain numbing ridiculousness of it all, it was OK, LOL!!! In all seriousness it was quite a laugh picking holes in it and laughing at the goofy actors.

This movie is dated in so many ways, it's sensational. You can either laugh at it or shake your fists in rage.This movie deals with many problems of American history, but with the typical white-male-Christian-American paternalism: The main character is one of those I-can-do-it-all-and-you've-got-to-love-me-for-it-kind-of-guy. He is so pompous and not to be taken serious at any time. What a horrid creature! His wife is a weak little woman for the first part of the movie and a still very weepy, but stronger character in the end. Too bad she still forgives his cocky ways after he's left her for the second time.

I can only say this: ee03128 from Portugal, I couldn't say it better. The worst movie I've ever seen... and I've seen lots of crap! When I read you comment I thought only about the thoughts I had while watching the movie. When I saw who was one of the script writers I understood it. Balagueró uses the same tricks in all his movies. And his scripts are not much better either. And, of course, in Barcelona we have tons of temples and churches around the city so we can keep cursed nuns to scare young Americans coming on vacations.

Maybe it was the fact that I saw Spider-man the day before I saw Duces Wild, but I do not think that there can be any excuse for this movie being as bad as it was. The cast was there to do it, but it seemed as if once they found them selves with a decent cast they had to try and make them fit into the movie. The only problem was that they did not fit. I did not like any of the characters and the story was sketchy at best. I left wondering why i spent my money on this movie.

2005 was one of the best year for movies. We had so many wonderful movies, like Batman Begins, Sin City, Corpse Bride, A History of Violence.....Coming up we also got Brokeback Mountain, King Kong....But if this year the only great movie that came out was Everything Is Illuminated, then we wouldn't miss all this year has brought. The first movie as a director of the talented Liev Schreiber is a delightful, heart-warming, touching drama that also brings one of Elijah Wood's best roles.

I've read plenty of Jane Austen in my time and approve of several cinema/TV adaptations but this one we just don't need.Rating is a 2 as I wouldn't say it's awful just so boring you will feel like you've wasted 90 minutes of your life. Dull script matched by even duller acting. I've heard Billie Piper is OK in Dr Who (not a fan so can't confirm) but in this she just sucks. There is absolutely no chemistry between the leads. This is Austen, it's supposed to be a romance!Please don't let this put you off Austen or historical dramas.

superhero movie ( 2008 ) is the most recent in the long line over ` ` parody ' ' movie movies which are so bizarre . it is a very large production that takes up only about half of the film . the plot , characters , culture and genre are completely predictable to such a large extent i feel it best to stay with the original story . i have not heard of this film before but believe me when i say that if it ever comes out my head will never recover . however , i am happy to see that one day this may come back to bite you in the butt .

A fairly interesting look at some characters from India's burgeoning middle class. Although India is rapidly modernizing, her culture is not keeping up. This film involves the patriarchal society, where women are not yet truly free citizens. A land of arranged marriages, men who dally with mistresses with total impunity, and women who are expected to tolerate all this, will eventually come up short. I was impressed with Nandita Das, who was quite attractive, and played her character with total earnestness. But I was even more impressed with Shabana Azmi, who I understand is a long-time fixture of Bollywood.

this movie won a special award at cannes for its acting and it ' s not difficult to see why . there are some very nice lines about the people who do n't like the movie . there is one question in the end that seems to have an angle that is more entertaining than the rest . why did the director write this story ? what else was she doing on this movie ? all we know about this movie is that it can make anyone laugh . so , i will tell you a secret . there is nothing funny about this film .

For a teenager who has never read Austen, this adaptation might be fine. But only for them. This is a disjointed "Cliff Notes" version of Mansfield Park, and if you have not seen another version or read the books parts of it would be head scratching.Why has it been so hard to do a good adaptation of this book? The one in the 1990s took such liberties that it barely seemed to be the same book - the mindset was completely modern and prurient.Here we have Billie Piper who looks like a pretty country wench.

this movie was terrible . you could n ' t fast forward fast enough to get to the end of this movie when the movie starts . i have a strong opinion that the actors are pretty dumb . it might be possible to do something like that after seeing the movie for a while , but there is no way i would ever try . the entire experience is just too horrible . why did n't we go to the film with some other characters ? maybe it would have helped us all to have some fun on an otherwise dull night .

The main reason for watching this picture is to savor the brilliant performance of S. Ephata Merkerson. Ms. Merkerson dominates this film with her tremendous presence as Nanny, the woman who believes in doing good, no matter to whom, with no strings attached. This actress clearly shows a range that is amazing.Thanks to director George Wolf for bringing this distinguished cast of some of the best Black Americans actors together. This ensemble group under his tight direction help create the right atmosphere in which the action takes place.Of course, none of this would have been possible if Ruben Santiago Hudson hadn't written his wonderful play.

The opening scene really got me into watching the movie. However, not more than 5 minutes later, I was already gouging my eyes out. Not only could I not understand a word that was said, the acting could have been better by a group of mentally handicapped. The one highlight of this movie was that there was a punk white midget. However, I didn't quite get the connection on how a white midget was the child of two African Americans. But I guess anything is possible. Also, why the hell was Robin in the movie?

Having watched this movie several times, I have come to the conclusion that Milos Forman made a very daring decision to manufacture a muse for Goya, when the artist led what most would consider a tempestuous,passionate life while the French Revolution and the Napoleonic era raged across Europe, surely one that would have sufficient drama upon which to draw. While I do understand that Mr. Forman was relating in the microcosm of the tragedy of Ines' life the devastation of the world at that time, I was left feeling that there was just so much of Goya left out, so much of his humanity.

Watching this film today I got the feeling this thing was missing about 10 to 15 minutes or so from the beginning of the story. John Wayne rides up on this trading post/saloon out in the middle of nowhere to meet with the owner about some robberies. All he sees is the signs of a massacre, some dead bodies, signs of a fight and no one alive in sight. That's because the owner's daughter is hidden in a secret room, the kind you find in old English murder mysteries.The reason you find those hidden rooms in those kind of stories is that they were formerly priestholes.

I just watched the DVD of this award winning film. One Life Stand is a stark drama that through it's pace, black and white shots and atmospheric music, paints a very compelling and honest picture. It's a story about life's dilemma's around power, sex and control highlighted by a few sad lonely lives. The mother (very well acted by Maureen Carr) is uptight and drawn in on herself. The father only appears on the side-lines, and yet is a powerful and pivotal part of the drama.

have seen this movie today . very disappointed and wondered how it could be in the oscar shortlist . the story has gone on for almost a year , but not so much as one - sided or half - sided plot twists . there are lots of good points to be drawn out , including the two characters that were portrayed at the end . i wanted to get something off my chest , but decided to say nothing until after the film was done . i also thought i had a right to ask him questions , like why he came back to his house .

Every time I see a film like this I get sick to my stomach. When I watch a movie I like to see what I see in everyday life. As I go through my day I see blacks, whites, Asians, Latinos etc...How do you cast a film and don't even think of the possibility that other ethnic groups will walk past you? I'm sure they didn't do it on purpose but pay attention. I don't care if it takes place in Kansas or South Central. All I saw was one token black.

rachel and chuck yoman ( valerie harper , gerald mcraney ) , decided the city is too busy and dangerous to risk having someone who looks a lot like don ghanes try to run off for a night or two . they had set up a party for one of the other local teenagers in their hotel room but i 'm afraid there 's no point in trying to do anything that will get them back in . it just seems like the most likely scenario would be a couple of kids sneaking down the street doing something so stupid . i was n't really looking at what happened after they left , i was just watching .

I just discovered this obscure '70s horror movie while browsing on YouTube. For a low-budget effort, it has plenty of compelling moments in gradual pacing in leading to the surprisingly shocking finish. While there is one woman who takes off her shirt constantly, the fact that she's a nymphomaniac makes those scenes important to the story and there's one scene with the curly-haired young man as he attempts to seduce her that turned me on before his pulling back made her screaming mad. The young nurse who comes in and gets hired is alluring herself and I'm not surprised she posed for the cover of Playboy.

This was a sordid and dreary mess. I needed a shower when it was over. It goes something like this- some socialites are murdered and a woman homicide detective is assigned to the case. She discovers that the victims belonged to an underground lesbian society, and she befriends an associate of the group who may have relevant information. Since the detective is an attractive woman, of course she is horny and intrigued (which reveals much about Hollywood and its psychosis about women). What's surprising is that none of this is very sexy or interesting, just depressing and yucky.

i do n ' t understand why this movie was released , it looked like something that you show your mates after they go off to college but what do you make of it ? are we all in love with the same actors , or are we just seeing the same movie ? did we ever see the same film as others , and there was no reason for me to think that a movie made on the bus would have been good enough . then again , if i had spent time watching it at the local cinema instead of at home i would be a lot more likely to put my hand over my mouth .

this film is bad . not so bad it is good . just bad . it is however hilariously bad that the director is to be found here , i would n't have thought they got off to a crappy start at all ! how could people like this movie be good enough for someone like me ? what is the premise of this film ? what is the premise of this movie ? where did we find this movie ? when did it get out ? where are we going to find this movie in this film and what will it do with it ?

gorgeous annie belle in her prime stars in this adventure / sex movie . she wears her hair in a buzz cut and goes to dinner with some of the best friends i ever knew , but is constantly on the verge of losing her mind by the end . if you 've never seen a film that shows people getting along with each other without having an actual love affair , how do you understand so much about it ? it 's like she has no idea what it really means to be gay , or what it actually means .

saw this last night and being a fan of the first demons , i had hoped that the sequel would go much smoother . there were some really bad moments but no worse than these . the most depressing thing was how the movie seemed to come out without any help at all . i do not particularly like the second part of the book and i am quite disappointed in the third half of the series . however , i still think the story will be good for you . it is pretty awful . i just hope you can keep your word and put it into writing .

I think "Rosemary's Baby" is the most overrated horror film out there. Not scary, interesting or much of anything. It's reasonably well-directed and Ruth Gordon was wonderful but that's about it. But this sequel makes it look like "Gone With the Wind"!I caught this on TV back when I was 14. Unfortunately, I still remember it. From what I remember Rosemary's baby Andrew is now grown up and the coven wants him to start taking over (the world that is).

I caught this movie on local t.v. at about 4:30 a.m. I didn't have expectations for it but after the opening credits I knew I was into something good.There are situations that are left for your interpretation to "find out" what really happened so your attention is a key factor.The whole psychological thriller situation deals a lot with character development and the way things are executed by the main character.Your sub-conscience also plays an important part because through a series of events and dialogs you will be able to make a correct interpretation and generate an opinion.The technical aspects are very good.

i made a promise that if ever i posted a comment that was less than complimentary , then later felt compelled to edit it so that it will not hurt anyone else . this film is the worst thing that has ever happened to this movie in my life . there is no way that this is going to make up for any of the bad things that have happened here . but i do not want you to be disappointed , and i can tell from your eyes that you are trying hard to hide what you really want to say when you hear about this story .

this must rate with the worst films i have ever seen . it just was n ' t funny . my wife has not yet been released and she is in a lot of trouble with the law , which makes me feel bad for the fans who have lost their way to see what she is made of . there are many good ones that i have seen over the course of my career , such as this one , but i do n't really enjoy them very much . well , some of them were hilarious , but i never saw a film that could be construed as funny .

as if the world needed another seagal movie . add a bunch of actors who , well . . . are not very bright . but that was all they could get from the film . so maybe you might want to keep an eye out and see if they have any news about this . i do n't know if it really makes much sense . in some ways it feels like it should be easy . after all , how else could there have been a whole group of them here in the first place and they could have just been passing through on their way to the grocery store .

this particular film was one that i wanted to see in theaters , but never got around to it . a good movie can just get dull and the actors are not very interesting to watch . then , on top of all the other things that had gone down in hollywood , i did n't get to see the story from the start . at first i would think there were strange characters ( who lived in the movies ) , but as they became more obvious i saw nothing odd in them . then i realized what kind of people they have to be to work with such a great film production company .

This was a random rental at the video store. But I was impressed from the start. Wooden Camera is a gem of a 2nd feature by an engaging director. The film captures deeply insightful moments and several often times frustrating and complicated social interactions young interracial friends would experience in a modern post apartheid South Africa. The young actors are quite good and well directed in their approach to the core material and the dialogue is natural and interesting. The film is very rich in visuals providing a frame by frame study of deeper understanding and fulfillment without falling into iconic stereotypes and clichés.

Help! Once again, Paul Schrader has sabotaged his own intentions with dull, pedantic storytelling. I rearranged a vacation so that I could see this "world premiere." What a mistake! Why did Schrader even want to make an Exorcist film? Lofty intentions are fine, but if I wanted 2 hours of theological babble, I would visit my nephew's Sunday school. Father Merrin's struggle with his faith, as presented in his younger days, is a potentially interesting subject. But an Exorcist movie needs more! The relentlessly draggy presentation, along with ridiculous special effects, makes for a strange production.

the first time i ever saw this movie was when i was four years old . i remember loving it and being impressed that they were able to find such a great movie . it started out just like we had in the original , but it played out far worse . it was full of horror scenes , which i did not understand , but i liked the show , so i watched it from my place on the floor . i really enjoyed it . there was a girl named laura who came over one night and talked about how awful she felt for her brother .

an under - appreciated , unseen gem . estevez does a remarkable job of illustrating in poignant , heartbreaking fashion , the way we can all get along so well as a group . if one person wants to keep this up , just give him a call . it 's not like he even knows that i am a woman . his wife was very attractive , but they are not married and there is nothing sexual in the way she looks at him . for instance , when she says that she ' s not interested in what he has to offer , she really is looking forward to seeing the big screen .

I will commend it in only one respect.. it was innovative. Innovative doesn't mean it's a good film, it means that it can give you an idea of what you can take and implement in your own films.The simple plot is.. well.. simple. I got to the point where I didn't care if they destroy the building or not. If I had to hear that girl's annoying giggle one more time, I swear I would hurl the DVD out the window. And there's also the protagonist. They try to make him lovable, but he's a freakin pervert!

This is an excellent film, but Momento (Nolan's other big budget film) is much better . I would recommend people go to see Momento and then if they like that, see this film. THe film is shot in black and white which I was a bit annoyed with at first but once into the film you understand black and white is the best way for the film to be seen. It is extremely gripping and reasonably easy to understand even though the way it is made is extremely clever. Elements of the storyline i think are a bit daft but the film is definitely worthy of a second viewing.

I was on a British Airways flight from London to New York when I saw this movie. I wish I could have fallen asleep. The story line was very thin and the editing crew did their best to stretch it out as long as they did.Gary, played by Andy Garcia, was such an unlikable character that I found it hard to be supportive of him. Andy's acting ability is good but not good enough to make up for the poor writing in this movie.Andie MacDowell did a fine job with her portrayal of Linda, Gary's romantic interest.

i think ` ` rosemary ' s baby ' ' is the most overrated horror film out there . not scary , interesting , or even amusing , but it could be quite a letdown when you get through the movie . 
 " at first i hated the movie so much that i just decided it was a waste of my time because it would be more fun on tv . however , later i started feeling bad for some of the other women in the movie who had made their feelings known to the movie . i really liked the way they spoke and how they dressed .

Okay they tell you it's real. They don't list any screenwriters or directors, but one viewing of this movie will prove to anyone - It's not real in the way you were hoping for. The speaking rarely sounds like real natural talk...but also down not sound to be scripted. (possibly loosely scripted). To me it sounded much more like they were always trying to ad-lib. (which they almost always did poorly). Therefore, they knew they were making a 'movie', not just collecting real natural footage.

i rented this movie because it supposedly takes place in a jazz club - - you know , those hip , hipster rock - and - roll groups that come out during the night ? no . it 's not like that at all . it 's really one of those classic film shows about a young man who comes out of the building and is killed by an animal or a group of bikers . it is not funny , so let me finish . this movie was supposed to be good , and i thought this was the most awful movie i could have hoped for but it was a total waste of talent .

I found it almost impossible to empathize with Ricci's character in this film. If she was supposed to be a depressive, I think the screenwriter and director neglected to research depressives before making this film because Ricci's character was more a depiction of a self-centered, worthless sh!tbag than a victim and survivor of depression.The forced attempt at introspective narration was as ludicrous as the pained interactions between her and the people around her. Sorry but I couldn't buy it. This is straight to video schlock. I'm glad I didn't pay to see this.

I actually liked this movie even though this movie seems to be so hated and i think it's even better then The Deer Hunter, which was overrated. Both this movie and Year Of The Dragon are very underrated although i could see why someone would not like this movie. At three and a half hours the movie just goes on too long and the second half of the movie is much better than the first half. Kris Kristofferson and Christopher Walken are fighting over Isabelle Huppert but she can't make up her mind about which one to be with.

after seeing the harry potter movies , i ' ve been a fan of the trio actors rupert grint , daniel roesele and steve carradine . 
 " what ' s wrong with you ? ! ? ! " i scream as i slam my fist on the table trying to get their attention . they just look up from their screen and stare back at me in terror . it does n't help that i really wanted to know what he had to say . i hate when people lie to me . it ' s not worth the price of admission , even if it was true .

I have to say this is the worst movie that I have ever watched in my life, I cannot believe that I wasted $10 at blockbuster ; this movie should be burned and who ever thought of it has issues. Who ever actually spent money to make this movie was insane =D This movie has TERRIBLE actors and some of the scenes make absolutely no sense. Well, the whole movie doesn't make sense. Also the part where those "men" come into the diner ( department of national securities )that happened to be the worst part of the film.

this movie was cheesy and it was more than that . it was about this guy who gets a curse and dies . " i look up to find my mother watching the movie . her eyes are half - shut but her face still has the same smile on it . 
 " i did not come here to make friends or anything like that . you have got to believe me when i say that if this movie were a reality tv show it would be a good one . it was just another way to waste my credits . i watched the movie for some time and decided to check it out .

irene jacob is mesmerizing in this final installment of krzysztof kieslowski ' s trilogy and the story is infinitely satisfying as a result . i am not a fan of that movie , nor do i consider myself one . however , i do know what it feels like to wake up every day without a television . so , i believe there is no reason for me to dislike this film . it is not too far from the truth . you just should have seen the way michael chaplin looks at his wife or how she acts around her kids .

The threesome of Bill Boyd, Robert Armstrong, and James Gleason play Coney Island carnys vying for the hand of Ginger Rogers, a working gal who sells salt water taffy. With the outbreak of World War I, the threesome enlist and pursue Ginger from afar. The first half of this RKO Pathe production is hard going, with the three male leads chewing up the scenery with overcooked one-liners and 'snappy' dialogue that quickly grows tiresome. The second half concentrates on action sequences as the US Navy pursues both a German merchant cruiser and a U-boat.

my mother frank begins as a warm , amiable comedy about a middle - aged catholic woman ( frank , short for " god " ) living in america where her family has always had an eye for color and clothing . the film is based on a series of religious studies that were done at the behest of one of the founders of the american church . she is told to stay away from the religion and never engage with any religious groups or political groups that she might be able to relate to if she wanted to .

I have had the opportunity to catch this independent film and was impressed with it, despite the lack of excitement in the plot. The acting was very good by everyone involved. Amy Madigan played the part of a guilt ridden mother who is tired, yet well intentioned and determined to make up for her younger daughter's condition. Yet, in the process, she has neglected her older sister, who is more interested in playing with her savant-syndrome sibling and living in a world of escapism.The men in the movie are very powerful in their secondary roles.

Ah the sci-fi channel. How often do you disappoint me? Quite often I think, do you ever show good movies? OK you have given me the great 'Heroes' and the reasonably good 'The Lost Room' but they are series, and as for the movie well there really is nothing positive to say. Bad acting, bad directing, terrible characters and a shallow story, and that is just for starters. I checked out the director Allan A Goldstien and was not surprised to find nothing of interest in his resume (in fact I am half thinking that this is a pseudo name).

First of all, let me say that I am in no way denying the importance of the subject - quite the opposite. I am Polish and I have been aware of the Katyn massacre for quite a long time (in fact, two of my family members died there), so I was looking forward to this film. Unfortunately, I was disappointed.I think the main problem lies with the script, which encompasses too many subplots and characters, none of which are properly developed. The characters are painfully one-dimensional; their stories are intertwined, but lack overall meaning.

this movie has some good performances , as others have pointed out , but suffers ( as others have pointed out ) a great deal from the premise . i found it rather hard to see where it all began . i could not believe that these people would ever want to be actors . their roles were so terrible they could only be seen and read in the movies . no matter what we thought , or did , or saw on tv , they just were not my first choice for them . there was one other reason i liked the film .

From the fertile imagination which brought you the irresistible HERCULES (1983), comes its even more preposterous (read goofier) sequel: right off the bat, we get another unwieldy "beginning of time" prologue which even contrives to completely contradict these same events as set up in the first film! ; a condensed montage of highlights from same is soon followed by a SUPERMAN-like scrolling credits sequence. Narrative-wise, here we have four rebellious gods who steal Zeus' seven all-important (but poorly animated) thunderbolts  a crime which, for one thing, sets the moon careening on a collision course with Planet Earth!

Wow. What can I say? I was born in 1960. I love bad TV movies. Love them. I get involved. The works. I want to get involved. I'm spending time watching the thing. I watched the emmys last night on TV. How in the infinite world was the Empire Falls (excellent name)TV movie up for any awards? It truly had wonderful talent. Of course. And they tried admirably. But how can ANYONE pretend that was an OK (tv for goodness sakes) screenplay? OK direction?

i am not understanding why people are praising this movie . i did n ' t like it at all . i was just trying to save some money and get my life back together . that is one of the worst movies i have ever seen . i wanted to go to college but i did not want to do so . i think i would prefer to spend time with someone else who cares about me . there was nothing romantic in the movie . i got an idea and decided to read through a couple of titles . the first part was a little too bad .

what an awful movie . full of cliches , perplexing scenes , very bad acting , and an atrotious script that makes it difficult to know what to say when they have to . the ending is so boring that you can only watch it for about half an hour . i 'm sorry , but i have to give you a chance to relax and enjoy this movie . if you want to watch this film , i would like you to think twice before you do anything silly like watching something like this in the flesh . please just take the time to enjoy this movie .

supposedly , a movie about a magazine sending journalists to investigate reports of ufos with one being more or less accurate than another . there was only one major story , which is quite the problem . in this particular case it seemed that ufos were sent on a wild goose chase before they reached the country . the author said the film had not been released for nearly a year and it was not yet available in any type of book . i wanted to make my name known at first , but i could find no record of me being able to write the screenplay .

How in the world does a thing like this get into my DVD player at home? How does it even get to be packaged and distributed? Are there absolutely zero screenings a movie (and I use that term loosely) have to go through before it's put on a video store's shelf anymore? I'm all for DIY film making but come on! That doesn't entitle me to get a group of my friends and relatives together, a crappy camcorder, an awful story and put it all together to create a heaping pile of crap and call it a movie.

its all my fault . they all told me i should avoid seeing this movie because im a huge fan of the show and it took me two hours just to watch it . when i finished it , i felt that i was getting out of the habit of watching it but i ca nt help wondering what is going to happen when i die . i mean i have seen this movie many times before but never watched it in person . i am not sure if i wanted to watch it in front of the cameras or if i just wanted to feel some type of emotion other than being mad at myself .

I just viewed Eddie Monroe and I was very impressed. The story was easily paced as the plot unraveled to a surprise ending. Heartwarming performances, action, humor, and drama filled the screen. Topnotch acting by some talented Long Islanders. Great script. This is the best film that Fred Carpenter has made to date, he should be very proud of this work. Doug Brown's score is on the mark. Craig Morris is the next Tom Cruise or Brad Pitt. Hard to believe this is a low budget, independent film. Just imagine what Carpenter can do with a Hollywood level budget.

I read Angels and Demons about 3 years ago, and I can honestly say to is one of the few books that I couldn't put down while reading.The movie however was pretty much what i expected, a lot of action, with somewhat of a mystery storyline. Tom Hanks plays, in my opinion, a much better role, of Professor Langdon than in The Da Vinci Code.You won't have to worry about this being as bad as The Da Vinci Code, this is everything that it wasn't. Much more interesting, more action, more suspense, and less of the unneeded controversy.

norm ( an ) ally i do n ' t mind remakes . there are some pretty good ones out there , so it is possible to find more than half of what i think there are . but that only makes it all the more interesting . this was not exactly a good way to start the book . i would have preferred something better . but since i am having a difficult time doing any other thing , i will say this . this book really stinks - it smells like a dead animal that has been eating its own tail for two days .

i have lost count as to how many times i have watched this movie. i've never grown tired of it since this is a movie that can be enjoyed and interpreted on so many levels. they just don't make movies like this anymore.after recently finally watching the riveting documentary on the making of this film (Hearts of Darkness:a filmmakers journey into madness), i'm even more amazed that this film even got finished, yet alone turn out so great.the fact that they actually filmed this movie in the jungles of the Phillipines is the film's greatest asset.

this film is great ! being a fan of ` ` the comic strip presents . . . ' ' i just knew i should be in that movie when i was a kid and not now . . . ' , i am going to take this opportunity to say thank you for doing so well on this one . but i can not thank you enough for the very first three months of my life . it also shows that people who believe that they are safe from the law have a hard time believing what they are seeing .

A lot of the comments seem to treat this film as a baseball movie, but I feel this is only secondary. It's really about living in Japan, and it really succeeds.I spent a few years living in Japan, and I suppose the reason that this movie didn't do too well is that you sort of have to have experienced Japan to get it. I was watching this with a well-travelled friend who's never been to Japan, and he noted that many of the events in the movie were so ludicrous that they destroyed the suspension of disbelief.

I must say: out of all modern korean martial arts movies this one is worth checking out. It wasn't as epic as Musa-The Warriors and didn't develop the characters as well, but it had many nice ideas. Simple story: a elite soldier thought dead, returns after years to end the reign of the Japanese in Korea in medieval days. His counterpart was formerly the best friend he had and now he is out to stop him. The fight scenes are all with sword or different weapons and very entertaining to watch. The motives of the figures are discovered first near to the end.

1st watched 8/7/2004 - 3 out of 10(Dir-Brett Thompson): Silly, juvenile-focused movie about three kids being zapped into their favorite cartoon with their parents experiment. The script left much to be desired in this Hanna-Barbara like rip-off of some Saturday morning 'live-action with people in dinosaur costumes kids show' with some goofy cavemen hanging around. Nothing really to admire about this and nothing much to be said either. I'm just amazed I found this at a Blockbuster video store as bad as it was and the way the stores are ridding themselves of old VHS movies.

the opening scene really got me into watching the movie . however , not more than 5 minutes later , i felt like i was watching someone die . in my mind , i can see the blood and gore being poured out of the body and onto the ground . this movie could n't be better as it is the best thing i have seen in a long time , and for the first time ever , i actually get to enjoy it . when i say watched , i am talking about three movies at any given time .

My son Adam (5 years old) is a big Scooby Doo fan. He like this film a lot. He particularly liked when the Loch Ness monster tried to attack Shaggy and Scooby. The vote score is his choice and reflects his love of the characters.Having seen the "Vampire Rock" film first, this, not surprisingly, was very similar as they repeat a well worn basic plot in a different setting.Few adults will come across this without having their own memories of the TV cartoon series and even fewer will watch it without children. You either like this or love it.

for connoisseurs of bad movies , galaxina is a true gem . with truly horrid dialog , acting , and dialogue i 'm not sure what this movie even exists for . still , there are a lot of interesting characters . i hope the book will bring me out of my funk again . although i could make a real money as an actor if i knew what i wanted to be when i grew up . that is until i found out about the horror in which i had to leave home for so many days . at least i 've met some cool characters in the movies .

buster keaton was arguably at his most enjoyable when he did short 20 minute films , and they do n ' t make movies like the ones we just watched . this is because it 's more fun than what i saw on television , except for the fact that there is very little comedy in this movie . there were a great number of scenes where the characters seemed to be doing something different than they should have , which is totally unlike the way some of their actors act . i can not say i understand why either one or both of these guys are working for the dod .

i have been looking forward to the release of this dvd ( and it ' s follow - up { female prisoner scorpion series } for over three decades . however , after having spent two years trying to find a sequel to one of these videos , i simply couldn ' t take it any longer . in the end they all ended up being filmed at the very last minute and i decided to go with the original plan . if not for the film , this movie would have been a disaster . now there are lots of bad movies like this one .

When the Legends Die is a powerful, moving story of an orphaned Ute Indian who goes on to become Tom Black Bull, a champion bronc rider. Raised in the old ways, Tom is given a white man's name and must adopt the language and ways of the white man to live in that world. Bitter about the role he has been forced into, Tom finds fulfillment doing one thing, busting horses, riding them to death, in the rodeo. The movie has Richard Widmark in the role of Red, the man who befriends Tom and acts as his manager.

something not - so - great . ` ` silence of the lambs ' ' remains demme ' s only good film , and i ' m of little use to you at this stage . i ' ve seen better but i don ' t seem to be on it . perhaps you should leave the film in the back of your mind . that ' s the kind of movie you like to watch . i ' m not much of an actor . i did once read one of my father ' s many book reviews .

who said it had to be believable ? do yourself a favor and turn off your ration before you sit through the worst of the movie . when they come out , you probably wo n't know what happened . i am so excited about seeing this movie that i forget all about my homework . i go home after class and ask if there is going to be something in it that i can watch while i write a story on the internet . nope . just an old book with a picture of the dead guy sitting by himself at the end .

This movie was pointless. I can't even call it sci-fi, since that requires more from a movie than merely taking place in space. "Max Q" isn't even set in space for the entire movie. The story/plot is unoriginal, the cast isn't anything to write home about, although it would be strange with a top cast in a mediocre film... Furthermore, it's not particularly exciting or well-told. At least it's evenly balanced in a low quality sort of way, in that nothing or no one stands out. Everything is equally bland.

The Adventures of Hercules has to be one of the lamest excuses for a movie I've yet run across. You would have to look far and wide to find anything that approaches the level of ineptness on display in this movie. Acting  Bad. Editing  Bad. Direction  Bad. Special Effects  Bad and Laughable. Plot  Bad. Lighting  Bad. Cinematography  Bad. Costume Design  Bad and Silly. Everything Else  Bad. Watching The Adventures of Hercules is about as enjoyable as a root canal. Even for a fan of bad movies, it's a real endurance test.

why do people make bad movies ? did n ' t anyone working on the picture know that what they were making in this movie would be so great if you watched it ? there had to be someone who could help us . i just wanted to go back to the old days where everyone would laugh at those films . i still remember watching them on television when i was first here . we had no one to laugh at , but that does n't stop people from acting and doing terrible things to improve their performance . the director of this movie made me memorize this movie because it is very funny .

This was Gene Kelly's breakthrough, and that alone makes it memorable. Throw in Rita Hayworth as his love interest and comedian Phil Silvers of all people as his sidekick and you have the ingredients for a real crowd pleaser, which is exactly how it turned out.Kelly plays Danny McGuire, a nightclub owner in Brooklyn (Brooklyn is always the "wrong side of the tracks" in '40s films) whose star attraction and love interest is Rusty Parker (Rita Hayworth). Rita is lovely, and even plays a dual role as Rusty and Rusty's grandmother.

well , first off , the twins are exactly the same . there is no one is girly and one or two girls are good , but i do n't see anything wrong with having a lot of other girls who look great in those pictures . secondly , we have to keep it simple . this movie is all about little girls and boys . i can imagine that most teenagers would be looking forward to seeing someone like us make love on a big screen somewhere . as a matter of fact , i was hoping that maybe if i saw some action in this movie , you 'd want to watch it .

wow . . . i suspected this one to be bad . . . but now i find myself just at a loss for what to do next . it makes no sense at all . the movie was stupid , really ! there were only a handful of real characters that had anything in common with this particular character ( although the fact that he was the most gorgeous guy you could think of made me think that his character was nothing more than a little old woman ) . as we were leaving the theater , i heard a voice speak and when i turned around i saw a young girl standing on the sidewalk .

Our reviewer from Toronto told you what you need to know about this film (except note that it needs editing-the hand held technique gets really old, really fast). I saw this film last night in Menerbes, France-we are in the Luberon Valley, which is covered with vineyards and of course wine makers. They were all there in the Salle de Polyvalente for the showing-crammed in. Polite, patient, genial. Although my French is testy, I got the gist of the film but noted that the audience loved the "old" terror growers interviewed-esp.

the writers missed so many opportunities and created so many plot holes . example : when dave retrieved his keyboard from the trunk of his jeep , he had no idea it was just there for a minute . he could have gotten it for some other kind of purpose but did n't . that is to say , he could have gotten it for anyone , but not him . i would never let that happen . i mean , why waste this much money on you when you could be saving money for a better story ? dave thought he could find something better - a more believable ending .

What a silly movie. While it looks nice, it doesn't make a lot of sense. On the one hand, the film suggests that Juana's "madness" was that she was just a woman ahead of her time. On the other hand, she has an obsession that is right out of the worst Victorian novel of the wronged woman, and that does seem a sort of mental problem, like Miss Havesham in a castle. This movie is what Elizabeth would have been if Elizabeth had not been able to get past Essex's sexual attraction.

MASTER PLAN: have the winning team in a deadly tournament. One of several martial arts action pictures that attempted to capture the flavor of the famous "Enter the Dragon" from '73, this one is an effort from South Africa. The villain's stronghold is a bit different, appearing as a white castle-like fortress in the middle of the desert from a distance. The villain himself, a Baron or general, is a slightly more perverse version of the "Dr.No" or Han mold of master villainy, having strange flashbacks to the glory days of Nazi Germany.

A thinly veiled attempt to push Hulkamania to the film going non-wrestling fan. What could be worse than Hogan in the movies? Bad actors in the wrestling ring, and this film produced both, as Tiny Lester made his way to the WWE that summer in the mother of all promotional blunders. See the dictionary under Oops. As a card carrying member of the stupid kids of the world paid to see this in theaters and when I came out I immediately checked into H.A. - Hulkamaniacs Annoynimous. I am proud to say I have been off the Hulk for 17 years now and have never had a craving since.

OK, this movie wasn't good at all. Video games aren't what I would brag on if I was over the age of 15. Cool to play games, but writing a comment about video game players may like this movie for that it is, that is strange. Just play a video game, don't make up a sorry story about getting trapped in one. I use my cell phone, I hope I don't loose my girlfriend in that. Grease being the worst ever? OK, Grease has a very well thought out story along with being a musical.

In Extramarital we see B-actress Traci Lords at her very best. She's all wrapped in horror & suspense here, a type of role that suits her very well.This mainstream movie lends a lot of its atmosphere from Paul Verhoeven's 'Basic Instinct' (1992), by the way. However, there are differences between the main female characters of Traci Lords ('99) and that of Sharon Stone ('92). For instance, in Extramarital Traci adds some tiny elements from her porn-past. We also shouldn't forget mentioning Extramarital's three main actors.

i ' m sorry but i just honestly can not see why anyone would actually like this . it ' s stereotypical of all the movies or movie stars in the world , except for the ones that have a good laugh . you ' re too young and naïve for this type of crap . the film was written by an old man who didn ' t know how to do anything else . the director explained that there is only one thing worse than a movie where the characters behave as though they are on some kind of medication or something .

our family ( and the entire sold out sneak preview audience ) enjoyed ` ` the guardian ' ' . kevin costner is extremely interesting . i never heard of him , but i have heard about him in the school book club , or on television . it is one of those things you do n't really like to read for the sake of finding something interesting in it . in this movie , there is nothing very interesting about the way people are acting . they are not acting at all , they are just pretending to be actors .

Korean cinema has the ability to turn genres on its head, and the latest by the celebrated director Chan-wook Park is a tale of a good pious priest who becomes a vampire. Add a temptress leading him astray and a cast of eccentrics and you have a wonderful recipe.Directed in part in a style similar to the "Sympathy" trilogy it's as sumptuous as it is dark. Steering clear of cliché it does offer some new tricks in the overdone vampire genre. Its an existential movie trying to capture the moral conundrum of how exactly a person has to choose to live with their conditions rather than revel in the blood lust.

it ' s hard to work up any enthusiasm for this awful cartoon - like epic that for some reason has become a horror movie . the plot is really lame and so are the characters . i just want to laugh , but i could ' t do it in front of the whole class when they all had to watch this crap ! i wish i could find some kind of film that was funny . no matter how hard i try , i can not come up with anything even remotely funny at this point . everything about this movie is absurd ! there is nothing funny in this film !

Wow! It's hard to put into words my feelings for this episode. Ice is one of the best episodes of season one for sure. It's my favorite of the season. Six people and a dog in a claustrophobic structure isolated in the middle of the arctic with an unknown organism that causes murderous aggression, the drama can't get any better than that. Paranoia reigns supreme as even Mulder and Scully have doubts about each other's sanity. I've heard people complain about this episode's similarities to the movie 'The Thing'. I haven't seen it, so I wouldn't know.

the movie is great for venezuelan tourism , birds , birds and more birds . only 1 piranha . nice to know how they can be eaten . i thought i was having a great film but i did not really pay attention in the script when i first heard about it . this one is awesome . the story centers around a man being killed by an animal . apparently there are some bad people who want to kidnap him . he goes off alone and tries to find out what went wrong with his body . he is very badly beaten as if someone had put a gun to the back of his head .

this movie was very cute and totally little girl appropriate . my nieces have watched it non - stop since they ' ve seen it , but in this case we did not like any of the movies . one thing that i think is strange , there are no playstation 3 games to try and play at all . instead , we just watch video clips of everything that happened in the two weeks or so before the outbreak . the main reason this movie was selected is because it has such an easy and well - made storyline . i really loved this movie .
