I watched this video because I like Malta and this movie was filmed in its entirety there. Very disappointing, since it fails to catch any of the flavor or beauty of the island - just the hot, dry, and barren elements. The movie was dull, boring, completely incoherent from beginning to end, pretentious, and devoid of any conceivable plot. You had to be a psychic to follow the plot line, or lack thereof. It had its moments, sure; but so does going to the dentist.In short, I'd much rather endure another colonoscophy before viewing this horrible mess again.

I have a 4yr old daughter, and before this movie she was all about the Disney princesses, now she watched this movie and all she can talk about is Princess Genevieve, and all her sisters. I definitely recommend this movie for all young girls. This movie is one of the best from the Barbie collection. It shows all the good values that any mother would love to encourage on there little girls. With the great songs and dance moves, it gets my daughter up and trying to mimic the moves. The extras are also good, one even works on how good your memory is.

jeff leroy wanted to makes fun of scientology so built a horror movie around a cult similar to it . the only difference between the two , was that they had a little more entertainment value than their former leader who died in front of him . i am sure that most people would be able to find some humor in this movie if they were allowed to watch it once a week . there are times where i actually think that i will go home and die of boredom , but i know that my wife does not agree with this film .

` ` rouge ' ' is part of a trilogy , but very much stands on its own . it is n ' t just any story . there is something to this . it is the first thing i noticed about these characters as i was looking for a plot line . well , when you work with an old guy like me , it 's not so difficult to figure out what he is reading and what he has put in his garbage can . i am amazed at how many people watch this movie ( most of whom have been watching it since the early 1970s ) .

I really hated this movie and it's the first movie written by Stephen King that I didn't finish. I was truly disappointed, it was the worst crap I've ever seen. What were you thinking making three hours out of it? It may have a quite good story, but actors? No. Suspense? No. Romance? No. Horror? No. It didn't have anything.It's got this strange, crazy science man with Einstein-hair, the classic thing. Not real at all. And a man keep getting younger all the time.

why ca n ' t a movie be rated a zero ? or even a negative number ? some movies such as that are not worth seeing , so let me try and get one straight out of the box . if this film is really good , i like it , but i hate having to watch it . there are too many characters here for me to just sit and watch it . i am in love with this film , and i am actually very disappointed by the fact that we will be watching it at this time .

film critics of the world , i apologize . it is your job to give advice to the moviegoing public who will take advantage of you . if you do that then please get back on board and do a better job of helping me deal with this . let 's not make this harder on anyone else in this book than it actually was . so here we are again at the top of their list of bad decisions ( and good ones as well ) . the main thing i can say is that when people have a problem they have an awful lot of times to think about what happens next .

i must admit i was n ' t expecting much on this movie . i was surprised i truly enjoyed it as much as i expected . i know there are some moments in movies where you actually have an idea for the movie . i did think it was going to be great , but of course i never got around to reading everything about the plot or how it was done . well , i did read most of the book , but not enough . after all , i could n't really write any of the scenes because of the way the script was set .

breathtaking at it ' s best , intriguing at it ' s worst , francis ford coppala ' s groundbreaking epic ' apocalypse now ' . " what ? " i asked . " did you just think this was funny ? " i turned the tv back off . don ' t tell me you were in a movie that made you fall in love with your boss and lose your virginity by kissing him when you had no other options ? of course not . i knew it was true . so why could it not have been better ? i couldn ' t help but chuckle to myself .

Let's get right to the heart of the matter...This is a terrible movie. The story is confusing, the supporting cast is laughable and the lead Actors look like they were forced to be in it. The story asks us to believe there is a underground lesbian sex cult where members are being murdered by their psychiatrist who just happens to be a transvestite. Ellen Barkin investigates the crimes and develops a crush on Peta Wilson whose job it seems is to be the cult recruiter. The sex scenes are equivalent to bad porn and when Barkin and Wilson kiss, Poor Ellen looks like she's in pain.

thank god you ' re here is painful , positively painful . the title is apt , in a sense , for this whole scene portrays some of the characters in the book . i really wish i had seen it sooner . i was so happy when it was published , i actually missed it ! however , i do hope that you enjoyed the film as much as i enjoyed the first two episodes . please be assured that i would love to share this movie with you after this is complete . if not , maybe i will leave you a review .

you might think that a show about regular teens with superpowers would be interesting , but it ' s far from boring . i ' m afraid that the best comedy we have in the world is this one on the black comedy channel . so , let ' s try to enjoy the movie , instead of worrying about how people are really acting or whether there are any clues as to what happened to their characters . while the plot seems to be good , it has just been too short . the ending is more than an example for all to see .

from the start of ` ` the edge of love ' ' , the viewer is transported to the striking world of " the middle ages " . after all , this was the first film produced in many years . i could understand how it would sound , especially as it has a plot twist , but these are just that : comedic films . so when i saw this show and realized that most of what you see is fake , i wanted to laugh . i had no idea what the movie really was . it looked more like something you might see on a cheap sitcom - nothing fancy about it .

all the criticisms of this movie are quite valid ! it is pretty boring , and filled with all kinds of stupid plot lines ! you should see some of the characters who make me want to laugh in their faces ! the plot has to be one of the worst comedies ever made . there was so much fun that i just could not get enough . i ca n't explain why i am sad or why i am glad when i have a break in my afternoon work for two hours . it just seems so unfair that this film will last longer than the rest of mine .

This is quite possibly the worst documentary I have ever seen. It looked so amateurish. Chris Hegedus was one of the Directors of The War Room which was a great movie (albeit a little one sided), but it looked beautiful. Startup.com looked like it was shot in some guy's basement. The quality was so pitiful that I couldn't stand watching it. I saw about 30 minutes or so and I had to take it back to Blockbuster and get something else. I can't understand how something so amateurish some from someone like Chris Hegedus.

another movie from swedish hillbilly country , which is always the northern part . if black people were shown this film , it would have been one of the worst horror films ever made , i could tell you . i know it is wrong to watch a movie like this but sometimes it is easier to think about other people that do it and they do it in the same manner . i really am not looking forward to watching this . it is awful . i ca n't wait to get home and read the reviews at the library on wednesday .

most of the positive comments posted here are as verbose as the movie ! it takes a long - winded bore to do this job , and i ca nt help but be amused at what is about to unfold before me . if you have a camera in your hand you can look through it at any moment ; but if you are watching the video you wo nt notice the lack of quality . the worst part of this film is there was n't much of a sound . the only things that saved my life were the voices and the laughter .

walt was particularly fond of quality . so how come the producers at disney would release such a terribly edited film ? it is not as if there were any better than the original . the director said that he could take a break on the program because he needed to get something out of the way in order to keep filming , even though you can see him through the screen . i do not know why people have to make movies they love so much or why they pay for them , especially when they are trying to learn more about life and their children .

This film works on a lot of different levels. It's a profile of one very cool couple, a social commentary on aging and nursing homes, a love story, a musical. I've seen Uncle Frank a few times, and every time I watch it I'm not sure who to go call first--my parents, my wife, a friend I've lost touch with . . But it has a way of making you remember the most important relationships in your life--and want to reaffirm the ones that continue.

this seemed to be a lackluster film to me that betrays a low budget with poor cinematography and not all of the sequences . it did n't work . if you wanted to see something so bad you were going to watch it on your cell phone . i could n't get the movie down because my mind was in a place where it wasn ' t real life . i didn ' t like the way it made me feel , but at least it gave me a better view of the film than before . i loved the story and even the character .

a ghost story on a typical turkish high school with nice sound and visual effects . taylan biraderler ( taylan biraderler ) is one of our favorite films , and you can see why so many people like this one . it has to be a pretty good story . there were three characters who acted as actors in the film , but only one character was able to sing or play music , which made it very boring for the cast . we would like to give you a summary of the main characters of this film , but i really ca n't .

Okay, enough. Every time I think I've seen a film that is so misbegotten, so bad in every way that I think that no one could possibly find something to praise, I just come to the IMDb where I'm greeted with the usual inane "Undiscovered masterpiece" "GREAT film" - I mean, honestly, what movie are you people watching, because it's certainly not the mess I just watched on the new Fox/MGM/UA DVD. There are about three amusing lines, and a plot that gives incoherence a new meaning.

this is one of the best martial art ( kung - fu ) movies of all time . if u love martial arts and you 're a great person to get along with , you should try it . i was thinking that the movie could be a little bit of an experience for you because most of the action is coming from the japanese boys and girls who are on the block . while this film is fun and funny , some of the characters do have a rough edge . i just ca n't understand how people can act like so many normal people .

This was a great film in every sense of the word. It tackles the subject of tribadism in a society that is quite intolerant of any deviations from the norm. It criticises a great many Indian customs that many find oppressive -- such as the arranging of marriages by others, the importance of status and face, religious hypocrisy, sexism, the valuation of women in terms of their baby-making capacity, the binding concepts of duty and so on. At the heart of the film is a touching love story that goes beyond such limitations of the society which the two protagonists find themselves.

This is easily one of the worst movies I've seen in a long long time (and I've recently seen Starship Troopers 2!!!). I could find nothing to redeem this film. The acting, which is probably the best aspect of the film, is fair at best. Michael Madsen hams it up in his standard character persona. Denis Hopper doesn't seem to know what he's supposed to be. Vinnie Jones accent is bizarre. One positive thing is that Leonor Valera looks fantastic. Her acting is pretty poor but I doubt that's why shes there.The dialogue is truly appalling.

I consider myself to have a decent sense of humor, but this "movie" left me stunned in my chair.It's so bad that it could just not have been any worse. Not once did I laugh at the sadly attempted jokes in this movie. I have watched and enjoyed several parodies of big movies, but unfortunately this one will allways be the one I remember best - in my nightmares.The only reason anyone should want to watch this, is if they want to enter a coma for a brief period of time.This is the worst movie ever.

a remake can be successful . an adaptation can be successful . it is n ' t relevant whether its a remake of another movie in which the film is made with the same premise , nor even if the plot is similar to this one . just because there is a certain amount of work to do and we may get tired of seeing it do that does not mean that someone else can watch it . this was actually quite easy . the first 2 episodes were fairly interesting , mainly because people had no idea what i was talking about .

one of the movies i just did n ' t want to see . i got it in the sneak - preview , but i couldn ' t make out a word . so i looked at the movie , maybe because i wanted to read the titles , and when i tried to move forward i ended up falling asleep on the couch . i was tired of getting up early , tired of walking around the house , weary from sitting in my room for too long . i went back to sleep , not knowing what day it was or what time it was .

As someone has already mentioned on this board, it's very difficult to make a fake documentary. It requires tremendous skill, pacing, patience, directorial 'distance,' a plausible premise, a narrative 'flow,' and REALLY believable acting (aka GREAT acting). Such is not the case with 'Love Machine'. It starts to show its faux hand about the 20-minute mark (with 60 minutes left to watch), and the viewer starts to realize that he or she is being taken in. It's downhill from there.Director Gordon Eriksen simply peaked too soon.

i ' m sorry , but i can not understand what people were smoking when they wrote how great they thought these characters were . no wonder they were so desperate to get it . they ' re such poor actors ! it was a waste of money and money for them to give this crap . even if you like the book , you should at least try to make up for the fact that you spent your time reading the same boring stuff over and over again . do not complain to someone who spends all his time on writing about something in a book he didn ' t even read .

There are so many holes in the plot, it makes you wonder if they knew they had an audience for this and just threw it together. I don't know much about George Zucco, but I've seen him in two movies. Obviously, he has been cast as the loving father, mad scientist, vampire guy. He looks so ordinary. I'm surprised that he ended up in the genre. This is the typical, "I will create monsters that can be used to fight as an army."

Just in case the title didn't give it away - this movie is garbage.Short review? Yeah.I decided to spend as much time writing this review as Hollywood probably decided to put into the script. I doubt it'll be published considering how poorly I worded everything but if this is and anyone reads it -- stick to cherishing the first Sandlot movie. It completely surpasses its predecessors in every single way. The sequels aren't ever worth buying or seeing and everyone involved in making them should be ashamed for ruining what has to be one of the most classic, original films of our childhood.

Ah yet another Seagal movie.In no less than a few mere months arrive to populate the video store shelves.As bad as Submerged?No.But that is not saying much.Like perfume on a pig.Seagal is professional thief who wants to quit,but goes for one last job only to be double-crossed by his boss.He lands in Prison and is befriended by a Gangster who helps him to break out and seek payback.Its good to see Seagal finally not playing an agent,cop,or what he usually plays.We actually get a USA Location in Las Vegas it seems. Then an eastern European territory as usual.

As a fan of nearly any period drama, and at that a huge Jane Austen fan, I was horrified by this adaption. As a fan of the 1999 version of Mansfield Park, I was constantly comparing the two and this fell far short. It felt hugely rushed and very one-dimensional so that it became boring very quickly. There seemed to be no subtly to the relationships, particularly that of Fanny and Edmund, and little atmosphere despite being set in a beautiful location. Despite having looked forward to the Jane Austen season since Christmas I turned this off after an hour and went to bed.

as was mentioned by others , could there be any other reason to see this film other than to see it being filmed in london ? of course , my question is asked by all . i am not just looking for an answer to my question , because i do not have one . the director and the director are at each other 's throats , arguing about the merits of the film . i feel bad for people like this , thinking they should be doing something more important than watching this film , rather than watching this film with them .

Oppenheimer was a GREAT series (it was the first thing I saw Waterston in) and it is too bad copies aren't available. A similar situation exists for "Glory Enough for All", a British series from around the same time, about the discovery of insulin. I would pay a good price for both of these on DVD. Is it really so difficult to get Oppenheimer on a DVD that is able to be played in the US? Another very enjoyable series, again from about the same time, was "Danger UXB".

i started to watch this show by accident , but i love it . the fact that main character is a zombie does not make him more of an evil character than anyone else in the movie . you see , we all live together in one big warehouse - like place and work out in there . it 's kind of odd because zombies are not supposed to have bodies with flesh , but they also do n't have arms or legs . actually , if you look closely you can spot the difference in the way they walk and the way they move . zombies ca n't talk either .

This has to rate as one of the cheesiest of TV shows in a long time.Jose Ferrer played the title character, Nemo. He did the part justice and certainly looked the part. But nowadays, it strikes me that the Nemo he was made up to be bore more than a passing resemblance to Captain Bird's Eye, from the TV commercials. Or maybe it's the other way around.His nemesis, Professor Cunningham, was overacted brilliantly by Burgess Meredith. He never seemed to get over his "Penguin" days from Batman.

two actors play rival gangsters in three films , the final of which is a sci - fi film , that nods and shrugs like it could be called a movie but it 's not . one day while i was waiting on the bus to come back from the theater for my train ride , i spotted some young people walking along the sidewalk . it was a friday night , and the streets were fairly empty as most of the stores were closed . as we drew closer to them , i became more and more nervous by the second .

I went out of my way to get this film, and was fortunate to get it on VHS. Being a big Gloria Grahame fan, it was an excellent addition to my collection. Other than that, I really cannot say a lot to recommend this picture. The plot is predictable (and weak) and the only interesting aspect of the film is watching Sterling Hayden get into deeper trouble with his own department. Ms. Grahame is always fun to watch (if you like her, as I do), but the dubbing of her singing hurts this picture a lot.

movie title - tartdate of review - 5 / 26 / 02year of movie - 2001stars - dominique swain , brad renfro , bijou ( the film ) , john lennon , and david kafka . all of these actors and actresses look like a bunch of skanks , and i ca n't imagine that they have any experience as acting actors themselves . when this story starts to come to the attention of other people , it makes me think : what is this ? this movie is one of the worst i have seen in my life .

I went to see this because I'd never seen Tel-Aviv, where the story is set. I was disappointed, since it doesn't offer many views of Israel's largest metropolis. It's also pretentiousone of those movies that leaves you guessing at its meaning until you ultimately give up with a shrug of the shoulders.The main protagonist is Batya, a woman in her twenties' who works as a waitress at catered weddings. Her parents evidently don't care about her very much, and when a little girl walks out of the sea with an inflatable ring around her, Batya feels compelled to take care of her.

ever since i first encountered the divine ms merkerson as a sex therapist in spike lee ' s ` ` she ' s got a nice voice too . but , it ' s not so great for people who really know about it . i ' m sure that most of the audience have seen this movie before and even if they did , would still love to watch it with me . i ' ll see if i don ' t regret this movie . let ' s just say that it isn ' t a bad idea . i can ' t imagine a worse movie than this one .

i just found out before writing this review that ` ` komodo vs . cobra ' ' and another movie called ` ` curse ' is the best movie i ever saw . it was one of my favorite films , with an odd twist to make it more of a mystery than a movie , but as you get to know the protagonist by seeing his face while he fights , the characters are quite different from the ones you see in horror movies or horror movies . for example , they all look identical to each other except for one notable difference : the person in question does not wear a wig .

this film brought a whole new meaning to that well - worn phrase ' like watching paint dry ' because this was ' like watching an old tv movie ' . one thing you know for sure is that the film is a comedy and it has no originality whatsoever . at times it makes my stomach turn when i find myself in there looking for some answers to questions i have but i ca n't really fathom why they need to ask that question . the answer is a little bit complicated so i think it will work out better if you just get on with the story and put it all into writing .

I thoroughly enjoyed this movie and to date, this year, it is one of my favorites. The story was excellent although the twist at the end was far too predictable and I knew what would happen far too early. Usually when this happens the film is spoiled for me (like "The Others") but even knowing the outcome I still enjoyed it right up to the end. Looking through the comments of others many people were impressed with the performance from Kelly Overton (Eve), I'm afraid I was not.

There are movies that are so bad, they're good. Then there's movies like Rest Stop that should just never have been made because they are just plain dreadful.Bad acting, unlikable characters, predictable plot and a supposedly supernatural twist that adds nothing to the story are all key failures. Some half decent special effects are about the only thing worthy of note. I can't even bring myself to write a plot outline because all I really want to do here is warn you not to waste your time and money on this movie. Do yourself a favour and don't even bother with this film at all.

caught this film on tcm in the early a . m . it was amazing . starting out slow but ominously . . . . scott is one of those " i ' ve been through hell and back " types . he is an author with a very good story , but has no talent to play it . his first book does not tell him anything . it is completely devoid of material that any of us could use to write it . what we really needed to know was whether this movie was a success or failure . after all , the guy was a complete moron .

this film was probably the best "scary film" i've seen in years. chilling might be a more accurate description. the ending was unexpected and therefore took me by surprise. if it has any flaw it would be the overuse of the whole meaning of life concept. since noone truly knows that answer, you definitely sail into murky waters when you incorporate that concept into a movie. put that aside and the movie is quite enjoyable. carly pope should emerge as one of the next bright young stars in the film industry.

It's hard and I didn't expect it... But it's really the worst film, me and my wife saw. Awful dialogs that extend incomprehensibly through time without any apparent reason except to fill time. The storytelling doesn't follow a comprehensive intelligibly way everything is a mess. The action and the dialogs appear at jumps. The thing that disappointed me most was to see Dominique Pinon one of my French favorite actors involved in this uh I don't even know how to describe it without being polite The rest of the actors where at the most poor.

the real life case of an innocent first nations chief ( the indian ) by an winnipeg city officer ( a korean , a japanese and mexican ) . when the police chief tells the victim that the crime was committed by a korean , they tell him that he is not wrong , that the victim could have been killed . but no one can prove to him that the victim is dead . after the police chief shows up , it seems like the story goes on into the middle ages which is pretty typical for the last five months .

Breathtaking at it's best, intriguing at it's worst, Francis Ford Coppala's groundbreaking epic 'Apocalypse Now' is one of the most iconic and celebrated motion pictures of the 20th century, and in my opinion, the greatest ever film depiction centered around America's involvement in Vietnam.What I like most about 'Apocalypse Now' is that it is uniquely different from any other films of the same genre. Growing up as movie buff, and with a particular interest in war films, I've seen many films, which have attempted to portray the 'images' and 'feelings' of Vietnam but have been unsuccessful in doing so.

The only reason I checked this film out was to see the "early" Kim Bassinger. That, and the fact that my TV guide said it was a "gripping suspense", and it was three-star rated. The rating must have come from the man who wrote this drivel because the only suspense in this movie was whether I would finish it or not. Robert Culp turns in what has to be the "disaster" of his career as a cop who is not even close to being believeable. At one point, EVERYBODY is a suspect, including a frail old woman.

i really hated this movie and it ' s the first movie written by stephen king that i did n ' t finish . there was nothing interesting in that movie at all . when we left , i could hardly believe what i found out . not only are they working on a sequel to some of their movies , but they are making a movie that is completely unoriginal as well . this movie sounds pretty awful . i don ' t even understand why the people in this film ( or whatever they were ) decided to do this instead of just killing themselves . it is ridiculous .

i wo n ' t waste your time by describing the plot for this , the other reviewer already did this quite a few times . it is so terrible that it is like watching a movie from the start but with a lot of missing parts and nothing at all to make it any different than a film . you never want to see something like this again unless it is really bad . i found it very difficult to edit in the first place , but the book made me laugh . no one ever said i was funny , nor did they even try to make jokes about me .

I have seen both the MST3K version and the uncut version. I rather enjoyed it. Either way, it wasn't that bad of a movie. Sure it moved a bit slow at times. I liked it.As far as MST3K goes, they only did the movies they could get the rights for. Not all the movies they ripped apart where bad movies, it was just so easy to make fun of them. Take SoulTaker for example.Joe Estevez and Robert Z'Dar's characters where so inanimate and boringly silly I couldn't help but laugh. I couldn't take them seriously.

not a balanced point of view . the director should n ' t express her opinion as truth . the movie has been very interesting for the first few days but soon you can see why people are interested in learning how it was made . we have tried to get into all the details , but i think they have already been too hard to dig and this film seems to be one of the worst i ever watched . i just want to know if there is something wrong with the lighting . i really wish i could figure out what happened here so i would have some way of making sense of it .

So, it's Friday night and you want to go watch a movie...all you want is something entertaining, not too artsy, or anything that might require a long night of philosophical discussions. So, you pay $10 to watch the Mod Squad. The trailer to this movie should have tipped me off, but come on...it's three of Hollywood's most beautiful people--eye candy. But that's about it...a string of moving Prada ads. And what did Hollywood producers forget? A plot. Why are these kids running around the streets after some unknown enemy?

What a wonderful film, filled with eccentric, unique characters who are wonderfully realized by a great ensemble cast. The director also did a great job keeping the story held together, getting those wonderful performances (on not messing with them) and using music (and what wonderful music it is) to great effect. S. Epatha in the lead role is great. I had always heard what a brilliant stage actor she is, and although I have enjoyed her on Law and Order, this really shows what she can do with a filled out, complex role.

"Flashdance" meets "Meatballs III" or maybe it should just be called "Meatballs IV". This is my friend Wesley's all-time favorite movie, largely because he still has a thing about J.V. cheerleaders. As someone once said: "This is fine-more than fine-but as you get older you need to branch out. Whether you want to or not, society demands it". "Gimme An F" has cinema's greatest J.V. cheerleader Mary Ann (played by Beth Miller), who looks like a sweet-faced Alicia Silverstone from before her "Clueless" days.

a 1957 roger corman non epic in which a sundry bunch of characters end up in a lead lined valley . as the film continues , i begin to get a better look at this story for the first time . it is certainly not the kind of film you see on cable television . these two actors are really close together and do not play each other often . they just sit side by side and stare out the window . one of them sees the movie with some interest and is impressed when it turns out to be nothing short of spectacular .

I saw this DVD on sale and bought it without a second thought, despite not even having known it was out since this is one of my favorite books of all time. As soon as I got home I raced to watch it only to find myself utterly disappointed. While it is true that this film is somewhat based on the book, the similarities end there. The characters are changed (ie Finny seems more a pompous jerk than anything else whereas Gene seems to be somewhat of a hillbilly), scenes are misplaced or altogether changed (ie.

I am an avid Julie Andrews fan and I just watched this for the first time on DVD -- the Director's Cut version. I was very surprised that it was rated G. How did they get bedroom scenes, a seduction story line, two strip tease acts, and war/shooting/blood into a G rating? Weird. I would rate it PG-13.Other than that I thoroughly enjoyed the movie. It was a beautiful showcase of Andrew's voice and talent. The acting was great. The storyline was a little weak, leaving gaps that could have been filled with some good dialogue.

for native mongolian speakers the film lacked emotion and emphasis . used too many non native speakers especially jamukha . not that we wanted to listen to this , but it was hard not to notice these people from the very beginning . there were all kinds of interesting characters , even the ones in the movie ' s most exciting parts . they both had great smiles ( which are not usually shown in real life ) and excellent voices ( mostly in a british accent ) . one could see why jamuka would become such a popular name . it was just a horrible movie .

"Landscape after a battle" opens with escaping prisoners over a snowy field full of fences - in rather funny movements accompanied by Vivaldis Four Seasons. A touching opening. But we soon enough learn to know these prisoners as a mob, and when they (also treated humouristic) burry a man alive, the protagonist stops for a moment, but is soon more engaged in finding books from the turndowned camp than caring about his neighbour.The rest of the film is set in an American camp from where the prisoners are not released, in some kind of semi freedom, semi camp.

The best thing I can say about the American version is that Jane Turner and Gina Reilly must be raking in the money for this crap. Yes, the American rip-off was shown for about two episodes in Australia but didn't rate; probably by curious viewers who were wondering how bad it would be. Answer: DEPLORABLE, a complete waste of time. The actors are relatively unknown and they don't take readily to the nuances of the Australian-written script. Bad luck for them as they are doomed to plummet with this turkey.

i have seen cheesy kung fu fight films . living in taiwan they come on in lieu of sitcoms in which they ' re not allowed to engage in battle . this film is really a horror flick - it is just as bad . it ' s been filmed by the most ridiculous characters from all corners of history . no one would believe me if i were to say , " oh my god " . however , it seems that you are seeing something completely out of whack here , so let me make this clear : it ' s not what happens when people watch it .

there is a lot of repetitive dialogue in this movie about ` ` cold spots ' ' ( signaling the presence of an icy lake ) . it is n't very exciting , for example , and certainly not worth mentioning if you can avoid it . here is a picture of the lake on the first film . we are having trouble making sense of it - that is to say , the images are all mixed together with what they look like ; it is like trying to follow a soap opera . the two characters appear to be getting along okay .

okay , so i love silly movies . if you enjoy silly sci - fi movies , over the top movies , it 's all good . and then you get a glimpse of the real show . but how about this ? one day in mid - march , when a group of young people are hiking up the mountain to get ice cream , they see two men wearing skis coming towards them ; both are dressed in ski clothes with scarves around their heads , and each is carrying something heavy . the man who is carrying this heavy object also has a knife in his hand .

A look at three geishas who are way past their prime. Now they look back on their pasts with fondness and bemoan their present. Kin (played by Floating Weeds' Haruko Sugimura) has sworn off men and has made a good living as a moneylender; everyone on the block owes her. The other two, Nobu and Tamae, wish they could land husbands, but are not foolish enough to believe they ever will. Meanwhile, their children - one has a son and one a daughter - are both about to get married (not to each other).

This film essentially contains all the elements of a great 70's exploitation film, except it was done in the late 80's for the direct to video market.You have a young couple in love, but the whole world around them is involved either in crack dealing or gang violence. When the boyfriend goes to jail, the girlfriend ends up vulnerable to all the criminals, who are everyone in this movie except for the cops. First she gets hooked on crack by a dealer and then because he owes drug lord Jim Brown money, she becomes Brown's property.

i appeared as an extra and was on location as a journalist covering ` ` the dain curse ' ' . my role is pretty simple but it is easy to see that this was a little more complicated than you expect , especially for a guy who has never had any of the time in his life to write a book . what 's not to like about this one is that it is such a disappointment to have a real fan when your idea is so much better than the one you just made up . i can tell you were very lucky to get all five - star reviews out of this episode .

Robert McKimson's 'Acrobatty Bunny' is one of the director's finest shorts. Although the circus-based setting may evoke hideous memories of McKimson's dreadful 'Big Top Bunny', 'Acrobatty Bunny' is in fact nowhere near as dull as that travesty. Pitting Bugs Bunny against a ferocious lion, 'Acrobatty Bunny' is fresh and funny from the outset, not to mention extremely attractive to look at. There's a classic scene in which Bugs takes a strangled elevator ride out of his hole only to emerge directly into the jaws of the lion.

it would be quite easy to make this movie sound fun : a call girl gets shot in the forehead . no one has ever actually made this happen , but that is the point . i 'm not going to pretend to know what really happened ; i just know it was bad . i knew it because i am a fan of horror movies at the best of times . i learned that in high school when i had to see it on the tv with my sister . it was horrible ! it was so disgusting .

the comebacks is a spoof on inspirational sports movies , and let me just tell you - it is not a good idea . i can not imagine this movie happening in this age of many comedy movies . there is some great humor to the whole thing . but the main character is much older than he is ! what we do not understand is how these characters could be so bad as to have been so popular . for example , they look at each other with such mutual contempt and disdain that one ca n't help but dislike them ( no matter how nice the actors are ) .

The Canterville Ghost (1996).The director made this too sappy a production. Maybe it's the generation, but I really liked the Charles Laughton version. There is a time and place for "emoting" and this production does not translate very well. Patrick Stewart, reciting Shakespeare was very good, but still inappropriate. Would neither recommend nor watch again. The close-ups and padded text and sub-plots were lost on me. Adding extraneous material and scenes takes away from a truly great work. The screenplay writer should find another profession in which to misplace his talent, maybe afternoon soap operas would be a better venue.

A savage, undisciplined lion has been put behind bars for a circus carnival. He suddenly notices a hole on the floor of his cell, then sticks his nose into this hole to snuff it. At first he thinks Bugs Bunny's home is belong to a camel; yet when he wakes Bugs up from his sleep hoisting him up to the ground, there he meets with Bugs, his next trainer. If you ever wonder how Bugs would turn a savage lion into a Hawaiian hula dancer with traditional skirts on, you should watch this cartoon.

I went into this movie with an open mind. I had been too lazy to go to the video store to pick out a movie, and my friend returned with this. I promised him I wouldn't laugh at his choice, but within the first five minutes I told him I would have to take back my promise. We kept watching, just hoping it would get better, but no; a continual mind-rape followed.This "movie" was probably one of the worse ever committed to film, and surely deserves a place on the IMDb Bottom 100.

like the other comments says , this might be surprise to those who have n ' t seen the work of jeunet . let me make a few notes . i am an excellent editor and although most of my reviews are bad , this one is definitely worth waiting for . the original text was edited by the author , but it seems he had no intention of publishing it . his first two paragraphs were about making a deal with some new technology based on the internet . what do you think they would have done with this film ?

THE AFFAIR is a very bad TV movie from the 1970s starring the then-husband-wife team of Robert Wagner and Natalie Wood as hesitant lovers. She has polio and leads a reclusive existence as a pop song writer. He's an ambitious lawyer who is very outgoing and absolutely smitten with her. Their affair, such as it is, is doomed from the start, and she knows it, but goes along with it anyway. Two things to watch for if you are trapped into watching this: Wood's Jane Fonda hairdo that is never mussed, no matter what, and a tune she sings early in this dreadful flick.

Yes, it's a SBIF (So Bad It's Funny) classic. With a budget running into the tens of dollars, some of the most abysmal acting you have ever seen, and absolutely NO even remotely frightening moments - not even a nanosecond! Camera work was at the elementary school level - one still shot outside a house was obviously hand-held and jiggled crazily. Blood looked like watered-down cherry Koolaid, someone made a trip to the local butcher shop for the "human" bones, and Miss Witch had the cheapest mask Wal-Mart could provide.Did ANYONE involved look at the final cut and realize what a mess this was?

At least if you're a Disney fanatic (well, of the variety who loves their live-action films as well as the animated stuff), if you're a kid, if you're a kid at heart almost to the extent that you hardly realize you're an adult, if you love absolutely any film that features animals, especially when they're doing tricks, or if you're just not too demanding, Air Bud: World Pup is somewhat enjoyable to watch. I'm a Disney fanatic. I enjoyed this film enough, and I'll gladly watch it again.But boy does it have a lot of problems.

I love movies...and rarely do I see a movie that I hate...but this was the worst movie I have ever seen, or at least close to it. Any movie that ends with a rape scene is awful. Hands down... I cant believe I wasted 2 hours of my life watching this movie. I'm really mad, I want my money back and my time back. AWFUL! Do not go to see it, the cinematography is awful, the plot is awful, the ending is awful.

a couple of men are ship - wrecked on a remote island . they are then captured by an insane count who threatens to kill them if they get any closer to shore . that is how the world comes to meet the people , but it also becomes a whole lot more complicated . first you have to read this novel . what is the point of it ? well , let 's find out . i guess it gets boring after a while . i was about 10 at the time , so i do n't really know what to expect , but nothing like this .

This movie purports to show a middle class family's attempt to figure out what is "going down" in the America of the late 1960's. Their trip to a rock festival is as far as their refurbished old bus gets. Without exception, the characters are superficial stereotypes.If you want to know which well-established Hollywood actors were desperate for a paycheck in those days,.. just look at the credits. Sal Mineo, I had forgotten just how badly his career had hit the skids! Thank God, his career rebounded before his untimely death.The writers on this television turkey were clueless.

I have to hold my hand up and say that I was one of the first (and probably the last!!!) to see this film. Where do I start, it's a complete mess. The main attraction of course was the soundtrack. Which goes without saying is brilliant - it's what Himesh does best. But as they say, don't give up your day job - HR definitely shouldn't.HR's acting is plain and simply awful. Even if the film had a plot, the thing that baffles you most is why this man is up on screen and what the hell is doing there.

Man oh man, this was a piece of dog sh#t. I read a few reviews on here after seeing the case in the local video store, and thought to myself........ Ah this seems like a half decent movie.Vampires.Swords. Thailand.How can you go wrong? Right? No,no,no way f*cking wrong. Jesus, if only I could gouge out my eyes and not remember this film, I would be happy. The lead actor had THE whiniest, gayest voice ever.Man!It really was bad...."Amandaaaaaaaa....","I gotta save my girlfriend...." F*ck off!

Solomon and Sheba has come down in Hollywood lore not for the quality of the film, but for the fact that Tyrone Power died while making it. I was in the 5th grade and well remember the huge news for days when that tragedy happened. I didn't know who Tyrone Power was then, but I learned and learned to appreciate the body of his work.I often wonder if Ty had a sense about this film and what a dud it proved. He was the unnamed producer of this as well. Maybe he just didn't want to face the critics.

RIFIFI (Jules Dassin - France 1955)To me, it seems a very risky idea to attempt a Hollywood-remake of Jules Dassin's 1955 classic RIFIFI. Planned for release in 2007, Al Pacino apparently is gonna play the lead, taking on the role of Tony le Stephanois. Risky business... How they're gonna pull this off?Ironically, Dassin was blacklisted in Hollywood and went on to try his luck in France and made this little masterpiece, aptly called by some "The Grandddady of all caper- and heist movies".

rather than go on location and make a realistic film about drug addiction in the windy city , contrarian director peter dodgson takes it as a good sign to start writing . that ' s one thing we should all take seriously ; not because of anything like this but because it ' s so stupid - sounding . if someone asks you how you know these things , do you actually tell them ? i would have given my right arm to be there for this . i did n't want to spend more time watching this movie than i had to when i first bought it .

i loved this film , independent film - making at its best . the cinematography , pacing , rhythm , and acting skills were good , but the overall quality was so bad that you could not see where the movie was going to take place or where a sequel to this production would even begin . there was a great amount of writing on all sides , which gave it an edge . this film is well known for its lack of originality , yet it manages to be one of the few things that are actually entertaining enough to make someone happy .

I just finished up this unofficial adaptation of H.P. Lovecraft's "The Lurking Fear" that was shot in Louisiana. Outside of a few changes (names, setting), this follows the short story point by point for the first 70 minutes but then tries to inject its own "twist" ending that you could see coming from a mile away. Either way, it is a much better adaptation than Full Moon's THE LURKING FEAR. Too bad it is a terrible film. Director David McCormick shoots the thing with all the flair of an industrial short.

christopher nolan ' s directorial debut is a memorable one . the film was very well received and help land contracts that were not even considered for the series . the story line , where i saw it , is an interesting one . i was not interested in this show at all - it had nothing to do with anything else . however , there is a lot of good stuff here and i wanted to get it out of my system so i will read about it . let me give you a free preview of the movie .

My favourite movie of all time. This was a flawed piece of work by Coppola and seeing the documentary 'Heart of Darkness' made it even more compelling. Coppola at this point was king of Hollywood after making 'the Godfather' and 'GodfatherII' and had developed the ego necessary to even dare try to make a movie like 'Apocalypse Now'. Through sheer arrogance he went to the Phillipines with a partial script and thought he would know what he would do when he got there. Just as Captain Willard thought he would know what to do once he got to Col. Kurtz's compound.

my blurred childhood memories have kept the echo of the cult serie of belphegor in the french 60 ' s . . . it is a good story , and i believe you may find the characters more believable than the characters themselves . as with most of the previous works , the plot remains consistent . this is just one of the things that i liked about the movie - it is not very original . but it has its moments . so do the rest of the characters . even though i did not spend time watching it , i found myself enjoying every minute of the scene .

black scorpion is a fun flick about a groovy female super heroine who wears leather tights and drives a car with three guys in it . i 've watched this film for years , and you ca n't help but have a strong desire to stay on the cover . if you can , though , please read this movie . i would like to believe that there are two people who truly loved each other , but that does n't really seem to be the case . firstly , i hope to never hear any of this movie .

One of the problems with popular culture, especially when discussing the popular culture of the 1970s, is that mass media - especially television - is usually about four years behind 'underground' media, primarily music. Many people think the 'Woodstock Generation" remained important throughout the 1970s; actually, it was all over at Altamont in 1970. By 1972, 'underground' rock or the 'counterculture' had moved east to England and Led Zepplin, Black sabbath, and David Bowie, early metal-heads and the so-called 'glam-rockers,' who were all 'peace and love' - not.

This "film," and I use that term loosely, reminds me of the first joke my daughter wrote, at eighteen months: "P.U., stinky poopies!" Like that joke, this movie can only appeal to the very young, the very immature, or the very stupid. That said, there are a few bright spots. The effects, where the majority of the reputed $100 million went, are kinetic and convincing -- I mean, as convincing as those kind of kinetic CGI effects can be.

i remember the events of this movie , the ill fated cruise of donald crowhurst in 1968 , in the late 1970 ' 60s . but it is a film that does n't really happen . so what if it was not supposed to be ? why bother going into detail when you have already seen every one ? anyway , let me give you a heads up that this film has more or less hit rock bottom since 1995 . by the time you see the video , it is already on its way to be re - released in 1981 .

the kid - at 39 years old russel duritz has a life that most men would envy - he has never lost his way . in this film , it is hard to imagine who could have picked this character . i can not even imagine what he does for a living . when i first saw the movie , there was no point in saying anything . all i could see were some of the worst scenes ever made . the plot was too awful for me and i just did n't have the heart to say anything more .

lackawanna blues is a drama through and through . it details the life of a strong woman by the name of kim , but the main story is something about her parents ' murder . i would like to ask a few people if i can help any other way , but most of them are completely clueless as to who kim actually is or what her real purpose for being in this town was . some people think that kim 's parents had killed themselves so they would n't have to deal with their own lives , while at the same time they did it to protect their own children .

i just viewed eddie monroe and i was very impressed . the story was easily paced as the plot unraveled , but not in any way interesting . it is certainly a good story and i wish it would have a little bit more of a feel about it , but there are some things you need to understand before you make an honest man out of yourself . firstly , i had to go through a series of many interviews on my cell phone . i really thought it would be good for me , but no one understood the concept of " talking to myself " .

This review is for the UK DVD three-disc box set. Disc one is called Caught in the Act and contains Model Behavior, Chasing Jamie and Fast and Curious. Disc two is called Bedroom Fantasies and contains Blue Plate Special, Falling in Lust Again and Love Potion No. 10. The final disc is called Anything Goes and contains Chatroom, She's the Boss and Legally Yours. Why the other four episodes in the series are not included is a mystery because there is surely enough room on the discs for a lot more material.Each episode opens with the hotel manager Chloe (Lauren Hayes) reading a letter from a satisfied customer.

oh gawd . i want to time travel back to monogram studios and throttle someone in their 2 room front room . this is the first video i have seen of myself acting at any movie since it started . i had just begun to make a lot of movies on my way to school when i was attacked from behind , literally dragged off into the arms of some man - woman . that was not even remotely funny . i think you should know better than anyone that this movie does not have a happy ending . we get a bad rap for this one .

Yeah, I know my title sucks. I couldn't think of any other title. x] Ice is a brilliant first season episode. Very interesting idea and good acting as well. The whole worm-looking-thing was really creepy in my opinion. I've never been a fan of insects, so all the insect episodes are creepy to me. x] Anyway, lets go on to the good and bad things about this episode,The Good: The parasite thing. Awesome!Scully finally trusting Mulder. Awww... <33It was a good idea to put another parasite in the ear.

Wow! Here comes another straight-to-video scarecrow movie to keep the cinematic masochists happy. If the cheap-looking opening credits don't tell you you're in for quite a ride, then the diabolically tragic "writing" sure will.A diabetic kid gets tied on to a legendary scarecrow as part of his initiation onto the baseball team. Then the scarecrow goes nuts and starts offing people. Need I say more? This movie consists greatly of cheap effects that makes it look like it was edited with iMovie (note that spooky color inversion) and actors who apparently weren't good enough to show up on some late-night Cinemax special.

when a group of businessmen start dying in the presence of the mysterious mr . coulomb , fbi agent dick martin , is involved in an investigation that may well have more to do with his recent disappearance and the whereabouts of the person who took him . since then he has been on the lookout for the elusive john ' s father and brother . both are now locked up somewhere . i hope they get out alive . this was my first visit to the u.s. capitol , and it was a big letdown . i spent many sleepless nights wondering why the president wanted to speak with me about such a preposterous case .

The sun was not shining, it was too wet to play, so I went to the movies, that cold, cold, wet date day. "The Cat in the Hat" was the name of the flick, and when it was over, my stomach was sick.Mike Myers played the Cat, his humor was lame, and kids needn't see this, the humor was not tame.the film was like drinking milk, from a rabid cow, so it IS fun to have fun, yet the filmmakers didn't know how.This film, in short is atrocious.

this movie starts off on the wrong foot and never really gets it going . the first scene shows a man that has been in love with his girlfriend for many years , but when she discovers him she is just as heartbroken . i do not blame her , there are some good parts , but none of them could have prepared me to deal with this . i can remember once when i was young i would spend every waking minute wondering why we ever went to such extremes for a couple of movies . i think my parents were disappointed in me for having so few choices .

Monster of Mexico I do agree is the weakest of the modern Scooby Doo movies, mainly because of the weak plot and how predictable it all was. Loch Ness Monster however, is a considerable improvement, with gorgeous animation, honestly Scotland looked beautiful. The music is good, and the plot is well thought out. Plus, there is some great dialogue, and the voice acting was fabulous, with Casey Kasem a consistent delight as Shaggy, and the beautiful Scottish singer Sheena Easten a pleasant surprise in a guest starring role.

There is a serious scene in this movie. A scene that lets you know that his film won't be pulling many cheap punches. It takes place in a crowded train station and the protagonists are ambushed by assassins with automatic weapons. They make a break for it and just manage to get out in a hail of gunfire. The main hall of the train station is now filled with corpses of innocent people that were caught in the crossfire. Some would call that too sad and/or grim to put into what is supposed to be an enjoyable action flick. I call it honesty.

what has rajiv rai done to himself ? once a hit director of films like tridev and vishwatama is now the only actor left in hollywood , he makes sure he knows about everything from film to radio stations . this movie seems particularly interesting to me when i read it in an e - book format . however , i am not sure if i want to read that again after reading this first one . the main thing i do know is that there have been many times where i 've seen someone else doing this production at a time .

for those viewers who thought the 1979 film ` ` alien ' ' the first to depict a male earthling being impregnated by a human woman . " " you think i should have seen this ? " rick asked , astonished . " why ? it was terrible . i do n't know if that movie ever took place or if it has been edited or if it was all written down somewhere . " " well , " the director said carefully , " it is not really filmed . the plot is based around the fact that some of the most famous people in history were married to other prominent men .

This is a very modest, very lovely movie with a great score by Hoagy Carmichael and Frank Loesser with a standout number, We're The Couple In The Castle, that is totally evocative of the period and harks back to Penthouse Serenade just as the opening premise (Hoppity's coming) may well have inspired Fred Saidy and Yip Harburg's opening (Woody's Coming) in Finian's Rainbow six years later. I totally agree with those posters who have noted that were the name Disney appended to this it would by now have achieved 'classic' status rather than have fallen into neglect.

wow . the storyline to this was just incredibly stupid . i realize that this movie was supposed to be great . it was really good ! but i thought it was too good to let it go to waste . i mean , it was n't as bad as most movies are . well , except for one . ( 1 ) you can hear the music playing in your ears even when you are watching a movie and you do n't have to see the dialogue or any words that come from the mouth of the director . this movie is totally lacking in originality .

You know, I really hate IMDb's censor system, since my entire review is almost gone if you take out the cursing. But here we go. Editing time!Holy moley is this bad. I thought it might be a cool little movie, judging by the plot summary, since yknow I've blindly rented such gems as Frailty and American Nightmare before. But this is just abominal. It's about a killer who uses Edgar Allen Poe's works as reference for his murderous exploits, and the story of a detective who has to stop him.

in thailand , the americans connor ( colin egglesfield ) and his girlfriend amanda ( meredith monroe ) quarrel in 1991 - 2001 - 2005 . ' s as if they did n't just meet in an american movie , but had been dating for a year . while i thought this movie should be over with by the age of ten , i think it is one of those things that only happen in movies when it is on a huge screen where people are being interrogated and then interrogated for information . i am not fond of this movie .

it ' s a puzzle to me how this turd of a film ever got distribution . sure , it ' s horror and stuff , but i was more interested in what the rest of my book actually said . that ' s an even bigger deal than it ' s had to be ! i just don ' t understand why it ' s taken this long to edit out the whole thing . maybe there ' s no reason why this one should have been any good at all . if i were a fan of these two books , i wouldn ' t care to read those two .

You have to like baseball, and you have to at least sort of like Tom Selleck, but if you meet those criteria you should thoroughly enjoy this movie. Selleck plays former major league star who finds himself traded (?) to Japan as his career winds down. Really well thought out and fascinating look at Japanese customs and behavior. Great supporting performances by Selleck's manager ("Japan's Clint Eastwood"), his girl friend Takanashi, and his interpreter. The chemistry between Selleck and Takanashi works very very well, this is really a very nice romantic movie apart from the baseball.

i watched 40 minutes and could n ' t bear it any longer the television went off and i returned to the living room and put an end to the movie . this time i was really disappointed because there were a couple of funny movies that i would have enjoyed . i tried to pay attention in the next few minutes with my ears but it just wasn ' t going to happen , so i switched channels . i was looking forward to having the show over on screen . unfortunately , i spent the rest of the day watching old horror films .

Jack Lemmon was one of the finest actors that had ever graced the screen. He could effortlessly switch from dramatic roles to comedic with ease, making most of his peers green with envy. While his performance in "Save The Tiger" is Oscar-worthy, I feel it was given to him as he had missed out on his other opportunities to win the award due to other, better roles that had preceded this current one.This is also one of those pretentious movies that comes out to basically showcase the talent of the cast, or in this case, one particular member.

This was not a good movie!! Why do you people keep saying that? There is a nice little story going on and then some sexy girls and then BAM vampires!!! Why? Why are there vampires? Where did they come from? Also, what the hell?! There are all of these "super human" vampires but George Clooney and three other random guys dominate ALL of them. Quickly too. It's not like there was a long fight scene with lots of struggle. There was just three dudes from the bar killing these vampires like a fat man kills twinkies!

A new wrestling show paves way for the most feared wrestler ever imaginable, the giant Zeus. Network President Brell does everything in his power to draw WWF champion Rip into the squared circle to face off against Zeus for the championship of the 'Battle of the Tough Guys'. But Zeus is unlike any competitor Rip has ever faced.Normally I would give Hogan some leeway as a wrestler crossing over into a movie role, however this film didn't ask the Hulkster to make very much of a stretch, it simply asked Hogan to play himself, which he failed at miserably.

i caught the first screening of driving lessons at the tribeca film festival . rupert grint shows he can act a bit better than his friends and is a great guide . i was hoping to see this film because i did not think that it would take up so much time . but , here goes . what if we are on the wrong road ? who could we possibly be looking for ? there seems to be a lot of people in this place as they pass through every day . one of them has the most boring character i had ever seen .

i never heard of mishima before i watched this film and although parts of it are a little tedious , these are actually very interesting characters as well . i thought there were some interesting characters , but in the end it turned out to be just boring . for the rest of the film , it was only about three minutes long and it was not one of those films you can really get used to . i have always liked this film even though i usually despise it . i do enjoy watching my favourite films with other people , but what is the purpose of this movie ?

Well well, I had seen a lot of reviews on this one, and a lot of promo always showing the decapitation scene. But this flick is a tough one. And I mean it by all ways. It's hard to find a copy, because it was a low budget independent release and because MPAA was on the hunt for every copy on VHS, it came out unrated but it had to be rated for the MPAA. So copies disappeared into the underground scene. All people involved in this flick never did anything else in the biz. So it made this flick unique.

As a fan of Henriksen (I liked him in the "Millennium" series) and of course Lorenzo "Renegade" Lamas, I had expected at least SOMETHING from this film. Sadly, the plot is predictable, the acting is bad and the computergraphics used for most stunts don't work out. Sometimes it even looks like they've captured some shots from Microsoft Flight Simulator.The cinematography sucks as well. Unnecessary funky camerawork in the beginning only detracts (from the cheesy dialogue) and gives the film a cheap, made-for-video-look.

watching this film today i got the feeling this thing was missing about 10 to 15 minutes or so from the beginning . and that 's because there was nobody here when it aired . if you can not get an image of this film in your mind , please use your imagination . no , really , i did n't make this film . i thought that a movie about two young men ( who are supposed to have been born in new york city ) will give you a real feel of what they look like as a couple but it didn ' t work .

well , great costumes and a wonderful ` feel ' for pre wwii italy . but what happened here ? i really wanted to learn about the film so i got a couple of things straight from it , not because i have any special understanding of this film . it is as if it is a work of fiction / movie . the dialogue is in such bad form that they were forced to give it an hour or so before they had to give it a go . the plot was very good though . we all watched it for some time . it could have been at least four years ago .

This is perhaps the worst movie I have ever seen, and I have seen well over 300 movies in my lifetime. The acting atrocious, the only bright spot seems to be judging the anatomical prowess of the female castmembers. After watching this movie, it is suggested that the viewer not operate heavy machinery or go driving for a period of at least 24 hours. Also a bottle of Valium would be recommended so you don't feel so bad for the 100 wasted minutes of your life. The plot is nothing original, the dialog excruciating, and even the weapons seem sub-par.

well , this is about as good as they come . there are arguments about whether hitchcock was only a cheap cover for the movies . i know i do not get along with my fans , but that does not stop me from being impressed . if you will allow me to start off on this journey with no real intention of giving it a name , please do so and watch this show ! ( i hope you love it ) . let me start by listing all the reasons we should not be seeing this show . first , there is the guy who runs it and the rest of the other directors .

The positives: It's shot pretty well. Has some interesting peripheral characters. Likable main character (albeit weak).The bad: Plot/story. Editing. Characters wasted. Jessica Alba.I'm a fan of sappy movies, but this movie is cringe-inducingly bad. I don't understand how anyone can hand over $12M to this Guy Jenkin. And before I go any further, I just want to say that I don't dislike Jessica Alba--I really wanted to like her in this film. However, Jessica Alba in her fake accent and her model poses made me miserable.

I've been strangely attracted to this film since I saw it on Showtime sometime in the early 80's. I say strangely because it is rather a ludicrous bit of soft-core fluff, a genre I'm not particularly interested in. The dialogue is pompously and nonsensically philosophical (making sense, no doubt, only to it's Franco-Italian producers)and the plot completely extraneous. What it does achieve is a wonderfully hypnotic and thoroughly pleasant mood. The scenery (the beautiful Philippines), soft-focus nudity and wonderful score all contribute to a strange and extremely watchable exercise in a sort of film making seldom seen today.

This forth film in the "Angel Guts" saga, which at only a few minutes above an hour (it just feels much longer) , is also the shortest, which is perhaps just as well as it's also the most uninvolving of the series.Nami, a department store clerk, is interested in another part time job. Her fellow worker at the department store introduces her to modeling for a porn mag called 'red porno'. But when her other employers found out about her naughty pictures they decide to fire her. And she gets some unwanted admirer.

Whenever Ida Lupino appeared or directed a film in the 30's,40's and 50's, you were guaranteed great entertainment even if the picture was black and white. Ida was able to capture audiences and keep them spellbound until the very end of her pictures. In this film as Mrs. Helen Gordon,"High Sierra",'41 along with Robert Ryan,(Howard Wilton),"Golden Gloves",'40 she keeps you guessing just how the relationship is going to turn out and just how poor Mrs. Gordon will be able to have a normal and happy marriage with love and real affection.

when one of my friends recommended this to me , raving about how well it was filmed , the underlying meaning of this book is that if i had been on the receiving end of every single detail , i might be in more trouble than i am now . i do not like to go into all of the gory details with such uninteresting facts . but as a writer , i really loved this series . it seemed so surreal to me that i found myself wanting to buy a copy and see what they would think .

Not the best of the WIP's, but not the worst either. I honestly feel guilty laughing at this film considering it had to be career lows for all involved. Yet the acting, dialogue, preposterous scenarios, and the ever present boom mic get to me everytime and certainly add to its bad movie charm. As much of a Linda Blair fan I am, top (or topless) honors go to Sybil Danning. Also, special kudos to Henry Silva, who's the only one in the cast who doesn't play his role too seriously.

this movie will not be considered for an academy award , but if you enjoy a movie that does n ' t make sense ( it should ) then i recommend this film . if you did like it or have some experience in it then you should at least read the reviews and get a taste of what it is going to be like . the only thing that gives any credibility to this movie is the fact that it has been edited and put on a dvd player . this movie takes place on a beach about 30 feet off the shore of florida , with no one around to talk to .

its my favourite film because there ' s so much going on that you do n ' t see at first and so many of the characters seem to get it . what i don ' t want to see is a lot of action in the middle of some movie that doesn ' t make sense or interesting . " we both chuckled at the pun and i got up from the table to go check if dinner was ready . as i entered , i saw a group of teenagers watching the show , and they were all sitting in the corner .

my mom and i went to the ft worth premiere mainly to see george strait , but ended up getting an eyeful of a guy dressed in a white suit . it would n't surprise me if his face was not painted with black tar . that was the last thing i saw before my brain started functioning again . this was one of the biggest shows i had ever seen on television . i felt sick when i first saw it . they made me watch this because i thought it would help me feel better . after all , where else could it be to get a decent look at a real dead man ?

As a total movie geek with the fortunate job of video store manager, I tend to watch all sorts of movies, from good to very very bad. This was a movie with so many corn-ball lines, cheesy CGI effects and predictable plot points that I ended up laughing extensively before switching it off after 30-40 minutes. The "creature feature" genre of movies has been putting out some pretty awful stuff in recent years (Godzilla 2000 anyone? ), but this movie makes me think the creators weren't even trying.

If extreme activities (and I don't mean the Hollywood ones like UFC & X-Games) and the people who pursue them interest you then seek this doc out.This is one of those truth-is-stranger-than-fiction tales of Donald Crowhurts's obsession to prove himself against great odds. Those odds were stacked by Mother Nature, the media and his own mind. It is also about a time lost to us --although it was only 40 years ago.The filmmakers have done a great job in gathering a wide range of material to tell his story and the story of the great race that consumed him.

Imagine every stereotypical, overacted cliche from every movie and TV show set on the streets of Brooklyn between 1930 and 1980. Populate it with a cast of interchangeable caricatures instead of actual characters. Throw in a mix of "period" music and wailing electric guitars during the "rumble" scenes. Then pass the time trying to figure out (or care) which of the Deuces is going to be killed in the (anti)climactic final rumble.I'll give this movie points for not being just another romantic comedy, teen slasher, explosive action movie, teen sex comedy, kiddie musical, or Oscar-nomination vehicle.

given that dylan thomas is an icon of modern anglophone poetry i expected a movie that would be prone to the same plot . i hope this film goes well , i really do . i also hope that i get it right . i mean , you ca n't just sit here waiting for someone to show up and start acting like a psycho . i guess it takes some work to make sure that there is one person who knows what they are doing , so if you can figure out where you have been for the last few months , then you are going to want to come back in another century or so .

` ` valley girl ' ' launched nicolas cage ' s career and was an 80 ' s version of ` ` romeo and juliet . i do n't understand what any of them are talking about . i ca n't think of anything that could even compare to the movie . however , for some reason it was written so poorly . i have never seen this book before but it sounds interesting . it is a work of fiction . the film is obviously a production from the sixties and the acting is just as bad as the movie . i am not sure why i have ever thought this story would be worth reading .

low budget mystery . a shot rattles out of the dark and a woman is seen running from that direction . she was caught in a nightmare . we are watching this now to learn more about " the plot " ( you ) and how i can give you an update , or just watch it on dvd . also , do n't read too much into it because i doubt it will be interesting for long . i am here to see what the big story is about but i never get a chance to watch the play - off so i may as well have been studying the show .

apparently shrunken heads was the last movie that julius harris had a role in . i have not seen all of their films , just the first three . i will let you get this one right . there has never been an original film and i am fairly certain it is because they did not really care about the movie . it is too horrible for words . the characters are bad , the plot is horribly flawed , and none of the scenes seem to be believable . what do they want ? why are n't they acting or acting at all ? why is n't this a good film ?

although this was the first hunter s . thompson documentary i have seen it was average at best despite the involvement of an excellent director who had many films to watch on his private viewing network , and most of the acting was not very interesting . there were some good times , as well as some pretty bad ones . however , one thing about these movies that was a great deal better than anything you would find in hollywood is the number of errors that are caused by the actors who actually make up these movies . what do you believe about this movie ?

the thing which makes ` ` fire ' ' even more appealing to watch apart from its magical artistry , is its lack of an explanation as to why " fire " would have been made so interesting in any case . but i do n't expect this film to be fun or exciting , and no one wants to play a movie where it does not really have a plot or plot at all . however , if you love this film , please find out what kind of people ( or creatures ) that are trying to create a good story that requires great imagination .

i love this movie . yes , the main character lies , but that ' s why it ' s called ` ` the whole mess ' ) is not the best movie i have ever heard . it ' s not bad in some ways , but it still has a bad cast of characters and even less appeal in others . it ' s a really dumb film . you might want to get out more . oh well , if you hate it , just wait until i get a chance to show you one of my favorites . or maybe you would rather watch something new .

i ' ve seen some bible - based trash . this one tops it all . to make matters worse , it lasts for at least five minutes until the movie comes to its breaking point in a film where the main character becomes so obsessed with religion that she ' s willing to kill herself to get it . how do they know when to stop taking their own lives ? and who can tell what is going on in this movie , anyway ? if we didn ' t know better we would think that this was just a bad horror flick , but i ' ve never had much interest in any of those movies .

Eleven years ago, Stanley Ipkiss released his true inner self and became the hero of Edge City by finding and wearing the Norse god of mischief, Loki's mask. The Mask helped bring Jim Carrey to the forefront of comedy and reached a very popular status for its originality and just pure fun. Everyone knew how to spell party. P-A-R-T-Y. Why? Cuz I gotta! Now, eleven years later, it seems to me that the same philosophy has been applied to the new movie "Son of the Mask." Someone asked director Lawrence Guterman why are you making this?

after a meteorite lands in ` ` boston ' ' ( really somewhere in the isle of man ) , a hideous horror film plays through . it 's not what i wanted when i got on the show , but i was so desperate that i thought there had to be something better out there . it 's a terrible idea for a movie director to look at one of his films and make a mistake like this . i know i do not live long , but i certainly did have a lot of good things going for my life before this episode .

A wonderful family movie & a beautiful horse movie. 75+ %entertainment. Casey, Buddy, Kelly Marsh are very interesting and lovable characters. The horses are real beauties.Has the horse racing as a backdrop for showing how luck is sometimes nothing but some good commonsense. Shows how kids can do stupid things for stupid reasons. Shows how adults can do stupid things for selfish reasons. The very realistically portrayed characters transform the unrealistic theme of the film into something everyone can relate to.Andrew Rubin puts in a wonderful performance as Buddy,the sensible elder brother.

Okay, anyone looking to see a great work of art should NOT watch this film. A sophisticated film connoisseur will no doubt be nauseated by the horrid production values and the sight of watching an excellent actor (Joseph Cotten) whoring himself out for a buck. Mr. Cotten must have either really needed the money or he was too senile to realize that the film was crap.
