steven segal ' s movie career is a tribute to horrible cinema . i have been tragically bored with every one of my own movies over the past two years . some of the actors are not so bad , but this film was just like any other . i do not have much to recommend it at this point , but what i think really is that it would be more exciting if i had seen it on a bigger screen . i am sure anyone watching this could take it as a little too far , but i still wanted to make sure i did n't get an idea of what it actually was .

Nothing like this was seen on TV at that time and probably never will again. From the first image of that police light blinding you and from there you heard the words: "Police Squad - in color", you were schocked to see that this in no way was an ordinary sitcom.Also to kill off a "Guest Star" and then never refer to him again, where had you ever seen that before. Then the actual show started and if you did not pay attention, you would miss several jokes in the background. Don't pay too much attention to one thing or you would be sorry.

watched this months ago on netflix instant and left a review there . let me say , most of the other reviews were good . but for all the work i made in those days , it is not worth it to find out about what you have seen here today . so i think it would be very nice if you would tell me what was going on at least once in a while . how could i ever appreciate such a beautiful movie when i was so busy with my own personal life ? do you have any questions ? well , here 's the first thing that came out of your mouth .

Mystery Science Theater 3000 would have not been able to bring any redeeming quality to a showing of this "gem." This one is like a cheesy pirate copy of 80's porn you could have purchased on VHS from an arcade on 42nd st. before Disney bought the whole smash and closed them all down. But, wait - all the sex scenes have been cut. I challenge anyone to find a worse film. This film could replace water-boarding as a humane method of interrogation. No, I take that back - I would prefer water-boarding.

i found this movie to be a big disappointment , especially considering the cast . the characters are not believable . the character is extremely difficult to get close to . you will find out why in time . just watch this film for yourself . it is probably the most boring one we ever made and i can hardly believe that anyone would want to go to any trouble to see this movie . there was a lot more than just an outline of scenes where the leading lady gets all flustered . there were lots of twists and turns , some very unfunny , and i have no idea how to describe them .

eve is an eye opener , because of the great sceneries and the tech - no music in the backgrounds , we have to write a couple of words about it . however , as far as i know , she is a good artist and can make her own mistakes . this movie has not been written yet . that is why there is so much drama involved in the original film , but i guess i just never get enough of it . if you could see this movie after watching it at night , you would not believe how bad it is !

i really should have learned more about this movie before renting it . it was one of those movies where a bunch of teenagers go in and start shooting people like they are cattle , except for the part that is going to cause a whole lot of trouble . if i was you i would have stayed in bed , or at least rolled over , or tried to sleep . there are other ways to get up early ( like walking around the campus in the middle of the night , or driving around the city with a guy who has a girlfriend ) .

The main reason to check this one out is to watch Laura Gemser in all her glory.That's reason enough for me.She heads to Africa as guests of another rich guy that seems to be all over these films. Huge mansion near the jungle. Hunters staying around for parties when they aren't out hunting zebras. And said parties becoming drunken orgies.All the high society types in the Emanuelle films seem to have out of control fetishes. And Emanuelle beds most of them.Joe D'Amato did NOT direct this one. He just ripped it off and used the same cast(s).

Hannibal must be the most God-awful movie I have seen in a long time. In fact, I want my money back. What a waste of time. No plot, minimal character development, questionable motives, poor dialogue, sub-standard acting. What else can I say? If you haven't seen it don't bother. I wouldn't even hire out the video and if you happen to come by it on TV... change the channel. The only reason anyone might have to see this movie would be to see whether the gratuitous violence lived up to all the hype (which quite frankly is why they added it).

Not the best plot in the world, but the comedy in this movie rules. Kelsey Grammar is wonderful in this movie. Another funny guy is Rob Schneider who will make you crack up with his segments with Ken Hudson Campbell who plays Buckman. Lauren Holly plays probably the more serious character in the cast as Lt. Lake. Bruce Dern is a great actor in this movie, playing probably the most serious character in the movie. The actor i liked the most was Toby Huss as Nitro, all the electric shots his character takes in the movie is hilarious.Plot is a little uneven, about Lt.

unfortunately a boring flick , and obviously the only way to see it is the butchered bootleg public domain version . i could see him on the screen , standing up , saying something like " this is just so ridiculous ! what the f * * k ever happened to this movie ? where does this happen ? " or " why am i not surprised that they are trying to kill you all right ? " but i think it would make a lot of sense for me to be shocked at one point in my life , when i first found out about the movies .

this movie is like happiness meets lost in translation with a sixth sense ending ( or maybe a crying game at least ) , but if it were to die out , we 'd have had to stop . the film is not even good enough to catch my attention . i ca n't imagine how the characters are going to know the plot and what they are supposed to be doing , but who knows what has been going on all these years . it does not help that there is an awkward moment where one man just asks his wife if she would like to go into the forest and find a beautiful place to live .

i love this movie ! ! ! this beautiful , charming love story drew me in immediately with its lovable simplicity . it has a lot of wonderful twists and turns , such as playing the role of the girl who loved the star and being a hero . this movie is so much fun to watch ! however , the more i watched it , the more i grew concerned . it was like watching two people who could barely talk . every word out of their mouths - and that 's saying something ! - was funny and funny .

this was an interesting movie . i could have done without the bathroom scene and the seduction scene - ewwww , that film is bad ! i would not want to be part of a horror film or anything like that again . so why should it be different ? because i think you can get a lot more action if you keep watching the same tv shows over and over again . when you do n't know how much longer it 's going to take to make a sequel then you may want to find something else to watch . i 'm just trying to get the basic premise right before i go to sleep .

i consider myself a big fan of low budget horror movies . the more bizarre and imaginative the film , the worse it gets . this movie is nothing like what i had hoped to watch last night . instead of being full of fun comedies ( although i guess there is an ' in ' when you think about something like that ) , it was just as annoying and depressing as before . i feel like they are telling me to put my heart back into my body , but i ca n't quite figure out how to do so .

I can see that the ratings for this film aren't all that high for this film, so I must be in the minority for liking this film so much. Well, I am right and everyone else is wrong (just kidding). I guess I like it because I am a psychology teacher and I really liked the brooding character played by Ryan. While he truly is dangerous as well as VERY menacing, you can't exactly hate him because he is clearly mentally ill and probably suffering from some sort of brain trauma. And wow did Ryan do a really good job portraying this man!

( spoilers more than likely . . . nothing really important you could n ' t have figured out yourselves ) yeah , it was a pretty long shot . . . one of my biggest fears was that the entire movie would be made up in a matter of minutes . and if this is the worst movie i ever saw then what else could it possibly be about ? well not bad - very good , even - but there is no other description to describe how awful it was . it seemed to have happened while i was watching the film .

if you ' re looking for an accurate portrayal of che guevara , the cuban revolutionary who helped aid fidel castro during the first world war , this is the man . don ' t be fooled into thinking that you are in love with him . i do not know what was in your mind when you agreed to come with me . you were just a young innocent girl having a bad crush on a boy . it has been over twenty years since you last saw him . his death would have been much harder to bear had he not been there to guide you out of it .

I am astounded that so many people find this film even close to good. Let me make it clear that I am a HUGE Hitchcock fan and went out of my way to own as many of his films on video as I could but this one I felt was so below par not only for Hitch's films - aw heck, I'm being far too nice here. This pictured really sucked. I don't care that Hitch did a favor for the very talented Carole Lombard, but I have seen 50s sitcoms with more cleverness and style than this boring turkey.

This was a nice film. It had a interesting storyline, that was executed pretty well in the later part of the film. The storyline kinda reminded me of The City of God. But this one is done in a more nicer way in comparison. It had what i really loved:a tinge of surrealism. Some pretty interesting cinematography (thru the wooden camera) I'm not sure if it was culturally correct, but it definitely widens you're view of south Africa. The actors were good (for 1st timers, most of them anyway), i especially liked Estelle character, which made this movie pretty enjoyable.

pot - seeking pre - teen joshua miller ( as tim ) throws his sister ' s doll into the river while daniel roebuck ( as david ) sits down and watches . it ' s not very funny , but all of a sudden i feel really bad for these guys , especially daniel roebuck . he has just lost his sister in a tragic accident that was supposed to have been his fault . they ' re going to stay in touch with each other ? what the hell ! i ' m going to lose some money over this ! well , i can ' t do that .

i find this film meretricious , tentative , lethargic , and skillfully a bad choice of entertainment on celluloid . however , in this instance it was a good enough shot to get me off my guard for a moment . i was not looking forward to the evening , but i did enjoy watching it and saw nothing else so far as the film . i decided to look back at the first few chapters and read through them all . i had a feeling there were some similarities in the scenes , but i still found it strange that the characters who were doing this movie appeared to be more character than actual person .

This film is one of my fondest childhood memories. Seeing the Muppets (at the height of their popularity) heading Hollywood, singing and dancing, with Miss Piggy googely-eying her beloved Kermit, Fozzie Bear doing his best as everyone's manager, and a generous cast of "extras" delivering a film that turned out to be "okey dokey".Kermit's melancholy ukulele number "Rainbow Connection" was nominated for an Oscar that year, but was beat out by Norma Rae's "It Goes Like It Goes". I'll pick Kermit's song any day!

ok , so i got ta start this review by saying i was really expecting to see this flick for my first novel in a month . but i guess that just ai nt happening . and i would like to give this short story a chance to be published in all the above . if you liked this one , please have a nice day or maybe there is something else i need to tell you . good day ! thanks for reading and i hope you enjoyed it . also by david leventon

 she stopped mid - rant , and looked over at me with a huge grin on her face . i tried to get back to sleep , but my dreams kept drifting away from the television screen . this was supposed to be a good movie , but this could not have held any of the excitement i felt yesterday . i wanted nothing more than to wake up in front of all those people and watch these movies .

Finally! Third time lucky. This film has been always been on my mind, but my first viewing I forgot about it and only caught the second half of the film. Then only a couple months later I had the my second chance of watching of it, so I decided I would record it. Only to discover that my timer went off late and again I missed the first half of the flick. I wasn't going to allow that to happen again. So, when it came on TV again, I thought bugger it I'll wait until it comes on, then I will record it.

at the same time john russell was playing ranch owner nathan burdette , trying to free his no good brother from his jail cell . they all went to work and found that both men were a real prick . it turns out there were not two more in the state of california , so john russell gave himself a couple of hours to write up his story . this is one of the best times i have ever had , but unfortunately it did n't go very well . what happened after he got back to his apartment ? why do you want to tell me this now ?

This movie is not worth anything. I mean, if you want to watch this kind of stuff, flip to Hollywood movies! This totally is a disgrace to the Bollywood name. Neal N Nikki seriously sucked! Never watch this movie. As for the actors, it appears the acting genes skipped a generation. Tanisha couldn't have worn less and Uday Chopra obviously was just picked because he was the director's spoiled son. (All of that Halla Re was amazingly stupid) The songs are eh, and I hope the director did not spend to much money on it...... Bottom line, I hated the movie.

sometimes there ' s a film so bad that you just keep watching in awe . this is one of those movies you like to watch the most , i can ' t say what genre it ' s on , but i believe it ' s one of the good ones that ' s never been released . well , i know i don ' t have to tell you all about the worst show of my life , because i didn ' t look forward to seeing it with my two roommates and some of the others .

Even by the lowered standards of '80s slasher movies, this one stinks. The usual gaggle of oversexed teens heads for a "forbidden" part of forest, which burned in the 1940s and apparently left a sole angry survivor. Fast forward (actually, you'll want to fast-forward through much of this mess) to the present day, where a couple of campers are butchered; the teens follow in their wake, while a semi-concerned park ranger (a sleepwalking Jackie Coogan) and his healthier cohort (who spins a lot of time tuning his banjo) succeed partially in steering our attention from yards of run-of-the-mill nature-footage padding.

Ninja Hunter (AKA Wu Tang vs Ninja) is pure entertainment from start to finish due to its outrageous characters, nonsensical plot and lack of any pretensions whatsoever. The makers of this film have given us a truly OTT masterpiece which has to be seen to be believed.The plot centres around Wu Tang villain, Abbot White, who wants to destroy the Shaolin monks and become supreme martial artist. In order to do so, he teams up with a clan of Ninjas, led by three masters  gold lamé ninja, white mustachioed ninja and black ninja  and succeeds in destroying the Shaolin temple and most of its inhabitants.

i expected a lot more out of this film . the preview looked interesting so i decided to check it out . first off , you will have to look at the plot : the story ' s all in chinese characters , and the dialogue is strange . the narrator ' s description is odd ; the style is different than the way it usually was , so it ' s hard to find any similarities to the original versions . but there are no similarities that can be seen in any of the other movies either , only the same parts .

man , what an awful film . as with many terrible films , the structure of its awfulness lies in the way it seems to have a negative connotation when viewed by any and all people who were not present . there is nothing inherently evil about the movie ( though it has a very bad ending ) but i just ca n't understand why someone would choose to turn out the lights at the beginning of something that could potentially be so bad . if only one person on the planet wanted to go to the cinema , they could have been able to see it .

Absolutely the most thoughtful, spiritually deep, intense Hamlet ever done -- no other version comes close. Jacobi has the best understanding of the role of all the actors that have played it. Patrick Stewart's Claudius is ferocious and still sympathetic -- I particularly like the two doofuses playing Rosencranz and Guildenstern. Very feckless and yet sinister. Some might gripe about the need for a strong Ophelia -- she's not a strong person, that's the point, and Lalla Ward hits the proper nuances. Amazing. Simply Amazing -- every one of the more than two dozen times I've watched it.

the title role of this western is played by robert walker , jr . he ' s a young gun who ' s working for the fbi in washington , d.c. he ' s an agent from the us federal agency . i ' m supposed to meet him in new york city and find out where he ' s going to live . i ' m looking forward to it . after my visit to the country club i think i may be able to get some good leads as to what ' s been happening in america lately .

it carries the tone of voice that narrates the book into the jungle of vietnam and into the wild - eyed look of an american soldier who wants his comrades ' brains to be removed from their heads . no doubt the stories have some kind of meaning . as a historian , i could n't help myself . the first part is not for me to read , but for the movie . i thought at first that i was reading wrong because the main characters were more in - depth than most people would want to tell the story .

` ` a research scientist is experimenting with human dna in an attempt to create the perfect human being . his mission is to achieve perfection as soon as possible . but when he gets to this point , he comes up blank . there is no ' s ' t any reason to think they would have killed me if you were on the moon . i had just been thinking about how much it was going to hurt not to get my hands on all of them . now i ca n't even start thinking about getting my hands on some of these people . "

Altioklar's populist approach manifests itself in all his titles, from the worst to the best. He doesn't care (or has no clue) about art, all he cares is to make people think they've got a kick in the groin by watching his movies. The problem is, the effort is way too evident, and as events unfold with all the senseless exaggeration kneaded into them, the effort fails badly.On this "Turkish" movie (who knows where the original or originals were made, since it felt extremely Hollywoodish to me), Altioklar is trying to be some sort of Tarantino.

goldrush : a real life alaskan adventure is a great tv film for all ages . the movie focuses around a guy who has gone to canada and found an apartment there . he 's a local boy who has some friends in toronto that want to help him move on . however , they have no idea how it happened . i 've been told that most of the movies are very bad , but this is one of those rare instances when a good film can not get off the ground . this was going to be one of those times .

you could have put the characters on the island for any reason at all and had the same movie . i did , however , write the book . the main premise was similar to that of my first novel , but there is no way it could be a good idea to use the plot in this manner . i wanted to create a good character who would be willing to work with us to build a better set of characters for this sequel . i hope you all like this novel and will take your time to read it .

Leslie Nielsen hits rock bottom with this absolutely horrible comedy that is the worst mainstream film that I have ever seen. There is nothing to like about this film, as it is essentially a one-joke film, and the joke isn't all that funny. How many times are we supposed to laugh at an almost blind man making a fool out of himself? That's not funny, that's just pitiful. Nielsen seriously needs to start refusing some of these pathetic scripts, and Stanley Tong needs to stick to making Jackie Chan films, because it doesn't get much worse than this.

like in a circle the movie leads back to its point of departure , the image of the cranes that are trying to escape from the water were all but abandoned on the spot . i 'm not sure what kind of movies these people would like to see if they did n't get to watch this film . the first thing that caught my interest was the idea that maybe there is still a way we can stop this thing from happening . or maybe it only has one reality , the real one . after all , i really do not know why i am looking at pictures of the island in australia .

I read a few reviews of the movie and got the impression that it was not as good as the previous Karate Kid installments. Although my favorite is still Karate Kid II, I felt this fourth installment of the movie series was consistent with the others and had some important lessons to share. Unlike the previous versions, the karate student is a female teenager who takes a somewhat different learning path, rather than a male teenager. Maggi finds this a little more challenging, but rises to the occasion. The plot twists are believable and predictable.

The violent death of Fernando Ramos Da Silva only eight years after the completion of this film, only adds to the poignancy of dierector BAbenco's powerful message. The film is split into two halves - the first in a reformatory where a group of youngsters are abused and violated by the violent law enforcers and guardians. The second backdrop is the city where they are confined instead by their own actions and morality, which includes mugging, pimping and killing different characters who enter their lives.The differing gender and sexual roles in the film allow for constant changes in the characters as they interact with other people.

This movie was a major bait and switch. I rented it because of Rebecca St. James, a popular Christian singer. I have met her and wondered what she would be doing in a UFO movie. Well.......I think that she starred in this movie to help out a friend, or a friend of a friend. My first clue that this movie wasn't what it was supposed to be was when I witnessed the special effects of the UFO encounters. Cheesy! As the movie progressed, I noticed how plastic the actors were. It was funny how almost everyone in the movie wore solid colors.

I saw this movie once a long time ago, just once, and I didn't know where it had come from, and I looked for about six years to find it, and I finally found it here at IMDb.com! Just the whole concept of the movie is great, I believe it's got something to do with a race of bioengineered beings, keeping tabs on us and our planet, but there is one person who keeps out of being assimilated into conformity. And the way that he does it,to keep himself from being tracked and located, is what keeps the movie entertaining.

honestly , i do n ' t really understand why there has been so much controversy about this show . it embraces the idea of a man being involved with an african american woman . " " he is not african american , you fool ! and if he are , he will not make such a strong impact on the lives of the average american woman . she may even be more interested in what he sees in his movies than that of the natives . " " i would like to point out that this show has never been made into a reality tv series .

this has got to be the most god - awful piece of cinematic crap i have ever watched . it makes mel laugh , and when she sees what is coming next , she tries to put her hands over her ears to stop the sound . i feel sorry for her . i do n't blame her for trying to save my life . that was a terrible day . after that , i fell into a dreamless sleep . if anyone could make me fall into a deep well of despair , it would be sean . i mean , he 's so good - looking and charming .

Although this series and the mini film in particular were very important at the time of release, I feel that the series as a whole was actually fairly poorly written with a weak cast. The issues at heart are extremely well portrayed yet it is difficult to relate and understand the problems within the film when the acting and script isn't convincing enough (especially when looking at the mini film).I also don't believe that this mini film or series has stood the test of time as now many of the scenes are quite laughable.

i have not seen and heard the original version . i am no russian , but i am learning right now . i also had the pleasure of writing a novel about an american and his girlfriend who live in florida . this was my first one of these when i was 19 years old . there was no movie or movie about the film being made . it was always a big surprise for me to get out of bed at the start of the week and actually read the book . i liked the title though . it sounded so romantic .

The trailer for this film promised a new twist on the zombie genre: setting it in the Old West. Except it's not the real Old West, of course. It's some sort of Future West, in a world where some apocalypse has, as apocalypses are known to do, killed people and subsequently turned them into zombies. It's zombie virus time again, folks, and you know what that means? Get bitten and become one of them.So, into this dusty and dead-filled world comes a hero. He's a bounty-hunter, getting paid for taking care of zombies.

"Hood Rat" is absolutely terrible. This is a urban version of "Willard". I just can't believe this movie got made, let alone distributed. Someone in Universal Studios thought that people would watch and like this "movie". The only good thing in this is Ice-T as the landlord. He was funny. The one thing I hate in movies is sped up action. Once or twice is bad enough, but the WHOLE movie is like that. Every scene transition is some fast motion special effect. The director should be banned from making movies forever.

` ` black vengeance ' ' is an alternate title for ` ` ying hung ho hon ' ' aka ` ` tragic hero ' ' ( i do ) . the story goes on to tell of a boy who has no idea that his mother and he are about to go down with a train . it 's so bad , you 'd think somebody would see this coming . at first they did but after a while things started to get interesting . two young men in uniform came up to them and invited them to stay at their house in norfolk for the night .

there was n ' t much thought put into the story line on many fronts . this is a good action movie , just as bad as the one in which we watched it before . if you want to see the sequel ( no pun intended ! ) you may want to watch the first episode where they get abducted and have to find their way home with an alien who claims to be related to the aliens by his own skin . if you do not watch this for yourself , i can only say that it is a truly shitty movie .

Yumiko (Wakana Sakai), the pretty adopted daughter of a recently-deceased Japanese businessman, inherits control of her father's company; her uncle Kazuo (Shun Sugata), miffed that he wasn't left the business to run, orders a hit on his niece. When jug-eared chef Kensuke (Takashi Okamura) enters the wrong hotel room by mistake and knocks out hit-man Invincible (Jung Yuen), he is mistaken for the killer and sent to kill Yumiko. Instead, he falls for the pretty heiress and ends up vowing to protect her.

i am sorry to rain on everybody ' s parade . just a little background about me : i like and respect my job but not much . i have worked in the same industry for 25 years , but never had to see this movie as it has been so far out of print that i do n't even really know how many hours you can sleep through . i have seen quite a lot of film films at my age , but this one showed me a lot worse than anything i had ever seen in my life . it was probably the best movie i had ever seen or thought i would watch .

it ' s true , no one really expects anything from sequels . but even by that low standard this is not as bad as i had hoped it would be . it just doesn ' t add up to an overall horror film . the first two scenes are extremely predictable . there is nothing much worth writing out and in the middle of them , there ' s a dead man on the stage who falls asleep before he kills anyone . the plot is very simple . you can ' t expect to know all the plots or what they look like .

this was a surprisingly very good movie , and an interesting idea . . however , it was just a little odd to watch that particular movie with my parents . why did we get in the car with them ? i mean they could n't have been nicer if they had invited us along on a cruise ! no matter how many times i tried to see one of those horrible movies , i failed . there is no point in watching a terrible movie about the bad guys . there are enough bad guys at the party that i really doubt any of them would help us .

another great musical from hollywoods golden age ! i liked this movies story about a trio of friends who are going out together and they meet up after their first date with someone they never met . as a matter of fact , it was not that far - fetched but it made me see why my friends were attracted to each other . in fact , i had to watch this because i am the only one with an interest in watching such a wonderful film . the main character is a girl named amy whom he falls in love with ; she has two sisters who are very pretty .

for a tv movie this was definately worth seeing . all the acting was very well done and the story of the crime was fairly simple . i felt that it was not important in any way , yet i have to admit that it was nice . there were lots of great scenes . some of the director has great taste . so much so that it is almost as if he made it his personal mission to set people on fire at least several times . i can not see how someone could watch such a boring film and actually enjoy it . i feel that the plot is rather dull .

this movie is a terrible attempt at a spoof . its attempts to parody various sports movies are half - baked and half - hearted , but it succeeds so far in making a decent film about something else altogether . however , we have had enough of those shows for one night . let 's go to the cinema and watch an adult comedy . i hope you will get on with the movie . here are some reviews of this film . please enjoy it . the characters are all very nice , but they also really are a waste of time .

This self-important, confusing b+w "film" watches like an infant on a very bad acid trip. You're dealing with something that reminds you of a piece of rotting lettuce that accidentally fell out of the back of a garbage truck: no one cares to touch it because it will probably be washed away on its own down the storm drain. There's no room for plot when you've got "visceral imagery" and "subtle" allegory. To me, it seems like the director tries to make the next great art movie while begging for intellectual accolades.

i love this movie . it is the first film master p have ever done . it is based on this movie . for the next two weeks he will sit there alone with a large bottle of cheap wine , watching the television show all day and thinking about what a stupid movie it is . when he realizes that this is a very dumb movie , he gets pissed off . then he starts to cry because he can not believe in this movie . after a couple more nights of being bored , he starts spending time with the rest of the band .

I saw this movie on the shelf at Blockbuster and thought it looked cool. The DVD case touted so many great actors and I wondered to myself, "Why have I never heard of this movie?" Then I turned over the case and saw the director, Lee Tamahori, and thus the answer began to explain itself. First of all I want to defeat the idea that a great cast equals a great movie, but more importantly, I think I should explain why this movie is so terrible. Okay, the script is awful and full of one dimensional characters.

i have seen this film probably a dozen times since it was originally released theatrically . anyone who calls this ' the movie ' just can not believe how silly it is . it is not very original at all . and as far as making fun of this movie , i really ca n't say you would be able to get anything in this movie that makes any of this funny . it is quite pathetic really . if you are looking for something more interesting than that movie , let me tell you about the last film i had or saw that could have made it worth seeing .

We picked this up as a part of a Brentwood set, under the title "The Broken Skull." Shot directly onto video, with widely varying sound and lighting quality, this movie winds up with a hyperactive quality that may inspire the viewer to feelings of nervousness, confusion and irritability - and not in a good, "Evil Dead" kind of way.Without going into spoilers, what appears at first to be a simple revenge ghost story becomes increasingly convoluted and bizarre. While there are some interesting ideas here, the overall effect is likely to leave you scratching your head and saying "hunh?

tediously long dreary cinematic waffle . i could n ' t believe how bad this film was . i watched it merely as a waste of time and money but i was very disappointed with the ending . i did not get a good look into the story , even though i don ' t know what it is to watch an awful horror movie that has only been released for a few weeks . however , i guess if you were going to watch this one ( at least it will be fun to watch something that plays out like this ) , you wouldn ' t want to miss anything .

i seen this movie when it came out . i thought what an average movie . i have now realized i never saw one of them , and the only thing that i did see was a couple of movies with people dancing around in red plastic chairs . this is just plain weird . there are no lines or plot lines which could have been made up . it does not make any sense at all . i have never seen a movie like this ; i have read a few books and seen some movies where they do a lot of acting to get people to pay attention to the movie .

I was at the premier of the movie last night in Rome. I am not an expert in the book, however there are a great deal of changes from the book to the movie. The pacing of this movie is much faster than the Davinci code. Many things were trimmed otherwise this would be a 4 hour movie. Many things were also changed to give the movie a fast pace. I think what matters is the feel of the movie and that works well for Hanks, Brown and company.There are some things in the book that would appear very implausible in the movie form.

i just found the entire 3 dvd set at wal - mart in the bargain bin for $ 5 . 50 , so i think i may have paid $ 25 , 000 to get this movie . why did n't i see that ? i thought i had been too busy trying to figure out how to save my money . but then i saw the whole thing in a movie ! it looked like a nice movie . even if it were based on reality , who would care what it really is ? and when you come back from the dead , you can actually read about it in new york times .

so , this is the worst movie you will probably ever see . it ' s up there with ` ` crossbones ' . i ' m surprised you did n't know that in your own youth ! i ' ll bet you don ' t have anything against it at all ! you ' ll probably laugh and cry if you get a taste of it . i hope you love this film . my mom thinks it ' s a waste of time but i ' ll make it up as i go along when i ' ve been watching it .

I really liked the Far Cry game, nice graphics, good level-design, interesting and clever enemies, above-average length and even a somewhat decent plot. I am not by default against movie spin-offs of games. I thought "DOOM The Movie" was hilarious. But what Uwe Boll has done here, is to take the game and modified every one of its good aspects and turned them into something horrible (well not the length, the movie runs only a merciful 90 min) The characters are even more stereotypical than in the game, which is quite an achievement.

MINOR SPOILERSMisunderstood classic remains one of Henson's finest and most personal films. It may seem funny to call a movie as beloved as this one 'misunderstood,' but people do seem to remember this one mostly for Jerry Juhl's snappy screenplay and Paul Williams's knockout songs. Now while these things are admittedly great, as is the movie's formal playfulness (screenplay-within-the-screenplay, film break, etc. ), what distinguishes 'The Muppet Movie' from the other Muppet films is the serious, wistful thread that runs through the picture.

to paraphrase thora birch : ` ` i kind of like this movie . it ' s the exact opposite of everything that is supposed to be exciting about television . i was just trying to think of what would have happened if i had watched it as a kid . well , maybe not even that much scary . the movie itself was pretty awful , but i ' m not in love with it because it didn ' t make much sense . anyway , the plot was basically a bunch of stupid people chasing after each other . the characters were so stupid and inane that nobody really cared what the actors were saying .

I really enjoyed BG Seasons 1-3 and really couldn't understand those who didn't like it. But I can't defend this nonsense. Spoilers follow.The first problem is that the characters are now doing inexplicably stupid things on a regular basis: So if Starbuck thinks she knows where Earth is why not send her out in a Raptor? Would the Admiral accept the resignation of his third most experienced officer? Would the Quorum elect their newest member, the non-elected Adama Junior? He has about three weeks political experience under his belt, and is the son of a man they distrust.

I was lucky enough for this film to come on TCM, so I had the opportunity to see it. It's rather hard to find, despite it being a Hitchcock classic. Unfortunately, it also has its shortcomings, some of which Hitchcock has repeated later. First off, the ending is a little too neat and "perfect". In the last few scenes, until the last five minutes, there is an astounding amount of tension; then, the five minutes just clears everything perfectly up... very unsatisfying. The ending is also overly dramatic, for a Hitchcock film.

"Lackawanna Blues'is so emotionally powerful in its portrayal of urban Blacks during the 50s and early 60s. A culture of joy and sadness specific to working class Blacks that existed outside the mainstream culture. The characters of Santiago-Hudson's play depicted Black individuals who lived imperfect lives but maintained strong positive values of love,loyalty and honor. Although the characters moved away from those values at times, they did not deny the importance of the values. Instead they recognized and accepted their own imperfection and those of the other characters, without judgment, that passed through the life of "nanny".

i normally do n ' t like romantic films , but i love this film very much . the story is really pretty in the end and it 's so funny that one of the funniest moments ever comes along on this show . i know you will be interested to read the first episode of the movie and what we find here is interesting . i have just been given a tour of my hometown for the first time ; the town is such a mess with most of the businesses closed or deserted . there was only one road that went into town during the day which was n't used very much .

stay far away from this film . the fact that you ' re reading reviews tells me you may have already heard this movie , however i will take a look at this film to verify if you are interested in viewing it . my name is tim mcnichol and i am one of the leading directors . i ' m sorry to disappoint but i ' m very disappointed that i missed this movie on such short notice . i like all of the characters , i ' m happy to watch every one of them as long as they do not try to mess up my character line .

Anyone that is looking for an episode of "Law and Order" or "CSI" would have to look elsewhere as the most basic elements of police or forensics work were totally ignored in this case.A murder took place, and all the police did was to grab a 15-year-old boy off the street and take him to the only witness - a 65-year-old man - and say is this the guy who did it? Sure, the old man thought that the kid in the back of the police car had to be guilty. never mind that he looked nothing like the real killer and was dressed completely differently.

Right this moment I am watching this movie on TV here in Tokyo. Beautiful scenery, beautiful sets of biblical proportions, beautiful costumes, beautiful color, beautiful Gina. Great climactic scene when God destroys the Sheban idol and a lot more with de Millean thunderbolts at the moment when Yul and Gina are about to consummate their love. Yul does a halfway decent job of delivering his lines, though he sounds a lot like Yul delivering his lines as Ramses or Taras Bulba. George Sanders sounds like George Sanders playing George Sanders.

I just watched this move for the 5th or 6th time and am still in love with it. It still makes me cry and sing and worry and celebrate.I almost wrote Bonnie Hunt a letter to tell her how much I love it. David Duchovny's grief scene is so flippin real!!! Minnie Driver is so natural and honest. My favorite line is when Duchovny says "I miss Elizabeth but I ache for Grace". Oh man! I'm crying just thinking about it. ALSO... Bonnie Hunt and Jim Belushi are sooooooooooooo the perfect Chicago area couple!!

The basic plot is good and can be engaging. The music is so great that it became the theme music for the TV show IRON CHEF (though it is WAY overused and too intrusive in the movie). So, how did this movie end up so poor?!?! Well, the plot was about 95% predictable and the characters were about as 1-dimensional as possible. And the dialog?! What person would actually allow themselves to receive credit for coming up with the STUPID macho bull-crap that purports to be dialog? You get much greater realism from most cartoons!

i was at the premier of the movie last night in rome . i am not an expert in the art of film making because i do not believe it is necessary for me to , but my initial reaction was to have a huge laugh when the plot was revealed and i had no idea how things were going to get out of control . on top of this i was watching a movie that was just too bizarre . i was shocked when they told me about the death of some man who lived here in the hollywood hills and he died in 1971 with his wife .

Except for the glossy look, this show had little to recommend it. The writing was patronizing and convoluted. Without exception the characters were shallow and unsympathetic. The female characters came off the worst... reduced to spoiled, selfish airheads whose soul ambition was to run around in slip dresses and stilettos, and try to bag a man. This aspect of the show is all the more curious as the series was produced by two women! The acting for the most part was dull and humourless with the cast playing one dimensional characters attacking every scene on the same note.

Following is an intriguing thriller that requires constant awareness to be completely understood. The plot has many twists and uses displaced chronology. The event sequence complicates following Following. If you are willing to pay attention, it is an exciting movie full of noir earmarks. With the running time at 70 minutes, there is a lot to take in, but the fast pace helps to keep the viewer enthralled.Bill is a lonely, untidy fellow who takes up shadowing people and seeing where they go-what they do. He is a bit too conspicuous, however, and eventually gets caught by a well dressed, clean-cut bloke named Cobb.

i was lucky enough to read the book beforehand and i do know a little about Tudor england.the writing directing and editing of this TV movie for the most part was truly awful. i felt as if i was watching a really bad drama doc about the period rater then a movie.first there were too many cut's between important parts. And leaving out important events which happened at the time, one is henry's fall out with Rome over his desire to divorce Katherine of aragon which led to england's breaking away from Rome and establishing her own church. they barely stuck to the book at all.

previous reviewer claudio carvalho gave a much better recap of the film ' s plot details than i could . what do you make of this movie , and what have you missed ? it is not at all what i had hoped for . it lacks the impact of a historical comedy . in any case , i do n't think it will be very interesting to read . as far as i know , i have never seen an italian film before . this was one of those films that made me question why i even liked it so much .

I was sorely disappointed in this movie. Twice I was temped to walk out because segments of the movie were so demoralizing and depressing. The movie has elements that allude to all the seamy things in life (pornography, murder, suicide, fornication, hatred, gang warfare). The graphic nature of the violence in this movie was particularly disturbing.And Richard Dutcher does a great disservice to the LDS Church in portraying missionary attitudes, commitment, spirituality, and obedience as unfocused and lackadaisical.My biggest objection to this movie, however, was that it is the exact opposite of a feel-good movie.Dutcher's God's Army One was okay.

Before we start, may I say I hope you've already eaten when you're reading this. Why? Because, after I'd seen this film for the first time, the bird's look and sound made me want to eat chicken after the words 'The End' had appeared on the screen. So don't say you weren't warned.Fred Sears might have directed "Earth vs. the Flying Saucers" (an okay film and one of the bigger examples for Tim Burton's "Mars Attacks"), but "The Giant Claw" is not that giant a film.

this is one of my three all - time favorite movies . my only quibble is that the director , peter yates , has been given the option of watching it . i am a fan of the film so i would not have to see what is going to happen after it begins . unfortunately , i never get to see what is going to happen on the other side . i hope i will enjoy it again soon . please feel free to leave a review on goodreads or on your website for free reviews and / or recommendations . if you liked the movie i would really appreciate if you would leave a review .

No blood, no sex (though it oozes passion), no special effects, but just one of those pearls that comes across your movie screen when you're not really looking and grabs your attention. Great acting, great sets, great music, beautiful storyline. If only there were a lot more movies made like this one!The sets move us through time and make us feel like we were there.The acting appears like real life, and elevates us to the level of awareness of "Nanny", to whom no-one is a lost cause, least of all the inhabitants of her own "Halfway" house.

perhaps i missed something , but i found goya ' s ghosts to be a tedious costume melodrama . as to the ghost , i believe there is a great deal more to the story than what is told in any other genre of film . even if the director doesn ' t care for this movie , i don ' t think that he cares enough to pay much attention to anything except his own selfish desire to get rich . at the beginning of the movie , they are able to find ways to have their way in the plot and take some of the fun out of the scene .

If you have seen the Telugu version of Gilli "Okkadu" you will find this to be very similar in story line, but Gilli has different songs and takes place in Tamil Nadu not Andra pradesh. Although this is a remake of "Okkadu" you will find that Vijay and Trisha make this a unique film, Vijay and Trisha make a great pair. A few negatives were when Vijays character slaps Trishas character for going to buy a present for him, he never apologizes and she still stays with him in the end.

With actors like Depardieu and Richard it is really a hard task to make a dull movie. But Weber is a master in setting a slow pace and making supposedly funny scenes without any wits and depth. This movie is high on story but low on character. You never get to know any of the characters except for superficial slapstick. Unfortunately Weber has no idea what slapstick is all about. His style could be described at hit and miss. Of course some people laugh when they see someone slip on a banana peel. Weber directs his humor at this lot.

Hard to believe - but it is! I shouldn't be surprised. Commercials try to show how unique and "funny" a show can be. Yet not only didn't the commercials announcing this new show have the slightest iota of humor to me, I've not spoken with anyone who found the commercials amusing, either.I don't recall ever seeing a pilot so devoid of cleverness, cuteness or humor. The characters were insufferable for the most part. Especially Selma Blair's (which is astonishing she would agree to be in a fecal sample of a show like this).

Another lame attempt to make a movie "gritty" and "thought provoking"- whatever the hell that means. They have Al Pacino say a lot of words like - "Television killed football." Yeah whatever. This is another movie that showcases Oliver Stone's Delusions of Grandeur. If Stone is trying to show us that football will be our downfall or something, why does he insist on romanticizing the sport with his stilted camera movements and Kid Rock songs? He even throws Cameron Diaz into the fray for purely aesthetic reasons.

So, you wanna be a rock star? See this movie. You don't like rock, you say? Or you're REALLY into heavy metal? Then put on your favorite album and dream yourself away, this movie has nothing to offer. Rarely have I ever seen a movie being able to portrait the dream of being in a rock band as good as this. I had long hair during the late 1980's and early nineties, and I have played guitar for the last 15 years or so. Did I like Rock Star? Oh yes.

This movie has an outstanding acting, by Marilia Pêra, and a stunning dicretcion by the argentine Hector Babenco. This is, in my opinion, the best Brazilian movie ever made. The movie was filmed with child from the 'favelas' , the brazilian ghetos. The children weren't actors and were casted by Babenco in the city of Rio de Janeiro. The story is about the criminal children that are arrested in the correctional prison, that looks much worse than Alcatraz. The children are constantly raped and beaten by the policeman. Unfortunately this is not purely fiction, in Brazil it does happen till today.

We all know that the world is full of dodgy, rip-off horror films. Some of these can be fun to watch, due to their stupidity, awful effects and iffy dialogue. But Raptor, which could have been in the same league as the equally pointless Carnosaur series, does not even ATTEMPT to have any enjoyment in it. Its so poorly done, it is really unbearable, even if your just watching it with the intentions of having a no-brain day at home. Where do we start? Well... the sets are pretty drab. My old drama group created more realistic stages.

i have to say this is the worst movie that i have ever watched in my life , i can not even fathom how it ends . however , i 'm sure you would find it more interesting if you were n't such an ass - kicker and could give a shit about the film . i just wanted to let you know that i ' m really sorry about what happened to your car . i honestly did not care for the story , but i was trying to be a good friend . i never meant to get you hurt , but i guess i made the mistake of opening my mouth too far .

i went to see this movie at a book signing in lexington , ky last night . after a wonderful review , it was perfect to stay out until after the movie . i could feel the mood of the movie changing with each character being mentioned in this story . my eyes started to glaze over . i looked at the clock and noticed it was almost six . there was not much time left . i would have to go back to my office and watch another scene . i had never seen anyone look so worn down . i decided to go home to change .

Whoa. I mean, whoa. I mean, whoa whoa.I saw this movie, waaay back when I was eight, in 1996. Back then, CGI films were a rarity; and good ones even more so. Also, back then we listened to things called CD players. But I digress. I used to like this movie a lot, way back then, and up till viewing it again, I've held reaally fond memories of it. Hey, it's Don Bluth! Anyone who hates "All Dogs Go to Heaven" is clearly a robot.

it has been years since i have been privileged to see this movie on tv . i only wish i could take the time to enjoy it myself , but it is a horrible movie . it was so bad in my first year at school that i ended up getting into a lot of trouble with the girls . when you get your first film from someone who does not make a living by being a good actor , you learn to appreciate the good quality acting . i just ca nt understand why people who spend money on something as expensive as this would need to buy it .

Piranha starts out as expected, stupid white people going to discover new lands and exploit them. I thought for a while it might be a cannibal film. It starts off like so many others, showing nothing but shots off untouched Amazon rain forest. For all I know it could be Florida. At this point you figure some animal mutilation or natives will pop up. Instead you get the acting talents of William Smith, who starred in L.A. Vice and Angels Die Hard. He plays Caribe, an acclaimed hunter, who I would describe him as Jack Palance Light.

...than you easily spot the biggest fault of the movie. What was the motive? The details of the murders were used, but never explained. I guess the team got too much into the atmosphere, which is great, but the story is definitely lacking. There is no thread to follow. I guess if that was done properly, the movie would've lasted a bit longer, but it would've been worth it, at least for me.Casting is very good, I loved Wilson as the vulnerable Vicky.Not much more to say, really.

awful star wars knock - off with a slightly more comic tinge . robert urich stars as the leader of a group of men that have no idea who they are or where they are going . his name is david , so he really did get it right . this movie is based on him trying to help other people in various situations and find ways to make up for their mistakes . some of the actors ' names are quite funny , you can say that because they are all pretty good . what a waste of money ! it 's one of the most useless films ever made .

I enjoy science-fiction just as much as the next man but what the hell was that? Apparently shot over just three days using excess film stock left over from his previous film, 'Nana (1926),' this Jean Renoir short is a bewildering futuristic satire, produced on a budget that couldn't have been much more than zero. In the year 2028, following a great war, Africa has become the most civilised region on Earth, and what was formerly Europe has been designated "Terres Inconnues (Unknown Land)."

well , that was sure a waste of dave mckean ' s talents , was n ' t it ? do n ' t get me wrong , i liked the guy , but he was one of the greatest guys i had ever met ! and as far as movies went , this one was awful . the actors were just as terrible as the audience , with bad lighting , bad scenery and no acting whatsoever . they did n't have the same talent as the other actors , although i guess there is more to show here .

watching the preview of armored i thought the movie was either going to be a very bad or a very good horror movie . as soon as i heard about it my heart almost leaped out of my chest . how could this be happening to me ? all of these other film titles have shown that they are not really what we were looking for . and then there is james hendrasen , but he seems to be doing an excellent job of making this movie better , if not better than any of the other movies i 've seen in the past few years .

there are two things that i noticed in this film . ( this is not a spoiler , just a comment on the movie and an attempt to make me laugh . ) at the conclusion of the film , it was about a man who had some problems in his life . he never had very much money , and when he did , they were usually pretty high . as you can see , he ' s been in the army for several years , but he doesn ' t have a family to go home to during the holidays . instead , he lives in a small town in south dakota .

my two daughters ( ages 11 and 13 ) and i were lucky enough to see a screening of this movie which was based on a bad comedy . in truth , it was one of the biggest horror flicks i have ever watched . i remember watching this movie when i graduated from high school . i am sure it would have made more sense for me to just get a job or even work part time but there is no chance in hell that i would find any kind of job that would keep me from getting old .

rarely does a film capture such intense drama and emotion . what makes this film so unsettling is that the characters do not have much to say about the plot , but in a few seconds the actors begin to become lost in a scene where everything goes horribly wrong and they end up dead . the most interesting aspect about this movie is how bad things got . i mean it was bad enough as it was , but this film should be worse . the only reason i ca n't see any comedy at all today is because some of these people actually look funny in the film .

Nothing will ever top KOMODO with the lovely Jill Hennessey as a shrink (! ), but KvC ain't quite as bad as I expected for a SYFY channel quickie. Just make sure to watch it while drunk or stoned, or while trying to go to sleep. The unimaginative title basically says it all: A group of mostly unknown actors converge on an island where a government experiment to grow giant vegetables has gone wrong. Giant creatures that came into contact with the vegetables have taken over the island and eaten everyone. So now the government is preparing to blow up the island, regardless of the people being there.

some of the secondary actors try , really hard . and camera shots in the desert are quite lovely . ' he had been so engrossed with the film this time it took him a bit longer to absorb the rest of the speech , his eyes were half - closed from the sun and his ears were numb . but he could have done with a cup of beer . as soon as the last character came up on the screen i turned to face them . they were very excited about how the film should be played .

mr . bean has always been my favorite . no matte how many times you watch the same thing , the same one , the same number of different movies . but then there 's a big difference between doing it at home with me and watching it on your own . i do n't understand why i had to watch that movie because i did n't know what the theme was for this movie . if you liked this , go to see it in new york when you 're bored . i mean seriously . this movie is more like a horror film .

i do n ' t know what neighborhoods the folks who wrote the rave reviews for this movie live in , but if you were to go over to their homes and ask a bunch of people around to watch the show , they would just say " oh , no , that 's boring " or something like that . well , it turns out that this movie really is very old school ; the actors seem to enjoy it as much as anyone else . the main theme is : we must have had better taste when we started this film than we did when we first made it .

With the war not going well for the Soviet Union, Stalin accepted volunteers from the prisons and used the prisoners as shock troops. This is the story of one such battalion. There are petty crooks, political prisoners, soldiers kicked out of other units, gray-haired veterans of the White Army plus some dangerous criminals.They are thrown into battle ill-equipped, untrained and face the threat of the NKVD if they show signs of cowardice or failure.The special effects are rudimentary and many of the minor characters are one-dimensional, but the overall story is very human and riveting.I have not seen a version with subtitles or dubbing.

Being a former MST3k watcher, even I found this movie unwatchable. The awful attempts at humor-heck the awful attempts at acting. Nobody needs to read a harangue on this piece of junk.I just like how all the positive reviews were clearly written by cast members or family friends. Just click on their other reviews and wow--they are all reviewing Modern Vampires. Give me a couple of bucks and I can make a movie better than this. One of the most incompetent pieces of film-making I've ever seen and that's saying something.

This movie is about a young couple running away to start a new life in LA, who end up being stalked by a psycho at a deserted rest stop. Actually, it's really just about the girl (Nicole), since her boyfriend literally disappears within a few minutes. The movie gets going extremely fast, and early on you wonder how it could possibly stretch its story out to feature length. It isn't long before you realize that the movie does this by simply wasting time with unnecessary scenes that go nowhere.The story is not only paper-thin, but unstructured, stupid, and incoherent.

The girls might be prettier if you're their accompanist or a $#!+-faced onlooker. What I'm sayin' is that it'll take special circumstances for a non-whince reaction to this effort. The delivery of many lines appears to be distractingly unnatural for some actors. Lighting seems to be a problem, too, although failing eyesight may have accounted for my frequent squinting. And if you view this film, be open-minded enough to accept elements that no zoo or circus would reject: They are the above and below-ground creatures who feasted on dozens of campers near an empty Louisiana mansion.

shot in my former home town by a couple of college kids , this movie centers around some freak named jack . they call him an ' artist ' - who ? that would be cool ! but the problem is that his paintings show he is not very good at art . i really think it is more accurate to describe how he is doing . he just doesn ' t know how to act like someone else or even how to express himself . there is a lot of stuff wrong with this movie and everything that goes on afterwards .

so many of us who are devoted to the ` ` art ' ' of the motion picture will disregard or forget the concept , but i can not . this is an act of injustices in my time . why should they give a crap about it when it has nothing to do with any real substance at all ? i just like to see how that compares . i have seen a lot of good movies recently , but these were pretty stupid . and i saw no reason to think the movie was better than what i thought it would be .

jurassic park iii * _ _ _ adventure sam nell ( the dish ) , william macy ( happy texas , fargo . it is also very hard for a writer to write down a story that they really did n't want to play at . however , let me say that i have my moments when i think that this is going to be a good first book . perhaps i should just leave this movie as i can see no other way . anyway , if you would like to review the script please consider an attempt on the person who has been watching the screenplay .

it was 1983 and i was 13 . i watched valley girl on hbo one night when my parents were at the movies . there were some strange things going on , i could not take my eyes off of her . she kept looking over at me like she just saw something funny . so i got up to help her with the movie . " " then what happened ? " paul asked . 
 " after i helped her pick out the movie , i took her hand and we walked in the direction of the beach house . we walked about fifteen yards before a dog started barking right in front of us .

I thought this was a great action flick. A very good role for Geena Davis. She is a very versatile actress. One of my favs next to Angelina Jolie. I actually watched The Long Kiss Goodnight right after seeing the new Tomb Raider movie. It got me thinking, Charlie or Lara? Which one would win in a fight??? Either way, both women are very strong, intelligent characters that are fun to watch. Especially when they're kicking butt. I just hope to see Geena in another film soon. Seems like she's been out of the spotlight a bit too long.

being a gay man who lived through the time period examined in this tedious documentary , i was eager to find out what was going on that would make this movie so entertaining . i just wanted to see it because i thought i had seen enough of these movies to last me for awhile , but then again i did n't know much about tv or acting . however , after watching this movie my curiosity got the better of me and i started asking around . the director was very good and he gave me quite a detailed description of the plot and characters .

Apparently this movie was based on a true story. I'm not sure how accurate it is, though. But it really reminded me of how when I see that someone has been murdered on the news, it's amazing how much it doesn't affect me. Sure, I think it's terrible, but I honestly don't care. I move on. It seems that murder is trivial now. This is what River's Edge shows. Nobody really seems to care about this girl and her death, not even the killer. Then what's the point?

I've been writing hardboiled crime fiction for a number of years now. When a writer develops a story he always has a character/actor in mind to bring the story to life. Last weekend I found a new one in Paul Vario playing uncle Benny in Eddie Monroe. This was a slick film highlighted by Vario's presence both on and off the screen (as his voice-over narration is also heard). I also especially liked the actress playing Benny's niece and Eddie's ex-wife, although everyone did a fine job in this exciting movie about playing with bad guys and the double-crossing that goes with it.

there are so many things wrong with this movie that it is hard to pick just a few . let me start with a little comedy in which a protagonist who gets kidnapped or killed is forced to kill several innocent people during his escape . the plot is fairly boring and you can see why the title of the movie is so good . however , since i am an expert on medieval - style medieval film production i had to look up some parts of this book and get them based on what was actually done here .

i think trash really sucks . i watched it a couple of weeks ago and i have n ' t seen that one in a year . it 's actually quite funny . the only thing i can see is that it looks like garbage . you know , maybe this movie will end up with my name on it . do you think i am crazy ? i really hate to admit it , but when i saw this movie , i was shocked at how many people seemed to want to talk to the audience . the whole show just made me so uncomfortable i thought i might vomit .

wow , did this episode start on a stooooopid premise ! the enterprise is chugging along when all of the lights go out ! this is a movie that i saw once on the radio . i knew it would be better in person . i had been so worried about seeing my dad and his new girlfriend again that i have completely forgotten to bring any of my own movies home . i do not know where they even are in this world . how can i possibly use this film to get away with taking part in something this stupid ?

ok . . . . so , by minute 15 in the film , there ' s still no dialogue . this film arrived to me after i left it a day ago ; i didn ' t even notice it coming into my head . i was only in it because i wanted to see some action and got caught off guard , but then i remember that it was supposed to be a surprise . " don ' t take this any further , don ' t take it any further ! please do not take it any further ! ! ! ! ! ! ! ! !

this movie was obviously made with a very low budget , but did they have to make it so obvious ? ! ! " what are you talking about ? ! i do n't understand any of this ! " i asked in disgust . i sat down on my bed . the television was off and there was even a film in the ' s ' . i looked over at the tv for the first time since waking up . the screen showed a bunch of kids playing soccer . there was a big crowd of adults and kids that were yelling and making sounds .

Irvine Welsh's follow up to Trainspotting hits the screen as three short stories set in Edinburgh, all with a few of Welsh's trade marks, drug culture, depression, the working class and Hibernian football club. Uneasy to watch in places, it is no less than very well written, 2 of the stories having a darkly comic twist to them while the 2nd story a serious (and shockingly realistic) plot to it. Will not appeal to most, including myself to a point, but will no doubt adopt a cult following.

this is by far the funniest sitcom that has ever aired on tv . i own all 9 seasons on television . what a crock ! this is not the first time i have been here and watched this film before . i just hope the script is good and the characters are real . i hate this part for some reason . i really want it to be over so i can get away from here . but i am stuck . if you want to see this movie , or even watch it , you need to get an idea of who is in control here .

golden boy is in my opinion one the sleeper / lost treasures animes out there . a sexy comedy , this one was much more funny than the real thing . as i read the play i started feeling sick . i tried to pay attention and try to think of why it would be funny . that 's all i ever did while acting . i had a few moments of panic on the way to the theatre but i quickly got used to the character . when i first came to the scene i really felt sorry for the actors but they just looked so sad .

this was a random rental at the video store . but i was impressed from the start . wooden camera and tripod were one of the few pieces of film i had ever seen . the quality was just about right . if it could have done a better job , i 'd have been able to take a picture of what i was thinking when i first saw it . it 's a sad story that makes people wonder how someone can live in this country without having seen or read all of the movies they watch . however , it has proven useful since my friend bob is currently writing a book on the subject .

this really is by far the worst movie i ' ve ever seen in my whole life ( i ' m approaching about as close to the real thing as a man can be . but it ' s worth it to watch this movie ; i ' ll admit that it doesn ' t have a lot of humor at its best , and you know what else ? it ' s the most absurd one i have ever seen ! there ' s nothing amusing about this movie . i think i just wanted to see this movie because i found it too funny to look at again .

this movie is certainly one of the greatest films ever made . it is a story told in a steady , positive way and has been shown countless times over the last three years which i think would be impressive if it was n't based on a bunch of old cliché crap . it is completely lacking in character . the whole plot is boring . the only thing that really catches your attention is the man who lives next to him . as he sits in his car he is staring straight ahead , ignoring all the other kids playing with their toys . his eyes are turned away from the tv .

i watched this film mistakenly thinking that it was that other radio station zombie flick . the shonky production values at the end of this movie are almost as bad as the ones in the first part . but if you want to watch any of this , then you have to watch this episode . it does not exactly fit the bill of good movies , but there is one thing that makes it great . the characters never do anything remotely similar to the films and the plot goes nowhere with them . it is really too bad that they are so far gone and will never re - emerge again .

Ah, another movie with motorcycles, hell's angels posse and Steve A-Lame-o as the not-so-cool car driver. This movie does not rely on story but lots of drinking, pot smoking, and lots of moronic acts. Steve's rendition of a dying cat during his "I love what I know" serenade had me vomiting for hours. Bike chick Linda (rrrr) makes out with everyone! Fats did the best acting since he just grunts and makes sounds. I also dare you to try to make out what Banjo is saying. "You messin' wit private stock."

I took my 14 year old to see this movie. We left after 15 or 20 minutes. It was absolutely awful! This movie should be rated R at the least. I am not that strict with movies but, this was just too much. It was a waste of money. I thought it would contain some comedy and I knew the comedy would probably be crude but, this was WAY beyond crude. I was sitting there watching and reading (a certain subtitle at the beginning of the movie was what really got me) and I could not believe how crudely sexual it was.

in the twilight years of his career , charles bronson forged long - running partnerships with several directors , most notably j . for the first half hour or so , we talked about film and acting , and what we were going to spend our money on . he always had a plan . he was never one to go out and buy anything that i would have described as cheap , but this movie took me by surprise . how could an actor possibly come up with something like this after only seeing it a few times ?

Ever once in a while I run into a movie that is so embarrassingly bad I wonder why movies exist. This is one of them. This is a terrible attempt to parody The Godfather with annoying cartoon sounds, and bad dialogue. Eddie Deezen is just plain annoying as Tony, an annoying twit who upon his father, Don (William Hickey)'s request, takes over the family business. Tony, as I said, is an annoying little twit. This makes the whole movie a complete mess. The movie is terribly daffy. It's too cartoonish.

A magazine columnist who writes about life on her farm house when in fact she lives in a NY apartment must come up with a plan when she learns that her publisher and a war hero will spend Christmas with her. After a slow start, it turns into an entertaining little screwball comedy, thanks to a fine cast. In a big departure from her previous role as a femme fatale in "Double Indemnity," Stanwyck displays a nice comedic flair. Morgan is smooth as the affable war hero while Greenstreet is well cast as the publisher.

Not a box office success; no-one really knows why. It may have failed simply because of its title. It looks as though you need a two-word tough-guy title to attract a sufficient proportion of the idiot crowd - "Die Hard", "Lethal Weapon", "Hard Weapon", "Die Lethal", etc. - talking about "the long kiss goodnight" will get you nowhere. But for once Renny Harlin has made a GOOD action movie. A large part of the reason for this lies in the fact that the central character, Samantha, earns our affection and interest early on.

the first time i saw this was when i was with a date , and she thought it was an awful joke . i felt sad because it actually was n't funny at all in that way , but it is funny on a much larger scale for people who know about movies . this movie was probably made in germany by the nazis , where it featured some of their most notorious " crime fighters " . what i heard from one of my friends and co - stars came across as something out of a sci - fi film , but i knew better .

this is a new barbie movie . the graphics were really good . they made the movie seem partially realistic . i like to watch this movie when i 'm in college and i like to see how it happens . it has a lot of interesting characters who come together to make the movie even more entertaining . if you want me to tell you all about this , i will . i would suggest that you keep your mouth shut about this for the rest of the film so that you can get an early start tomorrow .

hey what do you expect form a very low budget movie ! ? ! ? although i have n ' t seen any of this kind of thing in a while it is pretty impressive . i ca nt help but think there are more movies like this than just the one that made me want to go into this video , and i could actually understand why people thought this was good . this film is bad enough without having to watch it . it is so depressing . no one seems to be watching it . as for the plot , i am not impressed at all with how it came about .

Wow, Stella Shorts are great! Lots of patrons from The State and Stella, the TV show. I never knew that Stella could have gotten any better then they were on the TV show Stella or even Comedy Central Presents: Stella. I also never knew short comedies could be any good. My favorite ones were Pizza, Racking Leaves, The Woods and David arranges to a meeting with his long lost cousin Greg. I think over all that David was the funniest one. Its funny when he doesn't make sense. I like the music in the shorts.

first i got ta say that this film is way less pretentious than the da vinci code . sure , there were some decent comedies but not many great ones . i 'm a real fan of james bond films . my mom used to sit with me every day and watch them as she always did . it would be nice if your mother was watching those movies like she usually does . i am an adult , i know that i should be able to have a parent watch these movies so i just do n't see what can be done with it . besides , no one likes the movie .

First of all, before I start my review, I just read every review for 'The Muppet Movie' here and I can't believe that someone could give a negative review to a movie like this. (Fortunately there was only one.) I mean, I can understand how someone may not like 'Star Wars' due to the whole Sci-Fi genre, but to not like a movie starring some of the most lovable puppets in the history of mankind is almost sad. Okay, I will step off my soapbox now and review this movie. 'The Muppet Movie' came out when I was seven.

this is a tough film to review , since several factors need to be taken into account . let ' s see if i can figure out what they really are ! the first thing i ' ve learned from this film has been that we have to follow our own rules , and not allow ourselves to be corrupted as well . it ' s hard to understand how anyone or anything could become a victim of something that does absolutely no good . it ' s like watching a movie in which everyone else is acting perfectly . you can see them , but nothing happens .
