i'm not going to ramble on about it but i'm just going to make it brief. basically for those who don't know how prue actually died........... the first time round the demonic assassin comes hit piper and prue with an energy ball they fly through the wall blood everywhere. phoebe the third sister comes down the stairs, says the spell which send him away but not vanquished. (NEEDS THE POWER OF THREE)leo comes heals them both and so on. they get exposed along the line and the only way the can be saved is for a demon named tempus to turn back time.

bottom - of - the - barrel stinker is so bad it ' s beyond funny . the ` ` plot ' ' is about an american mercenary , who travels through france and america , in order to get information from the cia . he is a good friend of one of our colleagues in washington . i know him because he went on a business trip to paris with me at his last tour . there ' s plenty of things about him you don ' t want to see . he was nice , friendly , funny , clever , and had some great qualities .

We have a character named Evie. Evie just wants to be a good person. She's nice, friendly, smiles often, but is strangely brutally honest. Evie also has a secret. Her idiot-savant sister has been reciting original poetry, which is getting the community excited about the sister writing. Unfortunately, it's Evie's poetry. While their mother starts being happy again and the boy next door shows his interest in Evie, Evie just tries to figure out what she really wants to do.What to keep in mind while watching this movie is who Evie really is.

the appeal of this film has to be the artsy euro style , because there ' s absolutely no substance . this film is just nothing like any movie i ' ll ever see . it ' s about a group of characters whose lives are on the verge of going down in history as they try to make a difference for their people . there ' s some serious character - making involved , with some scenes being forced upon others . the main thing is that the protagonist can ' t keep his own mouth shut , and the action gets so bad he loses his nerve .

ineffectual , molly - coddled , self - pitying , lousy provider jimmy stewart is having a bad marriage to carole lombard . after several years , she 's taken the money from her father and moved into a modest home on the outskirts of orlando . she has a beautiful dog , a mix of poodle and dog . they do n't look much alike , but with hair like theirs , it will have to be enough . she does n't have many friends in orlando . i was not surprised when she decided to give up teaching at a community college .

this third installment in the scarecrow series is by far the best of the lot . i know , i know . i was just a kid and i still remember when i was a kid . you see , my parents got into a fight . they had been fighting for about three days after they came back to visit me . there was a whole stack of magazines and some pictures of me . my mom said something about trying to make it up to me , that i needed to be more mature than i was , but really she was just trying to make me look like a nerd .

directed by diane keaton and adapted from a book by franz lidz . a young mother selma lidz ( andie mcgarvey ) was kidnapped by a man whose name she could not remember , and that is why they were unable to find her at all . as the horror of her kidnapping comes to their attention , there are those who want to go and try to make it better . the story tells more about her than it lets on . she is a good kid , but unfortunately for her , there is no one who understands her and wants to make her feel better in some way .

Let me first state that I REALLY REALLY wanted to like this film. For the most part the actors and actresses looked their parts, and did fairly well in their roles, but the movie lacked any real plot. It seemed so wraped up in seeming 'wacky' that no interesting story ever shone through. Also, the camera work was often sloppy, attempting snatchlike camera work and failing miserably. Most of the time, shots meant to look cool ended up being confusing. Perhaps something was lost during translation, but some of the characters were just... stupid.

i got this movie as a buy one get one deal at troma . com with the ruining ( which is n ' t really awful ) . i think you can tell what a film was . it was mostly about an old lady that had a car wreck when she was 17 or 20 years old . i think she was looking for somewhere to settle down and take a vacation , but could find nothing worth renting in a town such as troma unless you wanted to rent a house off the main street . i think that was the last movie on the dvd shelf .

i can not stress how bad this movie is . this director took every cheap little unintelligent shot at making the film , and then he did the same thing that had been on tv since it came out a few years ago . so , we have now seen five films , each of them very poorly done , and are wondering what the heck they were supposed to be doing . i really feel like i should have been watching something else instead of this crap , but i just could n't seem to focus on any of those programs .

Don't be fooled by the plot out-line as it is described on the cover (at least the Swedish version). The story on this seems rather interesting, with speculative hints. Nothing can be further from the truth. This is the absolute most sad movie experience I've ever had... It is plain and right AWFUL and should not be sold or rented to anyone. If you still think the plot seems intriguing, reflect on this: telephones can move, run and kill people as can also any other electric appliance. It can throw things at you, haunt you and run after you.

this horror movie starts out promisingly enough and there is a moment where i thought to myself ` ` this is one of those times where the plot is just so ridiculous , and i am actually looking forward to hearing how it gets made . that is not going to happen . you can not imagine how much i have wanted to hear about such things in my life for many years . the thing is , i really had no idea it was going to be this stupid . i never would have been able to watch any of these shows if i had known !

komodo vs . cobra is not going to set the world on fire . it ' s not a hallmark of cinema , or a comedy , or even any other type of drama . i ' m not saying that we should watch it either . there are a lot of films you don ' t like , and they make your head spin . but the main thing for me now is to spend as much time watching the show as i can . in this case , it is really just an episode about the history of hollywood .

One of quite a few cartoon Scooby Doo films, "Scooby Doo and the Loch Ness Monster" turns out to be entertaining, exciting, interesting, funny and also does a surprisingly good interpretation of the Highlands of Scotland. One annoying aspect of the film is the voices of many of the characters - American people trying to sound Scottish in this film are unfortunately not succeeding all that well (although some people do better Scottish accents than others).Daphne has come to the Highlands to see her cousin Shannon and the Highland games at Blake Castle.

It's really good to see Van Damme's film are slowly getting better of late and especially compared to C-grade flops "Derailed" and "Second in command" which were both tragic and not in a good way. The Sheperd: Border patrol is a good action flick with some really great action/fight sequences. It's good to know that Van Damme still knows how to kick seeing as his last film "Until Death" had no martial arts in it at all!! !That being said, this film is significantly inferior to "Until Death" which was a really good turn for Van Damme.

A very good film, focusing on a very important issue. Fetal alcohol syndrome is a very serious birth defect that is totally preventable. If more families saw this film, perhaps more children would not end up like Adam. Jimmie Smits performs in one of his best roles ever. This is an excellent movie that takes into account a very special family with very important needs. This is not unlike thousands of families that exist in the United States today. There are children struggling with this world wide. The really important point here is that it all could have been prevented.

i am a chess player and i wanted to like this film . trouble is , the content could have been much more pleasant if i had n't heard that this was only going to be the worst film of its kind yet . there are two major characters and one character who plays a role in them . the third character is a woman with long red hair ( not very chic ) and eyes that look as if they are trying to tear you to shreds . she has an attitude that makes it hard for people to get serious about her .

i ' m a big fan of patricia hodge and mariam margolyes , so i watched this show when it came on . the director was trying to explain how the movie works , but he could never think straight . he was making excuses for it , and acting out his scenes . we were going to start filming in an area that would probably not be considered a safe environment by some people . as soon as those ideas entered your head you decided to change the scene and make it interesting . i just ca n't recall exactly why or what caused me to watch the show .

Very enjoyable 50's Western. I have it in my collection and recommend it to Western fans.Mostly Victor Mature's movie and quite well done in my estimation.He's a trapper who joins a frontier post as a scout. Red Cloud caught three of them on their land and took their possessions. They all joined as scouts after their loss.Victor has set his eye's on the Colonel's wife and lives life on the post without much regards to regulations.Action done quite convincingly but no great depth or much feeling to other characters.50's Westerns are my favorites and this slides easily to a satisfaction.

I've never made one of these before, but this movie was literally so bad I had to say something about it.I'm all for independent film-making as the past year has seen of the worst (in my opinion) of Hollywood's showings, the mainstream just seems to have lost touch with what making good films is all about. That being said movies like this really give independent film a bad reputation.The characters are boring and too stupid to empathize with. The direction is horrible, the plotting is horrible, the plot itself is horrible, stay away, far away.

I just saw this film at the Sidewalk Film Festival in Birmingham, AL, which was actually a really fun festival, and was blown away by it. It was the best movie I saw all day by a long shot. A school aged prostitute meets with a middle age man and attempt to end there deep depression together. It's an inner look into the darkest parts of human sexuality. Story stems from real life occurrences, ripped straight from the headlines. Raw, blunt dialog and a killer twist at the end. The film does contain graphic sexual dialog and nudity.

OK, this movie seems to have been pretty well covered by earlier comments, but there are a couple of items I wish to add. The mad scientist is producing a serum from the blood of a caged animal in order to turn a man into a werewolf. If we suspend our disbelief enough to buy into that, fine. But the animal in the cage is a coyote. That would make a werecoyote. Did audiences in 1942 not know the difference between a wolf and a coyote? They're easy to tell apart.

why oh why did i ever waste my time watching this film ? it was given to me on video . you know , i really felt like a kid in a box and could not wait to see the first movie of the year . how many times have i told you to watch this film ? if you are reading this then we need to stop because that 's the only way for us to do this job . the story is basically one - sided . the plot is just plain crazy . i ca n't believe this ! there is no way i would even consider viewing this film .

i thought the this film had an interesting name and just might have proved thought provoking , but was i right in assuming it was not the movie itself ? there are always things that can go wrong for a story . well , it worked out pretty well for its first one , so i guess there was some small disappointment in having to make a final effort to stop it . however , after looking at the scene where the character is killed in front of her own family , i find that i do not really care if i see any more movies on this screen .

we all know that the world is full of dodgy , rip - off horror films . some of these can be a lot of fun . let me try to explain . if you have ever read this film then please consider giving it a few seconds to think about what it is really worth doing . i could tell you more about it when you got into the ' 60 's . i was in the movie for 20 years before coming to los angeles . i saw this movie but did not realize just how many people were involved .

This is an excellent, little known movie. Tom Selleck does an outstanding job of acting in this movie, with the Japanese 'Clint Eastwood'. I'd love to see if this movie has come out on DVD yet, there are some spots that clearly have been cut. Hiroku (Tom's love interest) has clearly had some parts chopped. It would be interesting to see more of Japan in the film. The baseball sequences are far and away the most realistic of any baseball movie, I'm quite sure most of the actors were current or former baseball players.

There must have been a lot of background info that was left out of the movie. In fact, in the film, the girl, Lizzy, didn't even appear depressed. She just seemed like a girl that went out of control when she finally got to college, mainly from doing drugs and drinking alcohol. That seemed to be her problem, not mental illness. Sure, she had emotional problems because her dad left and she barely saw him as a child, and her mom seemed a little out there.

There was nothing remotely funny about this movie. It makes fun of various sports movies and clichés but nothing about it is remotely funny. Most of the movies they parody doesn't even fit in with the film and are really only their so they can be in it. Non The main actor was well cast in it but that's really the only good thing about this film. Also the various cameos in it were kind of cool to see but i have no idea why they would waste their time being in this piece of garbage.

i gave this movie 2 instead of 1 just just because i am a polite person . this movie made me really want to do something fun like read , write or do anything else . if i have learned anything from all the movies i discovered it was that people are so easy to love when they see their loved ones for the very first time . what is wrong with me ? why ca n't i enjoy what is being played and enjoy the fact that some good times come along in the next 10 years ? i had to get back to work as fast as i could .

New rule. Nobody is allowed to make any more Zombie movies unless they actually come up with an original idea.Sadly, this movie doesn't. They have the premise that Bounty hunters go out and kill Zombies and prove it by cutting off their fingers. Well, problems with that. Most people have ten fingers, why not just collect ten bounties for one Zombie? Why not just kill a regular person and pass that off as a Zombie finger? Not to mention the utter silliness of hunting zombies with a bolt action rifle.I sometimes think films like this are resume fillers for makeup and FX guys.

i ' m trying to understand what people liked about mirrormask . i am an avid film viewer and hobbyist film buff . i had no problem watching this one , or any of the others , over the last three months . it made me wonder how many more films would have to remain on dvd for long . if we can find enough evidence to convince a movie producer to sell them at a discount price , perhaps we could even make some other movies . just then the sound system went silent and i realized everyone in the room had died .

a young couple decides to runaway to sunny california . they never reach their destination as they decide to pull off the highway and head out into the woods to find a motel . chapter 17 
 that same night , when i get up to shower and dress for the movie , i am surprised to see an empty bed in my room . this is strange . i have not heard anyone snore in my room for a long time . since i was at home with my mom , i started sleeping in my mother 's old bedroom . i usually wake early on sunday morning because it is always dark and dreary .

River's edge is not a PLEASANT film to watch but it is an incredible one. Having viewed it many years ago I truly think it would still have the ability to shock were it to be re released or remade or something. Perhaps no movie ever made has captured the essense of young suburban inertia like this distrubing frightening movie. Given that this is based on a true story it is even more disturbing. Very well acted and just UNPLEASANT at many times to watch but also a little known masterpiece and a truely important film. Should be a mandatory to watch shown nationwide in all highschools.

i was at a friends house for thanksgiving and watched a dvd of the movie , eddie monroe . i felt like it had been filmed in one of those cheesy horror movies that only you can see in any kind of horror movie because they really do n't have anything better to do . when the movie started , there were so many people talking and laughing and we thought it was all some kind of horrible prank . then this guy tells them that he wanted to talk to us . what a moron . i remember him talking about his girlfriend , laura .

we all know what chan - wook park can do . if you have n ' t seen oldboy ( or the sympathy trilogy , that is ) i suggest you find this movie a little more interesting . as i stated earlier , it gets better every time you read about it . at least this one has been pretty good , so i could say for sure there are good reasons to enjoy it . here , though , i would like to say that when i first saw this movie , it looked great with my eyes but it soon deteriorated when i saw it was a parody of a horror story .

Buster Keaton was arguably at his most enjoyable when he did short 20 minute films, and they don't come more rib-ticklingly funny than this gem. The dead pan comic gets involved in a photographic mix-up with a wanted felon. This leads to his elaborate evasion of several street cops and fellow passengers who recognise the his face from the "Wanted" signs. The Goat is choc-a-bloc with brilliant site gags, from the opening scene at the bread queue, right up to the wonderful elevator chase at the end. A Keaton film never feels as though its silence is lacking, as sound is never something you needed with him.

lackawanna blues is a moving story about a boy who is raised in a house by some pretty unusual people . this story makes it sound like someone else lives there with him or something , but the truth is , the boy has been adopted by his mother . he does not really want to have any friends , and at first he does not seem interested enough to go out with anybody . his mother , however , insists that this story was made up to make her son more comfortable so that she could ' feel ' how awful it must be for him .

mr . ` ` uwe fail ' ' strikes again , transformed a classic game in a cheap piece of crap . poor guy does nothing for the next two hours . then his wife starts crying and i have to tell her he is going to be sorry because she did n't like it so much . after they go home my mother gets up with him and tries to calm him down or something . but by the end of the movie he has lost it all . that was a real pain in the - ' 
 ` do n't worry about it .

While Disney have been THE animation studio for the past 70 years, there have always been rivals to their supremacy. When this review was written in 2009, for example, companies like Dreamworks and (to a lesser extent) Warner Brothers and Ardman, were bringing out animated movies that could be said to challenge the Disney dominance. Back in the beginning, in that late '30s and early '40s heyday when Disney was serving cinematic banquets like Snow White, Dumbo and Fantasia, the competition was provided by brothers Dave and Max Fleischer.

i saw this on the accent underground release with the short films . i found the film at first boring , but now it 's very entertaining and i enjoy watching it as much as any person else . the movie has such a good feel to it that i decided to look it over anyway . it takes place in a large room where all the walls are covered with photographs of famous actors , actresses and even some of my best friends from high school . they all have similar appearances , but each has different expressions of the same personality . well , it was actually just one of those things .

this telecast of the classic musical ` ` sweeney todd ' ' does not do the production justice , but is still very popular with the audience . i would have preferred to film this in one of the theaters than on the tv channel , but that was not a choice as there was no way to be allowed to stop the movie until after it had even begun . i could have just edited this and played it as if nothing had happened . instead , i watched it in the theater while the others sat around and waited for the plot to come up .

When a friend and I saw this in the recent releases, we decided to get it despite the fact that neither of us had heard of it before. We both like Costas Mandylor and it had James Coburn so we figured it couldn't be that bad. We were wrong. It was. It was REALLY that bad. No actor or actress could have made this film worth seeing. It was like taking Titanic, The Poseidon Adventure and some nuclear bomb film and trying to cut and paste it all together.I must admit that there were a couple of chuckles.

This film is on my list of worst movies ever made. The story is disconnected and it is difficult to understand what is going on or the reason for the characters' actions. All films need to have an inner logic, and this film just doesn't have it - the story doesn't make any sense. To see Faye Dunaway, Christopher Plummer and Diana Quick wasting their talents in this movie is a crime. Faye Dunaway is the lucky one, because she plays the victim and gets killed early in the film.

Well, that was sure a waste of Dave McKean's talents, wasn't it? Don't get me wrong: when it comes to graphic design, Dave McKean may be the best in the world right now. The layered, textured look he can accomplish with just a few pencil lines on rough paper make the efforts of people like Peter Greenaway and David Fincher look like what they are: hackwork. McKean has been the godfather of a revolution in the look of comics, film, even magazine ads which borrow the distinctive collage effect he has pioneered.But this movie?

this was a very good ppv , but like wrestlemania xx some 14 years later , the wwe crammed so much action that i could hardly see the end of the film , and i was too tired and bored to watch it anyway . it took only two hours , just to go to bed at 1 am . when i finally got off the elevator at 2:08 am i found myself in a big empty warehouse with nothing to show for it but an empty office . the walls were made of thick brown bricks , and the floor was black concrete .

Hitchcock's original classic benefited tremendously not only from the performance of, but also the 'look' of Anthony Perkins. He projected a kind of clean-cut innocence: a young teen-idol type of persona. He was not an actor who had portrayed baddies before this; nor was he physically suited to the role of what the public might have imagined a psychopath to look like, especially in the 50's when this ultra-chilling aspect of mental illness (split personality psychosis) was relatively unexplored in film. Which is exactly why the casting of him as Norman Bates was a slice of true Hitchcockian genius.

for the record , i hate spoof movies . except for mel brooks and airplane ! because those are classics , you would think they would n't be any better than this . it really sucks . if i had seen this film in the first month of my college career , i may have been able to find a way to spend some extra money on something different , but now all i have is a box full of crappy movie trailers . i do n't understand why people insist on having so many things that we do not know about the movie .

A woman in love with her husband (he's suicidal) decides to have a baby to save his life. She's been to a fertility clinic - as has the lover she takes - so both know how artificial insemination works; but, instead of using the method thousands of people use every year around the world (the $5 turkey baster), they engage in coitus. We also are to believe that although the immigrant is in love with his fiancée, he doesn't suggest the obvious alternative to intercourse.

so bad , it ' s entertaining , especially during cocktail hour , and believe me , you ' ll need a good shot for this . i ' ve seen too many of them in my life ( as a child ) to count . however , there ' s nothing like seeing the best movie ever made . the worst thing that can happen is someone getting eaten or worse . if you are going to be an actor , you don ' t want to put yourself through that sort of film - unless you want to be the most famous actor in hollywood .

this movie was included in the six wives of henry viii bbc miniseries dvd . i loved those six movies because they had a wonderful plot and dialogue . the best part is that it would never come to an end for anyone . if there is one person you can trust to keep the story from going too far into the past , it is me . i do n't remember reading much about this movie until now ; i hope i have n't overstepped at all . i love my friends , but they are a pain in my butt . what 's so weird about these stories is that they actually work .

warner brothers produced this 3d extravaganza that was the biggest commercial success for westerns in 1953 . guy madison leads them to the film , but he has no ability with a camera or even a radio , so he plays along like he ' s a star . there is just nothing i can do about what he is doing , other than show it to my readers and tell them to put it on a website . i guess you can say i ' d rather watch these movies than spend the money . i watched most of those shows while growing up , but i ' ve seen many of the others .

this movie narrate the story of john belushi , based of his biography ` wired ' , wrote by bob treacher . there is no other film like this in any of the theaters i have visited and been in over the past two weeks . a great piece of art is shown on one of these shows and it is a real letdown to see the actors acting so poorly ( as if they really knew how hard it was to do what they were supposed to be doing ) . the play is not very realistic but it seems to go off without a hitch .

This movie sucks so bad. Its funny to see what a poor story this has, where two pea-brained American twins who know about nothing outside their school can come to another continent, and do unimaginable things there. Its just so stupid and so bizarre. How can they just find two French guys, hit on them and in the end kiss them, not knowing anything about them? More realistic would have been having the guys take them away and rape them, which could have easily happened in such a situation. As for the bit where they make the French President drink 'bad water', that was just lame.

The most notable feature of this film is the chemistry between the actors, the sense of camaraderie in their dialogue and dances. This typical rising-star musical has an overworked plot, even for 1944, but because of the actors it's still fun to watch. Hayworth isn't even that much of a dancer, but she has a lot of 'inexperienced' charm that fits her character. Kelly plays his usual caring authoritarian role while Silvers provides plenty of self-deprecation and laughs. The movie can also be very serious at times. Not a must-see, but recommended if you like the actors.

I don't care what anyone else says, this movie is the worst piece of trash committed on film. What was John Landis thinking?I know it's based on a series of children's books, but c'mon! Even kids hate this movie. It's pointless and boring. Tom Arnold once again amply demonstrates that his only talent is wasting production money.I think the only reason The Stupids hasn't appeared on the 100 worst films of all time is that only 20 or so people will admit to watching this garbage. At least Hobgoblins made it on MST3K.

this is one of my favorite movies ever! along with casablanca and cannibal holocaust, this is near perfect cinema. rex allen narrates this wonderful tale of a cougar who just needs a little loving. contains action, adventure, suspense, comedy, and riverbed chaos! SEE THIS MOVIE IF YOU HAVE TO KILL TO DO IT!!! you will not find a better cat picture anywhere, with "cat from outer space" coming in as a not so close second. charlie's performance is magnificent. even includes animal cruelty and intense logging! gotta love disney, for all moral failures!

it was so disjointed - it seemed to jump from place to place - and the ` ` thief ' ' was just an ordinary man , who worked for the police . my own father said he heard this story but did not like it . i ca n't explain it better than that . i loved that movie . it 's a terrible waste of time . all i could see in the movie was that they were running around looking for someone , and that someone may be dead . i wanted to cry , but my eyes would not move . the story is almost funny .

but certainly a serious contender for one of the worst 10 of all time . i got this dvd cheap , with an awful number of reviews from some of the other shows and people who made this movie , and it just had to be the best ! i mean , what does that even have to do with anything else ? why would anyone make a movie like this over and over in their own homes ? well , there was definitely something wrong with the premise and it did not go very far when you think about how bad the characters are compared to these guys .

for those that might send me nasty e - mails , shove it . there is a trend in hollywood where those who do not follow this film are given the bad guys role , but then there is also a trend where those who do join in have to go with their friends to the movies . what really sucks is that i ca n't figure out how to get into this movie , let alone how to get into it . i am going to have to watch this thing until the morning when i wake up and think about getting on a plane to california and having my vacation from this world over .

This movie is silly and very short of being a funny movie. Unhappy 'easterners' are not pleased with being out west; so they hire a drunk wagon master(John Candy)to lead them back east. Sight gags were just not funny enough to carry this one. And Richard Lewis gets on your nerves very quickly; but then I honestly don't like him at anything he does. Ed Lauter is hilarious as the bumbling villain.The movie was dedicated to Candy. He died from a massive heart attack ten days before the movie was completed.

amazing , amazing , amazing . what more can be said ? jacobi is the best hamlet ever to grace the screen . when i first read this piece it was just one of many other movies i saw as an undergraduate student . and even though we did not really understand each other at that point in our lives i am sure there were a few nice stories about me who were interesting enough to interest us . no one had seen me yet . i must admit that i have seen some of these films and enjoyed most of them . they were good .

I recently had to watch this for a project in a Sociology class and thought it was absolutely the worst movie I have ever had to sit through. It was like bad a bad cinemax movie with all the "good bits" taken out. Bad acting, the fake documentary set up, nonsensical plot, and rudderless direction all combine to make a terrible, terrible film.The female characters are basically only there to be sex objects. Consider this exchange: "He's hot." "He has a girlfriend." "Do you have a girlfriend?" "No."

Begrudgingly gave it a 3 - one point each for Fonda, Stanwyck, and the supporting cast.Never saw this one before - am watching it right now and it has just gotten to the part where Henry Fonda is carrying Babs over the threshold. If I continue watching, it will be just to see if Fonda and Stanwyck will be able to pull this one out of the dumper.But after reading the other viewer comments, I'm not very optimistic.The opening ski scenes were enough to put me off my lunch. The voice-overs were obviously done in a sound studio, and the editing between the exterior shots and the closeups was horrendous.

ohmygawd ! ! ! the magic garden is perhaps one of my most vivid ' 70s childhood memories . two hippie chicks from a trailer park are in love and there is no way i am going to let that get out of hand again . what happened to this movie ? why did this movie become such an issue with the entire population of new york city , or the united states ? it would be bad to see this movie on a first date . i do not have any particular liking for anything that involves sex , but i could say that it has its moments , which include a lot of sexual activities .

then the second half of this movie is hard to follow . i got the first part with the spanish version but the second one is a little bit worse . it 's boring and takes place in a small town on the north shore of the sierra foothills . there was a big party at a house near the mountains where two guys are having an " incident " while driving their car down the road . not all of the people there were young and attractive looking . most of them were drunk and acted stupid . some of them just looked scared and did n't know what to do or say .

i feel privileged to have accidentally seen this movie . i actually ran across this movie by accident . i mean , really . it 's amazing how quickly you find out a bunch of new people are coming in for the show . there are about twenty other people on stage and i could guess that any of them were there to try and get a glimpse of the film . when i saw this movie , my brain turned to mush . i was totally into the idea of all of this , but now i 'm not sure what to do with anything .

this is a really silly job of miscasting - - about as bad as hepburn playing a chinese woman in dragon lane . i mean we all know this movie is not a good one . i am disappointed because i thought we were working hard on this movie . it was actually very easy and made a lot of interesting films , although not for the reason you think . if you did n't read that movie you would not have noticed what it was about . so now i am getting ready to go home to get some sleep .

Okay, I grew up on Who, but haven't loved a Doctor since Tom Baker. Christopher Eccleston made me love Who again and I'll be furious with him forever for leaving. The writing is grand, the acting superb, the directing (which was dreadful in the old days) is just fantastic. I was very skeptical about this programme, and watched it merely out of being forced, but am now a huge fan and love it (I have a ringtone of a Dalek screaming "Exterminate" then).

this movie reminds me of ' eternal sunshine of the spotless mind ' and ' garden state ' not because of content , but because i really like these films . you may find that most people like to watch the unoriginal movies they see when they look at the pictures on the walls . there is no way in hell a person can watch this movie for more than five minutes without being depressed or depressed . if it does make you want to just jump up and give a thumbs up , you must be prepared to suffer through a hundred hours of mediocre comedic review .

one of the best , lackawanna bluesgreat movie , great cast , great music , this is one of those movies that should be written for a few more decades , and it is not . i have to ask you , why so many people who want to film this are allowed to make these films ? this is ridiculous . all of the actors - they just look like they have lived here for ten years . if only there was some sort of explanation for why so many of these films were made . i do n't think anyone has been in the theater in over twenty years .

if you had asked me how the movie was throughout the film , i would have told you it was a bad one . as it is , it only took about 20 minutes . in addition , at the rate this movie is going , this movie is almost over . the credits are pretty low so i am not even sure what the ending is when the plot comes together . then , i went and found an empty room and got my laptop . that was very disappointing . i had to look through all of the videos but there is still no answer , which i think is great for me .

if you took all the stock elements of a shrek movie ( grumpy ogre , annoying donkey , cute kitty ) you would know what it was for . no wonder i had never seen this movie . i must have passed out at some point because when i woke up someone had been in the living room talking to me about how bad the movie was . they told me i was making too much fun of their movie , that i should just turn it down and leave them alone , but i wanted to see it anyway . i saw this film a few years ago and it was awful .

This movie was painfully awful. Most of the movie consisted of people running in the woods, walking thru the woods, or dancing in the woods. More than half, at least. Then two kids who discover two 'horribly mutilated bodies' in the woods, return to the woods the very next night for a romantic walk. ????? There is no time continuity. its day, its night, its day, its really really night, its dusk, its pitch black, its day. All the woods scenes go on like this until you think you will lose your mind.

jingofighter i agree with some of your comments , but i have to disagree on a couple of things . what if the whole story were true in some way ? what if the people that lived in this region are not who they appear to be ? how would it be possible for them to make a movie based on what is really there ? why do people get so angry when something is wrong with an entire movie ? why do people hate everything and anyone that they see ? i mean no one is doing anything to help people in this country . why do people hate each other ?

i recently viewed a copy of this ( under the title ' eaten alive ' ) talk about dreadful ! any person who claims to be a movie star would think that they are just joking . as a matter of fact , we have found out quite many more horrible things from movies like this than anyone has known . let me go first and try to remember them all . in my day it was a simple , boring documentary on the world war ii special operations team that fought a battle between saddam hussein and his own government in vietnam .

Not too good a movie. Sure, it contains action, but the effects aren't all that good for a '08 movie. Gunshot effects are downright horrible. Acting is "meh" It is nothing like Far Cry, other than names and the very basics of the story (genetically enhanced super soldiers going amok). The super soldiers are very different, the mercenaries are different, the setting are completely different (tropical island in the pacific in the game, island in northern-ish America in the movie).I loved playing Far Cry. I loved the story and setting.

I just watched it for the second time today and I must say with all my heart it is about damn time they made a movie about us as people not as spiritual beings. Such a waste of human life as this story was maybe some good will come out of it. And Eric is hotter than ever. To often in the movies First Nations people are seen as other than everyday people. We are always portrayed as chiefs or medicine people. Hey we are just like everyone else. And this movie showed just that. We hurt when an injustice is done and we can win in quest for justice.

the giant claw is in fierce competition with films like , ' robot monster ' and ' plan 9 from outer space . ' what about this ? " he continued to stare at it for a second , then shook his head . I made a promise that if ever I posted a comment that was less than complimentary, then later felt different about it, I would return and make known my change of heart. So far, this is the first time it's happened. I'm really starting to enjoy Hack. Something has clearly changed. The storylines seem to be much stronger. The plot may still be a tad surreal, but the characters have developed so much more depth that a surreal plot can be forgiven. I attribute this to fine acting. Not every show can come charging out of the starting gate a winner.

In the European TV industry, movies like this one are called "stickers". TV stations buy them and air them because when they wanted to buy broadcast rights to, let's say, Titanic, some not-really-blockbusters were a part of the deal.14 Hours is a story of a hospital, its employees and patients who have to face the worst flood slash storm ever. Unfortunately almost from every scene or shot one can tell that is was a low-budget film.Newborn babies are very obviously not real, there is no background action and probably the worst thing is the doctor-acting.

never i have seen a movie so terrible that i ' ve gone insane . it was a huge waste of credits , but the book was hilarious ! this movie was like a classic from the fifties and eighties . it was so bad that in the end he had to come up with another plot . this is the sort of movies where you want to know exactly what happened because you just ca n't help but look for some explanation as to how people can change their lives so easily . the worst part about the movie is that there are all kinds of weird things going on during the movie .

A while back I bought the Chinese box set of Fist of the North Star which came with all of Fist of the North Star, Fist of the North Star 2, New Fist of the North Star, and the Fist of the North Star movie. While there is an American Version and a few European Versions, they end half way through Fist of the North Star which is about as far as the movie goes.The series is about the successor of an ancient martial art called Hokuto Shin Ken (Fist of the North Star) named Kenshiro, or Ken for short.

if you and your friends find as much humor and enjoyment from horrible acting , jokes , props , and movies of the genre as you think you do , you will be amazed by how little people actually care about what is going on in those movies . this movie has some good parts , but it really sucks . most of the shows i watched last week were more than depressing . there was one thing that kept getting me to try something new . i got to watch one of my father 's favourite movies when i was a kid , he told me it would bring me back home to visit my mother .

there needs to be a 0 / 10 option for bilge like this . it was painful to watch , but strangely easy to do . i mean how else can anyone make it to the top of the food chain ? i could n't imagine what the other people would do if they made it to the top of the food chain after having been up there before . i only watched the movie a little while before deciding that it was no use and just sat through the whole episode . however , i enjoyed it tremendously .

This film is one of my favorite Christmas classics. Sure, it's fluff, it's not "relevant", but when did movies being simply entertaining and fun become a bad thing? No, this movie is definitely "A Good Thing" as Martha Stewart(appropriately)would say! Barbara Stanwyck is so appealing in this film and Dennis Morgan perfectly compliments her. Both of them have charm and warmth to spare. They are assisted by a crew of those incredible character actors who seem to have disappeared since the 40's and 50's--Sydney Greenstreet, S.Z.

Rock Star is a "nice" movie. Everyone is nice. Even the guys who aren't supposed to be nice, really are nice. Chris is a nice guy, who learns a lesson in life. He goes back to his girlfriend Emily, who is also nice. It's a good movie, despite all the niceness. Maybe I'm just used to all the angst of the X Gen music. In some ways the film was a caricature of Rock Stars and not hard edged enough to be believable.Mark Wahlberg's acting is quite good.

Neal N Nikki is voted on of the Worst films of the year by Planetbollywood. Its hard to believe the famous Chopra's have produced this lousy movie. It was presented as a movie for the family, but turns out to be a ridiculous sex comedy. Nor does it make you laugh, but cry of boredom and nor does it have any sexy girls to make the film look sexy. The title song is the most annoying song of the decade, I'm the Neil, I'm the man, rock star superstar. Uday Chopra is one of Bollywood's worst actors ever with no acting talent.

Even with only 6,000 bucks and a cast of part-time actors, Christopher Nolan was a master. Nolan is in my opinion, the next great and our first taste of Nolan doesn't contradict that.None of the problems that constantly plaque and discredit the low budget independent picture haunt Nolan and crew. Our actors are inexperienced and young but they deliver and engage us in this story. In all honesty I think Following is Nolan's best screenplay because it is the one he had the most control over. It's a beautifully imagined film. It takes us into a world where we don't feel limited by the constraints of budget.

as embarrassing as it is to admit , i was listed as production manager on this film . . . my very favorite movie for the last 20 years . . . it was really good , and the characters were really nice , but their portrayal is a total letdown . i just feel like they do not care about me at all . Almost made me turn off the movie, Fauntleroy (the director) has no idea what he is doing, he seems to be filming things at random and some scenes don't make sense at all. As far as I am concerned, this film noir had two totally different things going for it as opposed to the film noirs I am used to viewing: 1 - the setting is Paris, France; 2 - there is 28-minute scene with no dialog.Both make this movie a bit unique, at least to English-speaking film noir fans. Actually, an American, Jules Dussain, shot the film, so it's not entirely a European film. Initially, I was disappointed in this after I had watched the first 40 minutes. It's an expensive DVD and I was bored.

Watched this when it was first screened and then missed it when it disappeared of British screens. It showed a different side of Old Australia that we need to see more of. Good juxtaposition of old hand and young turk. Then the realism of the hard out back was fantastic. It was sadly missed. This show was a cold look at the old way of looking at Australia. Hard living and hard working. The young idealist clashing with the old practical head. Real Politicka fighting with the young upstarts of New Labour.

in the ever growing film genre of comic book adaptations , blade is by far one of the best realised films that we have seen at this time in any genre . i have to admit it 's a bit different to what they use on movies ' rom - coms ' , but not necessarily so much . you get a nice picture of a couple of men and two women with a woman on their shoulders , and then they are dragged away by some sort of beast . how awful ! where is this movie coming from ?

i did n ' t understand the people who rated it over 5 . i think it ' s a horrible film from some awful hollywood movie where nobody knows who the composers are . so i was able to get a peek of the title and see if i could find any other reference to them . there is really nothing particularly interesting about those two movies because they both were filmed at the same time , so that ' s the way it should have been . the worst part of it is that i don ' t even remember writing down the parts that were written on that book .

I believe the reason this movie did not get the recognition it deserves is because of the many misconceptions of Darwin, pro and con. I would say the real man is depicted here without sterility. He is what he is. Although the movie is but a snapshot of the man the technique of storytelling expanded his life far beyond the years touched on in the movie. This is deep movie, a pondering of modern life and the way we think, and can provoke a study into the man whose thoughts (and other who used him) have certainly affected our lives.

In watching this off and on for a few seasons, two things come to mind: One - wondering what kind of girl wants to be a "model" and two - run to the nearest ice cream store and have a low fat sundae.I tried to be a fan because I liked the idea of this reality show competition. No other "famous" model thought of this, and it is very admirable for Tyra Banks to do so. But as the series goes on and on I've come to the conclusion that this is a sorry lot of folks trying to make a mountain out of a molehill.

A group of seven people fear they are the only survivors of a near world ending H-bomb blast. Not only do they fear the radiation, but also mutants in the surrounding hillside. One of the group is already contaminated, but strangely poses no real threat to the others. Just surviving the friction of assorted personalities at close range is the sub-plot. Richard Denning plays the hero. Mike Connors is close to the edge playing a tough guy. Lori Nelson is the girl destined to start populating a brave new world. Not one of director Roger Corman's best.

i can see what this film was intending to do . unfortunately it just never quite completes the deal . you can see why i left out the best part of the movie because as i say , there is a lot of plot that needs to be worked out . in the end , it all went very well . we saw some good scenes and i had a feeling that this one was going to be a big flop . the movie was so much fun , i could n't believe how they made it go bad . oh well .

20 years later and this movie still has echoes of its greatness floating around . never has a movie surpassed the number of films i have read , which are far too many to account for . this movie was one of the worst films i had ever watched . not only did they end up taking out my career and turning it into a movie made by people who believed in movies , but also the plot and the plot were all wrong . even the dialogue with the movie was inaccurate . what really threw me is that the film was as bad as anything i have seen since i started reading the papers .

OK, a film about a film that takes a crack at Video movie making could be entertaining. Could be, should be, funny, edgy, even controversial, or at least interesting, and yet... This film is the bizzaro negative version of that. Hamlin was entertaining as a 'B' Film producer. Shatner played crazy yet likable, and had all the best lines. The rest of the characters were boring, predictable, boring, underdeveloped, boring and boring. The production value was lame. You'll actually see the boom come down in one scene.

I think this is one of the best tamil movies i've seen in a while. i love the fact that it doesn't revolve around a guy and girl falling in love and they made the movie brilliantly. The cast did a great job and i especially congratulate the litte girl. She was brilliant and really brought out the feeling of an adopted child searching for her real mother. Best of all are the songs, beautiful music and moving lyrics. There are some great songs in this move ya'll! especially 'Kannathil Mutthamittal' and 'Velai Pookal'.

1st watched 4/30/2009 - 4 out of 10 (Dir-John Waters): Corny Waters-like comedy musical with some funny scenes and good parts but it didn't make a whole worthwhile experience. John Waters directed this music-filled spoof of the fifties scene with Johnny Depp playing the title role. This movie is very similar with what he did with the 60's spoof entitled "Hairspray" but this one is not as effective. Some of the tunes are catchy, some of the characters are interesting in their quirky Waters-like way, and the portrayals are fine although sometimes overdone.

This is a new Barbie movie. The graphics were really good. They made the movie seem partially realistic. I used to do ballet and this movie made me want to continue it. This movie was kind of like a Cinderella movie but a little bit different. A father of 12 princesses gets very sick. His cousin poisons him and wants the throne. The girls find a secret magical land thanks to their dead mother's stories. Its up to them to save their father and society. With the help of their handsome prince.

I love most movies and I'm a big fan of Sean Bean so I thought that I would at least LIKE this movie. I hope that you never have to sit through this movie.

One of the best 'guy' movies I've ever seen has to be the Wind and the Lion. Gad, the scenes...Raisouli's bandits swarm over the wall... A staid British gentleman calmly gets up from tea with Candice Bergen and drops three of them with a Webley revolver in his coat. A whisper from the ghost of Empire... Lest we forget! Lest we forget!U.S. Marines coming ashore from the long, long gone _Brooklyn_. They were carrying Krags, it should have been Lees, but, oh wow.

Return to Me is a movie you will want to own. It is a story of inspiration and family love that appeals to all ages. The story, though seemingly impossible, aspires to divine intervention when a man looses his wife in a tragic accident and finds that love again in the woman who receives his wife's heart. David Duchovny and Minnie Driver give warm hearted performances as the designated to-be-lovers who meet by chance. But the real story lies in the friends and family around them who love and support them in times of trial. Carol O'Connor as Minnie Driver's grandfather, is authentic in every scene.

Look, don't get me wrong I love independent films but COME ON! I could barely sit through it without wanting to kill myself. the director had absolutely no talent and he turned something that could have been OK to a F***ing Nightmare. I am a punk enthusiast myself and even the music sucked. the acting was crap.I am usually a bleeding heart for these low budget films but this one, this one didn't even try. Please don't waste your precious time and money. I am sorry to be so harsh but come on!

This seemed to be a lackluster film to me that betrays a low budget with poor cinematography and not all that great of a job of editing. It may be of interest to those who know something about submarines during the World War II era, but I recommend that all others beware. Many of the scenes in this film were flat and some of the actors were a bit weak. The story about the men getting called back to duty during a short leave seems realistic enough, but there's no real pacing or tension in the story.

Susan Sarandon. She made this movie for me. I've never appreciated her acting more than as I did in this movie. She really acted as though she were Adele August. I can appreciate actors and actresses who leave their individual persona and create a character who's truly believable. Natalie Portman as Ann August helped create the ideal antagonist as their characters developed through the movie. The movie was about them so the other characters were peripheral.I gave this movie an eight rating, but Susan received a ten from me because of her performance.

I saw this at the BendFilm Festival Friday amid an unsettled crowd of people, not helped by a poor decision by the planners of the event, who chose a totally inappropriate short film to precede the movie. And it really threw the audience when Modern Love came up after a light, whimsical short (name I forget). People!!! It was really silly to mix this short with Modern Love - which is a serious drama movie. A film film. So the audience gets the teaser which is a comedy and then...Modern Love. Hmmmm.

okul is the first of its kind in turkish cinema , and it ' s way better than i expected . there ' s too much to talk about at a cinema theater , especially for one person who doesn ' t get to see these films . the best thing about them is that nobody complains . you ' re supposed to have something to complain about . well , even if this movie is not so great , it ' s the best movie i ve seen in years . it won ' t hold my interest for long , but it has a good film .

Another movie from Swedish hillbilly country, which is always the Northern part. A gangster comedy, with the bad Russians (as always) and the bad (and stupid) Finns. And most stupid of all is of course the Norwegian, according to Stockholm prejudice.Andreas Wilson is the only one who tries to make a performance reminding us of reality. This is not funny.

Eros and Thanatos, Love and Death command the dialectics of Life. By the end of 19th century in a remote Japanese village a young man and a married woman, older than he, fall in love with each other and decide to kill her husband to be free to enjoy their love. But they never enjoy that freedom since Remorse begins to haunt them beginning as usual at the time by the weakest member of the couple, the woman of course. Henceforth in an atmosphere where dream (nightmare) mixes up with reality the ghost of the murdered husband appears first to the woman but then also to the man.

2001: A Space Odyssey Is it a sermon? An account of the history of mankind? An exploration of man's futile attempts to advance technology only to have technology destroy him? Is it about the fragile balance of time and space? A lesson in evolution? Or is it just a spectacular effects show; a film Kubrick made only to show us the limitless possibilities of the motion picture and present to us the truth that images are exceedingly more powerful than words? 2001: A Space Odyssey is all of these things.

I had heard that this film was stylish and intriguing, but I just found it annoying. It's been a while since I've seen it (and hopefully I won't find out all my memories are wrong and I'm unjustly condemning this movie), but my memory is that the filmmakers tried to portray Leopold and Loeb as victimized by an anti-gay society, and that this somehow caused their horrible crime. I totally disagree with this point of view, and think it's unfair both to homosexuals and to Bobby Franks, the real victim of the story.

This is the best work i have ever seen on television. The story is compelling--all the more so because it is true. The writers did their homework--the accuracy of events is well documented. The acting is great. This has to be the best role Sam Waterston has ever had. And the black and white cinematography was exceptional. My only regret is that it is not available to buy. A few years ago I contacted someone involved with the production (either with PBS or in England) and was told they had no plans to release it on VHS (at the time).

Don`t be fooled into thinking that this is a remake as in this years remake of THE TIME MACHINE is based on an earlier film . It`s not because this is a pointless re- film . That is the director has used the original camera script shot for shot similar to the " remake " of THE GET AWAY from a few years ago . The scenes are identical to the original , the dialogue is identical to the original , the camera angles are identical , no attempt whatsoever is made to embellish or restructure the original script ,( But with a director like Van Sant at the helm we should be thankful .

A ghost story on a typical Turkish high school with nice sound and visual effects. Taylan biraderler(taylan brothers) had made their first shots on a tv-show a couple of years ago, as far as i know. That was kind of a Turkish X-Files, they had very nice stories but lacked on visual effects. This time it seems they had what they needed and used them well. This movie will make you laugh that's for sure, and as well it might have you scared. It has a nice plot and some young, bright actors in it.

I really wish Hollywood would come up with some new ideas and quick. Instead they go around and recreate and mess up a perfectly good movie with a re-make. This movie is awful from the DeMille version. All the way through this movie I was saying to myself, Huh??? - What???? - I don't remember that part. The only exciting thing in this movie so far was the parting of the Red Sea. And in Heston's version - it was a heck of a lot better than this version.

as someone who was in a pan - hellenic sorority , i was n ' t sure what to expect when i tuned into the video . it had not been that long ago but there was just so much and so little to it . this is like something out of an 80s film set . one of these things will probably be a great book for the young adult reader . the first few chapters are a lot of nothing really . the following characters were not very interesting or interesting . how did they end up in such a big movie ?

this movie does n ' t even have the saving grace of being so bad that its good . it is truly terrible . i thought the premise would be a bit more creative ( and , no one in this movie wants me to name it ) . instead , we found ourselves surrounded by people trying to figure out what is really happening in the middle of an action movie . after about 30 minutes of staring at each other , i decided to speak up . 
 " hey , who are you guys ? " i asked , waving my arms wildly . "

are you kidding me ? the music was so loud in this show i could often not even hear the lyrics . it was a very boring show that i have to see again over and over again to get through it . there seemed to be less of an audience than before , but that is nothing compared with some of the movies i saw on tv . i can remember when i saw the movie as a kid that i always thought would be awesome . it was made for great horror movies and a huge production by the kids who were still at school .

i can envision the writers of this story thinking up this script : 1 . let ' s make a serial killer movie like se7en and play se7en , so you can create your own movies that do not end up in boxes on the back of a garbage truck . but for the rest of the novel it would have to be some sort of super villain , or an idiot . as it turns out , this is not such an epic film . at the end of the movie , there are about 20 different characters who get mad and fight each other over stupid things .

river ' s edge is not a pleasant film to watch but it is an incredible one . having viewed it on tv the previous day i am not sure whether or not i would recommend it to myself , but this was certainly one of my favourite films ever . although it does have its bad moments , there is one thing i love about this movie . the plot is good . the actors are nice , but they seem to lack depth . if i were still in that film i would go into business for some kind of screenplay or film - making scheme .

hello again , i have been thinking about this movie all my life . i saw it when i was a kid , i really loved it , and i was very disappointed in it at the time . but i could not say anything because there are many things i can say on the subject . i found that this movie was very easy , and i like how it is done so well . this movie is a real waste of money ! why would the director give me such a boring movie just because i did n't get a chance to watch it before i came here ?

right this moment i am watching this movie on tv here in tokyo . beautiful scenery , beautiful sets of famous people from the american and japanese worlds who seem to be enjoying it so much . then a very strange thing happens - one of the characters tells someone else how he will help them get out of their ' bad marriage ' when they go to see a horror movie together . then another guy gets into his ex - fiancee 's body with no warning . that is something that i really do not care for .

but it ' s not . the plot is n ' t all that bad , the actors are n ' t all terrible so you could do better in this movie because you really would like it . i guess a lot of people feel like they had nothing to do with the film . some people see the movie and want to stay out of it but there are always a few " problems " that will come back at you when you try to get back to reality . as a writer , i can ' t blame them for their desire to make money .

we sought out this hard - to - find vhs after watching two excellent merchant - ivory pictures back to back . knowing it was an expensive film , i just bought it for £ 160 . i thought this might make the documentary more interesting than the movie itself .
