First I must confess that A Separate Peace is my favorite book. So of course, I have some bias against any attempt at adapting it for a feature film or television movie. But as I began to watch this film, I was more than willing to give it the benefit of the doubt. The original version from the early 1970s, though shot at Phillips Exeter Academy where the book's author attended school, and though it stayed as faithful as it could to the book, lacked any real depth of feeling and failed to capture the essence of the characters.

I've discovered this movie accidentally and it was really a nice surprise. A Christmas Classic,it's also one of the fine comedies of the 40s. The only problem is : She hasn't got any farm and she can't cook.

This film would be a great piece of history if in fact it was a real film of the Kennedy assassination. The are far too many mistakes in this film for me to point out. It is a film of the Kennedy assassination, but many of the important facts have been altered. There are missing scenes, and many of the scenes, after the president's limo passes the sign, don't fit in. Both Kennedys move noticeably slower then the other four people in front of them. Next time you watch this film look for things that don't add up, such as the Texas Gov.

jack lemmon was one of the finest actors that had ever graced the screen . he could effortlessly switch from film to action in seconds and without even blinking a single eye . i really do not know what his character looked like , but she was beautiful . there was something about her that reminded me of some of the famous actresses who had starred in this movie . she was incredibly good looking as well , with an aura of innocence and charm that made my stomach drop . she also got a lot more money than anyone could possibly spend in a month or so .

this film is a very beautiful and slow film . there is nothing hollywood about it . it is very low budget with a great story , but not as good as i had expected . the acting is excellent and the scenes are extremely amusing . the main issue at the scene is that the characters are very hard - bitten , almost insincere . there is an undercurrent of criticism to be felt , even if they are somewhat unconvincing in portraying themselves as " normal " people . i have watched this film for four years now and ca n't believe that there is any truth to what anyone has said so far .

My two daughters (ages 11 and 13) and I were lucky enough to see a screening of this movie last night. We were all pleasantly surprised to see how entertaining and funny this movie was. David Duchovny was very appealing as the male lead and Minnie Driver gave her usually competent performance. Some of the scenes are laugh out loud funny - especially one scene Minnie Driver has with a fellow "transplant" donee. I liked the fact that it was a movie that I could watch with my children and I wasn't embarrassed by any scene whatsoever.

One of the earlier reviews of this movie ends with "Only for big fans of the lead actors or fans of exotic Romance/Adventure Holywood movies...," as if those weren't reason enough to love it! Anyone who, after seeing this movie, complains about Connery's accent, or the lack of historical verisimilitude, or the realism of the political motivations, or any other extra-movie concerns, simply doesn't love movies. See it and be awed by the star-power of the two leads, the exotic, romantic, photography and music, and the bold adventure of a truly escapist film.

I loved it. In fact, I watched it over and over and over, and I could watch it again. This movie doesn't get boring.The vampire concept is revolutionized in this movie. Arly Jover, mmmm mmm, she can bite me any time she wants and what a sexy accent she has. Donal Logue provides great comical relief.This vampire movie is like no other. I can't wait for Blade 2.

This flick was the introduction for a lot of us to the works of K Gordon Murray. That's because it was easy to find. It was on every public domain label in the VHS era, and before that, a late night t.v. cult classic, double knee thigh slapper. Besides, HOW do you resist the title?For late comers, a brief explanation of it's merit: Florida wheeler dealer K. Gordon Murray imported Mexican horror films, dubbed them into English, then made a mint with them at the drive in.

This film is really really bad, it is not very well done and is a lack lustre attempt at something but I am not sure what. I watched it and was very disappointed. It promised a lot, but delivered nothing at all. The characters are shallow and wooden, and the music, if you can call it that, is dreadful. There are of course all the creatures and animated beings, but they are so poorly done that it does not come across as anything other than a third rate movie.

i watched this film not knowing anything about it . i had presumed it was a sci - fi b movie of some sort . but , to be truthful , i have only seen this movie a dozen times since i bought it and that was only because they made it so bad . all the other films are similar to this one . it did n't really happen until later in the film ; it was just an old , cheap film . i am sure we can agree that it is not something that ever happened . what you see is the same as what i saw .

burt kennedy both wrote & directed this western taken from a novel . kennedy was a well known good writer , but he fell down on his ass and never came back to play again . you might not believe this , but if you saw kennedy around in that film you would be laughing . what happened to him was bad . it was just an awful parody of the first movie , and i have yet to read any one of kennedy ' s novels . i ca n't help wondering how many people could have done it . i do n't know if anyone ever has seen the film .

one of low budget horror schlockmeister actor , john carradine ' s more animated roles as a implied nazi scientist , but the real problem with this movie was how much fun he has . it really sucks ! i ca n't help but want to laugh when i read this . i mean seriously , there is nothing remotely funny or humorous about this film . i could have sworn i just watched my best friends and their parents go to sleep . i must have been an actress for a couple of days after that because i never saw this movie in the first place .

This feels very stilted and patronizing to a great extent. The whole plot is extremely forced - especially the "gallant" effort to save the college from ruin, and the moralistic overtone (especially by the leading lady) grates a bit.But there are one or two comic moments that do help relieve the boredom, and the dancing is quite fun (especially for alleged amateurs - ha, ha! )The shop proprietor and the young guy doing spectacular tap dancing were particular highlights. And I liked Peter Hayes impressions of Charles Laughton and Ronald Coleman as well.

i was very excited to see rock star because i am a big fan of mark wahlberg ' s . i really like his story and i want to know how it was written . however , you can never have too much fun with this one because he is such a bad ass . i love this book and i will read it again soon . if you enjoyed this story , please go to the back page for a review so that i can send some other people a thank you . they would like to know how great this book was as a writer , or why they liked this film so much .

this was absolutely the most tragic pile of cinema to which i have ever born witness . not only was it a very bad show , but at least there were plenty of interesting people in it . i spent hours watching it on every saturday night . i think it was probably the worst horror flick i had ever seen in my career and it really made me gag . the best film i ever watched is that of the wizard of oz . no , this movie was completely different . the characters were exactly as i remember them . they were just like everyone else .

i finally snagged a copy of kannathil muthamittal through netflix and spent new yera ' s eve watching an amazing drama about two men who are having an affair . he ' s not interested in making love to her . he doesn ' t want anyone else to be happy either . when he ' s finished with her , she turns to leave , and he runs his hands over her body , as if to try and find some kind of substance that might make her fall asleep again . instead , he just keeps rubbing her breasts and kisses her on the lips .

Based on the comments made so far, everyone seems to either hate this movie or love it. I think it would be fair to point out that although this is not a GREAT movie, it has its interesting moments. For one thing, it was filmed on location in Colorado (was it Breckinridge or Telluride? I can't remember, but it is in the credits). The location is absolutely stunning and spectacular. It's beautiful, even to me who lived in Colorado for several years.Next, it has Disney's penchant for wonderful character actors.

A couple of friends and myself visited the video shop a few years back and we were in one of those moods to rent some cheesy non seen flicks. My friend grabbed Head of the Family and we were greeted by a head sitting in a wheelchair. Well that set us off laughing and we decided to have a bet to see who would be the one who had to go to the desk and pay for the movie. Well you guessed it, it was me!!!!!!!! I have never been so embarrised in all my life.

attend the tale of sweeney todd . . . the strangest , most off - putting , but most wonderful broadway musical . it takes a lot of talent to do such a production and some of the actors ' characters are not nearly as great as the director or director himself is . i saw this with my own two eyes . i would love to hear some of what they have to say about the show , but i think you better start talking now . " he took a long drink of his water . " first of all , why should i talk ?

this film reeks of production line planning . it appears like the filmmakers looked at recent hit movies , and thought that if they made a good movie they would have a better life . this film was just bad enough to keep them laughing for a time , but now it is not funny at all . why do people even bother with this film in the first place ? why are they wasting our credits ? it is too depressing to watch . there is only so many hours of film you can watch without thinking about what happened ( which i will explain later ) while watching someone else take the film .

I remember watching Police Squad! when it first came on ABC in 1982 and I thought it was a very funny show, thanks to the many sight gags, non sequitors and scripts filled with word play. In one episode, there was a line where a man named Once was shot twice. But unfortunately, ABC canceled the show after only six episodes. I felt it deserved a much longer run but a network executive thought the show demanded too much attention of the viewer because of all the sight gags in each episode.

this is one odd film . it seems to be aimed at a younger audience , but is filled with a sense of sadness that only an adult movie could provide . the character does n't even have a name . well , there were some good laughs while it was going on . my best friend and i used to watch this film over a week ago . i remember we were in the living room talking about it and we both had tears running down our faces . the plot did n't make sense . when you watch movies like this it tends to feel like your life is ending in a tragic way .

many experienced and excellent actors mixed together in an ongoing plot of an untold part of world war ii on the basis of one great performance . the film will be released in about two months and should be available in a week or so to date . it will take a good three years to do this . you can see how sad that would be . i like the characters better when the movie is not as exciting as this . also , i had to edit the scene ( s ) several times with my own personal assistant while i sat in front of this tv screen trying to catch up with the others .

just what the world needed - another superficial cookie - cutter mary - kate and ashley olsen movie . this movie gives out horrible messages to people who try to live up to its portrayals ; it is completely lacking in substance . we have seen so many movies that you never know what is going to come next because they are so predictable , predictable , predictable . one day , a friend tells us that he has been to see the movies on the internet and it was like the most boring , boring thing ever . but after watching it , i had to agree with them .

I just watched this yesterday and wanted to read other peoples scathing comments but found some high marks.WHAT??? This was probably the worst Asian horror movie I've seen. *spoilers* There were just so many fundamental problems with the story. A lot of Asian horror has the twist of spirits trying to help but just looking scary (with notable exceptions: ringu and Ju-on). This is the case here except they aren't scary. A pretty Asian woman who looks a little pale isn't scary at all.

this is strictly for pryor fans . just because he was a great , funny guy does n ' t mean this is the sort of book that will make his career . i had never seen a more depressing movie in my life . as we went through the film , most people could see that there was absolutely no emotion behind the scenes , not even anything that might be worth seeing . i did get some bad readings , but overall it was pretty much what i had expected from someone who had been to movies at least two or three times since i got to this school .

this is , for different reasons , a very very bad action movie . first of all , seagal is a great director and we have no chance of him ever winning a film . his movies are really terrible and you do not even need to know the name of the cast to see what is going on . i spent most of the afternoon sitting at the desk next to her while she worked on her laptop in the study . as much as i wanted to spend my evening watching it , i decided i was tired of watching it .

bronson took the money and ran with this film ; he must have house payments like me ! this low rent movie is a good one . as a result i can write a lot of things that i really do n't care about . i know some of these movies will be fine , but they all suck . i see a lot of people who were happy to make a movie just to watch it while they are in the public eye . if you think i did this because of my love of comedy , you are mistaken . let me try to explain to you something .

do n ' t be taken in because the premise of this film is a good one . it is , but there are only two elements : the obvious and the other actors . 1 . the plot is not even close to the way it was before the movie took off . 2 . it does n't sound right , and 3 . what the hell is happening to me ? i could have done without all these stupid characters . i mean , really . who has to work as a director to be able to make movies that are so far down the road ?

roy thinnes and joan hackett are superb in this 1970 melodrama . the lush settings , the haunting music , the overall character , the story , the characters , the content - all of it is stunning . how can anyone believe such a thing ? you ca n't . and even if you could , why not see the humor ? no one has ever done something like this to me . i have never been good at laughing with a laugh , especially when someone is watching my reaction . that was the point though . this comedy just does not feel like a comedy .

This film's a big bore. It has a plenty of Predictable plots & endless sentiments from the start. It starts good with a classy number but seems lost midway.Surya & Jyothika's on screen chemistry works out really good & a good part by Bhoomika. Why include Vadivelu in it? He disappears totally after a good half an hour!. Santhanam proves his wit again by timing comedy.AR's tunes sure will last for sometime. But he could have done better. What ever be the drawbacks still it's worth watching once if you feel alone at home or looking for a good time-pass.

this movie , with all its complexity and subtlety , makes for one of the most thought - provoking short films i have ever seen . at first , it was a total waste of time , and as i watch the film i begin to doubt if it was such a terrible idea . when i saw this movie i knew it would be a good fit . after all , the only thing that got me through was the fact i had to look forward to seeing that movie . not knowing about any of the things that happen between actors and writers is something that is very important to me .

river ' s edge is an extremely disturbing film written by acclaimed american screen writer neal jimenez . it is based on an old story of a dead girl being murdered by her boss . i am interested in what this character has to say for himself , but not enough to make me feel like i have to watch this one . i can see why they wanted this film . the first thing you will learn about this genre is that it is almost always too boring . the plot is always too interesting to be made fun of . every time you turn around , you find yourself wanting to kill yourself with boredom .

the first word i can find to describe this movie is awful . this movie is one of the worst movies i have ever seen in my life . when i watched it and read the credits , i thought it was a great example of bad films . then , when i went to see this film and saw some of the people that made up this movie , i found myself having second thoughts . i know that this movie could be quite good with its acting and acting , but it was such a letdown that i was going to sit back and let them make it sound better than it actually is .

i have watched two episodes so far , i really like it . even though i am no longer in a position to make much of a play , i feel that maybe this is the beginning of an episode . for me , this time it is one of the best . i would never have come if it were not for what my friends and i did together on many occasions over the last several weeks . this movie was very good , but the plot was bad as well . at some point in the film i decided to buy a copy of " the dark lagoon " and check out the opening scene .

This movie is certainly one of the greatest films ever made. It is a story told in a steady pace, told mostly not by words but by cinematic means of expression. Perfect blend of spectacular special effects and classical music bring to life creations of human imagination in both realistic and poetical way. The story itself is quite simple at a first glance. As the title implies, there is an archetypal journey, a motive repeated for thousands of years. This motive was always used not only to depict a trip in space and time, and beyond, but also had rich philosophic meaning.

it's hard to make a negative statement here after all this raving about how great deed poll is, how wonderful the actors did and so on and so on. i did not like the film. it's crappy!there are orgies, they have taboo sex (gay sex, bi sex, oral sex, rape, anal sex, masturbation, brother-sister-sex, brother-brother-sex, sex on drugs, sex without drugs, sex, sex, sex seems to rule their world. i guess the director is desperately in need of a getting laid.) the story is just dirty and shameful.

sweet young nurse charlotte beale ( a charming performance by ravishing redhead knockout rosie holotik ) goes to work at the hospital and i think she ' s in shock . why do i say this again ? because , it ' s true . she ' s had three children but each of them has already been given up for adoption due to their father ' s death . oh my god what if she is one of those women who can ' t be turned off by her body ? how could i have been so stupid ? that is why i said " no " .

the brighton has a traumatic drama in the breast of their family : the twenty years old emily brighton ( her mother ) is shot by two people . this film was edited at the last minute , and i am not familiar with what it is doing to the rest of america . i do remember how badly it used to look in the 1960s , but now it seems to be making some sort of spectacle of itself all over the place . i never really liked the film , although i did love the " good " parts .

I'm not here to tell you "Armored" is Kubrickian, Hitchcockian or Fellini-esquire. Nope. Referenced directors are more like Don Siegel ("Charlie Varrick") and Walter Hill ("The Warriors"). Those two helmers didn't fool around with niceties like putting women in their movies. No skirts need apply. They unapologetically made guy movies. Guns, lots of guns. Men met violent death with a twitch of the jaw. Their movies were like a sap to the head. You want a friend? Get a dog. "Armored" is so a guy movie.

This is what Disney Channel shows to kids who are dumber than posts. It suits them well. It's not funny, the acting is the worst I've seen in many years, there are more stereotypes than there are actors, and everything about this show makes you groan and roll your eyes. Wanna know why? Not only is this show a waste of airtime, the lead "actress" Selena Gomez looks like a pig. Jake T. Austin's character needs some Ritalin. David Henrie's character needs to visit a strip club and get wasted.

this is quite possibly the worst documentary i have ever seen . it looked so amateurish . chris hegedus was just getting his feet under him with one of the most famous actors in all of history , and then suddenly he finds himself in a strange land that has never been seen before . after having had to watch some horror movies on tv at school , i am really starting to get used to the idea of aliens landing on earth and shooting people . i think it will be like a movie where you see a ufo take off and everything goes into reverse .

I was lucky enough to see this film at a festival last year and had half expected it to get a release. The fact that it was shot on a digital camcorder has surely inhibited its success, but as i understand it was never the intention of the film maker to make it LOOK LIKE FILM in the first place, it was more about the story the characters and their relationships. Is that not what films are supposed to be about!? But it did have a quality in the texture of its visual appearance that suggests May Thomas is onto something we should pay attention to.

this movie , which i just discovered at the video store , has apparently sit around for a couple of hours . " " what else ? " asked bates . 
 " well , some of the characters seem to feel that they know each other from somewhere in the distant past and have been friends for years . these guys are definitely not the type of heroes who would want to make a movie out of the same film as one of them . it was all too fast . there is so much going on , but the last scene was so bad that i can not even start to figure it out .

hilary was great as julie , and pat was once again magnificent as mr . miyagi , but there should have been no mistaking the similarities between the two of them . they were both good - looking , with thick dark hair and long features . they were very tall , with broad shoulders and a well - defined jaw . they had some serious looks , and it appeared to me that they were not all too bad at it . they also had strong builds and an easy manner about them , even if it was only in english .

the trailers for this movie promised and this movie delivered exactly what was promised : good campy fun with lots of happy endings that will last a very long time . there were a lot of laughs , so i could n't be bothered getting out of bed to enjoy it any longer . no big deal . i have a really bad feeling that this movie is one of the best in my life . if i would like to see this show again , i can assure you that it wo n't be nearly as entertaining as this one but i must admit that i got a thrill from watching it myself .

boring movie . poor plot . poor actors . the movie happens in a room supposed to be in morocco somewhere , and i see a little more of it . this film is not actually an actual production of the movie . it just appears in the ' twilight zone ' genre which is what most people expect when they wake up in the middle of the night with no idea how much time has passed . you would think that there would have been something about this film that would really bother you . however , you do n't find anything like this on the internet .

I love Japanese movies--having seen at least 100-200. So it's obvious I am not afraid of Japanese films. However, sometimes there are Japanese concepts for film that just don't translate well to Westerners. They might be hits at home, but abroad they just don't seem, well,...normal. It's like the live fish my wife ate on a business meeting or odd PS2 games such as dating simulators or Katamari Damacy--things that are accepted there that confuse non-Japanese. This is probably the way others view things Americans take for granted, such as American football, fried Snicker bars and Paris Hilton!

One of my desires is to be a film-maker, and I just have to say there's no way I will be able to compete with the powerful drama The War at Home. The reason is because the acting is perfect, and when you see the movie, you'll know what I'm talking about. All I can suggest is watching it, I got so involved in it and was extremely impressed.Estevez's and Sheen's relationship on the screen was absolutely amazing.And so was his relationship with his mother (Kathy Bates). Some of the best scenes include these 2.

is it really possible that so many people in this film believe that the girl is a witch ? just like i was saying , she could have been on stage in a movie about witches and werewolves . even as i thought it , i realized that there were two reasons for this book - first of all : 1 ) the premise was very strange ; second , no one knew much about the witch . i can only guess at its origin and based upon the characters , their personalities , etc . ( i ' m sure that these books are full of crap ) .

All I can do is echo the sentiment already expressed by some of the other commenters. This is CITY OF GOD meets HAPPY DAYS. The bipolarity of the ruthless thug (one minute a ruthless killer, the next minute a Luv's diaper commercial) is completely unconvincing. You can approach it in one of two ways: (1) A gritty, realistic movie turned sappy; or (2) a sappy, ABC-afterschool-special with profanity, violence and animal cruelty. Either way it just don't fly, do it? Why then has it received so much praise?

this movie was bad on so many levels . the writing was horrible so even the best actors could not make it . the title of the book is a good one , though the plot is uninteresting . i saw this movie in a film called " what to expect " that i loved . it started off well enough , with a funny story that made you laugh out loud and made you think . the ending was awful , too , but by the time you watched it , you were actually feeling sorry for somebody who had been cheated out of a fortune by a cheating spouse .

I just watched The Dresser this evening, having only seen it once before, about a dozen years ago.It's not a "big" movie, and doesn't try to make a big splash, but my God, the brilliance of the two leads leaves me just about speechless. Albert Finney and Tom Courtenay are nothing less than amazing in this movie.The Dresser is the story of Sir, an aging Shakespearean actor (Finney), and his dresser Norman (Courtenay), sort of a valet, putting on a production of King Lear during the blitz of London in World War II.

franco films can be divided into 4 categories - the ` ` earlies ' ' ( often black and white and inventive ) , the " raisins " ( " cockerel " ) . in some of these movies , when the characters get too creative they have to change roles . as a result of this , it is really quite funny to see so many other actors acting like idiots on film . i do not mean to say that there is nothing funny about this movie . there is no point in telling you what is funny if you are just a stupid kid trying to entertain yourself .

A potentially good idea gets completely let down by a weak script which throws all credibility out the window leaving the actors very little to work with. Roth covers it up as best he can by being all mouth; Hurt has about as much menace as a fluffy bunny and Stamp can't seem to decide whether he's playing an ex-London crook or some toff straight off the playing fields at Eton. As for poor Laura del Sol she does what she can but her character is no more than every northern European's idea of the stereotypical Latino woman who's all pouts and hot temperament.

` the last frontier ' is a superior western that overcomes numerous deficiencies in weaving its tale of trappers jed scott , an ex - military major who runs a ranch in mexico and spends most of his life on horseback . it has two notable flaws : ( 1 ) you do not want to kill someone unless they actually die . 2 ) you hate them when they die , even if it is only for some reason you feel guilty over it . and 3 ) you are afraid to see the real jed scott in the flesh at all . he is just too hot and too scary for me .

This is one of those movies that you just don't want to end. The characters are rich like a well woven tapestry. Colorful costumes, music and characters draw you in and tell a tale of the people that lived in a boarding house over the decades around the time of the civil rights movement and the Vietnam War. A young man is taken in by a dynamic, big-hearted woman that runs the house and these are stories based on his experiences.I couldn't believe this was a made for television film. It was so well executed.

this is film is probably one of the best i ' ve seen so far . i would put it only half - decent at least . there ' s too much in here that doesn ' t sound right . there are pictures of old people who look like they should be on a comedy team , and others who look like those who have lost their hair . you want to take this movie seriously ? okay , sure , do it for the fun of it , but let ' s just make sure it ' s real .

First - nick-623, Pearl Harbor was bombed in 1941, not 1942. They didn't have to predict the bombing.Second - did nobody notice these six industrialist/lawyers/whatever were missing for a rather long amount of time? They were killed *before* the surgery took place! Third - how the heck did Lugosi get out of cabs without being seen? Fourth - why did the Japanese not just kill him, instead of putting him in jail with a convenient look-alike companion and his surgical kit? Fifth - oh, what's the use?

Having loved Stephen King's novels and short stories for many years, I, like most reviewers, have been consistently disappointed in the adaptations to film from his printed works. A few notable exceptions are "Stand By Me" from "The Body", "Carrie" from the novel of the same name, and "The Shawshank Redemption" from "Rita Heyworth and Shawshank Redemption". This movie is by far the worst thing that has ever been produced with Stephen King's name attached to it in any way. It is no surprise that Mr. King has pretty much disavowed any connection with it.

When I went to see this movie it was already a forced choice, as my original intent was sold out. what ensuited then was sheer terror, this movie is so bad i could hardly bear it. the story is not worth mention, a gay goalkeeper forms a gay soccer team to play against his old straight team who - on discovering his sexual orientation - gave him a hard time. loaded with unbearably old and overused clichés of gays, the thin plot matches perfectly the inane dialogues... it is absolutely astonishing that actors as dietmar bär or charly hübner waste their talent and time on such nonsense.

I watched all three mad max films in succession for the first time a few days ago and was left bitterly disappointed with the third instalment. it destroys the fine work of the first two films with weak and cheesy action and a story line that turns the apocalyptic Australian wastelands into a comical sand pit one would expect to see in a children's adventure movie. the character of max is unrecognisable from his dark and cynical persona seen in the previous films and changed into a predictable uninteresting saviour that left me feeling betrayed. if you haven't seen this film yet then simply don't.

I'm a Petty Officer 1st Class (E-6) and have been in the USCG for 6 years and feel that this movie strongly represents the Coast Guard. There were only a few scenes that were far fetched. The most far-fetched was when PO Fischer (Kutcher) went down inside of the sinking vessel to pull the vessel's captain out of the engine room... that would never happen. Swimmers are not allowed to go inside of any vessel no matter the circumstances. Second, the Command Center (supposedly in Kodiak), it looked more like a NASA command center... we don't have any gear that hi-tech.

Has this ever happened to you? I go into my local video store and see a few new arrivals in the "film noir" section. I spy a copy of a new arrival of a film I have never seen called NAKED ALIBI. Its from one of those mail order video companies that offers (mostly) "dupey" looking copies of hard to find titles. The description on the box sounds good. The film has players I like (Sterling Hayden, Gloria Grahame, and Gene Barry). So I take it home and watch it.

I can't express enough just how bad this film was. First of all what a waste of some legendary stars although they are quite old and pretty unconvincing. Fred Astaire, well I guess he must have owed some one a big favor as this was his last film role. The script is a mess and the film seems terribly draggy. I imagine maybe if I saw this back when it came out (1981) I might have thought it was decent. However seeing so many actual good horror films, this was one of the worst.

'The 4th Floor' is a decidedly mediocre film starring Juliette Lewis as a young interior designer with a heck of a problem neighbor. Jane (Lewis) has recently inherited a terrific 5th floor apartment from her grandmother, and per agreement with the landlord, gets a ridiculously low renting rate. Her boyfriend (William Hurt as a creepy weather man) wants her to move in with him, but she wants her own space. So she moves in, and weird stuff starts happening, and because this is a B-grade horror flick, there's a dumb, not-to-be-found-in-reality reason why.

I am not familiar with the producer's other works, but this movie is a piece of crap. I never saw the MST3K version, but I can tell you, Mike and the Bots probably didn't save it. I love a grade-z movie as much as the next bad movie fan, but this was almost unwatchable.There was no credit for who did the voice of "The Dark One". Sounded a bit like Patrick Stewart at times.A group of high school students who found a junk super-8 camera in the trash heap could make a better movie than that.

James Stewart plays Johnny Mason, lawyer. Carole Lombard is Jane Mason, wife. Lucile Watson the mother-in-law Harriet Mason. Johnny sees Jane and quickly marries her. Mother is disappointed. Mother lives with them. Many troubles are ahead. Jane can't cook. Can't set the table. Can't do many things according to mother. The interaction between daughter-in-law and mother are the highlights of this film. Stewart and Lombard are married but just don't have any real magic on screen. Stewart is Stewart. He is good as a timid husband and son but this doesn't carry the film.

ok . a warning for anyone out there who is a parent or guardian . be careful about who you see at the store , and do not let anyone get you into trouble . " he said seriously . i laughed as i pulled on my sweatshirt . " yeah i know what you mean . i would like to come too . we could meet up more often . " i wanted to say some things but did not want to seem clingy or needy . instead i asked , " so where are you taking me ? " " well it has been awhile since i have really seen one of my kids .

If you're looking for a movie that's fun to watch simply because you can make jokes about the not so great acting, cheesy "special" effects, and typical sci-fi plot...then this is the movie for you! Not at the acting was bad, in fact, a few actors were actually fairly decent. The special effects weren't the greatest (to say the least); the animals looked completely computer animated. There was an annoying squawking to cover up the swearing and there was only one song played over and over again throughout the entire movie.

do n ' t look in the basement this little forgotten gem holds a special place in my heart and on the inside of my own skull . all i can say to myself is : why ca nt i have just left her alone ? i thought we were friends . how could things have gone so wrong ? when did i become one of the bad guys again ? i am very sorry for everything i have put you through , but what else can i do ? it took me years to get to where i am today .

this movie has got to be the biggest disappointment i ' ve ever experienced with a film . the acting is not bad but the scenes are so wrong that they make me laugh . i don ' t think it was too hard to get the film started , and as a result we got an amazing amount of work done on this one . i can ' t wait to see the look on my boss ' s face when i tell him what just happened . he looks like he wants to beat the world into submission ; i will definitely be the one to put his face to shame after this movie .

hello, looking for a movie for the family to watch on a Friday night? Can't find what your looking for? I thought this was an extremely enjoyable movie. Good for the whole family. I found that it had a remarkably rare combination of it being appealing to both adults and children alike. It was brilliant, to say the least. Bruce Willis's acting was top-notch, there was a lot of humor in it and overall, a great movie. In my opinion, it's a must-see movie.

im warning you people out there , this is just a waste of your time . i am being honest with you here , i really am . i know how important this game is for the entire world and i like to see my viewers happy . i believe that many of you will be able to enjoy the show as it plays on tv or on youtube . i can only imagine how difficult this is for you guys to watch . you must remember that these videos are in no way funny . what we are getting into here is absolutely ridiculous and completely lacking in originality .

grosse pointe blank was really quite a below average film . its hit man theme is very dry and is so trite it makes me wish i had an actual one . the only way to make it look like it actually happens , is if you ' re willing to believe that there are such people as this movie , or even see it . however , in fact , it appears that they don ' t have the balls to try hard at it . i saw the movie on tv a couple days after i got out of the academy .

( HR is what Himesh is called in the movie, I think he likes it too. ) It's amazing how intelligent people, talented even fall in to the same trap.I really like Reshamiya. It's amazing what he has done. Jewel Thief is *THE* crime thriller of Bollywood, and why should it not be? It is directed by the biggest exponent of the crime thriller art in Indian Cinema Vijay Anand ('Johny Mera Naam' and 'Teesri Manzil.) I could watch this movie for any of the following reasons (in order of importance):1 Vijay Anand's direction 2 R D Burman's music 3 Dev Anand 4 Vyjayanthimala 5 Ashok Kumar 6 Majrooh Sultanpuri's lyricsEven if Jewel Thief is not a Bond Movie it definitely has bond babes. Helen, Tanuja, and the mysterious Vyajanthimala (and some cameos.)

an art teacher comes across an antique wooden bed made from gingko trees and puts it in his apartment , he leaves it there for someone who wants to take it on a road trip . 
 " where were you guys last night ? " i ask . 
 " do n't get used to this one , " alex says , rolling his eyes as he walks back into the living room of his apartment . " it all just happens to be some kind of dumb accident . " " no , it 's definitely not dumb , " i say . " what is it with this guy ? "

i ' m racking my brain , but i ca n ' t seem to think of another movie quite like the valley of the shadow of death . " " this movie has some interesting plot holes , so why not use them ? " spiritwind offered his own suggestion . it was a great idea as long as they didn ' t make too many errors . 
 " actually it ' s more than just bad film . it ' s really depressing . you would have thought all the horror movies were over by the age of 11 . " brick looked at spiritwind and wondered if he was getting it right .

i loved this movie when it first came out ( but i was just 12 years old then - and i was very much a big fan of this movie , especially since i was only 17 ) . i do n't care if the plot is bad . this film is great because i loved it so much it took me months to figure out what that meant . but now i have to pay for it , and i 'm really looking forward to this movie . i love being in the game with tom cruise , even though he is not very funny .

this is by far probably the worst film al pacino could have starred in . the movie had no real characters , and i was a little disappointed when the director did n't give us a lot of dialogue . he gave us the chance to really talk about some of the characters , but they were all so lame that we were too scared to even consider acting our part . it has to be an awful waste of time because most of the people in this film are completely unoriginal , which makes it hard for us to make a good impression on anyone .

Story of an ex-Navy Seal who is now a combat medical officer assigned to a state of the art Russian sub with a nurse. This is to answer a call for help set off by a dying member of the original crew. The sub has been overtaken by terrorists who are bent on destruction. So we see the duo try and gain control back. And this happens with the fear of the US Naval Forces is about to unleashing everything it has got on the terrorist sub to prevent it from launching its arsenal. Be careful of the early explicit sexual scene in the first quarter of the movie.

What some Hollywood-movies try and practically never succeed, creating somehow metaphysical connections between persons (without becoming unrealistic), manages this beautiful movie perfectly well (resembling in that way a little to the wonderful 'La Double Vie de Veronique' of the same director and with the same beautiful actress). This is a REAL movie, that changes perspective of life a little bit - intelligent and beautiful story, masterfully directed, excellent main actors, masterful cinematography. I've just seen the movie the 3rd or 4th time, and I still think it's one of the best I've ever seen.

ridiculous , nauseating doggerel with terrible acting ; ineptly , superficially , and condescendingly trawling all the most banal cliches . i have n't read any of these movies , and it made me want to gag . but that 's exactly where i would be going next if i was watching this . i will never understand actors . i do not follow how they work , how they relate to a character , or even what he or she actually looks like . in fact , i always find myself trying to make fun of the people who do this crap .

(Spoilers more than likely... nothing really important you couldn't have figured out yourselves) Yeah, it's really weird. But after that, I had a dikens of a time finding it, even here on IMDB. I kept confusing it with "Night of the Demons," but, you know, they're basically the same thing.

Or vice-versa.This is a French film noir directed by an American film maker (Jules Dassin) who had to leave the country because of being blacklisted by Hollywood thanks to HUAC. The premise of the story is rather familiar--one last jewel heist for Tony le Stephanois and his buds--and so is the ending with everybody getting... Well, no spoilers here, for sure, since this is the sort of film in which tension toward the ending is important.Dassin filmed in realistic lighting in black and white on the streets of Paris using actors and actresses who are not glamorous.

this movie sucks so bad . its funny to see what a poor story this has , where two pea - brained characters do something stupid , then fall for the wrong people . but i never thought that it was so sad that everyone on the planet is having to deal with such a horrible life . even when you are going to be in love with someone after three months of dating , there is really no point in getting all romantic and emotional about it . well , that 's okay , though . it did not make me feel very much like falling in love , either .

ghilli is the best movie of vijay & one of the biggest hit in his career . . . . as i had to see this one , it was the best movie of my life and i felt like i did n't know where to look . there are some great movies but we should be thinking of a lot more . the most interesting thing about this movie is that i knew exactly where to look for you , so why did i not ? i have tried to find you a few times and even when i thought you were going to get your way , you always turned up .

as a big jim carey fan i took my seat in the cinema with optimism . after all , fun has its moments and many of those were pretty bad . you have to admit that they were pretty terrible . this was the first movie i had ever watched at least 2 , 000 times . there are plenty of horror movies that make your heart skip a beat or two , but none of them have anything to do with me . what am i thinking ? it just is not fair to let my parents see this kind of shit on tv .

This movie is very disappointing for one who has read the book. As written by Rafael Sabatini, this was a clean cut tale of piracy in the Caribbean, and it would have made a grand motion . Also, it would have been very simple to make. All the action takes place aboard ship and on a deserted island. Unfortunately, the screen writers took the title from Sabatini then threw the rest of the book away. Even the name of the main character was changed, and his screen personality was completely different from that of the individual described in the novel.

this movie made me want to bang my head against the wall . it is hard to compare such badness to what you see on bad movies , but i found it fascinating that the characters were able to come and go so easily . i do not have any trouble talking about it . there are lots of people in this movie who have already seen it ; i can talk about it at a reasonable speed . the first few scenes are very similar , but they are not as entertaining as the rest of the film itself . i am pretty sure that most of the characters are completely unoriginal , except one or two .

Sweet young nurse Charlotte Beale (a charming performance by ravishing redhead knockout Rosie Holotik) goes to work at a remote rural asylum run by Dr. Geraldine S. Masters (the excellent Annabelle Weenick). Among the motley assortment of colorfully crazed patients are insatiable, aggressive nymphomaniac Allyson King (the luscious Betty Chandler), loopy Judge Oliver W. Cameron (a gloriously hammy Gene Ross), paranoid Vietnam veteran Sergeant Jaffee (nicely played by Hugh Feagin), gentle giant Sam (the amiable William Bill McGhee), and nutty old hag Mrs. Callingham (the supremely irritating Rhea MacAdams).

the only good either of the problem child films caused was bringing together amy yasbeck and the late john ritter . i just wanted a better idea about how to best get this thing moving . one of my first ideas is to give them a different movie when they are not watching it or even thinking about seeing it in action . i am pretty sure we can make some great movies though . i mean , look at all of the characters , and i had no idea that these were real people living here . after looking around for a while i decided to take a little more time to watch them .

i think the manuscript of this movie was written on the piece of toilet - paper . no respect whatsoever to many of its characters or a single title , which i know is a load of horseshit , but what else can you expect when you hear that people are in their fifties ' s " eighties " and living in the sixties ? well , these days there is no more than 60 years left before the movies are done , and at the time of filming the original script has not been seen since 1998 . it 's hard to believe that such an old testament film could have been made in 1912 .

in a morocco completely invaded by europeans and americans , in the beginning of the twentieth century , the moroccan revolution was very good . but once it became apparent that there would be no more american movies or movie shows ( especially the last three weeks ) , this film came to a dead end . all you could do was go with one script , which was pretty boring . every time i looked at the tv , i thought ' this is really going to suck ' so i tried to get back to the real life .

eleven years ago , stanley ipkiss released his true inner self and became the hero of edge city by finding a way to ' get rid of ' this bad boy , but he ended up getting killed in vietnam . i could never understand how people could agree on anything when they had just seen the movie it was not something you saw on tv . at that point i found myself wanting to ask about the story , but i did n't know how much i wanted to hear about it . so i just let it pass .

Stanley Stupid (Tom Arnold) and his wife, Joan, like to sleep in bed with their heads under the covers and their feet on the pillows. They have two equally challenged children, Buster and Petunia. One day, Mr. Stupid notices their garbage is gone again....there must be someone stealing it from the curb. He goes off in roller blades after the garbage truck. When he finally gets to the dump, he is startled to learn not only that "other folks garbage" has been stolen, too, but that there is a secret organization meeting at the landfill.

Why isn't this movie on the bottom 100? Raptor is, without a doubt, the worst movie I have seen in all of my fifteen years of life. I have never before witnessed such a catastrophic mess as this. Absolutely everything about it is awkward and cheaply done.Nobody in the cast gives a somewhat decent performance. The dialogue is utterly incoherent and the humor is anything but humorous. Corbin Bernsen was the most painful part of the whole thing. I can't help cringe when I recall some of his lines, like "In or out? You're worse than a cat!"

There seems to be a spectrum of cinema. On the left, there are movies made mostly for entertainment and/or commercial purposes. In the middle, there are movies that are both entertaining and artistic. On the right are movies that are not as commercial, but are focused more on cinema as art than cinema as product.I'm not here to say any one part of the spectrum is better than any other, but that when a movie goes too far to either end, it's rarely good. Such is the case with Naqoyqatsi.I had no idea what to expect when I saw it advertised.

the most obvious flaw . . . horrible , horrible script . this movie had a potentially good story , but it did not have the potential for success . it could have been a lot worse . in any event , i decided to keep writing . i really do n't care if my parents like me or not , and i know they will get annoyed if i write too much , so here i am , writing at night . it 's difficult to find anything more interesting to do with myself . i usually watch the tv when i read about movies , but today it seems as if no one actually watches them .

It's a bit unnerving when a studio declines to screen a film for the press before it goes into wide release. That many movies suck is no surprise, but when a studio itself admits as much ahead of time, the process of movie-going becomes a passion play of sorts. Consider it an early Christmas gift from Hollywood, then, that "Aeon Flux" isn't nearly the affront to taste and decency one might expect, given the above. Though ultimately overwhelmed by its flaws, it at least has (sort of) an idea with which to toy around.

beautiful . . . . that one word pretty much sums up this whole film . everything from the cinematography , the directing , the casting and even the dialogue . it is absolutely fantastic . if you really do n't like it , just drop it . i 'm a writer , not an actor and as far as i can tell , most of the people on this movie are only interested in what they 're supposed to be focusing on . i found this movie to be somewhat pathetic . the acting is very bad and the dialogue is completely lacking in detail .

Mute Witness is a modest, yet very solid thriller that never really received the attention or good comments it deserves. The film  written and directed entirely by Anthony Waller  is a tense, action-packed thriller with black comedy aspects and horror influences. No pointless mumbo-jumbo or endless plot-twistsjust straight to the point mystery. Mute Witness handles about the vicious topic of `snuff'-movies and is effectively set in Russia. *** SPOILERS *** Since the production costs are cheaper there, a US film crew temporarily moves to Russia for shooting a horror film.

i do n ' t understand why some of you ( or many ) have given this film upward of 8 stars in my life . they also gave this movie upwards of 7 stars per year at the age of 15 . i think it 's an excellent script with a great plot , but the plot is not quite as interesting as the story . i can see why there are a lot of people who would like to give this film a happy ending , but it does not feel like the kind of thing you really expect .

I saw this movie when I was very young living in Houston, Texas. I really enjoyed this movie, and I wrote to Jean Peters in Hollywood, and I told her how much I enjoyed seeing her in this movie. She sent me an autographed photo. This movie was directed by Jacques Tourneur, and besides Jean Peters in the starring role. It also stars Louis Jourdan, Debra Paget, and Herbert Marshall. It was released in 1951 in color and is 81 minutes long. Jean Peters was married to Howard Hughes.

Obabakoak is a bunch of short stories with an only common point: the little Vasque town of Obaba. In this film, the director tries to explain some of these stories by using a young reporter as a continuum. The result is a strange film, as it has any main character (the movie spends about 20 min. to each tale) other than the town of Obaba. Any story is really well explained and the fact is that they result very boring. It was by far the best film of the year in Spain, but, well, that's not saying too much.

Korine's established himself, by now, as a talented and impressive image-maker. The promotional posters for Mister Lonely all include the film's most impressive compositions (though there's one in particular I've yet to see in promo material: that of a blue-clad nun teasing a dog with a stick, surrounded by green forest with torrential rain pouring down). The opening images of this film, of Michael Jackson lookalike (Diego Luna) riding a small motorbike round a track, is strangely compelling and beautiful: Roy Orbison's "Mister Lonely" plays on the soundtrack, and the images unfold in slow-motion.

This movie is a must see for any war movie buff. You smell that? Lance: What? Kilgore: Napalm, son. Nothing in the world smells like that. Kilgore: I love the smell of napalm in the morning. You know, one time we had a hill bombed, for 12 hours. When it was all over, I walked up.
