i heard legends about this ` ` film ' ' ( quotes used so as not to insult films ) for a price of $ 49.95 . i was shocked when i found it in a trash bin in the mall . i also did not buy it . what a waste of time ! and i should have paid attention to the reviews , because there is a good deal more about this " movie . " i really wanted to get a look at it . i mean , it had been written by some guy who actually lives in seattle , but no one knows who he is .

a bad quentin tarantino rip off , at least i hope that ' s what they were going for because at the moment i am not interested in seeing much of anything . unfortunately , when the credits roll it appears that some movie was filmed in the early 80 ' 80s which was good and bad but really just did n't interest me enough to look any further than the scene with the zombie apocalypse . so i went into the kitchen and made myself a sandwich and tried to forget about it as i ate my sandwiches .

this is one of the best action films i have seen . geena ' s portrayal of the tough as nails movie in which the characters are told to stand by and not make a single move . i like it . the whole scene is pretty lame . you can see that from here . i don ' t even think that geena was aware of the bad stuff that goes on behind her back . it ' s very clear to see that she ' s been doing her job just fine until we walk out into this studio .

a chicago couple , dillon and dougherty , are falsely accused of killing their daughter . people begin to wonder if the police will show up to get the kids back . that is all i could tell you at the time . but now , this has become something else : there have been other reports of shooting and shootings from local authorities . one of them involved a man in a large car . as it happens , the man was killed before his death . what would you like to do with this piece of news ? ' " 
 the camera cut to the studio again .

i watched this film last night , i though i would rent a horror / scary film from blockbusters and i got this dvd because of that . it was an old friend of mine from high school who had been in the army . i used to be one of his buddies but we never talked much about being friends . i do n't really talk about my personal life or the events that have led me here . all i remember is what i saw in it and i just want to keep it that way . if i see a movie like this again i might just take it out and put it away .

Like a lot of films from the early sounds days, Cimarron must be viewed more for historical interest than as compelling entertainment. The hammy acting of lead Richard Dix, nominated for best actor, can be excused as a relic of the silent-film school of acting. However, even giving benefits of the doubt, Cimarron is a badly shaped piece of drama -- a bloated film that moves from unrelated sequence to unrelated sequence with little dramatic impact. Offically, the film is two hours and four minutes; it feels like four hours when you're watching it.

this movie was a disappointment . the story is essentially the shining with a castle ( or a very cheap hotel ) , but it failed miserably in that the plot was much better than what i was expecting . to be able to pick one of my favourites is not something that i have ever really wanted to try . when i first got the idea , i found that the book was about how people ' ll ' m supposed to treat their spouse and family if they don ' t ' ve seen it yet . i had just read a book by someone else who ' d been married for a long time .

this movie makes ` ` glitter ' ' look like ` ` schindler ' s list . ' ' tarantino and the weinsteins really need to get a life ' . i can tell that it was made from the same stuff . the story , of course , did n't make much sense to me , other than the part where the people on film have no problems being alive . there was a man in 1940 who was a friend of mine who got into some pretty terrible trouble with someone . he was killed in a car accident at an abandoned factory , so he ended up in a morgue .

estevez , martin sheen and kathy bates are superb in this portrayal of a vietnam vet home from the war . but if you get all the way to the end of this film then you find that it has no redeeming qualities . what should be one of the worst parts is when they begin with the sad story about a man living in an abandoned hut surrounded by people who call themselves his own . at this time in the story , don ' t pay any special attention to how bad things were for him during his career . he was treated unfairly and made to feel inferior .

this film works on a lot of different levels . it ' s a profile of one very cool couple , a man and a woman . the woman is in her early thirties . she is very pretty , with deep chestnut brown hair that falls straight down to her waist and eyes that are slightly too bright . the man has a beautiful blonde bob and his smile is perfect . as for the brunette - " what was her name again ? - i didn ' t get a chance to look at her picture . all i could do was guess who she might be .

i will never , ever forget watching this show around the age of 13 . even at the young age of 18 , i watched it for only a couple of minutes and left . i did not get to sit on the couch again for 3 more days . it was my job to make sure that everything went perfectly . there was one part of this program that caught my eye in particular : ' what is an evil god ? ' this is the worst movie i 've ever seen . let me try to say that some of the worst reviews from the film have been good .

Komodo vs. Cobra is not going to set the world on fire. It's not a hallmark of cinema history. What it is is a group of underfunded filmmakers trying to make another movie, make another paycheck, and continue to support themselves and their families. As such I give these efforts a lot of slack. I mean, come on, it has to be hard to be a Russian special effects technician. Not a lot of big budget films getting made there. BUT-- they are a dedicated bunch and more than willing to throw their all into whatever lame American monster flick needs affordable SFX.

A kooky, but funny bit of diversion. You kind of have to see it from the beginning to follow what's happening, but each report to earth has it's own little joke. Pretty good special effects for a very low budget sci-fi t.v. show. It's fun to watch. Sort of in the vein of Red Dwarf, but even more low budget. For someone who's just coming in in the middle of one of the episodes, what you have to realize is that these guys are all incompetent, because they've been moved up the ladder of command, because the other officers died.

` ` cat in the brain ' ' is a series of extremely violent sequences knitted together by a plot that feels like it has to be real , " i said . this was a story designed for a child who would grow up to be a big star athlete . there were dozens of characters and events that i had never seen before , yet these characters had an uncanny quality about them , which made me wonder if someone had played with their mind . at first i thought it was funny but as we got closer , i began to notice what they were talking about .

this is an excellent documentary about a story i had n ' t heard about before . the first solo , non - stop film that i saw was very good ; the dialogue was pretty good . however , the premise seemed to be quite strange : 
 there is this one girl who got into a car accident and was attacked by her father . when she sees the man , she becomes enraged and tries to kill him with a gun . the man runs off and does not come home . the police find out later that this was planned by a young man who happens to be living in san jose .

this movie was so awful that i ca n ' t even describe it . i was amazed that i even sat there to watch it . but , then , i really wasn ' t any more surprised than i already was . what did he expect me to see ? i had seen all of my favorite movies before ; and i never thought that i would see anything like this from this point forward . as i watched the first one , it occurred to me that this film was not nearly as bad as the other ones . when i turned the tv on , i realized that it was actually pretty good .

i know it ' s rather unfair to comment on a movie without seeing the complete piece - but i am just curious if you had your own idea how this should have been made . let ' s start by saying that this film is not even remotely interesting . why ? well , i guess it is because it was all done so early in the summer and we didn ' t get much time to watch it . i do not like horror movies either but these are really nice ones , especially the gory parts .

Pete's Meteor. I seen this referred to as "authentic" and a "gem." I caught this movie on a Saturday afternoon. I kinda wished that I didn't.Apparently this was noted as being Mike Myers' first dramatic role. Unfortunately it had to be this movie. The first thing you'll notice that Pete's Meteor suffers from is a complete lack of plot. Or rather, a bunch of little subplots that aren't really connected and don't go anywhere. Young orphan Mickey lives with his younger brother and sister with their grandmother.

first i must confess that a separate peace is my favorite book . so of course , i have some regrets . i wanted to give it more credit , but i did not see how the plot could have been more interesting . i was not prepared to write about the big bang theory because it sounds so boring , but in this case , it had something to do with the creation of the nuclear explosion that killed at least 100 % of the world population in the last 20 years and set them back over 90 years or so .

So bad, it's entertaining, especially during cocktail hour, and believe me, you'll need a beer, a drink, or whatever to get through this turkey. Where do they get the financial backing for such paint-by-the-numbers "horror" flicks? The fun in this movie is predicting which characters will get eaten and in what order, and trashing the so-called "uniforms" the "military" jokers wear. The raptors, by the way, are not the same raptors we met in "Jurassic Park," but a cousin species. (Sorry, no spoilers here.

The film tells you to be aware and conscientious. It also destroys any and all things, the Bible claims to be true. To people like me the first episode was interesting and the second was disastrous. It has been called "blasphemy", and it is, if you are a believer. It is sad to hear, that many people think of it as a good sequel to the Bible. However, the film shows you a lot of things and subjects, that can be interpreted as a filmic version of the "Revelation".

This wonderful movie captures so many elements of what makes a family comedy funny, entertaining, sweet and memorable, it's difficult to decide where to start.From the opening number, "Rainbow Connection," Paul Williams's excellent score sung with gusto by Kermit D. Frog, which gives us a prologue of what the whole adventure is about, throughout the story, this is one fun movie.Essentially, it's a road trip movie, where Kermit travels cross-country with a dream of pursuing a "rich and famous contract" to entertain.

It kicks you in the stomach. There are other films with more convincing characters, a more realistic story, and maybe even more depth concerning political invocations. But then again, most of these are not directed by Peter Watkins. Maybe the one true genius artist of British Film to emerge out of the 1960s, Watkins has made quite a bunch of rarely seen films that perfectly capture the spirit of the outer-aesthetic world - the world of political ongoings, social problems and governmental solutions. Thus, his work is probably less "filmic" than, say, political, which some may call a weakening of their inherent artistic quality.

I watched this film last night, i though i would rent a horror/scary film from blockbusters and i got this one out. The opening scenes were so long winded, the conversations between characters seemed not to lead anywhere. The story line seemed so poor to me, she gave him HIV and then she goes to meet someone else but she is killed by the man she infected ( i think she may have been doing it for a long time to different people) Then when he dumps the body it just happened to be the man she was going to meet, was in the forest and saw him dumping the body.

it ' s a real big bummer that people easily are able too make movies because of cheap digital video cams , and when the movie is done you know that it really is not so bad . in a way it is rather good . i don ' t believe in this movie itself at all but if you ask me , this movie is much more than just funny . it ' s scary , it has a lot of creepy characters and even plays a different character . i would say that it is one of the worst reviews i have ever seen and i will never admit that to anyone again .

asmali konak has arguably become one of the best tv series to come out of turkey . with its unique premise , we may never have a moment 's fame if it were not for two very obvious differences in the plot : the movie was so lame that i felt like someone had left me on the bus and then switched off the lights when i looked up from my magazine . as much as i enjoyed the acting , this movie could not have produced an even better ending . however , there is one other factor that strikes me as odd .

The makers ask for a huge suspension of disbelief, you grant them it in the hope that given a little time they'll convince you it's possible. Alas, with TV movies it seems as though they specifically set out to make cheap Cosmo questionnaire films. With a small budget and big claims you should spend every penny on the details to convince the audience. Not here though. The film gets a few points for the good performance the two leading ladies give against the odds, but unfortunately it's not enough to save the day. oh, and the less said about the ending the better.

This movie was chosen, quite frankly as a pig in a poke from our local Video store. It turned out to be quite a pig. The plot line-such as it is-was disjointed, inconsistent and predictable. The actors constantly looked embarrassed to be mouthing the poorly written lines. The only funny moment in the entire film revolved around the dangers of smoking and the inadvertant deployment of an airbag. The remainder of the film lacked the punch to amuse either of my young daughters (aged less than ten years), myself, my wife, my mother-in-law, or even the cat or the dog.

**Might contain spoilers**Ok, lets conclude this movie in one word: bad. Two words? Really bad. Now why do I think that? Let me explain. Guttenberg leads a special-ops team consisting of four persons that get assigned to retake an lethal virus after some arms-dealer stole it from a lab. They do this by attacking the arm-dealers in mid-flight and somehow gets back the virus after some fighting. However, suspicions arise about Guttenberg because one of the terrorist knew his name. After debriefing the team-members get attacked by unknown persons and everyone starts to suspect everyone else is involved.

so one day i was in the video store looking for a movie . i came across this and rented it from an old couple that lived next to each other . when i walked through the door they both looked at me , but then they said that you had no business taking pictures with your kids . i got very frustrated and decided not to buy anything of mine . i watched this movie because there was nothing else to do - just watch it and try to think about something besides my pain and misery . after awhile , though , i started to realize how much i really enjoyed it .

i was rather disappointed . the first tetsuo made me an instant tsukamoto fan , from the first 5 mins ' to the 10 . he seemed to have a lot more time and talent than me . i thought he could learn something important in this life , like how to give up smoking . maybe if he spent as much time studying as i did , he might be prepared for the next chapter of his life . what a waste of time ! one thing i noticed about this movie was that it has a great dialogue . we really liked this movie because it had a character so young .

Although I saw this movie in Korea, in Korean, and therefore did not understand the language, images sure say more than enough. From what I can make of it, this is the story: Two superb sword fighters become friends in their service as the king's guard. One of them finds himself opposed to the ways of the king and starts assassinating important men. The other has to hunt him down. This movie is visually great. The swordfighting is great. And the movie has a gripping end. I just hope this movie will be marketed for the western cinema goers.

my first post at the imdb has to ( unfortunately ) be to warn others not to waste their time . it is difficult to tell who actually reads these books when you read them - or even if they wrote them in english . and as a reader i am not surprised about the movie that takes place during this movie . there are a few good parts , some bad , some very good parts . however , once you get started with the main story , you never really know which one of those are real or what part they are playing .

Being a fan of Saint Etienne and the City of London, I was very excited to see this movie on the list of the Vancouver International Film Festival. This movie has great shots, an absolutely excellent soundtrack and interesting insights into a 'not so well known' London.The movie is held completely in 'dark' colours, which I personally don't like too much. Furthermore the narration was a little too British and the comments sometimes got a little flat. Other than that, there are some great comments by Londoners and excellent shots.

Yet another version of mother of all gangster flicks-the Classic "Godfather" and yet another case of over-hype due to media circus. Sarkar, the 13th Hindi film of Ram Gopal Varma as director is also the weakest in his Underworld trilogy including the other two being the excellent-Satya and Company. The Charisma, the magnetic persona of the two Bachchans playing father-son duo on screen for the first time is definitely a treat to watch out for. Not just strong performances but their perfect chemistry is the biggest scoring point here for which Varma should be applauded.

this movie was absolutely terrible . the only explanation i can think of for the good reviews it received from the director was " what a joke " . the acting and quality are great , but there is no reason why the director had to put this film into production . i really want to read that movie one last time before we leave town . if it has any effect at all on my enjoyment of it , i promise you i will never repeat the experience again . thank you for seeing this movie . i truly believe this movie might be a success , and i love the book so much .

Take your video camera, turn out all the lights in your house and film people running around with flashlights for an hour and a half and you've got the basic idea of what this film looks like. It is very irritating to watch this kind of movie. To be fair, there are scenes of daylight at the very beginning and very end of the movie. I like scary movies and creature features but this one just didn't do a thing for me. So sorry. I really tried to like it.

this movie made by the nfbc was made in honor of the montreal canadians dynasty years in the 50 ' s , 60 ' s . it came to a bad end when the old guy who ran it all got sick . his family ( and many others ) abandoned him on the coast of canada in 1965 . that movie was never made again . he died in a cabin fire in alaska in 1999 . while the story is not one of my best , even i did not know anything about what went on there or what they were trying to create .

the acting is awkward and creepy , and not in a good way . . . at all . the writing , although it appears to be well written , is just about as predictable as an old movie . i like this part because it does n't take very long to get the actors ' expectations and expectations up . even when you are watching them with a viewer , they still seem to be getting what they really want out of the script . this book is one of the reasons i have chosen to read this book .

Like classic Hollywood musicals, the plot is just an excuse. A must see for those interested in French music hall (including a song by Édith Piaf) and for the wonderful 10 plus minute cancan finale. The dancing in the film is not at all like what usually passes for cancan.Some might object to the Technicolor costumes and the bright lighting, but it gives you a clear view of some grand costumes and sets.Consider it Jean Renoir's love letter to the Paris he grew up in. Certainly the Jean Renoir film for people who don't like his serious films or who only like his Hollywood productions.

Just watched Hair after a lapse of 20 years. It struck home. For those of us who tried to stand on the shoulders of the civil rights movement and fight the rule of privilege and power; who resisted the fascism of the Johnson/Nixon administrations; who now as veterans of civil wars fought the war in Vietnam every single day until finally the US beast died and fled; for all who said no in many different ways -- it's remarkable how unsuccessful we were. How large the real table was on which Treat danced. How driven the wizard behind the curtain.

pretty lousy made - for - tv sequel to the roman polanski classic . rosemary ' s son adrian has grown up and is embodied in that movie . his mother was a woman who lived in an apartment complex when he first moved in with her . after one night out with him , he tried to have sex but it was not successful . on the whole , he looks pretty much the same , although there are some similarities . in the movie this guy goes into the woods and finds another guy . the poor guy loses his life and gets abducted and killed by two people in the woods .

a while back i bought the chinese box set of fist of the north star which came with all of my stuff , there was this one movie where i got caught up in a fight and killed someone . you would n't believe how many people died ! no , it really was not as scary as some of the movies were portraying , it was pretty awesome . i am so sorry for being so stupid , i just loved the movie , and i thought it would be an inspiration to make me a new friend , so i made a special dvd that would take me away from home .

i must admit that i did n ' t get around to seeing this movie in the theater . as it was about a girl who gets into an accident , she just could have done better . i tried not to like the first part and had to give up after two minutes of watching it . well , i started to see some of the others but mostly kept to myself . what 's the deal with these people ? what would make them do such a terrible thing ? you would think they would at least want someone to take the blame for their crime .

While the new Pride & Prejudice film is gorgeous to view, and the soundtrack is lovely, we are not seeing Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice. The film is for some reason set back in the early 1790's, rather than the Regency period where the novel is set, as scholars have long shown. The Bennets' Longbourn estate is ram-shackled and looks like Cold Comfort Farm. Yet the Bennets in the novel are gentry class; they own a farm, but the pig does not walk through the house, nor is the farmyard of manure and chicken droppings contiguous to the home.

first of all , i personally adore demons and demons 2 , i saw them although it was hard to watch . this movie had some pretty heavy stuff on the side . the actors were quite good , most of the acting was horrible , the scenes were atrocious , and everyone was just stupid . i found myself really looking forward to this movie with a slight twinge in my chest at the thought of what would have happened if i had not agreed to be in it . however , since i am the one that starred in this particular film , i am not going to complain about the bad parts .

I enjoyed very much the movie wooden camera. I think it's a little bit influenced by the Brazilian movie "City of God", but maybe this parallelism between the two tracks possible to follow (crime and art) in social neighborhood are a reality. I think the films made by Madiba are really beautiful. I don't think it's unreal that he shoot such good films, because there's a lot of artists that don't have any type of education and can be really genius. I enjoyed very much the soundtrack.

` ` what alice found ' ' is the greatest movie that nobody ' s ever heard of ! i underestimated it when i told my wife about this movie . i wanted to show her all the pictures and videos , but she was too tired and stressed out to listen . she said she ' d see them on friday morning . i did believe her , but i have to admit i had hoped it would be something different , but after a little more time i was disappointed . at least then i didn ' t have to look into the eyes of anyone who would make an enemy .

I was expecting a lot more of this film than what I actually got. The acting was just awful from everyone and the story was far from impressive. It took a lot of something I don't to even follow what was going because it was so jumpy. An example of the acting is when Paxton's character, Vann, is upset the South Vietnamese colonel for so he throws some of the sand from the "sand map". It was impossible to get any idea of what he was feeling and his actions were robotic.

!!!! MILD SPOILERS !!! !The premise goes like this : A store gets burnt down and assistant Sergio is asked by the father of the man who started the fire to take the wrap to which Sergio agrees .So far so good , but there`s a fair lapse of logic involved Sergio agrees to do this for the sum of 25,000 dollars but why ? Come on guys if you were a good looking white boy would you run the risk of getting a long spell in a tough jail ( A very real possibilty for arson ) for the sake of 25 grand ?

This was the next to last film appearance by Jill Ireland, who died of cancer in 1990 after four decades as a well-known actress and producer. Ireland made quite a few waves in the press when she dropped her then-husband David McCallum in 1967, beginning her long relationship with Charles Bronson. It is a great irony that Bronson, probably the all-time leader in number of deaths rendered on-screen, had one of the most enduring marriages in film history. 'Assassination' seems to be a movie that was tucked into Cannon's production schedule for the sake of Bronson and Ireland.

one of the best of the ' kitchen - sinks ' . fantastic views of london and invaluable snippets of working class life . not only do they look beautiful in their clothes , but they make the whole thing seem like an episode on tv . i wish it were that bad . i 'd love to have seen it with my own eyes and would love to be at home in my room . no , i would rather die . if you see something like this movie , you can imagine how hard it was to keep it going ( or even get away with it ) .

i watched the movie with tears and smiles alternatively . anger surged in me to see the ruin of hanoi . it made me feel sick . i could not sleep for the next few hours . this is just a stupid movie , right ? why are all these terrible movies so boring ? they get more and more boring as the weeks go by . what was the point of being an idiot when life did not seem any less boring than it already was ? one minute you are watching a film and on the next minute you are watching a movie . how can people do that ?

I must say I thought the show Greek would be really ridiculous and stupid. Since I am part of a sorority I didn't want them to make Greek organizations look bad....but I think Greek is hilarious. Yes, they do have the stereotypical sorority and fraternity but it's not mocking but just cute humor.All the characters are pretty likable minus Rebecca Logan (I just can't stand her), Casey and Rusty have good chemistry as brother and sister. Then there is Cappie. Who doesn't love a guy like Cappie haha His character brings so much to the show.

Another decent offering from the pen of Vince Gilligan.A pre-"Malcolm in the Middle" Bryan Cranston plays Patrick Crump, a deranged guy who eventually hijacks Mulder via gunpoint and has him driving west at high speeds. It has something to do with his severe head ringing (& possible deadly combustion--his wife just experienced it), and the pressure only seems to be relieved by heading towards the left coast. Only Mulder could relate to this guy's plight, and actually bond with his captor before the all night ride is completed.

This movie was made on a relatively small budget (10-20 million dollars?) with almost no promotion at all from its distributors. I only knew about it because I am a long time Jean-Claude Van Damme fan and I always check out his latest films in hope that they will be at least watchable and aside from some real turkeys (Derailed, Second In Command), they are. This movie has an easy enough plot to follow and Van Damme gives a good, humorous performance through out but the movie owes all of its credit to the fight scenes involving Van Damme, Scott Adkins and the final one of them together.

I am very disappointed because I expected a real ride as promised in the many reviews. The script is very bad with lot of holes and the direction too. The director failed completely to develop each violent scene with thrills and suspense. It tries very hard to follow a wannabe thriller. Therefore I had to watch how every bullet was spent without giving any sense to me. I was always asking what kind of movie I am watching. Then I didn't like that she smoked aggressively one cigarette after the other but perhaps the film was supported partly by the tobacco industry.

2005 was one of the best year for movies . we had so many wonderful movies , like batman begins at the top and ends with a villain ; this movie was very boring . it did have a little bit of fun though , which is why all of us felt more comfortable with it . i really wanted to see this movie before i lost my nerve . but alas , i could never get past the initial feeling of being watched ( by someone else ) . in some way , this movie makes me feel like i have to go on camera to do it .

The Ten Steps has basically a reasonably good premise for a scary short but the execution is simply appalling. The dialogue is terrible and the acting is of the kind so regularly witnessed in Irish short films. Really really embarrassingly bad. The girl has to go down the 10 steps of the cellar to change the blown fuse. She telephones her father who is entertaining his boss at dinner. The mother, an "actress" with very questionable acting skills, answers the phone and in a loud scolding voice tells her not to be ringing as Dad is 'trying to impress his boss'.

in extramarital we see b - actress traci lords at her very best . she ' s all wrapped in horror & suspense that the characters have somehow made up a story for themselves and are trying to help someone else write one . i could ' t disagree with that , so i decided to watch it for a couple of minutes . as usual , it ' s not good . the acting is horrible and the scene looks awful . this movie didn ' t seem to be able to portray the plot . what makes it even worse was the fact that no one ever seems to know who the heroine is .

I caught this on HBO under its category of "Guilty Pleasures", and I would agree that I felt guilty (and pleasured) watching it. One, it's trash, and really raunchy trash. Two, the plot is slow and predictable and once you learn "who did it", you think, "So what?". However, I must admit to being enough of a male chauvinist pig to want to sit through what is obviously a poor movie, if for no other reason than to see Peta Wilson get completely naked a number of times.

a film , first and foremost , should be good storytelling . it should be entertaining - and entertaining does sound like a great idea . i would also recommend it to other kids who like to watch films made from the movies of the past and see what they think they saw . but you have to listen to this film before you can really enjoy it : it is one of the most boring , ugly and annoying movie i have ever seen ( although it seems to make me feel that way even watching it makes me sick ! ) so let me tell you something about this film in general .

ocean ' s twelve is probably better than ocean ' s eleven . i know most people would disagree , but i really do not give a crap what some of the other kids think . this movie was really good and it seems to be on dvd . i want to go see something like this again someday . i can not believe we just watched an old movie that did not make it to its title , let alone how they came upon it . 
 " well , i 'm pretty sure you should have watched this once before . " i commented as we walked out onto the dock .

I'm sorry, perhaps this is part of the wave of praise for fireman since 911, perhaps it's an old fashioned story, perhaps it's not meant to knock your socks off but I'm sorry, this film is awful. As in the title, cliché 49, I think it has at least that many clichés. It's a dreary story (impressive managing to be dreary when there's dangerous fires and lives being saved) about a fireman. And his dreary life, told in a pointless, 'scene from now' flashback to the past style.

` ` the journey ' ' is a romantic version of the cold war . it ' s about an english woman ( who does not speak british ) who wants to kill a man . you can tell by the way she was acting when she wrote the movie , and i know that 's what she would have done . but there ' s another story , one that doesn ' t really get any interesting . this film has nothing to do with my father ' s involvement in the civil war and is just as depressing as the movies themselves .

If you took all the stock elements of a Shrek movie (grumpy ogre, annoying donkey, cute kitty, obligatory dance number, etc. ), put them in a blender and condensed it to 20 minutes, you'd have this mess. Painful to watch; I may have laughed once. The story and dialogue are rushed beyond comprehension, with the voice actors sounding like they phoned in their lines. The final reworked rendition of "The Christmas Story" poem felt like it was written by a committee in five minutes. And boy, a little Eddie Murphy goes a long way.

Lackawanna Blues is a moving story about a boy who is raised in a house by some pretty unusual people. It's editing and soundtrack really pulls you in to the story and lets you experience the film the way the writer really meant for it to be seen.The music really tied into the story, which made the characters come to life. The editing made the story more progressive and captivating. I was also surprised by some of the performances of the cast, most notably S. Epatha Merkerson's.I can't wait to see the one man show featuring this films writer, Ruben Santiago-Hudson.

Dear reader, Watch out! This movie is not really a movie, though its creators have the impertinence to call it so. If you have not been warned about its content, here it goes: the film is simply a sequence of imagines which flow continually and are trying to transmit a certain feeling, concept. They could be called, therefore, symbols. The images are accompanied by a soundtrack, it's purpose being to create atmosphere as well. However, the images the director has chosen can only transmit feelings to an American audience, because they are, in an overwhelming number, American icons.

given the acting roles he played in the 1940s ( casper gutman , signior ferrari , mr . peters , jerome jones ) : we must be moving too fast ; we have no idea what 's happening . it may be an accident , or it may be a real thing . i know this movie has a lot to do with some of the plot that is being used , but if you like this movie and want to read the story , just say so . if you hate the movie , please tell the author to send me a letter about it now .

It's unlikely that anyone except those who adore silent films will appreciate any of the lyrical camera-work and busy (but scratchy) background score that accompanies this 1933 release. Although sound came into general use in 1928, there are no more than fifty words spoken to tell the story of a woman, unhappily married, who deserts her husband for a younger man after a romantic interlude in the woods.The most vividly photographed scene has the jealous husband giving a lift to the young man for a ride into town, proceeding to drive normally until he realizes the man is his wife's lover.

never mind the serious logic gaps , never mind the achingly cliche character portrayals , never mind the haphazard writing of characters in a film . i think we are all beginning to see through to the very core of these characters . you will find that this novel is actually quite decent . it has been a little too long since i wrote one and i was trying to get back to enjoying it . my main problem is with the actors , because i seem to be the only one stuck with them . the rest of the time they seem to have no idea what they are up against .

I saw this movie and thought it was a sleeper. Sometimes I can get into intellectual Romantic movies. This movie just did not move me. I felt like it was about one hour too long. Camille is portrayed as a very sympathetic sculptor, who loses just about everything. I thought the whole movie was just sad, and downcast. If you like tragedies, you MIGHT like this. I just thought it was too long, which meant it has many unnecessary scenes, which ultimately lead to about one hour of boredom. I would not recommend this movie.

` ` female convict scorpion - beast stable ' ' , the third in the series , is a magnificent piece of art . this film can be pretty funny , and i like that it has an engaging atmosphere that makes you feel like you 're on a roller coaster ride rather than on a jet plane . but the story behind this movie is really just an attempt to avoid getting into trouble . when i saw the movie last season , i got scared . i mean , who would give up something as valuable as a tv show ?

i have recently found this film on one of my husband ' s vhs tapes ( the blank variety which he likes to use for movies ) , and it has made me very angry with the world . what i saw at the end was an awful portrayal of the bad guy . when i see this movie ; i immediately start feeling sorry for the actors . there is nothing else i can do to help my husband , and that makes me feel terrible for him . if i were a movie star , i 'd be acting better , but i hate being judged for my career .

This BRASS EYE special PAEDO-GEDDON was swamped by complaints ( More on that later ) when it was broadcast in 2001 following a national debate around a possible " Sarah`s law " following the abduction and murder of school girl Sarah Payne . In fact it`s scheduling was delayed while Phil Collins took legal advice after he found out he`d been fooled by the show`s maker Chris Morris into a starting a campaign entitled Nonce-senseIf truth be told this show is probably more remembered for the controversy than the content which is in very poor taste but I do confess that I laughed out loud .

obviously , someone was looking at catching onto the ` ` blair witch ' ' wave . this movie was set up like all of the others and i liked it a little less than what i would have expected to see in one of the worst movies i have ever seen in my life . if you do not watch these episodes , you are apt to find yourself sitting through the entire series in the middle of the night with a very hard - on for this particular movie that is more of a horror flick than any kind of tv show .

It's been a long time since I have been in the art-house theater and I went to see Douches Froides because it has gotten such great reviews in the papers.The thing is with this movie, is that it has no head or tail, but merely a section in time about the life of the three main characters.When it started I already knew that it was gonna be a long sit down, but sometimes things can get better, in this case not. There is no real character development or interconnection between the players.

certainly this film is not for everybody - - - but for anyone with a sense of humor and love of period . that movie ' s not for everyone . it ' s bad enough when you ' ve got a bunch of other people who think they know the story but they ' re just looking to see what kind of guy " s doing it . " i ' ve never heard any of your stories before . i didn ' t even know you were in films until this morning . well , as a matter of fact i was surprised .

I was so "impressed" with Tim Kincaid's MUTANT HUNT that I gave this one a try. It is the near future, post apocalypse of course. A wandering fighter named Neo (no, not that Neo!) joins a group of similar looking fighters to challenge The Dark One and his underling Valaria. Along the way they encounter mutants, crazed females, sewer worms, a big spider leg and some clunky robots. Oh my! Sadly, ROBOT HOLOCAUST is hardly up (or down) to HUNT's level.

This film has its detractors, and Courtney's fey dresser may offend some folks (who, frankly, need a good smack upside the head) -- but the film is top notch in every way: engaging, poignant, relevant. Finney, naturally, is larger than life. Courtney makes an ideal foil. I thought the performances to be terribly strong in both leads, and Courtney's character provides plenty of dark humor. The period is well captured, the supporting cast well chosen. This is to be seen and savored like a fine cordial.

this really is an "okay" series.. everyone in it is pretty good. but i just can't take Reba. she's trying to be funny but she just isn't and then she got a stupid accent!! if they took her out of the show i would love to see it every day..i have been watching the show in 10 min now and as i said before, Reba IS destroying the show. however the 20 year old guy (dont know his name) but he's soooo funny, and he's really saving it all..so here's the recipe to get a great show.

if you have n ' t read tolkien ' s masterpiece ; prepare yourself for maybe the best movie experience ever ! if you find your way to the following series in this book , enjoy a few of the best scenes : 
 the first one is an awesome thriller . i think i will take a short peek at it from time to time to make sure it ' s really a good story . it ' s hard not to watch it once or twice every week though . after seeing what it looks like in movies , i had to agree that it ' s too good to be true .

When HULK hit theaters in 2003, it wasn't long before DVDs of the old Incredible Hulk TV show popped up in an attempt to cash in on the craze. We saw a similar occurrence a year prior when Spider-Man cartoons appeared on DVD to coincide with that hero's big screen debut. Companies leap at the opportunity to ride on the financial coattails of a hot brand.So the fact that this picture never surfaced on the shelves of Wal-Mart as its featured heroes clobbered the box office in the summer of 2005 says a lot. I guess everyone involved would just rather forget.

i wo n ' t be too hard on this show because i enjoyed the first season , but then , things changed . unfortunately for me , the show was not a success at all . when i left the theatre , i thought that i might be able to see it through . if you get this part , you can see what real actors are doing as well . this is actually a wonderful time to learn and to do something useful . i have made two great movies , one with some good ideas in it , and the other with an even better set .

shtrafbat is the story only russians could tell about the second world war . the largest front of the whole thing was a nuclear missile launch from new york to washington , dc in 1973 . this movie is very poorly executed . it is so much more complicated than anything we have ever watched and i find myself laughing out loud at its complete lack of originality . how come there are no words ? i do not think it is possible to express this many characters in a movie based on two different parts of the same story . the main purpose of the movie is that it portrays people with similar personalities .

This is one of the strangest things on TV. It is set in a bizarrely underpopulated Midlands superb called Leatherbridge which seems to be the dullest place in the country. It features a bar with no visible staff or customers, a university with no students, a police station with no criminals and a doctors' surgery with more doctors than patients. The story lines are dire - every episode revolves round a bizarre medical issue acted out by a variety of brummie extras who can never actually act, and for some reason the doctor always ends up round their house solving their problem.

Tyra & the rest of the modeling world needs to know that real women like myself and my daughter don't care to see all the ridiculous modeling to sell something. Weird locations, too much makeup & too much skin is not necessary. Sex does not always sell when you are selling to women. The same goes for the horse stomping runway walk that looks unnatural. People come in all shapes & sizes & they need to have that on the show. My daughter has a 36" inseam, is tall & slender & a size 5, I am more average at a size 12.

. . . . ok , small - town , clueless sheriff ? check . sheriff ' s hot daughter ? check ? ne ' er - do - well boyfriend of a famous movie star ! check . sheriff ' s hot wife of some famous actress and her husband ' s girlfriend . check . judge ' s favorite show , check . but the story is basically a bunch of people wanting to have a good time and forget about all of their responsibilities . i can ' t believe how little they actually seem to appreciate each other ' s company .

I saw this movie last night at the Berlinale as part of the competition. It was billed as the "world premiere" of the movie by the host (though it seems that people here have seen it previously). I have to say, I still don't really know what to make of the movie. I am unfamiliar with the book, purchased the ticket only two hours beforehand and had only limited knowledge of the plot. Not enough, as it seems, as I had problems getting into the movie. The movie is sometimes being narrated by Jones' character but somehow that perspective did not fit for me.

This movie was trying to something, but failed miserably. All the attempts at suspense were cheap, and there were so many tired gimmicks and plot holes I ended up laughing and making fun of it the whole way through. At least I was entertained. The ghosts are attempting to warn the family, so why do they attack the girl, whose name I didn't care to remember. And what was with the black and white at the beginning? I know what they were trying to do, but they fell far short. And where the heck did that guy (John Corbett's character) come from?

get the cd instead . the show is tame , and the editing sucks . the crowd gets way too much enjoyment out of it . " " so what 's the best part ? " i asked . 
 " the last part was about a girl with a boyfriend who could n't keep his hands off her at night . when that movie ends he decides to make sure she does n't have any kids . the only thing worse than watching an adult movie is seeing a grown up chick with a man . " " no offense , but this is awful .

the finest short i ' ve ever seen . some commentators suggest it might have been lengthened , due to the fact that one of the most successful stories in the series has been thrown back in its face by an overweight , middle aged gentleman who does not believe in what he is doing or where he thinks he is going . the movie was a terrible waste of my money and i hate films . when i saw this one , i was not expecting it to be funny , nor was i expecting to see it for a living .

Dolemite is one of the best movies featuring a pimp as a hero, who takes down the man, meanwhile hooking up with all the finest women that the ghetto has to provide. Mind you that these women know karate, and are fine foxy ladies.SPOILER--the end fight scene is pretty crazy, with Dolemite ripping the heart out of Willy Green. Make sure your copy is unrated.Plus there are a cast full of innovative brilliant characters like the Hamburger Pimp, Reverend, Mayor, Queen Bee, and others. The apparel is great, and the sets are full of 70's style.

i would give this a zero if they had that rating . fun was no fun at all . i mean , why would you want to go to the beach with an ice cream cone ? i mean , how hard could it be ? ! anyway , i have heard of people who do this in the movies . but , i have never seen any real films like this before . my parents loved their movies , but they did n't have any idea what they were going to see . so , here i am , on the other hand , trying to make something for them .

I went to see this on the strength of Albert Finney alone. He's one of my favorite actors and he rarely fails to deliver. I'm not sure if the plot is interesting or just silly: it's about a little boy who is about to be born, but as his mother goes into labor, he refuses to come out! This sends God and the whole human being factory into a crisis and Albert Finney is called out of purgatory to try and convince the boy to change his mind and decide to want to be born.

Six months after high-school sprinter Laura dies during a race, a killer begins to murder the rest of the track team using a variety of sports equipment as weapons: that's the daft plot of early 80s slasher Graduation Day, a lacklustre addition to the genre that offers very little in the way of style, originality or decent gore.What it does deliver, however, are some stunningly awful musical interludes, a few familiar faces (including an early appearance from scream-queen Linnea Quigley), and a smattering of nudity (a prerequisite of any slasher movie!

it might be that the film i saw was entirely different from the one that the others saw , however . if you want to understand something ( and it is definitely not hard to do when you have to deal with such people ) , it 's that most of the scenes are completely incomprehensible . as an example , i think some of the actors actually believe that they were part of some kind of ancient cult . all the characters are very similar but a lot of the dialogue has been turned off at times . this is really difficult for me to follow .

I have watched every version of this play that I can think of, including several on the stage, and Sir Derek Jacobi is absolutely the best Hamlet I have ever seen! He has the most wonderful voice for stage acting, and his expressive face will take you on a roller coaster of emotions throughout this play. The way in which he delivers his lines takes you on a journey through madness. He (as Hamlet)can in an instant be loving, soft and gentle and in another instant be raging against the hell that is his life.

there is one of the best movies directed by andrzej wajda , that story told about young writer who is in a canoe paddling through the river with his family . the story itself is good , but it reminds me so much of someone else i have never met or been involved with . all of the plot was great and the dialogue well written . however , as i read this movie , my mind wanders to other things . oh , what i would like to write if i could get something out of it . . . i do n't know why i ever had to go to see this film .

The movie opens with Charlie (Jeff Daniels), a business man just finishing his lunch in a neighborhood deli. It appears he doesn't have enough cash to cover the check. Instead of reaching for his plastic, he furtively glances around to see if the coast is clear and ducks out of the place without paying. Unbeknownst to Charlie, "Lulu" (Melanie Griffith) had been observing him from the other side of the deli. "Lulu" is decked out in what passed for cool back in the 1980's with a brunette page-boy cut.

spend your time any other way , even housework is better than this movie . the jokes are n ' t funny in a way most of the movies are . i mean , if you were watching this movie on tv it would be like having a dog who had died from cancer . there have been some good comedies about dogs ; there have been some pretty good ones about puppies that got killed or lost their owners . but none of them ever make me sit through the movie . it is so boring and boring . i really feel sorry for these people who have to watch such a stupid movie .

when i was driving home after work , i bought some movies for my four year old twins . i wanted to make them feel special so i would not have to remember them every day . this movie had been a big success - and by the end of the movie i was looking forward to watching something that could be as fun as watching sex . i think i am going to need to take another long nap . chapter 1

There's lots of ketchup but not a whole lot of sense in the supposedly explanatory third sequel, which piles on the naff visuals to no effect. Good old Alan Smithee directed this one, in which various members of the same family (all played, poorly, by Bruce Ramsay) are terrorised by Pinhead (Doug Bradley, wheeled out of mothballs for the umpteenth time). Peter Atkins tries to imbue his script with poetic touches but doesn't seem to realise that his dialogue is as deep and meaningful as a plate of sick.

The Internet is a wondrous thing is it not? I am watching a taped episode of one of my all time favorite documentaries, "Vietnam:The Ten Thousand Day War", from my DVR in Florida USA to my laptop in Kuwait; I'm writing a review about this series and have just read another review from someone who actually lives in Vietnam! Amazing. I would like to just say that for Minh Nguyen to make the statement that America brought the war to Vietnam is one sided. I know America was the main player in the west but it takes two sides to wage war.

the title , although singular , will undoubtedly remind real horror fans of tod browning ' s immortal classic about a zombie infestation . i just do not know if this movie is a good fit for the movies , but we need to find out . after having seen almost all of the dvd trailers , and finding that it was not recommended in the series , i wanted to see what type of film they actually watched . i am not saying that even though i like this film , it really does not give me much of a clue as to why any of the titles are so popular .

I just saw this movie and all I can say is, where are the drive in's these days. This seems like it would have been a great 2nd feature at a drive in in 1977 (maybe playing with one of those Joan Collins movies), but it's only worth watching now if you're feeling nostalgic for the 70's. Silly plot that is full of holes, but it does remind one of the era it was made in. Interesting to see Melanie Griffith so young and Anne Lockhart is quite attractive, though not much of an actress.

oh , yawn . not another chick flick where the men are all pigs and the women will get even worse if they take their bra off . it would be a total waste of time anyway because there is no way to watch a movie without seeing what the guys look like in the real world . so why should we watch a movie when we could watch a movie on my cell ? i have always found that watching a movie with the intention of making them feel better about themselves would be more fun than watching a movie that was n't worth watching .

the evil that men do ( 1984 ) was one of the few non - cannon films charlie bronson made during the 1960s . he has a great work to say about this movie . i found it hard to believe that rick ' s brother , jack , actually got killed in that movie . what sort of film would lead to something like this ? if you ask me , there are far worse actors on earth . why would anyone want to become a villain anyway ? but then again , how did they get out of bed in the first place ? no one knows .

this movie is terrible , it was so difficult to believe that katie became a heartfelt teenager with the power to see the future like i have always seen . in fact , we all wish she could have become a teen , but no one believes that she can do what i have done . not just you and me , but all the other girls who would love to be able to go back to school and play their role as grown ups without fear of being kicked out of the program . i saw her first year of high school , right before she graduated .

Waters's contribution to the world of cinema has to be searched with a telescope, and then when/if something is found (by sheer chance and lots of luck) it has to be analyzed with a microscope.And after it has been analyzed it would get discarded into the lab's "rubbish bin for totally useless things". One single atom of that microscope is worth all of his movies combined.CB is etremely campy, and intentionally so. The usual JW stuff: comic-strip dialogue, simplistic plot, moronically cheerful characters, chewing-gum pop, overacting etc.

whoa , this is one of the worst movies i have ever seen ! the packaging for the film is really cheap and very old - fashioned . the dialogue is a bit off but they are good . the main characters are great ; it is so easy to get confused about what they are saying ( as well as the inflections ) . the most terrible parts are the language : some of the actors are funny , some of them are not , and it is all quite boring . here is your chance at a real action movie .

I actually liked certain things about this game. I loved the first person perspective and wish we had had that choice in the first three games. There's nothing like seeing the monsters up close, in your face. The graphics really weren't bad, but I would have liked more things to interact with even though it was just a shooter. The music was fine. The things I hated were: The movement kind of sucked and aiming was a total pain. The story was too lame for words and too much of the same old thing with no originality.

( possible ? ? spoilers included , but nothing critical given away . ) i just watched this classic low budget version of the novel . as i was watching the movie , my mind wandered and i wondered why i liked it so much . if i do not watch this thing , i will never have a reason to leave home . in all honesty , you can not possibly imagine me living in an environment like this . i spent my childhood there with my friends . after high school i did not go into any of the places i thought were normal until i saw the horror movies .

I was told Jon was for awhile on spiritual experiences. I guessed the film will be interesting.In fact isn't at all. Not so much profound for a such subject. "eternity" never-ending life. Experiences after death and "dejavu". The film is not as a comedy but isn't funny at all, at least not express yet. It's so naive. Charming film but naive film. A must to avoid. mild spoilers below . the prospect of war was clearly on the horizon when tfw was filmed . from the opening scene , a great man and his team were captured by the local police and dragged into a room . they were locked up for at least 15 minutes - i do not even think it was more than 10 seconds . the bad part is they were still able to make out who was in the room during this short film as they were being interviewed . there are many theories about who would have had access to this videotape , but no one could come up with any evidence of these people being accomplices .

man oh man , this was a piece of dog sh # t . i read a few reviews on it and wanted to see if they could bring it in . but there was something that kept my mind off it . i just could n't figure out what it even meant . at the end of each book i would tell you that we all loved this movie . one critic said that it should be released by next week ( the other critic told me that " we all love this movie " ) . then another critic suggested that it needed a better script .

This film is supposedly about three young idealistic people, two of whom join the Naxalite movement and blah blah. It is really just another film about some beautiful, rich people trying to decide who they should bed next; the peasants and naxalites and the political struggles of the era merely serve as a picturesque backdrop. Literally, as we don't hear the villagers say a word, never mind learn anyone's name, thus they occupy the same 'role' as the 'natives' in old Hollywood films. The movie is also dull, and the story does not actually get us anywhere - except to various bedrooms.

pure schlock from beginning to end . the average 12 year old might find that it has an interesting take on a subject , but nothing is all that different as long as you do n't have an audience . what was going on back there at home ? how did we get into this place ? i want to talk to your dad . i 'm really sorry to hear about what happened to you in the hospital , but if you will allow me to give you a second chance , you can come up with some better stuff for this movie .

my friend and i rented this one a few nights ago . and , i must say , this is the worst comedy i ever read . i was going to let you in on a few things , first of all , since i like to think it may have been written by a very bad person ( which makes sense , considering what they did to him in the end ) . secondly , i am really tired of movies that make people laugh when they are about to die . i guess i need to learn some things about the human condition .

i saw this movie for the first time when quentin tarantino showed it to a bunch of us at the local high school , which we were all in the middle of having an ' out of order ' moment in the film . " my parents are still on vacation and they are trying hard to convince my mother to pay for their trip back home . she just ca n't see her kids as a couple . if i remember correctly from the book that the reason she is so unhappy about the trip has nothing to do with the children .

the makers ask for a huge suspension of disbelief , you grant them it in the hope that given a choice - and this is a fair one - they can make an example out of some of the others . if you do nothing , the makers wo n't be able to do anything about it . if you fail , you may well have to pay the price . i just ca n't find it in myself to write a story like that . so no thanks . why not go live in europe ? or somewhere in the middle east ?

Chick Flick? Of course.... Been done before? Many times.... Predictable? Yes..... Worth watching? You bet! I was delighted with Sarandon and Portman's portrayals of otherwise stock characters in a familiar story line. I am a great fan of mother/daughter stories. What makes the difference between the good ones and the weak ones ARE the performances and the character development. Although this is not the BEST of its genre, I will buy it and watch it again. I felt the characters were believable and the acting was superior.

Thank God I didn't buy this movie myself! I borrowed it from a friend who bought it out of sheer curiosity and of course after viewing it feel they should be reimbursed! This has got to be one of THE worse movies I've EVER seen! I do realize they couldn't have had much of a budget but I swear I could make a better movie than this staring my pets! The acting was horrible, so was the editing, the dialogue, EVERYTHING! It was so bad that it was seriously making me angry as I watched it!

I left the theater, and I was only 10 years old. That's how bad it sucked. The plot was horrid and the acting was worse. the director godfrey reggio must be a very charming and persuasive man for this dreadfully botched project to have seen him doing this . i am truly sorry for the way this thing has come off . in fact , i hope that you can make it through this film . you will get to see how terrible my character is . at the same time , i am quite sure that he is just trying to make me laugh so badly that i will probably forget the whole thing . i suppose it could be said that i never saw much humor in this work .

a couple of clarifying comments are in order . herschell gordon lewis contributed a brief introduction to the video release of this movie which i did not see but it seemed rather good . it 's a small one , nothing special and it has lots of twists and turns so i am impressed . on the screen i could make out a picture of me , my parents and a girl i did not know ; her eyes were bright with life and her hair was long and brown . i wonder why they have taken me in ? she was so cute and funny .
