The "science" is asinine - a masonic atom gun?? And what's up with the enormous amounts of Brylcream in everyone's hair? I guess the 50's were the Slimeball decade! Well, this bird puppet apparently comes from "some god-forsaken anti-matter universe", and it's here to build a nest & lay eggs in New York.

The film Soultaker is essentially an older form Final Destination in which several car wrecked teens have their souls separated from their bodies and must cheat death who is chasing them... The film has its moments, and its concepts, the idea of disoriented souls being separated from their bodies is a pretty nifty idea... If this movie were remade with a few good actors/actresses and some awesome special effects it could turn out to be extremely awesome... As for the actual film, I recommend watching the MST3K version, the pure version might be too boring to sit through, unless you love bad movies staring Martin Sheen's brother...

right . . . so you have a dam , tons of water ( that seems to flow really really slowly ) , and yet you feel nothing ! how do you feel ? can you imagine such a thing in your life ? ! ! ? ! i want to make it all up as fast as i can when i get home this weekend . well , let 's see , i 'll tell you what , i 'll be able to write for a couple of pages and put it on my blog , with just one question : is this the first time i read this stuff ?

This is quite possibly the worst film I have ever seen. I would think you could get that from the title. Also, there is a particular love scene that could be the strangest in the history of film. I can't even remember why I saw this film or when. Only that is an absolutely horrible movie-viewing experience. On the other hand, if you are looking for the absolute weirdest movie to waste two hours of your time, then by all means rent it. Good luck finding it at your local store though. I doubt this movie is in a very wide-distribution.

This junk bore as much resemblance to the novel as a pickle slice does to a cucumber. The film makers took the Alamo section out of the book, made it into a movie, and said it was based on the book. Hah! Wonder what they did to induce Mr. Michener to endorse this piece of fluff? It was just another Davy Crockett, flintlock rifle, Santa Ana, 13 days of glory collection of poppycock. I almost started rooting for the mexicans, just to get the damn thing to end.

one of my favorite movies . i like horses , i like happy endings , and i like walter matthau . but even if you were to look at these episodes from the end of the movie and know there was more than just one guy , it would still be hard to believe that he would have a heart - to - heart talk with a girl about her father . i also like the characters . they are so cute and innocent looking that they do n't deserve to be treated so bad . this is the only time that people actually care about their characters ( or their family ) .

If you liked the Grinch movie... go watch that again, because this was no where near as good a Seussian movie translation. Mike Myers' Cat is probably the most annoying character to "grace" the screen in recent times. His voice/accent is terrible and he laughs at his own jokes with an awful weasing sound, which is about the only laughing I heard at the theater. Not even the kids liked this one folks, and kids laugh at anything now. Save your money and go see Looney Tunes: Back in Action if you're really looking for a fun holiday family movie.

director and playwright richard day adapted his own stage material for the screen , clearly inspired by rock hudson ' s " what if . " however , there are a number of other factors that should not even be on this film ' s movie agenda , such as : 
 ( 1 ) to keep my name in the book , i wanted to make sure i could get some work done . this movie is going to take its toll on me . i spent the first two years of it studying how to make a good acting job .

the quickie ( 1 outta 5 stars ) pretty poor movie . . . an old - as - the - hills story about a high - ranking gangster who comes across this film on tv , but has to leave when some idiot decides to take it for free . . . which makes no sense at all . they 're not supposed to kill each other off and then show up with money . why would anyone do that ? what kind of crime could they have done if they did n't kill each other off while in the line of duty ? also , how does this plot come together ?

yes this movie features a gal named jessica who says everything is evil and she causes trees to land on fire for no reason at all , but then there are the zombies . if that were really what happened , then why did some of these idiots say it was just a bad movie because it was horrible ? i do like this film , even if it is not my favorite one . the other thing that seems to make sense in this situation is that there is no such thing as an original movie . you see , the premise has always been the same .

jerk hazer mike ( david zelina playing this college frat man as one major bastard you want to see die ? ) . a couple of his friends , who were from san francisco , are in on the act , and make the entire scene seem even worse than it really is . they do n't even try to sound funny , which is just as well . i could use a good laugh , especially since i have only been back for three hours , and already i feel that i 'm running low on energy and my body feels tired and sick .

A traveling couple (Horton and Hamilton)stumble onto the town of Gatlin, where kids have slaughtered the adults and are always eager to slaughter more, along the way they're separated and Peter Horton of course must save his wife from these tiresome, er terrible tykes in this very bad adaption of one of King's best short stories. In the original story King managed to create tension and draw personality of his characters, however all of that has been zapped from the production and all that is left is a repetitive bore which is far too predictable to be all that suspenseful.

this was gene kelly ' s breakthrough , and that alone makes it memorable . throw in rita hayworth as his favorite movie author and i might have had a little trouble fitting in with that genre . there were many good movies , the most important one of all , which is something to see right up until the very end . let me give you an example : 
 1 . a young girl runs to her mother for help while she goes to a party . she does not know that her brother is in love with another girl and that he has lost both his wife and girlfriend .

The best thing about this flick is that it seems like they used a lot of stuff left over from the Pearl Harbor attack in Tora Tora Tora. My favorite was the shot of the P-40 crashing into the row of parked P-40s but filmed from the top of a hangar or crane. Unfortunately it just gets worse from there.There's two black guys and two white guys as American POWs, as well as some Filipinos POWs and Japanese guards. The ranking POW of the Americans is a white naval Lieutenant, which is of course an O-3 in the navy.

one of the problems with popular culture , especially when discussing the popular culture of the 1970s , is that they always think there is more to life . i can tell you that at least 50 , 000 people spent their entire lives watching reality show reruns of a new year , only to find out that the program had nothing on the real world and was simply making them bored . i 'm not sure why they thought they were getting a free show in the first place . maybe they thought the show was stupid , or maybe it was just very good .

the stage star grace hayes stars in this obscure little film . after years of being on the stage , i have to say i like the play . it is really pretty good and makes you feel like you 've just stepped into some very bad action movie . so much has happened during these past few years and i am a little worried that i will never get back what i had lost . well , not much actually . i was an aspiring actress who spent every spare moment going out for coffee with her new boyfriend .

a group of four young men , attending a prestigious private school , belong to an old covenant that was formed at the age of twenty - nine . it is in the early 1970s and has been made into something called the " holy grail " for some time . we will have to see if there is another way to interpret this story , which i hope not . i just want to say that we do not know why this place exists , although most people would describe it as one of the scariest places in the city . it is probably the worst movie ever made , and i mean scary .

If you're looking for an accurate portrayal of Che Guevara, the Cuban revolutionary who helped aid Fidel Castro in his bid for power, you'd better read up on Cuban history or even type in his name on a search engine (you ARE on the Internet, after all).But whatever you do, DO NOT WATCH "CHE!". Unless, of course, you just want a good laugh.All the reviewers of the time (and moviegoers) gave "Che!" their vote for worst film of the decade. And no wonder; have you seen this travesty?

this movie was extremely disappointing , i thought it would be another ' marijuana comedy ' but do n ' t be mislead . this movie had an interesting dynamic and a good amount of character , even though i have read that there are so many characters involved . i found myself trying to talk to the person on the other end of the line without success , so i looked for a way to reach out to him or her . my first reaction is to just throw it all away and try to find some kind of solution .

I've just revisited this fondly remembered bit of cinematic madness from my early days, and must urge you to beg steal or borrow it.The story begins with a duel between a righteous Shaolin priest and our villain Abbot White, needless to say, Abbot White kicks Buddhist ass, and wages his campaign against Shaolin unhindered with the aid of his new ninja allies (a golden clad one who fights with a gold ring, a black clad one who fights with a spear, and my favourite; one who fights with a pair of knives who can disappear and reappear as a flying carpet).

personally , i have no problem with the acting , nor the script . i do have a problem with it . if you had n't been on the set and seen this movie , i would have lost all of my respect for you . however , i like what you have done and am glad that you got to watch it . i enjoy every second of this movie and i want to continue it . i will not discuss the sex scene or any of the sex scenes , but i wish that you could have watched the rest . i really enjoyed it as i watched it .

rita hayworth as rusty parker is the cover girl du jour - - she ' s one of the dancing girls in this film . she was n't so bad , either . her acting is a lot better than that of other girls . i thought she was good , but now i ' m getting tired of listening to it all . if you want to talk about what happened back in 1987 , just check in with me on smashwords : i would have been happier if you kept asking me questions and then making fun of me like you did back then .

The only reason for me for watching this little known Irish film was the question could Mike Myers have played a normal, dramatic character. Well, he could and his acting was pretty good but unfortunately that was probably the only good thing that I can say about this film. In the beginning film follows life of twelve years old orphan Mickey who lives with his brother and sister with their somewhat eccentric grandma. Despite some strong language it looks like a family film but after a while it becomes clearly that Pete's Meteor is a hardly suitable for young audience drama.

` ` prime suspect 4 ' ' continues the exploits of the inscrutable and dogged seeker of truth and justice , detective steve traylor . as is the case with these crimes , one can not blame them on a story that seems to have come from someone else who claims to work for an organisation called the secret service . this is not something you see on tv , so much like what you might expect to see on tv . it is too far - fetched to be believable or credible , though i find it extremely plausible at best .

this is by far one of the best films that india has ever made . following are the plus points in this film - which is a huge understatement . the first two scenes and then the third were very easy , but it all gets a bit too complicated after that . so what do you think of this movie ? it does n't really look as appealing as any i have ever seen before . the actors seem to be more focused and their acting is more interesting than the rest of the movie . the only things that bother me are the people that play these roles .

wow , there are no words to describe how bad this movie truly is . i usually pride myself on my ability to put up with any amount of insanity . not for this film . this movie is all about making it so you can make sense of everything that happens around you . at the same time , the only thing that really matters here is making sure you 're in the wrong place at exactly the right time . the problem with this movie has to do with the first person to enter it . the characters are always the same and the dialogue is the same .

I really should give this stinker more credit that 1 star, because the film has so many eye-rolling lines that it's almost worth the price of the rental. The acting, if you want to call it that, is so stilted and contrived that it makes Ed Wood's actors appear life like. "Sammy," the lone black character, must be Mimi's husband in real life because he appears in her other films, but he has zero acting ability. His lines are priceless due to his absurd delivery, though I suspect the intention was to create a sympathetic character.

i am in a movie club at my school and i was forced to sit and watch this utterly dismal movie , because it just does n't seem like what you 'd expect of someone from hollywood . then there are these two guys . one of them is very old and he has a bad attitude that makes him sound like a complete loser , and the other guy ? i do n't know who they 're supposed to be . first off , you probably wo n't see anything of any importance on this film , but you ca n't say for sure that there is n't some significant plot or interesting plot .

This amusing, sometimes poignant look at the Hollywood detective genre of the 1940's and 1950's stars Robert Sacci as an unnamed former cop who retires, uses his life savings to pay for plastic surgery to transform his image into that of his idol, Humphrey Bogart, then sets up shop as a private eye under the name "Sam Marlowe". Robert Sacchi, incidentally, is one of the rare few Bogart impersonators who got the lisp exactly right; more to the point, the body and facial language are there.

i am sure i ' m in the minority ( i know i am among my friends ) , but i have never felt so lonely as when we first came to live together in the middle east . i would like very much if you were able to talk to somebody about this situation . how long do you think will happen ? there are a few of those people who wish they had never even seen this video . at one time , i thought that this was a good film , but after seeing it twice , i just could not believe that it actually started here and has been playing for many years .

For me, this is another one of those films that I got to see off of the Los Angeles based "Z" Channel when it was in service. And it was another one of those movies that I saw when I was young...and learned that there was a world out there...one I did not want to accept.Moving to Los Angeles and getting to watch international cinema became quite the guilty pleasure hobby of mine and to date, no premiere channel programming has matched the "Z" Channel in its showing of international films.

a bit too much mediterrenean machismo for me . the cast was beautiful , lovely to watch in all of its majesty , and i liked every second of it . it was an excellent performance , but if you do n't like my acting , i would be happy to try something else . " she had heard these words many times in the past , but she could n't remember ever hearing them actually spoken out loud . maybe this was not so different . there were some people who said they were from the east , but in fact , they were from the north .

i could watch this movie all day ! i love it . probably my all time favorite movies . but i really want to stay and watch this movie and not be disappointed with the movie . i am very interested in the story , which has an amazing ending for the first time and is so unrealistic that i would give it a chance if i had just watched it earlier . the movie was as bad as the book . the actors were completely useless . the characters were so dumb that i could n't tell if there was anything funny about either of them .

This movie had an excellent premise, and could have been a fascinating look at racism, attitudes to women at work and male female relations in England early last century. However, it simply turned into a soppy love story. But what was worse, is that the love story was totally unbelievable. The acting was for the most part poor, the direction confusing, but most of all the screenplay and the story were non-existent. The only thing I liked about the film was how dark it must have been before electric lighting. I really got a sense of just how little light one candle puts out.

` ` de dominee ' ' is based on the life of a real dutch gangster , klaas bruinsma ! in the early 1980 's , he went off to france to meet a french lover . he died in an american prison during his tour of duty in france . you know the kind of stuff that happens in prisons . when he came back from paris , he spent two nights in jail and was released the next morning . i found out that this guy was actually a really good actor but could n't do any much more than stand there and stare at the movie screen with a smile on his face .

the storyline of this movie is cliche and obviously has been ripped off from jurassic park . the filmmakers did n't realize it would be a great story but they tried to put the plot in the wrong place and fail miserably . the characters all looked as though they were trying to look cool , well that is pretty much why they did . there is no rhyme nor reason to what the actors were doing . you must understand that not only was their acting inept , but their acting performance was atrocious . this film could have easily gone better .

Being a wrestling fan, movies about wrestling generally suck (Backyard Dogs, Bodyslam, Jesse Ventura story) but this one isn't the worst I've ever seen. Yes its bad but its better than some of the others I've mentioned.Hulk Hogan stars as basically himself and for some reason, a rival network wants to beat him up because he doesn't want to be on that network. Let me explain it so everyone can understand....picture USA Network having Rip...and TNT will go to any lengths to get him.Does this make sense...no?

i have viewed this cartoon as a child , a father , and now a grand - father . it is my most fervent regret that the children of my first generation are having to work for a man they hardly know . at times it is like being around someone who truly knows how to be a great actor , and then when he is in the middle of his acting , he gets so angry that he just takes off . i once thought this was funny until i came to see how many people had to put their life on hold to become a great actor .

Sorry about the "extremely clever" summary phrase. I don't know what I was thinking, but I really couldn't help myself.I've been meaning to see 'Bloody Birthday' for a long time and I must say that it was a pleasant surprise to find a copy of this film by accident and for such a low price. And believe me, I live in a small South American village and these things are very unlikely to happen. It's a real shame that some of these 'gems' from the 80s are now almost completely forgotten.

this was a great film in every sense of the word . it tackles the subject of tribadism in a huge way . for example , when i wrote this about my sister , she and i spent a lot of time together during that time . but it was not until recently that we discovered how similar the story really is to the original . the main reason why they did this was to get me to like it on film . now i understand why someone who is very good at all these films wanted to make this movie . there were many things more satisfying to watch on television than this .

how bad idea was to remake an almost oscar - worthy film ? ! mosthly martha is much more better , and i see no reason for me to doubt that the movie should get well done . as you will see here , in the mid - 19th century this film had a pretty good ending with lots of good characters , decent dialogue , and plenty of sex . but in fact , it has not been one of the best movies i have ever seen . when i first saw this film i was so disappointed in myself , especially after my mother died .

Years ago, I used to watch bad movies deliberately. Somehow I missed this one. No gesture rings true. No facial expression fits the scene or the action. I've never heard such inappropriate music for a film. At the final scene, I was rooting for the car to run over that ridiculous kid - one of the worst child actors ever.Only one name in it I ever heard of - Wilford Brimley. He must've been very hungry to take this part.DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES, WATCH THIS MOVIE!!! YOU'VE BEEN WARNED!! !

i watched the this the other night on a local station because i did n ' t feel like watching tripe like that , so i didn ' t . it is a bad comedy , and as much fun as it is to watch it , this one has not been played in over 40 years . it ' s sad . i don ' t even like the characters ; they are simply too predictable , but this one really gets you with all those plot holes . the main character is a very old - fashioned male of thirty - five years old who lives in the suburbs of washington state .

This is by far one of the best films that India has ever made. Following are the plus points of the film...Wonderful direction, cinematography and editing, the editing is very smooth and the timing of changeovers is excellent.Even though the film shows the life of Mumbai Policemen and their hardships, it never gets boring or sympathetic.Mind-blowing acting by lead actor Nana Patekar. One can surely hope that he gets nominated for the Best actor for the academy awards.Controlled violence. The violence is controlled and the film doesn't become a bloody mess.No stupid songs as in usual Indian movies.

take it from me as a camera man who worked for republic studios from 1946 to 1950 and then warners . in 1995 , the studio director called me to his office because i was supposed to be there . i did not know what to expect . the meeting had been an enormous success and they seemed to have some very high ratings on the tv screen . after a short period of conversation , the interview began . the interviewer asked " where is your wife , sister , and daughter ? " he answered " they are both dead . "

back in the 70 ' s , a small - time texas filmmaker named s . f . brownrigg directed a handful of surprisingly decent screenplays but it has only been about 15 years since i was on the film scene . this movie is supposed to be a great hit but the cast has just so many characters and their character is not as good as the original . the producers can not believe what they have made . it seems that one of the reasons i love this movie are the actors and the actors seem to enjoy the role . the main point is that the director wants the cast to be perfect .

i ' m rating this pretty high just because of sam elliott . i could ' ve done without the female nudity in this movie - but it would be a better movie for the two of us with the guys , who will be laughing at our inability to play a single scene . i am looking forward to this movie , and i hope all of my characters are as hilarious as they were before we went through this film . one of my favorite movies is this movie . however , there ' s something different about this movie when you watch it .

Citizen Kane....The Godfather Part II....D'Urville Martin's Dolemite. This is the single greatest piece of celluloid ever created and unleashed upon humanity. Rudy Ray Moore, in a role that transcends Academy Awards stars as Dolemite, the baddest cat in the universe. He clearly does not take any jive from no turkey (I myself am unfortunately a turkey) and proves it with his powers of rapping, pimping, and karate chopping. This is blaxploitation at its absolute finest, a shining example of the genre with its low budget, continuity errors, and hatred for rat-soup eating honkey expletive expletive.

i rented this type of ` ` soft core ' ' before , but i can honestly say , i was n ' t in a rush to go into anything that might be useful . " " you must have been . there is just one thing missing : how much time were you planning to spend here ? " she asked . 
 " about six weeks , at the most , " i said , not really telling her the whole truth . besides , i do n't feel up to explaining why i decided to come all the way over here .

After just viewing the movie, I must say this is one of the worst films I have ever seen. This takes my worst movie award away from Komodo, which is no easy feat. It is neither a porno nor a legitimate film and it gives them both a bad name. The acting, camera-work, plot, script, and sound are all awful. My personal favorite part of the movie is the duck asking the bartender if he has any grapes. Why was a joke such as this put in the film?

i was waiting to welcome arnold schwarzeneger ' s return to action after the dismal movies he ' d made after ` ` his own . ' i could have used an oscar , but it didn ' t happen . i should have listened to that movie a while back , and then just stayed in my room until it came along . it doesn ' t make this movie any better , though . all of the character is horribly predictable , with everything from dirty jokes and no - strings romance . i do not even enjoy watching those stupid movies because they remind me of the time when i was a kid .

it ' s hard to believe that there are some people out there in the world that actually think this is funny and that it was so funny when it ' s not , or if it doesn ' t even come close to being funny anymore . i ' ve seen quite a few movies since then , and i got to watch them most of my life . " he took another long drag from the cigarette . " as i recall , this movie is just a little scary at the beginning . there were two people in it who made it funny .

I must give credit to Billy Dee for trying to pull this off. Knowing this was a blaxploitation film, I started my DVD with a certain expectation. I knew it would be low budget... the acting sub-par... but hoped for a few gems to be sprinkled throughout. If there were any diamonds or gems sprinkled within this film, they were successfully buried under tons and tons of coal... or perhaps overacting. As an actor and filmmaker, I cringed often when potential poignant moments were ruined with atrocious performances. Yet, I must admit, I could not look away.

this is truly , without exaggerating , one of the worst slasher movies ever made . i know , it was pretty bad . but for a movie where there are so many funny characters that you could have called it a horror flick ( or worse ) , it might have been better . this film was about a young boy who discovers his father murdered in the night and goes looking for the man to save him . unfortunately , after he finds his father , he decides to go see his mother too . this film is much funnier than the first one .

i went to see this film because it was recommended to my wife and she wanted to go . we were both extremely depressed by the movie and really felt like we needed a change of scenery . i have seen some of these movies before but only on the television shows , so i thought it might be fun to watch them again . one of the most enjoyable experiences of my life is watching an episode of " in the early 1980s " called " in the late ' 70s " where two young women are kidnapped by another woman .

Do not see "Mr. Magoo." It is one of the worst movies I have ever seen. Leslie Nielson was not funny in it. He has not been funny since the Naked Gun movies. Well it won't take long to figure out that this is not a Naked Gun movie! The movie's plot is ridiculously foolish. Nothing in the entire movie was funny. The first few minutes of the film were animated to look like the old Magoo cartoons. I wish the movie would have stayed that way.

this short subject gathered kudos from all kinds of places for its plea for religious toleration . after a session , i would like you to hear this in the following words : 
 " how can we know if these guys are sincere or if they want to kill us ? there is too much uncertainty . one thing that i have not noticed about this film is that this film is totally lame and has no substance . i just do not understand what the story behind it really is , and what kind of game is being played by these actors .

this movie was alright . mary - kate and ashley play twin sisters ( sorry for stating the obvious ) who against their best friend has to fight to remain in the good graces of her best friend , mary - kate , and make it back home before being forced into a marriage by both her best friends . there was very little humor in the acting , but the characters were interesting nonetheless . if only they would just be honest with one another , then maybe we could all learn some good stuff from them . that would have been my guess though ! oh well .

this movie was , of the 67 of 71 best pictures i have seen , by far the worst . it started at ten in the afternoon and went on to take a total of 6 hours . there are lots of great titles , though some are so bad you might find them difficult to read . how many times have you seen it ? not as much as 1 / 2 times . that is one of the things i am grateful for about being in the films because it helps me concentrate on what i want to know . why did these movies be banned from the films ?

the four la cops in fedoras driving around in a big black convertible look faintly absurd , and even more hilarious . most of the stories that i have heard are pretty good . after all this time , it would be nice if the story never left the studio . but it did . i do n't know whether or not the story will ever be released . i think it has long since passed the point that it needs to . for the record , i like my job well . there is nothing else to say about it . it 's very boring .

this is probably the best movie from director hector babenco . it shows a brazilian reality unknown by foreigners , and it looks good but really has an awful story about people who killed themselves to kill a drug - dealer or so i hear . it makes me laugh when i see how much they just do n't understand what is going on . there was some kind of a shootout in the middle east that ended badly . it did n't exactly take place , but it sure as hell felt like a scene in one of my most hated movies . why would anyone even want to talk about such a thing ?

I have for years remembered a song "JUST A COUPLE IN A CASTLE" ("No. twenty moonbeam square, just a couple in castle in the air"). I couldn't find the song, but I remembered that it it had to do with cartoon bugs. I located a reference to the movie on the web. I had seen the movie when I was only 9 year old at the Ligonier PA theatre. I was pleased to find that it had Kenny Gardner the singer with Guy Lombaro (I am a Lombardo fan).

"Problem Child" was an okay movie, but did it really merit a sequel? I don't think it did. The original movie's only redeeming asset was Gilbert Gottfried, and he wasn't even good in this sequel.I can't really put my finger on why this movie was bad. For starters, it just wasn't funny. Even when I saw this as a nine-year-old, I didn't sympathize with Junior (Michael Oliver) at all. His character came off to me as whiny, self-loathing, and perhaps most importantly, a rebel without a clue.

This telecast of the classic musical "Sweeney Todd" does not do the production justice, but is still quite enthralling.Firstly, the most enjoyable aspect of this version is the production design, from the wheeling multi-set to the startling trapdoor. Then, the staging is excellent, right down to the slashing.The main failing here is in the performances people give. Oh, they're believable, all right-- but it is quite frustrating when nobody seems to be hitting their cues on time in a song as fast-paced as, say, "Kiss Me."

Genius or utter madness? That depends on your interpretation of this film. I responded to it on the level of a self-aware "cop-movie parody", and I sincerely hope that was the intention as I don't see anyone taking it seriously! :-D Paul Rudd for one seems to be chewing up the scenery and really getting into the spirit of things! Is this film supposed to mark a departure for Rudd from his core background in the comedy genre? Some kind of insane attempt to reinvent him as a hard-boiled action star? I think not!

why would anyone make a film like this ? why would anybody invest in a film like this ? why would anyone do that to their own best friend , and then have it made out of junk ? the more i get involved with this , the less i want to be a part of anything . no one has ever had a movie this bad in their entire life . if you ask me , the first thing i remember watching was a movie about zombies . oh , they are not bad guys at all . actually , they are just so very stupid !

Frederick Forsyth's books are always so intricately plotted, with twists and turns, and usually a great surprise ending. This adaptation had none of that.So much of what was great in the book (the history of Monk and the betrayed agents; the plot to influence the outcome of the Russian election) were completely missing in this adaptation. Instead, there's this completely new plot about bio-weapons that was a yawner.Forsyth's protagonists always operated in the shadows, forever just slightly beyond the reach of the antagonists. The joys of his books have always been the machinations of carrying out their mission.

Very poor quality and the acting is equally as bad. This movie is a prime example of present day england and the mindset. There is no mention of Jesus in this movie nor does the movie feature any type of scripture Christianity as most know it. I am also very surprised because this film is a BBC program and the BBC is quit well known for their quality programing, but it looks like the BBC's attempt to rival the Hollywood psycho/drama films are failing completely. Poor acting, poor plot, poor culture that seems to be without religion.

I finally snagged a copy of Kannathil Muthamittal through Netflix and spent New Yera's Eve watching an amazing drama unfold. It began with Shyama (a winsome Nandita Das) getting married to Dhileepan in the backwaters of Sri Lanka and then a war takes over their romance. Shyama has to flee to India and is in a refugee camp as she gives birth to a child. Several years later we see Amudha, a playful well-loved child (P. S. Keerthana), who is the darling (or burden) of teachers, parents and fellow schoolmates alike, in a very How to Solve a Problem Like Maria sequence.

okay , sure , this movie is a bit on the hokey side . it ' s difficult to take characters seriously and do much of the talking . i like the story about an ex - soldier who travels with an army in afghanistan . he makes it sound so scary . but , it ' s funny how you don ' t find these things funny any more than other movies that are made to look that way . they are just a little creepy . one night a few hours later , he leaves for a flight to washington , dc .

This event defined an era of wrestling entertainment that, I believe, is not equaled today. The colorful characters - in their stereotypical garb - brought a certain charm to the show that has since been raped by society and overexposed. Wrestling had a bit of an innocence back then. A kid could watch it without watching an episode of Jerry Springer.Looking back now (I was 5 at the time), although I loved both Warrior and Hogan, I think I enjoyed Warrior more because of his mystique. Hogan was the branded hero who weilded an impressive public image.

alert : this review contains major spoilers . do not read on if you plan to see this film . judging from the previous two reviews , the story is based on the premise and dialogue in this movie . please feel free to recommend this book to other readers . any advice or suggestions were made by me and my wife about how to handle this film . they have done a number of good things and did a lot of good things but we just ca n't really get into them . no matter what type of film you choose , these movies will never go out of style .

i totally agree . this is ` ` pitch black underground ' ' and a well worn plot . the best scenes are all done with light , not shadows . what 's going to happen ? " " you want to write a good story ? " he laughed . " how do you even know that it is an interesting story ? it could be very exciting . " " okay , so there was this movie that just sort of came to life in the pit of your stomach and went into production . it did n't get any better than that , at least .

It would be quite easy to make this movie sound fun: a call girl gets shot in the forehead by a North Korean spy, but survives. The bullet that is embedded in her brain makes her long for knowledge, as well as sex. Unbeknownst to her, she walks away from the shooting with the cloned finger of George W. Bush in her purse, a key which can unlock the power to use nuclear armaments. Just call it a romp, and at least a few people will show up to the theater.

i expected this movie was originally supposed to show before the election . cbs ' s last shot at throwing a big party took off for the fourth time in less than two weeks , and they were running like it was some kind of horror movie . instead we got this crappy - looking film that looks like it could have been one of the many " horror " movies made in the past six months . it 's actually pretty boring if you know what i mean . there are lots of characters that want nothing more than to get their money back from the rich or poor .

As a big Jim Carey fan I took my seat in the cinema with optimism. After all, Fun With Dick And Jane appeared to have all the raw materials to make this another Carey success. After the opening five minutes of good humour it seemed that this film would provide but it went wrong as soon as the plot kicked in. The idea that a charming, charismatic, top V.I.P employee could suddenly find himself turning up to work in his nearest supermarket is just so hard to believe and then to get your head round the fact that this guy has also become a master criminal is virtually impossible.

As I said, sometimes low budget is good. You get to see a good movie without a lot of the extra BS that can hide an otherwise piece of crap. Well...this was that piece of crap. If anything, I thought it had humor, unfortunately the humor was unintentional. The only half-witted acting came from Bill Smith and his part was cut out (that's a joke). There was never a Bill Smith, nor was there anyone cast who could act. Even Gerald Okamura sucked, and he's been cast in nearly 40 movies.

the movie uses random events of historical significance as its backdrop and willy - nilly criss - crosses the lives and time - lines of its characters . this is one of those scenes that looks more like a science show than an actual movie . there is no real scientific reason to expect anything , but when it becomes apparent that these characters are in serious trouble , it makes for a very depressing film . i was surprised to learn from some of the other students at this school not to know about this film , especially since i have always wondered how someone would ' t know about it .

ok , this does n ' t compare to the explosive tempo of the first part ' s opening sequence ; nor to the other parts . it is as if the script were a video that was lost in the same time zone and never made its way into any context . i just like to say that most of what i read in this movie is wrong and it ' s hard to find any right words when you come across these three pieces of crap on the cover . this movie will be an early edition , so i am going to recommend it to all the young kids who wanted to see this film .

whoever likened this one to raiders of the lost ark certainly knew whereof he spoke . he might , as some say , not have made it out of this world , but in that case , how can you tell that he actually did get a better deal ? let 's just say he took more risks than i did - and i would appreciate it if there were no such risks in coming out of here on this particular trip . we all know the real reason people put up with this crap is so they can get away with it . my dad thinks this place is bad for me .

I'm a big fan of surrealist art, but this film by Bunuel (with some ideas from Dali) left me cold. Bunuel had a life-long grudge against the Catholic church and delighted in trying to offend Catholics in fairly silly ways. This is one of the silliest; almost like what you'd expect from a smart-aleck 18-year-old in film class. The last few minutes of the movie, which have nothing to do with anything else, are a final nose-thumbing at religion.If you read the "scholars" regarding this slow-paced, occasionally amusing film, it's all about how the church and society are guilty of sexual repression.

if all movies had to be destroyed and only one could be spared , death in venice would have to be the worst of the worst . there is no way to get rid of this movie or any other horror film , unless it is a particularly scary one that will give you nightmares . this movie has been so stupid that i thought it would be more fun to watch something from a very small town . at least i did not have to try to make myself sick . actually , i am still shocked by how quickly my life turned out .

largely forgettable tale in which mercenary kerman & employer agren travel into the jungle in search of agren ' s missing son . at this point , most of the story comes down to what happened : the two men kidnap a young girl and take her with them . she is so distraught by this episode ( as it usually does ) that she gets scared and jumps off the cliff . but no matter how many tricks she tries to pull , nobody can save her . when the kidnappers arrive , they find her dead body dumped on the beach . after all , not one other body was found .

forget jimmy stewart reliving his life and opt for this smart comedy of errors instead . i suppose only institutionalized people will be capable of making such films , but maybe they can make it really funny . i still find it hilarious to watch a movie without an audience , especially when the person in the background is screaming and screaming at all the right times . there are always so many other people that need to be put in their place , who could n't get a good idea of what kind of film was going on .

The first season was great - good mix of the job and the brother and friends at home. it was actually a pretty funny show.Now it shows up again and the brother and the two hot chicks are gone -- and the whole thing revolves around the airline company. Even the old man who runs the company has gone downhill - way too over the top, where before it was perfect.That and no more Sarah Mason - one of the best looking girls in Hollywood.This is what happens when you let some execs get their hands on a show.

i ' ve seen several stage and film adaptations of alice in wonderland and this one has to take the cake . as far as the script goes , there ' s no way it can be any better than this one , so you ' ll have to keep asking yourself how many other people could have been inspired by this movie or made the movies . let me just tell you that it doesn ' t really matter if you were inspired or not . i am very good at what i do and i will make sure you remember this .

Estevez, Martin Sheen and Kathy Bates are superb in this portrayal of a Vietnam vet home from the war but still haunted by it. Bates plays a clueless mother who just wants the family to be a "family." Sheen is terrific as the father who tries to understand what his son is going through but is too wrapped up in his principles to really empathize. The setting is Thanksgiving Day and the relatives are coming for dinner. Estevez, who plays the returning vet, wants no part of family tradition and insists on wearing his combat fatigues to dinner, explaining "This is what I wore last Thanksgiving."

i ' ve never understood this type of spoof movies . you get some serious / semi - serious movie that everyone knows about and you laugh it off . but then you get the idea that it comes down to this . what happens in the movie ? where do things really happen ? these people were not just making movies for themselves or acting out a script . they were doing it for me . how can you believe that there is no such thing as god , or at least something like that ? surely there ' s some truth to those claims .

Some people are born with mourning souls with their song sung singularly until they encounter another soul as tortured and/or as bitterly sweetly beautiful as their own and an unusual magic happens. YOU ARE ALONE is a brutally honest look into two tortured souls that intertwine for a moment of understanding and oneness only to be torn apart by the differences in the oneness between they're pain. Death is explored figuratively and literally. It is what happens when ones soul is dead or similarly too alive, too awake to reality. It is the life NOT which you imagined behind the eyes of passer-by's.

bought for £1 , project vampire is one of the worst movies i have ever seen . wooden acting , a parody of the classic horror genre ( even though we can use that word in most situations ) . i like to watch this crap because it shows some action , which is nice but does nothing to make the world a safer place to live . i do not understand why people who watch this stuff would go to such trouble to try and show their films to others , especially at the expense of their own safety .

i watch lackawanna blues every time it comes on . it brings back happy times for me . i grow up in a new town with people coming all over me to say what they think of my acting skills and trying to do the best job i can . but i know i could never be as good - looking as lackawanna . this is so ridiculous ! why does anyone care about my looks ? when i was younger i could n't even look in the mirror , let alone have sex with any girl who would pay me enough money to try and get into my pants .

i suggest if you have already seen the original american graffiti , do not see this movie . if you have , show it to the film editor and maybe you would know what he is looking for . or perhaps you will come to your senses and change your mind . either way it is an incredibly dull book . there are two scenes where both of them make love in a darkened room on a stage while a few other actors are still doing their best to keep up with things going on . first , the scene has been edited so many times that i can easily tell what happened here .

Now, lissen you guys, I LOVED THIS FILM, though not quite as much as FAREWELL TO THE KING, another beloved John Milius epic. It was fun, a lot more than if it were based on a Tennessee Williams drama. It's a great yarn, with a whiff of political correctness. I love this film for its beautiful photography, its humor and its attenuated criticism of the Bad Guys (Berbers) and the REAL Bad Guys, the spear- carriers for the acquisitive 'civilized' world, with their repeating rifles, artillery and large gunboats out there in the harbor.

nurse charlotte beale ( the lovely rosie holotik ) has arrived to dr . stephens ' clinic for the insane prepared her for what she is going to find . there are other interesting things about it . first of all , i must say that this is a very boring story . the people in it are completely out of whack . as for the characters - well , it does look like you could take an elephant by the ears if you would just sit back and enjoy yourself . secondly , the overall content is really dull and boring . they do n't seem to pay much attention to anything .

I loved this show. Such talent; and I am so disappointed that it is canceled, after only just beginning. I looked forward to this show all week long. And so sorry for the people who were hoping to be The One. I would have loved to see who would have won. It just began, and in my opinion,it should not have been canceled. I hope these young artist have been viewed by talent scouts, and have the opportunity to reach their goals. I voted, and sat waiting for it to come on; never knowing that it was canceled.

i did n ' t know what to expect from this hugely popular ( and hilarious ) swedish comedy & satire team . the only other time i watched it was a movie based on this one , and it made me laugh even though i knew no one could hear me over the sound of music . however , this film makes me laugh again . every time i look at it i think about how good it was when we first saw it in 1983 . the story that i remember is much worse than last year . it does not say much about the new millennium or anything else that has been told so far .

This new movie by Jeskid is awesome! Check it out and you'll be amazed. The story of Emily Waters, once a girl from a broken home, whose only means of escape from an abusive father was through her sketchbook. Until one night her drawings manifested into reality and saved her, and now using this power she fights against those who would do evil. Both live action film and hand drawn animation blend together to create a unique and original experience that will shake your soul and blow you away. The music is incredible as well, it really intesifies the emotional experience and draws you deep into the conflict.

this is the last film of krzysztof kieslowski - one of the greatest directors in the history of cinema . the film was originally set for two people , one for each person , as a way to make the film look like a movie . while there are some great comedies in the world , they are limited by the length and scope of the story . it is very easy for a man to have an affair with a beautiful woman , but i could n't see why she would even think such a ridiculous thing , when she has just told her whole family about him .

I mostly rented this movie to see Shannon Elizabeth. She played well in this movie, but the plot sucked. The movie wasn't really about anything just about trying to stay single after making a pact when one of Jerry O' Connell's friends gets married. The other friends put together this money and who's ever last to get married get's the money ($10,000) from all his friends. Anyway the movie just try to follow through by making no since and trying to make it more funny then making since. I'm glad I only paid .50 for this movie.

Wow. The storyline to this was just incredibly stupid. I realize that this movie was supposed to be of a comedic genre. But still, even nonsense is supposed to make at least some vague sort of sense.Water has become incredibly rare substance?Well, that's strange, considering that hydrogenated oxygen (or oxidized hydrogen) is one of the most plentiful substances there is in the universe. And pretty easy to make. Glomp together hydrogen and oxygen atoms, and voilà, water.Instead of water, the rarity of dilithium crystals or some such thingamajig should have been used as a plot device as something the pirates would go after.

as a genghis khan ` ` fan ' ' i was looking forward to this movie . after devouring conn igguldens epic , which i just watched on dvd , i decided that i would watch the movie for an hour or so while i was waiting for my wife to get home from the movie and have sex with her son . i hate movies like this one and i have no idea what to make of them , other than the fact that they keep me up half of the night telling them how lame they were in bed .

Much of the commentary on this board revolves around debating the validity of some comparison to R DOGS made on the DVD cover. Forget about all of that... This film-- er-- home movie is utterly horrendous. How can anyone with a shred of credibility claim this as being 10/10??? There is no plot, none. I couldn't believe that I spent money to rent this (more on that later) and that I had fooled myself into believing that this (based on box cover art and some sort of film fest award blurb) had potential.

I've tried watching it twice, though I haven't been able to make through either episode. For me, it's basically just not funny. I can tell where I'm suppose to laugh, but I can't. I've never seen the original, so I'm not comparing. I also love comedies, including off-the-wall comedies like Married...With Children and Family Guy, but this show just doesn't' do it for me. The jokes are lame and flat, and the acting is mostly annoying. The commercials made it look interesting, but it isn't.

i ' m a huge zack allan fan and was disappointed that he only got one scene in the movie . it was definitely not what i had been hoping for ! i was also disappointed that they didn ' t portray a lot of this film in any other genre . you would think people would have known better by now , because there is a whole series of similar movies made here . i know that the plot and characters were different in the first ten minutes of the movie . it was pretty boring , so i expected to feel a little disappointment at how things went , instead i felt nothing but joy .

The characterization in this movie is among the worst I've ever encountered. The dialogue is trite and cliché to the point of extreme distraction. None of the issues the characters face are developed at all--they're merely surface details intended to get a point across without having to actually come up with believable dialogue to support said point. Also, the depiction of the Chinese characters leaves a bit to be desired--I find it hard to believe that the Chinese father learns flawless English from a book(or so it is implied in one scene) so he can teach it to his daughter.

Ho Hum. Just another flick with Steven Seagal pretending to be some spiritual being, but bashing heads and killing like it was nothing. He, of course, justifies it in the end by donating the money to an orphanage., How sweet. Lay the world to waste and we'll ignore it if you take care of a little girl. Jeesh! This time, he is partnered with Ice Cool (Anthony 'Treach' Criss). Gotta have someone to lay all those cringe-inducing lines on, man, and there are plenty.

sometimes it ' s hard to be a pirate . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . but by golly miss jean peters has a lot of fun ! i ' ll admit it was a bit of an experience to watch and not really see what happened . . . the whole time you watched me , i just wanted to die . that ' s probably the reason why i made the film so bad . some people like to keep their heads down . well this is no different . . .

As a nice anecdote to one of the above comments: In was in Mumbai about two weeks before the release of this movie, I was approached -being white- to dub some of the lines of this movie in a recording studio.While I speak German as well, i was kindly asked to do all dubbing scenes in English, otherwise it would be too confusing for the Indian audience... So therefore, all Germans in this movie actually speak English! funny enough i did multiple characters, so if you would want to actually spoil some time by watching the movie again, listen carefully; all non-Indian characters are only done by 4 voices!

i own a copy of this film and have always loved it . i comment here , however , because i was just reading the second edition of this movie when someone told me how many people there were in the audience . i did not read that part of the book before i finished reading it - i just know it is an enormous tragedy to watch people suffering from depression . one of the big differences between these two movies is both comedies had been based on each other and the same plot . they are both great comedy stories , so i 'm surprised they have made it this long .

I'm not sure where to start with this. In short, it was a disappointing movie. Having taught the novella, I was aware that it would be a hard story to turn into a movie. The movie has a couple of interesting lines (mainly between Alfred and Aschenbach) but it doesn't represent the debate on art that basically shapes the novella. For one, I was expecting an older Aschenbach and a younger Tadzio. In the book, Tadzio is fourteen, but he is described as pure, ideal, innocent, whereas in the movie he reeks of sexuality and is a tease.

i have a hard time putting into words just how wonderful this was . once in a while you see it as a comedy or something of the sort , but no one else looks at it that way . the only person who actually takes the movie seriously is don ' t expect to be able to stand up for himself , so he simply chooses to stay on stage and act out the part of an actor - even if he is doing what he truly believes he should be doing . the problem is that don ' t quite follow the whole premise .

POSSIBLE MINOR SPOILERIt's not a terribly objective review but I just found this movie horribly depressing. Like a lot of Russell T. Davies'work, it asks more questions than it can answer. His best work (Bob & Rose, Doctor Who) revels in hope against the odds and perseverance even after apparent defeat. These uplifting themes seemed strangely absent here. I suppose the fact that I'm still thinking about it days after viewing is a testament to the quality of the program but the resolution was just too bleak for my tastes.

Got the chance to see this at a friend's house today, and was impressed with what it achieved on such a small budget. Not that this ever bothered me anyway, since I love low budget sci-fi like Dr Who, Blake's 7 and Dark Star. Hell, even Outland wasn't a big budget affair, so whilst money helps, it takes more than throwing cash at things to make them good.The story is straightforward at first, with a group of mercenaries paid to escort a prisoner through space. Their ship is attacked and they are forced to land on the nearest planet.

i was so looking forward to watching the documentary self - immolation of the mastermind behind boondock saints , one of the first film studios to come on tv and do this . the story started with a little girl who saw her father at the movie theatre in downtown detroit . he was there with his wife and kids when the police arrived . the child 's mother was trying to help him and he did n't seem to know what happened . however , it turned out that she had been crying . she said she had fallen down the stairs and broken her ankle .

Seriously engaging, intelligent and thought provoking drama at its very best. Mean, gripping, moody and captivating. Every home should have a copy! Don't take my word for it see it yourself. One Life Stand makes you consider your own lifestyle and how you treat your family and friends. Beautiful photography and impressive acting makes for one of the best cinema-graphic experiences of the year. John Kielty's debut is a delight and adds a real touch of truth and realism to this deep and gritty film. This is a film that cares and has an honesty that is unequalled in recent years.

my son adam ( 5 years old ) is a big scooby doo fan . he like this film a lot and has been on television all his life and when we came along he had to ' just ' watch it because the first time he ever seen it he thought he was dead . i liked this movie , but i really did n't expect to see it every day for the next ten years . what a joke ! it was so bad that i had to watch it twice before i decided to watch it again as a child .

The movie with its single set, minimal cast, and straightforward photography (except for a couple of brief special effects) reminds me of one of those old 60 minute playhouse dramas so popular during TV's early years. Nonetheless, the suspense hangs heavy over poor war widow Ida Lupino as she tries to deal with her semi-psychotic handyman Robert Ryan before one of his mood-swings kills her. And who better to play the troubled part than that great actor Ryan. He wasn't very versatile-- watching him essay comedy is almost painful.

When King Kong stripped her of her top in the 1976 remake, I was breathless. I don't know how many times I went back to see that movies hoping to see more. Jessica Lange was not a great actress then (She became one), but she was so hot! I went to see "Sweet Dreams" when it came out because, by that time, Ms. Lange had become a great actress. It looked like a wonderful story. And she's always exciting to see.I never walked out of a movie faster.

this is a very low budget film , set in one location in a valley shielded by the effects of high - tech equipment . there is no way to know for sure if we will see our friends again and if that happens we need to find somewhere else to get away from this place . you may not believe this , but i am really having trouble staying on camera at all . my first instinct is to make myself look like i am filming this , but i realize it would be bad for the show .

I have recently found this film on one of my husband's VHS tapes (the blank variety which he uses to record stuff from the telly). The film looks as if it was last shown in the eighties and I don't remember having seen it since. It has not (to my knowledge) been released on DVD or VHS although I shall browse around for a copy.The film tells the story of three young people: two girls, one on the edge of puberty and the other much younger, and a young boy who go to live with their mother's brother and his young, mute Irish wife.

i really wish hollywood would come up with some new ideas and quick . instead they go around and recreate the most horrific scenes in history . what do you know ? it was a terrible film , and i hate to be one of those people that thinks movies should be built on the ground rather than in the air . this was definitely not one of those movies i watched during my first few years of being in the movie world . for the past two years , i have looked forward to watching every damn movie ever made , and i did n't even feel the need to sit through any of the bad crap .

i ' m a fan of the horror movie , regardless of which hemisphere it comes from . i know what you mean . this movie is pretty boring . there are two characters in the film and they all seem to think that the only thing that will happen between them is for them to stop talking at the end of the movie so they can talk to each other . when the movie starts i feel as though i have to watch it again but i am too scared to try and force myself to do anything with it .

Love the TPB's but this was a lame episode. Didn't have the same feel that the series or the movie has. Looked like it was put together in a hurry. I didn't enjoy it at all. The so-called acting was awful. The cast appeared like they knew this was a money-grab of an episode to get to market quickly. I hope we don't have an easter special next because that will be it for me. The writing of this episode was definitely Mike Clattenburg's worst in the history of this show.

I wasn't expecting much from this tale of a kid whose term paper is stolen and turned into a movie script.. who then he travels to hollywood to get even.. but.. hey.. it's still a fun film. Frankie Muniz of "Malcom in the Middle" fame stars as the kid and is fairly good and Amanda Bynes as his friend is also very good. Yea the film does work as an advertisement for Universal Studios theme park and is really kinda a silly kids film.. but i enjoyed it anyways.

As much as 'The Beginning' showed that we're still going to get "classic" x-files, Drive showed that the X-Files was going to explore new territory. They start by giving us a unique teaser to Drive, with the news camera footage. It was an interesting transition from the the TV to the real events. I would've liked it even better if they had kept that news footage camera for the entire teaser and not cut to the inside of the car. Upon viewing this episode live back in 1998 I was thinking, "Am I on the right channel?"

So me and my friend are carousing our local movie rental store and are looking for something to pick up to go along with Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind, so why not pick up the third installment in the Scarecrow series!?! Keep in mind that this is not just Scarecrow Three; this is, Scarecrow: Gone Wild. Now both of us had seen to the first two Scarecrows so we felt obligated to finish the job. Let's start with the cover of the DVD first. First we notice a picture of Ken Shamrock ("The World's Most Dangerous Man") on the cover.

this is one of the most horrible ' scary ' movies i ' ve seen for awhile . i had to wonder what was so scary about this , as well as whether it meant anything at all . how many people have come out of their homes to watch this movie and still get some pleasure out of watching it ? this film is even worse than the other ' horror ' books i ' m reading . the first thing you ' ll notice about this movie is that it has no plot or any form of dialogue .

Stay FAR AWAY from this film. The fact that you're reading reviews tells me you may have already been tainted by the awfulness it carrys. This is a truely horrid movie... so let's get down to the problems. Writing and Direction: It wouldnt surprise me if these were handled by a group of overactive gradeschoolers that watched 'scream' and 'I know what you did last summer' a few too many times. GIANT GAPING plot holes abound; while I can't congratulate them for this movie, its nice knowing they're finally potty trained.

i am astounded that so many people find this film even close to good . let me make it clear , i do not know a thing about the book - except for the fact that all the characters were acting badly . and if you ask me there were some bad actors in it . i saw one very good actor die before my eyes ; but he was really an innocent kid from a village who could not have ever lived long enough to come across this movie with its tragic ending . here is another of my favorite reviews : ' the first two weeks in the desert are hard to come by ' .

Oh my God... where to begin? "Chupacabra Terror" is one of the worst B-Horror movies ever made. This crap makes "Demon Slayer" look like "The Exorcist". Special note: A Horror B-movie needs to have at least one sex scene. Don't expect even a hot girl in this one. With that inexcusable mistake, I should begin with the complete bash.First of all, if you're going to make a Horror monster movie, you should spend big part of the budget in creating a "cool" monster outfit.

some sort of accolades must be given to ` hellraiser : bloodline ' . it ' s actually out full - mooned full - blown , and you can ' t believe how bad this movie was . i have to say though , the story is n't very bad . i just wish that i had been a better actor . however , if you want to keep reading , look at the main character , george w. bush . do you think the book would be worth watching ? well , let me tell you , it is nothing short of a masterpiece . i am really trying to stay awake .

there was no need for this movie , plain and simple . the original , although hated by some , is not a good film , at least not as it has to be in my opinion . it is not something i thought that i would enjoy doing . it is just another one of my ' favorite ' movies . it has been a long year , and i have yet to hear of anything more exciting or interesting than this movie . when the time comes to make the movie , i am prepared . if you do not know what happened , do not read this .

i love his martial arts style , it is quick , close up and oh so fast , but it is totally unsatisfying . in fact , i was afraid that this game was boring as well . if anyone should be interested in the action , they should try to put a name to the scene of the murder . no one really wants to hear about the murder at all . it seems like the only way to get revenge is to make sure that people pay for their crime or die for it . the police do n't even give a damn what the killer does .

this film is much the same as cannibal holocaust . if it were n ' t for the needless animal killing in the movie i 'm sure we would n't ever have had to come up with all that . at first i thought it was going to be some sort of a comedy or something similar , but there were lots of laughs . it just seemed to lead to an ugly ending . after watching about 20 minutes of it , one of the main characters finally loses his wits and begins to try to kill them . then he gets eaten alive by a large bear .

This Is one of those classic American made for TV movies that are just made for watching on a rainy afternoon. Although the script is highly implausible it never takes itself too seriously and neither do the cast which leads to a great tongue in cheek murder mystery / horror film best enjoyed with a bid bag of popcorn or box of chocolates. A big bonus of this film is the fantastic location filming and despite the strange goings on and even stranger residents round Lake Tommahawk I for one would not mind living there!All in all a great film to watch over and over again.

having endured this film last night , i turned off the dvd player with a sense of deserving a medal for being honest . after all , i really have to do this more often , or else it 'll become an issue in my career . so far i had seen enough horror flicks and watched too many westerns to understand how they were used . i am not very good at judging people ' actions by how they behave . as i have said previously , most films are predictable and predictable ; that is , there is never any action .

8/2008. When I originally wrote my comments, shortly after first seeing this film, I took a critical view, feeling that Lemmon and Matthau had basically "phoned-in" their performances, which paired them in a manner they'd done several times previously.But upon seeing it again, it seemed different, especially in view that neither of the two main mega-stars lived a great deal longer after its release.With the exception of Spiner, all of the eight principals are performers with considerable experience, and likewise unavoidably a lot "longer in tooth" than we've seen in many of their other film and t.v.

I heard that after the first Oceans movie, the sequels begin to go downhill. I believe that this is not the case(at least not for this film). This movie is even better than the first film! The original crew returns three years after they successfully robbed Terry Benedict's casinos. Now, Benedict is visiting each one of them personally telling them to get the money back within two weeks. To do that, they must do a couple heists in Europe to get the money.The acting is very good. The all-star cast exceeded expectations.

It's the 1980's and the teenagers are ready to party it up in a scary old house that is rumored to be haunted by the ghost of Murder McGee. After mistakenly conjuring the dead through an unfinished conversation on an Ouija board, the kids are forced to fight to the death battling a vengeful ghost who possesses and kills all of their friends one by one. Sound familiar? It's supposed to. It's clearly marketed to pay homage to the classic 80's slashers with the tagline: "Excessive violence. Gratuitous nudity. Zero budget."

Sony Pictures Classics, I'm looking at you! Sony's got the rights to Harry records -- you need to distribute the film and you'll get radically increased sales of his back catalog! Anyhow, this is a great study of a fascinating musician, woefully underknown, full of great stories, greater music, and it could have been 3 hours longer and I'd have loved it even more. Saw it at the American Cinemateque Mods & Rockers Festival at the Aero Theatre in Santa Monica, where it played to a packed house. They were turning people away at the door!

i first saw this film in 1980 and it touched a cord which reminded me of a more innocent time on the street . not to mention it made me want to get out and have some fun , if only to make myself feel better ! i felt like a total moron when i watched the movie because it showed such terrible characters , so bad that it could never be re - made or re - acted . i am just trying to figure out how i got mixed up with people who are actually good actors and who are really good at their jobs , even while doing things that are illegal .

Yep, it's me again! Mr 'I sit through crap so you don't have to'.What do you think this is about? Could it possibly be about a woman who call a sex line and arrange to meet bachelors in a secluded area? Then her cross-dressing boyfriend comes along and slits their throat with razor, before they make off together with his cash? Wow, what a guess! And if I tell you that the cop who is put on the case is forced to team up with a sexy assistant DA to nail these suckers, what conclusion will you come to?

I feel really bad for reviewing this movie because I wish that I had only watched it as a concept production. The Covenant looked like it could have been a really original piece, but sadly they lose the great idea in the translation to the screen.The story follows four (five) teens that are the descendants of the families that started the town of Ipswitch a survivors of the Salem witch trials. They also happen to be a part of the secret sect called "The Covenant". Their power must be used sparingly as it drains their life-force in small amounts and is highly addictive.

Very odd, this seems like a very average movie to me, if not slightly less. It is brilliantly shot but, together with the performance of R. Lee Ermey, that's about the only redeeming aspect I found in the movie which consists of two separate parts. The first part covers the basic marine-training which, watching it in 2007, comes off like something I've see a zillion times before in dozens of other movies and series and it's not particularly gripping. After 30 minutes I got the idea and wished they could just get on with it.

Leonard can write lyrics, but he sure can't sing. Nor has he had an original idea in his life, just a floater. From the looks of this nasty little puff piece (note that his publishers, McClelland and Stewart were involved in the production), he didn't know how to live, either. The woman he loves is only mentioned in passing and no woman is allowed to speak in this nonsensical advertisement. While Irving Layton was given a credit, the other poet interviewed, Earle Birney, was to remain nameless.

this is one of those movies that i can watch again and again and not get tired of it . but this movie was different . you see a kid being dragged off to a circus , the next thing you know the kids are walking in on an actor who has gone through his entire life doing stupid stuff . some things were so bad , i ca n't even describe them . the story was just too disgusting . my mother made the movie when she was eight years old . it was pretty awful . there were lots of funny comedies and horrible characters - which is how i found myself watching this film .

nothing more than a soccer knock - off of the mighty ducks , this film proved to be annoying in most aspects . even when it was made i never watched it . instead i just read the movie while eating lunch . my favorite thing is watching a video with some of my friends and we get to watch it together every night . for example , after watching this movie i realized that it was probably the most interesting movie i have ever seen or heard of . there were not a lot of scenes in the movie , but the plot was very good .

this is definitely one of the ultimate cult classics , and is a must see for all psychotronic fans . i had an awesome song written by my wife . i am not ashamed to admit i have been a little shocked at the style and timing of the musical . it was the best book i ever read ! but i just ca n't help but feel that i have lost my way in the whole thing . i am very surprised to see that the author actually wrote this . it is such an awful film . i do n't know why the publisher would want me to get involved in this kind of nonsense .

TDY is probably the single worst piece of trash to ever hit the straight to video selection. They take a scene from The Order starring Jean Claude Van Damme and this angers me because Van Damme is a personally favourite for B movie comedy. Segal has done some fine work in the past but he has dropped very low in my books and he will probably never pull out another undersiege or marked for death unless he sits down and has a very good brain storming session with himself. It also annoys me how he didn't do many of his own stunts like he has done in previous films.

Some critics have compared Chop Shop with the theatrical releases of City of God and Pixote. I've seen both of those as well as Chop Shop and like in many instances, I don't feel the comparison is warranted. City of God and Pixote surely had a much higher budget. Chop Shop is a low budget independent film about survival and hope, disappointment, and continuing with life. One of the scenes is allegedly filmed during the US Open and either the filmmakers had incredible connections or the scene was filmed at another time and the US open footage was added.

a straight - forward x file that shows that action is always the equal of intelligence . rob bowman ' s direction is more in line with your work than anything else he has seen in this movie . it seems as though he was never expecting to write this book , but even after his second draft i can see why . these are not exactly what i would have described as a good movie , and i feel that i may have been prejudiced against some characters in this one . however , they were all very good actors , especially on my first night on the job .

I saw this movie on my flight from Philly to Denver. The screen was three rows in front of me and about 12" x 10". So I really wasn't going to watch it. But I like Malcolm in the Middle, so I thought I'd watch just a few minutes. Next thing I know I'm sucked in, having a great time, and was pleased as how good it was and how fast it seemed to make the time go by. I agree with that the acting is very good for this level of entertainment.

I have watched THE ROOT OF ALL EVIL with the avowed object of refuting this so called scientific atheist . I don't know where to start as he is such a rich source of stupidity.He is obviously not a statistician else the odds of 2/1 of him burning for all eternity would have pushed him towards belief in GodHe regards science as religion and expects us to believe him as we do God. One has only to look at the language used in his postulations. Regarding Faith. This commodity is used extensively in everyday behaviour. Just think about it.

first off, i'm amazed to see that this film has got a rating of 7 on this site. at first i thought it might be industry people logging in to IMDb and jacking up the rating. but after looking on rotten tomatoes and seeing that this film has something like a 76% approval rating, it seems that maybe folks have just been duped again into mistaking pretentious crap for profundity. i mean, this film is simply awful. the acting is simply terrible, but the rest of the film is worse. at least the acting provides some (unintentional) laughs.
