" just an example for the other characters : ' do n't get me wrong ; i love everything i have read , especially the parts where the plot thickens .

with david arquette starring you would immediately think this to be a stupid movie . well , it is a little funny actually , but i really thought it was great until i saw the title . it is based on the most terrible film i ever read in my entire life . the plot does not seem to have even a single ounce of logic about how we should go about this movie . there has to be a more believable outcome if we can solve this problem . and let 's tell you something , i do not feel like solving this problem , at least not right now .

i ' ve never written a comment on imdb before , but this movie was so bad it left me little to talk about . the plot is awful , like a nightmare and the characters are just plain boring . i can remember sitting at home with my kids watching tv for two hours straight ( or as much as they could watch it ) while listening to the noise from the tv . every once in a while i would look outside into the darkness of the woods and find that there were no deer to be seen . instead , i saw a large animal stalking through the woods toward me .

to say that this is a good show is not to say anything at all . after all , this is the only time we are in real life . the first thing i would like to add to it is that if you look closely , you could see some of the stuff that is supposed to exist . so , just stay back . i am a great fan of comedy shows , but this is ridiculous . this is too much . how can i watch this crap without getting disgusted ? i really have no idea how to live with any of this !

this can hardly be called a good movie , actually it ' s not even close . but i have to agree that the actors are pretty good . as long as their acting is very good , in the end it really doesn ' t matter because none of them will ever give you a second look again . at least one person on earth gets to make a movie that makes money . there is just no such thing as " life is never easy " or " for sale ! " in this case , if you think about your own life you will see that most everyone else ' s is better than that .

My expectations were high after seeing the trailer. They were even higher when i saw the movie had the same director as independance day and godzilla. The special effects in independence day were much better then in this movie. The whole movie I was waiting for the spiders to show up. The rest of the storyline was really boring. And when the spiders came, they had a very amateuristic look, like the special effects were from a movie made in the 60's. I didn't watch the whole movie. When it was played for about one hour I switched off my DVD-player.

Why did they have to make such a dreadful adaptation? The whole "Complete Jane Austin" series as a part of Masterpiece Classics looks like a huge disappointment. Characters are totally miscast and there's no chemistry on the screen. The whole thing feels rather rushed. The 1999 movie release based on the same novel seems like a masterpiece compared to this. I really want to forget it. I'm really happy though that "Pride and Prejudice" won't be re-made as part of this project and we will see the iconic and magnificent Colin Firth and Jennifer Elle as protagonists.

it ' s nice to see a romantic comedy that does not have the prissy man lead , this has solid premise . i was n't expecting an open mind about this film , and for a while i simply wondered if it would make any difference . after all , it didn ' t matter how good it really was , because in the end everything is predictable . some people believe they can do anything on television , but when they start watching tv it turns out to be a joke . the most entertaining thing you find in there is the antics of the bad actors .

how many movies are there that you can think of when you see a movie like this ? i ca n't wait to see them . let me know if they are on the top shelf of any cinema . one of my favorite films is bad , so please be careful what you ask for ! it seems to me that every movie has a theme : a bad ending . that does not even make sense to me . i do not understand the story . i mean , why would we want something like this in the first place ? this movie was supposed to be about an old girlfriend .

I had never heard of this film and only got it because I am a Martin Sheen fan. Now I am stunned as to why it did not receive the praise and recognition that it truly deserves. The four characters all make you feel for them, the father trying to assert his authority, the mother still clinging to traditional family values and both trying to keep up appearances despite the total fragmentation of their family, the daughter wanting her own life and the son haunted by his experiences in Vietnam. One felt that this was a scenario that must have been played out in thousands of 'ordinary' families after Vietnam.

although it was dark , depressing , and at times hard to watch , you are alone held my attention for a good while . that ' s when i saw something interesting : two large people on the ground with their backs against the side of an suv . the first one was bleeding badly from a hole in his head , the second was still alive and was trying to move . after about thirty seconds of watching , i decided not to bother . if i had n't been forced to watch this , i might have stayed home and spent the whole day looking for them .

Directed by Diane Keaton and adapted from a book by Franz Lidz. A young mother Selma Lidz(Andie MacDowell)is battling a very serious illness and her self proclaimed inventor husband Sid(John Tururro)is a little lacking in the emotions department. Unhappy with the new home situation, their sensitive son Steven(Nathan Watt)decides he wants to stay with his two eccentric uncles Danny(Michael Richards)and Melvin(Lou Cutell)until his mom is well. Steven seems to be happier and even takes interest in his strange uncle's living habits; he even decides he wants to change his name to Franz.

This movie tries its darndest to capture that classic bad canadian movie feel:"quirky" and obnoxious characters (a few); "quirky" town with "quirky" folk; a "quirky" coffee shop or restaurant (coffee shop here); lots of shots of canadian stuff for postcards (ocean stuff here); lots of mention of "gotta get out of this town"; downright booooring.And it succeeds on all counts.Something to note, though. I couldn't figure out whether this movie was just trying to be post-Northern Exposure "quirky" comedy or something surreal like a drug-induced or psychotic hallucination.

I have read and enjoyed many of James Lee Burke's Robicheaux mysteries. When I read 'In The Electric Mist With The Confederate Dead' was being filmed and Tommy Lee Jones was playing the lead, I was thrilled. After watching it last night, I ending up turning it off with about twenty minutes left, not wanting to see any more people shot or beaten up. Don't get me wrong, I don't mind blood and gore-I love 'The Untouchables' and 'The Godfather Trilogy'. Perhaps it was just that I had previously seen 'Birth' and 'What Just Happened' before watching this.

I think "category 6: day of destruction" was very unrealistic. The digital effects where like a children's cartoon. The actors didn't act realistically, for example, when the girl was shot she acted like she got tomato sauce splatted on her. The movie was boring but I watched it because it was on. The only interesting character was Tornado Tommy, he was funny!Please keep the special effects real.I liked the comment: "What did we do to p.i.s.s-off Mother Nature? "I don't know what else to write to fill up the 10 lines.

i ca n ' t quite explain why i find this so alluring and ` ` the leopard ' ' not ; it may be a good thing if there is some sort of connection between the name of the book , which contains all of its characters , and the title . after all , i have seen it before on television in my youth , and most often in movies , but this time i could n't believe it . this movie , with the cover image of an old man with grey hair ( perhaps the age of his clothing ) , makes him look as though he has gone to hell .

Without a shadow of a doubt this is and probably will always be the worst film i have ever had the missfortune to see my whole life. Take 5 wooden actors who got thrown out of acting school because they were so wooden someone sat on them thinking they were a bench.Then add a cheap camcorder. You know the old VHS types that cost £20 on ebay. Add a terrible story line with no effects and yes you have this film. What a shocker it was. They couldn't even save it by having a fit girl in it.

The story of Sweeney Todd evokes memories of the work of classic writers like Charles Dickens, and more contemporary writers like Edward Gory. As a musical, it naturally becomes more like the musical Les Miserables. Both deal with the grim effects of poverty in the Industrial Revolution, and the breakdown of organized society. But this musical is different from Les Mis in one very important aspect: Stephen Sondheim, the songwriter who can adapt to any style. To be sure, he's had his successes and failures, but one thing about his shows you can always count on: They will be something unique.

i think my summary says it all . this mtv - ish answer to the classic candid camera tv show features a man who has been shot in the face during a shooting . that is , if you want to make fun of him for wearing such a bad face . i am not saying this guy is not hot and attractive , but the way he dresses makes me feel like i should n't judge him too harshly on what he is wearing . at least i can say i have no problem liking him despite his looks . i find myself wondering what made him choose to wear such a terrible picture .

return to me is a movie you will want to own . it is a story of inspiration and family life . there was an old guy in the car who loved to drive his wife around in her car . they would stop at this fast food restaurant and just eat like nothing ever happened . the movie is about a man who lived through the same horrible experience as his wife , who had to find a way to save him from a terrible death that killed his wife . she died on their wedding night after having been cheated on by his lover .

At first I didn't think that the performance by Lauren Ambrose was anything but flaky, but as her character developed the portrayal made more sense. Amy Madigan seemed too terse for her role and didn't really tie her daughter's characters together, even though it was apparent that her character was disengaged with the character played by Lauren Ambrose.Christopher Lloyd is a hit as usual and carried off his role to encourage the story line. His character development left the audience wondering why he was chastised by the younger characters and could have been accomplished more directly with The overwhelming glue to this somewhat vague story line was play by Taylor Roberts.

go get your camcorder , your little brother , and the disturbing neighbor next door who throws boiling water on you . i 'll just watch a movie , see what happens , and make a joke later . i have no sense of humor . i was told that it was an alien movie with bad graphics but it seemed more believable than a movie at the time . i am sure this story is only made to look like a movie , but i do n't think it is . i never had any doubts about the authenticity of this story , not anymore .

Wrestlemania 6, is an entertaining Wrestlemania, if not an entirely successful one. The Ultimate Challenge, is of course worth the price of admission alone, but once again as with a lot of the early Mania's, there's too much filler in between. The crowd pops for almost everything, and as always, giving us the reliable announcing team of Gorilla&The Body. Having a Face vs Face match as the main event for a Wrestlemania, was absolutely unheard of at this time, it only made things that much more tense. Matches.

i saw this in a preview screening and have to say that this documentary style movie is the biggest load i have ever watched . i have always wondered how these films would have been produced if one of the people from my planet had not chosen the film , but i guess it has gone beyond that question when you are forced to witness the whole thing , even if it does cause some damage to the actual scene . unfortunately for me , this film was quite interesting and i just ca n't wait for the sequel to play out on the screen . i hope you feel better tomorrow .

Dolemite may not have been the first black exploitation flick to come along but it certainly is one of the best. It is a pivotal film in the Black Exploitation genre as where it caused a dramatic shift between the films that came before it in contrast to the films that came after it. It wasn't necessarily a poignant or moving film about black culture and it's fight to overcome issues like racism or anything as important as that, but it was the story of one bad-assed dude fighting "whitey" with his army of hot kung-fu mama's.

This is a wonderful family sitcom. Rowan Atkinson has appeared in to other excellent sitcoms, The Thin Blue Line (Better than this) and Blackadder (Not better than this).Mr Bean is a no talking, human disaster. He goes to places and gets himself in absolute mayhem, the mayhem includes: Climbing up to the top diving board and is too frightened to jump off, taking about 20 minutes, until some kids eventually throw him off, ending up inside a washing machine and driving his car while sat on a roof.

i loved so much last bellocchio ' s movie , the masterpiece ` ` l ' ora di religione ' ' . it had a long and colorful history of some of the old movies but was just too dumb to be good . this movie was very well written about an area that appeared to be made up of ancient ruins . its original purpose was to take a look at places like egypt or africa . however , i know that this film has lots of references to the mayan calendar . what is even worse is the fact that many of the characters appear to have come from the same country as their descendants .

The Mod Squad isn't a movie, it's a void. That's the most fascinating thing about it and the thing that kept me watching  I'd never seen a film that offered absolutely nothing before. It's a film without any reason to exist whatsoever, seemingly consciously designed to appeal to no-one as if made purely as a contractual obligation to someone the studio really dislike. There is no plot, there is no characterisation, there are no set piece action scenes, there aren't even any scenes as such, just a progression of increasingly empty shots projected at 24 frames per second.

it's a real big bummer that people easily are able too make movies because of cheap digital video cams nowadays. usually I would appreciate this possibility but if you see movies like this it's just a big shame. and it's also big shame if people like h.p. lovecraft get abused by the likes of this. I rented this "movie" cuz of the drop "h.p. lovecraft" on it. and I'm a big fan of many of his adaptions, mainly those done by brian yuzna & stuart gordon. this movie has nothing to deliver!

i believe i share the same psychological outlook on the world with kieslowski . he is polish , i am danish , and we all find it funny that in a language that is so much alike , people ca n't make sense of the way it is made up . kieslowski has been in the air for over 20 years and he has never had to be anything other than english . you might have thought he was one of those movie - star types . there is not one negative thing about his life at this point , and i must say that i am surprised that they chose to give him such an important role .

I have always loved the ironic symbolism and brilliant cinematography of Coppola's masterpiece. I was lucky enough to meet Martin Sheen outside the Santa Monica Civic Auditorium one night in 1981, as he waited for Charlie and Emilio to leave a concert. He was very humble about the praise I shared with him for this work of art, especially his portrayal of the young Captain. This is, without a doubt, a must see, a complete 10 and an important part of American Film History. "Charlie Don't Surf".

this is one awful movie ! ! some people told me that it was not that bad actually but i am disappointed in myself for thinking differently . i mean , really what the hell is the point of this movie if you are going to watch it ? no one can do anything else than watch a horrible movie like this ! ! ! there is no real meaning to this movie unless you happen to see it at all , which most people do n't . so it just kind of blows your mind after seeing it on television .

Even a bad Julie Andrews Musical is worth watching and this isn't bad! In fact it's quite entertaining. Actually it's a fascinating study on trying to manipulate a star's personae.To break Julie's "goody two shoes mold" she plays a German Spy/English Musical Hall Actress. She subsequently went on to take her top off in the movie S.O.B. and play a drag queen in Victor Victoria and other not so goody girls usually under hubby Blake Edward's direction.The movie is admittedly problematic It is hard to feel for her character because she's a German Spy.

A recent re-issue of the French crime film (original title 'Du Rififi Chez les Hommes'), with its famous 20-minute silent jewel heist sequence, now comes in the US in a gorgeous new print from The Criterion Collection with improved subtitles and some extras. Jules Dassin was an American (born Julius Dassin in Middletown Connecticut) who was forced to make films in Europe because he was Blacklisted. Rififi was well publicized in the US and did well in art houses. Later Dassin became a lot more famous in the US for 'Never on Sunday' (1960) starring his wife, the Greek actress and political activist Melina Mercouri.

A small-town schoolteacher (Geena Davis) slowly begins to realize that she has suffered amnesia and really use to be a secret government assassin! Soon, there are men after her and a small-time private detective (Samuel L. Jackson).This was action-packed, with some great special effects and really funny one-liners (especially from Jackson). Although the action may get a little silly at times, who cares? After all, aren't movies meant to be a good time?Craig Bierko is fun as a ruthless villain. The movie itself was an all-around good time.

even the trailer for this movie makes me cry , like the first time i saw this movie . not that there is anything wrong with this movie ! ! ! it was a horrible movie , and i would rather watch the movies alone than watch it with people i actually like . the plot is so bad you might have to pay to watch it at all . anyway , i think the best part about this movie is what the characters are doing . they are getting along just fine and acting great . in fact , it seems they could be playing a double act as they try to make each other uncomfortable .

I went to see this film because it was recommended to my wife and she wanted to go.We were both trying to look at our watches well before the film ended, in order to see how much more we had to endure. Two hours and six minutes long, it is. It's divided roughly equally between battle scenes (about a dozen of them, all more or less interchangeable), and plot development.One would have thought that with the subject being the son of a minor tribal chief who conquers half the world, plotting would have been relatively easy.

A vg Brit rom-com, one to watch if you can get your hands on a copy. Quirky and often surprising, this is not the best of Brady's films (Kiss Kiss Bang Bang is by far the funniest), though it does have a unique charm. Well written the story veers off into a few dead ends but mostly surfaces with a new plot high. You know from the start how it's going to end, but when it comes it is honest and very open ended, a realistic and credible ending, the end seemed like a beginning, enjoyable and left me wanting more.

this was the stupidest movie i have ever seen in my life . it is a complete waste of money . i mean , we were looking for an actress , not a real actress . what do people like to do in a movie like this when they really want to be acting ? so far , this film has been one of the most original and unconvincing movies i have ever seen . i would n't mind doing something like this again myself . but i thought that if i put on a big enough show , everyone would watch it .

DON'T LOOK IN THE BASEMENT This little forgotten gem holds a special place in my heart and on the Video Nasties List. The flute-sitar-rattle box soundtrack is classic. The main character, although way hotter than most low budget starlets, is a pretty standard low budget lead. The Doctor Masters character is well written and well acted. Some of the lesser characters are kinda stupid but add to the nostalgia of the movie. It's Campy. I ain't trying to lie. The character that makes this great is a Faulknarian Man-Child named Sam, one of the patients in this sanitarium-gone-mad-flick.

this film was utterly horrible . stupid premise , and horrible acting by all . whoever wrote this trash should have told you how awful it would look to the public . not one bit of any of your other friends is even remotely funny ! but that does n't make any difference . it just makes no difference . i wish everyone would come up with something good about this movie . i know what you are looking at . the actors are pathetic . there are some great things about them , though . first off , they get a real chance to tell us what they thought they were going to say .

it is not uncommon for a celebrity to be faced with the proverbial ` ` wake - up call ' ' . and , i 'll tell you , this is a good one ! do you remember the last song ? in the beginning , i was really hoping to get a word in before the show starts . i think i was disappointed when it just ended . i thought it would go better if it was an episode or a story . but , that 's not the way it ends . as i said , every time someone tells a story , the audience reacts to it like they have seen it somewhere before .

Aside from the fact that this movie was filmed mostly in Rockport MA, which is a beautiful town where my mother once rented a small storefront and I spent many a pleasant summer as a child, it is fun and cute little film. I must admit that I had no desire to actually see this movie even though I have a weakspot for romantic comedies (I don't know why). The trailers I saw were not appealing, the cast did not look that interesting and I had no idea what the plot would be about.

tdy is probably the single worst piece of trash to ever hit the straight to video selection . they take it way too seriously . i was really disappointed at first when i saw that part of the film . i did not understand a lot of it , especially in this movie because it was so cheap and dirty looking . but the fact that i bought this dvd does not prevent my mind from drifting toward the one place that i thought i wanted to be when i went to see it . i had hoped to make it to san francisco , but i knew that was not possible .

spoof films have come so far since mel brooks in ' the producers ' ( 1968 ) said ` ` do n ' t you think that is a good movie for it to be ? For the first time in reviewing films, I found myself immediately uninterested in this story. I don't know if it was the way that it was filmed or the story behind the characters, but it felt bland, overused, and completely unoriginal. Within the first thirty minutes, I found myself rather apathetic with all the characters and the story. I felt as if I had seen this structure before, and Tart was providing nothing new to surprise me. After thinking that it may just be my mood, I stopped the film and chose to start it fresh in the morning, but the same feeling persisted.

i am a big follower of indian movies especially malayalam and tamil . shame on india for not sending this movie as a movie , it makes no sense whatsoever . i could use a better film to explain my own views on this movie and i found myself in such a funk that i barely made the effort to watch it when it was finished . now if you want to get something really good right now , do n't hesitate to make up your own mind to do it . but i know that is unrealistic . let me put it like this .

I don't leave IMDb comments about films but this.... this film was bad. very bad. I fast forwarded through most of it, stopping where I hoped the acting had improved since the last scene, only to continue with the fast forwards. Formula plot -- once the obvious murderers were discounted, there was only the one left. And that was in the first five minutes. Scene by scene it felt as though I'd already read the script before because there were no surprises, no mystery. The Tori character... bad bad acting.

"Japan takes the best from around the world and makes it their own", while that may be true, it applies to all except for one thing, that being,.....Major league baseball....but not to worry, "Mr Baseball" is there to try and change all that. But just who will change whom, is the part of the movie that really makes it rock! Tom Selleck is one of my favorite actors and really shines-on in his comedic roles. The storyline may be true to life, however the subplot is dead-on.

Ok, everybody agreed on what was the best season. The first. And killing off Boone was a bad desicion. Also killing off others was bad. Blame the directors and writers for it. Bad boys. BUT. I still think this is the best scifi series ever! Sorry guys I can't help it! I see that the quality of the series was decreasing after the first season. Still it's easy to accept Liam as the new main character, if you are over Boone. He is really... mysterious.

Wayne Wang's direction may be the ingredient which made this film much more impressive to me than "Slums of Beverly Hills", which covers remarkably similar ground. The interplay between Susan Sarandon and Natalie Portman is riveting. Real chemistry there. This film succeeded in bringing me inside the dysfunctional life of these two women without dragging me down into depressed frustration. Susan Sarandon's character hammers at all the nerves which a narcissistic parent is capable of touching in an insecure adolescent. She amazingly manages to do this without coming across as floridly insane or intentionally sadistic.

I won't go into detail about why this movie deserves an awful rating, plenty of other people have already done that. Suffice it to say that out of the over 400 movies that I've owned on DVD, this is the ONLY one that I got rid of- it was so worthless that I couldn't see ever wanting to watch ANY of it again.However, I do have a comment on the ridiculously high average rating of 2.9 (as of 3-15-06). While skimming through the 4 pages of reviews I saw no rating higher than 3 stars.

Something of a disappointment. Lee J. Cobb is the anti-union head of Roxton Garments in New York. His partner in the business is killed when an elevator is unleashed and plunges twenty-seven floors to the bottom of the shaft, in the scariest scene in the film.Cobb doesn't know it, or doesn't let himself realize it, but the man behind the killing is Richard Boone, who protects the business from union organizers.Then Cobb's son, Kerwin Mathews, returns from Europe determined to learn the business and join his father in running a clean shop. He's shocked -- shocked!

One of the best sitcoms to run on Indian television along with Dekh bhai dekh and Idhar udhar. Great acting, well paced and an extremely amusing script made this a truly memorable series. The fun filled opening montage (sung by none other than the inimitable Kishore Kumar)gave a very accurate picture of what one could expect. I used to borrow it from my local video library years after Doordarshan had stopped airing it. I wish Indian television would revert back to serials such as these rather than the asinine saas-bahu soaps and reality television which is all its good for these days.

It has taken several viewings for me to fully appreciate this film. Initially, I was struck by the stylized sets, but found the rest slow going and dull. I thought that such a sensational subject needed the Ken Russell treatment to take it way over the top. I now find the enforced restraint (placed on the production by Mishima's widow) to be an asset. Some of the more lurid aspects of Mishima's life are reiterated and dramatized by corresponding themes from his novels. I think it helps to be familiar with the novels - that's what finally made the difference for me.

This great film never showed up in my town, so actually I didn't have any opportunity to watch it until the late 80'es when I caught it on German television. I was expecting something of a disaster, and found instead a well-acted grand western with superb location work. The tiny tube couldn't really damage it and there's almost not a dull moment in this 4-hour film, so I hope to see it once again on the big screen. What a spectacle that would be! Don't miss it, if you ever have the chance.

two years after leaving the small town of grover ' s bend due to encountering the krites , brad brown returns in his pickup truck at a high school reunion . he is so engrossed that he almost does not notice we have arrived until we stop in front of his house . i am surprised to see that it is empty , but relieved nonetheless . once we are on the porch , brad leans forward into his open door and says , " hey , man , what do you think you are doing ? there ai nt nobody out there for miles .

this movie , i would like to say , was completely great . i can see how many people would give a million dollars to see this movie and even if they had seen it they would not be interested in watching the original movie . i personally know that this movie was really good and i think some of those folks are still trying to enjoy it . but i ca n't quite remember which one of the three is the real deal . i could not even figure out what made it interesting enough to make an effort to watch it .

my friends and i watched this movie last night . it was pretty incredible . by all means , this is one of the great films you watch . just to show your appreciation , i should also warn you that this movie has been in print since 2012 . some of the filmmakers who had a major role in this film have lost their way , but i believe they managed to get an idea on how to fix the problem . i would say it was a lot more complicated than it looks . i hope you like it , it really helps make people feel less uncomfortable .

Like a lot of the comments above me, also I though this was the average scifi movie, but unfortunately it was not. I found it rather patronizing, and indeed, preaching.But that is not the only comment. The scenes are very 'artificial' (not as in scifi, as I will explain a in a few moments). this is easily one of the best movies of the 1950s . otto preminger directed only four or five really interesting movies in his entire life but he has a few good ones and i think they can have some good points with the other two . it 's a great movie that makes all the difference in the world to these guys who were raised by a family of drug dealers and forced to kill themselves to survive . it was one of the first shows i ever saw and it was an incredible success . the producers gave us a special treat because they did n't want anyone to come along to watch it .

there is a lot to like in this film , despite its humble trappings of a preachy pc tale about a woman whose marriage was broken by an ex who had fallen in love with her boss . however the characters do n't have any real connection and the script does not make any sense . i think that when you look at some of these scenes as a young child , you see that there are many holes in the storyline . but what really baffles me is one of them . it goes back nearly ten years . for example , i was reading through this book when i heard the door to my bedroom open .

rabbit fever is one of those film oddities . it ' s an enjoyable 90 minutes , demands little of the action and drama . when they are over , they just end up with a few bits of popcorn in their hands . like i said , my favorite part of the movie was the scene where you come across two young girls getting ready to go into their apartment and get ready for bed . they were dressed in all sorts of skimpy outfits . that ' s when you see a man standing in the doorway with a camera sticking out of his back pocket .

. . . but had to see just how bad it could get . the plotline was thin to begin with , a lot of people were dying , and the idea of taking a job at one of those companies gave me an idea . i 've never met anyone from the industry who has money like me , but i know enough to think about how this is going to look when i tell my boss that i am going to try to find a job . there are some really good actresses on the staff , and they may be interested in being my date for this little party .

this movie was childish in its writing and laughable in its visual effects . scenes where father merrin is tossing his daughter into the air and catches her by the wrists as he pulls her down to the ground with him , and that ' s when she starts screaming at the top of her lungs . there really was n't much point in letting the movie get away with it . i just did n't want to watch it - i loved it . i like a lot of people , but this movie was just plain terrible . the premise was bad ; the acting was awful ; the actors were totally inept or completely insane .

for an indy film this is probably a bit better than a 3 out of 10 , but in general it was . i really do n't give a crap . i just think the first movie should be more romantic than that . as we were walking up the main street toward my house , i could see a man and woman walking hand in hand . at first i thought it was a couple or two old folks going to church , but then i noticed it was a girl and a boy with their arms around one another . they were laughing and joking about nothing in particular .

This movie stars Ben Kingsley as Frank, a hit man for some Russian mobsters based out of Buffalo. He is also a raging alcoholic, and this has caused his job performance to decline. After he falls asleep in his car during a would-be hit, his mob boss uncle sends him to San Francisco, where he is to attend AA meetings and get a job as a mortician's assistant. If you're thinking that this makes absolutely no sense, you're not alone.It gets worse. Well, it actually gets better, but not before getting much, much worse.

when i first saw stella on comedy central i thought ` ` god , this is horrible ! ' ' but i like it . if i see that movie then i know it 's terrible because the dialogue is atrocious , and the cast is not all that good either . this movie did seem to have an unwritten theme with a little bit of originality but the plot was quite sad and rather dull compared to those of my previous movies . i guess what i really mean is , i had no idea there were such things as bad actors and bad stories .

While not as bad as some movies (like the horrible "Atomic Twister"), "Meltdown" still relies upon common misconceptions and inaccuracies about the nuclear power industry to advance its plot. I am currently studying Nuclear Engineering in the pursuit of a Masters Degree, and it was easy to point out flaws that would be obvious to anyone involved with the industry.Riding the false fear that a Chernobyl style meltdown could happen in an American plant, the movie states that any meltdown (even partial, according to one of the guest commentators in the movie) would mean disaster for the area.

kubrick may have been the greatest director of all times . he may have made more classics than anyone else in the series . and it has been his passion as well , so i do not know how he died . there is still some left to read ! if you want to find something , keep reading . your book will be out of print in only a few weeks . after that they can make an issue of this film . just let it play for one or two minutes . i love my movies and would never recommend this one to anyone but the director of this movie .

writer & director jay andrews , a . k . a . jim wynorski , serves up more of his characteristic shlock with a different kind of character but there are lots of differences . i thought it was nice that this guy seemed to be trying out for something bigger . he made it clear that he had the talent to put on a good act but when i saw him , it took all my patience and will power to not just let him know that i felt bad for him . " " how can you not want to kill him ? " steve asked . "

Far from combining the best bits of Pontypool and 28 days this managed to ignore them. Whilst shamelessly copying them. (if that makes sense?) Pontypool was different and got progressively tenser, this just stinks. The Radio DJ, "we must stay on air" spends effectively no time on air. He sits on his bottom and watches the TV for news. This is by far the worst excuse for a zombie movie ever. Is there a single person in the USA or indeed the world who doesn't know what a zombie is? Or ever heard of the word "zombie"?

Historically awful. Scarcely an accurate moment in 4 hours of ridiculosity. One cannot keep track of the inconsistencies while watching. As with all track and filed movies, nobody bothers to ask for any track consultants. Events and techniques that weren't even created until the next century are shown. From the shots of runners jogging in a 400 meters to the highly overweight actor portraying the high jump and long jump winner, one would have to know absolutely nothing about track to even be mildly entertained. Likely thrown together in 1984 as a tribute to the games just prior to the LA Olympics.

This movie was much better than I expected. ++++ Jean Peters actually does a passable job as a pirate and does decent work in her sword fights. (To the extent she may have a double doing the action, it's hard to tell...but Peters herself obviously is doing a good deal of it, and doing it well.) ++++ With a good and serious script, this could have been an excellent film. But it's basically cheesy. Still entertaining however. ++++ Not up to a regular Jacques Tournier film, but definitely above a regular Jean Peters film.

i was so ` ` impressed ' ' with tim kincaid ' s mutant hunt that i gave this one a try . the first few moments were hard and fast , but they kept getting better . the second time did not turn out too well . the third is even harder . it takes me a good half hour to get my brain around what i have just been told . you might think that i am a bit jaded at this game , but for the sake of humanity and the survival of the human race , perhaps i must be a little naive in the extreme .

His music, especially what we hear of it here, is very slow. From around the time of Bach's death composers had been working out ways of making music progress at a slower and slower pace: over a century later, Wagner and then Mahler wrote pieces that are about as slow as it is possible for music to get. -Of course, one can cheat by writing a 4/4 march and then specifying a tempo of, say, semiquaver = 1, but that tempo wouldn't be the correct tempo. Wagner and Mahler wrote music that is PROPERLY played at a snail's pace.

It's said that this film is or was banned in the US since it was released. Since there is no information on IMDb I must rely on my other sources and believe it. If this is really true, the movie is even more hurtful and frightening and is it is anyway.The movie is a so-called mockumentary, although I think the topic is too serious call it like that. It creates a scenario where America is like a military state and all revolutionary objects are arrested immediately without proof. After an obligatory tribunal they have to decide if they go to prison for some years or choose the punishment park.

Great party movie, following the adventures of Bill & Tom, two high school buddies at opposite ends of the spectrum. Bill (Eric Stolz) prefers to live life straight-laced, while his friend Tom (Chris Penn) takes nothing seriously except partying all the time. When Bill moves out of his mother's house to live on his own he faces many issues, from his girlfriend, to his brother, to his landlord. Meanwhile, his friend Tom moves in to keep the rent down but proceeds to turn Bill's life upside down.

rock star is a ` ` nice ' ' movie . everyone is nice . even the guys who are n ' t supposed to be on the team . " he turns back to me with a smirk , but this time it looks genuine . he just laughs at his own stupidity and gives me a wink . i 'm about to break into tears again when i realize that if i let them , i was really going to have a lot of fun tonight . then again , what do i expect out of this movie ? there is n't much to recommend it , other than the main character is dumb .

chop shop is a hidden treasure out in theaters ! i can not begin to describe how wonderful the performances are . it would take me years to get used to what they are all doing and at least half of them were made in 1944 . many of these films were filmed in south america , and i do not know whether this is because they ' re so bad that you want to give up on them and leave them alone or if it has some real relevance to the movie . whatever the reason , i sincerely wish this movie would be played differently .

i like seeing linda blair playing in an actual ` ` horror ' ' movie again . i had been disappointed with the story , because it was so close to true that i started to get some good ideas from my own experience . there was nothing wrong with a good film when you are going to go out on a date with a girl , and then just leave her alone for the next day . what did i miss ? oh , well , all i can say at the moment is that she was fun and cute and very funny .

are sea side resorts the sad , dreary places they ' re always depicted as in movies and novels ? certainly not on the coast of jamaica , but this is the only part that i ' d ever seen from the beach . why would anyone pay $ 30 dollars for a place to spend their time ? all it has to do is buy a bunch of seashells , a couple pieces of paper and a magazine . the people who come here are so unimaginative and lame that i was afraid of what they might have to say about us . how can we trust these people with our money ?

in the european tv industry , movies like this one are called ` ` stickers ' ' . tv stations buy them at the market and sell them when they have no credits . after the movie is finished , i go into a bar to pick up a bottle of booze . the bartender asks me how much money i paid for it . i just say " $ 1 , 29.95 ! " so that 's where the trouble comes out of the show . as soon as i get it all off my chest , i feel sure i will regret it forever .

Ghilli is the best movie of vijay & one of the biggest hit in his career.... As I had not seen the Telegu movie so I could enjoy this movie even more.The story is about a girl wanting to escape the clutches of a local goon who wants to forcibly marry her. Since he is a goon so no body is ready to help the heroine. Vijay who had come to play a Kabaddi match there sees this and decides to help her. The rest of the movie is how vijay helps her & how the girl ultimately escapes the clutches of the goon & the goon's father's political cronies.

i would have been about 11 years old when this movie was first released . all these years later at the age of 14 , i can still recall a lot of things about the movie that are hard to explain . in fact , i can actually recall one thing that is very difficult for me to explain at all . i was an actress . not because i was young , but because i had been acting for my entire adult life . i did not like how people acted , or the way they talked , or the way they made themselves feel .

This is the last film of Krzysztof Kieslowski - one of the greatest directors in the history of cinema. He intended to retire after this film, so in a way it is his artistic testament. He died a couple of years after making the film, and though it is said that he intended to return to directing, Destiny decided that this was indeed his last. And what a film! 'Rouge' the last film in the three colors French trilogy is actually a very Swiss film. Set in Geneva, one of the two main characters is a Swiss retired judge, and Durenmatt immediately comes to mind.

so , you wan na be a rock star ? see this movie . you do n ' t like rock , and it don ' t matter how much you love to have the stuff on the show , there is no way of knowing what might have been done if you would have known that music was a major part of your everyday life . you can ' t just give it up without thinking about it . but i didn ' t mind because it made me feel great about the whole thing . maybe i was just being overly generous .

Yep. Those of my generation who grew up watching those old Sunbow cartoons were spoiled. The 80's Joe tune was one of the best cartoons in the history of television. Well written stories, well developed characters. Granted it was nothing more that a glorified toy commercial but it definitely helped carry that toy line. Fast forward almost twenty years later and enter Valor vs. Venom. The animation was average at most. The movement of the characters seemed to jerky and puppet like. The movie felt more like a Small Soldiers sequel than a story about a special military force.

I would like to thank you for giving me a chance to be one of the first to actually view the film. It really does grip you. John Paul does eventually get to see the light and make a life for himself away from being tied to his mothers apron strings.I imagine there must be so many families these days in the same position (especially with children leaving home older but I wouldn't say wiser) with very sad parents who haven't really got lives of their own and who make their lives a misery.I think this film should definitely have a wider audience.

deep water ( 2006 ) * * * * ' ' it is indifferent . . . it ' s there waiting for you to finish your reading . when you are finished reading , take a break and get up to write another story on the way home . that will allow you to have a better feeling about the story because even if it ' s not as interesting as this one , it ' s better than the last one or the beginning . i love this film , and all the good parts , but the bad parts are great .

cool action - yeah the premise has been done - but not this way - that ' s the trick . i can ' t put any words in my mouth to explain how this scene ends , and frankly it ' s hard to believe anyone who has never witnessed a movie is even remotely familiar with this kind of stuff . i don ' t know what i would have said or done if there was another person who had seen this sort of production at least once before . there is no rhyme or reason to the film : it is just bad movies .
