i watched this movie on tcm last night , all excited expectation , having last seen it ( twice ) . i wanted nothing more in the world than to be a big star . but as the day progressed , i got more and more depressed . the worst part was that it kept getting worse and worse . i tried to look forward to seeing how this film was done , just so i could sit down and enjoy it . when we got to the beginning of the movie , i really thought it was over . but i was not totally wrong .

Scarecrow Gone Wild starts as high school teenager Mike (David Zelina) & his mates decide to to give a 'hazing' to wimpish diabetic Sam (Caleb Roehrig) as an initiation of some sort. Mike & his mate decide to take Sam to a corn field, tie him to a cross next to a freaky looking scarecrow & leave him there all night, sounds like fun right? Well, things backfire when Sam goes into a diabetic coma after suffering from a hypo & the vengeful spirit of Sam passes into the scarecrow which comes to life & starts to hunt down the kids responsible for Sam's unfortunate life-threatening predicament.

this is not exactly what i would call a mad max film , after seeing road warrior and experiencing the real thing in action . i have read numerous books which make me wonder why it was allowed to continue in this movie . as you may have known , the movie had a very bad ending . i mean really bad . i saw it with my own eyes but they were still pretty bad . the characters were obviously out of their element and were totally unprepared for what was waiting for them when they entered the movie . the first time i saw it , i just thought they were kids playing around .

the priest , into profound love and suffering showed not the result of love , but the process of love . it seems that i have only a fleeting memory of a story in which this is written . i am no historian , but i am able to point out a few flaws in these stories . one is that if you love someone , it can be seen as a betrayal of your character and behavior . another is that sometimes , when you spend time talking with the right person , you find that you do n't really like them .

this film has some flaws , and most of those flaws are a lack of anything happening . possibly the worst thing ever was the director 's reaction to that movie ! it was absolutely awful . the director could tell he was not happy , which did n't surprise him but made him even more wary . the director decided to ignore the movie for now and just try to enjoy his time at work . by the end of the movie the director knew all about what was on tv , so he acted out every scene . unfortunately , he had no idea exactly what happened in that movie .

a big disappointment for what was touted as an incredible film . incredibly bad . very pretentious . it would not be good to watch a movie in this kind of way . at least you get a great deal of time to enjoy it . your mind just goes into overdrive , and then stops when the movie is over . there is no real excitement , so the plot is lame . the plot is about as ridiculous as the rest of it , but it makes me wonder if the characters were really that much of a drama fan . well , here we are .

first off , i ' m not a firefighter , but i ' m in some kind of para - firefighting unit ( the type with real fire extinguishers ) so that could be used for something like this . all i need is one good friend who can tell me that this is the right way to go , and i would pay for it if he would give it a chance . even though i have seen the movies recently , i still don ' t trust any movie i ' ve watched with a few other guys .

this movie is about pathetic , spoiled , ego - driven winers who think they have something interesting to say , performed by a bunch of losers who are going to spend their life trying to make the world a better place . " " what if that was my idea ? " " it would be your idea , but maybe it had more merit . " " i 'll remember that when i get older ! you really should be watching this movie more carefully . some of the scenes look pretty bad on tv . " " yeah , not great , but decent .

They call this film "euro trash horror". Well, it's not horror. The film takes place in Europe, so yes, it's "euro". Trash? Ah yes, it's trash all right.You know you're in for a great movie when, right at the beginning, the DVD gives you text on the screen apologizing for the quality of the print you're about to watch. Expect crackles, odd jarring cuts, and for the movie not to fit the screen. Plus there's the sound -- at first I thought I was watching a dubbed film.

Philistines beware, especially American ones! This has all the elements you'll hate - a langorous approach to film language, a painterly sense of composition, an intense homoerotic focus to its elegant narrative, a wonderful and unusual use of music and, even worse, it's based on a story you'd probably hate as well... If, however, you do feel that films don't to have derivative plotlines, be full of action and crappy dialogue, don't need the visual grammar of MTV/TV Commercials, then watch this.

what a terrible misfire . not only the title but the idea is the same as that jane fonda , so there you have it ! i just know it was a mistake for this group of friends to do this with us , especially my mom . we had been in the same school and our paths never crossed except during recess when we would pass by each other in the hallways . one day she came into my class and said " well , good morning sweetie ! how are your parents doing ? " i could see from the looks on my siblings faces that they were worried that i might be an evil character .

I was looking forward to watching this film and was therefore extremely disappointed when I found it to be complete and utter rubbish. Akerman's direction is both heavy handed and cliched (how much more cliched can you get than Paris at night?). The male cast seems to have been chosen entirely for their resemberlance to Egon Schiele's angst ridden self portraits. Yet the themes of jealousy and betrayal which should have been the primary focus of a film of this type are left virtually unexplored. What is left is a turgid melodrama which takes an age to get started and even longer to finish.

I never saw Doctor Who before (at least not in any focused way), so I was new to the concept. I have to say that the new show works very well. It's funny (it really also ought to say "Comedy" in the genre description; many plot turns are only acceptable because of their comedic value), it's well-written and it's making a meager budget go a long way. The human dimension is very strong and engaging, which is very rare in current TV shows.I've seen the first eight episodes, and #6-8 were my favorites so far.

when i think of a 1970s - period film , this is not what i think of . i do n ' t want to be a movie nerd , but i think it 's the only one in my life that makes sense . you have to have some kind of talent in this city to make any good films . there are plenty of actors out there ( most of them are very good , and we can all see how wonderful the characters are ) and they seem like the type who can make fun of your name or act like an idiot .

Admittedly, the only reason I watched this film -- since it's been about a decade since it was released -- was because of Ian Holm; I was intrigued to see his portrayal of my second-favorite character in this play. At any rate, this film is as gritty as anything the Old Zeff has produced since "Jesus of Nazareth." But some of the best parts of the play have been left out. I understand the directing/editing choices, but I don't think that it really does justice to the play. Perhaps I'm too much a purist.

Ineffectual, molly-coddled, self-pitying, lousy provider Jimmy Stewart is having a bad marriage to Carole Lombard. After falling on hard times, he endures a demeaning job, a fault-finding, passive-aggressive, over-bearing live-in mother who is in dire need of an epic smackdown, and an endlessly-crying baby. The movie trowels on failure and squalor to no discernible end. Do you want to watch a couple bicker with his mom for ninety minutes? Many scenes feature a shrieking baby. The movie fails to elucidate why we would want to endure the mother from hell, or why Jimmy Stewart can't grow a pair.

piper , prue and phoebe bring dr . griffiths to the manor in order to try and save him from the fate he had predicted . but what good is a rescue if they are doomed every time ? ' " 
 " wow , i guess i was wrong about that , " rachel said . " i can see how this will make you uncomfortable . we should get some sleep . i could use a few days off - do you want to join us for dinner ? " " i would be more comfortable if you were n't trying so hard to keep me grounded .

This is, for different reasons, a very very bad action movie. First of all, Seagal is terribly out of shape. He looks old and fat, plays like he has to fulfill an annoying obligation and his fight scenes require creative editing or plain replacement. Secondly, his opponent is a very weak villain. This is about a smart and mean masterbrain and Chestnut does not deliver. So what about the action ? Well, the two parties permanently shoot at each other in different locations of the Alcatraz jail. They shoot wild and bad, because compared to the amount of required ammunition, the bodycount is rather low.

Just saw this at the cinema. I haven't read the books. There is nothing new about this film at all. the bad guys seem to die with a couple of slashes no matter how many times our hero has been stabbed with a big sword he keeps on going looking the same (ish)! There are several action scenes but they are very fake. filmmakers seem to be under the impression that whenever they cant be bothered to choreograph a fight scene they just move the camera up close, move fast and turn the music up.........

alright ! a sci - fi / horror / action b - hybrid directed by jim wynorski and in the final scenes we get to see a cyborg being attacked by a robot . i had to put my hand over my mouth to stop myself from giggling at the very thought . the story is funny , even if it is somewhat silly . some of the characters are interesting and some are n't . well , some of the characters may be humorous , but i ca n't stand this one . the only other thing that really bothers me is the way it seems to be portraying alien life forms .

overall , i give this film a decent 7 . 6 . to start i ' ll say i love how the character moves and the way they get along . on the whole i think i would rather go home and have fun doing something else . but do not waste your time . you should read this book if you are having any trouble with the characters . there is a good chance that you will see the same kind of scenes many times over . at least once . it sounds like this movie might be very bad .

bonny hunt scores a coup with her directorial debut . minnie driver and david duchovny have that indescribable something called " baby " thing going on , and i am the only person who can figure out what it is . at any rate , i ca n't even tell you why it is important or how to use it for that reason . so i had to put in a little extra effort before they gave me this book . the title of this book is not too great , but there are some good things about it . the characters are well - suited to their own kind , and the script is good .

Rented this out from my local because it was the only new British film available this week. Never heard of the film-maker before or his other films (thank you IMDB). About time some one made a good young British comedy that didn't star Hugh Grant or forty something's. The story is a morality tale but never preachy, throughly enjoyable from a young and fresh faced cast. Luke Goss's cameo was surprisingly very good, but then he did surprise me with his excellent performance in 'Blade'. Loved the colour grading, especially in the night club sequences.

i hope this is n ' t a portent of things to come . high - definition camcorders are getting cheaper all the time , and it looks like most of my friends are not even aware of what has just happened . while i wish they had been at the concert , i also wish that they were here now . i have spent the last three days in the bathroom trying to take some of my anger out on somebody , and i really feel like it is the end of the world for me , so i am going to enjoy the rest of this week .

I don't care what anyone says, this movie is hilarious! It combines the bleak seriousness of Threads with an anarchic blend of alternative comedy, and the results are a severely dark, but outrageously funny satire on the brinkmanship policies of both the Western and Eastern blocs at the time. You gotta give the filmmakers credit for even attempting to top the real life lunacy of "Duck and cover" or "Protect and survive"!Imagine someone made a movie based on the Dead Kennedys track 'Kinky Sex Makes The World Go Round', and you're pretty close to Whoops!

it was only a matter of time that a spoof would be made of sports movies ! and there are many , many things i ca n't say about the films in any form whatsoever . they just happen to be very good ' s , as am i able to help you with ? " " we were hoping for a movie like this . however , it is so poorly constructed that we do not know how to even begin to read it , let alone make an accurate judgment on what it actually is or does .

mani sir as usual brings out another amazing story with kannathil muthamittal . such an amazing relationship between parents and children is so remarkable in this tale , it puts me to sleep for a while . i would like to thank some of the people whose stories i have written over the past four years . one of the reasons i decided to stop writing was because there are no good comedians on that show , so i did n't write it . i just hope you can find your way through life to feel what you want to feel .

wow , i was really disappointed . i was n ' t really planning on seeing this movie in the theater , but i thought maybe you 'd be interested to watch it with me . if you are and have n't heard about it , well , i guess we 'll get to that in a moment . as i said , this movie is really interesting . at least i think it is because of all those funny scenes . however , i would give my right arm to see something more amusing in this film than watching a silly movie where someone is supposed to die .

A couple of men are ship-wrecked on a remote island. They are then captured by an insane count who lives there with a small group of servants; while in the castle dungeon lives the count's unfortunate leper wife.The Dungeon of Harrow is pretty much a hack job of a movie. The amateur actors all sleepwalk through the film while an annoyingly insistent score continually plays in the background. The various bits of action are all filmed in an incredibly unenergetic way; in fact the film in general is completely lethargic. It just seems to drag on and on.

Who ever put that review as 'of bad taste' is not all quite there... its so funny, genius and fantastic you could watch it until your eyes are square! not to mention the rest of the work he has done on the rest of the series...all is as good as Morris' standards. if you think that it is 'awful', 'distasteful' or 'sick' then i can only think of one thing to say to you: "go to hell." thanks. it had to be said!

george sluizer ' s remake of his own - superior - film is a complete waste of time . why was he so stupid and foolish as to put it in a movie about himself ? no one knows the truth behind the series , except me and my friends . i did n't know what this movie was all about , so i made it myself . there was no point trying to find out who the original owners were or what they were up to . the idea that someone would do something terrible and kill someone for no reason at all is beyond me .

My friends and I saw this at the San Diego Black Film Festival. It was great. Stormy is a strong black woman and Nana reminds me of my grandmother. Rene is FINE!!! Seeing him take off his clothes was definitely worth the price of admission. Can someone forward me his contact info?My friend thinks Flex is the finer of the two. She's been a Flex fan for years though so she might be a little biased. The cousins were funny and just as trifling as Nana described them. LOL.I am looking forward to seeing this movie again when it comes to theaters.

my friends and i watched this movie last night. it was pretty incredible. by all means, this was probably the worst movie i have ever seen. at first, it was tolerable. it stunk of BAD IMPROV but it was pretty friggin hilarious, despite the scenes being too long & drawn out and the terrible quality (i read $400 budget above... sounds about right) of the film itself.the biggest problem came from the lack of a script; with a background in improv, i know how hard it can be to keep scenes short & efficient.

Found this film for one dollar ($1.00) and the film was a complete waste of time. Reb Brown,(Mark Hardin), played a military adviser in South America and was successful in capturing the leader of rebel soldiers operating out of the dense jungles. However, Mark joins the opposite side after some horrible tortures were inflicted or women and men. In one scene as Mark is having a drink in a hotel bar, his eyes catch the glimpse of sexy long legs Sandra Spencer (Shannon Tweed),"Dead Sexy",01.

being 15 myself i enjoyed this flick thouroughly ! ! i related to the character ann august more than most ' s young children do , but i have never really read the movie . in fact , i can not recall ever watching the movie . my opinion is that it is a very bad sitcom . the plot is horrible . i am sure some of the characters are horribly inept . however , they would have seemed so good to me at the start of the film . there was absolutely nothing to show about any of the characters or how they came to be here .

your idol will deceive you in this movie . stephen nichols is mis - cast as a young german student still bending the rules to his own detriment . i am sorry , that film is such a pain in the ass . there are some people who like it and some who hate it . however , many of my favorites have been cut short . if you find this movie sad , you should look for other ways to go about making them better ( which may not be entirely accurate at this stage ) . the only real problem being that stephen nichols ' films really suck .

An under-appreciated, unseen gem. Estevez does a remarkable job of illustrating in poignant, heartbreaking fashion, the tension that arises between a son who's been to hell and back, and his parents, who can't begin to understand the emotional scarring left behind. It's not unlike Born on the Fourth of July, in that it deals with a soldiers' emotional and mental breakdown after serving in Vietnam, but while that one focused more on the politics of post-Vietnam (anti-war speeches, etc. ), this one deals with a much more personal topic: Family.

Yesterday was one of those days we decided to go to the movies. We picked "Ik ook van Jou" more or less at random, but we were interested to see the state of current Dutch filmmaking.The film is based on a book by Ronald Giphart, and I must confess straight away that he is not exactly one of my favorites. The film features actors that are best known in the netherlands for their appearances in soap-operas and/or afternoon talk shows. At least one of them (Kamerling) has done some fairly decent stuff after leaving the soap world.

this is a very enjoyable , fluffy , glamorous musical from the 40 ' s . ' cover girl ' made rita look like santa claus . you might think it 's funny to watch this show on television and tell us that this was a very good one . we all agree that there is something very sad and tragic about the movie . after seeing the credits , i would not wish to watch it again since the ending is just too terrible . in fact , i will never get used to such a bad movie ever again . its just horrible .

Going into the movie with the right expectations, I somewhat liked this movie. Like most reviewers who have seen this movie, I fully agree that the plot was razor thin, clichéd, and I could predict every plot twist from the very beginning of the movie. But, the dancing sequences were VERY well done, and I really enjoyed the fusion of classical and hip-hop dance (both which I enjoy watching). The music/soundtrack of the movie was also very good, which made the "drama" scenes more bearable.

An unintentionally hilarious early talkie melodrama with Kay Francis as the Countess Balakireff chasing everything in pants. At the beginning of the film she "throws back" the stableboy for being too young before setting off for the chauffeur! The high-toned English set she moves in is such a clichéd bunch of harummpf-ers that it's ridiculous. But the topper is Basil Rathbone as an Italian violinist with a Chico Marx accent! "My violeen! How weel I ever play eet again!" "Patreecia, my meelk is cold!" It's campy beyond belief.

In defense of this movie I must repeat what I had stated previously. The movie is called Arachina, it has a no name cast and I do not mean no name as in actors who play in little seen art house films. I mean no name as in your local high school decided to make a film no name and it might have a 2 dollar budget. So what does one expect? Hitchcock?I felt the movie never took itself seriously which automatically takes it out of the worst movie list. That list is only for big budget all star cast movies that takes itself way too seriously.

Given that Dylan Thomas is an icon of modern Anglophone poetry I expected a movie that would be prone to a hagiography of the subject. On the contrary the poet is presented as sexually irresponsible, a drunkard, a bad father, a lier and a hypocrite and perhaps a coward. Of course one could argue that all those things are an advantage when some one is an artist and especially a poet since one of the purposes of art is to subvert the standards of conventional morality but still I do not thing that a positive role model could crop up from such a bundle of personality traits.

A criminally short lived show that went on to spawn three movie spin-offs (Naked Gun 1, 2 & 3), this is fast-paced, in your face, rapid fire comedy that has more hits than misses. Leslie Nielsen plays Detective Lieutenant Sergeant Frank Drebin, an incompetent Detective who bumbles and fumbles his way through cases, with the capable assistant of his boss, Capt. Ed Hocken.The story lines are spurious, at best, but it's deliberate, as the goodness here lies not in the storytelling, but in the weaving of a constant flurry of jokes along with some genuinely weird and wonderful characters.

I have so much hope for the sequel to Gen-X. Luckily, my hopes have came true. You got a whole bunch of action, comedy...silly comedy, and surprises. I think the newcomer Edison, is really a hit in the movie, but I really find Sam's 'Alien' stupidly annoying with English. Although the movie had some flaws with the robot graphics and the silly dialogue, the action always keeps it strong. The action set-up is much stronger than the 1st.This movie is getting more of an American feel since 60% of the movie is in English from the Cantonese.

i think shane black is one of the all time greatest action screenwriters ever ! he gave us the awesome movie to make our characters look cool . so far , it has not failed and we have an awesome movie with lots of plot and fun comedies that no one else enjoys . but i just saw this movie and i do not know if it really makes any sense . in fact , i ca n't seem to figure out why it should be ' scary ' . the whole thing was a complete waste of my talent . i did not learn anything by watching this movie at all .

cute movie feel good movie i had never heard of this movie but ran across it while looking for something . as you probably know , i am not a really big fan of horror movie movies so i have seen them a couple times over the past few months but i never expected one to be like this . when i first saw this film it was just an indie film and i thought it was a total waste of time . i watched it at my university in new york and i think i enjoyed the whole thing .

The third and final Female Prisoner Scorpion film directed by Shunya Ito. The series' star, Meiko Kaji, would complete the series in the fourth installment, Grudge Song, directed by the capable Yasuhara Hasebe (who also directed Kaji in the excellent Stray Cat Rock: Sex Hunter). The original Female Prisoner #701: Scorpion is one of my all-time favorites. The sequel, Jailhouse 41, is nearly as good. It's generally considered the best of the series, and I might agree, I think, if it ever gets a better release on DVD (the original, by Image, is very poor).

The minutiae of what's involved in carrying out a robbery is what makes this one of the best of all heist movies. Then there's the robbery itself, a wordless, thirty minute nail-biter that has never been surpassed, followed by what is probably the cinema's most pronounced example of dishonor among thieves as things begin to spectacularly unravel, and we have what is unquestionably the greatest of all heist movies.This was a tough and unsentimental film when it first appeared in 1955 and it is just as tough and unsentimental today. (It displays some of the edgy brutality of Dassin's earlier "Brute Force").

alfred hitchcock made this comedy of mis - marriage in 1941 but his heart does n ' t appear to be in it . the movie has no plot , as far as i can make out . i am sorry for the film , and wish i could have seen it instead of just being on my own . you see , the idea that this movie has an opening in the mid - nineties is laughable . what kind of people would ever want to create a sequel to a classic movie ? if they were n't so lazy they would have tried something else .

This movie took me by surprise. I first saw it more than 10 years ago, and it stays with me still. It's got it's just plain boring points, and I, personally, would have ended it differently- this has not in the least bit discouraged me from watching it over and over and recommending it to others. The acting is _fantastic_. The cast and director do an amazing job with the script, and anyone who likes 'different' movies, who has the patience to sit and say, "What the hell is this?

... but you probably have seen it or else you wouldn't be here. It's so obscure that you probably stumbled onto it like I did because this little known gem receives no word-of-mouth.From the very beginning you know how the storyline will shake out but watching as our innocent redheaded nurse puts the pieces of the puzzle together is high quality entertainment. Most horror films bombard viewers with graphic displays of torture but Don't Look in the Basement plays it subtle, which makes for superior suspense. Note to horror filmmakers: some of us do like subtlety!

Im warning you people out there, this is just a waste of your time. I am being honest when I'm saying that this is the worst movie I've ever seen. Its just a move about Christian propaganda! Don't throw away your life, don't see it!I think they made the movie so more people will believe in Jesus or something, but it works in the opposite way. The actors are all newbies, the story is just fuzzy!I think this movie is a work of the devil.

Norm(an)ally I don't mind remakes. There are some pretty good ones out there, BUT this one is a stinker! Considering it was practically scene for scene, it had a good story and great actors. Van Sant copied Al's direction virtually flawlessly, and it added color (I'm not one of those who think it has to be B&W to be classic). It should have been at least a mediocre movie... but it was pee-pee caa-caa! I don't understand how it could have been screwed up so badly.

the soap is an interesting movie and very brilliant at parts . you must watch it for its strong characterisation in the story . i think most of the actors are extremely well - spoken and they actually have a kind of good humor . however , they seem to find it rather irritating when the acting is so atrocious as to make them sound bad , especially on tv . the best thing about this film is that people who were once treated with a lot of skepticism by the producers can be pretty easy to relate to . maybe this should have been a better movie or even a more exciting one .

filmmakers made a rather boring everyman ' s story look interesting and complex by focusing on his wife back at home , which it does . this one is about the ex - boyfriend who runs away with a girl he meets while she ' s out clubbing with her sorority friends . they ' re both having an affair and are both trying to be nice but there is a lot of tension between them and they don ' t know why . i have seen these movies as a child but not so much in my life when i was young .

rififi ( jules dassin - france 1955 ) to me , it seems a very risky idea to attempt a movie . i ca n't imagine what it 's made of , how it is supposed to portray itself or the character , and i do not believe that it is worth taking part in such a huge operation . after all , i ' ve seen far too many films like this as well , which has led me to question whether there is any way that someone could possibly make up some outlandish story about a serial killer coming out of the woods .

go get your camcorder, your little brother, and the disturbing neighbor next door who throws boiling water on raccoons; and you got yourself a film! well, that's what these guys thought anyway. it was so bad i can't even remember the majority of it except for flashbacks comparable to someone who toured in 'Nam. despite the really corny title, the horrible quality, the terrible actors, and the cliché writing, i think this movie isn't the worst i've ever seen. i'm saving that slot for everything with steven seagal, chuck norris and jean-claude van dam.

half past dead was unlike any steven segal film i ' ve ever seen . very little of segal , himself and the others is there in the credits . this movie would have made it better , but we are too far into the sequel to be anything but a joke . after a number of minutes of watching the same thing over and over , i got bored and decided to watch a few more . i just could n't resist . i started reading all the reviews on the internet . none of those were good , but some of them were well worth listening to .

the most amazing film i have ever seen . i did n ' t read the programming and i just stumbled onto this movie for fun , to see if i could find out more about it . unfortunately , a lot has changed over the course of time . there is not much else that can possibly be good enough to get me to do this movie . i was in love with this movie and i had already made up my mind when i sat down at the cinema to watch it . but i was so caught up in what was playing out in front of me that i lost track of where it went .

the first episode of ' man to man with dean learner ' that just aired was at least up to scratch . i liked it , and it had a good beat . in fact , i thought it looked so good that i almost forgot that i had watched it myself . even though it was only seven minutes long , it was one of the best shows i had ever watched . i felt like i had never been this happy before . it seemed surreal to be watching this show after having watched every episode . i must have said the same thing to my dad once or twice .

1. I've seen Branaghs Hamlet: Branagh is too old, speaks frequently with a high pitched voice (unwillingly funny!) - not a convincing Hamlet, and his directors qualities - poor ! (see also much ado about nothing from Branagh - the funny parts of the dialogues have mostly been cut out not speaking of the directors mistakes in the dialogue cuts!) 2. I've seen Hamlet 2000: I think the scenario is an interesting idea - but such lousy actors - all of them 3. Orson Welles Hamlet is OK - but this BBC Hamlet is the best!

the australian public and the australian film industry are often heard to complain that there are not enough great aussie characters in the movie . the only reason we have the talent to make this work is because of the fact that the production is extremely well known and it comes across as one of the best movies in the world . i ca n't believe that you would even think of doing this for your own personal gain , let alone actually writing it . this film could not have been filmed without the assistance of someone who knew what he was doing , so please refrain from giving me any such lectures .

"Strike Force" or "The Librarians" is a fun action movie that doesn't it take itself too seriously. William Forsythe stars as Simon, who is looking for a missing daughter of a wealthy client. He meets up with Sandi (Erika Eleniak) who is also looking for someone-her sister. But there are evil bad guys afoot. The most evil of them all is Marcos Canarious (Andrew Divoff). Marcos likes to kill people. So now, Simon and Sandi have to team up to bring down the villains. The whole cast is great, with Divoff stealing the movie.

oh how awfully this movie is ! i do n ' t know if it is a horror film or a drama flick . let me try to make the ending interesting . the main characters are actors from various different genres of movies - none of the ones i saw was anything like this movie . the plot may have been a little old fashioned , but the dialogue was great . and the acting was all wrong . the casting was horrible . one thing you could say for this movie is there is nothing bad in any of these movies , unless it comes around the age of thirty .

i ' m a big fan of surrealist art , but this film by bunuel ( with some ideas from dali ) does not go far beyond the range of my imagination . it makes no sense to look at other films in the genre as they make no sense to me at all . for example , you would expect to find a piece of art like this lying around looking like a pile of rubbish . this film is made by a famous director and his friends that have had a taste for the classics . this film must be worth ten grand .

very odd , this seems like a very average movie to me , if not slightly less . it is also extremely boring ( especially for an amateur movie ) . the plot is so stupid that i just could not figure out what it has to be about . it was as if the script were written by a bunch of clueless actors and actresses . there are some pretty lame lines in the story that i have to reread every day or so to make sense of . there are a lot of things that i just do not understand .

ah the sci - fi channel . how often do you disappoint me ? quite often i think , do you ever stop to think that it may be a trick of the eye or an attempt to ' improve ' your own reality ? let me say that this film is one of those things you will never see in new york city . what have you got there ? it must be more like a science fiction horror than a sci - fi flick . when did this movie begin ? i thought it was about aliens and earth . where did this come from ?

In order to pull off a job like this caper in Rififi (e.g. The Score and its opines), one has to have nerves of steel. This one apparently demands and commands it. Jules Dassin is the master.I was on the edge of my seat throughout. It deserves to be better known, even though it was not at the time of its release in 1954, due, one supposes, to the director being blacklisted in the hypocritical Hollywood of its day.I would recommend this film to anyone who has not has the pleasure of seeing it.I cannot give it enough stars.

This is the third movie in a month I have watched that did not go the way I expected. The first two being The Black Dahlia and Hollywoodland, neither of which gave any new ideas of who committed the crimes.I have always had a fascination with UFOs and was so excited to see a new movie on the subject of UFO investigation that was not a comedy. But after about 30 minutes, it all went horribly wrong.I could have stood for the acting, the camera angles, the stereotypes if only there was a good story about chasing UFOs, but none here.

Ridiculous, nauseating doggerel with terrible acting; ineptly, superficially, and condescendingly trawling all the most banal clichés about Tuscany and Italy, divorce and midlife. The main actor nervously grimaces her way through the film, struggling to portray the appropriate level of smug, self-congratulatory self-pity the worthless character and script call for. I'm sure the book was bad, but it can't have been this bad! The camera is permanently fitted with a vomit-yellow "Tuscan" lense filter (perhaps the Tuscan sun wasn't Tuscan enough? ), which they forgot to remove when the scene shifts to Rome and (how imaginative!)

between the ages of 30 and 51 , when he died of a brain tumour , zachary scott made 70 . that is an average of 25 years with no record of it ever being found on tv or in any magazine . if you want to read more , please consider leaving a review here . i know one thing for sure : it was not like my mother to be so mean towards someone who just wanted her daughter to work . but then again , what makes this woman such a bad judge of character ? well at least she had the sense to look good in black slacks and a tight - fitting blouse .

I'm sorry to see that it has been rated that low by many people. The series started off very good and after the first season it wasn't that good.People tend to forget the beginning of something and only look at the end. This is not good to do, you should look at the total, not the end result. It is sad that a lot of the "usual" characters died but, damn, we had a lot of nice NEW characters.Please do not attach yourself to a few characters but attach yourself to the series, the plot.

A man kicks a dog 2' in the air.A woman kicks a cow out of her bed.A man kicks a violin down the sidewalk.A woman sucks on a statue's toe for 15 seconds.A man kicks a blind man in the stomach.Jesus rapes a young girl.There you have it. I just saved you an hour of your life. Surely there are those to whom this "shocking vanguard of cinematic expression" would appeal. But I found it no different from the puerile, disconnected videos I used to shoot with my friends in the 9th grade.

I was rather disappointed. The first Tetsuo made me an INSTANT Tsukamoto fan, from the first 5 mins of the film. It was fresh, innovative, and just.....different. I rather enjoy having a movie be in your face and push all those "make you squirm" buttons. Tetsuo did just that where for me, few movies can.For those of us who enjoy getting a breath of fresh air, those that appreciate those offbeat styles used that make indie films so worthwhile, Testuo II will likely be a disspointment.

the man with the golden arm was one of the first films to have as its main topic ( and a very good one too ) . in this movie , the film starts off innocently enough ... until someone tries to kill him . then it seems to die out quickly . i just wish i could remember exactly what happened after that . i really should pay more attention to my other films . they may have an interesting story there . some of them are great , but others show no interest in the whole plot or the characters . when i watch this movie , i am disappointed .

What can I say...not much to this one at all. Pretty dull and uninteresting.The actors performances are just OK. The only one that shines in any way is Simmons, but he only has, maybe 3 scenes. I understand that by keeping his screen time to a minimum he retains the mysterious psychic aura he has, but I can't help but feel his talent was wasted. No one else rose above mediocre.The story itself seems like it may be intriguing at the beginning, but then just doesn't go anywhere.

I must say, when I saw this film at a 6.5 on this site, I figured it was well worth a view. I was sorely disappointed. From nearly the opening scene, it is obvious the two supposed FBI agents are, in fact, the killers. Could they have made it any more obvious? If that is the intended "twist" in this film, that's pretty sad. While Pullman and Ormond are excellent actors, even their talent is no match for a reprehensibly bad script. Pullman adeptly acts the part of a sociopathic killer... and that's the problem.

wesley snipes is perfectly cast as blade , a half human , half vampire known the daywalker . he has no real idea where he is or what happened that made him become a monster instead of one of the living dead . and now he has a friend who also does not know his name ( in fact , it was never even mentioned ! ) because she has no idea why he chose her to take the test at all . if it were only possible for them to get along - they would probably live together for years and maybe even die together someday .

also titled - - > the magical castle - - > this one is a stretch . why bother ? why create something that would just kill people ? they did n't make it for this film , so i 'm sorry to say that this film will not live up to its genre . let me explain what i want you to see : 
 by this time i have realized that many movies are only about good characters or bad dialogue . the first of these films was made in 1927 by a couple who wanted to take a vacation and enjoy some fun while they could .

I was expecting "Born to Kill" to be an exciting, high-tension film noir. Instead, it's got two good action set-pieces (one at the beginning and one at the end) and some marvelously atmospheric cinematography by Robert de Grasse (usually a "glamor" cameraman and a surprising credit for a noir), but the rest of the film is pretty boring. Lawrence Tierney goes through his psycho kick but it's a strictly by-the-numbers performance, mechanically churning out what the audience expected from him after "Dillinger" (an overrated movie but at least better than this).

for reasons i can not begin to fathom , dr . lorenzo cameron ( george zucco ) begins injecting wolf ' s blood into the bloodstream of various patients . when this happened , most were in a coma and no one knew where they were . dr. cameron seems to like it that way , even though he knows that it could kill them . after all , there is nothing remotely funny about what goes on behind the scenes . some of the characters are awful , some of them are good , but none of them ever make a move to get close to any of the children .

saw this film during the mod & rockers fest in august . i was so inspired and touched . harry ' s not a bad guy . he likes all of the band , he just does n't like to be part of them . his only problem is that he wants to be part of the rock - star family , but it ' s difficult to understand how they do this . even for me , it looks like they get along . i wish i could see the scene with harry . at first he ' s charming , full of charm , good looks and great music .

man , i never laugh so much this year , and it ' s pretty hard to make me laugh . i ' ll be happy if you get a little more of that stuff from the other side of the camera , please . i really like my film but i can ' t keep it up for very long . do you mind watching this ? here , i have this cd - rom at your disposal . no doubt you want to take some photos . i ' m sure you know how many people watch this movie , right ? i don ' t see any of them watching it .

Roger Corman has enjoyed his shares of cinematic infamy in his illustrious low-budget career, spanning over 300 movies. While few (if any) would call him great, his films' obscure connections to underground culture (via reference, tribute, or influence) have ensured him a warped legacy of sorts. Throughout his career, he has also developed a bad habit of remaking his own films ("Piranha", "Humanoids from the Deep", "The Black Scorpion", etc. ), without improving on them in the slightest.

i think this is a pretty good movie , but one thing makes it very interesting to me . it is about a young man who finds himself with the most difficult life of his life . the problem is that there is no way to get around this . if we are to believe that this character is in love with the girl , then this movie ends up being more entertaining than any comedy i have seen or been to . i thought it might be interesting to look at this film ; however , i was wrong . what you need to see here is a lot like the story itself .

set mostly in the back streets of toronto ng is a dark , mysterious journey that takes the viewer into a strange world where the only thing you can make sense out of is someone being dead . this is about the most romantic and scary movie i have ever seen . it includes the " big - shot hollywood actor " coming to be part of an international terrorist organization that wants to eliminate the american people as a threat to our government . i read the film before i went to bed last night but could not believe what i saw .

A suprisingly good film considering the circumstances of its production. Features performances from no-name actors that rival the top talent on the planet (sadly none have persued a career). Also features the the god-like ability of Christopher Nolan to write perfect dialogue. Dialogue is what carries this story, which is about a man who likes to follow people for material for his books. Well shot, VERY well edited, even better written, and amazingly well performed.This movie has everything a great film needs, except people who have seen it.

this is a crummy film , a pretender to a genre of surprise ending movies . and a genre that was not very much fun . i have no doubt it would be quite interesting for the reader if they knew what was going on in there . i mean , i really expected it to be funny , even though i did n't see any of the jokes . it just looked dumb . i should have taken more time to pay attention to the script . who are these people doing this production ? and how many actors do those people have ?

I feel terribly sorry! Where the Lubitsch-pic was enchanting, marvelous, full of spirit and elegance, this one here is only - colored! Lana looks like 51 (in fact she was 31 at that time, but obviously depressive) and tries to play a shy and dull girlie. Think of Jeanette McDonald, who gave the role of the widow a double-faced depth by "playing" with Count Danilo. That Lana had to play an operetta although unable to sing - crazy! She only sings one song - the title role of an Lehar-operetta, that is really funny!

Honestly, this is a very funny movie if you are looking for bad acting (Heather Graham could never live this down... it has three titles for a reason- to protect the guilty! ), beautifully bad dialog ("Do you like... ribs? "), and a plot only a mother could approve, this is your Friday night entertainment! My roommate rented this under the title "Terrified" because he liked Heather Graham, but terrified is what we felt after the final credits. Not because the movie is scary, but because somebody actually paid money to make this turd on a movie reel.Horrible movie.

I have seen several Yul Brynner films--yet this is his best performance as the camera captures his emotions in close up as he snarls, smiles, and laughs. Brynner might have been equally arresting in Ten Commandments, Taras Bulba, The Magnificent Seven, The Brother Karamazov and the Mad Woman of Chaillot but none of these films have captured his range of talent in close ups as in this one. He is arresting and tantalizing to watch in every shot.Equally fascinating and sexy, without removing her clothes, is Deborah Kerr.

the ten steps has basically a reasonably good premise for a scary short but the execution is simply appalling . this is one of the worst movies ever made . it makes you want to vomit and your stomach twist up at the same time . there is just nothing about any of these characters or their stories that really tells you anything . they are all just like everything else that has happened in the movies . if you have enough money and know how to watch this , then you get to go to the movie theater .

Writer/director John Milius takes a little-known incident from American history and extrapolates wildly in all the right ways. The result is a grand adventure tale that showcases two of its stars in memorable, larger-than-life roles: Sean Connery as the wily Arab sheik with an inexplicable Scottish brogue, and Brian Keith as President Theodore Roosevelt, itching for the chance to put that "big stick" to good use.Aided immeasurably by Billy Williams' glorious widescreen cinematography and a magnificent score by the always reliable Jerry Goldsmith, this early effort seemed the harbinger of a talent to rank with contemporaries Lucas, Coppola and Spielberg.

I watched Love Life on holiday, when it was filmed at a film festival in Florida. It was a lovely surprise to find a British film that wasn't derivative or exploitive. A beautiful romantic comedy for a change that will charm the pants of audiences prepared to sit back and enjoy the gentle pace of the film. The transitions between scenes I found a bit distracting, but as whole I think Love Life is a winner, a ruby in the dust. One for all the family. A pleasant change to see a British film for teen audiences that isn't littered with four letter words.

during an eight - year stretch of the 1980s when charles bronson made nine films , only one was released by a local theater company in the 1960s . he lived in new york city with his wife for about thirty - five years , got his acting license at a small and relatively cheap theater and then moved in with his wife . now he 's working as an actor on this film . " i know what you mean . they 've seen it three times since that movie began and are still not convinced . how long have they been watching it ? "

buyer beware . the alpha video release uses a print that defies description . the movie was shot in color , which i did not understand at first , until i tried to look at the images . i thought this book was supposed to tell you everything about what it was like on earth , but no one ever told me they were taking so long to load it . then , i found it on a shelf when i was trying to keep it out of their hands . the only problem is i got distracted from the movie by the sound of a male voice .

ok , first of all , who in their right mind would remake hitchcock and second , who would do something like that ? and third , what in the hell was he doing with this film ? he was not a fan of country films , as well . he had spent most of his life thinking that maybe one day someone would pick it up and put it to use . so he had made an attempt to keep the film going , although he never found anyone who actually enjoyed it more . but there was still something wrong with it !

a lot of ' alternative ' comedy in britain in the 1980s was insular , misguided , overly - political , and unfunny . this has been my first criticism for this movie and it was an extremely bad one . not to mention , i have no hope that i will see the sequel to this film . when i saw the book on the market , i knew exactly how to get into the story . it seemed like an impossible dream ( or rather a very predictable idea ) but the plot was just as good . the only flaw was the lack of any other characters .

It starts a little slow but give it a chance. In the spirit of the "Wackiest Ship in the Arm" and the "Pink Sub" this movie is about a not so orthodox group engaged in not so orthodox methods to outwit everyone. Rob Schneider is priceless as a LT that takes himself way too seriously which results in a failed mutiny attempt and "pirate" crew makes him walk the plank. In contrast Kelsey Grammar(similar to Cary Grant)does not take anything to serious except the job. This movie is more about lines than plot.

Terribly disappointed with CITY OF MEN after being swept away by CITY OF GOD. Lost is the exciting and unpredictable storyline, and instead, in its place, is bland predictability with the obvious attempts at audience manipulation by a superficial pretentious production and distribution team. This story ended up feeling like a sappy soap opera rather than a gritty indie feature, which is what is should have been. This is what happens when distributors try to seek a wider audience (ridiculous sweeping shots of the Rio coastline, etc) at the expense of a gripping story and characters.

i recently had to watch this for a project in a sociology class and thought it was absolutely the worst . " " what is that ? " she asks . 
 " it 's basically an introduction of the theory behind the development of the universe . if you ever decide to read this , i think you might like it more than me . there are some very interesting - looking characters out there , but i ca n't really tell whether they are just actors who want to keep their heads down and get better grades . these guys are actually quite good .

first things first , i am by no means a picky movie watcher . i ' m not one of those " how much can you afford this " fan - mail fans who ca n't take a hint and do something about it . for example , i could have gotten a copy of this to me at some point today , but i wasn ' t so keen on looking through it right away because i really didn ' t want to miss any of the action . so i decided to make myself look at the whole thing .

Okay, so writer/director Larry Bishop obviously has some important connections and knows the right people in Hollywood in order to produce his own film and fill up the cast with eye-catching names. Good for him! Now what he really still needs is inspiration and talent in order to come up with an actually worthwhile scenario rather than the overly pretentious and wannabe convoluted crap he penned down here. "Hell Ride" isn't a movie; it's a hectic and hopelessly inept fan-boy endeavor to bring homage to the notorious biker-flicks of the 60's and to the recently revived Grindhouse cinema formula in general.

years ago , i used to watch bad movies deliberately . somehow i missed this one . no gesture rings a bell . i must be missing something because when i saw the script i just did not want to see it again . if you have ever seen this movie , please make your own comment about me being stupid enough to watch this movie and i would appreciate it if you could recommend someone else . this book is based on the premise that every character in it really wants their characters to win . there are lots of places where the hero gets shot in some kind of horrible way and he goes insane .

this movie does n ' t have any pretense at being great art , which is good . but it is a really boring movie , and when i was young my father would watch it with us . it had one of those terrible episodes where he tries to read it out loud so everyone could hear him . i found out that if you watch it twice you will know that it is supposed to be a horror movie . the actors do not seem to understand why the movie is making so much noise . how can there be an audience for something like this ?

although it is n ' t mentioned very often , ` ` do n ' t look in the basement ' ' is a very interesting series of movies . most are comedic and have an extremely funny twist , so that 's a good reference . there is a major plot line that will be made for this movie and if you feel you must take part in it , then just leave the theater as soon as possible without getting paid . i really ca n't get over the fact that people who go to see a movie spend $ 20 , 000 to have a decent film done on dvd .

fair and nifty little science fiction / horror fantasy thriller about a well - known video game designer , allegra geller ( jennifer jason ) , has the title of a film that looks as if it would be made on an american tv show . she claims not to even know her movie was made on television , but i think she really knows how to pull off a good plot . i saw her at the movies several times in my life and never wanted to see anything else , so here i am standing in the middle of a large studio filled with all kinds of crap .

this is perhaps the worst movie i have ever seen , and i have seen well over 300 movies in the last five years . unfortunately , this film is very badly made and i will be happy to leave it unsold for a long time . as you can imagine by the way the credits are going , i have no problem watching it . there are many good comedic reasons behind the movie . it does not get any better than this . if you want to know the bad things that were done with the script of one of these movies , you should watch this movie at your favorite cinematographer 's house .

first of all , i believe that this movie is much more appreciated by viewers who have actually read joseph stalin 's work . in fact , some would argue that he was inspired to be the greatest film maker on the planet . but as you know , it was a big disappointment to any of us because we saw him at least half a dozen or so times throughout the entire book . however , one memorable event happened when the movie started . A bunch of full-length movies featuring the Muppets, created by Jim Henson & Co, have been made, but "The Muppet Movie" was the first one of them all, and the first in the original trilogy, which also features "The Great Muppet Caper" and "The Muppets Take Manhattan". It was released seven years before I was born, so I obviously didn't get to see it at the time (nor did I get to see its two successors when they were first released). However, I saw a lot of the Muppets during my childhood, mostly after Henson's premature death in 1990.

I'm guessing that the movie was based on a hefty book. Given the number of characters and subplots during Katyn, I thought that the movie creators, perhaps the writer or director, intended to create an epic movie. But really there wasn't enough time to properly spend on developing characters or story. Aggravatingly, there were many unrelated side-stories that could have been edited out.In relating the events leading up to the mass-murder of all these intellectuals and officers, I don't think the movie explained any reasons why murder was necessary. Was it political? Philosophical? Revenge?

After the success of Star Wars, there was a boost in interest in Sci-Fi movies. This was one of those cheap attempts to cash in quickly.A group of survivors from a spaceship land on a planet inhabited by stop-motion dinosaurs, where half of them are systematically killed off (the people not the dinosaurs). Porn-movie level acting. Cheap special effects, even for the time, although it looks like a lot of effort was put into them.Costumes were pure 1970's, as were the hairstyles. Ahh, the 70's. I expected a disco to break out at any minute.Nothing to really recommend in this film.

My girlfriend wanted to see this (lol this is the case a lot)...so I rented it. Then I saw how acclaimed this was nominated for 10 Oscars. GREAT! this should be good ol' drama. This movie had a lot of potential...the direction and the way everything was paced was very well. But once the movie ended, I couldn't help but ask myself if this story was really worth making a film for. Virginia Hill (Annette Bening) was EXTREMELY annoying, I just couldn't tolerate her character at all.

this movie was * good * relatively during the first parts of it . we have a story , from 3 points to 4 points , and we want to see how it turns out . there seems to be only about two or three minutes in any one episode , but that should be enough . so let 's get back to the beginning of this movie . i thought i remembered reading something about a big family who went on to make their parents work all the money . apparently they spent $ 40 , 000 with an uncle ' s girlfriend . what kind of friend are you ?

i thought the movie was sub - par . the acting was good but not great , the story was funny but no matter how bad your plot , you knew it could n't last . and this movie would have been much better if someone else had picked it up and played it . i was beginning to like these two guys a little bit . they always seemed like they liked the movie more than what was expected of them . one time when they were about to go out to a restaurant together he asked her to take him home .

Audrey, I know you truly cherish your husband Ted's memory but PLEASE do his legacy justice and heed his wishes. Dr. Seuss refused to license his characters during his lifetime for a very good reason. We beg of you to please stop cashing in on his stories, images, fantasies and characters. They are getting disemboweled by the powers that be of Hollywood and Broadway. The children of tomorrow will be stuck with these histrionic and grotesque interpretations that will forever pollute the loving warmth and innocence of his books.It is indeed your property to do with as you wish.

i realize the line on my summary is not too polite . this film written & directed by scott caan & starring , jim smith , steve henshaw , tom jones , stephen king , andrew carroll , and a few other characters in this work . however , i prefer to refer to these characters for their good quality . there are lots of good qualities : the humor , the depth of character , and the overall storyline . even if you did n't care about all the details , it would be nice to hear from people who do . thank you so much for your critique , etc .

although this movie ( and i use the term loosely ) was made in 1997 , we just watched it a few weeks ago . what do you want to be when you are not a movie director ? do you want to play the hero or the villain ? have you ever thought that you might end up hating your job more than you love it ? did you ever wish you could hate it more than you love it ? there is no such thing as good movies because you can never understand how people should really think about their own lives . the world is so unfair !

I love this show. It's clever and very well acted. David Morse and Andre Braugher have great chemistry. The writing is clever and subplots generally give great comic relief. After every new episode, I'm always amazed how thought provoking and at the same time entertaining this show is. My only complaint would be Donna Murphy's absence, at this point, in the second season. As David Morse ex-wife, Heather, she added such character to the show.I think this show is a credit to the crime/drama genre.

Jack Lemmon was one of our great actors. His performances in Days Of Wine And Roses, The Apartment, Some Like It Hot, Missing (to name the first ones that come to mind) were all worthy of Best Actor nomination. His only win was for Save The Tiger, and that's a shame. He gets melancholy down to a science, but never brings it into balance with the driver in his character. He actually did a similar character much better toward the end of his career in the one-note Glengarry Glen Ross.

i love movies . . . and rarely do i see a movie that i hate . . . but this was the worst movie i had ever seen . you know , i never watched one of those bad ones where someone comes out on the stage and it is not so bad . . . just creepy . this movie was pretty much worse . i 'm sure most people around here are shocked at the first sight of horror movies , but these are real life shit . this is the worst movie i 've seen . there 's no telling how many years it has been since i saw a horror movie .

this movie is bad , so bad that my mother who can barely stand the ` ` suspense ' ' of disney has to go into it and find out for herself . as if i did n't already know that there was a special place in her life where all the other kids would love to hear her sing and play the piano . i do not want to even begin to imagine what she would have said to those children when they first saw the movie . well , maybe " you will get to meet him " could have been better , but i really think the show must have gone way too far .

it ' s 1913 . a studio prop boy spies the actress who is going to become hollywood ' s next great - daughter and then , after an awkward encounter with his sister , finds himself watching a movie without any idea of how it ' s going to work out . that ' s when i start to understand why they make such a good set . the character is so boring . he ' s supposed to be clever but instead he looks completely clueless . the acting is horrible . there are too many wrong turns .

a stupid movie , with a stupid plot . feels like they threw every imaginable cliche in a blender . this film is so horrible that i wish i could just go home and drop off the dvds . why am i allowed to see this ? it 's a total waste of money for me to spend all that time on something so stupid . how could anyone think such a horrid movie was good enough to entertain someone ? what do i care whether or not it has a good laugh ? who cares about a lame movie if there is no good comedy ?

This movie is a haunting telling of the life of the author and poet, Mishima. It jumps around through his past, through his last day, and through some of his stories but is expertly constructed as it moves from section to section. It captures the flavor of the man, his work and of his times...the difficult 1960s.I think the most wonderful parts (literally, full of "wonder") are the excerpts from his works. The sets (especially designed to work with the camera) are amazing....stylized, beautiful and effective.

this film is a cash in . a cash in reliant on a rousing theme tune created for an earlier episode of " old world " . i thought that was about all i could take with me , and that the rest of the movie should be more interesting . i did n't think at all it was going to be a great first book , but i suppose it may have been . i am sure you know this as well as i do . there are so many good comedies , films and dialog in this film that it seems they have nothing better to do than to skip over everything .

This movie has got to be the biggest disappointment I've ever experienced with a film. The acting is horrific, the suspense build up minimal, and the plot overall is ridiculous. I found myself rooting for the victim to just hurry up and become a victim, because she obviously needed to be put out of her misery. Anyone with rudimentary knowledge of how the world works will immediately be disgusted at the leaps we're asked to make in logic, and the so-called suspenseful buildup would be lucky to get a 3 year old to be mildly worried.

no redeeming features , this film is rubbish . its jokes do n ' t begin to be funny . the humour is wasted in the end that it should ever have been made into a movie at all . the only thing good about this film was that it was a bit of a disappointment to the reader . i mean , you can see why i would be so opposed to this one , and i know i would not want to spend my entire career just sitting on a beach with two friends ( or even three ) while waiting for something like this to happen .

i have never been as surprised by a film that was this old . only ` ` the treasure of the american empire ' came to my attention when i saw this movie on the screen , about a couple of people who went out to dinner and got into a fight , they had taken a bunch of photos of the car accident , but there were not many in the picture , just enough to put a smile on my face . however , this movie was so horrible that i really wished i could have stayed in it for more than 3 or 4 minutes .

this weird movie from texas is about fallon , a dilettante rich boy in the late 1800s ( although he was very handsome when he was younger , with dark hair and eyes ) , but i know what happened here . you just do n't see all these strange movies like this anymore . some of the characters ' names are interesting , but the dialogue is really slow . it would have been easy for me to read the dialogue without seeing the character , but i found it rather boring . anyway , that is another story that will remain an enigma to the reader until the sequel comes along .

certain filmmakers can do no wrong in the eyes of national critics , which is one reason you should never consider this movie , because i was not able to purchase this film or any of the other films that will be released next month . as far as making it better than what it truly was , i did manage to make it seem good . the only drawback to this production is that the cast and crew were not all too eager to get on the road with a movie they had already been selected for and who knew how long they would be there .

ok , if you like yer monster moovies sullen , stiff , starchy , and thunderously dull , but with lots of room for improvement ! . if this novel is made available on smashwords at amazon.com or in print , please look for an example of this horror movie . while the plot was very good , it was so bad that i had to take a long break to get it under control . i do n't remember how many times i 've watched this movie , although i have seen plenty of movies during my time off . however , i am quite certain that the film does not make any sense .

Forget Jimmy Stewart reliving his life and opt for this smart comedy of errors instead. I suppose only institutionalized sexism explains why this flick and Stanwyck's other great Christmas story, "Meet John Doe" aren't revered with the same level of love as...well, you know it's name.Stanwyck plays a food writer for a McCall's-type rag who has been lying for years to her pompous publisher about the folksy setting for her recipes. She's an ace b.s. artist until the day Morgan's sailor is pulled from the ocean after 18 days afloat & 6 weeks recuperation in a Navy hospital.

This movie is an abortive, stillborn attempt to stitch together several bad movies and make some sort of extra-bad movie. It fails at even this, since there's way too much "plot", and not nearly enough goofy puppets and ridiculous gore. Seriously, the puppets are sweet, and the guys in suits crack me up pretty good. The performances are C-grade at best and lame throughout, with special props to the Spec-Ops guy who spoke some sort of bizarre East Coast/Venusian dialect that was almost impossible to decipher. Not that you really care what he says, as only the curse words are distinct.

` ` japan takes the best from around the world and makes it their own ' ' , while that may be a good thing . for some reason , people tend not to understand the meaning of an english word until they see the movie in person . but even then , this was one of the first times i saw movies that went out of date . since you can see most movies on television , there are some really great things that happen . however , what happens in these movies is pretty bad . here , in the united states , it is called " the french revolution " .

wow . what can i say ? i was born in 1960 . i love bad tv movies . love it when someone else has to live a life like this . they do have good taste in music . i loved all the classics . at least i did n't listen to any of them , i just wanted to stop listening to the movie . i thought it was great . i mean i loved the way the characters played with each other . i really hated those people . why are they making such an awful movie ? let me put it that way .

` ` opposing force [ 1986 ] ' ' was n ' t as good as ` ` dr . strangelove ' ' and it was n ' t quite that good either , but if you go through the whole film with a little extra flair you can get to see about a dozen other films in progress . some of these have got their own special qualities : the quality of celluloid , the ability to walk , the way they speak , how they behave . the most important feature is the fact that they do not take the lead for a movie .

Any chance to see Katharine Hepburn in something I haven't seen or from her early movie career is a treat, and on that level the film is amusing, but she's horrible miscast as a Hill Billy. Her famous New England enunciation slips through, making lines like, "I'd better rustle up some Vittles" pretty ludicrous. She's so pretty and so young it almost overcomes this major flaw. The story is an old fashioned melodrama, and there fore, a younger generation may think this pretty corny stuff, but this was the staple of American Entertainment well into the 1940's.

i am appalled to see that so many people have given positive reviews for this ` ` film ' ' . this is absolutely ridiculous and you will never believe how bad this movie is . in fact , it is not only terrible , but it is completely unfair ! if a writer or actress gets sick , they should just let the cast decide who dies . this movie was designed by an unscrupulous person with no desire to make money . this movie does not exist as we would expect it to be based on real life characters .

hope the summary line wo n ' t irritate you that much ( it ' s a little homage to the chappelle show / charlie . " i ' m so happy i ' ve read that one , but this movie is such a waste of talent and material that i ' m afraid i would have been disappointed if i had n't seen the part in the first place . there was not one interesting thing in this movie . the actors seemed like they were having a very boring life . well , the movie started off fine with some serious plot errors .

i agree with all aforementioned comments . this show was a delight to watch . funny , witty , terrific ... and i have no idea what i was looking for , but i had to admire it . it 's nothing like anything i have witnessed in any of the magazines or movies i have watched . not only that , but i saw some pretty incredible stuff while on the job . it is a shame that my friends are watching this show . they really would like to see this show . even if it is a complete waste of my money and time .

as i write this in november 2005 i ' ve become aware that the great british boom of cinema has come from a movie set by a popular film company . it was supposed to be made in the 1950s , but the big change came during the last 10 years of its life span . so there are lots of old - school films , just like this one . but they didn ' t quite work out as i wanted them to . this is not the sort of movie that i thought would be fun for my wife .

i almost stopped watching hindi movies because of the mediocre quality and story lines . one exception for this is the film called " the death of a man " . it is made up of short stories that were not very clever or interesting at the start , but when they eventually made sense , they did n't have any other choice . the ending was pretty good and i thought it would actually be fun until the villain started talking about people in the movie . if you ever wanted to try a new movie , please take the time to think about how to get there and what to expect .

i saw this turkey in the theater , but i had a good time . the special effects are n ' t very interesting as long as you are too busy watching the actors . it seems like every single one of them knows what they want to do or will do . it is just so depressing . some of my best films are made in that theater . the movie itself was really bad . i could n't stand it . when i watched it , i thought , " ok , let 's see if this thing kills people . . . i 'm not a big fan of horror movies .

nightkill stars robert mitchum as a world - weary private eye probing the case of a missing industrialist ( mike connors ) and his wife . one of the highlights of my summer in new zealand was seeing andy holmes . after the movie is over , i get out of bed and walk down the stairs to the kitchen for a cup of coffee . it 's nearly three in the morning and i am really looking forward to waking up on a sunday morning . i go to the living room where andy is already at the kitchen table talking with her parents .

the most intense and powerful film i have seen in years . there have been other films before that delved into this genre of movie , but it has never been to my liking , so i had no desire to see it . as a result , i spent the remainder of my first week staring at the screen with a mixture of annoyance and curiosity . i sat down for a few minutes to get my composure back and try to concentrate on the movie . it was good , but not what i am looking for .

This movie was obviously made with a very low budget, but did they have to make it so obvious? It looked like they made no effort to make the "future" look in the least futuristic. For example, the first scene takes place in an 80's office building and all the cars that get blown up are from the late 70's (I assume they didn't want to blow up cars that cost more than $500). Additionally, its pretty obvious that Don "the Dragon" is driving his personal car during the movie (after all, he did partially fund the film).

i do n ' t know what it is exactly , but the film is happily sitting on my shelf , with a few more titles . i can make out the title : " to kill an assassin in the desert ! " as if there really is a movie like this here . i 've never seen it , so i am not sure why i have seen it . i was pretty shocked when i read it earlier . i guess i liked it because it gave me a chance to look around for a bit and figure out where the movie went from there .

I had heard good things about "States of Grace" and came in with an open mind. I thought that "God's Army" was okay, and I thought that maybe Dutcher had improved and matured as a filmmaker. The film began with some shaky acting, and I thought, "well, maybe it will get better." Unfortunately, it never did. The picture starts out by introducing two elders -- Mormon missionaries -- and it seems that the audience will get to know them and grow to care about them.

when i sat down to watch greek for the first time , i was n ' t expecting a show with complex script writing . it started out as a movie about an ancient warrior who lived on a island , and his son killed him before he could finish killing him . that was after the battle of herodotus where he killed two warriors during the battle . ( i think there were too many people watching to know that . ) i remember that this movie was so poorly written that i made a mistake . the ending was worse than the characters had originally thought it would be .

one of chaplin ' s longest films up to that point , burlesque on carmen is a clever and surprisingly complex plot . while the film made her feel as if she lived in a different century , i think this is just about the first time she really let down her guard around people . it took me awhile to get used to the idea that she was such a good actress . even though it 's been two months now since we went to mexico , for all i know there could be a million more people out there at any minute .

from the portrayals of andy warhol in the films i shot andy warhol and basquiat , this is the type of film that might appeal to you . there is a lot of sex and moaning and yelling and screaming going on . it would probably be very easy to see the production with the actors being so excited but they would not have time to do much . this is an even better scene ; all the actors are having such a good time that when they start getting annoyed or angry they get confused and start shouting and making funny noises .

This movie must be exported to the rest of the world! An absolute masterpiece, with a both bizarre and grim film about four different stories from four different locations in Sweden. The one with the newly renovated hotel with the improper wooden figure of an old finance minister is absolutely the best of the four, odd story about love or career. I would love to see all four as a film on their own they can be so much more extended. Also the unique pause in the middle is something I've never seen before.Can't wait for the series (if they're doing one) or the extended DVD.
