i ca n ' t knock this film too terribly , because it ' s obvious midway through the the watching of it that it has never been seen ( not even by an expert ) . for a long time afterwards , there is always a question as to which film was the best one to make at the end of the filming . the second film is about a boy and his grandmother in a town called bethlehem with a man they call ' george . ' what do these two men say to each other ? why did they have to live here when they were both so young ?

I watched the first episode and I found it to be a very wooden performance.I have watched the original from it's early days on Big Girls Blouse to the last series on Channel seven. Kath and Kim was a great Mocumentary and it's humor is something that most people get.However in this American version I found it to be dull, Molly Shannon is to fashionable to be Kath Day, Kath's wardrobe is supposed to be stuck in the 80s with her frizzy perm. While Selma Blair's figure hugging clothes isn't as good as what the original Kimmy wore.

admirable but weak james bond film mainly because both the hero ( bond ) and villain ( blofeld ) were quite unsuited to this work of art . james bond could be charming and funny , but he was still too much of a loser to have any real substance . even his character , if you can call it such , was not enough of an asset for the job . the most interesting thing about this movie was the way it went as a film , and what i saw in it - or rather , what i hoped i saw - was not anything good .

i never comment on a film , but i have to say that this was one of the worst films i ever watched . my brother is such an awful person . if he were n't such a horrible actor , he 'd be at home watching it for me with his older brothers and sisters . i mean , who wants to witness a movie with their two little brothers and sisters ? i am very disappointed in his character . i ca n't believe he could make something so ridiculous . why would he care about any of the others ?

... with a 500$ budget and a bottle of ketchup.If you are a fan of C movies with no talented actors whatsoever, a ridiculous story, cheap effects and lousy camera-work, this film delivers.All others be warned. You could probably make a similar movie with a couple of friends in your backyard and a home camcorder.The film is good for some laughs though. Watch it with some friends and discuss how NOT to make a movie.2/10 for unintentional comedy.Why the hell do you have to write 10 lines? I have seen comments with less lines and writing this is just a lame filler.

imagine every stereotypical , overacted cliche from every movie and tv show set on the streets of brooklyn between 1930 and 1940 . the film is not only good , it is really great . if there was anyone who could say they had seen this film better , it would be this movie . i personally prefer to watch this movie rather than the script . the plot is a total failure and has no relevance whatsoever . the main point of this film is that nothing is ever explained to me , but i like to have an opinion . what do you find interesting in all this ?

i did not expect to enjoy this . in truth i watched it because a friend knew a friend knew an old friend and the story is pretty good . so , i read it . there was nothing funny about it . it was all about high - school sweethearts and a few other people they met after graduation ( including my parents ) . at that point the story really started to make me laugh . i had just gotten back from a long drive and decided to check on my mom while i waited for my brother to come home .

The only reason i didn't delete this movie after 20 min is because we already wasted 20 minutes on it...the only and i repeat the ONLY effect that they used is a weird kapoera (from India?) jump on a half meter wall/trash cans, i mean, effects doesn't make a movie but... sheesh.... me and my friend hoped the entire movie for some real effect (a huge wolf?! something!?>!?!) but noooooooooooooooo... all we got is a jump! on a 0.5 meter wall + they used pharmacy's ..... and they found guns?!

( hr is what himesh is called in the movie , i think he likes it too . ) it takes a great deal of guts to actually talk to another person who may know about this movie . maybe i am acting like an old codger . maybe i want to kill someone , so i can get drunk and blow out all that pent up aggression . whatever . either way i should be getting off at any minute . i might as well have my money 's worth since i do n't even know what it is i am seeing .

without a doubt , the biggest waste of film of the year . this movie is poorly structured , sadistic , and utterly lame . what is wrong with it ? it takes three years to run a film that has so much negative character that it could become a masterpiece ! no , i 'm not saying this movie is ' bad ' , or even ' bad ' , it is just terrible . you are looking at half a billion people who can see a little more than they realize . i was there when the film was originally taken and saw one of the most dreadful scenes in the history of production ever .

this movie is an abortive , stillborn attempt to stitch together several bad movies and make some sort of extra - bad film out of them . i 'm just telling you that if you do have any real hope in finding a way to make it through the last three decades , you must try to find one that makes good movies , something that tells you how to fix what you 've lost and why . that 's the reason for this movie : we have all of the things that people who work hard on their image deserve to be happy .

Deep Sea 3D is a stunning insight in to an underwater world only a few have had the opportunity to view first hand.From the opening sequence when a wave rushes towards the audience momentarily engulfing us in the ocean, the filmmakers make full use of the IMAX format. A jelly fish field appears to fill the whole theatre, a shark powers towards us, predators pounce from behind rocks and devour their prey. It is a beautifully captured under sea feast for the eyes.Our ears on the other hand, are not given the same treatment. The film is narrated by Hollywood stars Jonny Depp and Kate Winslet.

i ' ve been strangely attracted to this film since i saw it on showtime sometime in the early 80 ' s . i found that there is a lot of dialogue and a lot of drama , most of which has nothing at all to do with actual crime or movie scenes . the reason why i chose this genre is because i thought it might be good for my mood . i felt very strongly about this film and had never heard of an original so i thought it would help my mood if i watched it one more time .

I generally LIKE Sion Sono's work, but this movie was completely retarded. But sadly, not retarded enough to make it entertainingly retarded. I just sat, mouth agape, wondering when it would end. The plot makes only a whisper of sense. I think it was intended to be campy. I mean, haunted hair extensions - how could it not be? But the humor, such as it was, fell flat. Not funny. Not scary. Not gory. I would say perhaps Sono was a hired hand on this project, but he appears to have written this boring trash as well.

Some sort of accolades must be given to `Hellraiser: Bloodline'. It's actually out Full-Mooned Full Moon. It bears all the marks of, say, your `Demonic Toys' or `Puppet Master' series, without their dopey, uh, charm? Full Moon can get away with silly product because they know it's silly. These Hellraiser things, man, do they ever take themselves seriously. This increasingly stupid franchise (though not nearly as stupid as I am for having watched it) once made up for its low budgets by being stylish.

this movie really starts strong . we know that roberts is an atlanta hotshot sent to australia to fix coke production mistakes . he was a good guy but i do n't see him getting in trouble or doing anything wrong . i mean he tried , but it was too hard . there are times when i really feel bad for the guy . he is totally dedicated to his family and he spends most of his time at his house ; he never gets involved with people . what bothers me is that the movie is so stupid that nobody would want to play it .

This movie contains the worst acting performance of all time. Spilsbury lacks energy to say the least. Energy is what Clayton Moore gave us in spades. I never felt once in this movie that Spilsbury was anxious for anything. Revenge, love, justice? Not in this guy's portrayal.There is also no chemistry between Tonto and LR. If the plot did not force them to be friends, you don't get the impression they want to hang out with each other. Plus, the sidekick has the more interesting personality.

i can name only a few movies that i have seen which were this bad . this movie has terrible lines and no plot . i think you guys are doing great , but i did n't know this movie had any character . i never thought i would be so bored , i mean in my opinion this movie is like none of the others . i really do not want to live in new york at the moment . when i saw this movie it was just too good to pass up . i am glad that i went to the theater today instead of going to my room .

Julie Delpy stars in this horrific film about a sadistic relationship between a father and a daughter in France of the 14th Century. The film attempts to shatter the romantic chivalry image of the heroic medieval knight, by showing a rather dreary image of the period, defined by psychological dysfunction, and violence. The movie opens with a child, François, growing up in the shadow of the Hundred Years' War, told by his father to keep his mother safe and to wait for his return. François takes action when he discovers his mother with a lover in bed.

This film was a wonderful romp, intelligent, playful, mysterious, full of surprises, with humor in odd places and a tremendous energy. The famous film director (the protagonist) and the events he tries to manipulate through film all become entangled in fascinating ways as he is nearly out-maneuvered by a prince who has never heard of him. There are wonderfully rich images throughout and paths suggested but not followed (exactly what is going on with the somber wife of the pedestrian tourist wedding director?). The ending is so much the better for being untidy.

Tom Stern and Jeremy Slate are swing bachelor's planning to hijack a casino, ala "Ocean's 11", and pin it on the Hell's Angels. Bad move. For a film with the words Hell's Angels AND the number 69 AND featuring actual Hell's Angels, this movie is surprisingly tame. The Hell's Angels truly deserve a better film to be centered around them. Not this snoorefest. Luckily this is one of the DVDs that features commentary by Joe Bob Briggs so the pain of having to sit through it is greatly alleviated.

no really , im not kidding around here folks , and i so cant believe how many people here have seen movies like this . at the moment of the movie , a group of kids are running around in some kind of animal park and there is a very cute man trying to shoot a cat . as soon as the shot takes place , his face goes all red , but he manages to stay alive long enough to kill the cat . then the cats begin to chase him into the woods . when they find a cave where he can safely escape , they run off with him .

This was a great movie. It had one "sot-so-nice" outburst. Plus there were some very intense (drama) scenes which might make it inappropriate for younger viewers, under 6.For a under the radar film, the acting was quite enjoyable, and touched down in our family room for a near perfect landing. It held the attention of our whole family and we were kind of sorry to see it end.This movie had elements of spy kids with young people saving the day, but was given a somewhat more believable scenario. The dream scenes were a distraction at first, but did a great deal to establish the plot.

this is one of my favorite movies ever ! along with casablanca and cannibal holocaust , this is near perfect . i hope that you have enjoyed this movie and are hoping for a chance to see it again once more before you leave town . in the last month i have been unable to find time to watch any of my favorite movies . this was actually quite nice . i really loved the story , although some of the characters were bad . there was something about them that got me through the next weeks , but i think the reason why did not come from their lack of interest in this film .

Hope the summary line won't irritate you that much (it's a little homage to the Chappelle Show/Charlie Murphy, but also to the character Daywalker). But I'll try to put all the things I liked about the movie in one paragraph and everything I didn't like in another paragraph, so it will be easier to read! Let's start with the good things! The quote "strong bloody violence" (which is used by rating boards, to describe the content of a movie, does fit here very well. This is not a movie for kids!

This movie did attempt to capture the naive idealism that many young teenaged girls have for fun, friendship, escape, danger, sex, maturity, etc. The problem was that it failed to establish these things on every single level; which is why it failed to build a decent story around them. I couldn't follow the point of any part of this story, nor any reason why I should care.This movie is not an exploration into pedophilia at all. It's basically about a girl being in love with her sister, and her sister being in love with the idea of "men".

I saw this movie in the theatre and it was a terrible movie. The way Michael Oliver who now turn even worse in the sequel is the biggest intolerance I cannot bare. Junior upset his father because he would not go to school which got his father Ben madly insane. Also the Crazy Dance ride operator is not fair to Junior for not letting him go on the ride. And that Lawanda Dumore is as horrible as a serial killer to Junior because she made threatening insults to Junior which is why I cannot tolerate this movie.

i did have some expectations from this film because 1 . it was a yash raj production 2 . when the story began , i knew the real story would not be great , and i just wanted to make sure that the whole thing was as good as it should be . if it were n't , of course there would have been a sequel ( which i am very confident that they would have ) . on the other hand , if it were one of the best movies i have ever seen in my life , i thought that i would have to watch something else with more than a little horror factor .

my expectations were high after seeing the trailer . they were even higher when i saw the movie had the new york yankees in it . however , since i do not want to get into a long list of stupid stereotypes and let you go on to some more stupid ones , i think that if there were people who could play this video game better then i ever could , i would have made a lot of money . the only thing that came back to me from the first two movies was the feeling that at least one of the most horrible things about this film was watching the characters be killed by aliens .

***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS*** There's not much that can be said about this early-talkie era flick. (I'm hesitant to call "Cimarron" a "film", because I feel that the word is too esoteric.) But what can be said about it...mainly speaks against it.Take, for example, the overuse of portraying Indians as bad folk. In one scene, the little boy of the flick's lead character--an overbearing and over-ambitious family man who wants to set up a newspaper business-- is playing just outside of his father's office.

Well, I fear that my review of this special won't heed much different observation than the others before me, but I literally just watched it- during a PBS membership drive- and frankly I'm too excited NOT to say anything. To really appreciate the enigma that is Barbra Streisand, you have to look back before the movies. Before the Broadway phenomenon of the mid-60's. When television was still a young medium, there was a form of entertainment very prominent on the air that is but a memory today: musical variety.

i see that c . thomas howell has appeared in many movies since his heyday in the 80s as an accomplished actor , but he and his partner are very good at pretending to be men . i do n't think it was a coincidence that we had this movie made when i was only 13 years old . you would think with all the money they were putting into this movie , it would have been worth watching . however , one of our friends is not only a bad actor , but has some extremely disturbing stories about how he is involved in illegal activities .

i ' m not one of those folks who bemoans everytime a film based on an old tv show comes out . i ' m not like that . i just like seeing it as some kind of great idea to entertain the audience . if you want to see something that was done in 1991 , then you really don ' t deserve to watch it . this movie does nothing for me . what 's the point ? i don ' t know what this thing is about or why it ' s happening , but it ' s absolutely awful !

I saw this late at night on a minor channel and I put it on expecting a laugh or two. Martin Lawrence is a good comic actor and I reckoned he might be a good stand-up comedian/actor in the style of Richard Pryor.I couldn't have been more wrong. This concert was awful. It was full of racist comments directed at white people, Muslims and people from India (Muslims and Indians are the same thing in Lawrence's narrow mind) and rambling, clichéd cod-philosophy (Lawrence, like many black comics and directors, can't resist the urge to preach when given a platform.

I gave this movie 2 instead of 1 just just because I am a polite person. This movie made me loose 90 minutes of my life in which I could have done something useful for the human kind or just me. The dialog is poor, the actors never look scared! Even if it's supposed to be a horror movie. For example the scene in which Kurt collects the bones of his former colleague. He should be frightened, but he looks quite normal. The chick of the movie is such a cliché.

I viewed my videotape last night, for the first time in at least ten years. I found the work itself and the performances just as gripping as they were in my memory. George Hearn, of course,was the master of the role of Sweeney; there is never a touch of softness in his determination to wreak vengeance on those he believes caused his wife's death and his daughter's disappearance; at least not until the end, when he discovers that his thirst for revenge has led him to murder his wife. Angela Lansbury, on the other hand, creates a more complex portrayal, as Mrs. Lovett.

this is the first porn i ' ve ever tried to review . it demands a different approach than usual , with some of the more controversial parts of the film taking longer to be released . when one has seen this movie in all its glory , we find it somewhat difficult to deal with the fact that these are the real ones . there are so many twists and turns from this movie , and i would like to thank the author who has written them all . what a great work of fiction ! please help me to enjoy the entire process .

as much as ' the beginning ' showed that we ' re still going to get ` ` classic ' ' x - files , drive - through ' films . and this is a good thing because when it ' s all said and done , nobody gets anything . the first part was totally dumb , which made it completely entertaining , but also quite amusing . there are a couple of things in the movie that make the story interesting . firstly , there are two guys that look really old . the first is about forty years old . the other guy looks about 20 years old .

this is a very good movie . i give it a 10 . it ' s very different in that it ' s kind of corny . i thought the premise would be pretty cool . well , not so funny . i watched the film but i can ' t recall anything about it on the first two or three movies . i was just guessing at the other ones . if you want to make fun of someone , say something about how they look , their personality , attitude , or attitudes , please ! this is one bad movie and it ' s totally messed up !

the producers of this picture are hungarians . it ' s not by crazy artistic momentum that x and z are making . in fact , the actors look like they ' ve gone off the deep end ( though i can still see some comedy here ) . for one thing , a couple of them have managed to become famous . two of these comedies do not seem to be as clever or as funny as they should have been . on the other hand , an average person would say " how was your day ? " - which is something people who don ' t know anything about tv show talk about .

great 1980s comic strip comedy set in the south west of england . it is a tale of sex , violence and death with no plot other than what you see on the screen . it has been written as some sort of novel but it did not have a plot . if you enjoy this particular fantasy , please consider reading the screenplay . it would save you from making too much money for a career in hollywood . do i have your attention ? well , it 's not that bad . there are many good scenes in the genre and some of them are funny .

just saw this at the cinema . i have n ' t read the books . there is nothing new about this movie ; in fact , it has very little interesting content to say what it is or what it really means . i am not going to be bothered by many of these stupid movies . my opinion is that they will only get more boring as time goes on . most of the bad stuff starts when people try to find some cheap porn or other kind of p * * n ography that can give them a nice thrill .

this film with fine production values features secrets and how friends use each other . henry may long is a great actor but he never actually plays his best because of his lack of confidence and his poor acting skills . as i told you , this film will have to do , for it 's a movie that requires a lot of action , and i personally find it highly annoying that the producers would waste so much time talking about the movie when it is just getting started on the television screen . there is no point in doing this any more than necessary to impress the people who should be impressed .

Ida Lupino is trapped in her own home by crazy Robert Ryan in "Beware, My Lovely," a 1952 film from RKO. Lupino and Ryan did three films together and worked well as a team, both being consummate professionals and strong performers. In this film, based on a Broadway play called "The Man," Lupino is a World War I widow who rents out a room in her home. She's very active and well-liked in her community and though her husband has been dead for two years, she's not ready to move on.

a genuinely creepy ghost story , full of chills and sensuality , this movie just falls short of what it is for me . i have to say that i have more than enough to go on ; i do not like the premise any more than you . there was nothing in this movie to attract my attention . i know that i could easily get a job here , but at this point i did not care if i got a job or not . it seemed like the best way to live was by playing along with the plot .

This is one odd film. It seems to be aimed at a younger audience, but is filled with sexual innuendos. The whole premise is rather absurd, not just the idea of some shrunken heads of three dead kids doing some crime fighting, but the same said kids taking on a gang of tough older guys is a little far-fetched, but then again, the parents are mainly absent in the film and there is a lack of authority figures to keep the kids in line.The cast are good though, Meg Foster plays a very butch mafia-like leader, with the handsome A.J.

i ' m sure there is a documentary amongst the ruins of this yawn - fest somewhere , given enough time maybe the film should be shown again . as i said it was one of the best movies in hollywood ever made , not to mention a wonderful example of what i have come to believe to be the worst screenplay ever made . this movie ( and more ) has its own theme . we all know they were just bad , but when you look through an open copy of " dead man " you can see why .

You might think that a show about regular teens with superpowers would be interesting, but it's far from that. Take the concept for example: the main character(s) have a big secret that they hide from they're peers. It's just like Hannah Montana and That's So Raven. Next, the acting is just average. Selena Gomez seems to be half asleep through many scenes. Lastly, the jokes are either cliché or boring. If they're not using they're colorful, yet strange dialog to make us "laugh", they are throwing various props around the room.

By Jove, what an unholy mess! Revenge, incestuous love, mechanical games-like fighting, ceaseless and utterly unnecessary violence, some primitive "music" hammering away at the bewildered victims, big "surprises" (which actually tend to be about as "revelatory" as The National Enquirer's headlines). Add some shoddy camera movements pretending to be stylish and creative and you've already impressed the crowds. This movie's totally undeserved popularity powerfully indicates the very low level pop sub-culture has succeeded not only in achieving in the last decades, but also in imposing as dominant taste on an impotent audience.

This is one of the movies one has to start watching with an open mind. One knows it's going to about a mute, one could look forward to or be afraid for a lot of sentiment.Well, forget it. The movie starts with a little black humour, and then gets started. From then on its takes you on an ever frightening ride through the dark centers of Moscow. All right, it must be said: the unexpected twists are expected, and the mute is mainly used as a plot tool or fear builder.

i am not familiar with the producer ' s other works , but this movie is a piece of crap . what do you expect to find in it ? it is nothing more than a silly script that no one actually knows how to edit . so let me try and explain something else - this film was a complete failure . the dialogue is lame ; the acting is unhelpful . if you had seen the movies when we were in grade school , you would understand why this movie was so pathetic . all the actors just seemed to think that their characters would be happy to sit through the scenes .

TART is the worst movie I've seen this year, and that includes both the Affleck/J.Lo bomb GIGLI and the Rob Zombie borefest HOUSE OF 1000 CORPSES. I don't know if that's a fair comparison seeing that TART was made two years earlier and probably has a budget half that of even the low-budget 1000 CORPSES. Regardless, all three movies suffer from the same shortcomings: horrible script, horrible acting, horrible direction. *** SPOILERS *** (although I honestly don't think there's anything to spoil)TART is about a group of super-spoiled private school kids.

this is really one of the worst movies i have seen in a while . it ' s not funny at all , just gross . i wanted to leave right then and there , but as soon as i sat down , i knew i needed to get away from the movie , or else they were going to kill me for sure . i watched about thirty minutes before i realized that if i didn ' t stop this movie , i was going to die . so i had to sit through a half an hour of it before i even thought about staying in the room .

this movie was so bad it looked like a home movie . in one scene , the camera very slowly turned away from them . the next shot was worse . it was a bunch of teens laughing and pointing at the camera . they were trying to take pictures of each other . when the kid tried to take some shots of him , he fell down . the crowd cheered for the poor kid . i could feel my eyes getting teary and i knew if i laughed too much , i would n't be able to stop myself .

This one is one of those classic B movie following the exploits of 2 hobos. It's done really cheesily and Big Stupid running off one-liners like a cardboard cassanova. But Jack Elam steals every scene he's in as the creepazoid Jesse (now Jerome!). My favorite scene is the lynch mob and the dad's voice going up 10 octaves ("You loved her?"). Danny, Big Stupid's protege, is surprisingly stupider, but not as loathsome as our lead star. There's also a quaint scene of a guy pimping at the diner.

yes , indeed we have a winner - a winner in best dumb - action - movie ! the only reason i chose to vote for this one was so i would n't have to see this show . as soon as i saw the movie and read the comments on the television screen , i immediately knew there could n't be that many other comedians involved . i had been trying to figure out what the plot was but i ca n't say i liked it . i really like the comedy and i thought it would get me out of my rut . the story was just boring .

Closet Land is an amazing, terrifying piece of cinema. It features only two actors in a single set, but never loses your attention. The set design is imaginative and troubling, the staging of scenes maintains your attention, while adding to your own sense of confusion and terror. The acting is outstanding, with Alan Rickman and Madeleine Stowe having the duty of carrying every scene.I first saw this film in 1991, soon after it came out on video. It didn't play in theaters where I lived; not surprising, given its political content. It should be seen, though.

mr . baseball is a film of paradoxes . written and filmed as a ` ` light , sports comedy ' ' the stars ' ( not to mention all of them ) , i have read numerous stories in which they ' went down ' . most of these are comedic but some are real . this one is an old - school " bad joke " that ' s so bad that it looks like it ' s meant to be funny . the worst part was that the plot could never be made into a decent movie .

it is sad that some find this film worth watching . i am russian , and i am disgusted . my mother would kill me for this . no one cares about movies . nothing makes sense . even the plot is just so stupid . we have to use the script as an example . i got into an argument with my aunt when i was in high school . she asked me what i wanted to study . i did not know what she meant , so i told her i wanted to study russian and i could not think of a better reason than to go to school here .

terror in the jungle is a real find . if you saw it , you ' re one of the few people on earth i have not seen dead ! so when this film comes out and all its characters get murdered , it will be a very good show . i ' m sure the first person that sees it will either believe it was really staged or turn away from it . i don ' t mind watching this movie . i know many people who do not want to see this but i can ' t just stand by and watch it any longer .

Wow -- this movie was really bad! You talk about formulaic, typical movie plot? Watching this movie was like hitting my head repeatedly against a brick wall. The transitions kept trying to be cool but failed. The plot twist at the end, where we find out who the bad guy is was unexpected, but doesn't make much sense until his monologue. Even then... The amount of gore in this movie doesn't help either. Are all of those images necessary? My last complaint is about the plausibility of chunks of the movie.

age of steel follows up the previous episode , rise of the cybermen , which was excellent in some respects until a couple of months ago . i hope it does not take you long to figure this thing out - i think it has made a good first impression . i really enjoyed the movie and i thought it was pretty cool . but as you can see , i was disappointed when the characters became clones . there is one other similarity to the others . while we do not all agree that they have similar characteristics , we disagree on the extent and depth of their capabilities .

This has got to be the most god-awful piece of cinematic crap I have ever watched. It makes Mel Brooks movies Oscar-worthy by comparison. Jim VanBebber needs to be publicly slapped for trying to pass this off as ANY form of entertainment.While some may say that this movie is true to the low budget genre of such classics as "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre" or "Night of the Living Dead", the production value is not in question. It is VanBebber's ability to cast and present a plausible story line. The casting is deplorable.

i recently saw episodes 1 - 4 , and now i ca n ' t wait for 5 & 6 to be available ! ! ! i hope you enjoyed this series as much as the first time . i love the suspense thrillers ; i can still see it in my mind whenever i have a moment to think about what i saw last night when i was on the set . the plot was very different from the other two movies i have watched , but they both seemed to make sense . the script and characters were like that of every film i ever saw .

the worst film i have seen in the last 12 months . the plot of the story was uninteresting , not like any movie i had seen in my life , but i did hear that it was bad and very well made . i could not wait for the next installment to be written and watched by the two other people whom i knew were on the tv . unfortunately , many of the characters came from poor backgrounds , which is an understatement . this is nothing short of awful . how do you know a good movie is bad ? are you even trying ?

the affair is a very bad tv movie from the 1970s starring the then - husband - wife team of robert wagner and natalie mcmillian . i had seen this movie plenty of times on my television shows in college , but i had never actually heard of it , so i did not know if it was one of the worst flicks i had ever seen in my life . it has to be one of the worst , but at least it does n't look like they were really trying to have a sex life . that makes me want to scream in disgust .

irwin allen put all his talents behind this one : he ' s co - screenwriter , producer and director of this cartoonish movie that ' s about to take the form of an entire tv audience . is this a bad time ? do i have too much to worry about ? there can be only so much fun you can watch in a movie like this one . i ' m not really into watching movies as a way of doing my job or making myself feel more comfortable . i prefer thrillers that portray real life situations where people are being murdered and then they just go ahead and film the movie on their own .

I saw this film at school and absolutely loved it. Based on a true story, this is an absolutely splendid masterpiece of a film. Seriously, I couldn't find anything wrong with it. One definite plus is how it was filmed. Set in Morrocco in 1904, the Wind and the Lion is filled with stirring images like the Great Raisuli on horseback especially. The cinematography was faultless, the editing was crisp, the costumes were gorgeous and the scenery was breathtaking. And I have to mention the music from Jerry Goldsmith, it was phenomenal.

"Tumbling Doll of Flesh" by Tamakichi Anaru is a Japanese shocker about three thugs who sexually abuse,torture and dismember a young woman whilst filming their horrible actions.Typically twisted Japanese porno sickie that offers plenty of sadistic sexual violence and grisly gore.There is no plot to speak of,just plenty of hard core sex scenes(optically censored again)and lots of blood.The special effects are quite impressive-the dismemberment of Japanese porn actress is shown in unflinching detail.The tongue cutting scene really made me squirm.Her arm is also chopped off and her stomach is graphically sliced open and finally one of the sickos is having sex with her intestines.

mute witness is a modest , yet very solid thriller that never really received the attention or good comments it deserved . i loved the first few pages of this tale , but not as much as the movie . the plot and characters are too predictable , and the story is just too hard to follow . there was a bit of a horror scene on the soundtrack , but i could n't enjoy it . so i gave up . in the end i decided to let the movie play its own game , which was to watch it live .

what we know of caravaggio suggests a strutting brawler with a healthy sense of entitlement who lived amongst whores and had no clue that she was about to die . in reality , she was simply playing her part like every other prostitute on the east side . the only thing that really shocked me when i met them was that they didn ' t try hard at all to get any work done . some of the things that they said seemed to have an awful lot to say about who they were and how they could do what they did and yet still be considered professionals .

you have to like baseball , and you have to at least sort of like tom selleck , but if you do like baseball you will not be into it . the only thing that is really exciting about the season is the way everyone seems to act as though they think it has something to do with them . i was watching the braves play this season and could understand why anyone would want to win a baseball game . there are things that most guys hate about baseball in the first half of the season because they can never find anything on tv that is so interesting .

Sci-Fi channel thinks this IS Sci-Fi; it's a shame. Big Bugs, Snakes, Mythical Beasties, on and on, they persist.Some one at Universal had the brains to include BattleStar Galactica (the new, good one) and Firefly for a brief moment in their line up. I know they know they difference between total garbage and extremely high quality sci-fi.A few years back they were on about how they were going all high and mighty, making productions that were not just for us mere, lame-o Trekkies. Thanks so much, Sci-Fi!

at the story. It is reality mixed with Americana- and very original.Emily Grace is a young girl tired of her boring life working at a minimum wage job, in New England. Her sleazy boss propositions her- she quits and takes a little bit of cash from the register. Driving from New Hampshire to Miami, Florida, is not a short trip, and her Ford Escort dies out. She then meets a personable older couple, portrayed by Judith Ivey and Bill Raymond. They have an RV and graciously offer to help her out- it isn't safe for a girl to be alone on the road.

The real life case of an innocent First Nations chief(the Indian) by an Winnipeg city officer(the Cowboy) is the basis of this TV movie. The actual case caused its fair share of racial tension in Canada, a small scale Martin Luther King thing. The misjustice of First Nations people is becoming a staple in the Canadian cinema diet. What makes this film worth viewing is the focus on the family's reactions. The father played by Gordon Tootoosis demands forgiveness and the brother played by Eric Schweig demands justice.

This film was great!Tangi Miller and Flex did a great job. They both look good together and they both pulled it off.Tasha Smith was so funny as the cousin,and she couldn't stay out of her business.Essence held it down for her girl, when she needed her. Aloma was sweet and played a dear Grandmother she really reminded me of my grandmother.And Oh,I can't forget about the stripper, he was so find, and I didn't know if I should cover my eyes or smile while I watch him reveal his sexiness on the big screen.Damn!

Now for sure, this is one of the lightest-hearted stories that Bruce Willis has been in to date and yet,-- it is still touching. I really like Bruce's style and persona, I haven't loved everything he has ever been in, but he brings it to the 'Big-time' for me in most all his film endeavors.The story begins..... He is power, confidence and style with a capitol 'S' . He drives a Porshe he lives well, in a palatial estate with a grand view of the fair city. That's Russell Duritz.

In this follow up to The Naked Civil Servant we see the final years of Quentin Crisp's life in New York. John Hurt is again Crisp (come on who else could play the part?) and its a role he inhabits to the point of disappearing. For me Hurt is Crisp and I've always found it very hard to take the man himself because Hurt was more him than he was himself. Its masterful performance. His equal is Denis O'Hare as Phillip Steele, Crisp's long time friend and confidant.Unfortunately outside of the performances the film has little to recommend it.

it ' s one of the imponderables of low - budget independent film - making that so many with so little in the way of imagination can produce . even if you have enough credits to make it , you would never be able to follow through on this project . there ' s no reason not to go ahead and take some of your best shot . 
 " this is something i ' m particularly interested in , " mark continues as i look at my camera for a few moments . i feel a sense of dread about seeing this .

I absolutely adored this movie. For me, the best reason to see it is how stark a contrast it is from legal dramas like "Boston Legal" or "Ally McBeal" or even "LA Law." This is REALITY. The law is not BS, won in some closing argument or through some ridiculous defense you pull out of your butt, like the "Chewbacca defense" on South Park.) This is a real travesty of justice, the legal system gone horribly wrong, and the work by GOOD lawyers - not the shyster stereotype, who use all of their skills to right it.

Well the previews looked funny and I usually don't go to movies on opening night especially with my kids because ......well you never know. Here is a movie that doesn't appeal either to children or adults as the jokes are too perverse for children and falls completely flat for entertainment purposes for adults. I was actually embarrassed to be with my 9 and 6 year old and having to explain to my 6 year old what S H * T spells. Essentially what happens here is a total twisting of Dr. Seuss's classic.

Whoa, this is one of the WORST movies I have EVER seen! The packaging for the film is better than the film itself. My girlfriend and I watched it this past weekend, and we only continued to watch it in the hopes that it would get better...it didn't...The picture quality is poor; it looks like it was shot on video and transferred to film. The lighting is not great, which makes it harder to read the actors' facial expressions. The acting itself was cheesy, but I guess it's acceptable for "yet another" teenage horror flick.

i did n ' t hate this one . i just could n ' t adapt to the story . it did n ' t really take me long to see how my opinion of this movie would be judged . a lot of the good things about this movie are the way it is directed , the dialogue and dialog , the plot . however , if you don ' t feel that the characters are trying too hard ( which they most definitely are not ) , then why don ' t you think about moving up to the next stage in this movie ?

I can just picture how this movie came to be:"So how else can we screw up our careers?" "I know! Let's take a film that was wildly successful and make a sequel out of it!"Perfect! We'll get B-grade actors who have half the charisma and want only 10% of Carrey's original salary. We'll save millions and rake in a massive profit, never mind the fact nobody wants to see a second rate sequel with none of the original actors that made it popular in the first place!

it is n ' t too bad , but ultimately it lacks the quality that the australian series has . the jokes are few and far between . i think it 's one of the most entertaining movies i 've ever seen . i wish i was in it . when i finally left my room this afternoon i had to make a decision about which film to take on . first off i would have like a new movie set , or at least an action flick where i can get some action . then i 'd like a more modern story - ending with a little romance .

This film has some flaws, and most of those flaws are a lack of anything happening. Possibly the greatest film to show the direness within Fly-Over Country, "Rolling Kansas" is a film in which nothing happens and you don't care about anybody. Like life, it starts, it moves, and then it ends. A few attempts at humor are made, but everything falls very flat. The occasional cameo just reminds the viewer that they could be wasting their life doing something besides watching this movie and the one rock song they bought and used at every single instance.Do yourself a favor and go see a good movie.

acting 10 , script 1 . ` ` hurlyburly ' ' is from that unfortunate postmodern school of theatre that has declared it the best film to have on show since 1930 ! i thought you knew how to play with your words , as did a dozen of your fellow actors . they are not even really there , and we do not see them here for much of their roles . what makes these things so bad ? when this movie first started , it was quite good . it went by far better than i had ever seen before . in any case , it was totally uninspiring .

Yet another in the long line of "Don't" films of the late 70's and early 80's yet this one is much more than that. This film is a highly underestimated low budget schlocker with a twist. It has the grainy quality and bizarre soundtrack that is typical of horror films of the time period but it's the highly underestimated performances of the surprisingly talented actors/actresses that make this movie good. A young nurse arrives at Dr. Stephens' progressive mental hospital right after he has been murdered by one of his patients and all is not what it appears to be.

I have seen this movie 4 times in 5 months and i never get tired of it just because it is perfect. And it has also got the best film music ever and the best supporting roles ever written for a movie. I mean you just have to love Robert Duval , Marlon Brando , Martin Sheen and Lauerence Fishburne in this movie but specially Duval. I can not believe that Kramer vs. Kramer did win an Oscar in stead of this amazing war movie. So this is my conclusion if you take the director of the worlds greatest movie ( The Godfather ) and the best of Hollywood actors you can only succeed.

If you have never heard of Jane Austen, seen the original movie or the 1995 BBC adaptation, or even seen a pop up version of the book, then this farcical attempt to show this classic love story may be considered vaguely endurable.From the opening scene, this film must be remembered for its awful acting, abominable miscasting and complete lack of the classic wit of Jane Austen.Whoever decided to cast actors (with the exception of the excellent Judi Dench) who have obviously never heard of Jane Austen, let alone read her, should be punished!

as a parent of two girls ( 14 and 11 ) i have grave doubts about this show and all its content but , what does it matter ? it is in the name of my dead father and he is still alive . so , how do you know anything about this crap ? ! ? are you making me mad or am i getting used to this show ? ! ! ? ! ! i want nothing more in this world right now than to go home and put this show on the front page of any newspaper in the world .

I'm so glad he wasn't alive to see this. This movie is a debauchery of his work. I agree with the other commenter-- this movie was a terrible disappointment. I'd give it a zero, but am forced to give it a 1.The story was weak, and it reminded me of the days when I was a young teenager trying to write a movie, then looking back on it and realizing how horrible it was. Bad actors, family and friends, and someone stupid enough to fund it was how it was made.

Sure, most of the slasher films of the 1980's were not worth thecelluloid they were filmed on, but this video nightmare may well bethe dullest produced.Six horny pot smoking students decide to go camping. Of course,and you know this already, they begin getting killed one by one by amysterious stranger. The climax has a hunky forest ranger trying toget to the teens in time before the last cute girl becomes buzzardbait.John Carl Buechler, my least favorite B-movie guy, did the lousymakeup effects here. The cast features Carel Struycken, of "TheWitches of Eastwick" and the Addams family movies.

well , i have to agree with the critics on this one , who all said ` ` leave it alone . ' but that just is n't true . no way could they have found out how far along i am . there is absolutely nothing wrong with what you do . if there is something wrong , you are supposed to help it . if there is something wrong , you 're supposed to make sure it happens . maybe i should have thought of that . and i would like to point out that it has never been proven to me in a courtroom that the judges were not being truthful about their positions .

Lame rip-off of THE QUATERMASS XPERIMENT (1955): the first half is deadly dull, even dreary - but the latter stages improve considerably with the scenes involving the rampaging 'monster'. In the accompanying featurette (a rather dry affair at a mere 9 minutes, when compared to the ones created for the other titles in Criterion's "Monsters & Madmen" set), director Day - who admits to not being a fan of the sci-fi genre - tries to justify the film's shortcomings by saying that he had a zero-budget to work with (where all the outer space scenes were composed of stock footage!

i ca n ' t believe the amount of reviewers who praise this as realistic . i ' m a million miles from having that kind of talent at my age , especially if i ' ve been up there for about two weeks . i have to say i am not too proud of how i was raised by such people . i spent most of my childhood listening to them ramble on and on about how great their movies are and how awesome they are . i always had to tell them it was n't really bad .

i ' ve seen a few bad action movies in my days , but this one ' s just plain awful . i ' m really sorry that you went through such a terrible time and there ' s an awful lot of good people in this movie and they ' ve all gone to horrible extremes to save each other . no - one has ever been so evil in their lives as they are here in this story ! i could have put the book down at any time and done something about it . however , what i do can only hope is that somebody will come back for it sometime .

ever once in a while i run into a movie that is so embarrassingly bad i wonder why movies exist . it was one of my worst cases as a child and i had to watch it often enough . the only good parts , however , were those which you can not tell from this movie : there is this really horrible guy who falls off a cliff and smashes his skull against an enormous boulder . then there is this woman who just gets her life back together again and lives with her husband - although he never did give her any money !

The horrific production doesn't qualify as a "film." It was obviously shot on video tape, and very poorly at that! There is a constant screaching sound for the audio(sounds like a bad microphone), which is so annoying that you sometimes cannot understand what the characters are saying. Badly dubbed-in music will suddenly appear in a scene, and the entire editing of this thing rates about a ZERO!The plot is contrived and ridiculous. A late 20's gay man trying to hide his live-in lover from parents visiting? PLEASE!

Helen (Kate Capshaw) owns a bookstore in the sleepy, coastal town of Loblolly by the Sea. Divorced, Helen has a young daughter who is going to camp for the summer, giving mother a bit more freedom. Working at Helen's store are the manager, Janet (Ellen DeGeneres), a man-crazy village-gossip girl who has eyes for the handsome fireman, George (Tom Selleck), and two young college students, Jennifer (Julianne Nicholson) and Johnny (Tom Everett Scott). One day, Helen stumbles across a romantic, tender love letter and she suspects that Johnny has written it for her.

SPOILER WARNINGWe've all heard the "Boy Who Cried Wolf" legend. But what if the wolf was a person in the modern world. Well it might be something like Big Fat Liar. Fourteen-year-old Jason Sheperd ( Frankie Muniz from "Malcolm in the Middle" ) is always lying to keep himself out of trouble. One day he is pressured to write an English essay, but it winds up in the hands of sleazy film-maker Marty Wolf ( Paul Giamatti ) who plans to turn Jason's story into a Hollywood blockbuster. No one believes Jason when he for once tells the truth and he ends up in summer school.

I am an Australian currently living in Japan. I saw this movie on TV here and was very impressed by the accuracy and honesty in the portrayal of Western and Japanese ideologies colliding. Whoever wrote the screenplay, and directed this film must have a good knowledge of what it's like to be a foreigner living in Japan. The only part I thought was too Hollywood-y was when Tom Selleck's character kisses the woman in the middle of her office and she lets him. Public displays of affection are not really acceptable here. Finally a movie that highlights the true 'gaijin' experience!

i remember this bomb coming out in the early 80 ' s . at first it sounded like a great idea , but after what we were seeing today , i was pretty sure it was a total waste of bullets . you never see such an awesome horror film as the one i was watching that day . there is something so frightening and terrifying about it . even though i was sitting down for lunch , i got lost trying to find the nearest tv station to watch it . my mom said that she could show me some videos later , but until then i had no idea which channel i should watch .

this was by far one of the worst movies sandra bullock has starred in . ben affleck should stay behind , not just so he can get into trouble at the next big movie festival . but that 's just too bad because i am really enjoying it . i do n't care about the plot , it is a real piece of shit and i want to watch it from its start . i like the whole idea of having a movie as long as there are a bunch of dumb kids hanging out with their parents . what a joke .

this is by far my favorite action movie . but what makes it work is not the elaborate renny harlin comedy , which you have seen - that i am very grateful for . while i do enjoy movies such as those in this genre , the story is not much better . at first the plot was fairly simple . the characters are quite predictable and they seem to be able to relate to the world of the film without actually interacting with it . each time i watch this scene , it seems like there is something about this character that has me intrigued .

I just found the entire 3 DVD set at Wal-Mart in the bargain bin for $5.50, so I thought I would take another look. Total of 13 hours to watch it all (26 episodes). I was born in 1948 and saw most of them on TV in the sixties. Many independent stations repeated them for many years.Better than I expected actually, time has been kind to the obvious sincerity of it's creators, and to the obvious gratitude and respect they give to all the Allied fighting men and women.

you know sometimes you just got ta have it ? that ' s how this movie is with me . i watched it when i was in high school and it was great for the first few years of my life . then after a while , i had to get out of my apartment . i thought i would enjoy the film at the time , but i did not . all i could think about was taking a walk down by the river . i remember thinking how strange it was to hear water lapping against the riverbank .

ROCK STAR is a well-told Hollywood-style rendition of the tale based on fact actually on how Ripper became Rob Halford's replacement for Judas Priest. Mark Wahlberg poured on his likable boy-ish charm and performed with believable admirably, something he has been known to do since the release of BOOGIE NIGHTS.Stephen Herek, no stranger to musically-themed movies, takes the audience through the wonders of the breakneck lifestyle of an extinct species, the Hair-Metal Rock God. Wahlberg's "Izzy" acts as the film's host plays the everyman who gets to see his wish come true.

I just saw this on TCM tonight and was shocked at the over-acting by Jean Arthur. Her bugging her eyes out in surprise and just generally over-doing everything was not in the same style as Dietrich and Art Lund. Dietrich was marvelous in her restraint and comic timing. She being the best thing in this movie. The Wilder gags were flat and frankly more like something a freshman in college would write trying to "get away" w/being wicked,witty and dirty, but just sounded boring and not funny at all. It seemed the humor was being pushed too hard to be funny.

i ' m surprised to read all the positive comments on this movie . even my 4 and 6 year old sister could hardly write it down ! i thought that was one of the bad things that happened when i was born in 1976 . a lot of good times came from this film for me . i saw the whole thing , and so does my little brother paul who lives in california with his mother . no big surprise there though . if you want to see anything about this movie , please sign up at the site of https : // www.smashwords.com / books / view / 2768524 .

my parents may enjoy this show , but i fail to find the humor in it . what is so damn funny ? how could i have been that stupid as to believe all this was going to be a movie or a series of movies - and there were lots of movies . it just does not seem fair . even if the plot is not bad , the audience is not very interesting and the content is much too depressing for me to like . on the other hand , you know the ending of this movie ; they are all dead . why should this be any different ?

reba is a very dumb show . you can predict pretty much anything that ' s about to happen . barbra streisand , the actress i saw at the cast party , was a great looking young woman ( it 's not too hard to think that she ' s the queen of england ) . as soon as i saw how far along she really was , i knew something huge was coming . if we ' re going to live in this world , we need to keep a close eye on all of the bad stuff and watch for the best ones .

I have seen many many movies and this just totally blew my mind. The trauma, the suspense is just amazing. I ended so wound up in the psychological fear and Philosophy of it, and relating it to reality. Movies that play and challenge your mind are movies you don't forget, those that make you doubt your reality. A problem could be the quality, but that doesn't bring down the essence of the movie.The idea it self is brilliant and the ending leaves you just completely shocked and with the question for you to seek the answer. I just totally loved it!

Nothing about this movie is any good. It's a formulaic predictable "romantic comedy" geared to make females force their significant others to watch. In other words, it's a predictable chic flick that is neither comedic or romantic and is extraordinarily forgettable. If you like watching the same thing over and over then this movie will fit just perfect. I was also forced to watch this with my g/f at the time and it's no surprise we are no longer together. I enjoy great movies that are wonderful to watch, while she just wants to see the same thing over and over again just with different actors.

I realize most people don't know who Solomon Kane is and that the film is pitched at that much larger audience. But then why bother to call it "Solomon Kane" in the first place when the name has no marketable value? The characters certainly has NOTHING whatsoever to do with the R.E. Howard character. Except he has a big hat. That's where the resemblance ends.It's always a bad sign when any superhero/fantasy/sci-fi movie lingers over an origin story, but when you invent one whole cloth like this for a character who didn't have one at all, you've already missed the point completely.

"Hey, I didn't order no cab!" "Yeah, well you got one..." What can I say about Hack...what a man among men. He was a heartened ex-cop turned cab driver with a heart of gold. If you were able to (and fortunately for America's TV viewers...one person per week was) penetrate the cold, hard surface of Hack's exterior, you got to see a caring man devoted to vigilante justice. The show was superb, I laughed, I cried, I smiled...all in the same episode.

having enjoyed koyaanisqatsi and powaqatsi i was looking forward to this third part of the qatsi trilogy and seeing what it looks like , i guess you would call it " fun " . i have read a lot of horror books over the years as well as some new thrillers . also , it has been a long time since i saw one of those movies . it is really scary and i can hardly believe that all this happened . for instance , there was a woman who was attacked while she was driving home from a party and had to be pulled out of the car by the local cop .

This movie was utterly and unequivocally terrible. The plot was so predictable and boring and the script so corny and pretentious that by the end I wanted to stab my eyes with the nearest pen.Normally I don't write reviews, but I was astonished by the number of positive reviews it got. While I admit that the acting was okay at some parts, the script's deficiencies more than outweighed the decent acting. The only reason I watched this was because a few of my friends were watching it, introducing it as most likely the worst movie ever made, judging by the trailer.

i do n ' t care what anyone else says , this movie is the worst piece of trash committed on film . when you see it , they are so horrible that it makes you want to crawl into a hole and die . not only am i going to be stuck in this miserable place for the next 2 hours , i can barely eat . now look at the screen . there are two people staring at each other , acting like they might have known each other for years . then they turn around and go back into the cabin and close the curtains . wow .

It is sad that some find this film worth watching. I am Russian, and I am disgusted. There is nothing in this film that deserves praise, except cinematography. However, I am not one of those who find beauty in death or perversion. I think this film is poorly designed and directed. There is nothing more irritating and even enraging than shameless speculation in art (if you can call this garbage art). Balabanov wanted to shock the viewers by pervasive evil, and he succeeded in creating a hopelessly dark film. But the biggest shock is Balabanov's primitive directorial work.

kazuo komizu strikes again with ` ` entrails of a beautiful woman ' ' , the sequel to ` ` entrails of a beautiful woman ' -- this is called the original story . in other words , you should see this new one . on the back of that book , written in russian - japanese characters , were pictures of people i 'd never seen before . i was so caught up in it i had forgotten all about this movie and the plot . the only thing i could be certain of at the outset was that it involved a man who looks very much like ivan hemingway .

High school female track star dies of a blood clot after winning a race with the community in an uproar against Coach George Michaels(Christopher George playing him as a major butt-head who is VERY demanding of the athletes under his watch). He'll be canned after school lets out providing the flick with his motive as a possible killer. Some twisted psychopath in sweats(much the same as what Michaels is often seen wearing), using a stop watch to time his executions, murders the members of the track team the dead female runner was a part of.

This movie surprised me. The box is misleading, the tagline is misleading and the costumes and tone of the film are misleading. The movie is quite gory, well-acted and beautifully shot. The special-effects are top-notch and seem to be ahead of their time, until you realize this movie came out in 1979, not in 1963 like it's tone would suggest. It is a unique take on the Dr. Moreau story, and one of the better versions filmed. The first fifteen minutes are the highlight and the most shocking, but the film doesn't ever really fall apart.

I went to this film having no idea what to expect. I actually took a date to it in the theaters when it first came out. We both thoroughly enjoyed it and it helped to have someone to discuss it with after seeing it.I only recommend seeing this film if you appreciate non-mainstream movies. It's not as disjointed as Liquid Sky or as fanciful as Forbidden Zone. The original plot is very easy to follow. There's A LOT of subtle humor.Here's a quick summary of the plot if you are completely lost: A big-brother type government keeps tabs on everyone in society.

When I first saw the previews for this movie on TV I thought that this could be a funny movie. I was wrong. All though I am not totally against movies that make fun of others. Some are actually funny such as the first scary movie. This was one of many that have been made as of late that are not. The humor in this film was anything but funny and was rather dull.I feel the one of the biggest problems is that they poked fun at to many movies such as Varsity Blues, Friday Night Lights, Stick it, etc.

Another first: this French movie is my introduction to the world Eric Rohmer. Perhaps I'm a bit hasty when I say that this is probably my last Rohmer movie but I was immediately turned off by the way Rohmer relies on monotonous philosophical conversations that never get to the point. There is a scene in the movie where the characters discuss love that I thought was never going to end. Honestly, no matter how much I tried, I couldn't understand why Rohmer is so highly regarded among cinephiles. He struck me as being one of those obnoxiously petulant people who are filled with hot air.

Greedy land baron in the tiny western town of Prairie City wants all the ranchers off their land, using intimidation tactics and arson to get them to vacate; seems the town is swimming atop oil, and when a Swedish farmer refuses to leave, he's mowed down by the baron's hired gun. The farmer's seafaring son soon arrives, slowly realizing what he's up against and attempting to rally the rest of the residents to fight. Another lawlessness-in-the-West story, with everybody under the thumb of the villain (who naturally holds all the cards).

this show is pretty alright and fun to watch , its a great disney channel shows and sometimes entertaining . i really liked the original movie , but could not figure out what made it make me dislike it . all of the characters have a big difference in their personalities from the ones that i am familiar with , which does not surprise me much . the director was good - looking and seemed to be very friendly . there was one character who was just as tough as the rest . he took advantage of the obvious flaws in the movie and started acting out his own scenes .

One would have expected Hitchcock's return to major studio filmmaking to err on the side of chastened caution. Surely few expected his most riotous, unrestrained film, a gleeful melange of vicious black comedy, exciting suspense, mocking manipulation, and astonishing flights of fancy. But that is precisely what they got: STRANGERS ON A TRAIN.What is remarkable is how much Bruno's transgression disrupts the world of the film. Much has been made of the masterly crosscutting motif, but its immediate effect is to completely obstruct the straight line of progress Guy is making of his life, and hence the society he represents or is eager to join.

totally forgettable movie but an unbelievable soundtrack : i ' d give it ( soundtrack ) a 9 out of 10 minutes or 20 seconds to live . this is my favorite film , although i was really hoping that it wouldn ' t start until the end . when the credits begin to come on screen i almost scream with pleasure . as i sit here watching this , i think how funny it would be for someone who has seen many horror films and has been subjected to many movies . at the time , i just assumed it was all some kind of lame attempt at humor to get my attention .

Solo is a poor film - that cannot be ignored. The acting for the most part is very wooden (the only exception is Adrien Brody's performance as Solo's creator Bill) and the story is slight enough that you would probably forget it WHILST you where watching the film. That said, such films are more about the action than the plot/acting and, as such, live or die by the action set pieces - that after all is the point of such films - to give 14 year-olds something to smile at whilst the adults watch films of actual substance.

Time has not been kind to this film from the transition days of sound from silent. The plot has a gangster falling for a socialite who wants to help the down on his luck violinist she loves. There are of course complications. The problem with the film for me is that it hasn't aged well. Performances are all over the place with some emotional scenes seeming so over the top as to be laughable. One late exchange where Carol Lombard throws someone out of her room had me howling with its sing song delivery.

this movie is all about reality , submarine warfare in ww2 was not a clean precise science . there were no explosions , no explosions at all ( except for the fact that they went off when i had to run for my life ) . actually , most people thought it was some kind of joke . but really , who does n't ? you could put one up with the first time i saw this movie . anyway , as i have explained over the past few months , the movie ' s plot and characters appear to be genuine .

a cbs radio program entitled ` ` we the people ' ' assists in finding an american home for vienna refugee charles wagner ' . the story is very old - fashioned ; it may be quite different from the current one and it must have been thoroughly edited ( as i see it ) to make it seem authentic . the whole situation is ridiculous , the only good parts of it having been made by me is the fact that it 's about to become a horror movie but which is pretty close to being just another waste of time .

unless there ' s some huge ironic conspiracy going on , my jaw dropped when i read the positive reviews of this book . in fact , the entire movie was hilarious . i mean , not like this movie where everything is a big joke , but almost exactly like this movie . the theme seemed to make it all worthwhile . what i would n't give to see this movie ! i really enjoyed this show and it showed the same thing every week . that ' s how you ' re supposed to feel during a bad episode .

i ' m a big horror film buff , particularly of the 1980 ' s subgenres . name one i ' ve seen but this one is great . i could not believe what i saw when it first appeared . in all my travels there has never been an event where so many of the actors have been captured without being executed . i just thought they were stupid and probably would have been taken off at a later time , but this film was so much more exciting than i anticipated . it actually did have some interesting stuff going on , but overall it was really very boring to watch .

This is an extraordinary film. As a courtroom drama, it's compelling, as an indictment on the American justice system, it's frightening. For Brenton Butler the consequences of this system could be devastating. This film highlights the fundamental flaws of the legal process, that it's not about discovering guilt or innocence, but rather, is about who presents better in court. In truth, the implications of this case reach beyond the possibility of an innocent man being found guilty, or a guilty man being free. Every citizen has a right to justice, whether a perpetrator or a victim.

writer - director dean bell offered many surprises and engaging moments in this modest yet compelling road film . his dialogue was not what i imagined it to be , and at the same time there was a lot more to it than i realized . the characters were all very believable , they all seemed well mannered , and most importantly they had a good head for acting . this is the real thing . however , as we progress into the final scene in the series , i am getting tired of being treated like an idiot . instead of having a great laugh at the end , i 'm starting to get really irritated .

Produced by Nott Entertainment, this movie is "nott" very good at all. I sat through the first 15 minutes of the film before judging that the acting is bad, the casting is bad and camera work is bad. As I hear that there is a download of this film floating around on the internet, it is "nott" even worth the bandwidth.Up until the time I wrote this review, the average vote for this movie was an 8.5, which prompted me to view it and there was an average high majority of 10's for it, obviously voted on by liars and shills.

Excellent story, wonderful acting, amazing production values and a cool, action-packed short with a perfect twist at the end. What a great short film! I saw this film in Vail or Aspen at a film festival and was wowed by it. Then I saw it again at another festival (where it won again) and I was even more impressed because subtle touches become evident the second time around - for a short film, this packs a lot of clever layers into a short time.AWOL is not for the faint of heart, but it is very well done and completely impressive for a short film - for any film actually.

flesh feast starts at miami airport , ace reporter dan carter ( harry kerwin , he is also credited as one of the best ever ) leads his readers to believe there were some really bad people in the united states , but he could have made a joke of it , or maybe he just did not care . either way , he got the impression that the whole ordeal had taken about five minutes because he had so many questions for them . even though he was young and had been in high school , he thought he would be good with the rest of the audience .

THE MERCHANT OF FOUR SEASONS was Rainer Werner Fassbinder's first shot at mainstream acceptance. In a turbulent career of just fifteen years, he managed to create an astounding body of work in film and theater, both as a performer and a creative producer, actor, and director. Although this movie might not appeal to many viewers, the film has much to offer. The storyline is fairly straightforward. A man is ostracized from his upper middle class family due to emotional and economic problems, and proves unable to control his downward spiral.

This is probably the only film I've seen where the IMDb reviews on both sides of the spectrum are 100% accurate. "The Stupids" is an atrocious, dim-witted film with absolutely no artistic merit whatsoever, and is a denigration to a director like John Landis. And that's what makes it great.In order to appreciate "The Stupids", you have to keep in mind a little-known, but very true maxim spoken by director Abo Kyrou: "I urge you to learn to look at bad films, they are so often sublime."

this is only the second time i have been moved enough to write a review . unfortunately , both times i have been moved so fast it was all just a blur . i have spent many hours editing the story and doing some research on my e - reader to find out more about what they were talking about in the main characters of this work . for instance : how do you really get a good copy ? where did it originate ? that 's another thing i am not interested in . the entire movie revolves around the same person - the one who has taken the lead ; the one who gets killed .

the main reason for watching this picture is to savor the brilliant performance of s . ephata merkerson . ms . merkerson . as you read this , i believe you would agree with us that this was a bad move on our part , and not an easy one on the audience . so , why do n't we give it another go ? well , if you were to look at this article , you would understand why i thought the plot was extremely funny . this film is a very unoriginal portrayal of the life of don nadie ( who has a passion for crime in his career as a lawyer ) .

I watched the world premiere of this on the Starz Action channel. They call it Vampires: The Turning. The plot was a little confusing. There is a voice-over in the introduction about an 800 year war, and I didn't quite understand. The movie is about a young couple somewhere in Asia (maybe in China, I don't think the movie specifies). The couple has an argument and Meredith Monroe runs off and is kidnapped by a biker gang of Vampires. The boyfriend finds a group of vampires that don't kill humans, and enters into a battle with the bikers.

For the record, I hate spoof movies. Except for Mel Brooks and AIRPLANE! because those are classics and make fun of the clichés, not the actual movies itself. I think that spoof movies are the bottom of the barrel for both comedy and film. I especially hate things created by Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer, the "geniuses" behind DATE MOVIE, EPIC MOVIE, and MEET THE SPARTANS.I decided to give THE COMEBACKS a look. Since Friedberg and Seltzer had nothing to do with the production, I was as objective as possible. It was just like one of their movies.

back in august , ' 81 there was a country - ish buzz to movies , big hits like ` ` urban cowboy ' ' and ' cowboys of the desert ' . what 's more , i saw the same films before i saw them . it took me two hours to finish the first movie that i ever saw , because i did not want to watch any other movie as an adult , but i did enjoy watching this film . i just could not bear to watch it when i was a kid , so i had to watch it later .

Happy 25th Birthday to Valley Girl! Great soundtrack, plausible story, wonderful performances...captures the spirit of the 80's; the slang of the mainstreams and the outcasts. A wonderful rendition of high school life and "gritty downtown" from a suburban perspective.The soundtrack contains songs by Modern English, Felony, Josie Cotton, Sparks, Payola$, Josie Cotton, The Plimsouls, The Psychedelic Furs, Men At Work, The Flirts and Bananarama.This movie truly is Romeo and Juliet (minus the double suicide) set in 1980's Los Angeles.

as much as i respect firefighters for what they do . i was unimpressed and bored with this film . all i could see was that there was a lot of movement in the dark and the lighting did n't make any sense to me . it looked like the movie was supposed to be scary but instead it seemed like it was kind of amusing . at least when i watched it i knew how to play the game . well , i guess i should try and get a feel for this movie ( or " game " as some critics call it ) .

I saw it last night and I was laughing out loud for the whole second half of the movie. The whole audience was. Bruce Campbell has made a damn funny movie! I don't want to give anything away, but when the film turns and gets wacky, it gets really wacky. Just one funny scene after another. My hats of to Mr. Campbell and crew for pulling this off on such a tiny budget. Bruce was there to introduce the film and do a Q and A, which was a treat.

So many of us who are devoted to the "art" of the motion picture will disregard or forget that movies are also business ventures. Most of the time, they are far too costly to produce to be anything else. In light of this, it often seems a miracle to me that really great ones do get made every now and then. Once in a while, the film-makers will go so far over budget in producing a film that the businessmen responsible for funding the enterprise will be badly hurt financially and will of course become very angry about this.

this film essentially contains all the elements of a great 70 ' s exploitation film , except it was done in one of those old westerns where you know what it is and do not even have to look around to find out . i think i could see why people hate the movie , because it is so bad , but let 's be honest about these things . there are some parts that actually work , but the other stuff comes from the top down . for instance , a couple of months ago when we came back from the airport i felt like someone had shoved a hot poker into my heart .
