i chose this movie because i was looking for a triangle friendship between a girl & two boys . as it turned out , the boy / girl duo is not even remotely similar - but both are from the same country . so i thought they should have an early christmas present and make the best of it . it 's not that they were n't good to be friends with all three of these boys , either , it 's just that neither of them were particularly attractive . after seeing them in action , i do believe they may have been more popular back then than they were now .

i ' ve lost count of the times i have seen this movie , but i love it and find it rather amusing . i just ca ' t believe it was only two months ago . i don ' t even know what to say to her now that she has made a film about my brother and me in italy . how can it be so hard to like this movie ? there were all kinds of interesting things going on in the movie , but none of them had much impact on the plot . not one single thing could have come close to the whole thing .

Rabbit Fever is a mockumentary collection of sketches, each one of them focussing on a female personal device that was made popular by a single 1998 episode of Sex and the City (the latter half of 1998, rather than the early episodes which were all directed by women). From opening statistics that make Rabbit Fever sound like a soft porn movie, we are treated to a sea of predictable sketches with real and imaginary characters in a world run amok with women's addiction to solitary pleasure.Men, as Germaine Greer rather arrogantly explains, have invented a gadget for women that makes men superfluous in the bedroom.

This totally UNfunny movie is so over the top and pathetic and unrealistic that throughout the whole 90 minutes of utter torture I probably looked at my watch about 70000 times! Lucy Bell is so much higher than this crap and for her to sink this low is quite depressing. I have to admit that the whole audience I was in was laughing hysterically but the majority were Greek or Italian so I guess that this humour will probably make them laugh but not me. All this movie does is make you sick watching all these slackers make excuses for their stupid actions for 90 minutes.

this gundam series only follows gundam 0083 stardust memory . the story takes place during the same time line as the previous movie , but it turns out i am wrong ; gundam is actually a fictional character that has been exposed to so little attention over the last thirty or forty years . for all intents and purposes , he has always been one of hollywood 's leading men : a career actor , an actor , a comedian , a writer , a photographer , and just about anyone else with a degree in psychology . unfortunately , he also spent most of his life trying to imitate someone who would play him .

This film did not excite me. While on vacation in Turkey I noticed that it was playing at the local cinema and decided to take the chance to go see it. It did not go into detail as to how the bad guys were able to find him and re-imprison him after he had gone missing for so long.

after the failure of ` ` hellraiser iii : hell on earth , ' ' the chapter that served as a kind of entertainment is nothing compared to what we have done over the past twenty years . no one else would even consider acting this way ; they thought it was too far - fetched . but when you read the first scene , i think you will see why it was not a total waste of time . every actor has to write down the script and the actors themselves before they are able to make any major changes . some actors are good actors , while others are not .

This failed exercise in satire or commentary on the human condition easily earned a place as one of the 10 worst movies I've ever seen. a truly excellent look at the world and the realities of being a heroin addict . the movie is one of the funniest , most awesome movies on earth . for me it 's really hard to watch , i just do n't understand why my brother has to be so obsessed with these characters . i mean we are all young people and he is only twenty - one but his acting is bad . he can make a lot of money playing this character but he should have a serious talent . i remember that night well because i am in the kitchen having a nice cup of tea when the door opened .

Some describe CALIGULIA as "the" most controversial film of its era. While this is debatable, it is certainly one of the most embarrassing: virtually every big name associated with the film made an effort to distance themselves from it. Author Gore Vidal actually sued (with mixed results) to have his name removed from the film, and when the stars saw the film their reactions varied from loudly voiced disgust to strategic silence. What they wanted, of course, was for it to go away.For a while it looked like it might.

this film explores if not creates a whole new genre with perfect imperfection - - - hilarity , truth , fun , suspense . i 'm going to give it a pass . it is n't my fault that i have no imagination at all when it comes to the characters . for instance : what do they look like ? what type of car is that ? and how did you get so far out of town by just sitting around waiting for somebody to appear ? what does everybody expect to happen in this movie ? why should everyone expect someone to turn up at the house on christmas day ?

This movie has been a classic in my part of the country because it was filmed in my own small town. I now have many friends who are guards at Dixon Correctional, and I myself worked for 3 yrs at the SuperAmerica store next to the Krogers store the old lady was at. However, this is still the dumbest movie ever made, destined to be introduced by Gilbert Godfreid or Rhonda Shearer, if it hasn't been already. A bit of trivia, Illinois doesn't even have parole hearings, and Dixon Prison is a medium security facility housing burglars and vending machine vandals.

"The Cave" got released more or less simultaneously with the English film "The Descent", directed by Neil Marshall. Both movies share a similar premise; only "The Cave" is dreadfully unoriginal, unexciting and incompetent compared to the splendid horror adventure that is "The Descent". It feels like Neil Marshall realized that the basic story was too poor and instantly added ingenious ideas, depth and a personalized style, whereas "The Cave"-director Bruce Hunt simply went for the most rudimentary elaboration of the screenplay that was thrown on his desk.

this is one of the strangest things on tv . it is set in a bizarrely underpopulated midlands superb called london ( or , at least , as it should be said , london ' s perfect example of nothing better than an irish pub ! ) but there is no way that it can be the real thing . if you go all the way down to paris , you come across the world by visiting a cinema and they tell you about it . i do not know much about any of the other countries where films like these are filmed .

This movie was included in the Six Wives of Henry VIII BBC miniseries DVD. I loved those six movies. They were well-acted, well-scripted, and historically accurate. I did actually read Gregory's book and liked it well enough despite it's HUGE historical inaccuracies (I mean the whole fake homosexual angle with George Boleyn in particular), but this movie didn't even mention that. That angle was one of the pivotal points of the book. Above all this movie just leaves me asking "WHY?" Why do we see, as someone else aptly put, "The Real World: Tudor England"?

For a movie that gained so much recognition and appraise this spinoff to "Rosemarys Baby" is one big mistake. It starts off that Andrew/Adrian whatever his name is because he's so confused that he doesn't know who he is anymore runs away from a cult with his mother and soon is kidnapped by a strange lady that ends up taking care of him as if she were his mother. Well, after seeing "Beginning" I thought why the hell they burned Schraders Version and did that poor one. But now, after seeing "Dominion" I deeply understand this decision. But there is so much little of it in the movie.

Jennifer Montgomery's "Art for Teachers of Children" is a stunning, disturbing masterpiece. Montgomery's gritty camerawork and cinematography coupled with the brilliantly unemotional performances she evokes from her cast heighten the sense of shocking, raw realism in this autobiographical story of a 14-year-old Jennifer's seduction of her married boarding-school guidance counselor. The scenes between the amazingly uncanny actress playing Jennifer (Caitlin Grace McDonnell) and Jennifer's mother (actually voiced by Ruth Montgomery) on the phone are some of the most intriguing and powerful I've ever seen captured on film. The lesson ultimately learned here?

Ants are shown in cartoons as being able to carry away chicken legs, watermellons, people, etc. This may be an admirable characteristic because ants carry the film Phase IV. This is not because they want to, but because they have to.The movie opens with a narrator cryptically explaining that some cosmic event has come over the earth, and that a fellow scientist has been working on the effect this disturbance has on the ant population. The movie is broken up in segments; the first part after the cosmic event is Phase I, and so on until the end of the movie, which is Phase IV.What is Phase IV?

first , and foremost , i take issue to the title of this movie . ' chupacabra ' is not a word in which i particularly enjoy reading . it 's not an original story , and most of the plot does not seem like anything you would expect someone to use in a good movie . some of these films are really ridiculous , with little more than a sentence on each film . i think about that for a minute as we walk out of the store . i thought it might be nice if people were paying attention to what they were writing instead of the movies themselves .

i ca n ' t disagree with a previous comment that ` ` driving lessons ' ' is more than a little twee , but if you have no appreciation of the nuances of it , maybe you should just let me quote it to you on this program . it will probably be pretty boring , but it is a very good example of how far out of tune an adult can be in the field of computer programming . when i first read this program , it was my own idea of a way to save money and earn myself a few extra bucks .

The genius that is Stephen Sondheim was never more prominently displayed as it was in his 1979 "Musical Thriller" SWEENEY TODD, a Gothic, gory, grisly, yet delicious musical concoction about a demented barber who returns to London to exact revenge on the evil Judge who not only had him permanently exiled from London, but who is also raising his daughter as his own and plans to marry her to "shield her from all the evils of the world." The barber finds love,sympathy, and assistance from a lonely pie shop owner who has her own agenda where Todd is concerned.

originally , the spiders was planned as a four - part serial , and it shows . i dislike serials ; they are so hard to watch . but i did see one episode which showed a young couple being forced to take their daughter on a date with a man that is in the same condition as her . this is a bad movie . it has some terrible elements of a lot of horrible things that you can not wait to see . there was nothing pretty about this movie other than the fact that there was an overlap between the first scene of the movie and then the second scene .

this is , per se , an above average film but why in the name of bog was it made to start with ? let me say this : there are several reasons why this movie should never have developed . first , i think they were created to please people , not to prove that they can . if you do not believe me , go to the source . no one wants to know what it really is . second , just because the plot is good - looking does n't mean that the plot is dumb or stupid . it just proves that the story is a failure .

I understand that people have different expectations of low-budget, arthouse movies. I also know that John Sayles has a sort of glow about him, that earthy, intellectual anti-hollywood vibe, a la Tim Robbins, the Coen brothers and Atom Egoyan, that makes him a darling with the critics from the get-go.But this is not a good movie. I'm sorry, it just isn't.It meanders. It has too many characters. Its tone is uneven, its point of view is muddled, the acting is all over the board, from naturalistic to over the top.

Having read the books and seen the 1982 Anthony Andrews/JaneSeymour version, I have to say that this is not good at all.According to the books, Percy is supposed to be a seeminglyfoppish aristocrat when he's being Percy, and witty and cleverwhen he's being the Pimpernel, but here he just looks bored asPercy and mean as the Pimpernel. Grant has done much better things, andElizabeth McGovern's acting is uninspired and flat.

Mankind's Self awakening is the theme of "2001: A Space Odyssey", a process that unfolds along a space-time continuum. We "see" our primordial past, and we "infer" a cosmic future. The powers of intuition thus become the doors of perception, in our ongoing collective journey.From this transcendental perspective, a conventional, egocentric plot seems superfluous. Our frenzied conflicts and self-important dialogue are consumed in evolutionary change, and are irrelevant in a cosmos that is vast beyond comprehension. It's a tough lesson for a vain and aggressive species.

I saw this film when it premiered in LA. I think I laughed 2 or three times. The rest of the time I was in shock at how ridiculous/poorly shot and poorly written it was. Kirby is in fact the only saving grace in the film. I was disappointed at the performance of Larry Bagby , whom I usually find entertaining. If you enjoy watching your friend's crappy homemade short films that they shot on their mom's 8mm video camera then there's a slight chance you might enjoy this film. Then again part of what makes those movies enjoyable is that it's your buddies playing all the parts.

Man, what an awful film. As with many terrible films, the structure of its awfulness lies in the script. This is such a pathetic attempt at a psychological thriller that it gives the entire genre a bad name. Okay, here's one major problem: Sandra Bullock's character is abducted by Jeff Bridges in his car at a busy convenience store in broad daylight. Somehow, her boyfriend Kiefer Sutherland doesn't find a single witness to this act and subsequently spends most of the movie completely clueless as to her whereabouts. Come on!

Frank Sinatra has one of his best roles as a reformed heroin addict coming back to his Chicago neighborhood after an extensive stay in a clinic. He plans to stay off the drug and find work as a drummer, but he can't avoid running into his old friends. He had been arrested originally not for any drug-related charge, but because he was caught dealing in an illegal poker game. His skill at poker has earned him the nickname of The Man with the Golden Arm, and the men who run the game, one of them being his former heroin connection, want him to deal again.

I wanted to like this one - the situation was rich, and the setting unusual and interesting. But the story is swamped with childish female gothic romance elements that are hard to swallow. The director is unfairly prejudiced against the 'goy' characters -- content to let them be grotesque cardboard caricatures -- and inexplicably indulgent towards the homewrecking behavior of the heroine. The potentially interesting power struggle between the inventor and the governess is not really dealt with.Feminist film makers will get more credibility when they stop manipulating situations to throw all the sympathy to the heroine, and start dealing honestly with issues.

very enjoyable 50 ' s western . i have it in my collection and recommend it to western fans . mostly victor mature ( the first 20 - 30 % of the series that is ) . this one has been made up of a lot of great characters , so if there is something like this film on your favorite tv show , please do n't go out of your way to find out who is behind it . you would not be able to even begin to find out how long they were together after he had gone off to prison . at least $ 1.95 a day is really cheap .

if you enjoy suspense this movie has it . the fact that marina zudina portrays a mute adds to her appeal . she seems like she 's in a parallel world - one where there is nothing at all going on in her life , so i feel confident that she will eventually lead us somewhere . i wish i could make it back to the present but i have to watch these movies from start to finish again . it would take a long time to get used to them and i still feel like they should be played by someone bigger than me .

i have to say this is one of the best movie i have seen so far for naruto . the actors are beautiful and the plot is hilarious , but i just ca n't picture them being that good - looking . it all ends up being a very boring thing that i hate . no wonder most of my customers do not like these movies . they really must be made to look bad . if i am in this movie , you can imagine why i do not like this film . i get on the stage and sit in a chair and watch the actors go about their day .

The key scene in Rodrigo Garcia's "Nine Lives" comes when Sissy Spacek, hidden away in a hotel room where she is carrying on an affair with Aiden Quinn, find a nature documentary on television, at which point Quinn notes the contrivance of such things--disparate footage is edited into one scene, predators and preys are thrown together in order to capture the moment--all to force connections where none actually exist. Characters in the nine shorts that make up this film occasionally spill over into each others stories, but none of them ever seem to really connect.

i do not like himesh reshamiya . i do not like his singing too . but his songs are a waste of money . and his music is so dull and uninteresting that i should not have noticed it at all . maybe it makes me feel better , but what if it is some type of mental disease ? the only thing that makes me feel better is seeing this guy play his guitar in the middle of an enormous theater on a saturday afternoon ! he has the greatest voice ever , and the way he sings makes it sound as if he is singing to a group of people instead of a single song .

Please do not go see this. i really wanted to like this movie . great cast walter pidgeon in a role that reminds us of the old , boring movies . but this one was so much better . if only he were here , he could have taken my advice and not made me listen to it .

I remember when they made a big deal about this when it was coming out. They showed clips every week on WWF TV and everyone was excited. Once again, Bugs Bunny sacred home is violated by careless people. This time the traveling circus put a lion's cage right over the rabbit's hole. So Bug's has to come out of the hole and face Nero (that's the name of the lion), which he does in his usual hilarious style. After a slow and rocky beginning to the cart, it keeps getting better and better and winds up being quite hilarious. Nero the lion turns out to be a pretty good foil for Bugs and that turns this short into a highly memorable one, if still shorn of a classic.

This film tells the true story of escaped black slaves who found their own mountain-top commune as free men in 17th-century Brazil. The story is interesting and edifying. However, this film -- as a film -- is terrible.The soundtrack is not period music or tribal music. It is Afro-Brazilian pop music from the early 1980s. Battle scenes are fought to the sounds of cheesy pop rhythms best left to the disco or bad cops dramas. Admittedly, the lyrics are folk-ish tales of the slaves' heroism. The special effects are absurd. Rather than invoke the mysticism of African religion and atavistic beliefs, they merely make the film look cheap.

When Jan Svankmajer lets his imagination run wild, get ready. You're in for dark, harrowing films like "Alice" and "Little Otik," or short gems such as "Down to the Cellar" and "Jabberwocky." All of those are excellent films that represent disturbing, surrealistic film-making at its best.On the other hand, when Svankmajer attempts to make a political statement of any kind, you're advised to leave the room in a hurry. Svankmajer's films in this vein tend to be both adolescent and preachy, presenting straw-man caricatures in repetitious fashion to express his pseudo-brilliant insights.

Though it's a Christmas movie, "Christmas in Connecticut" could have been done any time of year, as it's the story of a soldier who spends what is to be an idyllic time with a Martha Stewart type. That's what he thinks. In reality, the lady in question, portrayed by Barbara Stanwyck, has a popular magazine column about life on a farm with her husband and baby. She has no farm, no husband, and no baby, nor are the many recipes she publishes hers. They belong to the restaurant owner nearby.

When I reviewed the video for a local magazine, I called it "the greatest achievement in the history of the American cinema." That was not wholly tongue in cheek. Chop Shop. Written and directed by Ramin Bahrani ( Man Push Cart). Bahrani specializes in character driven studies in naturalist style films about the sort of little people that get passed by every day, without anyone ever really noticing they are there, in New York. These are people who have been pushed to the very fringe of society. They exist in a sort of grey world, many of them migrants whose legal status in America is appears somewhat doubtful. Where do they come from ? How did they get there ? How do they cope ? Where will they end up ?

I saw the movie on its North American premiere (July 14, 2004) at the Fantasia Festival. I was slightly disappointed as I had been expecting a more epic, ensemble cast movie along the lines of Musa the Warrior. Instead, the movie concentrated only a much smaller number of characters. Still, the movie was solid, thoughtful and visually intriguing. There were slightly jarring tone shifts from the dominant thoughtful and realistic tone of confused loyalties, intrigue and blood, versus the lighter, more flamboyant, martial arts sequences.

This is an adaptation of an Edith Wharton work, whose writing is amazing. Sadly, this movie never shakes the feeling that these 20th century movie people don't grasp the 19th century repression and desperation Wharton's work depicts. Ward and Dalton aren't so bad, but Alicia Witt's wooden performance made me wince. She was supposed to be playing the restless element of the story, but she stood like a stick the whole movie long, and I never believed a word out of her mouth. When she asks Sela Ward "Why can't I move you?"

This is one of L&H's shorts most frequently cited as the first "real" L&H teaming and perhaps one of their best silent features. J. Piedmont Mumblethunder (Ollie) is a millionaire who has come to the docks to greet his nephew Philip, whom he's never seen. At first Ollie is laughing it up with everyone when this strange little man unboards and draws a great deal of attention to himself by the way he's behaving during his medical exam, but is quite humiliated when it turns out that this is the fellow he's supposed to be greeting.

**Possible Spoilers Ahead**Whenever fans of bad movies congregate for more than a few minutes, a name that invariably comes up is that of Larry Buchanan. This amazing director has given us remakes of other turkeys (ZONTAR THE THING FROM VENUS), cheap-jack crime dramas like A BULLET FOR PRETTY BOY, and tawdry conspiracy flicks like DOWN ON US and GOODBYE NORMA JEAN. THE LOCH NESS HORROR is a humdinger to say the least. Overlooking the fact that Loch Ness is extremely long and narrow, Larry filmed this howler on a wide and round California lake.

The story is about a 14-year-old kid who always tell lie, at home and school. One day he had his homework of writing a 1000-word-story. But he didn't, so the teacher told him to write it and gave her in 3 hours, or he would have to go to Summer School. Yep, he wrote it in 2:45.

What a crappy movie! The main character in this movie was supposed to be born and brought up in Canada, yet he had a thicker Indian accent than his parents! Is it just me or does Uday look gay in this movie? Also, do all the chicks in Canada dress like sluts? At least that's how it is in this movie. All the females are dressed like strippers. Don't waste your time with this one! The only good thing about this movie is the setting in beautiful Vancouver. Wonder why Bollywood is going through a slump?

carole lombard and james stewart gamely try to inject some life and meaning into this bizarrely constructed film about the ' black hole ' . although it does n't feel as if it were bad , there is no point in acting anymore , since i do n't really have anything against films at all . they 're a waste of time , and i really do not want to watch any more of them . why do i even care ? i guess i just like the movie . i just wish i could look back and be able to appreciate the way it felt on the other dvd .

UK-born Australian helmer Alex Frayne calls for attention with his strange, necessitating a meticulous read, visually stunning Modern Love (2006). Following the steps of a man incapable of controlling a drastic personality change spurred by the death of a close relative pic offers a fascinating examination of human psychology. Distributed by Accent Film-Australia.John (Mark Constable), his wife Emily (Victoria Hill), and their son Edward (William Traeger) arrive in a small Southern town to take care of his deceased uncle's (Don Barker) property.

With some films it is really hard to tell for whom they were made. Huevos de oro seems to aim at the well educated Spanish middle class. There must be many inside jokes in this movie which you will not understand if you are an outsider. This can be pretty annoying.Symbols and references to art and popular culture abound, the movie alludes to the work of Salvador Dalí, Luis Buñuel and the Surrealists in general, a certain infatuation with bidet baths seems to point to Duchamp's ready mades. What's more, the main character has also a knack for karaoke tapes with songs of Julio Iglesias.

you can take the crook out of the joint , but it seems exceedingly more difficult to take the joint out . i have an opinion on a number of issues , and i think there could be some similarities between the first two cases that i found in the second case . the first case was written by a young couple who has recently been diagnosed with multiple sclerosis . they have only been able to visit their children for a short time , but are still pretty sick . after the third case , the kids started to get sick , as did the people who brought them home from their hospital stays .

this film is on my list of worst movies ever made . the story is disconnected and it is difficult to write a description of what happened next because there is too much detail . the part i liked best was that it was not like a movie or movie in which we can tell the truth about who we are . it had a lot of character problems that were left out , and most of the scenes were just too stupid to even begin to look good . for example , this movie has one very important rule : any movie that has been filmed by a person in the first place would never exist .

i watched this film with a sort of dangerous fascination , like a hedgehog trapped in the headlights . there was something very interesting about it that would have made me want to turn it off and put it somewhere else , but my imagination is always running away with me . i do n't even know why i bothered to watch it at all . it just seems so stupid , i ca n't seem to find anything funny about it at all . i just could n't stand it . what if it had a plot ? i did n't really watch it or think about it - i was too scared to .

a great film . every moment masterfully conducted by toyoda and his crew . the actors give credible performances all the time . i never thought it could have come from anyone . 
 " let me get this straight , " i said . " you make films like this , and they end up being just as shitty as this movie is ? " " why bother watching them now ? it was always a letdown to see how well they were doing . these are the worst movies i 've ever seen ( which is not saying much for the first year or so ) .

Filmmaker Bryan Forbes, who once displayed a light, sardonic touch with beguiling material such as "Whistle Down the Wind" and the original "Stepford Wives", completely bottoms out here. Not only is his direction inept, he also sloppily adapted Sidney Sheldon's early novel; the results are atrocious. Roger Moore plays a psychiatrist framed for the murder of one of his patients; Rod Steiger, chewing the scenery, is a hot-under-the-collar cop (it's easily his most embarrassing performance). The only actor here to exhibit some life is Elliott Gould, who knows a thing or two about enlivening a bum script.

Oh, there are many worse Wayne movies. This movie is edited poorly but it has a campy element that makes watching it enjoyable. The villain is an Anglo actor who sports ridiculous Mexican clothes and affects an over-the-top Mexican accent which is hilarious. The girl is dressed like a Jean Harlow wannabe, this is 1934 after all. At least the location shots are beautiful and enjoyable.Watch it and laugh. Don't expect a serious western, but rather a lightweight and superficial story with poor acting but occasional flashes of camp humor.

i feel terribly sorry ! where the lubitsch - pic was enchanting , marvelous , full of spirit and elegance , this film had a very boring ending . you see , i know this movie is n't as good as some movies in the movies , for sure , but it still has a nice touch . i can tell that it was written by people who wanted to read the book or watch the movie itself . not many actors are brave enough to follow their personal desire to try to go outside of the box office at all , so this is a great place to find inspiration .

where do we start with an offering like this ? i nearly said film but that would be going a bit too far . 
 " the movie is not really based on much of what happened here , if you know what i mean . it does have some pretty good highlights from my past , but nothing very useful . the only thing that is positive about this movie is the fact there is so little to tell . at first it was just a lot of static , but after a while it became more entertaining for me .

Jim Wynorski strikes again with the very literal minded KOMODO VS. COBRA. No guesswork here. A giant CGI komodo dragon -- it sort of looks like a dog minus fur -- takes on a humongous CGI king cobra, with a bunch of tree huggers and others caught in between. The tree huggers get charter boat captain Michael Pare (who else?) to take them to an off-limits federal island. An experiment by a mad scientist in growing very large veggies has become an experiment in growing very large critters, thank so to our nutty military.

It is an interesting exercise to witness the early works of great artists. Sometimes, even without the 20/20 vision that hindsight offers you can see the cogs and wheels that make these people what they are. Following is one such look into the past of Christopher Nolan, one of the great time-warping story-teller of today.Christopher Nolan's style of film-making puts a great deal of emphasis on the delivery of the story. Although people might complain it relies too much on the back-and-forth shifting of time, I still find it fascinating to see how he uses that one technique differently each time.

I know not why people considered it trashy or obnoxious; It's not like American Pie or something. I know not why people are offended by the Universal plugs; since it's part of the plot, the advertising is excusable.This is a funny movie with good dialogue, good subtle wit, a good story, a good moral (that thankfully doesn't get too sappy), GREAT acting, and a cheesy ending. (minor spoiler) The basic premise here is the classic story of a Shepherd boy (Muniz) who lies so much that no one believes him when the Wolf (Giamatti) comes along.

everything everyone has said already pretty much rings true when it comes to ' the prey ' . endless nature footage of a man being attacked by a giant spider and trying to get away from the monster is also well worth watching . however , i thought it was going to be quite dull and boring . if there was ever a story in this movie that does n't make me hate my parents , this is it . one thing i do appreciate about this movie though - you can always watch an opening scene where the villain is captured by a superhero .

this is the perfect example of how a great book is turned into a poor film . the direction just sucks . i 'm sure that if you were an author , you would be disgusted with this thing . it was good , but not quite so good as this movie is . at first i thought it might be ok to watch a lot of crappy movies ( especially the same kind that we see on cable ) , but they are all very dull and dreary . most of the time though , i get a kick out of watching them . i have watched many such movies over the years .

Imagine yourself trapped inside a museum of the dark middle Ages and a resurrected vampire and his maniacal sidekick are chasing you. Where is the absolute last place you want to hide? I'd say inside the uncanny Virgin of Nuremberg torture device, because there's a good risk you'll get brutally spiked to death. And yet, the elderly lady in this film stupidly runs into her spiked coffin. "The Vampire's Coffin" is a rather disappointing sequel, as director Fernando Méndez doesn't re-create the Gothic atmosphere of the 1957-original but puts the emphasis on comical situations and dialogs.

* * * * * spoiler or two , not that is matters * * * * * * two : this is my story ! the plot is just as good as i could hope for . it gets even better every time we see each other . you see , when i got here , all i needed to do was get into the movie , take a walk through the park , and be at home before dawn . then i got out and headed over to the house to see if there were any clues that might lead me to the answers that will help me figure this out .

This thing, directed by french sensation Patrick Sebastien,is worst than all the turkeys that you may have seen. Forget Independence Day, Kazaam, The patriot, etc... you get the picture, this one's the pits. Sebastien is a TV celebrity in france, (if you need an equivalent, let's say he's Jerry Springer with an I.Q of 13), this is his first movie let's hope it's the last. I hope Troma or someone would distribute this film in the States, so that you guys out there can excperience the French stench at it's worst.

OK so this is about 30 minutes of gore with no story whatsoever. There is no spoken dialogue, no subtitles, not even any real characters. You see three people in the entire movie (that are alive) and two are just there for very little reason. The main guy has no emotion and just mutilates corpses for no apparent reason. That is the entire movie. I love to see very gory movies, especially since in America real gore just isn't very common in modern movies. So yeah the gore effects were pretty cool. But it just isn't really disturbing.

i did n ' t expect much from this movie , it was just one of those movies i thought i ' d seen . i couldn ' t say for sure that the show was quite as good but i didn ' t see a single flaw in the way it was made . when the director ( and i don ' t care to call him a " director " ) told us we had been chosen for this assignment , well , that ' s not what i thought would happen . there were no problems in this film , or any of the other movies that have been written .

this blake edwards film is n ' t too sure whether it wants to be a comedy , a drama or a comedy . he does n't get the first clue as to what it will be like . in fact , he gets the last half of this film for free ! i did n't really pay attention to how it was taking place because all i could think about was my friends and why they had to die . i know you do n't understand me , but i can relate . it took a big load off my mind and i got to sleep that night with no more than a few nightmares .

I'm a large scarred heterosexual male ex-bouncer, ex-rugby player, and ex-boxer, and I love this movie.It's no "Mystic River." It's a piece of fluff. But there is room in life for fluff, and when that fluff is engagingly shot, well-acted by attractive, likable people, cleverly plotted and full of good dialogue, there's even more room for it.I'm not the biggest Tom Selleck fan. But he's good in this. So are Julianne Nicholson (love her bald head and freckles), Ellen Degeneres, Kate Capshaw and even Tom Everett Scott (That Thing You Do!

i ' ve spent quite a while going through all the reviews for this film . i ' m in total agreement with the critics . i feel that these people were meant to be actors - you know , writers who make great films - but as i saw it , they have made little or no progress . even so , one of them seems to have more than adequate acting skills . he just doesn ' t get it . at least not yet . he ' s doing an excellent job , if you can call it that . there has to be some good writing in this movie .

this is simply a good ole fashioned western . . not overly complex or long . it does n ' t deceive itself , however , that the author and his audience ( although they do act funny ) think this is the funniest movie imaginable . the director was very disappointed when he discovered how quickly it got turned into bad comedy . the cast consists of two women : one who is also a female , and one who is a guy . for the next thirty minutes she gets up from her chair to dance with all four of us .

If you just want gore, and nothing but gore and torture, you've come to the right movie. If you want a at least a sliver of good acting, logic, story, consistencies, or even a good guy ending, go elsewhere.I couldn't help but to think to myself, "Jeeeez, are those people mentally challenged?" Example, after being chased around and seeing other people mutilated, the main actress meets a police officer and spills out her story to the cop with tears and everything and told him about the psychopath that drives in a yellow truck.

I happened across this movie while channel-surfing and it seemed to be yet another poorly- made Christian film about The End Times (which I find rather entertaining because they take themselves so seriously). To be fair, I only saw the last 30 minutes, so I missed the part about UFOs and the Sci-Fi stuff. But it was long enough for me to categorize it as an embarrassing and appalling representation of the Christian faith, as well as a rather pathetic film in any artistic sense.As a film, the script was terrible, the acting was mediocre, and the pacing was poor.

so i was sick with the flu one saturday and the silver lining was that scifi channel was having a little fun in some of the other episodes . at least my parents had made it clear that i had no business watching the show . i did not really like this show . all the action seemed too slow and boring for someone who loved to watch films . even though i liked this show , there was still a sense of disappointment in the first few seconds as if i would have enjoyed watching it more once i was done . the whole thing just felt wrong .

it ' s painfully obvious that the people who made this ` ` movie ' ' have never seen such brilliant spoofs as this . i don ' t see how they can make any real effort to make this movie sound interesting . but it does seem like a good idea if you ' re one of those actors who wants to get into action and do something really special , right ?  " what ' s going on here ? " asked bob mcmillan . 
 " oh , yeah ! "

i had the dubious opportunity to view this movie on tv . it ' s the perfect example of how to deal with a relationship , where one guy spends half of his life making sure someone has a good relationship and the other half trying to avoid having to deal with those relationships . in fact , it ' s the first time that anyone ever showed any interest in this movie . the premise is simply ridiculous . the people involved do not seem to know what they are talking about . why am i sitting here watching this ? there are too many problems for this book to be worthwhile .

this is one of the worst movies i ' ve seen in a while . the acting was just soooo bad . it ' s like you were watching a really bad horror flick but on a better , much more interesting movie . the only thing missing is the sex scene , which should be interesting , but that doesn ' t count . i found this film rather depressing at first . i suppose if you have to see someone die for a little while and then not do anything for another two weeks you are going to get over it .

a great movie, with a rather unclear political message. it´s shot in a theatrical style, i.c. most of the action takes place inside. mayor surov and diana ashcroft seem equally suspicious of each other. emotions run high since the western tourists and business-people seem unwilling and unable to yield to the eastern-russian charm of the mayor, although he makes every effort to understand their point of view. the two opposite world-views are made pointedly clear, but the movie also shows that human emotions cannot be controlled by politics. its powerfully acted and has a high emotional impact for a 50s movie.

my only reason registering to this site was for the opportunity to write a comment to this movie . i had n't even made an attempt at doing this in a very long time , and did n't have the energy to get it done . so when the credits started rolling , i just let out a sigh of relief and sat down hard on one of the chairs , with my feet up on the table and my head resting against the back of the chair . as much as i wanted to turn around and walk over to see if she was alright , i simply could not move .

Having been raised in Canada, I saw this short many times mostly on the CBC. I have seen it numerous times, at many ages in my life, and each time the reactions are the same. It is a joyous bittersweet, beautifully animated film that tugs at your heart. I am sure I have it on some VHS tape somewhere digging around.Every kid growing up can relate to the situation, and wanting to fit in with your favourite idols. The scene and look on the kids face when his mom is filling out the Eatons catalogue and his jumping around the room is priceless.

when a movie called hell ride comes out you expect a certain amount of biker cliche . with character names , i can just imagine what that would be like if the director did make it through the entire film without making any movies at all - and he was supposed to be one of those people . he was n't , but i had an inkling as to how bad off he really was . in other words , his acting was mediocre . his writing was pretty good , but his acting quality was abysmal . the only reason he was doing this was because there was no money or fame in being a star .

look , do n ' t get me wrong i love independent films but come on ! i could barely sit through a movie when i saw it last . this was one of the biggest films i had ever watched and i did n't even pay any attention to what it was about or how it was directed . all i wanted to do was watch the rest of the movie . my eyes were drawn to the other movies that were available on the shelf . none of them featured any special effects . not a single one . there was an odd amount of people who came to this film .

Not for those adrenaline maniacs etc It's a good movie, looking at after war, psychical problem, from the other point of view. Emilio Estevez is great as a young man, haunted by the demons of Vietnam war, causing problem in family. Marin Sheen is also good as a conservative father.It all comes down to the problem how to deal with the past, with whomEmilion Estevez's character can't seem to deal, and Martin Sheen's character don't want do deal with.Protective mother looks at this problem with warm , and open heart but with her mind closed for the obvious reasons.

just watched this on dvd three times - once the ' normal ' way , once with the scenes in consecutive sequence that i never paid attention to so much as the fact that they actually made one of those . and i really did not know what any of that had to do with the previous two movies . there must have been a ton of fun going on in here . the first thing you have to notice is how many people are in here all day long and how many go home at night to eat or drink some sort of late night snack .

` ` witchery ' ' is a decent little euro - trash horror yarn ! david hasselhoff is pretty damn funny in this one . he seems to know just about everything that anyone says or looks like he knows what he is doing . i am sure that most of you are not all that familiar with david hasselhoff , and that makes him hard to believe . he has been famous throughout the world for his acting , acting , acting as an actor . there has never been any real reason why he ca n't take a joke and laugh it off without any problem .

I'm going to recommend putting this one in the "skip it" pile as well. I was mildly excited by the concept when my fiancée rented it, and a bit more excited when I saw that Milos Forman directed it. Ah, well.....The costumes were nice, sure, but they were typical. There was nothing about them that said they were from anywhere but the Period Costume department of any major Hollywood studio. There was no distinction between Spanish, British and French - everyone dressed like they were at court in Versailles.

what a dreadful movie . the effects were poor , especially by todays standards , but that was forgivable . i think some of the other actors are just not very good at anything else . this film is absolutely terrible and it gets to the point where you get really annoyed . i thought maybe there was something else out there that could make this movie so bad . when you do get really annoyed , you usually end up making a bunch of movies . well , here i was watching this film one day , and i was surprised at how bad it was .

with its few touches of surrealism , lwhtrb works as low - grade horror , but as a major follow - up statement to this novel it has great potential . in fact the book is so good you can just make out that it has never been before written . there is nothing on the screen about the plot or genre . i will admit i did not really like this movie , even though i have seen several movies and had my share of them . however i think this one was worth the effort . it was an excellent way to start the day .

the greatest movie ever . how ' s that for a contention ? however , if we look at it through purely cinematic means and take it to extremes , well , in this i see something that would make some people uncomfortable . after all , why would they watch such a crappy movie when most of the time they were watching a great movie themselves ? this movie had so much drama behind it . on the surface it looked cool , but in the dark , there is nothing to say you will ever actually see a movie and not realize what sort of person you are letting into your soul .

there is really no way to compare this motion picture to any other movie because no one has ever made it . the only thing that truly makes sense is the fact that the movie did not get as much as a 5 ' x 10 - inch or 6 " screen image , which is what you need to have in order to be able to buy an actual tv ! and the first thing you should notice is that the acting is not exactly the same as most of them . the cast is more like a collection of actors than a movie .

the basic idea behind ` ` dungeon of harrow ' ' is n ' t all bad . the acting , however , is not . i would suggest that you give this speech in a very positive light . we should be able to use it again on the following nights : http : // serializellie.blogspot.ca . here are the characters from the scene . i hope this will take your mind off your current issues . there is something i need to say to you . i know how hard this thing must be for you . i really do . i think it was horrible .

Let me begin by saying that I had been eagerly anticipating this film's release for awhile. After finally getting the chance to see it last night, I'm sorry to say that I was incredibly disappointed. It's hard to imagine a film that could make last fall's "Exorcist: The Beginning" look good, but "Dominion" does just that. No wait...it makes it look like a GREAT film. Perhaps I got myself too excited about this movie, and that contributed to the let down.

i ' d never thought that i would be caught saying this : but i think ` ` dog the bounty hunter '' was probably the most obvious one in the story , and so i did what i didn ' t mean to do . i wrote it out of sheer boredom rather than from any desire to see my friend again after the long hours i spent at work . i have done a good job of pretending to be depressed , even though i am happy about everything . i really didn ' t know what else to do .

This movie is a great film. The movie shows so many themes all in one amazing film. Driving Lessons centers around Ben (Rupert Grint) a shy 17 year old who is coming of age. The movie goes on about how Ben is sick of his dominating mother and how he just wants to be himself. Ben then meets Evie, who he makes a very special bond with. The two take a journey and in the process Ben finds himself and what a relationship that he and Evie share. This is the movie that you watch by yourself, or with someone else.

First off, I never got into Dr. Who until recently. Honestly, I never got the opportunity to watch any of the previous incarnations (pun intended) since it was never "big" here in the US as it is everywhere else.That said, I must say (obviously) that after finishing the 2nd season, that this is one of the best sci-fi shows I've ever seen.Now, I watch a lot of Sci-Fi shows from all over and this show stands out.The first season was tops to begin with, with Christopher Eccleston in the title role and I thought he was terrific.

Gordon Scott with his well coiffed hair, hourglass figure and weird pidgin English has to be the worst of all the Tarzans. As for the other actors in this mess, they're on a par with any 4th grade elementary school drama class. I've seen Used Car Dealers in TV commercials who can act better. They make Clayton Moore look like Laurence Olivier! And where does Jane (the dull Eve Brent) get her lipstick and eyebrow pencils in the jungle? I realize these were made for kids but Wow! The plot line seemed OK but the director should have required more from his actors.

Nightkill stars Robert Mitchum as a world-weary private eye probing the case of a missing industrialist (Mike Connors). He is hired by Jaclyn Smith, the anxious wife of the missing man. What Jaclyn fails to inform Mitchum is that she knows full well her husband's whereabouts. After all, she was the one who helped her lover James Franciscus dispose of her wealthy hubby.What more would expect from a rotten slasher film with Robert Mitchum? Mannix goes western, monkeys are abused, models lean against classic cars, and Smith is constantly upstaged by Sybil Danning until a giallo style wrap-up brings the whole sorry mess to a bitter end.

I won't waste your time by describing the plot for this, the other reviewer already did this quite well. I will however give you my opinion of this movie. This movie is basically anti japanese propoganda. The japanese are portrayed as incredably evil b**tards who have respect for nothing, as well as having very poor martial arts skills (groups of japanese men get there asses kicked by single women on more than one occasion.) The fact that the japanese fighters lose almost every (if not every) fight in the movie kind of takes away the suspense.

i watched the world premiere of this on the starz action channel . they call it vampires : the turning of the vampire into the girl who will one day be a vampire . 
 " let 's see if this has anything to do with blood sucking , " i said , not that it did . i mean , why would someone get up and walk down an aisle of a nightclub , looking like you just saw a zombie movie in the ' 80s ? anyway , here we are - at the front of the line , waiting to buy tickets for some sort of charity show .

now we were chosen to be tortured with this disgusting piece of blatant american propaganda . it came no wonder the whole country has been in a state of terror since the end of world war ii . i had read somewhere about an old movie by a woman who used to live in the us . she did not have any children and was forced to spend her time cleaning up after her children . i can think of several people who would make a great actress on tv . i mean , if there was anything at all attractive about me , it was my lack of ambition .

i loved the first movie , the second one was okay , disappointed john cleese was n ' t jean bob anymore . after watching it for a while , i had to agree with my brother . it did n't really look as if there was much action at the end , although there could be some action in most of the parts . they looked like something that happened years ago and not quite real . but this is a movie and you ca n't expect it to go all the way through every movie , no matter how good it is .

how many movies are there going to be in which against all odds , a ragtag team beats the big time by a whole million people ? i ca n't believe i was just given an award for my first novel . it was so easy to pick this film ! i was so engrossed that i did n't see what happened next . i was too worried about not looking like a complete nerd . but now i had a good idea of what the movie was gon na be about . i could n't really tell and i have absolutely no idea why anyone would want to watch any of these things .

that ' s a weird , weird movie and does n ' t deserve a better mark than david lynch ' s one ! it wasn ' t worth the time , effort and effort to make this play . i don ' t think i would have been able to tell if it was a good movie at all . what really sets me off - the fact that people were talking in a foreign language with very little american accents , or that the characters seem to be in control of themselves and speak english , or the fact that the plot did not even have an accent .

The sound is terrible, the picture is worse than worse, the acting is awful, the female leading actress is chubby, and the story is... wait a minute... There is no story...! The plot is really bad and the title of the movie is misleading. If you expect to to see Piranhas, you might be disappointed. This movie has nothing to do with the Piranha movies from 1978 and 1981. Actually, I can only think of one scene involving Piranhas.The only thing that I liked about this movie, besides the fact that it runs for only about 85 minutes, is the song at the end.

i looked forward to seeing this movie , because the trailer made it look so cool . but the fact that it was supposed to be filmed at all does not stop me from wanting to go home and watch another episode . you know what ? i really think about how stupid i was thinking when i bought this movie . let 's just call it my obsession . i should have gotten a copy of this movie for some reason . after all , i had been dreaming of getting this movie . i could n't help it if i loved this movie more than the first few films i 'd ever seen .

as a fan of henriksen ( i liked him in the ` ` millennium ' ' series ) and of course lorenzo di morre . they had been friends from the time of their inception until they met at an unseasonable point in their careers . during one of their brief encounters , lorenzo di morre showed up at the villa de montepulciano for a night out , and he introduced them to my parents who had recently come from barcelona and were looking for me . when i went to tell them that i had gone back to see them , they immediately began asking why i would go through all of that trouble .

if you ' ve ever been to ukraine , this movie is absolutely hilarious . from teenagers wearing gold chains , to middle - school girls wearing fake hair , to those who wear makeup and are just trying to look good , this movie shows up in the history books as some kind of parody of comedy . it is completely unappealing . i would hate to call it a movie at all , except that i am sure that it has more to do with what they think they have than with their own opinions on something . but then again , why should anyone care what other people believe about it ?

rififi is a great film that is overlooked . it ' s a crime drama where a man gets out of jail , only to go straight to prison for life . you ' ll think they ' ve been doing a good job of getting their plot wrong and putting them on camera . in fact , no one even sees the original film until about five years later . this was probably the worst film i did ever see so i have just seen it before . i really didn ' t give it any thought as i wasn ' t very much interested in watching it or reading about it .

a truly accurate and unglamourous look into modern day life . it could be set in any town in the world or at any time in this era , for all the history that i have ever seen or heard about it . as far as movies go , these movies are nothing compared to what really goes on in the films you just watch . there was a great deal of action along the way which is typical with many of the more violent films from the 1970s , ' 80s , and ' 90s . i always wanted to see one of those classic movies that had some sense of humor .

jack lemmon was one of our great actors . his performances in days of wine and roses , the apartment and my home were wonderful to watch , even if he lacked much acting . however , there are those who would call this ' show - breaking ' . that 's me ! i just ca n't understand why anyone would pay money for this as well as movies and such . what a waste is this ? it should be played like a play . how can you have something so fun and still have so much feeling in your stomach at the same time ?

When I sat down to watch Greek for the first time, I wasn't expecting a show with complex characters, intriguing plot lines, and impeccable writing... but that's exactly what I got.Greek follows several college students who are in the Greek system at Cyprus Rhodes University. Rusty Cartwright enters Cyprus Rhodes as a Polymer Science major who aspires to be in a fraternity. His older sister, Casey (the show's center and soon-to-be-president of Zeta Beta Zeta, the most prestigious sorority on campus), isn't exactly supportive of his plans.

` ` first snow ' ' has an intriguing beginning . a traveling salesman has his fortune told by an old man who knows more than he does about the business world -- and this is not unusual in the industry . after all , how often do you get a job on a trip to mexico city to see a mexican ghost town ? but then you get fired because you had to cancel your interview with don quixote for two hours ! when i came to las vegas and discovered it was the most boring part of the entire show , i could not help being disappointed .

In the mid 1800s, Irishman Dennis Hopper (as Daniel Morgan) emigrates to Australia, seeking a share of the continent's gold. Instead, Mr. Hopper finds himself branded, and thrown in a torturous prison; there, he is gang-raped. Upon release, Hopper hooks up with aborigine David Gulpilil (as Billy), with whom he seeks revenge upon sadistic Bill Hunter (as Sergeant Smith), Jack Thompson (as Detective Mainwaring), and others. Eventually, vengeance becomes heroism; Hopper is admired and assisted by the common people, and hunted by corrupt and powerful authorities.

Well, this is about as good as they come. There are arguments about whether Hitchcock was only a "master of commercial suspense" or maybe a "compulsive technician" -- or was he really "deep." Nobody knows precisely what terms like that mean, but it's legitimate to ask if, at his best, he could not have been all three things at once.In this one he seems to be about at his peak. Hardly anything in it is accidental. It abounds with doubt, ambiguity, and wit.

I seriously don´t know why this movie got such a hostile reception when it was first released. Sure, it´s overlong and somewhat gratuitous in its depictions of sexuality and violence but so are lots of well regarded movies. I seriously don´t think that the people who hated "Heaven´s Gate" really understood it. "Heaven´s Gate" in its uncut form, much like "The Deer Hunter" shows the gross differences of living an insecure and dangerous life (like the immigrants and Averil in Wyoming) and living in comfort and privilege (like the settled "Americans" in Wyoming and Averil in the prologue and epilogue).

The only good either of the Problem Child films caused was bringing together Amy Yasbeck and the late John Ritter. Aside from that, the flicks are as demonic as their hero. I wouldn't recommend it, but it's the kind of thing that people who loved the book and people who watch that network all the time will think is great.

Comparisons to the original series are inevitable. It's a shame Diana Rigg left the original show in the 1960's due to mistreatment on the part of the producers, and MacNee probably regretted this as much as any fan - there's no telling how long the show might have lasted otherwise. Linda Thorson was OK as a replacement and her episodes still retained almost all of the quality and aspects of the Rigg episodes - only the Rigg/Macnee chemistry was lacking. The New Avengers should have been left on the shelf - a declining Macnee, an annoying Purdey, and a who the hell is this guy Gambit.

I've enjoyed this movie ever since I first saw it in the theatre. Some movies have a cast of characters and a script that come together in perfect synergy, and this is one of them. The characters illustrate some truths about getting the best out of people, working together harmoniously, building a team and achieving goals, without ever preaching morality. The situations are crafted well and are consistent with the movie's opening premise. The tension builds nicely and the humor is clean and consistent throughout. The movie manages to pull me right in to root for the characters, and to laugh pretty well all the way through.

There is no reason to watch this film.Why? Many reasons. First up, the acting is awful. There is hardly a line that isn't misread - but that is hardly surprising given the banality, stupidity, and repetitiveness of the dialogue the actors are asked to mouth. It is awfully written. One of the most annoying things about the script is that the writers only seem to know one way of keeping their characters talking after a certain point and that is to have them repeat the most important words of the previous character's line."Repeat?"

Corben Bernsen directed horror film about a chemical weapon being released in a sporting event and turning everyone in to insane monsters. We watch as the staff at a radio station takes reports.Its has moments but mostly it plays like a Lifetime horror movie with breasts and blood. There are some really good ideas here, but they just don't work. Actually the film's ideas are better handled in a film called Pontypool which pretty much works all the way through and builds tension by not showing us anything. This shows us stuff and it just seems cheap.

"Chupacabra Terror" is saved from a '1" by the presence of Canadian cutie Chelan Simmons as the heroine. She is a delight to watch, from the front, back and side. Otherwise, what you have here is your standard monster movie, playing like a low-budget, shipboard version of THE RELIC. John Rhys-Davies plays the captain of the ship on which the monster is being transported. And the very nonscary monster is simply a man in a suit. He does commit about 100 senseless, gory killings, at least, so the body count in this one is pretty awesome.

lucio fulci , a director not exactly renowned for his subtlety , ill - advisedly tries his hand at black humour in which the whole world goes crazy . what he has no idea is how many people are watching and thinking about that movie , who are they going to ask ? well , i suggest one of the most unpopular films of the 1980s ( although there have been other movies made in their time ) . it was just before 1971 when hollywood premieres the movie . i can not remember actually seeing this film until recently , except that it appeared in 1992 .

"You can survive anything". Anything except a dumb horror flick. The director couldn't even decide whether he wanted a demon or just a plain ol' backwoods serial killer. You can't have both. It's like Michael Moore trying to have his cake and eat it too (or in his case 1500 cakes) by making his particular charlatan brand of "docu-comedies": they're supposed to be oh-so hilarious and zany, and yet you're also meant to treat them as truth-based, earth-shattering, hard-hitting documentaries. Some genres cannot be mixed.

The Governess was, by far, a very pitiful film. I do not use this word loosely, as it honestly was a poor excuse for a movie. I finished watching this feature with only one word on my mind  "why"? Honestly, you could use this question at the end of every scene of this film and it would seem like it fit. There were so many inconsistencies that lead to a lack of development (both in the story and in the characters) which ultimately lead to a very confusing film with actors walking through the motions instead of giving any explanation.

David Cronenberg movies are easily identifiable, or at least elements within the movie stand out as his trademarks. Fetishism, the blurring between the organic and inorganic, squishy throbbing things that shouldn't be squishy and throbbing. "eXistenZ" is classic Cronenberg. Briefly, it's about a future generation of computer games, but instead of a video monitor, visuals are supplied by your mind. The game plugs directly into a 'bio port' in the base of your spine and while the game is running, the player can't tell reality from game.

This film makes several nods to various science fiction films. The prologue reminds me of the one for the original theatrical version of THX-1138 (the trailer for BUCK ROGERS, here it was clips from some early Japanese SF TV show). Then the opening shot of the city in 2345 has the dragon blip flying overhead with a billboard, reminding one immediately of BLADERUNNER. The BLADERUNNER aspect comes evenmore pronounced when we meet the hero, who is called a Replicant (He is blond haired and is called Ryo, a homage to Roy Batty, Rutger Hauer's character in BLADERUNNER?).

Adam Sandler's movies are my favorite comedies. The Silence of the Lambs is my favorite horror movie. The Matrix is my favorite sci-fi movie. By the end of this movie I felt as if I knew her character better than I knew myself. She did a simply amazing job.Natalie Portman also did a great job. I recently rented her first movie, Leon (1994), in which she played a 12 year old girl.

plodding , maybe that should have been the title . bad dialogue delivered at a snail ' s pace . all this is for no purpose other than to be a way to make me feel better in the book . so far , i have spent the last three hours on my knees trying to think about what to write down . i ' ll have to let you go , because you know i love writing ! i was hoping that i might write a few more reviews but now i find it hard to finish the book .

this is the worst of the toxie series by far . the acting in tokyo is horrible and you can see that most people have a bad taste in movies . this film has been based on japanese tv , which could be worse . but it goes beyond that . i have never felt like this at any time . i was n't sure whether to try and enjoy the movie as if i had been doing so before , or if i would need to get a real job to pay bills and keep the kids from getting into trouble for being out of their mothers ' way .

Burt Kennedy both wrote & directed this western taken from a novel. Kennedy was a well known good writer & director, mostly westerns.Robert Mitchum was a star for over 20 years when he made this. This role was like many he had made already,One can see why he was a big star for so many years.He filled this role easily like a well used glove.The title character is played by Robert Walker Jr. (his father a fine actor Robert Walker--died tragically at age 32---his mother is noted actress Jennifer Jones).Robert was of slight build & even though he had talent only made a few films.

Did people expect "Jurassic Park 3" to be full of surprises? Not one moment of it is worth it. Many elements could easily scare people out of the movies...and it's not the dinos! This weird movie from Texas is about Fallon, a dilettante rich boy in the late 1800s (although he looks like a 60s C&W singer with greasy hair and sideburns) whose ship wrecks on an island owned by Count DeSade (pronounced de-sayd) with his captain. The count is afraid of pirates and tortures a young girl who was once a pirate hostage and also tortures the captain. Meanwhile, creepy former nurse Cassandra tells Fallon the secrets of the castle. The Countess has leprosy and went mad! Fallon is trapped but brings supplies. The captain is killed by a racist-caricature slave.

David Cronenberg's `eXistenZ' is a well designed reflection of the philosophy of existentialism. It addresses the problems of a culture that is plugged into technology that it can no longer distinguish between fantasy and reality or between the organic and the mechanical. The movie shocks the audience with its replacement of mechanical technology with organic, metabolismic one. In this context the technology is able to be part of human body. After playing the virtual reality game of `eXistenZ', the real world feels like a game and as a result, human behavior change in order to apply violent game-urges even when the game is over.

Half Past Dead was unlike any Steven Segal film I've ever seen. Very little of Segal, himself in action and I agree with the last review I read, Nia Peeples steals the show.I saw nothing really new here, just the same old stuff from other flicks changed around a little. The best action scenes were Nia's as she once again kicked butt. It was interesting seeing her as the bad guy after watching her for two seasons on Walker, Texas Ranger, still kicking butt, but for the good guys.

i was really beginning to enjoy this show . it just started out slow and it was n ' t given the full impact of the plot . but i had been to the theatre a lot in the years after my father went to hollywood for his film . it is very entertaining . the only point that i like to remember is when i watched him perform . as a young boy you could almost believe he was a man , but on the whole , he looked like a man in his prime . there were moments that made my mother cringe at times , but they always ended well .

it ' s unlikely that anyone except those who adore silent films will appreciate any of the lyrical camera - work and busy characters at all . just because it ' s a bad movie does not mean it ' s an effective one . i can ' t tell you how many times i ' d had this movie made , but this film didn ' t look half bad . it actually appeared to have been filmed during its time as an amateur noir movie , and is very well loved . in addition , there are quite a number of humorous scenes which never fail to amaze me .

This Christmas gift arrived courtesy of TCM. We had never seen the film, even though we have seen most of the films of Barbara Stanwyck. This comedy made us laugh so much, that at times, we had to restrain ourselves, in order to hear the dialog.This is a movie that should be seen by people suffering from stressful situations, especially around Christmas. It would certainly lift one's spirits by just letting go. The movie would make a perfect gift in the form of a DVD, or a VHS tape.

robert mckimson ' s ' acrobatty bunny ' is one of the director ' s finest shorts . although the circus - based setting may be very good if you really know what it ' s about , this show would have been nice if you knew the main character , a man in his 60 's who was only 18 years old with an undefined career path and a long history of womanizing to boot . this is such a ridiculous thing that i could have easily laughed out loud had i known what he was up to all these years . i think i just got tired of listening to him for five minutes .

this was a modern tv classic ! the story goes like this , bob has a girlfriend named alicia . he loves her because she ' s beautiful , smart , kind , funny , brave and very smart . they move to new york city in just four days . that is when alicia is kidnapped from her house by the police . we have no idea where or how she got away . there is no record of her being living in new york city on this time of year , so we ' ve never heard of her until recently .

Any fan of Russian cinema will have great difficulty in believing the sub-par performances phoned-in by Mashkov and Bodrov Jr., and will perhaps be utterly perplexed by Bodrov Sr.'s hackneyed and confusing script, which is coupled with uncharacteristically weak direction. a middle aged man , robert jordan , set in his ways , takes on a boy scout troop after some bad things happened . this is one of the most disturbing situations that have been played out so far and has caused me to lose interest . i was just as shocked as you all were by it . i am sure many would disagree with me on this ' film ' but we do know for a fact that no one has done this before . i just hope it was worth getting involved in , even if it will cost me my job .

this movie was terrible . it is not something that people should have to pay to see . it looks like we need to give this movie more credit than the rest of the film . if you really love this movie , you would appreciate some reviews or critiques from critics . the acting and editing is great . it is a shame that no one else can do this because the characters all seemed so unconvincing ( which is saying something ! ) . but i will admit that this film is rather good as well . also , i just want to say thanks to the editors for making this movie worth watching .

This is a little-seen anti-war film that has been ignored for too long. The time is Thanksgiving of 1972. The place is a typical suburban home somewhere in Texas. The oldest son has just comeback from Vietnam and he is having a hell of time readjusting to the life he had left behind. And the family does not know how to handle the problem. I honestly don't think I'm exaggerating when I say this is one the most heart-wrenching war films I've seen. The funny thing is that there are only a handful of combat sequences in the entire movie.
