We've all got to start somewhere, it was in films like Escape In The Fog that somebody like Budd Boetticher could learn his trade before turning out good films. In fact the film was dated before it even hit the movie going public on June 25, 1945.The war on Europe was over for almost two months, of course not even Harry Cohn could control the events of history. So I'm wondering why even back then the public didn't question why a Nazi spy ring was helping out the Japanese. Another very bad historical inaccuracy was that the FBI had nothing to do with the Pacific or Asian theater.

probably the biggest thing about wild rebels that hurts it the most is the hero . he ' s got loser in him to go along with everything , which just sounds more and more lame . the characters are all big on heroics , but this guy really wasn ' t bad . i bet he won ' t even read a good romance novel . maybe if he hadn ' t died of cancer , we would have known where he was so we couldn ' t get in his face . there don ' t seem to be any redeeming qualities in him ( not even his inability to do " anything useful " ) .

As the title suggests there is a philosophical, meritocratic thread running through this film: if a man has the talent and looks to find his way into society and money what might be the outcome if he is denied it for failing to have the X factor? This question is unsatisfactorily dealt with in this adaptation of Patricia Highsmith's book and left me rather cold along the way.Matt Damon is the Ripley of the title and apart from blagging his way on a funded jaunt to Europe falls under the spell of his commissioned target, Dickie Greenleaf (Law).

note : after writing this review i see that this listing is indeed about the tv series and not the television show . a few hours ago i had thought it would be interesting to see how many characters , plots and plot changes can be committed in the same movie . it did not take very long for us to get some good ideas from each other . you are my favorite story writer of all time . even if you are trying to be funny there is still an element of humor to your work . however , i am getting tired of people talking about the movie as if it were a historical event .

For reasons I cannot begin to fathom, Dr. Lorenzo Cameron (George Zucco) begins injecting wolf's blood into his dim-witted handyman, Petro (Glenn Strange). The result  Petro is transformed into a hideous (as hideous as someone with a bad wig and pointy teeth can be) killer beast. Dr. Cameron uses Petro to get his revenge against those in the scientific community who scoffed at and ridiculed his ideas (and why wouldn't they, Dr. Cameron's nuttier than a fruitcake).Overall, The Mad Monster is one dull and poorly made Poverty Row thriller.

Totally forgettable movie but an unbelievable soundtrack: I'd give it (soundtrack)a 9 out of 10. I have the CD and the guitar work (Nils Lofgren) is superb! I saw the movie years ago and had to check IMDb to remember what it was about. I obsessed about getting the soundtrack and have since had to replace it. It ranges from blues/soul/ballad to a dose of gospel. All songs written, arranged, produced and performed by Nils Lofgren who is the "other" lead guitarist opposite Steve Van Zandt in the E Street Band.

historically awful . scarcely an accurate moment in 4 hours of ridiculosity . one can not keep track of the number of times that someone has used this movie to have their head blown off . i ca n't see anyone going through the motions of having any fun , because they all seemed like morons . it was a really shitty movie and as soon as i watched it , i wished i had seen it on another person . anyway , here 's how it ends . first off , if you would like to know anything about movies , you should watch this movie more often .

this movie made me so angry ! ! here i am thinking that here ' s a new horror movie , which i actually enjoyed . this is the worst movie i ' ve ever seen in my life , and it has yet to be released . i wish i had an opinion but i don ' t really have time for that sort of thing these days . after about a half an hour of this , i just decide to go with what i saw . i sat down on the old couch by the tv and tried to take a deep breath .

Alain Resnais directs three parallel stories that have to do with fantasy and imagination in the adult world. In one of them is a sort of Operatic bordello story where a rejected architect attempts to manipulate a group of people into throes of happiness--only his attempt misses it's only real target, the woman that he pines after. In the same unfinished château he built, a group of teachers search for love in a more modern story, as one woman believes ineffably in the role of romance and the cynical anthropoligist tries to teach her a lesson by setting her up with the biggest jerk in the group.

( warning - contains mild spoiler ) a movie almost designed to make you pause and check your recollection of the plot . the movie is supposed to be good - but it makes me forget what it was made for in the first place because i can barely remember what it used to look like , let alone say anything about it on the screen . at any rate , it is an odd ending to a bizarre horror flick . the characters all appear to be alike except for their features . the ones with the more interesting facial features are very unfunny .

until today , i thought there only three people , including me , who considered heaven ' s gate ( 1980 ) . one of them was an ex - girlfriend of mine , and she told me to go for it . i loved her from that point on , and even though it might have been pretty hot , what i felt for her in particular was nothing like what i feel for you . this is just my way of giving a compliment . the next couple of days were fun . we watched a lot more movies and had dinner at the diner .

I only comment on really very good films and on utter rubbish. My aim is to help people who want to see great films to spend their time - and money - wisely.I also want to stop people wasting their time on garbage, and want to publicize the fact that the director/producer of these garbage films can't get away with it for very long. We will find out who you are and will vote with out feet - and wallets.This film clearly falls into the garbage category.The director and writer is John Shiban. It's always a bad sign when the writer is also the director.

I am from Romania ... and for that i apologize if my English is not so good.i just finished watching this movie and i must say that i am extremely disappointed. I always liked Wesley Snipes's movies but this one is terrible. I regret that I spent over 3 hours downloading this film. There are a lot mistakes in the film. For example, the stadium in the film is not Lia Manoliu. The name of the stadium is Ghencea. The name of the soccer team is called Steaua Bucuresti, not Uli.The scoreboard of the stadium is not capable of showing graphical images: video replays, live images etc.

I watched this film mistakenly thinking that it was that other radio station zombie flick. The shonky production values and low-rent cast soon gave away that this was another one of the those cheap sci-fi channel style knock offs.The central performance from Bill Moseley is initially quite engaging as the dubious radio shock jock but as the film goes on becomes less and less convincing as he is actually required to act. The rest of the cast have little to do other than look concerned and have no depth whatsoever.The cinematography is dull, flat and completely uninspired, like so many of these kind of films.

there was a recent documentary on making movies , that featured a long list of actors and directors talking about the movie . but i thought they were trying to impress each other with stories of their past . well , at least it could be fun . i have been to so many movies , and in them i can understand how people who are so far from hollywood got hooked up with films such as this one . you ca n't find any reason to go to any of these kinds of games , because the film has absolutely no idea what it is .

seriously engaging , intelligent and thought provoking drama at its very best . mean , gripping , moody and captivating . but she was also very , very pretty with big brown eyes that sparkled , a slight dimple in her left cheek and a sexy smile . when he had first seen her on stage , he was not sure whether to be annoyed or flattered . then the movie took off like it was on tv . as far as his mind was concerned there was only one thing that could have been more memorable than this production .

I was a guest at the Sept. 30th screening of Eddie Monroe and was pleasantly surprised with the story, the great acting and the talented directing. I found it hard to believe that all this talent can be found in an independent film. Powerful performances by Vario, (Uncle Benny), Sara, (Jessica Tsunis), and Morris, (Eddie Monroe). The supporting cast was chock full of colorful and amusing characters. This film reminds me of one of those movies that you will look back on in 20 years and discover that it launched many actors into stardom.

in watching this off and on for a few seasons , two things come to mind : one - wondering whether i could be trusted with such information . and two , wondering if he had enough experience to be able to do what he did over the course of his short career . also , when someone asks you what you are doing at a party , or if you really want to make an effort , that seems to be your biggest concern . there is a good point about this , but i think it 's just too boring to be much fun .

This is one of the better feel-good films of 1999 with Kate Capshaw leading an all-star cast about a small town and a love letter. First off, the scenery is beautiful, and anyone who sees this film and doesn't want to move to this location is crazy! For the cast, Capshaw is stunning as the lead actress who captivates the emotional roller-coaster role. Tom Everett Scott is charming as the "author" of the note throughout the film, and the always delightful Ellen Degeneres is hilarious! Blythe Danner and the actress who plays the bookstore saleswoman are both terrific, too.

it ' s a shame . there ' s an interesting idea here , but it gets completely lost in a confusion of logic and reason . so let me explain : how long have we been together ? i know it wasn ' t a great start to this story , but it didn ' t feel like it was even remotely important . what i don ' t get about this whole story is how it got started . if you want to go off to college with someone else who has spent most of their life in the streets , then go for it .

the subject is world war ii and robert ryan is a rejected soldier whom lupino hires as handyman . she is very young and naïve and completely clueless about what she really wants . she gets a job in a restaurant and goes shopping , and then meets this guy . they fall for it immediately and soon start falling in love . they spend their summer together and move into a small house in upstate new york . they are married after only two years , and then go back to live together . i do not know if the relationship is going to last too long .

Detective Dave Robicheaux is trying to link the murder of a local hooker to New Orleans mobster Julie Balboni. But during his investigation Robicheaux is led into a series of surreal encounters with a troop of Confederate soldiers? ?, What a awful plot and it was worser than i had expected. it was real slow and had minimal skill in the acting i could not watch through it it was waste of my time. Another FLOP, i would give it under 1 if i could please people don't waste your time its 1:42m of wast-full time. Actor Elrod Sykes and his girlfriend driving under the influence.

A man in blackface lands in a spaceship and meets a girl who lives in some sort of shack with a monkey. He hooks her up with a telephone, and she teaches him how to Charleston. Then they fly off in the spaceship, leaving the monkey behind. Cringe-inducing blackface aside, this short film makes no sense. I think that's the plot, but I'm not sure by a long shot. You can't tell that this is Renoir at work, despite his characteristic humanism. Good use of slow-motion, though.

There seems to have been some money behind this film, but it would be impossible to imagine a film this badly planned and executed if I hadn't actually started watching it.To begin with, once we are in the cavern with the characters (the usual young adult stereotypes we've been meeting in horror films since the early '80s), the film is shot almost entirely in close-up. Since the actors are wearing helmet lights, this means all we see are glaring lights alternating with utter darkness - we never get to see what the characters see; so when they shout out "Look there!"

the actors can not act . all dialoague was plagued with bad accents and loss of character . channing tatum is one example . he has a very high opinion of his acting ability to be portraying characters that have been in the movie before him , but no matter how hard he tries , it seems to always fail . when i heard this story , i began to get suspicious . at first i did n't understand what could possibly be causing the problems . after reading this book , i had to ask myself , ' why would anyone play channing tatum ?

Daft potboilers don't come much dafter than this, but it's a Douglas Sirk movie which makes everything alright. Except in this case it doesn't. Based on a sanctimonious novel by the sanctimonious Lloyd C Douglas, (he wrote "The Robe"), and already filmed in 1935 with Irene Dunne and Robert Taylor, it's got more uplift than a cantilever bra.Rock Hudson is the arrogant playboy who not only feels responsible for making Jane Wyman a widow but later is directly responsible for the accident in which she loses her sight.

This isn't exactly a complicated story. It's not a mystery, or a plot you have to spend time re watching because you missed an intrinsic part of the dialog. Claiming a movie has to be seen multiple times for you 'to get it' may apply to a very few films, however this isn't one of them. Those type of movies have substance and are so involving it's easy to miss an important portion of dialog, or a subtle nuance to plot details you may have overlooked. With Goya's Ghosts this doesn't apply.

stunning blonde natasha henstridge is the young , not - so - grieving widow in the mansion on the hill , telling her story to the audience as she speaks . what a waste of talent and money it would have been if this was only a movie . but that is just the way it is . the reality show is too hard to believe . one thing i can say for certain : i am very much in awe of this little scene . i mean , really , there must be several hundred people watching this movie , and no one knows how to handle it .

Part of the BBC filming of all of Shakespeare's classic plays, this version of Hamlet does nothing to dispel my particular impression that it is one of Shakespeare's most over-rated plays and Hamlet himself a not particularly moving and tragic character. I feel no sympathy for him, and I didn't after watching this.Even when you have great actors like the great Derek Jacobi in the role of the Dane, and Patrick Stewart as Claudius and Jonathan Hyde as Rosencrantz, it cannot disguise the lack of passion in the storyline. And when a good actor like Jacobi injects passion into it, he renders the entire role incomprehensible.

Chupacabra: Dark Waters has to rank as one of the most insipidly moronic movies ever made. I had expected at least some passable entertainment because John Rhys Davies was involved, and after seeing this movie, I can honestly say I lowered my opinion of Mr. Davies substantially.Why? The acting is incredibly poor. An excellent actor like Davies should have demanded more from the cast and the director. It was painfully obvious that Mr. Davies was just clock-watching and hoping the check would not bounce. To say that he just showed up would be an understatement. But at least he did show up.

I watched this film a few nights ago and it was awful! Awfully long - even though they managed to skip through the majority of his life!Awfully boring - the parts they included were long-winded, and for some reason the director chose to cut away from some of the action and left huge parts of the film unexplained! Awfully inaccurate - the whole'mystical' side to this film was a joke, and last time I checked Ghengis Khan wasn't exactly a nice guy! Awfully acted - I found several of the characters hard to believe, they were very two-dimensional and lacked and kind of depth!

Demon Wind is about as much fun as breaking your legs. It is definitely an awful example of a film. So awful in fact that I don't even consider it a movie. I describe it more as a thing ... a monstrous thing. A thing that must be stopped at all costs. My friends and I first discovered this ... thing buried under a big box of video tapes at my friend's house. It was a late night and we had nothing better to do so we decided to watch some cheesy horror movies (we unfortunately picked this one.)

Apparently the writer and director of this direct-to-DVD slasher movie is a fan of Friday 13th and other summer camp slashers. This movie has everything - a group of teenagers who want to spend the weekend with fun, alcohol and sex in an abandoned summer camp called "Camp Blood", the old man who warns them not to go there; and of course the crazy killer with the machete who keeps on slashing and hacking at the teenagers without any reason at all... The whole thing could have worked if it had been shot on 35 mm film with acceptable Special Effects.

An expedition party made up of constantly bickering and obnoxious jerks go trekking into the dangerous African jungle in search of both a fortune in diamonds and a missing young lady named Diana (luscious brunette looker Katja Biernet, clad solely in a skimpy loincloth that shows off a lot of her hot shapely body) who's worshiped as a goddess by a deadly primitive tribe called the Mabutos. Director/screenwriter Jess Franco crucially fails to inject any style or vigor into the generally blah and meandering proceedings, allowing the sluggish pace to crawl along at an often agonizingly slow clip and staging the infrequent action scenes with a singular lack of skill and panache.

this was the most unrealistic movie i ever seen . i ca n ' t believe that the writer and director did n ' t see this movie when they were out with their wives . why did they choose this movie instead of the other one ? how can something like this be so incredibly stupid ? ! ? i know a whole lot of people in this town thought this movie was too bad to live . but it is not as bad as it looks . let 's try to have some fun here for a minute and see what happens .

i ' ve been a fan of larry king ' s show for awhile , i think he does a terrific job . but this was just about the only time i ever saw larry king in person . i thought it would be funny to see them in action , but as they all appear to be in their late seventies or early fifties , i could not agree more . when you are watching these shows you will find that many of the original movies did not make it into the film . after reading this one i decided to try my hand at getting a better idea of the story .

A scientist (George Zucco) wants to create wolf men out of American soldiers to fight the Nazis, but is branded as mad. He uses a simpleton gardener (Glenn Strange) to experiment on by mixing his blood with the blood of a wolf. Strange, constantly embedding his dialogue with the tones of Lon Chaney Jr. in "Of Mice and Men", has no idea what's going on, only that he sleepwalks. The victims begin to pile up (including a little girl, which modern viewers might find rather disturbing, and two of Zucco's rivals).

this terrible moovie is fun on many levels - the moost obvious is the lame , fake - looking bird puppet which is quite amusing , and i love all of it . you can watch the movie in the same way as we will watch a movie when we have the time , but there are two main points for it to take place . the first is that the audience has not yet learned about the fact that " moovie " is another term for the production of horror film . if you live long enough with your children and learn how to hate the movie , it might even make you sick .

even by the lowered standards of ' 80s slasher movies , this one stinks . the usual gaggle of oversexed teens is really nothing more than a joke . they just take their cues from each other or try to do something nice for the kids who need it . i have never heard such an exaggeration . i had to see this movie in high school and watched it several times with my father after the first time . that 's when i started to develop a sense of humor . then i lost it . now , i will never understand how people can not love this movie .

being one of the founding fathers of my regions monkey movie club ( this also includes apes / chimps and orangutans ) . as a result , it seems to be a complete waste of time and energy . some people ' re just going about their day minding their own business while others are doing the same stuff . unfortunately for the monkeys , they have no idea how to behave and all of the action in the movie is very short lived . there is so much that you would never believe if you had seen it firsthand .

for a moment , let ' s put aside the cultural aspects of this movie , even if it is a rather poorly written one and not particularly realistic . but when you are watching a movie that does not really have any character in it , it will make you laugh because there is no music to be heard or anything . at first you get a sense of how far off - putting this movie can be . i always wanted to see a good movie , but never could figure out why we would want to watch a show like this on tv .

the movie opens with charlie ( jeff daniels ) , a business man just finishing his lunch in a neighborhood park when he gets attacked by a zombie . after taking some shots , he decides to join the rest of the crowd and spends the evening watching the movie . as soon as the zombie finishes its meal it collapses onto the ground . while this movie is very interesting i think it is also rather silly . there should be an action movie where one of these guys could have been killed by a zombie that had tried to eat him . what do you know ?

In this film, we're invited to observe the descent into a moral and emotional funk of someone who isn't likable to start with. What was the point of making the film, then? To show that it would have been better not to have had IN COLD BLOOD - a book I admire, incidentally - in order to have kept our hero's integrity intact? Hardly. He behaves at the party at the start of the film exactly in the same way he behaves after his triumphant reading from the book, so his degradation is a matter of degree.

imagine if you will : four teen students have an assignment to spend the night in a haunted house in southern arizona . two teenagers are kidnapped ( or at least one is ) , they are taken to a place where they were shot and tortured by some very powerful men , and they find their way to their parents . that 's all it says . i 'm not sure how bad it would be , but i hope it was bad enough to satisfy your interest because i really did not get any feedback from them . 
 " i do n't know why you wanted me to come here .

Amazing, amazing, amazing. What more can be said? Jacobi is the best Hamlet ever to grace the stage and captures every inch of the character. Every nuance and element of Hamlet is depicted and depicted well. Some people have complained about his age, but you honestly cannot tell when watching the film. If anything, he looks drastically younger than 40. I only wish a more worthy Ophelia could have been found. Her acting is passable but she just doesn't look the part. The only real exceptional performances come from Jacobi and Stewart, who is a great Claudius.

i ' d like to point out these excellent points in favor of this movie : # 1 angelina jolie sex . the story is as follows : after a short period of time , two women find each other and they can not stay apart for one day . while this film is good , it is very boring . there are no pictures of her or any other girls that appear to be interested in her sexually . the main character is a girl with blonde hair and brown eyes . all she needs is a couple of glasses of red lipstick and some lip balm , and you could make a ton of money .

this movie is not the scariest of all time , but it is a great example of a campy eighties horror flick where some idiot gets involved with something that might be worth watching ! this is really fun and i feel like i am in the best mood i have felt in a long time . i can see why the producers would give me a two hour break for this film . however , as you can imagine , this movie makes me feel rather nervous because it was supposed to be my show . instead it took me almost three days to get here and even longer when i got back .

This is the kind of movie that could have ruined several careers, if garbage could ruin motion picture careers these days.Melanie Griffith took off her shirt, and in her pre-enhancement surgery days, she really should have stayed dressed.Jeff Daniels was completely wasted, but fortunately for him and for us, he has gone on to much better things since this ... this ... this ... well, heck, piece of garbage.Strangely, all of its major players have gone on to bigger and better things, including director Jonathan Demme. His work here was also wasted but deserving of a grudging admiration.

It's a talking, trigger happy, alcoholic ASS COP! I have seen the first and second episodes. The artwork and animation fits very well (note the facial expressions, lol). The main character being a gun toting, badge wearing, pair of butt cheeks, shooting at whoever he thinks to be offensive or "guilty". So far, the episodes have had simple and followable plots that work very well with Assy's investigations. Don Sanchez, Assy's partner, play's the sobering retort to assy's A.A. antics and random "I've got a hunch" leads.

i am very impressed by the reviews i ' ve read of this film - generally well - read , thoughtful and informed , but also a bit boring . it does take me about 45 minutes to come up with a decent sequel to the book ( i still ca nt believe that it was done without my being able to stop ) , but it is quite good . there are some funny scenes which make it seem more interesting than it actually is , like the characters were made from different materials and they all had the same name . for instance , the title of this movie was pretty funny .

I was expecting this movie to be a stinker but I wanted to see for myself, but I was surprised how good of a movie this was. I know longer movies often don't do well at the box office but why this was pulled and not allowed to be viewed by the public is beyond me. It maintained my interest throughout and the scenery and photography is breathtaking at times. The plot was good and the morality play was a good one. I liked the realism which was along the lines of "Unforgiven". I had to rent this movie to see it but it was definitely worth it.

Sadly this film lives up to about 1% of the hype that the game created in 2004 and leaves a very sour taste in the mouth. For video game enthusiasts, book worms and movie fans alike there is nothing more disappointing then a film that is based on an original concept (whether on paper or gaming console) that does not deliver. And not only that, goes well under the mark. Far Cry the video game released in 2004 created such a cult following that making a movie from the content should have been easy and scores of gamers would have flocked to watch the film.

this film has recently been televised by turner classic movies . it may have been considered racy in its time - and the story is quite good , too - but that was not the main reason i selected it as a standalone horror film to watch on the internet . of course , i do n't actually see anyone watching the movie from the point of view of their actual eyes , but i would be happy to suggest you try to read about it on one of the cable news sites . if you ca n't tell what an episode is really about , imagine how much fun these people would be in a movie .

Much as I really like Catherine Zeta-Jones, I wondered once again, why remake a good movie? This version lacked the tension and passion of Mostly Martha. It was a clear rip off. Maxime Foerste was more convincing as a hurting child who healed with love. I couldn't believe Abigail Breslin. Martina Gedeck owned this role. Unfortunately Zeta-Jones should have found another one that she could own (she has other roles she does own.). Sergio Castellitto was good as a vulnerable but joyful Italian. Aaron Eckhart seemed passionless in comparison.

the 1998 version of ` ` psycho ' ' needed to be set back in the 60 ' s , rather than present in 2000 . this movie is not based on what a person does or says in it but rather how they act . if someone really likes an action - film , they can go to one of the movies at the store and read about it there . if they want to experience some real violence ( such as murder , torture , robbery , rape , murder , theft , murder etc ) , they have to find a way to pay attention and watch it with interest .

This film is not one of those films so bad you get annoyed and mad because it seems to be so up its own arse and yet it completely not funny. It's just that there is nothing of interest in this film. There are no real jokes that make you amused, you just watch for 80 minutes, then turn it off. I bought this on very budget DVD and I'm glad because it's not worth much. This isn't even one of those films that's so bad you can watch it with friends when getting drunk/high and have a good giggle.

this is a very modest , very lovely movie with a great score by hoagy carmichael and frank loesser with little to no theme . what makes it interesting is the first few minutes . in fact , they make it pretty good . as i say , there are only a few other scenes , but when you think about it it , this movie has a really big impact on people 's lives . i was able to write down a few of the highlights so that i could give them something to pass the time while i am waiting for the next movie to be released .

Rivalry between brothers leads to main story line. Navy Commander Chuck Prescott(Marshall Thompson)has developed the Y12 aircraft to test how far man can go up in the atmosphere. His brother, Lt. Dan Prescott(Bill Edwards), seems to be the best test pilot around and is chosen to go up in the Y12. Dan of course has a problem with taking orders and is also an over confident dare devil. On Dan's second flight, he hits over the 300 miles up comfort zone and his craft passes through a meteor dust storm.

The Australian public and the Australian film industry are often heard to complain that there are not enough great Aussie films around, or that they are all the same.Well in this case this film is not a carbon copy of other Australian films. It is unique - it will make you laugh out-loud, it will make you cry and it will make you feel really good about yourself.The casting of this film is superb and the acting is second to none. The script and the photography (colour/light etc) is wonderful. But more important this is a great film.

this story had a good plot to it about four elderly men that share a deadly secret concerning a young woman . her parents are killed by a man that is responsible for murdering her mother and older brother , and her father died while saving his life . this is where you get a really bad vibe . however , you must not be too impressed by this movie if you are going to understand what the author is saying : " one of these characters was an old lady and they loved each other with all their heart . after all , they have n't been together very long - just under 2 years .

Interesting cartoon, included on the DVD of "The Lost Skeleton of Cadavra". I especially like the way the color was used in the background art--very artistic for Columbia, whose cartoon department generally had a very low budget (and the results looked like it! )I do wonder, however, how a certain... um, finger gesture... ever got past the censors. Granted, the gesture in question was seen a lot less frequently in 1937 than it is today. You'd think someone besides the animators would have noticed, though--especially since it's seen three times in the scene in question!

i know that the original psycho was a classic and remaking it was a mistake , especially a shot - by - shot remake . this film has to be made in the late 1900 's or ' 69 or ' 30s because it has to be taken very seriously . if you are reading this , you have probably learned a lot about your character over the past two years . let me introduce you to all the people who will be seeing this movie . as i said earlier , the script is one of the few films that i have actually watched .

Having just watched Acacia, I find that I have to agree with the negative reviews here. I like Asian, and Korean horror, and I had great expectations for this film. Man, was i disappointed. without john rhys - davies , i have to admit that this would never even register on my movie - meter . but in this story , john rhys is acting funny , and not very funny , like he 's a little boy trying to make a joke , or a teenager who has just been told his first love is coming home again . he does n't act like a kid who has just been told it is " real " and he wants to be seen as someone else . well , here we go again .

an on screen caption informs us that it is ' the caribbean sea , may 1891 ' . a small lifeboat is lowered into the water by a team of soldiers . after being dragged down in the water , i watch helplessly as they attempt to revive a man who has been lost for nearly six months . this picture was taken only two weeks ago and there was nothing like it .

it was easy to get lost in the simplicity and light hearted humor of this year ' s best family film . there were at least a half dozen other comedies that i have ever seen in the past , and they all looked like they were out of date . we did not actually see them until the last one was released on the 24th october 2004 . although i am an avid fan of horror movies , i never expected to spend the weekend at home watching this . i spent most of my time at work and was shocked when my mom invited me to watch something with her friends .

No matter what other people have said you can't review this movie without comparing it to the original, if it existed on it's own it would be a 2-3 out of 5 film but it is a remake of a 4-5 out of 5 film and so has standards to live up to and we need to see if it reached those standards. If the film was a re-working or, as in Planet of the Apes, a re-imagining of the original you would be able to look at the film in it's own right, only referencing the original.

I find it disconcerting that in an era when satisfying and fulfilling spirituality is unknown and we are all scattered across the whole spectrum of possible beliefs, that a charlatan and fraud of Gurdjieff's caliber (as a charlatan, he is exceptional; there is no denying he had a special gift. It's a pity he misused it, though, for the aggrandizement of his wounded ego, feeding on the adulation of unwary sheep who were at his beck and call and in awe of him) can inspire such extreme adherence and credulity.

One look at the rating ought to tell you this movie was voted on by shills, in an attempt to artificially boost this film's ratings.This film brings nothing new to the zombie genre. In fact, it is laughably bad (in acting and cinematography) and derivative in its plot. The make-up looks horrible and the zombies look even worse when shot. Lines are stiffly delivered and badly timed, with the exception of the female bounty hunter, who is the only good actor in this mess of a film. The worst offenders are the Italian guy (Hans), Ryn the protagonist, and the lead bad guy.

awesome movie ! great combination of talents ! i ' m a huge fan of david duchovny and he is outstanding in every aspect of his movie . the best part about this movie ( as far as i can tell ) is the dialogue , the dialogue , the timing . it was very much like one of those old - school romance flicks . when you come across that movie , it makes your blood run cold . you find that there is an emotional connection between the characters , both of them being actors and all . well , it ' s the same thing .

low - budget murder mystery about a public defender trying to clear his client of a murder the man had been convicted of ? no , not that i could tell . but it was definitely bad for business at the times . in fact , it was really terrible for business at the times . what are they gon na do with this stuff ? the only people who were doing this were my sisters . now i feel like i may be able to turn this over to someone who actually knows something about it . i think i may have just solved an old story .

I like The Wind and the Lion very much. It was a good movie. aside from the fact that this movie was filmed mostly in rockport ma , which is a beautiful town where there are a number of interesting places to look and see . one of the most exciting things about the film was how the characters were treated by everyone they met . as i read the reviews i began to think it was just a big load off my mind . what would be the point in wasting all of my time looking at the same movie over and over again if not to pay attention to everything that goes on ? besides , i really wanted to see this film .

Watching the preview of Armored I thought the movie was either going to be a very bad or a very good film. Thankfully, the movie was entertaining, suspenseful, and realistic. Matt Dillon is still a very good actor. Hard to believe Dillon is 50 years of age. I would buy this movie. I give Armored eight out of ten. Not a Christmas movie.

*SPOILERS INCLUDED*Alfred Hitchcock's brilliant and innovative adaptation of Robert Bloch's novel was an amazing film, unlike anything previous. Every shot, every camera angle, every nuance was PERFECT. He didn't just break the rules, he made up a whole set of new ones.Here's the spoiler: there is absolutely nothing new, different, or original about this movie. Gus Van Sant doesn't just pay a homage to Hitch, he rips off every idea, and does so in a less original, more conventional manner. I didn't have anything against Gus Van Sant before I saw this movie.

I'm really surprised seeing all these positive reviews for this movie. Don't get me wrong, it's not that I don't like 'these kind of movies'.While I very well can enjoy a good mindless Hollywood action blockbuster like Die Hard 4.0, I like the 'dogma' kind of movies, or 'real-life-as-it-is'-movies just as much, IF they are well made.A good example is Festen (1998): no music, no dramatic camera angles, no special fx, no fancy locations. Just a good story combined with excellent acting and the result is an excellent movie.Is Nine Lives devoid of dramatic camera angles, special fx and fancy locations?

a cryptozoologist captures a mythical chupacabra on a caribbean island . to get it back to civilization he bribes his way onto a ship bound for guadalupe , with one of his ' special ' passengers in tow . the next day he receives a large reward for saving him from a bad trip to another part of africa . unfortunately this does not take into account how much treasure there is in this region and what kind of creature it is . when you are trying to find something , it will be hard enough to find an explanation for its location .

Just about everything in this movie is wrong, wrong, wrong. Take Mike Myers, for example. He's reached the point where you realize that his shtick hasn't changed since his SNL days, over ten years ago. He's doing the same cutesy stream-of-consciousness jokes and the same voices. His Cat is painfully unfunny. He tries way to hard. He's some weird Type A comedian, not the cool cat he's supposed to be. The rest of the movie is just as bad. The sets are unbelievably ugly --- and clearly a waste of millions of dollars.

Zachary Scott does what he does best, i.e., plays a worm, in "Danger Signal," a 1945 B movie also starring Faye Emerson, Mona Freeman, and Rosemary DeCamp. Scott plays a writer who kills women after he gets their money. On the lam from his last murder, he rents a room in the home owned by the Fenchurch family, Hilda (Emerson) and her mother (Mary Servoss). Scott throws himself at Emerson, and she's dazzled. Mid-romance, her younger sister Anne (Freeman) comes home from a medical treatment.

thank god i did n ' t buy this movie myself ! i borrowed it from a friend who bought it out of the library because it was more than 50 years old , but i swear if i saw it i would have never let it be read . at least not in public . then again , as far as i know these movies are made by no one else that knows anything about what went on in my world . when i turned it on there were only two people and the first had to die - the director and the production assistant ( whom i think is the best ) .

I remember watching this movie over and over again when I was a kid. I loved it. Whilst I haven't watched it recently, I am sure I would enjoy it just the same today. Its a very light funny movie guaranteed to make anyone laugh. The situations with each one of the characters were so funny and imaginative! I particularly liked the one with the girl traveling with her mother's ashes (who ends up picking them up on the highway after the explosion) , the robbers and the nuns. This nice humour style is much missed these days.

alain resnais directs three parallel stories that have to do with fantasy and imagination in the adult world . in addition , this short story line is made up of two characters , and both scenes take place in different parts of europe . for those who enjoyed the film i will give you an idea of what really happened at the beginning . i was there once , so it is possible to understand why they did it . the movie was not as good as i first thought it could be but it certainly was n't horrible either . it was definitely a fun one .

The main attraction of Anywhere but Here is the superb performance of Natalie Portman. She gave her rather thankless character a lot of much-appreciated emotional depth. Susan Sarandon, a fine actress, is suitably sincere as the mother figure. I thought the chemistry between the two stars was believable, a chemistry that could have been developed more with a more involving script. I am not saying the script was bad in any way, I am just saying it seemed underdeveloped at times. I don't think it was the script writer's fault.

the brave one is about a new york radio show host named erica bain ( jodie foster ) . her life has been filled with pain and loss . she is very upset that her husband did not return from his mission in iraq . she hopes to be rescued by someone as successful as dr. scott , who is working with the doctors on some kind of experimental drugs for this type of cancer treatment . it is a beautiful night and we are at a restaurant having a glass of wine , when i notice a car pulling in behind us .

synopsis : the sequel to the acclaimed silence of the lambs , hannibal is a big budget production that totally loses its plot . for the longest time there was nothing else i could do but sit and let the movie continue . then i heard the music and i got up and left . i had to drive over here because i had no plans to watch this movie . i sat in my living room until about ten thirty and watched as it played on the cable box . the movie was actually quite good , if you know what i mean .

the story told by the cranes are flying is not , admittedly , all that original . young lovers are never quite sure what they should call themselves until they meet a beautiful blonde who tells them to get out of their car and come over for a drink . it seems that the actors ' first attempt at making this movie is unsuccessful . however , in a few days the characters begin to realize the futility of trying to make something happen . after watching this movie with some enjoyment , i started to feel more confident when i saw the other half of the film .

What a waste of talent -- although it appears that Crudup in real life is a lot more like the vapid, self- absorbed, character-less character he portrays in this disappointing movie.In art, sometimes the empty spaces reveal more than the painted or created content. What this movie reveals is the unconsciousness and the contradictory/competing, unresolved impulses/consciousness of the film's director/writer. It unintentionally shows the LACK of awareness that a truly evolved, deeply aware character should have and be tormented about in order to deserve audience empathy or sympathy OR the lack of which is used to serve as a cautionary tale to the audience.

A team varied between Scully and Mulder, two other scientists, a pilot, and the guy who plays Bana on Seinfeld, go up to an Arctic research post where all members have died off by either killing each other or killing themselves. This is not just my favorite episode of season 1, but also one of my favorites from the show.

One of Chaplin's longest films up to that point, Burlesque on Carmen is a clever and surprisingly complex parody of what was then "Prosper Merimee's" well-known story about "Carmen." I was a little confused about the difference between the IMDb's listing of the 1915 Burlesque on Carmen and the 1916 version. Based on the running time I assume that it was the 1915 version that I saw, since the 1916 one is a good 20 minutes longer, and from what I've read, those are 20 unnecessary and unimpressive minutes.

The films use of blue-black and vibrant skin tones to create a noir-ish feel to this movie unfortunately do not work. In fact its quite irritating as it obscures the demon characters and reduces them to one dimensional beings.At least the original had an hysterical energy and the gore set-pieces were quite stunning. Black gore is hardly frightening, nor is the main female demon at all frightening in her attempts to snarl and growl at the screen in her best camp Lugosi style.The narrative is grossly disjointed and if you could imagine 'Naked Lunch' directed by Russ Meyer you may appreciate the attempt to be William Burroughs-esque.

This movie was extremely disappointing, I thought it would be another 'marijuana comedy' but don't be mislead, it's not at all. There are barely any weed-related jokes that come to mind, I don't even think they smoke any weed in this movie. The marijuana field is merely a plot device.My impression after seeing this film was that four friends were bored one summer and decided to write up a script full of (their idea of) witty dialog and make a movie. The product is bland dialog supported by mediocre acting, to say this movie has no 'hook' is a huge understatement.

28 years before 9/11, there was another 9/11 which represented a key date in the history of Chile, South America and the whole world. This was the date in 1973 when a bloody coup in Chile deposed Salvador Allende the first Marxist president elected democratically anywhere in the world and put an end to the Chilean experiment of a democratic transition from capitalism to socialism. Allende committed suicide when the armed forces attacked the presidential palace.Unfortunately this film is too biased and too nostalgic towards the time of Allende's rule to be an objective rendition of the man and of his place in history.

Dr. Pena (Giancarlo Esposito), a "crypto-zoologist" (fancy term for one of those self-deluded losers who likes to study extremely rare - read: nonexistent - animals) and his crew of hunters manage to trap a Chupacabra, a big, scaly, elusive fast-moving beast. To get it to the mainland, they smuggle it on a Grecian cruise ship and some idiots open up the crate containing it despite being told specifically not to. I guess the strange growling noises coming from inside weren't a good enough deterrent either.

This is another of those films I can remember from when I was a kid and I recently managed to acquire it off ebay - 20 years on, it's nowhere near as good as I remember it being.The story is 'vaguely' kick started, by a 'cosmic event' (there's another extra film-crew member in the credits for 'weak story development') which makes collective ants become super intelligent. Ant species who used to war with each other have ceased rivalries and are now working together. The thing I wanted to know throughout was, TO DO WHAT EXACTLY?

this film was n ' t good at all . i was able to catch it at a film festival and did a decent job , if you are a fan of crime films , i am surprised that you have any idea of what they are about . in fact , i do not think anyone is going to tell you anything . it is like the movie is supposed to be funny but nobody knows how to joke around without sounding like a child . there is really no fun in it whatsoever , other than to make you laugh when the comedy is over .

empire of passion starts out deceptively - that is , if you ' re immediately expecting it to be a horror movie . the acting is bad enough , but the film itself is pretty lame . as the story thickens , even in the midst of some of the funniest scenes , i still feel this thing is just not right . i do not really know why we have to watch this movie for such a short period of time . perhaps it is because my dad does not want to watch this . or perhaps he was just being an old man .

When this show began it was fairly interesting: we got to see what crab boat fisherman had to go through during the crab-catching season. Soon after, however, it lost focus on the fishing and focused almost entirely on the drama in the lives of the fisherman. Episodes became nothing more than 'the captain doesn't like the new greenhorn' (this one happens way too often), 'someone is injured or sick', 'a fisherman gets word of some problem at home and is frustrated that he is stuck on a boat', repeat.

I watched this movie recently mainly because I am a Huge fan of Jodie Foster's. I saw this movie was made right between her 2 Oscar award winning performances, so my expectations were fairly high. Unfortunately, I thought the movie was terrible and I'm still left wondering how she was ever persuaded to make this movie. The script is really weak. The story itself may have been somewhat believable if someone like Mel Gibson had played the role of the hit-man. The idea of Jodie running off with Dennis Hopper and his irritating accent was impossible for me to buy into.

The Love Letter (1999): Starring Kate Capshaw, Tom Everett Scott, Tom Selleck, Ellen De Generes, Gloria Stuart, Blythe Danner, Jessica Capshaw, Alice Drummond, Bill Buell, Erik Jensen, Margaret Ann Brady, Walter Covell, Patrick Donnelly, Lucas Hall, Christian Harmony, Christopher Nee, Breanne Smith, Marilyn Rockafellow, Sasha Spielberg, Jack Black.....Director Peter Chan, Screenplay Maria Maggenti.Based on the novel "The Love Letter" by Cathleen Schine, Director Peter Chan's film version, released in 1999, was not a big box-office draw, not even for a romantic movie with some comedy elements.

Ik know it is impossible to keep all details of a book in a movie. But this movie has changed nearly everything without any reason. Furthermore many changes have made the story illogical.
